translated: And the context cannot enjoin an impossible purpose, so this inevitably follows: one should perform with a mantra what is to be done.

original: na cāsāvadṛṣṭaṃ śaknototi laukikaṃ vaidikaṃ vā pramāṇaṃ vidyate /
analyzed: na ca asau adṛṣṭam śaknoti iti laukikam vaidikam vā pramāṇam vidyate
translated: And that cannot be seen, there is no worldly or Vedic means of knowledge.

analyzed: tasmāt ubhayoḥ liṅga prakaraṇayoḥ dṛṣṭa artha prayogeṇa eka vākya tā
translated: Therefore, both the indicative mark and the context have a single sentence with the seen purpose by application.

original: evaṃ ca sati yājñikaprayogaprasiddherna mūlāntarakalpanā kleśo bhaviṣyati/
analyzed: evam ca sati yājñika prayoga prasiddheḥ na mūla antara kalpanā kleśaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And in this way, there will be no trouble in assuming another basis due to the well-known application of the sacrificer.

analyzed: atas svābhāvikam eva artha prādhānyam avasthitam
translated: Therefore, the natural primacy of meaning remains established.

analyzed: na evam iti
translated: It is not so.

analyzed: na dṛṣṭa ūrthe
translated: Not in the seen meaning.

analyzed: nirvṛttaḥ iti etāvatā eva tādarthyam avasīyate
translated: By this much alone, the purpose is ascertained.

analyzed: paruṣa artha anupayogena svādhyāya adhyayana vidheḥ ānarthakyāt
translated: Because the injunction to study one's own Veda is meaningless due to not being useful for the supreme purpose.

analyzed: na ca buddha śākhāḥ vidyamāna vacanā ceta na artha bandhanāt mantra artha upayogaḥ
translated: And the use of the meaning of a mantra is not due to the connection with the meaning, because the branches of the Buddha's teachings are not existent statements.

original: tatra yadi dūre'pyadṛṣṭa kalpanāto na mucyāmahe tato 'tikramakāraṇābhāvāduccāraṇādeva kalpanīyam /
analyzed: tatra yadi kalpanātaḥ na mucyāmahe tatas tikrama kāraṇa abhāvāt uccāraṇāt eva kalpanīyam
translated: If there we are not freed from the assumption of the unseen even from afar, then due to the absence of a reason for transgression, it should be assumed from the utterance itself.

analyzed: ubhaya vādi siddha tvāt uccāraṇa karttavya tāyāḥ tad prabhava tvāt ca adṛṣṭa kalpanasya
translated: Because the duty of utterance is established by both parties and because the unseen is assumed to arise from that.

analyzed: tatra ucyate
translated: To that it is said.

analyzed: yajñe yajña aṅga prakāśanam eva prayojanam iti
translated: In a sacrifice, the only purpose is to reveal the limbs of the sacrifice.

original: yadyapi lokavattairna saṃvyavahārastathāpi tatsvarūpaprakāśana mātra mevānuṣṭhātṝṇāmupakara vyati/
analyzed: yadi api loka vat taiḥ na saṃvyavahāraḥ tathā api tad svarūpa prakāśana mātram eva anuṣṭhātṝṇām upakara vyati
translated: Even though there is no usage like in the world, still the mere manifestation of that nature alone benefits the performers.

original: ataśca yāvanmātramevānaupayikaṃ sambodhanādi kāmaṃ tanna vivakṣyeta na tu tadarśana sarvameva vyaktatryaṃ na hokarūpyaṃ nāma kena tantravārtike /
analyzed: atas ca yāvanmātram evā anaupayikam sambodhana ādi kāmam tat na vivakṣyeta na tu sarvam eva nāma kena tantravārtike
translated: And therefore, as much as is not useful, like the address etc., indeed that may not be intended, but not all the manifest is not useful. Nothing is determined by anyone.

analyzed: cit niyatam
translated: It is not determined by the intellect.

analyzed: tasmāt yathā darśana abhyupagamāt dāma iti evamādīnām tāvat avihatam artha prādhānyam
translated: Therefore, just as those who accept according to what is seen, they indeed enter the abode of the gods, in the same way, the primary meaning of such statements as 'ā' is unobstructed.

analyzed: tām caturbhiḥ ādatta tat atra api vadāmaḥ
translated: And in this case also we say:

analyzed: parisaṃkhyā
translated: Pari-saṃkhyā (Enumeration)

original: yāvaddhi mantrāmnāna manavagataprayojanaṃ prakaraṇī cākṛtāthastāvadyattatsiddhyarthaṃ kalapyate tatsarvaṃ vaidikaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: yāvat hi mantra āmnāna manavagata prayojanam prakaraṇī ca a kṛta athaḥ tāvat yat tad siddhi artham kalapyate tat sarvam vaidikam bhavati
translated: As long as the recitation of the mantra does not have a known purpose and the context is not completed, then all that is imagined for the sake of accomplishing that is Vedic.

analyzed: nairākāṅkṣya uttara kālam tu kaccitam api pauruṣeya tvāt apramāṇam syāt
translated: But after the state of having no desire, even a little bit would be unauthoritative due to being human.

original: na ca śrutimakampayitvā liṅgādeḥ svātantryeṇa prāmāṇya miti vacyate /
analyzed: na ca śrutim a kampayitvā liṅga ādeḥ svātantryeṇa prāmāṇyam iti vacyate
translated: And it is not said that without shaking the Veda, the indicative power etc. are authoritative by themselves.

analyzed: tat etat āha
translated: He says this:

original: sati ca vākye liṅgaṃ viyojakaṃ taccāsya nāstīti /
analyzed: sati ca vākye liṅgam viyojakam tat ca asya na asti iti
translated: And when there is a sentence, the indicative is what disjoins, and that does not exist for this.

original: yadaiva hi prakaraṇādanena yajeta raśanāṃ vā gṛhṇīyāditi kalpayitumighyate tadaivāśvābhidhānomityanenāpahāromantrasya /
analyzed: yadā eva hi prakaraṇāt anena yajeta raśanām vā gṛhṇīyāt iti kalpayitum ighyate tadā eva aśva abhidhāna ūm iti anena apahāraḥ mantrasya
translated: For as soon as it is possible to imagine by the context that one should sacrifice with this or take up the rope, at that very time there is the removal of the mantra by the word 'aśvābhidhānī' (horse-name).

original: yadapi naiva saṃbandha ityādattaiti kathaṃ tatyaśvābhidhāno miti tatkārakasaṃbandhāsaṃbhavātkriyayaiva saha na sāmānyābhiprāyeṇa draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: yat api nā eva saṃbandhaḥ iti ādatta eti katham tati aśva abhidhānaḥ m iti tad kāraka saṃbandha asaṃbhavāt kriyayā eva saha na sāmānya abhiprāyeṇa draṣṭavyam
translated: And even if there is no connection at all, how is it taken up? Because of the impossibility of the connection of the instrument with that, it should be seen not with the general meaning but only with the action.

analyzed: tasmāt an ādāna mātre vidhīyate kim tarhi aśva abhidhānī viśiṣṭe
translated: Therefore, only the mere taking up is enjoined. But what then? That qualified by the horse-name.

analyzed: athavā prathama adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: Or, in the second section of the first chapter.

analyzed: phalatas paścāttana kāraka saṃbandhaḥ upanyasyate
translated: The connection with the subsequent instrument is stated from the result.

analyzed: sarvathā darśaśāvatā na asti
translated: In no way is there a connection with the Darsha-Pūrnamāsa.

original: yadi hi yadeva mantravacanātprāpnayāttadeva pratyakṣavacanenocyate tato vayamupālabhyemahi /
analyzed: yadi hi yat eva mantra vacanāt prāpnayāt tat eva pratyakṣa vacanena ucyate tatas vayam upālabhyemahi
translated: For if what is obtained from the statement of the mantra is stated by the direct statement, then we would be criticized.

original: nanvevamaprāpta vidhirevāyaṃ saṃjāta iti na vaktavyaṃ parisaṃkhyeti phalenaivamabhidhānādadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: nanu evam aprāpta vidhiḥ eva ayam saṃjātaḥ iti na vaktavyam parisaṃkhyā iti phalena evam abhidhānāt adoṣaḥ
translated: But in this way, is this not a mere injunction of what is not obtained? It should not be said to be an exclusion. There is no fault because it is stated by the result in this way.

original: sarvatra hi parisaṃkhyāśabdādevakārādvā vinā na śrutyā parisaṃkhyāniyamo vocyate vidhireva tvevaṃ jātīyakasya phalenaivaṃ vyapadeśaḥ /
analyzed: sarvatra hi parisaṃkhyā śabdāt evakārāt vā vinā na śrutyā parisaṃkhyā niyamaḥ vā ucyate vidhiḥ eva tu evam jātīyakasya phalena evam vyapadeśaḥ
translated: For everywhere, without the word 'parisaṃkhyā' or 'eva', the rule of parisaṃkhyā is not stated by the Śruti, but only the injunction is described in this way with the result.

analyzed: kaḥ tarhi vidhi niyama parisaṃkhyanām bhedaḥ
translated: Then what is the difference between injunction, rule, and parisaṃkhyā?

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: vidhiḥ atyantam aprāpte niyamaḥ pākṣike sati
translated: The injunction is for what is absolutely not obtained, the rule is for what is possible,

original: tatra cānyatra ca prāpte parisaṃkhyeti korcyate/
analyzed: tatra ca anyatra ca prāpte parisaṃkhyā iti kā urcyate
translated: and where it is obtained there and elsewhere, it is said to be parisaṃkhyā.

analyzed: vidhiḥ eva hi kena cit viśeṣeṇa evam bhidyate
translated: For the injunction itself is divided in this way by some particular feature.

original: tatra yo 'tyantamaprāpto na ca prāpsyati prāgvacanādityavagamyate tatra niyogaḥ śuddha evaṃ vidhiryathā brohīnprokṣatīti /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ tyantam aprāptaḥ na ca prāpsyati prāc vacanāt iti avagamyate tatra niyogaḥ śuddhaḥ evam vidhiḥ yathā brohīn prokṣati iti
translated: There, where it is absolutely not obtained and will not be obtained before the statement, it is understood there, the pure injunction is like 'he sprinkles the Brāhmaṇas'.

original: yatra tu prāgvacanātyākṣi kī prāptiḥ sambhāvyate tatrāprāptipaścaṃ pūrayanyo vidhiḥ pravarttate sa niyantṛtvānniyama ityucyate /
analyzed: yatra tu kī prāptiḥ sambhāvyate tatra aprāpti paścam pūrayan yaḥ vidhiḥ pravarttate sa niyantṛ tvāt niyamaḥ iti ucyate
translated: But where the possibility of obtaining before the statement is suspected, there the injunction proceeds filling the part not obtained, it is called a rule because of its controlling nature.

analyzed: yathā
translated: Like 'he offers the Brāhmaṇas'.

original: tandulaniṣpattyaryākṣepādeva tatmidverna tatprāptimātraṃ vidheḥ phalaṃ kiṃ ta rhyaprāptāṃśapūraṇam /
analyzed: tandula niṣpatti arya ākṣepāt eva tad midveḥ na tad prāpti mātram vidheḥ phalam kim ta rhi aprāpta aṃśa pūraṇam
translated: By the implication of the completion of rice, the mere obtaining of that is not the result of the injunction, then what is the filling of the part not obtained?

original: tadaprāptipakṣe ca taṇḍulairupāyāntarāṇyāci pyeran pūraṇe tu sati yā teṣāṃ nivṛttirasāvarthānna vākyāt /
analyzed: tad aprāpti pakṣe ca taṇḍulaiḥ upāya antarāṇi āci pyeran pūraṇe tu sati yā teṣām nivṛttiḥ asau arthāt na vākyāt
translated: And in the case of its non-attainment, other means like rice would be enjoined, but when that is fulfilled, that cessation of them is understood from the meaning, not from the sentence.

analyzed: na ca tad āraṇam niyamaḥ
translated: And that exclusion is not a rule.

analyzed: parisaṅkhyā hi tathā syāt
translated: For that would be a parisankhya.

analyzed: pratyāsannām vā avahanti niyata tām utsṛjya na anya nivṛtti phala kalpanā avasaraḥ
translated: Having abandoned the proximity of the fixed nature, there is no opportunity to imagine a result in the form of the cessation of others.

analyzed: tad prasakti dvārā tu avahanteḥ aniyatiḥ āsot iti niyama antargatā evā arthāt nivṛttiḥ gamyate
translated: But the exclusion of the fixed nature of the striking, which is due to the possibility of that, is understood to be included within the rule itself.

original: na ca prāpte sati vidhirayaṃ pravṛtto yenāsyānyavṛttyarthatā kalpyeta /
analyzed: na ca prāpte sati vidhiḥ ayam pravṛttaḥ yena asya anya vṛtti artha tā kalpyeta
translated: And when it is attained, this injunction does not operate, by which its purpose of operating elsewhere would be imagined.

original: prāgeva tu pravarttamānenārthasya prāpakaśaktinirodhādanyā prāptiḥ kṛtā sā cārthalabhyeti na tayaiva vyapadiśyate /
analyzed: prāk eva tu pravarttamānena arthasya prāpaka śakti nirodhāt anyā prāptiḥ kṛtā sā ca artha labhyā iti na tayā eva vyapadiśyate
translated: But when it is operating even before, the capacity to bring about the meaning is obstructed, and another attainment is made, and that is understood from the meaning, so it is not indicated by that alone.

original: yaḥ punaḥ prāṅgiyogāttatra cānyatra ca prāpnuyāditi sambhāvyate yatra vā yaccānyacca sā parisaṅkhyā /
analyzed: yaḥ punar prāṅgi yogāt tatra ca anyatra ca prāpnuyāt iti sambhāvyate yatra vā yat ca anyat ca sā parisaṅkhyā
translated: But that which is possible to be attained there and elsewhere due to the connection with the prior, or where and which other, that is parisankhya.

analyzed: yathā atra eva udāhate
translated: As in the very example cited here.

analyzed: yathā tantra vārtika
translated: As in the Tantravārtika.

analyzed: ca gṛhamedhīye pañcame pakṣe
translated: And in the fifth view in the Gṛhamedhīya.

original: atrāpi ca na prāpte satyeṣā pravarttate prāpakasya śākhasyānanumitatvātkathaṃ tarhi yadyetadvākyaṃ nābhavivyattata enaṃ prāpsyaditi /
analyzed: atra api ca na prāpte sati eṣā pravarttate prāpakasya śākhasya an anumita tvāt katham tarhi yadi etat vākyam na abhavivyat tatas enam prāpsyat iti
translated: And even here, it does not apply when the object is already obtained, because the injunctive sentence that brings about the connection is not inferred. How then? If this sentence were not to exist, then it would be obtained from that.

original: sarvasya pratyakṣasya vākyasya nānumānikavākya pratibandhamātraṃ phala miṣyate /
analyzed: sarvasya pratyakṣasya vākyasya na ānumānika vākya pratibandha mātram phala miṣyate
translated: The result of all direct perception sentences is merely the exclusion of the possibility of inference.

original: kiṃ hi tena paṭhitena yasyānyato 'pyarthaḥ siddhyati tadarthaṃ gaībharaśanānivṛttiḥ phalaṃ kalpyate/
analyzed: kim hi tena paṭhitena yasya anyatas pi arthaḥ siddhi ati tad artham gaībha raśanā nivṛttiḥ phalam kalpyate
translated: For what is the use of reciting that whose meaning is accomplished from elsewhere? The result is imagined to be the exclusion of the Gayatri recitation.

original: tenaivaṃ kalapyate kṛtvācintānyāyena yadi nāmaivaṃ vākyaṃ na bha vettataḥ kīdṛśamanuṣṭhānaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tena evam kalapyate kṛtvā acintā nyāyena yadi nāma evam vākyam na vet tatas kīdṛśam anuṣṭhānam syāt
translated: Therefore, it is imagined in this way: By the method of hypothetical reasoning, if such a sentence were not to exist, then what kind of performance would there be?

original: tatra mantraprāptistāvadekāntena siddhyedaśvābhidhānyāṃ tahadeva tu gaībharaśanāyāmapi prasajyeta /
analyzed: tatra mantra prāptiḥ tāvat ekāntena siddhyet aśvābhidhānyām tahat eva tu gaībha raśanāyām api prasajyeta
translated: In that case, the obtaining of the mantra would be accomplished without doubt. But then the same would apply to the Gayatri recitation.

original: yadā tvanena vākyena pratyakṣeṇa nairākāṅacyāda viśeṣa viniyogasamarthavākyānumānaṃ niṣiddhaṃ tadā kevalāśvābhidhānīviṣayatvasidvirityapaunaruktyādarthavadvākyam
analyzed: yadā tu anena vākyena pratyakṣeṇa viśeṣa viniyoga samartha vākya anumānam niṣiddham tadā kevala aśva abhidhānī viṣaya tva sidviḥ iti apaunaruktyāt arthavat vākyam
translated: But when by this direct sentence, there is no desire for anything else, and the inference of a sentence capable of special application is prohibited, then the establishment of the object of the Aśvamedha recitation alone is accomplished. Thus the sentence is meaningful and non-redundant.

analyzed: a viruddham param
translated: The other is not contradictory.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: The second quarter of the first chapter.

analyzed: dṛṣṭārtha uccāraṇa vādinaḥ pi tad niyamāt aparam avaśyam kalpanīyam adṛṣṭam tat mama api pratyāyana niyamāt bhaviṣyati iti avirodhaḥ
translated: Even for one who maintains that the utterance has a visible purpose, that unseen [result] must necessarily be assumed due to the restriction [on the mantra]. For me too, it will be due to the restriction on the communication. Thus there is no contradiction.

analyzed: etena mantra tva ādi niyamaḥ pratyuktaḥ
translated: By this, the restriction on being a mantra etc. is refuted.

original: satkhapyupāyāntareṣu viśiṣṭānupūrvīkamantra viśeṣāmnānādupāyāntaranivṛttī niyamādṛṣṭamātrakalpa nayā siddhamarthābhidhānam
analyzed: sat khapi upāya antareṣu viśiṣṭa ānupūrvīka mantra viśeṣa āmnānāt upāya antara nivṛttī niyama adṛṣṭa mātra kalpa nayā siddham artha abhidhānam
translated: Even though there are other means, due to the recitation of the mantra with a special sequence, the indication of the mere unseen [result] by the restriction on the cessation of other means establishes the expression of meaning.

analyzed: abhivāne rthavādaḥ
translated: In the Abhivani [hymn], there is an arthavada.

original: catvāri śṭaṅgeti rūpakadvāreṇa yāgastutiḥ karmakālautsāha karoti/
analyzed: catvāri śṭaṅgā iti rūpaka dvāreṇa yāga stutiḥ karma kāla autsāha karoti
translated: The praise of the sacrifice through the metaphor having four peaks inspires enthusiasm for the time of the ritual.

analyzed: hautre tu ayam viṣuvati hotuḥ ājye viniyuktaḥ
translated: This [hymn] is employed in the Hotra sacrifice at the time of the equinox.

analyzed: tasya ca āgneya tva adaḥ ca āḍhitya daivata tva saṃstava āḍha āditya rūpeṇa agni stutiḥ upavarṇya tasmāt
translated: And since that [sacrifice] is related to Agni and the deity Surya, Agni is praised through the form of Surya.

analyzed: tatra catvāri śṛṅgā iti divasa yāmānām grahaṇam
translated: And there, the mention of the four peaks is the grasping of the day and night.

analyzed: trayaḥ asya pādāḥ iti śīta uṣṇa varṣa kālāḥ
translated: The statement about its three feet is the cold, hot, and rainy seasons.

analyzed: dve śīrṣe iti ayana abhiprāyam
translated: The statement about its two heads is with reference to the two solstices.

analyzed: sapta hastāḥ iti aśvastutiḥ
translated: The statement about its seven hands is a praise of the horse.

analyzed: tridhā baddhaḥ iti savana abhiprāyeṇa
translated: Bound in three ways is with reference to the three pressings.

analyzed: vṛṣabhaḥ iti vṛṣṭi hetu tvena stutiḥ
translated: The praise as bull is due to being the cause of rain.

analyzed: roravīti stanayitnunā
translated: He roars with thunder.

analyzed: tantravārtikam
translated: This is well-known to all people.

analyzed: dveḥ macān devaḥ marttyān āviveśa iti utsāha karaṇa upakāraṇa sarva puruṣa hṛdaya anupraveśāt
translated: The god entered the two worlds of gods and mortals, thus benefiting by inspiring enthusiasm, due to entering the hearts of all men.

analyzed: evam anena margeṇa asti tāvat dharma sādhana smṛtiḥ
translated: Thus, by this path, there is indeed the recollection of the means of attaining Dharma.

analyzed: vidyā vacanam asaṃyogāt
translated: Knowledge is not mentioned due to lack of connection.

analyzed: yadi api pūrvapace yam abhiprāyaḥ na upanyastaḥ tathā api saṃbhava t upanyamyate
translated: Even though this intention was not presented in the previous case, it is still presented as possible.

original: yadi hi svādhyāyakāne 'rthavacanamupayujyeta tatastadāśrīyeta na tvevamasti karmabhira saṃyogāt /
analyzed: yadi hi svādhyāya kāne rtha vacanam upayujyeta tatas tat āśrīyeta na tu evam asti karmabhiḥ a saṃyogāt
translated: For if the meaning of the Veda were useful for one who studies the Veda, then it would be relied upon. But this is not so, due to lack of connection with the rites.

analyzed: tad anabhyāmaḥ tu prokṣa pādi vat maukaryāt
translated: That should not be studied, like sprinkling the feet, due to the purpose of the Veda.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: The second section of the first chapter.

analyzed: uktaḥ ca anitya saṃyogaḥ
translated: And the connection with the non-eternal has been stated.

analyzed: param tu śruti sāmānya mātram iti
translated: But it is merely the general similarity with the Veda.

analyzed: yajamānaḥ tāvat prārthayitā indraḥ ca prārthyamānaḥ sarva dārita
translated: The sacrificer is the supplicant, and Indra is the one to be supplicated, in all cases.

analyzed: kokaṭāḥ nāma yadi api janapadāḥ tathā api nityāḥ
translated: Even though the Kokata people are a country, they are eternal.

original: atha vā sarvalokasthāḥ kṛpaṇaḥ kī kaṭāḥ pramagandaḥ kusīdavṛttiḥ sa hi prabhūtataramāgamiṣyatītyevaṃ dadāti/
analyzed: atha vā sarva loka sthāḥ kṛpaṇaḥ kī kaṭāḥ pramagandaḥ kusīda vṛttiḥ sa hi prabhūtataram āgamiṣyati iti evam dadāti
translated: Or, he gives thus: All the people will come to him, the miser, the one with a bad reputation, the one with a bad livelihood, the one with a bad occupation.

analyzed: nīcāśākhaḥ ṣaṇḍhaḥ tadīyam dhanam naicāśākham
translated: The wealth of the eunuch is not of a low branch.

analyzed: tat ca sarvam a yajña aṅga bhūtam teṣām karmaṇi a pravṛtteḥ tat asmākam āharati
translated: And all that is not a part of the sacrifice, because their action is engaged in that, he takes it away from us.

analyzed: śeṣam gata artham
translated: The rest is understood.

analyzed: ūhaḥ
translated: Inference

original: ūhadarśanaṃ na mātā vaīnaityarthye ca puṣṭyādivṛddheḥ pratyakṣatvātpratiṣedhāsaṃbhavādānarthakyāttadaṅgeṣviti śabda vijñāyate /
analyzed: ūha darśanam na mātā ca puṣṭi ādi vṛddheḥ pratyakṣa tvāt pratiṣedha asaṃbhavāt ānarthakyāt tat aṅgeṣu iti śabda vijñāyate
translated: The view of inference is not mother or father, because the increase of nourishment etc. is directly perceived, because it is impossible to prohibit, and because it is meaningless, the word in its parts is understood.

original: tatrāpi sthaulyādivṛddhyasaṃbhavādadhikārthavācitvena dvivacana bahuvaca nayoḥ pratiṣedhaḥ sa cārthaparatve sarvapaśu viśeṣaṇamātrādyupāditsāyāṃ satyāmavakalpate /
analyzed: tatra api sthaulya ādi vṛddhi asaṃbhavāt adhika artha vāci tvena dvivacana bahuvaca nayoḥ pratiṣedhaḥ sa ca artha paratve sarva paśu viśeṣaṇa mātra ādi upāditsāyām satyām avakalpate
translated: Even there, because the increase of thickness etc. is impossible, the prohibition of the dual and plural is by expressing the additional meaning, and that is possible when there is a desire to include all animals and mere qualifications.

analyzed: yā ca anya pada vṛddhi sadbhāva pratītiḥ iyam ca
translated: And this understanding of the existence of the increase of other words.

original: yadyapi mātṛprabhṛtīnāṃ pārārthyātsaṃbandhibhedādeva ca bhedasiddhenūhyatvaṃ sadevānuvadati tathāpi nyāyāvaga tānūhasaṃkīrttanā nyāyaratantravārtika /
analyzed: yadi api mātṛ prabhṛtīnām pārārthyāt saṃbandhi bhedāt eva ca bheda siddhi inūhya tvam sadā eva anuvadati tathā api
translated: Although the Mantras, beginning with the one addressed to the mother, are for the sake of others, and their difference is established by the difference of their relations, the repetition still repeats what is already existent.

analyzed: hiteṣu ūha saṃpratyayāt prakṛtau vivaścita artha tā vijñāyate
translated: But the repetition is declared by the mention of the repetition understood through reasoning.

analyzed: anyathā tu tat dṛṣṭam avikṛtaiḥ eva sādhyeta
translated: Otherwise, it would be accomplished by the unmodified ones alone, as seen in that case.

original: tathā yadyapyanyadaivatyaḥ paśśurāgneyyeva manotā kāryetyūhaprāptidarśanamevamutrāṇāṃ meṣāṇāmityevamādīnāṃ yathārthamūhitānāmevāmnānamapi vivakṣitārthaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā yadi api anya daivatyaḥ paśuḥ āgneyyā eva manotā kāryā iti ūha prāpti darśanam eva mutrāṇām meṣāṇām iti evamādīnām yathārtham ūhitānām eva āmnānam api vivakṣita artham bhaviṣyati
translated: Similarly, although the animal belongs to another deity, the Manota should be performed only for Agni. The mention of the repetition is seen in this way. The mention of the rams and so on, which are repeated according to their meaning, will also have the intended meaning.

analyzed: itarathā prākṛta pada tyāge ca dṛṣṭa dvayam kalpyeta
translated: Otherwise, two seen things would have to be imagined - the abandonment of the original words and the imagination of another.

analyzed: artha an āśrayaṇe hi sarvam tat anarthakam syāt
translated: For if it does not rely on the meaning, all that would be meaningless.

analyzed: tasmāt ivaścita vacanāḥ mantrāḥ iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that the Mantras have a definite meaning.

analyzed: tantravārtike
translated: In the Tantra-Vartika.

analyzed: dharmasya śabda mūla tvāt aśabdam anapekṣam syāt
translated: Since Dharma has the Veda as its root, what is not in the Veda should be disregarded.

analyzed: evam tāvat vidhi arthavāda mantra nāmadheya ātmakasya vedasya dharmam pratyupayogaḥ sādhitaḥ
translated: Thus far it has been established that the Veda, consisting of injunctions, explanatory passages, mantras, and names, is useful for the purpose of Dharma.

original: idānoṃ pauruṣeyoṣu smaryamāṇārthāvadhiṣu ma nvādipraṇotanivandhanāsu smṛtidhvanivadveṣu cācāreṣu cintā /
analyzed: idānom smaryamāṇa artha avadhiṣu ca ācāreṣu cintā
translated: Now there is a consideration regarding the Smṛtis composed by Manu and others, which are based on human effort, have meanings that are remembered, and are like the echoes of the Veda.

original: tatra kiṃ cidudāhṛtya vicāraḥ kartavya ityaṣṭakāḍhismaraṇāni manvādisthāni /
analyzed: tatra kim cit udāhṛtya vicāraḥ kartavyaḥ iti aṣṭaka āḍhi smaraṇāni manu ādi sthāni
translated: Regarding that, the discussion should be done after citing something. Thus, the recollections of Aṣṭakā etc. are found in Manu and others.

analyzed: tad gandha samarpitāni pramāṇa apramāṇa vicāra viṣaya tvena udāhriyante
translated: Those are cited as the subject matter of the consideration of validity and invalidity, conveyed by the fragrance of that.

analyzed: sandeha hetuḥ vā abhidhīyate
translated: And the reason for doubt is stated:

original: manvādivacanaṃ smṛtyapekṣaṃ smṛtiśca mūlapramāṇāpekṣiṇīti naikasyāpi vedavannirapekṣaprāmāṇya niścayaḥ /
analyzed: manu ādi vacanam smṛti apekṣam smṛtiḥ ca mūlapramāṇa apekṣiṇī iti na ekasya api veda vat nirapekṣa prāmāṇya niścayaḥ
translated: The statement of Manu and others depends on Smṛti, and Smṛti depends on the original valid means of knowledge. Therefore, like the Veda, the validity of even one is not ascertained without dependence.

original: yatastu vedavādināmevāvigānenāvicchinnapāramparyaparigrahadārḍhyamato nāprāmāṇyādhyabasānamiti yuktaḥ sandehastatra pūrvapakṣavādī vadati naiṣāṃ prāmāṇyamevāpekṣitavyamiti /
analyzed: yatas tu veda vādinām eva avigānena avicchinna pāramparya parigraha dārḍhyam atas na aprāmāṇya adhyabasānam iti yuktaḥ sandehaḥ tatra pūrvapakṣa vādī vadati na eṣām prāmāṇyam eva apekṣitavyam iti
translated: But since the followers of the Veda firmly hold the unbroken tradition without any disagreement, therefore there is no possibility of invalidity. Thus the doubt is proper. There, the proponent of the prima facie view says that their validity need not be accepted.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: pratyakṣa ādi avagate rthe
translated: All recollections arise in regard to an object cognized through perception etc., and are in conformity with it.

analyzed: mānāni artham samarthayanti
translated: The means of knowledge establish the meaning of the Veda.

original: tadihāṣṭakādīnāṃ svargādisādhyasādhanabhāvaṃ pratyakṣādīni tāvanna gṛhṇantīti sādhitam /
analyzed: tat iha aṣṭakā ādīnām svarga ādi sādhyasādhana bhāvam pratyakṣa ādīni tāvat na gṛhṇanti iti sādhitam
translated: Here it has been established that perception etc. do not apprehend the relation between the aṣṭakā etc. and heaven etc.

analyzed: śabdaḥ u pi yathā agnihotra ādiṣu pratyaśeṇa upalabhyate na evam mantrāḥ
translated: Just as the word is directly perceived in the case of the agnihotra etc., not so in the case of the mantras.

analyzed: śabdasya tāvat ekam eva pratyakṣam pramāṇam
translated: For the word, perception is the only means of knowledge.

original: ma cettenānavagamyamāno 'pyastītyucyate tato varaṃ dharmāstitvameva niṣpramāṇa kamabhyupagata miti/
analyzed: ced tena anavagamyamānaḥ pi asti iti ucyate tatas varam dharma astitvam eva niṣpramāṇa kam abhyupagatam iti
translated: If it is said that even though it is not apprehended by that, it exists, then it is better to accept the existence of dharma itself without any means of knowledge.

analyzed: na vā anumānam api asmin śruti kalpane
translated: Nor is inference a means of knowledge in this case, as it presupposes the Veda.

analyzed: na hi smṛtiḥ tathā vyāptā dṛṣṭa anyat vā anumāpakam
translated: For the all-pervasiveness of memory is not seen, nor is there any other inferential mark.

original: yathaiva dharme sambandhādarśanānna kiṃ cilliṅgaṃ kramate tathāṣṭakādiśrutāvapi na vāgamena tadbodho nityena kṛtakena vā /
analyzed: yathā eva dharme sambandha adarśanāt na kim cit liṅgam kramate tathā aṣṭaka ādi śrutau api na vā āgamena tad bodhaḥ nityena kṛtakena vā
translated: Just as no inferential mark operates in regard to dharma due to the non-apprehension of the relation, so also in the case of the Vedic injunction regarding the aṣṭakā etc. The knowledge is not through a Vedic text, whether eternal or created.

analyzed: visrambhaḥ kṛtake nā asti nityaḥ nā eva upapadyate
translated: There is no confidence in the created, the eternal is not possible.

original: na ca vijñāyate vākyaṃ kohaśata nirūpitam /
analyzed: na ca vijñāyate vākyam nirūpitam
translated: And the sentence is not known to be determined by any other.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: The third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: arthavāda ādi rūpāt hi paśyāmaḥ bhrāmyataḥ bahūn
translated: For we see many confused from the form of arthavada and so on.

analyzed: upamānam tu adṛṣṭe rthe sahaśe ca anirūpite
translated: But analogy is not accepted when the object is unseen and the concomitance is not determined.

analyzed: na evā iṣṭam iti tena api na mūlaśruti sādhanam
translated: Therefore, it also does not establish the original Vedic text.

original: yadi hi śrutikalpanena vinā smṛtinrnopapadyate tataḥ samyaṅmalā syāt/🔽saṃbhavati tu svapna malatvena tenānai kāntyādarthāpatteḥ sāmānyato dṛṣṭasya vānavakāśaḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi śruti kalpanena vinā smṛtin na upapadyate tatas samyak malā syāt  saṃbhavati tu svapna mala tvena tena an aikāntyāt arthāpatteḥ sāmānyatas dṛṣṭasya vā anavakāśaḥ
translated: For if it is not possible without the assumption of a Vedic text, then it would be a proper basis.🔽But it is possible as a basis for a dream, so there is no scope for presumption based on the non-apprehension of the known or inference from general observation.

analyzed: tasmāt anupalabdhi gocara āpanna āryā śrutau mṛjā antareṣu abhipreta mūla abhāvāt nirmūla tva abhidhānam
translated: Therefore, even though the Vedic text is within the scope of non-apprehension, it is said to be rootless due to the absence of a desired root in other Smritis.

original: nanu ye vidurevamitikarttavyatāka evaṃphalakaścāsau padārthaḥ karttavya iti /
analyzed: nanu ye viduḥ evam itikarttavyatākaḥ evaṃphalakaḥ ca asau padārthaḥ karttavyaḥ iti
translated: But those who know that this is the procedure and this is the result of that object, that it should be done,

original: atha vā ye karttavyo 'sāvitītyaṃ viduste tathā vijñānantastādṛśāḥ kathamivāsmānvipralabdhaṃ na karttavyo 'sāviti vadeyuḥ/
analyzed: atha vā ye karttavyaḥ sau iti iti am viduḥ te tathā vijñānantaḥ tādṛśāḥ katham iva asmān vipralabdham na karttavyaḥ sau iti vadeyuḥ
translated: or those who know that it should be done, how could they, having that knowledge, deceive us by saying it should not be done?

original: nanvanye evaṃ vadanti karttavya ityanye na vā karttavya ityāhuḥ /
analyzed: nanu anye evam vadanti karttavyaḥ iti anye na vā karttavyaḥ iti āhuḥ
translated: But others say it should be done, others say it should not be done at all.

original: kathamanyatvaṃ yadā teṣāmadhyevamayaṃ smarthyataiti kathite bhavatyevaṃ pratipattiḥ /
analyzed: katham anya tvam yadā teṣām adhi evam ayam smarthyate eti kathite bhavati evam pratipattiḥ
translated: How is it different? When it is said that this is remembered among them, this understanding arises.

original: atha vā ye manvādayo vidurakarttavyo 'yaṃ padārtha iti /
analyzed: atha vā ye manu ādayaḥ viduḥ akarttavyaḥ yam padārthaḥ iti
translated: Or, those who know, like Manu and others, that this meaning of the word is not to be done,

original: kathamiva te vināparādhena lokaṃ vaccayituṃ vadiṣyanti karttavya evāyamiti /
analyzed: katham iva te vinā aparādhena lokam vaccayitum vadiṣyanti karttavyaḥ eva ayam iti
translated: how will they speak to deceive the world without fault, saying that this is indeed to be done?

analyzed: smaraṇa anupapattyā iti
translated: Because of the impossibility of recollection.

analyzed: ye tāvat manu ādibhyaḥ
translated: Those who are later than Manu and others,

analyzed: puruṣāḥ teṣām yat jñānam tat tāvat anavagata pūrva artha tvāt na smṛtiḥ
translated: their knowledge is not memory because it is about a previously unknown object.

original: manvādīnāmapi yadi prathamaṃ kiṃ citpramāṇaṃ sambhāvyate tataḥ smaraṇaṃ bhavennānyathā /
analyzed: manu ādīnām api yadi prathamam kim cit pramāṇam sambhāvyate tatas smaraṇam bhavet na anyathā
translated: Even in the case of Manu and others, if some means of knowledge is possible at first, then there may be memory, not otherwise.

original: kasmātpunaḥ putraṃ duhitaraṃ vātikrasya vandhyādauhitroḍhāharaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: kasmāt punar putram duhitaram vā atikrasya vandhyā dauhitra ūḍhā haraṇam kṛtam
translated: Why then is the example of the barren daughter-in-law given, after transgressing the son or daughter?

analyzed: sthāna tulya tvāt
translated: Because of similarity of position.

original: putrādisthānīyaṃ hi manvādeḥ pūrvavijñānaṃ dauhitrasthānīyaṃ smaraṇamataśca yathā duhiturabhāvaṃ parāmṛgya dauhitrasmṛtiṃ bhrāntiṃ manyate tathā manvādibhiḥ pratyakṣādyasambhavaparāmarśadaṣṭakādismaraṇaṃ mithyeti mantavyam/
analyzed: putra ādi sthānīyam hi manu ādeḥ pūrva vijñānam dauhitra sthānīyam smaraṇam atas ca yathā duhituḥ abhāvam parāmṛgya dauhitra smṛtim bhrāntim manyate tathā manu ādibhiḥ pratyakṣa ādi asambhava parāmarśa daṣṭaka ādi smaraṇam mithyā iti mantavyam
translated: For the knowledge of Manu and others regarding the past is like that of a son, and the Smṛti is like that of a grandson. Just as one, having considered the absence of a daughter, thinks the memory of a grandson to be false, so Manu and others, having considered the impossibility of perception etc., should be understood to think the memory of the Ṛgveda etc. to be false.

analyzed: yathā eva pāramparyeṇa avicchedāt ayam vedaḥ iti vākya anumāna abhiprāyeṇa uktam
translated: Just as it is said with the intention of inferring the sentence that this is the Veda, because of the unbroken tradition,

analyzed: itaraḥ tu arthasya eva aviccheda smaraṇam ayam āhi iti matvā punar nirmūla tvam āha
translated: but the other, thinking that the unbroken memory of the meaning itself is the Veda, again says that it is rootless.

original: vedaḥ punaḥ saviśeṣaḥ pratyakṣagamyastatra ghaṭādivadeva puruṣāntarasthamupalabhya smaranti tairapi smṛtamupalabhyānyepi smaranto 'nyebhyastathaiva samarpayantītyanāditā /
analyzed: vedaḥ punar sa viśeṣaḥ pratyakṣa gamyaḥ tatra ghaṭa ādi vat eva puruṣa antara stham upalabhya smaranti taiḥ api smṛtam upalabhya anye api smarantaḥ nyebhyaḥ tathā eva samarpayanti iti anādi tā
translated: Moreover, the Veda is directly perceptible with its details. There, like a pot etc., they remember having perceived it in another person. Others, having perceived it remembered by them, remember it and convey it to others in the same way. Thus it is beginningless.

analyzed: sarvasya ca ātmīya smaraṇāt parvam upalabdhiḥ sambhavati iti na nirmyūla tā
translated: And the perception of all is possible before their own memory. Therefore it is not rootless.

analyzed: śabda sambandha vyutpatti mātram eva ced ica vṛddha vyavahāra adhīnam
translated: And the relation of the word is dependent only on the usage of the elders for the acquisition of the meaning.

original: prāgapi hi vedaśabdādanyavastu vilakṣaṇaṃ vedāntaravilakṣaṇaṃ vādhyeṭasthamṛgveḍhādirūpaṃ mantrabrāhmaṇādirūpāṇi cānyavilacaṇānyupalabhyante /
analyzed: prāk api hi veda śabdāt anya vastu vilakṣaṇam veda antara vilakṣaṇam vā adhyeṭa stham ṛgveḍha ādi rūpam mantra brāhmaṇa ādi rūpāṇi ca anya vilacaṇāni upalabhyante
translated: For even before the time of the Veda, we find that the Rgveda, etc., in the form of Mantras and Brahmanas, are different from other things, and different from other Vedas, as they are found to be based upon different subjects.

original: sarveṣāṃ cānādayaḥ saṃjñā iti taddāraṇottarakālamapi ga myamānānāṃ pratyakṣatvaṃ sādhitam /
analyzed: sarveṣām ca an ādayaḥ saṃjñāḥ iti tad dāraṇa uttara kālam api ga myamānānām pratyakṣa tvam sādhitam
translated: And it has been proved that all these names are beginningless, so that even after their derivation, they are perceived to be eternal.

original: nanvaṣṭakādiṣu puruṣāntarastheghvapi kumbhakāra kriyāviva kiṃ cidvijñānamūlamasti yadi hi karmasvarūpamātraṃ sāta tataḥ pākādi tadindriyairanyānanutiṣṭhato dṛṣṭvā pare smareyuḥ /
analyzed: nanu aṣṭaka ādiṣu puruṣa antara stheghu api kumbhakāra kriyau iva kim cit vijñāna mūlam asti yadi hi karma svarūpa mātram tatas pāka ādi tat indriyaiḥ anyān anutiṣṭhataḥ dṛṣṭvā pare smareyuḥ
translated: But in the case of Ashtakas, etc., even when performed by different persons, there is some knowledge based on the action, like the action of a potter. If the mere form of the action were to be remembered, then others might remember it on seeing it performed by their own senses in cooking, etc.

analyzed: yatas svica svarga ādi sādhya sādhana sambandhaḥ smarthyate
translated: But the connection between heaven, etc., and the means to attain them is not remembered.

analyzed: na asau puruṣa antareṣu utpadyamānaḥ kaiścid dṛśyate eti andha paramparā nyāyena apramāṇa tā
translated: When produced in other persons, it is not seen by anyone. Thus, like the saying of the blind, it is not a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: sarvasya anādi vyavahāra upanyāsena veda vat prasiddhi abhimānaḥ bhavati atas ndha paramparā nidarśanam
translated: By citing all beginningless usages, like the Veda, it is considered to be well-known. Therefore, the saying of the blind is an example.

analyzed: vede hi prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: In the Veda, in the third section of the first chapter,

analyzed: prāmāṇyasya anādi tvam iha aprāmāṇyasya
translated: The eternality of the validity of the Smṛti is here [asserted] in the case of the invalidity of the Smṛti.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: tādṛśam vā aṣṭaka ādi smaraṇam
translated: Or such a remembrance of the Aṣṭakā, etc.

analyzed: na ca codanā mūla bhūtā upalabhyate
translated: And the injunction as the basis is not perceived.

analyzed: na ca ananubhūta sambandhā numātum śakyate
translated: And that whose connection has not been experienced cannot be inferred.

original: yadi ca vedādupattabhya smṛtayaḥ pravarttitāḥ syuḥ tatorthammaraṇavadita upalabhyāyaṃ manvādibhiḥ praṇīta ityapi pāramparyeṇa smaryeta /
analyzed: yadi ca smṛtayaḥ pravarttitāḥ syuḥ upalabhya ayam manu ādibhiḥ praṇītaḥ iti api pāramparyeṇa smaryeta
translated: And if the Smṛtis would have been produced from the Veda, then, like the remembrance of the meaning, it would be remembered indirectly that this was composed by Manu and others, having perceived it.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be said:

analyzed: kṛtārthīnām niṣprayojanam mūla smaraṇam an ārāṣṭam iti
translated: For those who have accomplished their purpose by the remembrance of the meaning, the remembrance of the basis is useless, as it is not desired.

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

original: na hi yatkṛtaṃ prāmāṇyaṃ tadeva vismattuṃ yujyate /
analyzed: na hi yat kṛtam prāmāṇyam tat eva vismattum yujyate
translated: For what has been made valid cannot be forgotten.

analyzed: a rtha smṛteḥ svatas prāmāṇya abhāvāt
translated: Because the remembrance of the meaning lacks intrinsic validity.

original: sarve puruṣāstāvadetajjānanti yathā vedamūnajñānādinā prāmāṇyaṃ na niścīyataiti /
analyzed: sarve puruṣāḥ tāvat etat jānanti yathā prāmāṇyam na niścīyate eti
translated: All men know this much, that the validity is not ascertained by mere knowledge of the Veda, etc.

analyzed: te katham iva tatra anādaram kuryyaḥ
translated: How then can they show disrespect towards it?

analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

original: yadi hi tairapyarthamātramevānyebhyo 'dhigataṃ na vedo iṣṭa iti tatastatpūrvakeṣvapyayameva paryyanuyoga iti nirmūlasaṃpradāyatvaprasajānimtvānna mucyase /
analyzed: yadi hi taiḥ api artha mātram eva anyebhyaḥ dhigatam na vedaḥ iṣṭaḥ iti tatas tad pūrvakeṣu api ayam eva paryyanuyogaḥ iti nirmūla saṃpradāya tva prasajā niṣkriya tvāt na mucyase
translated: For, if they also have understood only the mere meaning, and not the Veda, then this same objection applies to those based on the Veda also; so you are not free from the consequence of the tradition being rootless.

original: yadi tu pratīnaśākhāmūnatā kalpyeta tataḥ sarvāsāṃ buddhādimṛtīnāmapi taddāraṃ prāmāṇyaṃ prasajyate /
analyzed: yadi tu pratīna śākhā mūna tā kalpyeta tatas sarvāsām buddha ādi mṛtīnām api tad dāram prāmāṇyam prasajyate
translated: If, on the other hand, the missing parts of all the branches are to be imagined, then the validity of all the scriptures of Buddha and others would follow.

original: yasyaiva ca yadabhipretaṃ sa eva tatpralīnaśākhāmastaka niściṣya pra māṇī kuryyāt /
analyzed: yasya eva ca yat abhipretam saḥ eva tat pralīna śākhā mastaka niściṣya kuryyāt
translated: And he who desires a particular thing should select the top of the branch where it is missing and make it authoritative.

original: atha vidyamānaśākhāgatā evaite 'rthāstathāpi manvādaya iva sarve puruṣāstata evopalapsyante /
analyzed: atha vidyamāna śākhā gatāḥ eva ete rthāḥ tathā api manu ādayaḥ iva sarve puruṣāḥ tatas eva upalapsyante
translated: Even if these meanings are only in the existing branches, then all men, like Manu and others, will perceive them from there alone.

original: yuktatarā ca svādhyayādhyayana vidheḥ sāḍhādeva pratītiriti smṛtipraṇayanavaiyarthaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yuktatarā ca svādhyaya adhyayana vidheḥ sāḍhāt eva pratītiḥ iti smṛti praṇayana vaiyartham syāt
translated: And it is more reasonable that the understanding should be directly from the Veda itself, so the composition of the Smritis would be useless.

analyzed: na catad vijñāyate
translated: And that is not known.

analyzed: kīdṛśāt ḍākyāt idam manu ādibhiḥ pratipannam kim vidhi parāt uta arthavāda rūpāt iti
translated: Of what kind is this sentence etc. accepted by Manu and others? Is it from that which has injunction as its purport, or from that which has explanatory passages as its purport?

analyzed: paśya
translated: See

analyzed: na ca manu ādi vacanāt veda mūla tvam niścinumaḥ
translated: And we do not ascertain the Vedic origin from the statements of Manu and others.

original: te hi nirmūlamapi viprannambhādihetorutkā lokaṃ vañcayitumevaṃ vadeyuḥ /
analyzed: te hi nirmūlam api lokam vañcayitum evam vadeyuḥ
translated: For they might speak thus in order to deceive the world, even though the cause is destroyed, like a mirage.

analyzed: tasmāt apramāṇam
translated: Therefore, it is not a means of valid knowledge.

original: sarvacaiva cādṛṣṭakalpanāyāṃ tādṛśaṃ kalpayitavyaṃ yaddṛṣṭaṃ na viruṇaddhi na vādṛṣṭāntaramā sañjayati /
analyzed: sarva ca eva ca adṛṣṭa kalpanāyām tādṛśam kalpayitavyam yat dṛṣṭam na viruṇaddhi na vā adṛṣṭa antaram ā sañjayati
translated: And in all cases of postulating the unseen, one should postulate that which does not contradict what is seen, and does not lead to another unseen [postulation].

analyzed: tatra bhrāntau tāvat
translated: There, in the case of error,

analyzed: sarva loka abhyupagata dṛḍha prāmāṇya bādhaḥ ca
translated: there is the fault of contradicting the scriptures of the wise and virtuous, and the contradiction of what is firmly accepted as authoritative by all people.

analyzed: idānoṃtanaiḥ ca puruṣaiḥ api bhrāntim anvādāḥ nām anuvartti tā
translated: And even now, by the men of the present time, the error has been followed and propagated.

analyzed: tad parihāra upanyāsaḥ ca manu ādīnām iti aneka adṛṣṭa kalpanā
translated: And the proposal of its avoidance is of Manu and others - thus there is the postulation of many unseen [factors].

analyzed: anubhave pi saḥ eva tāvat anubhavaḥ kalpayitavyaḥ
translated: And in the case of experience, that very experience should be postulated.

analyzed: sarva puruṣa jāti viparīta sāmarthya kalpanā manu ādeḥ tat ca etat sarvajña vāde nirākṛtam
translated: And again, the postulation of the present men of all classes having a power contrary to that of Manu and others - this has been refuted in the doctrine of omniscience.

analyzed: puruṣa vākya paramparā api andha paramparayā nirākṛtā
translated: And the succession of human statements has been refuted by the analogy of the blind.

analyzed: na hi niṣpratiṣṭha pramāṇa ātmalābhaḥ dṛśyate
translated: For a means of valid knowledge without a basis is not seen to be obtained.

analyzed: tathā prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: Thus ends the third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: vipralambhe pi tad kalpanā
translated: Even in the case of deception, that [reasoning] is to be imagined.

original: vipranliāprayojanaṃ lokasya ca tatra bhrāntistasyāśceyantaṃ kālamanuvṛttirityādyāśrayaṇīyam /
analyzed: lokasya ca tatra bhrāntiḥ tasyāḥ ca iyantam kālam anuvṛttiḥ ityādi āśrayaṇīyam
translated: The purpose of deception, the delusion of the people there, and the continuation of that for so long a time - such things would have to be accepted.

original: utpannasya ca dṛḍhasya pratyayasya prāmāṇyanirākaraṇād dṛṣṭavirodhaḥ /
analyzed: utpannasya ca dṛḍhasya pratyayasya prāmāṇya nirākaraṇāt dṛṣṭa virodhaḥ
translated: And there is contradiction with what is seen, because the denial of the validity of a firm conviction that has arisen.

analyzed: tasmāt ātmavebhyaḥ codanā kalpanā eva jyāyasī
translated: Therefore, among these, it is better to imagine that the Vedic injunction is the cause.

analyzed: tatra hi tanmātra ādaṣṭa abhyupagamaḥ
translated: For there, the acceptance is based on that alone.

analyzed: śeṣāḥ tu mahā jana parigraha ādayaḥ sarve
translated: But all the others, such as being accepted by the majority of people, are followed.

analyzed: saṃbhāvyate ca manu ādīnām codanā pūrva vijñāna kāraṇa tvena
translated: And it is possible that Manu and others are the cause of the knowledge of what was previously enjoined by the Veda.

analyzed: tad artham eva āha tena upapannaḥ veda saṃyogaḥ traivarṇikānām iti
translated: For that purpose, he says, Therefore, the connection with the Veda of the three varnas is reasonable.

original: yāni punaranupapannavedasaṃbhāvanānāṃ mlecchādīnāmatīndriyārthasmaraṇābhi teṣāṃ mūlakalpanāvelāyāmeva codanā saṃbhāvanāpadaṃ nārūḍheti mithyātva hetu mūlacatuṣṭayapāriśeṣyādapramāṇatvam /
analyzed: yāni punar anupapanna veda saṃbhāvanānām mleccha ādīnām atīndriya artha smaraṇā abhi teṣām mūla kalpanā velāyām eva codanā saṃbhāvanā padam na ārūḍhā iti mithyātva mūla catuṣṭaya pāriśeṣyāt apramāṇa tvam
translated: But in the case of those whose connection with the Veda is unreasonable, such as barbarians, whose recollections of imperceptible objects are based on the four causes of falsehood, since the Vedic injunction has not yet become a basis for the possibility of recollection at the time of imagining the original cause, they are not valid due to the remainder of the four causes of falsehood.

original: saṃbhāvitāyāṃ punaścodanāyāṃ kāraṇāntaraniṣedhe kṛte nirmūlatvāsaṃbhavātpariṃśeṣasiddhaṃ codanāmūlatvam /
analyzed: saṃbhāvitāyām punar codanāyām kāraṇa antara niṣedhe kṛte nirmūla tva asaṃbhavāt pariṃśeṣa siddham codanā mūla tvam
translated: And when the Vedic injunction is established, then, when the possibility of other causes is refuted, it becomes established by elimination that the injunction must have a Vedic origin, since it cannot be without a root.

analyzed: yat tu kimartham codanāḥ na upalabhyante eti
translated: But why are the injunctions not perceived?

analyzed: tatra ke cit āhuḥ
translated: To this, some say:

analyzed: nitya anumeyāḥ tāḥ na kadācid uccāryyante
translated: They are always to be inferred, and are never uttered.

analyzed: yathā liṅga ādi kalpitāḥ
translated: Like those imagined from indications etc.

analyzed: katham anuccāritānām mūla tva upapattiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked how they can be the root when not uttered,

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: that is not a fault.

original: pāṭhāvicchedavatpāramparyeṇa smaraṇāttatmidveḥ yathaiva hi granthaḥ saṃpradāyādavicchinno 'stitvaṃ bhajate tathaiva pratijñayānityānumeyaśrutisaṃpradāyāvicchedasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: pāṭhā viccheda vat pāramparyeṇa smaraṇāt tad midveḥ yathā eva hi granthaḥ saṃpradāyāt avicchinna ustitvam bhajate tathā eva pratijñayā anitya anumeya śruti saṃpradāya aviccheda siddhiḥ
translated: Because of the remembrance of them through the unbroken tradition, like the unbroken recitation of the text. Just as the text exists with an unbroken tradition, in the same way, the unbroken tradition of the Vedic injunctions to be always inferred is established by the promise.

analyzed: tattva yuktam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: andha paramparā nyāyāt eva
translated: Because of the principle of the blind leading the blind.

original: yā hi codanā na kadāciduccāryyate tasyāḥ sarvapuruṣapratyacādiprasarābhāvāddarlabhataramastitvam/
analyzed: yā hi codanā na kadācid uccāryyate tasyāḥ sarva puruṣa pratyaca ādi prasara abhāvāt darlabhataram astitvam
translated: For that injunction which is never uttered, its existence is more difficult to establish, because it does not spread to the consciousness of all people.

analyzed: tathā ca smṛteḥ api sā eva vandhyā dauhitra sulya tā
translated: And in the same way, memory is like the barren woman's son.

analyzed: liṅga ādīnām tu nitya tvāt nityam anucarita śruti anumāna kāra ṇa tvam aviruddham
translated: As for the Linga and other sources, their eternality being established, their being the cause of the inference of eternal Vedic texts is not incompatible.

analyzed: tena varam pralona śruti anumānam eva
translated: Therefore, it is better to infer the Vedic text from the dissolution.

analyzed: na ca pralayaḥ na saṃbhāvyate
translated: And dissolution is not impossible.

analyzed: dṛśyate hi pramāda ālasya ādibhiḥ puruṣa cayāt ca alpa viṣaya tvam
translated: For it is seen that due to human negligence, laziness, etc., there is limited scope.

analyzed: na ca evam sati yat kim cit pramāṇam āpatsyate
translated: And even so, not everything will become a means of knowledge.

analyzed: śiṣṭa caivarṇika tantra vārtika  dṛḍha smaraṇa anyathā anupapatti labhya tvāt śruti anumānasya
translated: The commentary on the system of the virtuous of all classes.🔽Because the inference of the Vedic text is obtained by the impossibility of a firm memory otherwise.

analyzed: yahā vidyamāna śākhā gata śruti mūla tvam eva astu
translated: Let there be the basis of the Vedic text found in the existing branches itself.

analyzed: katham anupalabdhiḥ iti ced ucyate
translated: If it is asked how there is non-apprehension, it is said:

analyzed: yat tu kimartham veda vākyāni eva na upasaṃgṛhītāni iti
translated: But why are the Vedic statements not included?

analyzed: saṃpradāya vi na ābhabhoteḥ
translated: Because of the existence of the tradition.

original: viśiṣṭānupūrvyāvyavasthito hi svādhyāyo 'dhyetavyaḥ śrūyate /🔽smārttāścācārāḥ ke cit kva citkasyāṃ cicchākhāyām /
analyzed: viśiṣṭa ānupūrvya a vyavasthitaḥ hi svādhyāyaḥ dhyetavyaḥ śrūyate  smārttāḥ ca ācārāḥ ke cit kva cit kasyām cit śākhāyām
translated: For it is heard that the Veda should be studied as it is arranged in a special order.🔽And some customary practices are mentioned somewhere in some branch.

analyzed: tatra api tu ke cit puruṣam eva adhikṛtya āmnāyante
translated: And even there, some are mentioned only with reference to a person.

original: yena ṛtuprakaraṇāmnātāḥ kena cinnimittanotkṛṣyamāṇāḥ puruṣadhamatāṃ bhajante /
analyzed: yena ṛtu prakaraṇa āmnātāḥ kena cit nimittanā utkṛṣyamāṇāḥ puruṣa dhama tām bhajante
translated: By which, being extracted for some reason from the context of the ritual, they come to be treated as human practices.

original: yathā malavadvāsasā saha na saṃvadettasmānna brāhmaṇāyāvagurodityevamādayaḥ /
analyzed: yathā malavat vāsasā saha na saṃvadet tasmāt na brāhmaṇāya avagurot iti evamādayaḥ
translated: Like One should not converse with a person wearing a dirty garment, therefore one should not spit towards a Brahmin, and so on.

original: tatra yadi tāvattānyeva vākyānyuddhṛtyādhyāpayeyustataḥ kramānyatvātsvādhyāyavidhivirodhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tatra yadi tāvat tāni eva vākyāni uddhṛtya adhyāpayeyuḥ tatas krama anya tvāt svādhyāya vidhi virodhaḥ syāt
translated: If they were to extract those very sentences and teach them, then due to the change in sequence, there would be a contradiction with the injunction to study one's own Veda.

original: anena ca nirdeśena anye 'pyarthavādodvāreṇa vidhimātramadhīyoran kopayikamātraṃ vā /
analyzed: anena ca nirdeśena anye vidhi mātram adhīyoran vā
translated: And by this instruction, others would also study only the injunction or just the useful part through the door of explanatory passages.

analyzed: tatra veda pralayaḥ prasajyeta
translated: In that case, the destruction of the Veda would follow.

analyzed: na ca avaśyam manu ādayaḥ sarva śākhā adhyāyinaḥ
translated: And Manu and others are not necessarily students of all the branches.

original: te hi prayatnena śākhāntarādhyāyibhyaḥ śrutvārthamātraṃ svavākyaira vismaraṇārthaṃ nivanīyuḥ /
analyzed: te hi prayatnena śākhā antara adhyāyibhyaḥ śrutvā artha mātram sva vākyaiḥ a vismaraṇa artham
translated: They, having heard the meaning from those who have studied other branches with effort, would compile it with their own words to prevent forgetting.

analyzed: na ca vākya viśeṣaḥ jñāyate
translated: And the specific sentences are not known.

analyzed: yathā eva hi smṛteḥ dṛḍha tvāt hānti mūla tvam na asti evam arthavāda mūla tvam api
translated: Just as there is no ultimate basis for Smriti due to its firmness, in the same way, there is no basis in explanatory passages.

analyzed: śaknuvanti hi te vidhi artha vādī vivektum
translated: For they are able to distinguish between the meaning of the injunctions and the explanatory passages.

analyzed: tatra smṛ te
translated: There, the inference of the identity of the Smṛti with the Veda, based on the fact of its being an injunction, is without any evidence, as regards its being preceded by a Vedic text.

analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

original: vedo'khilo dharmamūlaṃ sarvo'bhihito veda iti ca svayameva smartṛbhirātmā badhvāsamarpita staccaitanniyogatastatkālaiḥ kartṛbhirbuddhikāritvādupalabdhamataḥ siddhaṃ vedadvāraṃ prāmāṇyam /🔽yastu kartṛsāmānyāt svataprathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: vedaḥ ukhilaḥ dharma mūlam vedaḥ iti ca svayam eva smartṛbhiḥ ātmā badhvā samarpitaḥ stat ca etat niyogataḥ tad kālaiḥ kartṛbhiḥ buddhi kāri tvāt upalabdham atas siddham veda dvāram prāmāṇyam  yaḥ tu kartṛ sāmānyāt
translated: the Smṛti-writers themselves have declared that the entire Veda is the root of Dharma, and that all of it is Veda. And this fact, which is perceived by the authors of the Smṛti at the time of their composition, on account of their being the agents, is established as the source of the authority of the Smṛti, through the Veda.

analyzed: ntram eva prāmāṇyam vedam ūna tvam vā anumānena sādhayati tad sva artha kāma anusāribhiḥ hṛṣṭa arthaiḥ ācāraiḥ anekāntaḥ
translated: But one who seeks to establish the self-validity of the Veda, or its being the root of Dharma, by inference, on the ground of the identity of the author, that is inconclusive, because the practices of the people follow their desires.

analyzed: śrayamāṇa śruti adhīna prāmāṇya āpatteḥ ca viruddha tā
translated: And it is contradictory, because it would lead to the absurdity of the authority of the Smṛti being dependent on the Śruti.

analyzed: tasmāt arthāpattiḥ eva ācā avyabhicārāt upacārāt paścāt mānāt anumāna tvena uktā asyāḥ eva smṛteḥ brūḍhimnā eti
translated: Therefore, the presumption itself, which has been stated as inference on account of its invariable concomitance, its being a secondary meaning, and its being a later cognition, is accepted as the basis of this Smṛti, on account of its being well-known.

analyzed: dṛḍha tvāt kāraṇa anumānam atha vā dṛḍha tvasya
translated: Or, the inference of the cause is firm on account of its firmness.

original: na hi manuṣyā icaiveti niḥśeṣasaṃskāracchidā maraṇenāntaritvāt karmaphana saṃbandhānusandhānāsaṃbhavanocyate /
analyzed: na hi manuṣyāḥ maraṇena antari tvāt saṃbandha anusandhāna asaṃbhavanā ucyate
translated: For it is not said that men alone, because of death, which cuts off all impressions without exception, are incapable of recollecting the connection between action and its results.

analyzed: smṛti vaidika padārthayoḥ kartṛ māmānyāt upapannaḥ veda saṃyogaḥ traivarṇikānām iti codanā mūla saṃbhāvanā pada lābha artham vismaraṇam api upapadyate eti
translated: And the connection of the three varnas with the Veda is proper due to the similarity of the agent in the remembered Vedic meaning and the present Vedic meaning. And forgetting is also proper for the purpose of obtaining the words possibility and gain in the original injunction.

analyzed: dṛśyate hi adya tve pi artha smaraṇam grantha nāśaḥ ca
translated: For even now, the remembrance of the meaning and the loss of the text are seen.

original: yaḍhātu śākhāntareṣu vidyantaeva tāḥ yastadāpi kasyāṃ śākhāyāṃ kāḥ padyantaiti syāṃśasya vismaraṇam /
analyzed: yaḍhā tu śākhā antareṣu vidyante eva tāḥ yaḥ tadā api kasyām śākhāyām kāḥ vismaraṇam
translated: But if they exist in other branches, then even then there would be forgetting of which ones are recited in which branch.

analyzed: vaidika tva mātram tu prāmāṇya siddhaye paripālayanti
translated: But they preserve only the mere Vedic nature for the establishment of validity.

analyzed: tad viśeṣa jñānam punar anaupayika tvāt an ādarttavyam eva
translated: But the knowledge of the details is to be disregarded itself, because it is not useful.

original: tathā pratyupasthita niyamānāmityāgatamāgataṃ nimittaṃ prati ye niyamyante vṛ ddhavayaḥ pratyutthānādayasteṣāṃ dṛṣṭārthatvādeva prāmāṇyamiti /
analyzed: tathā pratyupasthita niyamānām iti āgatam āgatam nimittam prati ye niyamyante pratyutthāna ādayaḥ teṣām dṛṣṭārtha tvāt eva prāmāṇyam iti
translated: Similarly, those who are present are restricted by the approaching occasion, such as the duty of rising up for an elder. The validity of those is due to the visible purpose itself.

analyzed: etat yuktam
translated: This is proper.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: nahi yāvakiṃ cidācaraṇaṃ tasya sarvasya mūlamitra pramāṇī kriyate /
analyzed: nahi yāvakim cit ācaraṇam tasya sarvasya mūlam itra pramāṇī kriyate
translated: For not all actions are taken as the basis of all of them.

analyzed: dharmma jijñāsā adhikārāt
translated: Because the topic is the desire to know Dharma.

original: yadi ca gurvanugamādīnāṃ kevalaṃ dṛṣṭārthatvameva syāttata ṛṣyādivaḍammeṃ pratyaprāmāṇyamaveti nopanyasitavyāḥ /
analyzed: yadi ca guru anugama ādīnām kevalam dṛṣṭārtha tvam eva syāt tatas na upanyasitavyāḥ
translated: And if the mere visible purpose of following the teacher etc. were to be accepted, then the Rishis etc. would not be mentioned as having no authority.

analyzed: syāt etat apramāṇa tvena eṣām upanyāsaḥ iti
translated: It may be argued that they are mentioned because they are not authoritative.

analyzed: na
translated: No.🔽🔽

analyzed: tathā sati hetu darśanāt ca iti atra udāharttavyāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: If that were so, they would have to be cited in the text And because the reason is seen.

analyzed: tasmāt śreyān samiti ca darśanam niṣphalam
translated: Therefore, the view that it is better is fruitless.

original: na ca niyogataḥ śāstrāta prāptiḥ / śakyate chupāyāntareṇāpi sāmadānādinā gururadhyāpanādīni kārayitum /
analyzed: na ca niyogataḥ śāstrāt prāptiḥ śakyate chupāya antareṇa api sāma dāna ādinā guruḥ adhyāpana ādīni kārayitum
translated: And there is no attainment from the scriptures by mere injunction. It is possible to get the teacher to teach etc. even by other means such as conciliation and gifts.

analyzed: tatra asti niyama vidheḥ avakāśaḥ
translated: There is scope for the injunction of restriction there.

original: sarvatra ca yathā kathaṃ cillokapakimahāyopāḍhānātmarakṣaṇaprītyutpādādikā ṭārthatā bhāṣyakāroktā śakyā vaktum /
analyzed: sarvatra ca yathā katham cit loka paki mahāya upāḍhāna ātma rakṣaṇa prīti utpāda ādikā bhāṣyakāra uktā śakyā vaktum
translated: And everywhere, the purpose such as the production of protection of the self by any means possible, as stated by the commentator, can be stated.

analyzed: na ca avaghāta ādīnām vṛṣṭi kāma yāga ādīnām ca dṛṣṭa arthānām avaidika tvam
translated: And the threshing etc. and the rain-desire sacrifices etc. which have visible purposes are not non-Vedic.

original: tasmāt satyapi dṛṣṭārthatve sambhāvyate vedamanatve niyamādṛṣṭasiddherananyapramāṇakatvādataśca gurvanugamanādernaimittikatvāḍha kriyāyāṃ pratyavāyaḥ ka raṇe ca na bhavati /
analyzed: tasmāt sati api dṛṣṭārtha tve sambhāvyate veda mana tve niyama adṛṣṭa siddheḥ ananya pramāṇaka tvāt atas ca guru anugamana ādeḥ naimittika tvāt ḍha kriyāyām pratyavāyaḥ raṇe ca na bhavati
translated: Thus, even though the Smṛti has an apparent purpose, it is possible that it is based on the Veda, because it establishes unseen results through injunctions, and because it is not based on any other means of knowledge. And therefore, the performance of the act of following the teacher, etc., does not lead to an undesirable consequence, either in the case of its being done or not being done, because it is occasional.

analyzed: dṛṣṭam ca prītaḥ guruḥ adhyāpayiṣyati iti evamādi niṣyadyate
translated: And it is seen that the teacher, being pleased, will teach thus, etc.

analyzed: niyamāt ca avighna samāpti artha apūrva siddhiḥ
translated: And through the injunction, the unseen result of completion without obstacles is established.

original: evaṃ cācārādgṛhyamāṇeṣu tathā syādityatra sakṛdasakṛddānuṣṭhānamiti vi cāro yuktaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca ācārāt gṛhyamāṇeṣu tathā syāt iti atra sakṛt asakṛt dā anuṣṭhānam iti vi cāraḥ yuktaḥ
translated: And thus, in the case of things being taken from the practice, the discussion of whether the giving should be done once or repeatedly is appropriate.

analyzed: itarathā tu dṛṣṭārtha tva vaśena eva udaka pāna ādi vat avadhāraṇam syāt
translated: Otherwise, due to the apparent purpose, the restriction would be like drinking water.

original: yattu bhāṣyakāreṇa dṛṣṭārthatvādeva prāmāṇya mityuktaṃ tatpūrvapaśavādyatiśayārthametaduktaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yat tu bhāṣyakāreṇa dṛṣṭārtha tvāt eva prāmāṇyam iti uktam tad pūrva paśava ādi atiśaya artham etat uktam bhavati
translated: But what the author of the Bhāṣya has said, that the validity is due to the apparent purpose itself, that is said for the purpose of surpassing the views of others.

original: yāstāvadahaṣṭārthāḥ smṛtayastāḥ kathaṃ cidapramāṇī kuryyādbhavānimāḥ punagurvanugamanādiviṣayāḥ kathamivāpramāṇaṃ bhaviṣyantīti /
analyzed: yāḥ tāvat ahaṣṭa arthāḥ smṛtayaḥ tāḥ katham cit apramāṇī kuryyāt bhavān imāḥ punar guru anugamana ādi viṣayāḥ katham iva apramāṇam bhaviṣyanti iti
translated: For those Smṛtis which have apparent purposes, one could somehow make them unauthoritative. But how can these, which have as their subject following the teacher, etc., be unauthoritative?

original: sabhāprapādīnāṃ yadyapi viśaṣaśrutinaiva kalpyate tathāpi paropakāraśrutyaiva samastānāmupādānātprāmāṇyam /
analyzed: sabhā prapādīnām yadi api viśaṣa śrutinā eva kalpyate tathā api para upakāra śrutyā eva samastānām upādānāt prāmāṇyam
translated: Although the validity of the assembly hall and the water-trough is not assumed by any specific Vedic text, still they are valid because they are included in the Vedic text that speaks of helping others.

analyzed: tasmāt śreyāṃsam iti ave gaībhena anugantavye siddha vat śreyasām ūnaiḥ anugamanam darśayati
translated: Therefore, in the sentence to the better one, the word better should be understood as a mere reference, and the text shows the mere reference to the better ones as if it were established.

original: yathā dhanvani nirudake kṛtāḥ prapāḥ pareṣāmupakurvantyevaṃ tvamiti devatāstutipare vākye siddhavatprapāsadbhāvaḥ tasyāśca pārāyaṃ dṛśyate /
analyzed: yathā dhanvani nirudake kṛtāḥ prapāḥ pareṣām upakurvanti evam tvam iti devatā stuti pare vākye siddha vat prapā sadbhāvaḥ tasyāḥ ca pārāyam dṛśyate
translated: Just as water-troughs made in a desert without water benefit others, so do you. The sentence is devoted to praising the deity, and the existence of the water-trough is as if established, and its end is seen.

analyzed: śikhākarma tatra api ācāra niyamasya a dṛṣṭa artha tvāt na eva tāvat mātram eva prayojanam
translated: The sign of the cow is the tuft-rite. Even there, the rule of conduct is for an unseen purpose, so that alone is not the purpose.

original: śakyaṃ pāyāntareṇāpi gocaṃ smarttu tenānya evābhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: śakyam pāya antareṇa api gocam smarttu tena anyaḥ evā abhiprāyaḥ
translated: It is possible to remember the cow by some other means, so the intention is different.

analyzed: karma aṅga bhūnam tāvat caturavatta pañcāvatta ādi vibhāga siddhi artham avaśyam smarttavyam gotram
translated: And the gotra must be remembered for the sake of establishing the division into four-mouthfuls, five-mouthfuls, etc., which is a part of the ritual.

original: ataśca taccinhārthamapi prathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /🔽tāvacchikhākalpasmṛtaḥ prāmāṇyamastu /
analyzed: atas ca tad cinha artham api prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda 🔽tāvat śikhākalpa smṛtaḥ prāmāṇyam astu
translated: Therefore, even for the sake of its sign, the tuft-rite is valid as a mere reference.

analyzed: tad niyama adṛṣṭasya tu akāntena eva ananyagati tvāt puruṣa artha tā setsyati iti
translated: But the unseen result of that (study of the Smṛtis) will be accomplished by itself, as there is no other way (of accomplishing it).

analyzed: tena sarva smṛtīnām prayojanavataḥ prāmāṇya siddhiḥ
translated: Thus, the validity of all Smṛtis having a purpose is established.

analyzed: tatra tat veda prabhavam
translated: Among them, that which is connected with liberation is based on the Veda.

analyzed: yat tu artha sukha viṣayam vektavyam
translated: But that which has as its object wealth and pleasure should be understood to be preceded by worldly usage.

analyzed: eṣā eva itihāsa purāṇayoḥ api upadeśa vākyānām gatiḥ
translated: This is also the course of the instructive passages in Itihāsa and Purāṇa.

analyzed: upākhyānāni tu arthavādeṣu vyākhyātāni
translated: The stories, however, have been explained in the Arthavāda (passages).

original: yattu pṛthavīvibhāgakathanaṃ tadbarmmādharmmasādhanaphalopabhogapradeśavivekāya kiṃ cidarśanapūrvakaṃ kiṃ cidvedamūlam /
analyzed: yat tu pṛthavī vibhāga kathanam tat barmma adharmma sādhana phala upabhoga pradeśa vivekāya kim cit darśana pūrvakam kim cit veda mūlam
translated: But the description of the division of the earth is for the purpose of distinguishing the regions for the enjoyment of the fruits of Dharma and Adharma, some of which are based on the visible (sources of knowledge), some on the Veda.

analyzed: vaṃśa anukramaṇam api brāhmaṇa kṣatriya jāti gotra jñāna atham darśana smaraṇa mūlam
translated: The enumeration of dynasties also is based on the visible (sources of knowledge) and memory for the purpose of knowing the Brāhmaṇa, Kṣatriya castes and Gotras.

original: deśakālaparimāṇamapi lokajyotiḥśā khavyavahārasiddhyarthaṃ darśanagaṇita saṃpradāyānumānapūrvakaṃ bhāvikathanamapi tvanādikālapravṛttayugasvabhāvadharmmādharmmānuṣṭhānaphalavipāka vaicityajñānadvāreṇa vedamūlaṃ aṅgavidyānāmapi kratvarthapūruṣārthapratipādanaṃ lokavedapūrvakatvena vivektavyam /
analyzed: deśa kāla parimāṇam api loka jyotiḥśā kha vyavahāra siddhi artham darśana gaṇita saṃpradāya anumāna pūrvakam bhāvi kathanam api tu anādi kāla pravṛtta yuga svabhāva dharmma adharma anuṣṭhāna phala vipāka vaicitya jñāna dvāreṇa veda mūlam aṅga vidyānām api kratu artha pūruṣa artha pratipādanam loka veda pūrvaka tvena vivektavyam
translated: The teaching of future events, based on the tradition of astrology and astronomy, is also based on the Vedas, through the knowledge of the diversity of results of the fruits of the performance of the natural qualities of righteousness and unrighteousness that have been current from beginningless time. The teaching of the subsidiary sciences, which expounds the purpose of sacrifices and the purpose of man, should be distinguished as based on worldly and Vedic knowledge.

analyzed: tatra śikṣāyām tāvat yat varṇa karaṇa svara kāla ādi pravibhāga kathanam tat pratyakṣa pūrvakam

analyzed: yat tu tathā vijñānāt prayoge phala viśeṣa smaraṇam
translated: But the remembrance of the special result in the application from such knowledge,

translated: and the remembrance of the obstacle the mantra is defective in sound or letter are based on the Vedas.

analyzed: evam kalpasūtra iyu arthavāda ādi miśra śākhā antara viprakīrṇa nyāya labhya vidhi upasaṃcāra phalam artha nirūpaṇam tat tat pramāṇam aṅgīkṛtam
translated: Similarly, in the Kalpasutras, the description of the purpose of the injunctions obtained from the scattered reasoning in the branches mixed with explanatory passages, etc. accepts those as valid means of knowledge.

original: lokavyavahārapūrvakāca ke cid ṛtvigādivyavahārāḥ sukhārthahetutvenāśritāḥ vyākaraṇe 'pi śabdāpaśabdavibhāgajñānaṃ sākṣācādi vibhāgavatpratyānimittam /

translated: And some usages like the priest etc. are based on the Vedas for the sake of happiness. In grammar also, the knowledge of the distinction between correct and incorrect words is based on the distinction of the vowels etc.

original: ekaviṣaye viruddhārthopasaṃhāriṇī vijñāne virudhyete balavadabalabattvanirṇayācca bādhyavādhakabhāvaṃ pratipadyete tadyadi śakitavirodhayorapi śrutismṛtyoḥ kena citprakāreṇa bhinnaviṣayatvena vyavasthā siddhyet /
analyzed: eka viṣaye viruddha artha upasaṃhāriṇī vijñāne virudhyete balavat abalabat tva nirṇayāt ca bādhya vādhaka bhāvam pratipadyete tat yadi śakita virodhayoḥ api śruti smṛtyoḥ kena cit prakāreṇa bhinna viṣaya tvena vyavasthā siddhyet
translated: And when two such cognitions come into conflict, they are found to be mutually contradictory, and to be related to each other as the sublater and the sublated, on the ground of the one being stronger and the other weaker. If, then, it be possible to establish the fact of the two conflicting Smṛtis and Śāstras having different spheres of application, then, even though they be in conflict, they may be accepted as both authoritative. Or, if it be found that the two are not in conflict, because what is enjoined in one is prohibited in the other, then, even in the case of the same object, the two may be accepted as optional alternatives, and as such, not conflicting, they may be accepted as both authoritative. And in the case of the conflicting Smṛtis, it is found that they are not in conflict, because the two are not found to be laid down as optional alternatives, and as such, they may be accepted as both authoritative.

original: vidheyapratiṣedhyayorvā virodhābhāvādekasminnapi viṣaye samuccaya sambhavāde kaprayogagatatvā sambhavādobhayoḥ prāmāṇyāṅgīkaraṇena prayogāntare cobhayānugrahaḥ syādityevaṃ vikalpāśrayaṇe'pyatyanta virodhābhāvātpratyakṣānumitaśrutijanitajñānayośca vaidikatvā viśeṣe tulyabalatvakalpanādubhayaprāmāṇyamupapatsyate /🔽tato yathopanyastaviṣaye'pi smṛtiprāmāprathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: vidheya pratiṣedhyayoḥ vā virodha abhāvāt ekasmin api viṣaye samuccaya sambhavāt e ka prayoga gata tva sambhavāt ubhayoḥ prāmāṇya aṅgīkaraṇena prayoga antare ca ubhaya anugrahaḥ syāt iti evam vikalpa āśrayaṇe pi atyanta virodha abhāvāt pratyakṣa anumita śruti janita jñānayoḥ ca vaidika tvā viśeṣe tulya bala tva kalpanāt ubhaya prāmāṇyam upapatsyate  tatas yathā upanyasta viṣaye pi smṛti prāmā prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: And as for the conflict between the two cognitions brought about by Perception and Inference on the one hand, and the Vedic Injunction on the other, inasmuch as both the former cognitions are based upon the Veda, they are equally authoritative, and as such, they are not in conflict with the Vedic Injunction.🔽And hence, even in the case of the subjectmatter of the Smṛti that has been brought forward, we must admit of the authority of the Smṛti.

analyzed: ā iyam apeśitavyam
translated: And thus, the Smṛti being found to be authoritative, we must admit of the authority of the Smṛti in all cases.

original: atha ta prayatnenāgviṣyamāṇe 'pi na viṣayāntarakṛtā vyavasthā / nāpi prameyāntarāvirodhātsamuccayo / nāpi vikalpenobhayānugrahaḥ / kiṃ tarchubhayapīḍanādatyantavirodha eva /
analyzed: atha na viṣaya antara kṛtā vyavasthā nā api prameya antara avirodhāt samuccayaḥ nā api vikalpena ubhaya anugrahaḥ kim tarch ubhaya pīḍanāt atyanta virodhaḥ eva
translated: Now, even if they are sought with effort, there is no arrangement due to another object, nor is there a combination due to non-contradiction with another object of knowledge, nor is there favor to both by option. Then what? It is only extreme contradiction due to the affliction of both.

original: pratyaśānumeya śrutyoca laukika pratyaśānumānavanma hānbala viśeṣastadā gatyantarābhāvādubhayānugrahāsambhava śratibalīyasvena sṭa tiprāmāṇyamapekṣaṇīyaṃ bhaviṣyatīti
analyzed: laukika pratyaśa anumeya śrutyā uca laukika pratyaśa anumāna vat mahān bala viśeṣaḥ tadā gati antara abhāvāt ubhaya anugraha asambhava śrati balīya svena bhaviṣyati iti
translated: Then, like the great difference in strength between inference based on perception and inference based on scripture, and inference based on worldly perception, when there is no other way and there is no favor to both, the strength of scripture will have to be relied upon due to the greater strength of scripture.

original: anāśaṅkita vipralambhabhrāntyādimūnā hyavyāhata vedamūlatvāvadhāraṇāḥ smṛtayo nirvyājaprāmāṇyāḥ śakyante dharmavyavahārāṅgatvena sthāpayitum /
analyzed: an āśaṅkita vipralambha bhrānti ādi mūnāḥ hi avyāhata veda mūla tva avadhāraṇāḥ smṛtayaḥ nirvyāja prāmāṇyāḥ śakyante dharma vyavahāra aṅga tvena sthāpayitum
translated: For those Smṛtis which are not suspected of being based on deception, error, etc., and which are ascertained to be based on the Veda, are capable of being established as constituents of Dharma usage due to their uncontradicted authority.

original: yadā tu vedaviruddhatvahetudarśanaparasparavigānādinā kena cidapi senāsāmaprāmāṇyaṃ kalpyate /
analyzed: yadā tu veda viruddha tva hetu darśana paraspara vigāna ādinā kena cit api senā sāma prāmāṇyam kalpyate
translated: But when the authority of the Smṛtis is imagined by someone to be due to the perception of the reason of contradiction with the Veda, mutual inconsistency, etc.,

original: tadā bahuśākhākhilaprakaraṇādibheda bhinneṣu veṭeṣu śrutiliṅgādyātmakopadeśanāmādidvārātideśātmaka vicitra pramāṇabhāgeṣu ko jānāti kā smṛtiḥ kośena vedabhāgena viruddhyamānā kadānumāsyataiti /
analyzed: tadā bahu śākhā akhila prakaraṇa ādi bheda bhinneṣu veṭeṣu śruti liṅga ādi ātmaka upadeśa nāma ādi dvāra atideśa ātmaka vicitra pramāṇa bhāgeṣu kaḥ jānāti kā smṛtiḥ kośena veda bhāgena viruddhyamānā
translated: Then, in the Vedas which are divided into many branches, all sections, etc., in the various parts of the Vedas, through the transference of the teaching consisting of Śruti, Liṅga, etc., by the door of the beginning, in the various parts of the proofs consisting of transference, who knows what Smṛti is? When contradicted by a part of the Veda, when will it be inferred?

original: ataścaivaṃjātāśakannaiva ka cidapi viśvasyeta aviśvāsācātyantameva prāmāṇyaṃ pratihamyeta /
analyzed: atas ca evaṃjātā aśakat nā eva ka cit api viśvasyeta aviśvāsāt ca atyantam eva prāmāṇyam pratihamyeta
translated: And therefore, one who is unable to do this will not believe in anything at all. And due to lack of belief, the validity will be completely obstructed.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus,

analyzed: eka mūla vyavasthāyām mūla antara nirākriyā
translated: In the establishment of a single root, the denial of another root,

analyzed: aprāmāṇya nivṛtti artham śakyāḥ na tad upekṣaṇe
translated: For the purpose of preventing invalidity, it is not possible to ignore it.

analyzed: paṭhita smaryyamāṇānām tathā evā iti avadhāryyatām  mūla antaram nirastam ca sāmānyena eva yat purā  tat anuprāṇyate paścā adhirodhe na iti atikriyā

analyzed: lathayataḥ modet

analyzed: vedaḥ ca yadi dṛṣṭa artham śrayamāṇa virodhi vā

analyzed: ṛtvigbhyaḥ dakṣiṇā dānam tānūnaprā ādi karmma ca

analyzed: svātantryeṇa pramāṇa tvam smṛteḥ tāvat na sammatam

analyzed: veda mūla anumānam ca pratyakṣeṇa virudhyate

analyzed: pratyaśce śrūyamāṇe tu na vidyeta ānumānikam

analyzed: nahi hastini dṛṣṭe tad padena anumiṣyate

analyzed: tāvat eva spharanti arthāḥ purastāt ānumānikāḥ

analyzed: yāvat pratyakṣa śāstreṇa mūtram eṣām na kṛntyate

analyzed: na hi sāścāt pramāṇa tvam smṛtīnām upapadyate

analyzed: na anya mūlam yatas tat syāt tat tu mūlam na vidyate

analyzed: prameyam yat paricchedyam bhavet kana cit ātmanā

analyzed: tasya syāt tad pariccheda ātma avakāśa pramāṇa tā

analyzed: yasya tu utpadyamānasya mūnam eva nikṛntyate

analyzed: labdhavyaḥ sa virodhe pi pūrva sāmānya darśanāt

analyzed: tasmāt sarvatra bādhyaḥ sau iti etat api na iṣyate

analyzed: yaḥ hi sāmānya dṛṣṭena vyavahāra

analyzed: bādhitām mṛgatṛṣṇām vā dṛṣṭvā

analyzed: rudhyate viṣayaḥ yāvat na asya pratyakṣa janmanā

analyzed: atas cit pramāṇa tvam ka cit api apramāṇa tām

analyzed: sayam atyantam anyāyyā iyoḥ api anavasthitiḥ

analyzed: yasya api tu apramāṇa tvam apramāṇam tat ucyatām

analyzed: yena śruteḥ pramāṇa tvam syāt smṛteḥ ca apramāṇa tā

analyzed: smātasya bādhakaḥ śrautaḥ balavat tvāt pratīyate

analyzed: pratyakṣam ca anumāne ca prāk etat hi avadhāritam

analyzed: smṛtyā pratīyate yāvat śutyā tāvat pramīyate

analyzed: viruddha dharmmatām ekaḥ na ca dharmaḥ pratīcchati

analyzed: smṛtvā ca artham parāmṛśya yāvat tad viṣayām śrutim
translated: And having remembered the object and reflected on it, as long as one engages in inferring the Vedic text pertaining to it,

analyzed: anumātum pravarteta tāvatmaḥ rthaḥ nyatas gataḥ
translated: by that time the object has gone elsewhere.

analyzed: yugapad pramimīyātām yadi ca artham śruti smṛtī
translated: If Vedic text and memory were to cognize the object simultaneously,

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda  gṛhīta viśeṣa tvāt syātām tulya bale tatas

analyzed: tatas ṛtha viprakarṣe pi pramāṇa tvena tulya tā
translated: Therefore, even in the remoteness of the object, there is equality in being a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: bhavet eva śruti smṛtyoḥ arthaḥ śruti parigrahāt
translated: The meaning of the Vedic text and the Smṛti would be due to the acceptance of the Vedic text.

analyzed: jāyate klṛptayā tasmāt ātmā bādhyeta apratiṣṭhitā
translated: Therefore, the Smṛti, which is not established, would be overridden by the one whose basis is accepted.

analyzed: smṛti mūla anapekṣā hi smṛti tvāt eva hīyate
