analyzed: tad apekṣā punar śrutyā bādhyate mūna varjjitā
translated: But that which depends on it is overridden by the Vedic text, free from the defect of being contradicted by perception.

analyzed: dvitīyena prakāreṇa vikalpa pavīm gatā
translated: By the second method, it is considered to be contradicted by the option.

analyzed: pannā pākṣikam bādham atyantam bādhyate smṛtiḥ
translated: The Smṛti is absolutely contradicted by the partial contradiction.

analyzed: kim tu tasyāḥ pramāṇa tvam śruti mūla tva kāritam
translated: But its validity is due to its being based on the Śruti.

analyzed: yatas tasmāt a tad mūlā tadānīm sā avadhāryyate
translated: Since that is so, it is understood that at that time it is not based on that.

analyzed: śrutim mukkā ca yat mūlam smṛteḥ anyat prakalpyate
translated: If something other than the Śruti is assumed to be the basis of the Smṛti,

analyzed: tena eva asyāḥ pramāṇa tvam atyantam pratihanyate

analyzed: tatas tvad ukta mārgeṇa pratihanyeta sarvadā
translated: Therefore, it would always be obstructed by the path stated by you.

analyzed: na tu etasya prasaṅgaḥ sti smṛtaḥ pūrva parigrahe
translated: But there is no possibility of this, if the Smṛti is accepted first.

original: na paścācchrayamāṇāpi śrutiḥ syātpratibandhikā /🔽gaībhenāpanītaṃ hi harennāśvaśvidgataḥ

analyzed: śrādye prapāṭhaka yena vrīhi śāstram pratīyate
translated: In the first section, if the treatise on rice is understood,

original: dvitoye yavaśāstraṃ ca na tattatprati durbalam /
analyzed: dvitoye yava śāstram ca na tat tat prati durbalam
translated: and in the second section, the treatise on barley, that is not weak against each other.

analyzed: sva śākhā vihitaiḥ ca api śākhā antara gatān vidhīn
translated: And even by those enjoined in one's own branch, and by the injunctions found in other branches,

analyzed: kalpa kārāḥ nibadhnanti sarve eva vikalpitān
translated: All the authors of Kalpasūtras bind (the people) with options.

analyzed: pūrva prāptau pramāṇa tvam para tvena apramāṇa tām
translated: In the case of the prior attainment, it is a means of valid knowledge, and in the case of the subsequent, it is not a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: prasajyamāni kāmā iva kaḥ dhī avasthā ītma cetanaḥ
translated: What intelligent person would accept this contradictory position?

analyzed: sarvā iva sarvā vā bhrāntimūlikā
translated: All Smṛtis are either based on the Veda or have their root in delusion.

analyzed: smṛtiḥ evam nirūpyeta na tu syāt mūla saṃkaraḥ
translated: Thus, the Smṛti should be examined in this way, and there should not be a mixture of sources.

analyzed: tatas ca pūrva vijñānam mithyā etat iti cintayan
translated: Therefore, thinking that the prior knowledge is false,

analyzed: dau eva apramāṇa tvam smṛtaḥ iti adhyavasthati
translated: he determines that the Smṛti is indeed not a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: samāna viṣaya tvāt vi pūrveṣām api bādhanam
translated: Because they have the same object, the prior ones are also contradicted.

analyzed: na hi teṣām amithyātve mithyā idānīntanam bhavet
translated: For if they were false, the present one could not be false.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: pratiprayogam pramāṇa parthyālocanāt
translated: Because the validity of each application is examined.

original: yadi hyeka prayogagatā locanenaiva prayogāntarāṇyapyanutiṣṭheyustato yena trīhiśāstramapramāṇīkṛtya yavāḥ parigṛhyeransa yāvajjovaṃ taireva yajeteti naiva pratipuruṣamubhābhyāṃ vikalpyamānābhyāṃ vyavahāraḥ siddhyet /
analyzed: yadi hi eka prayoga gatāḥ locanena eva prayoga antarāṇi api anutiṣṭheyuḥ tatas yena trīhi śāstram a pramāṇīkṛtya yavāḥ parigṛhyeran sa yāvajjovam taiḥ eva yajeta iti na eva pratipuruṣam ubhābhyām vikalpyamānābhyām vyavahāraḥ siddhyet
translated: If those engaged in one application were to perform the other applications only by the eye, then those by whom the rice-cult is not made invalid and barley is accepted, and by whom it is said they should sacrifice with barley as long as they live, the usage by both of these in each person as optional would not be established.

original: tena yāvatprayogabhāvipramāṇālocanavaśātpūrvānumitāṃ śrutiṃ cidapyaśṭaṇvanpunarapi smṛtimevopacabhya kartṛsāmānyatiṅgenaiva śrutimanumimānaḥ pratyakṣayā śrutyāściptacittatayā tatprāmāethenānyathānupapadyamānena smṛtyaprāmāṇyaṃ kalpayanpūrvāvadhāritamūlavyatyayameva pratipadyate / na pūrva kṛptamanjasyāprāmāṇyādhyāropam /
analyzed: tena yāvat prayoga bhāvi pramāṇa ālocana vaśāt pūrva anumitām śrutim cit api a śṭaṇvan punar api smṛtim eva upacabhya kartṛ sāmānya tiṅgena eva śrutim anumimānaḥ pratyakṣayā śrutyāḥ cipta citta tayā tad prāmāethena anyathā anupapadyamānena smṛti aprāmāṇyam kalpayan pūrva avadhārita mūla vyatyayam eva pratipadyate na pūrva kṛptam anjasya aprāmāṇya adhyāropam
translated: And thus, as long as he is able to infer the Vedic text, on the basis of the cognition produced by the application of the means of knowledge, he again assumes the existence of the Smṛti, and infers the Vedic text on the basis of the common author, and thus, by the direct Vedic text, which is in his mind, and by the impossibility of any other explanation, he assumes the invalidity of the Smṛti, and thus comes to the conclusion that there has been a mistake in the original basis as previously ascertained, and not to the assumption of the invalidity of the Smṛti, which has been previously established.

analyzed: padyamāna tayā eva asya jñāna tvāt
translated: Because the knowledge of this is easily obtained by the mere fact of its being possible.

analyzed: yat ca etat anavasthānam tvayā mām prati codyate
translated: And this regress, which you urge against me,

analyzed: bhavataḥ pi tat asti eva tena ācodya tvam ekatas
translated: exists for you also; therefore, it is not a proper objection.

analyzed: kāla antare pi yaḥ bādhaḥ sphuṭa tvena avadhāryyate
translated: Even at a later time, when the contradiction is clearly ascertained,

analyzed: yat tena api a pramāṇa tvam kṛtam tat na nivarttyate
translated: the invalidity that has been produced by it is not removed.

original: nanu yavaśruterapi tarhi pramāṇatvena parigṛhyamāṇāyāḥ puruṣāprathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: nanu yava śruteḥ api tarhi pramāṇa tvena parigṛhyamāṇāyāḥ puruṣa prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: But if the Vedic text, even though heard, is accepted as a means of knowledge, then there is contradiction by another person;

analyzed: ntara bādhaḥ tadānī masti iti mithyātva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: therefore, there is the contingence of falsity.

original: smṛtistu yāvatāṃ puṃsāṃ prathamaṃ gocaro bhavet /
analyzed: smṛtiḥ tu yāvatām puṃsām prathamam gocaraḥ bhavet
translated: But memory is the first object of the minds of only a few men;

original: tāvatāṃ sarvadā 'bhāvānnāprāmāṇyena mucyate🔽adhyāropyeta mithyātvamujjvalāyāḥ śruteḥ punaḥ /
analyzed: tāvatām sarvadā bhāvāt na a prāmāṇyena mucyate  adhyāropyeta mithyātvam ujjvalāyāḥ śruteḥ punar
translated: and as it is always absent in the rest, it cannot be said to be exempt from invalidity.🔽But the falsity of the manifest Vedic text may be imposed upon it.

analyzed: labdham eva smṛtau tat cat kimartham kalpyate śruteḥ
translated: But that which is obtained in memory, why should it be supposed to belong to the Vedic text?

analyzed: nanu śrutya viruddhāyāḥ
translated: But the ascertainment of the truth of the Vedic text, which is not contradicted by the Vedic text,

analyzed: anumānāt api prāpsyan kena cit pratibadhyate
translated: is obtained even from inference; and it is obstructed by some one.

analyzed: tatas ca āīvaiśasa prasaṅga nivṛttiḥ
translated: And thus the contingency of the destruction of the Veda is averted.

analyzed: yathā
translated: And thus,

original: yadyapyaudumbarīsarvaveṣṭanaṃ dharmaśākhādhyetasmṛti vilakṣaṇa pratyakṣaśrutyarthopapatrakāropanibaddhaṃ tathāpyupariṣṭāhacyamāṇātyāntaratvābhiprāyeṇa paruṣopadiṣṭatvā viśeṣācca smṛtivadevodāhṛtam /
analyzed: yadi api audumbarī sarva veṣṭanam tathā api paruṣa upadiṣṭa tvā viśeṣāt ca smṛti vat eva udāhṛtam
translated: although the wrapping of the Audumbari post with all the sacrificial grass is the meaning of a direct Vedic text, different from the memory of the study of the branch of Dharma, still it is cited like a Smriti text, with the intention of the remoteness to be mentioned later, and because of the non-distinction of being taught by a person.

original: krītarājakabhojyānnatvavacanaṃ yadyapyatharvavede 'sti tathāpi tasyāhavanīyasaṃbaddhayajñakarmopakārābhāvāttada dhikṛtatrayīpratipāditāgnīṣomīyasaṃsthāvadhibhojanapratiṣedhavirodhātprakaraṇaviśeṣādikatau virodhi syādityanena nyāyenādhikṛtānadhikṛtabalāvala viśeṣābhiprāyeṇa smṛtipaścaniḥkṣepābhāṣyakāraṇoḍhāhiyate /
analyzed: krīta rājaka bhojya anna tva vacanam yadi api atharvavede sti tathā api tasya āhavanīya saṃbaddha yajña karma upakāra abhāvāt tad adhikṛta trayī pratipādita agnīṣomīya saṃsthā avadhi bhojana pratiṣedha virodhāt prakaraṇa viśeṣa ādi katau virodhi syāt iti anena nyāyena adhikṛta anadhikṛta balāvala viśeṣa abhiprāyeṇa smṛti paśca niḥkṣepā bhāṣya kāraṇa ūḍhā hiyate
translated: Although the statement about eating the king's food is found in the Atharva Veda, since it does not assist in the sacrificial rites connected with the Ahavaniya fire, it would be contradictory to the prohibition of eating up to the Soma-Agni sacrifice prescribed by the three Vedas, due to the difference in context, etc. Thus, with the intention of distinguishing the strength of the qualified and the unqualified, it is stated by the commentator as the reason for the exclusion in the Smriti.

original: kṛṣṇa keśatvaṃ ca yadyapyanavasthitavayovasthākāla viśeṣaṃ jātaputratvapakṣe saṃdigdhasamāveśaṃ ca tathāpi yuvaiva dharmamanvicchedityevamādismaraṇāprakāśitārthaṃ yauvanāvasthāparigrahādantato vā vayonatikramāśrayaṇādaṣṭācatvāriṃśadvarṣa brahmacarya prāgupanayana sambaddhakālasya ca vayasaḥ sātireka dvipañcāśañcatuṣpañcāśanmātrasaṃvatmaraparimitatvenāparihāryyavayotikramāvaśyaṃbhāvitvāyakta eva virodho hagyate /
analyzed: kṛṣṇa keśa tvam ca yadi api anavasthita vayaḥ vasthā kāla viśeṣam jāta putra tva pakṣe saṃdigdha samāveśam ca tathā api yuvā eva dharmam anvicchet iti evamādi smaraṇa aprakāśita artham yauvana avasthā parigrahāt antatas vā vayaḥ anatikrama āśrayaṇāt aṣṭācatvāriṃśat varṣa brahmacarya prāk upanayana sambaddha kālasya ca vayasaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodhaḥ eva virodh
translated: And although the state of having black hair is doubtful when the son is born in a particular age and state, still, because of the retention of the state of youth, which is revealed by the remembrance one should seek dharma while young etc., or because of the final acceptance of the state of youth, or because of the inevitable occurrence of the transgression of age, which is unavoidable in the case of the age connected with the Upanayana ceremony, which is forty-eight years old, being limited to fifty-two or fifty-four years, the contradiction is indeed appropriate.

original: nanu ca pūrvakṛta sarvaveṣṭanottarakāla vihita veṣṭitāyā eva sparśanaṃ sambhavatītyavirodhaḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca pūrva kṛta sarva veṣṭana uttara kāla vihita veṣṭitāyāḥ eva sparśanam sambhavati iti avirodhaḥ
translated: But when the touching of only that which is wrapped is possible after the wrapping done after the previous rites, there is no contradiction.

original: kathamavirodho yadā sparśanaṃ nāma tvagindriyadvāraṃ spṛśyasaṃvedanam /🔽na ca vastrāntaritāyā udumbaryāḥ sparśo gṛhyate /
analyzed: katham avirodhaḥ yadā sparśanam nāma tvac indriya dvāram spṛśya saṃvedanam  na ca vastra antaritāyāḥ udumbaryāḥ sparśaḥ gṛhyate
translated: How is there no contradiction when touching is the awareness of the touchable through the tactile sense,🔽and the touch of the udumbara fruit covered by another cloth is not perceived,

original: na ca vastre spṛśyamāne audumbarī spṛṣṭa/
analyzed: na ca vastre spṛśyamāne audumbarī
translated: and when the cloth is touched, the udumbara is not touched.

analyzed: bhavati
translated: It does not happen.

analyzed: sparśānām atyanta bhedāt
translated: Because there is absolute difference between the touch of a cloth and the touch of an udumbara tree.

analyzed: nanu ca
translated: But in the case of the udumbara tree, the idea of udumbara is absent in the earth, and in the cloth separated from it, because of the absence of the idea of udumbara. Therefore, there is inequality with the example.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: This is how:

analyzed: satyam tatra iṣyate snānam tad vā sparśa kāritam
translated: It is true that bathing is desired there, caused by the touch of that.

analyzed: kāraṇam caṇḍāla sparśavat matam
translated: And the cause is considered to be like the touch of an outcaste.

original: kathaṃ punarayaṃ dharmaśāstreṣvanupanibaddho 'pi caṇḍālaspṛṣṭavalasparśana nimitto doṣo 'dhyavasīyate /
analyzed: katham punar ayam dharma śāstreṣu anupanibaddhaḥ pi caṇḍāla spṛṣṭa vala sparśana nimittaḥ doṣaḥ dhī avasīyate
translated: How is this fault arising from touching a cloth touched by an outcaste determined, even though it is not mentioned in the Dharma Shastras?

analyzed: katham vā na iṣyate doṣaḥ kāṣṭha loṣṭa ṭaṇa ādiṣu
translated: Or how is the fault not accepted in the case of wood, clods of earth, etc.?

analyzed: tad spṛṣṭa spṛśyamāneṣu na kramante yuktayaḥ
translated: The reasons do not apply here in the case of those touched by what is touched by that.

analyzed: yathā kāṣṭhaṇa ādīnām mārutāt eva śuddha tā
translated: Just as wood, etc. are purified only by wind,

analyzed: smaryate vāsasaḥ na evam toya prakṣālana ādinā
translated: the cloth is not remembered to be so by washing with water, etc.

analyzed: amedhyasya evam yasmāt paṭhanti
translated: Because they recite this about what is impure:

analyzed: caṇḍāla spṛṣṭa vāsasam ca asti eva amedhya tā
translated: The cloth touched by an outcaste is indeed impure.

analyzed: tasmāt asti salila ādiśa dvis
translated: Therefore, there is purification by water, etc.

original: nanu ca manuṣyasyaiva caṇḍālasparśanimittaprāyaścittavidhānāda śuddhirūpamamedhyatvaṃ gamyate na dravyāntarasya gavāśvādaḥ /
analyzed: nanu ca manuṣyasya eva caṇḍāla sparśa nimitta prāyaścitta vidhānāt śuddhi rūpam amedhya tvam gamyate na dravya antarasya gavāśvāt
translated: But since expiation is prescribed for a human being alone due to the touch of an outcaste, it is understood that impurity is in the form of uncleanliness, not in another substance like a cow or horse.

original: tataśca vastraṃ kiṃ gavāśvādivadaduṣṭamuta puruṣavad duṣṭa miti sandehe gavāśvāditulyamevāvadhārayituṃ yuktam
analyzed: tatas ca vastram kim gavāśva ādi vat aduṣṭam uta puruṣa vat duṣṭam iti sandehe gavāśva ādi tulyam eva avadhārayitum yuktam
translated: Therefore, when there is doubt whether a cloth is impure like a cow or horse, or like a human being, it is proper to determine it to be the same as a cow or horse.

analyzed: puruṣasya sa cailasya snānam yasmāt vidhīyate
translated: Because bathing with clothes is prescribed for a human being,

analyzed: tasmāt puruṣa vaha stram na gavāśva ādi vat matam  pūrva uktena eva mārgeṇa
translated: therefore a cloth is not considered to be like a cow or horse.🔽By the very same path stated earlier, the possibility of a single conclusion is removed.

analyzed: vikalpe vaśyam āpannām smṛtau eva niyacchati
translated: When an option is necessarily accepted, it is restricted only in the Smriti.

analyzed: nahi pramāda pāṭha tvam śakyam kalpayitum śruteḥ
translated: For the Vedic text cannot be supposed to be a case of inadvertent recitation.

original: duḥśruta svapnavijñānamūnnā tvāpadyate smṛtiḥ🔽parasparavirudve hi viruvāvyabhicārivat /
analyzed: svapna vijñānam ūnnā tu āpadyate smṛtiḥ  paraspara virudve hi viruva avyabhicāri vat
translated: The Smriti is not subject to the same criticism as a dream-cognition or a false notion.🔽Where two mutually contradictory means of knowledge are seen, like a contradictory means of knowledge,

analyzed: pramāṇe yatra dṛśyete tatra anyena eva nirṇayaḥ
translated: there the decision must be made by another means of knowledge.

analyzed: pramāṇam ayate yāti mūla bhūtām śrutim yatas
translated: Because the means of knowledge ultimately resorts to the Vedic text as its basis,

original: vivantādayatestasmātpramāṇā smṛtirupyate na ca varṇāśrayatvena yalopo na bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vi vantāt ayateḥ tasmāt pramāṇā smṛtiḥ upyate na ca varṇa āśraya tvena ya lopaḥ na bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, the Smṛti is accepted as authoritative from the root 'viv' meaning 'to desire'. And the elision of 'ya' will not be due to the presence of the vowels,

analyzed: ya lopaḥ hi vana ādi pratyaya āśrayaḥ
translated: for the elision of 'ya' in 'vyor va' is based on the suffix 'ana' etc.

original: yalope ca kṛte 'kāro yaḥ śuddhaḥ pariśiṣyate /
analyzed: ya lope ca kṛte kāraḥ yaḥ śuddhaḥ pariśiṣyate
translated: And when the elision of 'ya' is made, the pure 'a' that remains,

analyzed: tad anta avadhikāt paśca aṣṭa kriyate striyām
translated: after that, the feminine ending is made in the feminine.

analyzed: tat etat itara āśrayam bhavati iti uktam  yat vā śruti apramāṇa tvāt smṛteḥ prāmāṇya miṣyate
translated: This has been said to be based on something else.🔽Or, the authoritativeness of Smṛti is accepted because it is not authoritative like Śruti.

analyzed: siddhāt ca tad pramāṇa tvāt śratya prāmāṇya kalpanā
translated: And because its authoritativeness is established, the non-authoritativeness of Śruti is imagined.

analyzed: tat idam vikalpa vādinaḥ ekānta vādinaḥ tu anyataratra
translated: This mutual dependence is for the one who advocates an option, and for the one who advocates a one-sided view, it is in one of the two.

original: tatra sparśanasya lṛptaṃ mūlaṃ kalpyaṃ smṛteriti
analyzed: tatra sparśanasya lṛptam mūlam kalpyam smṛteḥ iti
translated: There, the root of the contact is accepted as the imagined basis of Smṛti.

analyzed: svatas sthitāt pramāṇa tvāt śruteḥ syāt klṛpta mūla tā
translated: The established basis is for Śruti, which has authoritativeness established by itself.

analyzed: smṛteḥ śruti anumāpaka prāmāṇyāt kalpya mūla tā
translated: The imagined basis is for Smṛti, because of the authoritativeness that infers Śruti.

analyzed: na ca adhyāropyamāṇā api śruteḥ syāt apramāṇa tā
translated: And even if Śruti is superimposed, it will not have non-authoritativeness.

analyzed: na ca tasyām asiddhāyām smṛti prāmāṇya sambhavaḥ
translated: And without that being established, the authoritativeness of Smṛti is not possible.

original: evaṃ tāvatsmatiprāmāṇyaṃ kalpayanneva tadādī parājīyate /🔽ya ḍhā tu śrutiprāmāṇyagata mitaretarāśrayatvamālocyate tadā tatrāpi pratipacabhūtasmṛtyaprāmāṇyāpekṣayā nirapavādaprāmāṇyāvadhāraṇasiddheḥ parādhīnatvātpūrvasidvasmṛtyaprāmāṇya limāyām
analyzed: evam tāvat smati prāmāṇyam kalpayan eva tad ādī parājīyate  tu śruti prāmāṇya gatam mitaretara āśraya tvam ālocyate tadā tatra api pratipaca bhūta smṛti aprāmāṇya apekṣayā nirapavāda prāmāṇya avadhāraṇa siddheḥ para adhīna tvāt pūrva sidva smṛti aprāmāṇya limāyām
translated: Thus, one who postulates the validity of Smṛti is defeated by the opponent.🔽But when mutual dependence regarding the validity of Śruti is considered, even then, due to the establishment of the ascertainment of unquestionable validity in relation to the invalidity of Smṛti which is the object of cognition, the invalidity of Smṛti which is already established is brought in.

original: tena yattadādye padake 'nanumitāvasthāyāṃtapakṣaṇamātre smṛteraprāmāṇyaṃ dṛśyate tāvataiva labdhapramāṇatvā śrutiḥ sarvadā nirapavādaprāmāṇyā bhavatītyanyataḥ paricchedaḥ
analyzed: tena yat tad ādye padake smṛteḥ aprāmāṇyam dṛśyate tāvatā eva labdha pramāṇa tvā śrutiḥ sarvadā nirapavāda prāmāṇyā bhavati iti anyatas paricchedaḥ
translated: Therefore, since Śruti has obtained validity by merely seeing the invalidity of Smṛti in the mere characteristic at the first moment when it is not yet inferred, it has unquestionable validity at all times, and its delimitation is from another source.

analyzed: kṛtvā ekam avadhim tasmāt sidvam ādye kṣaṇe dṛḍham
translated: Therefore, having made one limit, the firm establishment at the first moment is made.

analyzed: ānupūrvyā brajet tāvat yāvat mit vaḥ paraḥ sphuṭaḥ
translated: It proceeds in sequence as far as the second clear one is established.

analyzed: hetu darśanāt ca  itas ca na kṣaṇāt
translated: And due to the perception of the reason.🔽And for this reason also, the invalidity of the means of knowledge does not arise from another moment.

analyzed: vyabhicāre hi nā utpattiḥ arthāpatti anumānayoḥ
translated: For, if there is deviation, there is no origination of arthāpatti and anumāna.

original: ka ciyānti va cinobhaḥ ka cidyuktivikalpanam /
analyzed: cinā ubhau ka
translated: Some people think, some people imagine reasoning.

analyzed: pratibhā kāraṇa tvena nirākarttum na śakyate
translated: It cannot be denied as the cause of intuition.

analyzed: yathā eva vā idam ūna tvam anekāntāt na labhyate
translated: Just as the Vedic origin is not established due to the inconclusive nature of the reason,

analyzed: tayā anya mūla tā api iti tad āśayā idam ucyate
translated: so too the other-based nature. This is stated with that intention.

original: adhikaraṇāntaraṃ veti🔽aparitoṣastāvat prathamenaiva śrutiviruddhatvahetunā banavatā siddhe bādhe nāncācayaheturatīva prayojanavān /
analyzed: adhikaraṇa antaram vā iti  a paritoṣaḥ tāvat prathamena eva śruti viruddha tva hetunā banavatā siddhe bādhe
translated: Or it is a separate section.🔽The dissatisfaction is that, when the contradiction is established by the first reason itself, which is not defective, the additional reason is not very useful.

original: adhikaraṇāntare parvoktahetu nirapekṣaḥ paryāpta evaikasmṛtibādhanāyeti svatantratvena pradarśanam /
analyzed: adhikaraṇa antare parva ukta hetu nirapekṣaḥ paryāptaḥ eva eka smṛti bādhanāya iti svatantra tvena pradarśanam
translated: In a separate section, the reason stated earlier, independent of other reasons, is sufficient to contradict a single Smṛti text. It is shown as independent.

original: virodhena ca na vyāptāyāḥ smṛterapramāṇataḍyāptau nāpavādāntarodbhavaḥ /
analyzed: virodhena ca na vyāptāyāḥ smṛteḥ apramāṇa tad vyāptau na apavāda antara udbhavaḥ
translated: And when the contradicted Smṛti text is not established as a means of valid knowledge due to contradiction, there is no need for another exception.

original: sarjjanahomīyaṃ vāso'dhvaryugṛhṇātītyagnīṣomapraṇayanārthaṃ visarjjanahomakālasaṃbandhiyajamānācchādanaṃ vāso 'dhvaryurharati muktakametadāvaraṇānumitaṃ prathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: sarjjana homīyam vāsaḥ dhvaryuḥ gṛhṇāti iti agnīṣoma praṇayana artham visarjjana homa kāla saṃbandhi yajamāna ācchādanam vāsaḥ dhvaryuḥ harati muktakam etat āvaraṇa anumitam prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: The Adhvaryu priest takes the garment to be used in the Visarjana Homa. This refers to the garment to be worn by the sacrificer at the time of the Visarjana Homa for the purpose of bringing Agni and Soma. The Adhvaryu priest takes this garment, which is inferred to be a covering. The third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: smaraṇam
translated: The recollection.

original: evaṃ yūpahastino dānamācarantīti yūpaparivyāṇaśāṭakaṃ yūpaca stiśabdena nirhigyādhvaryuharttavya tayācārānumitayaiva smṛ tyā pratipādayanti
analyzed: evam yūpa hastinaḥ dānam ācaranti iti yūpa parivyāṇa śāṭakam yūpa casti śabdena
translated: Thus, they convey the idea that the cloth used for covering the sacrificial post should be given to the Adhvaryu priest by the Yajamana, through the Smriti inferred from the practice, by using the word 'yupachiti' which refers to the cloth used for covering the sacrificial post.

original: pratyaśrutivihitadeyāntara nidarśanavyāmohitaśca yajamānaḥ śraddadhānatayā tathaiva pratipadya tebhyaḥ prayacchatīti taireṣā smṛtiḥ pravartitā syāḍhityāśaṅkāyāṃ vedamūnatvaṃ nānumīyate /

translated: And the Yajamana, deluded by the example of other gifts prescribed by the scriptures, accepts it as such out of faith and gives it to them. If there were a doubt that this Smriti was started by them, then the incompleteness of the Veda would not be inferred.

translated: It will not be accepted as long as it is merely a report.

original: yadā tu śravaṇaṃ prāptaṃ tadāsmānna viśiṣyate
analyzed: yadā tu śravaṇam prāptam tadā asmāt na viśiṣyate
translated: But when it comes to hearing, then it is not distinguished from us.

original: yadā yānyetāni trayīvibhinna parigṛhītāni kiṃ cittanmiśradharmakaccukacchāyāpatitāni lokopasaṅgahalābhapūjākhyātiprayojanaparāṇi trayoviparītāsambaddadṛṣṭaśobhādipratyakṣānumānopamānārthāpattiprāyayuktimūlopanibadvāni sāṃkhyayogapāñcarātrapāśupata śākya nirgranthaparigṛhīta dhamādharmmānibandhanāni viṣaciprathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yadā yāni etāni trayī vibhinna parigṛhītāni kim cit tad miśra dharma kaccuka chāyā patitāni loka upasaṅgaha lābha pūjā khyāti prayojana parāṇi sāṃkhya yoga pāñcarātra pāśupata śākya nirgrantha parigṛhīta dhama adharma a nibandhanāni
translated: When these are accepted by the three Vedas, and some of them have fallen into the shadow of the garb of mixed Dharma, with the purpose of gaining fame for benefiting the world, and are based on logic such as perception, inference, analogy, presumption, and the like, which are not related to the three faults, and are composed in treatises on Dharma and Adharma accepted by the Sāṃkhya, Yoga, Pāñcarātra, Pāśupata, Śākya, and Nirgrantha schools,

original: kimāvaśīkaraṇoccāṭanonmāḍhanādisamarthakatipayamantrauṣadhikādācitkasiddhinidarśanabale nāhiṃsā satyavacanadamadānadayādiśrutismṛtisaṃvādistokārthagandhavāsita jībikāprāyārthāntaropadeśoni yāni ca bāhyatarāṇi mlecchācāra miśrakabhojanācaraṇanibandhanāni teṣāmevaitacchativirodhahetudarśanābhyāmanapeṣaṇīyatvaṃ pratipādyate /
analyzed: na ahiṃsā satya vacana dama dāna dayā ādi śruti smṛti saṃvādi stoka artha gandha vāsita jībikā prāya artha antara upadeśa ūni yāni ca bāhyatarāṇi mleccha ācāra miśraka bhojana ācaraṇa nibandhanāni teṣām eva etad śati virodha hetu darśanābhyām anapeṣaṇīya tvam pratipādyate
translated: Are these occasional accomplishments of a few mantras, herbs, etc., capable of enthralling, driving away, or driving mad, sufficient to establish that the teachings of non-violence, truthfulness, self-control, charity, compassion, etc., which are in agreement with the Vedas and Smritis, and which are perfumed with the meaning of the syllable Om, are not to be rejected, merely because they are external and mixed with the practices of barbarians, such as the performance of mixed meals?

original: na caitakka cidadhikaraṇāntare nirūpitaṃ na cāvaktavyameva gāvyādiśabdavācakatvabuddhivadatiprasiddhatvāt🔽śobhā sau karyyatṛktikalikālavaśena vā /
analyzed: na ca etat ka cit adhikaraṇa antare nirūpitam na ca avaktavyam eva gāvī ādi śabda vācakatva buddhi vat atiprasiddha tvāt  śobhā vā
translated: And this has not been determined in another section, nor is it to be left unsaid, because of its great popularity, like the notion that the word gāvī etc. is expressive.

analyzed: yajña ukta paśu hiṃsā ādi tyāga bhrāntim avāpnuyuḥ
translated: Or, due to the influence of the Kali age, they may have the delusion of abandoning the killing of animals mentioned in sacrifices etc.

original: tena yadyapi labhyeta smṛtiḥ kā cidirodhinī /
analyzed: tena yadi api labhyeta smṛtiḥ kā cit irodhinī
translated: Therefore, even if some contradictory Smriti is obtained,

analyzed: mad nādyuktā tathā api asmin etat eva upayujyate
translated: it is still useful in this, even though it is stated by me.

analyzed: mahājana gṛhīta tvam pitṛ ādi anugama ādi ca
translated: The acceptance by the great people, the following of the ancestors etc.,

analyzed: te dvīpa antara apekṣam vadanti eva sva darśane
translated: they also speak in their own view with reference to other islands.

analyzed: para loka virudvāni kurvāṇam dūra tas tyajet

original: ātmānaṃ yo 'tisaṃdhatte so'nyasmai syātkathaṃ hita iti

analyzed: tena pratyakṣayā śrutyā virodhe granthakāriṇām

original: na ca śākhāntarocchedaḥ kadā cidapi vidyata /
analyzed: na ca śākhā antara ucchedaḥ kadā cit api vidyata

analyzed: prāk uktā āha idam nitya tvāt na ca eṣām dṛṣṭa bhūlatā
translated: and their eternality is not due to being seen, as stated earlier.

analyzed: lobha ādi kāraṇam ca atra baṟhā iva anyat pratīyate
translated: And here, greed and other causes are understood to be different from the grass,

analyzed: yasmin san ahite dṛṣṭe na asti mūla antara anubhā

analyzed: na ca taiḥ veda mūla tvam ucyate gautama ādi vat
translated: And they do not say that the Veda is the basis, like Gautama and others.

analyzed: hetavaḥ ca abhidhīyante ye dharmāḥ dūratas sthitāḥ
translated: The reasons are stated for those dharmas that are far away.

translated: And the texts of these are stated by Manu and others as what should be avoided.

analyzed: yāḥ veda bāhyāḥ smṛtayaḥ yāḥ ca kāścid kudṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Those Smṛtis that are outside the Veda and those evil views that there may be,

analyzed: sarvāḥ tāḥ niṣphalāḥ pretya tamaḥ niṣṭhāḥ hi tāḥ smṛtāḥ tantravārtika
translated: all of them are fruitless after death, for they are declared to be in the darkness of ignorance.

analyzed: śiṣṭa akope viruddham iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is contradictory in the case of the conflict of the learned,

original: evaṃ tāvatpuruṣārthasmṛtīnāmavirodhe virodhe ca pramāṇatvāpramāṇatve nirūpite saṃprati ta kratvarthānāṃ yajñopavītodakācamanadakṣiṇahastācaraṇasmṛtīnāṃ bahuśrutyarthamadhyapātinīnāṃ viro dhāvirodhamātrameva vicāryyate /
analyzed: evam tāvat puruṣa artha smṛtīnām avirodhe virodhe ca pramāṇa tva apramāṇa tve nirūpite saṃprati kratu arthānām yajñopavīta udaka ācamana dakṣiṇa hasta ācaraṇa smṛtīnām bahu śruti artha madhyapātinīnām virodha avirodha mātram eva vicāryyate
translated: Thus, having determined the authoritativeness and non-authoritativeness of the Smṛtis on human ends in the absence and presence of contradiction, now only the presence and absence of contradiction of the Smṛtis on the sacrificial thread, sipping of water, and using the right hand in the performance of rites, which are included in the purpose of the Vedas, is being examined.

analyzed: tad nirṇaye tu kṛte pūrva adhikaraṇābhyām pramāṇa tva apramāṇa tva siddhiḥ

original: yadi yajñopavītādīni kratumanupraveśyamānāni codakaprayogavacanābhyāṃ na parigṛhyante nirākriyante vā tato virodhaḥ /
analyzed: yadi yajñopavīta ādīni kratum anupraveśyamānāni ca udaka prayoga vacanābhyām na parigṛhyante nirākriyante vā tatas virodhaḥ
translated: If the sacrificial thread and other things, while entering into the sacrifice, are not accepted or rejected by the injunctions of the ritual texts, then there is contradiction.

original: yadi punarānuguṇyātprakaraṇādipaṭhitavatsmṛtyanumitavākyasaṃyogena kratumanupraviśanti na ca pūrvagṛhītaṃ kiṃ civādhante tato na viruddhānoti /

translated: But if, due to compatibility, they enter into the sacrifice through connection with a sentence inferred from Smṛti like what is recited in the context, and do not contradict anything previously accepted, then there is no contradiction.

original: anyattu darśanaṃ satyapi virodhe pramāṇaprameyabalābala visaṃvādātsaṃdehaḥ /
analyzed: anyat tu darśanam sati api virodhe pramāṇa prameya bala abala visaṃvādāt saṃdehaḥ
translated: But another view is that even in the presence of contradiction, there is doubt due to the disagreement of the strength and weakness of the authoritative means of knowledge and the objects of knowledge.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus:

analyzed: śruti smṛtyoḥ viruddha tve jñātam eva balāvalam
translated: When there is contradiction between Śruti and Smṛti, the strength and weakness is known.

analyzed: dharma dharmi virodhe ca dharmiṇaḥ balavattarāḥ
translated: And in the case of a conflict between the property and the possessor of the property, the possessor is stronger.

analyzed: kim yuktam aviruddh tvam kratu artha aṅga smṛteḥ api
translated: What is proper? Non-contradiction, even of the remembered part of the ritual for the sake of the sacrifice.

translated: And what is heard is not diminished in the performance of its purpose.

analyzed: gṛhyante bhāvanā bhāvyaiḥ aṣūrvaiḥ sādhana aṃśa vat
translated: They are accepted by the seventh case ending, by the practice of the learned, and by the words expressing the object of the bhāvanā, like the parts of the means of attainment.

analyzed: na śākha parimāṇa tvāt
translated: Not because of the measure of the branch.

analyzed: padārthaḥ bhyadhikaḥ bhavet
translated: The meaning of the word would be more.

analyzed: śākhitam parimāṇam hi kaḥ tikramitum arhati

analyzed: dvābhyām śruti ādi ṣaṭakābhyām kāla iyattā kramāt sthitān
translated: The meanings of the words, which are established by the two, the six beginning with Śruti, by time, quantity, and order,

analyzed: padārthāḥ praviśantaḥ hi bādheran smārtta laukikāḥ
translated: if they enter, would contradict the remembered and worldly ones.

original: samasta prayogakā lāica pūrvāhnamadhyandinādayo 'tikramyeran /🔽kramaśca yaḥ śrutyarthapāṭhasthānamukhyapravṛttivatkramairavagataḥ sa catantravārtika /
analyzed: samasta prayoga kā pūrvāhna madhyandina ādayaḥ tikramyeran  kramaḥ ca yaḥ śruti artha pāṭha sthāna mukhya pravṛtti vat kramaiḥ avagataḥ sa ca tantra vārtika
translated: All the usages beginning with the forenoon and midday would be transgressed.🔽And the order which is understood by the orders of Śruti, meaning, recitation, place, principal activity, and sequence,

analyzed: vaidika padārtha ārūḍha tayā vijñāta āśraya pramāṇa parimāṇaḥ san anyathātvam cuta ādi nimitta ācamana vyavadhānāt pratipādyeta
translated: that, having become known as the measure of the basis known as the Vedic meanings of the words, would be presented as otherwise by the interruption of the Ācamana rite caused by the occasion such as the rising of the constellation Chitra.

analyzed: evam āyāsa nasta upavīta punaḥkaraṇa vyavadhāne yojanīyam
translated: Similarly, even in the case of interruption by the performance of the Āyāsa and Upavita again, it should be applied.

original: ukta parimāṇasya kramasya nānyadapi kiṃ citpramāṇamavakalpate tathā śrutyādyavagata pracayaśiṣṭa padārtha parimāṇamavaṇya madhvaryyādibhiravistṛtasamastapadārthanirmāṇāyāvadhāraṇīyam /🔽tataśca prathamāparikalpitapaścāda/
analyzed: ukta parimāṇasya kramasya na anyat api kim cit pramāṇam avakalpate tathā śruti ādi avagata pracaya śiṣṭa padārtha parimāṇam avaṇya madhvarya ādibhiḥ avistṛta samasta padārtha nirmāṇāya avadhāraṇīyam  tatas ca prathamā parikalpita paścāt
translated: No other means of knowledge is possible for the sequence of the prescribed extent. Thus, the extent of the parts of the sacrifice understood from the collection of Vedic texts etc. should be determined by the Adhvaryu priests etc. for the construction of all the parts of the sacrifice without omission.

original: gatasmārcapadārthānuṣṭhāne pūrvāvadhāraṇabhraṃśāt samastakṛtākṛtānirūpaṇā da nivṛttavaiguṇyāśaṅkasya samyaktatatvadānimittasaṃska/rapāṭavābhāvāda pūrva daurbalyena nyūna phalalābhapramaṅgaḥ
analyzed: gata smārca padārtha anuṣṭhāne pūrva avadhāraṇa bhraṃśāt nivṛtta vaiguṇya āśaṅkasya daurbalyena phala lābha pramaṅgaḥ
translated: And then, in the performance of the parts of the sacrifice imagined first and remembered later, due to the loss of the previous determination, there is the impossibility of determining what has been done and what has not been done, and the doubt of deficiency being removed, there is no possibility of obtaining a lesser result due to the weakness of the previous (performance) due to the absence of the excellence of the consecration caused by the proper completion.

analyzed: parimita śruti ādi apadeśa atideśa ātmaka aṅga śākhā parimāṇa tvāt vā na
translated: Or, due to the extent of the branches of the parts of the sacrifice consisting of injunctions and implication based on the limited Vedic texts etc., there is no scope for branches of the sacrifice exceeding that.

original: sahakarttavyāpagateṣu ca padārtheṣu sarvātmanā tvaramāṇasya yāvānevānyantāśaktyā kāla viprakarṣo bhavati tāvanmātrameva prayogavacano 'numanyate /🔽śaktastu va ṇamātramapi yadi vikṣepaṃ kuryyāt tadasya prayogavacana vidhina sa heta /
analyzed: sahakarttavya apagateṣu ca padārtheṣu sarva ātmanā tvaramāṇasya yāvān eva anyanta aśaktyā kāla viprakarṣaḥ bhavati tāvanmātram eva prayoga vacanaḥ numanyate  śaktaḥ tu yadi vikṣepam kuryyāt tat asya
translated: And when the things to be done together are absent, as much delay as is possible due to inability in other matters is permitted by the injunction of performance.🔽But if one, though able, were to cause even the slightest distraction, then that would be a violation of the injunction of performance.

analyzed: tasmāt trividhasya api śākhā parimāṇasya anyathā karaṇāt na ācamana a viruddham iti
translated: Therefore, since the extent of the branch can be altered in all three ways, the performance of Āchāmanā is not incompatible with the injunctions.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: api vā kāraṇam dṛṣṭam yasmāt eṣu na gṛhyate
translated: Or, since a cause is seen from which it is not apprehended in these,

analyzed: tasmāt na ācamana ādīnām kratu śruti viruddha tā
translated: Therefore, Āchāmanā and other acts are not contradictory to the mention of the sacrifice.

analyzed: yatra tu utprekṣayā pi anyat kāraṇam na avalambyate
translated: But where even by imagination another cause is not relied upon,

analyzed: atyanta ananya mūla tvāt śu titaḥ tad pramāṇa tā
translated: Because of being absolutely without another root, that is the authority.

analyzed: an anya mūlikāya ca śrutau mūle vadhārite
translated: And when the root in the Vedic text, which is without another root, is ascertained,

original: virodhe 'pi pramāṇatvaṃ smṛteḥ śrutyā na vāryyate
analyzed: virodhe pi pramāṇa tvam smṛteḥ śrutyāḥ na vāryyate
translated: Even in contradiction, the authority of the Smṛti is not prevented by the Vedic text.

analyzed: nanu pūrva bhāvi tvāt pramāṇa balābancam eva prameya balābalāt jyāyam tvena pratibhāti
translated: But because of being antecedent, the strength of the means of knowledge appears to be greater than the strength of the object to be known.

original: prameyagataṃ hi virodhamālocya pramāṇavirodhabuddhirbhavati /🔽tadyasyāmeva velāyāṃ virodho dṛśyate tayoḥ /tantravārtika /
analyzed: prameya gatam hi virodham ālocya pramāṇa virodha buddhiḥ bhavati  tat yasyām eva velāyām virodhaḥ dṛśyate tayoḥ tantravārtika
translated: For the cognition of contradiction in a means of knowledge arises only on considering the contradiction in the object of knowledge.

analyzed: prameyayoḥ sva rūpa stham tasyām eva
translated: And the strength or weakness of those two [means of knowledge] is determined at that very time when the contradiction is seen between the two objects of knowledge.

original: padārthatvena yeṣāṃ ca bannīyastvaṃ nirūpitam /🔽na smṛterbalatvena punastadapanīyate🔽na ca prameyada/rbalyabalīyastvanibandhanam/
analyzed: padārtha tvena yeṣām ca bannīyaḥ tvam nirūpitam  na smṛteḥ bala tvena punar tat apanīyate  na ca prameya darbalya balīyaḥ tva nibandhanam
translated: And those whose status as objects of words has been determined,🔽their status as objects of knowledge is not again removed on the ground of the strength of memory.

analyzed: prāptam smṛti pramāṇa tvam pramāṇa sthena vādhyate
translated: And the status of being a means of knowledge is not attained by memory on the ground of the weakness or strength of the object of knowledge,🔽nor is it contradicted by what is established by a means of knowledge.

analyzed: etat eva śruteḥ yatra smṛtiḥ vṛthā
translated: This is the same as in the case of verbal testimony, where memory is useless.

original: mahāsmṛtyāpi yā kā cinna śakyā bādhituṃ śrutiḥ
analyzed: mahā smṛtyā api yā kā cit na śakyā bādhitum śrutiḥ
translated: No memory, however great, can contradict verbal testimony.

analyzed: kāle yattā kramāṇām hi sarva ante prāptiḥ iṣyate
translated: For the occurrence of all means of knowledge is held to take place at the end of time.

analyzed: su jaghanya pramāṇaḥ pi padārthaḥ pūrvam anute
translated: Even an object that is the least authoritative is remembered first.

analyzed: na kena cit pramāṇena padārtha iyattā paricchidyate
translated: The extent of an object is not determined by any means of knowledge.

original: tatra yadi tena vinā 'nye samastapadārthasmṛtihetavo na syustata etadapyekaṃ kārapamiti parimāṇamapi sthāpyeta /
analyzed: tatra yadi tena vinā nye samasta padārtha smṛti hetavaḥ na syuḥ tatas etat api ekam kārapam iti parimāṇam api sthāpyeta
translated: If, without that [means of knowledge], the causes of the recollection of all objects would not exist, then that [means of knowledge] would also be established as a single cause, and even the extent [of the object] would be determined.

original: tasyāmapi tvavasthāyāṃ yathā śrau prathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /🔽tamātraparimāṇamasamāpya samākhyāparyyantaprāpitapadārthagataparimāṇāvadhāraṇamāśrīyate/
analyzed: tasyām api tu avasthāyām yathā  tamātra parimāṇam a samāpya samākhyā paryyanta prāpita padārtha gata parimāṇa avadhāraṇam āśrīyate
translated: Even in that state, just as in the case of the word 'agnihotra', the measure of the word 'agni' is not completed, and the measure of the word 'hotra' is not completed, and yet the measure of the word 'agnihotra' is accepted as reached by the combination of the two,

analyzed: tathā mṛtyā ācāra paryyanta avagata parimāṇam āśrayiṣyataḥ eti nirdoṣam
translated: in the same way, the measure known up to the end of the life of the student will be accepted. Thus there is no fault.

analyzed: kālaḥ hi ayam pradhānasya sarva aṅga sahinasya yaḥ
translated: For this time is the time of the principal, which can bear all the parts.

analyzed: aṅgaiḥ aviprakṛṣṭa tvam īdṛśasya eva codyate
translated: The non-separation from the parts is urged only for such a one.

analyzed: śauca yajñopavīta ādeḥ na svatantra padārtha tā
translated: The purity, wearing of the sacred thread, and so on, are not independent meanings.

original: sarvaṃ hyaṅgapradhānārthaṃ tena na vyavadhāyakam🔽vedaṃ kṛtvā yadā vedimakṛtvā ''cāmati cute /
analyzed: sarvam hi aṅga pradhāna artham tena na vyavadhāyakam  vedam kṛtvā yadā vedim a kṛtvā ca amati cute
translated: For everything is for the sake of the parts and the principal, therefore it is not an interrupter.🔽When one, having performed the Veda, sips water without performing the altar,

original: vedimeva karotīti sa vaktuṃ śakyate tadā🔽imamavārthamabhipretya bhāṣyakāraṇoktaṃ na caivatīyakā arthāḥ padārthānāṃ vyavadhātāro bhavantīti /
analyzed: vedim eva karoti iti sa vaktum śakyate tadā  imam ava artham abhipretya bhāṣya kāraṇa uktam na ca evatīyakāḥ arthāḥ padārthānām vyavadhātāraḥ bhavanti iti
translated: then it can be said that he is only making the altar.🔽With this meaning in mind, the author of the commentary says: And the meanings of the words do not become interrupters.

analyzed: itarathā hi aṅga pradhāna artha tve na āśrīyamāṇe śūnyahṛdayavacanam eva etasyāt
translated: For otherwise, if the being for the sake of the parts and the principal is not accepted, this would be a statement with an empty heart.

original: nanvica yajñopavītamudāharttavyaṃ darśapūrṇamāsādiṣūpavyayate devalakṣmameva tatkuruta iti kratvaṅgapratyakṣavidhānāt /
analyzed: nanu ica yajñopavītam udāharttavyam darśa pūrṇamāsa ādiṣu deva lakṣmam eva tat kurute iti kratu aṅga pratyakṣa vidhānāt
translated: But the wearing of the sacred thread should be mentioned, as it is directly enjoined as a part of the sacrifice in the Darsha-Purnamasa and other sacrifices, in the statement He wears the sacred thread, thereby he makes the mark of the gods.

translated: The sacrifice of one who wears the sacred thread over the left shoulder is expanded, but that of one who wears it over the right shoulder is unexpanded. analyzed: tathā ca na somena ucchiṣṭāḥ bhavanti iti prāpta ācamana pratiṣedha artham eva avadhārthyate
translated: And thus, the prohibition of sipping water, which is obtained by the statement they do not become impure by Soma, is reiterated only for the purpose of emphasizing it.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa ācāra tvam tu

analyzed: tasmāt na eva etat adhikaraṇa antaram

analyzed: śākha parimāṇa tvāt

analyzed: yat eva kim cana anūcānaḥ bhyūhati ārṣam tat bhavati iti

analyzed: vaidika vāsanā janita tvāt vedaḥ eva sa bhavati

arising from the propitiation of the deity,

translated: But it is said that because of seeing things like Prajapati's union with his daughter Ahalya, Indra being a paramour of Maitreyi, and so on, and because of seeing such stories, those who see transgression of dharma in the practices of the virtuous find it difficult to accept the authority of the practices of the virtuous.

original: tyayopāttaguṇābhūtopādīyamānasaṃkhyāparicchedyatvayogyasādhanāṃśa viśeṣaṇatvenopāḍhānāditaratra ca tṛtīyāvibhaktiśrutivacanaṃ vivaścitaliṅgasyaiva pratiṣedhakamiti darśayitavyam

translated: It should be shown that the statement of the instrumental case in the other case is a prohibition of the indicative only, because it is mentioned as a qualifier of the means to be determined by the number to be taken up, which is suitable to be connected with the qualities mentioned in the instrumental case.

analyzed: na etat eva bhicā api etat puṃstvam na eva vivacyate
translated: This is not to be accepted. Masculinity is not at all intended.

analyzed: brāhmaṇasya anuvādya tvāt tad vadha pratiṣedha vat
translated: Because the Brāhmaṇa is to be praised, like the prohibition of killing him.

analyzed: anūdyamānaḥ sarvaḥ hi yathāprāptam anūdyate
translated: For all that is referred to is referred to as it is found.

analyzed: tatra an ākāṅkṣitam dvidheyebhyaḥ vidhīyate
translated: There, what is not desired is not enjoined from among the alternatives.

analyzed: yatas tu surā pāṇam prasajyate
translated: But since drinking wine results from passion and delusion,

analyzed: brāhmaṇa kaścid idhi saṃbhavaḥ
translated: for the Brāhmaṇa, therefore, there is no possibility of any injunction in that matter.

original: tenecāpi yatturāṃ brāhmaṇaḥ pibettanneti vā vacanaṃ vyajyate yo brāhmaṇaḥ sa na surāṃ pibediti vā surāviśiṣṭapānapratiṣedhena pratiṣedhavidhinā vā pratyavāyavyāvṛttyā brāhmaṇo'nugṛhyataiti nāsya pānaṃ pratiṣedhaṃ vā pratividheyatvopapattiḥ tantravārtike /
analyzed: tena ica api yat turām brāhmaṇaḥ pibet tat na iti vā vacanam vyajyate yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ sa na surām pibet iti vā surā viśiṣṭa pāna pratiṣedhena pratiṣedha vidhinā vā pratyavāya vyāvṛttyā brāhmaṇaḥ anugṛhyate eti na asya pānam pratiṣedham vā pratividheya tva upapattiḥ tantravārtike
translated: And by that also, it is indicated that the statement that a Brahmin should not drink is that a Brahmin should not drink wine, or by the prohibition of drinking qualified by wine, or by the injunction of prohibition, a Brahmin is favored by the exclusion of the undesirable consequence, so it is not proper for him to drink or to be enjoined to prohibit.

original: na ca yo brāhmaṇaḥ pibedityanūdita sa ca pumāniti vidhivyāpārādinā liṅgavivaśā 'vakarūpate
analyzed: na ca yaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ pibet iti sa ca pumān iti vidhi vyāpāra ādinā liṅga vivaśā
translated: And the statement he who is a Brahmin should drink is not repeated, and he is a man is not the form of the injunction due to the inflexion indicating the gender.

analyzed: sataḥ ca ubhayatra api vivaścita liṅga saṃkhya tvam siddham
translated: And of the two, the gender and number of the indeclinable is established.

original: nanvevaṃ sati brāhmaṇa bovadhe 'pi puṃbrāhmaṇavadhavadbrahmahatyāstīti yadātreyyāmeva kevalāyāṃ bhrūṇahatyāprāyaścittavidhānaṃ tannopapadyate
analyzed: nanu evam sati pum brāhmaṇa vadha vat brahmahatyā asti iti yat ātreyyām eva kevalāyām bhrūṇahatyā prāyaścitta vidhānam tat na upapadyate
translated: If that is so, then even in the killing of a Brahmin, just as in the killing of a man or a Brahmin, there is the sin of killing a Brahmin, so the injunction of the penance for killing an embryo in the Atri-mantra alone is not proper.

analyzed: brāhmaṇa khī vadhe kaḥ vā brahmahatyām niṣedhati
translated: Who prohibits the sin of killing a Brahmin in the killing of a Brahmin woman?

analyzed: prāyaścitta antare tasyāḥ strī tva mātra nibandhanam
translated: In another penance, it is based merely on being a woman.

analyzed: dharmma buddhyā yadā āryyāṇām caritram upalabhyate
translated: When the conduct of the noble ones is observed with the idea of dharma,

original: kiṃ tathaiva pramāṇaṃ tadatha vā niṣpramāṇakamiti
analyzed: kim tathā eva pramāṇam tat atha vā niṣpramāṇakam iti
translated: Is it a means of valid knowledge in the same way, or is it without any means of valid knowledge?

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: The third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

original: nanu ca smṛtikārairevaitatprāmāṇyamabhyupagataṃ tahidāṃ ca smṛtiśīle ācāraścaiva sādhūnāṃ yasmindeśe ya ācāraḥ sa sadācāra uccate/
analyzed: nanu ca smṛti kāraiḥ eva etat prāmāṇyam abhyupagatam ca smṛti śīle ācāraḥ ca eva sādhūnām yasmin deśe yaḥ ācāraḥ sa sat ācāraḥ uccate
translated: But this validity has been accepted even by the authors of Smṛti. And in this Smṛti and Śīla, and also the conduct of the good people, wherever there is conduct, that is called good conduct.

analyzed: atas ca tad prāmāṇyāt eva siddham
translated: And therefore, it is established by the validity of that alone.

analyzed: na a mūla abhāvāḥ
translated: Because there is no root, and because of the perception of the reason, it is not so.

original: śākhāntara gatavedavākya darśana mūlāni hismaraṇopanibandhanāni pramāṇatvenādhigatāni /
analyzed: śākhā antara gata veda vākya darśana mūlāni hi smaraṇa upanibandhanāni pramāṇa tvena adhigatāni
translated: For the Smṛtis that are connected with the Vedas found in other branches are known to be valid because they have the Vedas as their root.

analyzed: nanu sat ācāra darśana a tad mūla mātra pravṛtta smaraṇānām mūla antara anumāna saṃbhavaḥ
translated: But from the perception of good conduct, it is possible to infer the existence of another root for the Smṛtis that operate only on the basis of that.

original: yadi hi tairmūlānyaśroṣyanta tato yathaivānyāni smaraṇāni nivadvāni tathaivaitānyapi nibandhānyevābhaviṣyanyatastu svayamupaladhānurūpamanivaḍya parapratyayenaiva sadācārāḥ pramāṇamityāḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi taiḥ mūlāni aśroṣyanta tatas yathā eva anyāni smaraṇāni nivadvāni tathā eva etāni api nibandhāni eva abhaviṣyan yatas tu svayam upaladha anurūpam a nivaḍya para pratyayena eva sat ācārāḥ pramāṇam ityāḥ
translated: For if they had not heard the roots, then just as the other Smṛtis were composed, so these also would have been composed in the same way. But because they themselves, not finding anything suitable, composed them only on the basis of the confidence of others, they say that good conduct is a means of valid knowledge.

analyzed: atas na dṛṣṭa mūla tvena adhyavasātum śakyam iti vicāryyate
translated: Therefore, it cannot be ascertained to have a visible root. Thus it is being considered.

original: tatra pūrvādhikaraṇadvayabalena prāmāṇyaṃ pratijñāyate karṭasāmānyā ḍidhisṭativirodharahitatvācca
analyzed: tatra pūrva adhikaraṇa dvaya balena prāmāṇyam pratijñāyate karṭa sāmānyāḥ ḍidhi sṭati virodha rahita tvāt ca
translated: There, by the force of the previous two sections, the authoritativeness is declared, and also because of the absence of contradiction with the general authoritativeness of the Vedas.

analyzed: smṛti kāra abhyanujñānam mahat anyat ca kāraṇam
translated: The permission of the authors of Smritis and other great reasons are also causes.

analyzed: teṣām ajñāta mūlānām tantravārtike
translated: As it is said in the Tantravartika: For them whose roots are unknown, permission is not possible.

original: śāstraparimeyatvaṃ tāvatparimāṇaśabdavācyaṃ dharmādharmmayoravasthitaṃ parimitāni ca śāstrāṇi vedopavedādīni na ca teṣāṃ madhye sadācāraśāstraṃ kiṃ cidasti /
analyzed: śāstra parimeya tvam tāvat parimāṇa śabda vācyam dharma adharmayoḥ avasthitam parimitāni ca śāstrāṇi veda upaveda ādīni na ca teṣām madhye sat ācāra śāstram kim cit asti
translated: As for the measurability by scriptures, the word parimāṇa (measure) refers to the states of Dharma and Adharma. The scriptures are limited, such as the Vedas, Upavedas, etc. And among them, there is no scripture on good conduct.

original: na ca sadācāraḥ svayameva śāstraṃ nāpi taddarśanamanuṣṭhānaṃ vātyantaparāyattatvātprameyatvācca /
analyzed: na ca sat ācāraḥ svayam eva śāstram na api tad darśanam anuṣṭhānam vā atyanta parāyatta tvāt prameya tvāt ca
translated: And good conduct is not a scripture by itself, nor is the knowledge of it or its performance, because of being utterly dependent and being an object of knowledge.

analyzed: smṛteḥ tu etad viṣayāyāḥ nirmūla tvam uktam eva  na tāvat deśa jāti kula bheda
translated: As for Smriti, its rootlessness in this matter has already been stated.

analyzed: ginnānām aparimita ti mūla tvam
translated: Now, it is not the case that the roots of the various names based on country, caste, and family are limited.

original: yāvadācāraṃ hi vedavākyāni kalpayatāṃ veda evaikaḥ kalpayitanyaḥ /
analyzed: yāvadācāram hi veda vākyāni kalpayatām vedaḥ eva ekaḥ kalpayitanyaḥ
translated: For as long as the Vedic statements are imagined to prescribe conduct, the Veda alone is the one to be imagined.

original: ekasya tu vākyasya naikasya ciḍhaparimitācāra vidhāyitvamavakalpate yata ācārāḥ pravartteranna ca dharmasūtrakāraistadeva dṛṣṭvā ''cāraprāmāṇyamupanibadvam /
analyzed: ekasya tu vākyasya na ekasya ciḍha parimita ācāra vidhāyi tvam avakalpate yatas ācārāḥ pravartteran na ca dharmasūtra kāraiḥ tat eva dṛṣṭvā cāra prāmāṇyam upanibadvam
translated: But it is not possible for a single sentence to enjoin a limited number of practices, by which practices could be initiated, and which the authors of Dharma Sūtras would have seen and accepted as the basis for the authority of practices.

original: śeṣadharmasmṛtivākyatulya nibandhanapra saṅgānna cācāradarśanottarakālapravṛttā smṛtisteṣāṃ mūlaṃ bhavati mūlama livantāvanta viparthyayaprasaṅgāt
analyzed: śeṣa dharma smṛti vākya tulya nibandhana pra saṅgāt na ca ācāra darśana uttara kāla pravṛttā smṛtiḥ teṣām mūlam bhavati mūlam viparthyaya prasaṅgāt
translated: And because it would lead to the same conclusion as the Smṛti statements about the remaining Dharmas, the Smṛti that came into existence after the practices were seen cannot be their basis. If it were the basis, it would lead to the absurdity of the practices being without a basis.

analyzed: na ca smṛtim arūpā api śrutiḥ atra anumīyate
translated: And even if the Smṛti were inferred here, it is not the Veda.

analyzed: viparthyayāt
translated: Because it would lead to the same conclusion as the Veda, and because it would lead to the absurdity of the opposite.

original: na tvācārasya sā mūlamiti nirmūcatā punaḥ /
analyzed: na tu ācārasya sā mūlam iti nirmūca tā punar
translated: And the practices do not have the Smṛti as their basis. Thus, being without a basis, they are again useless.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: The third section of the first chapter.

original: śākhaparimāṇatvāditi vā parimite hyarthe śāslaṃ pravarttatāparimitatvād ācārāṇāmucchā svatvamiti /
analyzed: śākha parimāṇa tvāt iti vā parimite hi arthe śāslam pravarttata aparimita tvāt ācārāṇām ucchā sva tvam iti
translated: Or because of being limited in extent like a branch. For a branch operates on a limited object. Practices are unlimited. Therefore, they are without a basis.

analyzed: parimita artha viṣaya tvāt ā śāstrasya aprāpte śāstram arthavat iti
translated: Because the scriptures have a limited object. A scripture is meaningful when it is not obtained.

original: vaigyānāṃ sevakānāṃ vā vaidyānāṃ nagareṣu vā /
analyzed: vaigyānām sevakānām vā vaidyānām nagareṣu vā
translated: In the cities of physicians or their servants.

analyzed: caritrāṇām yathā sukha aṅga tvam
translated: Just as the limbs of a happy person are beneficial, so let it be here.

analyzed: yahā sūtra trayeṇa api etat eva adhikaraṇam vyākhyātavyam
translated: Here, this very topic should be explained by all three sūtras.

original: ihāryyāvarttanivāsi śiṣṭācārānevodāhṛtya pūrvavatprāmāṇyāprāmāṇya saṃdehe śiṣṭākope'virudvamiti siddhāntastāvadupakramyate /
analyzed: iha āryyāvartta nivāsi śiṣṭa ācārān eva udāhṛtya pūrvavat prāmāṇya aprāmāṇya saṃdehe śiṣṭa ākope virudvam iti siddhāntaḥ tāvat upakramyate
translated: Here, having cited the cultured practices of the residents of Āryāvarta, as before, when there is doubt about validity and invalidity, the conclusion is stated first, that it is not contradictory in the case of cultured people.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Indeed,

analyzed: yadi śiṣṭasya kopaḥ syāt virudhyeta pramāṇa tā
translated: if there were anger in the cultured, it would contradict validity.

analyzed: tad akopāt tu na ācāra pramāṇa tvam virudhyate
translated: But due to its absence, the validity of practice is not contradicted.

analyzed: eka śabdam aneka artham śiṣṭaiḥ ācaryyate yadā
translated: When the cultured use a word with multiple meanings,

analyzed: vigānena tadā tatra kaḥ ṛthaḥ syāt pāramārthikaḥ
translated: then which meaning there would be real?

analyzed: na eva saṃdehaḥ karttavyaḥ manāk api
translated: There, doubt should not be entertained even slightly,

analyzed: prayogam prati talya tvāt sarva loka prayogiṇām
translated: because of the similarity of application to all, of those used by all people.

analyzed: sarva gāmi tvam tad tryāya tvāt pramīyate
translated: Its universality is known there by the reason of its being so.

original: naikaṣāmeva sā hyasti keṣāṃ cidvā na vidyate
analyzed: na ekaṣām eva sā hi asti keṣām cit vā na vidyate
translated: For it exists for some, not for others.

analyzed: taiḥ api abhyupagantavyā sva prasiddhi samā hi sā
translated: It should be accepted by them also, for it is equal to their own well-known usage.

analyzed: vibhītake śa śabdaḥ hi prayujyate
translated: Although the word 'hare' is used by non-Hindus even for the Vibhitaka fruit,

analyzed: tathā api vācakaḥ tasya jñāyate śakaṭākṣa vat
translated: Still, its denotative meaning is understood, like the axle of a cart.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: Third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: śā avasthā tad nimitta tvāt pratipattiḥ balīyasī
translated: The stage of childhood is stronger due to being the cause, the understanding is stronger.

analyzed: laukikī pratipattiḥ hi gauṇa tvena api nīyate
translated: For the worldly understanding is taken even as secondary.

original: laukikatve samāne 'pi śāstreṇābhyadhikā ci sā bhāṣasthāḥ puruṣā ye vā pratipattistadāśrayā
analyzed: laukika tve samāne śāstreṇa abhyadhikā sā bhāṣa sthāḥ puruṣāḥ ye vā pratipattiḥ tad āśrayā
translated: Even when worldly, that understanding which is based on the scriptures is superior, or that understanding which is based on men who are experts in the scriptures.

analyzed: kena api anyathātvena śākhā arthe niṣphalaḥ bhavet
translated: By any other way, the meaning of the Vedic text would be fruitless.

analyzed: laukikaḥ tu anyathātve pi virudhyate
translated: But even when the worldly meaning is otherwise, the meaning is not very much contradicted.

analyzed: tasmāt ye yājikaiḥ yeṣām vaidyaiḥ vā arthāḥ nirūpitāḥ
translated: Therefore, those meanings of words which are determined by priests and physicians,

original: meṣāṃ taeva śabdānāmarthā mukhyā hi netare
analyzed: teṣām te eva śabdānām arthāḥ mukhyāḥ hi na itare
translated: those alone are the primary meanings of those words, not the others.

analyzed: a viśrutaḥ ca śabda arthaḥ yaḥ vedeṣu upalabhyate
translated: And the meaning of a word which is not well-known and is found in the Vedas,

original: tatratya nirṇayāttasmā moke bhavati nirṇayaḥ🔽phālgune 'nyaiauṣadhīnāṃ tu jāyate patraśātanam /tantravārtike /
analyzed: tatratya nirṇayāt tasmai moke bhavati nirṇayaḥ  phālgune tu jāyate patra śātanam tantravārtike
translated: the determination regarding that meaning is made on the basis of the determination found there.🔽In the month of Phālguna, the withering of leaves of other plants takes place,

analyzed: modamānāḥ tu tiṣṭhanti yavāḥ kaṇiśa śālinaḥ
translated: but the barley plants remain joyful, bearing their ears.

analyzed: sadā na anyaiḥ auṣadhi mlāniḥ sarvāsām eva modanāt
translated: They are always joyful, not withered like other plants, because of the joy of all of them.

analyzed: namba etāni udāharaṇāni loka prasidveḥ eva vyavasthita tvāt yuktāni
translated: Other examples are not mentioned, as they are well-known in the world.

analyzed: na eva ucyante cit veśe yavatyā priyaṅgavaḥ
translated: Nor is it said that where there are priyangu grains, there is a peacock.

original: jambūṃ na vetasaṃ prāivarācaṃ nāpi vāyasam
analyzed: jambūm na vetasam prāivarācam na api vāyasam
translated: One does not speak of a rose-apple tree, a cane, a priyangu, or a crow.

analyzed: vacyati eva na tena api pṛthak kāryyā vicāraṇā
translated: Even by that, separate consideration is not necessary.

original: yadyapi tatrābhidheyasandehamanudāhṛtyopādānasaṃdeha nirṇayopāyavyākhyānaṃ kariṣyati yāvadākyaśeṣameva ca sa nirṇayo nānyacāyaṃ tvabhidheyanirṇaya ekatra ca kṛtaḥ sarvatra ca kṛta eva bhaviṣyatītyevamapunaruktatvamāpadyate
analyzed: yadi api tatra abhidheya sandeham an udāhṛtya upādāna saṃdeha nirṇaya upāya vyākhyānam kariṣyati yāvat ākyaśeṣam eva ca sa nirṇayaḥ tu abhidheya nirṇayaḥ ekatra ca kṛtaḥ sarvatra ca kṛtaḥ eva bhaviṣyati iti evam apunarukta tvam āpadyate
translated: Although there he will explain the means of determining the doubt of the subject matter by not mentioning the doubt of the subject matter, and that determination is only the remainder of the sentence, not otherwise. But this determination of the subject matter is made in one place and will be made everywhere. Thus it becomes non-repetition.

original: tatsidvisūtre ca sārūpyādīnāṃ gauṇavṛtti nimittānāmanukramayādveta sasadṛśajambūpratyayasiddhiraśavdārthatve 'pi vijñāyata eveti nehodāhatena kāryyam
analyzed: tad sidvi sūtre ca sārūpya ādīnām gauṇa vṛtti nimittānām anukramayāt veta sa sadṛśa jambū pratyaya siddhiḥ a śabda artha tve vijñāyate eva iti na iha udāhatena kāryyam
translated: And in the sutra on its establishment, the means of the figurative usage of similarity etc. is understood even in the absence of the meaning of the word, by the enumeration of the rose-apple tree similar to the cane. Therefore it is not necessary to quote it here.

original: tatra kiṃ tulyatā yaktā kimekaiva balīyasī /
analyzed: tatra kim tulya tā yaktā kim ekā eva balīyasī
translated: There, what is the similarity required? Is it only one that is stronger?

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: The third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: samā vipratipattiḥ syāt a dṛṣṭa artha vyavahāriṇām
translated: There would be a dispute among those who deal with unseen matters.

original: sarvo hi śabdo 'rthapratyāyanārthaṃ prayujyate / arthaśca saṃvyavahāraprasidhyarthamabhidhīyate
analyzed: sarvaḥ hi śabdaḥ rtha pratyāyana artham prayujyate arthaḥ ca saṃvyavahāra prasidhi artham abhidhīyate
translated: For every word is used for the purpose of conveying meaning, and meaning is stated for the purpose of establishing convention.

analyzed: yathā eva hi ārya gamye rthe saṃbandha anāditā matiḥ
translated: Just as the cognition of the relation in an object understood by the Aryas is beginningless,

analyzed: mleccha gamye tathā eva syāt aviśiṣṭam hi kāraṇam
translated: so it would be in an object understood by the Mlecchas, for the cause is not distinguished.

analyzed: yathā ca mleccha deśe dhūmaḥ gneḥ avabodhakaḥ
translated: And just as smoke is the indicator of fire even in the country of the Mlecchas,

analyzed: evam svārthe prayogāt taiḥ iṣṭaḥ vācakaḥ
translated: in the same way, the word is accepted as expressive by them also from its use in their own language.

analyzed: iti prāpte bhidhoyate
translated: This being the case, it is stated:

analyzed: śāstra sthā vā iti pūrvavat eva sakala sūtra vyākhyā yojanīyā
translated: The learned in the scriptures, as before, the entire explanation of the sutra should be applied.

analyzed: kim ca  yathā
translated: And what is more,🔽just as there arises the misconception of the expressive in those born from the power of good and bad deeds,

analyzed: jāyate vācaka bhrāntiḥ tathā eva mlecchabhāṣite tantravārtike
translated: in the same way in the speech of the Mlecchas, in the Tantravartika.

analyzed: atas bhāṣā abhiyukta tvāt āryyāvartta nivāsinām
translated: Therefore, due to being engaged in language, the cognition of the residents of Aryavarta,

original: yā matiḥ saiva dharmāṅgaṃ śabdārthatvapramā matā🔽smṝtyācāravirodhe vā sāmyavaiṣamya saṃśaye /
analyzed: yā matiḥ sā eva dharma aṅgam śabda artha tva pramā matā  smṝti ācāra virodhe vā sāmya vaiṣamya saṃśaye
translated: that alone is considered to be the limb of Dharma, the cognition of the meaning of the word.🔽In case of contradiction with Smrti and conduct, or doubt of equality and inequality,

analyzed: samā vipratipattiḥ syāt mūla sāmya āiyoḥ api
translated: there should be equal disagreement, even if the roots are equal.

original: yadācārabalīyastvaṃ phalasthatvātpratīyate phalādiyujyamānaṃ hi pramāṇaṃ durbalī bhavet
