translated: Even when qualified by the universal, the particular individual is not cognized, because there is no cognition of the particular individual. If it is argued that only the individual is cognized, that is not so.

analyzed: tadānīm tasya ākṛtitaḥ nyatvena anirūpaṇāt
translated: Because at that time, it cannot be determined as different from the universal.

analyzed: mātra śabdaḥ hi sāmānya vācī iti ākṛtiḥ eva ucyate
translated: For the word only denotes the universal, so the universal alone is referred to.

original: nānākāreṣu ca vastuṣa tadbhedānusāritvācchaktīnāmanvayavyatire kābhyāṃ gotvākāranibandhanaiva gośabdavācyatvaśaktirgamyate /
analyzed: nānā ākāreṣu ca tad bheda anusāri tvāt śaktīnām anvaya vyatirekābhyām go tva ākāra nibandhanā eva go śabda vācyatva śaktiḥ gamyate
translated: And in things with various forms, the potencies follow the differences, and by positive and negative concomitance, the potency to be denoted by the word cow is understood to be based on the form of cowness.

original: ta dekādhārasāmānyāntarāvagatirviśeṣākāṅkṣā vetyarthavyāpyavyāpti bhyām /🔽anatyantavyatirekāccā kṛtera mūrttatvādyāśrayadoṣāprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tad eka ādhāra sāmānya antara avagatiḥ viśeṣa ākāṅkṣā  an atyanta vyatirekāt ca kṛteḥ a mūrtta tva ādi āśraya doṣa aprasaṅgaḥ
translated: The meaning is: the cognition of the common substratum of those two, and the desire for a particular substratum, by the pervasion and non-pervasion of the meaning.🔽And because there is not absolute difference, there is no possibility of the faults of the substratum of the action being non-embodiment etc.

original: sāhi pratīyate niṣṭarūpā kriyāyoginī tu vyaktyupetā bhavatyeveti prokṣaṇāveśaṇādi tu na kathaṃ cinna saṃbhavati /
analyzed: sā hi pratīyate niṣṭa rūpā kriyā yoginī tu vyakti upetā bhavati eva iti prokṣaṇa āveśaṇa ādi tu na katham cit na saṃbhavati
translated: But that is understood. The action which is related to the form is indeed accompanied by the individual. Therefore, sprinkling, placing etc. are in no way impossible.

analyzed: viśasana ādi api tu vyakti a vyatireka apekṣayā saṃbhavati eva
translated: But even cutting etc. is indeed possible in relation to the non-difference of the individual.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus it is.

analyzed: paśu ādiṣu apanīta aṅgeṣu viśeṣa buddhi abhāva ātma āmānya rūpā eva viśasana ādi viśiṭā buddhiḥ dṛṣṭā
translated: In the limbs of animals etc. that are killed, the cognition of the particular is absent. The cognition distinguished by cutting etc. is seen to be of the universal form only.

analyzed: nanu evam anityā kṛtiḥ syāt tena aṃśena iṣṭā eva āśra ya antara avināśāt tu sarvaiḥ api avināśaḥ uvaṇyam eva eṣṭavyaḥ
translated: If it is so, then the universal would be non-eternal. It is accepted only to that extent. But the non-destruction of all is to be accepted only due to the non-destruction of the substratum.

original: tena yattāvanmātrameva tasya vināśo 'nekadeśasya tu na kathaṃ cidvināśaḥ syādityubhayathā vyavahāraḥ /
analyzed: tena yat tāvat mātram eva tasya vināśaḥ neka deśasya tu na katham cit vināśaḥ syāt iti ubhayathā vyavahāraḥ
translated: Therefore, that much alone is the destruction of that. But the destruction of what has many parts cannot be in any way. Thus there is usage in both ways.

analyzed: atyanta vyatireke tu na eṣa dharma vidhi viṣayaḥ vyatratiṣṭheta
translated: But in absolute difference, this would not remain as the object of the injunction of dharma.

analyzed: na ca paśu tvam mamūrtta tvāt
translated: And not the universal of animal, because it is non-embodied.

original: tadupalacitaṃ tu yaddavyaṃ taddavyatvāhate na tādrūpyeṇa gamyataityekārthaṃ samavāyāvyāpakatvācca dravyaṃ gamayitavyaṃ / tatrāpyamūrttatve doṣaḥ /
analyzed: tad upalacitam tu yat davyam tat davya tva āhate na tādrūpyeṇa gamyate eti ekārtham samavāya avyāpaka tvāt ca dravyam gamayitavyam tatra api amūrtta tve doṣaḥ
translated: But the substance that is qualified by that is not cognized as having that form when the substance is cognized, so the substance must be cognized as the substratum of the universal, because the inherence relation is not pervasive of the same object. Even there, the fault of being incorporeal arises.

analyzed: āśraya upakṣaṇāt ca dravya mātra prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And because of the destruction of the substratum, there is the undesirable consequence of mere substance.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ tu paśu tvasya vā dravya tvasya vā vyāpaka tvāt agamyaḥ
translated: But the difference is not cognizable because the universal of animal or the universal of substance is not pervasive.

analyzed: na vā pratītam vidhinā saṃbadhyate
translated: Or what is cognized is not connected with the injunction.

original: na ca yatra saṃśayastatpratītam /🔽na cānyatrokto dharmastatrāsaṃbhavādanyatra kā ryyastasmānna sāmānyakṛto viśeṣeṣu yuktaḥ / viśeṣā api vyapade śātsāmānya mevetyamūrttatā /
analyzed: na ca yatra saṃśayaḥ tat pratītam  na ca anyatra uktaḥ dharmaḥ tatra asaṃbhavāt anyatra kāryyaḥ tasmāt na sāmānya kṛtaḥ viśeṣeṣu yuktaḥ viśeṣāḥ api vyapade śāt sāmānyam eva iti amūrtta tā
translated: And where there is doubt, that is not cognized.🔽And because a property mentioned elsewhere cannot be applied elsewhere due to impossibility, therefore the difference based on universals is not proper in particulars. Even the particulars are merely universals due to verbal designation, so they are incorporeal.

analyzed: asādhāraṇena tu nā eva vyavahāraḥ tasmāt anirūpyaḥ dharma vidhi viṣayaḥ
translated: But there is no usage at all with the uncommon, therefore the object of the injunction of a property is indescribable.

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya ādi ca prasidvi viparītam lakṣaṇayā kalpyam
translated: And the co-reference etc. is to be imagined by implication, contrary to what is well-known.

original: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu vyatirekābhyupagamenāśrayamācagatiruktā / viśeṣarūpā na kadā cid vyaktiḥ pratīyate /
analyzed: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu vyatireka abhyupagamena āśraya māca gatiḥ uktā viśeṣa rūpā na kadā cid vyaktiḥ pratīyate
translated: But the commentator has stated the destruction of the substratum by accepting the difference. The individual is never cognized in the form of a particular.

analyzed: yaḥ upyāyi bhāvaḥ saḥ upi aupacārikaḥ
translated: And the state of being extended is also figurative.

analyzed: sāmānyāt ca viśeṣa lacaṇam tatra na āśrayitavyam
translated: And the definition of the particular based on the universal should not be relied upon there.

analyzed: ākṣepa mātra bhāvāt atha vā etad viṣayaḥ eva ayam prapañcaḥ
translated: Or this elaboration is only about that, due to the mere implication.

analyzed: kim śabdena akṛtyāḥ vā iti
translated: Whether by the word or by the form.

analyzed: anvaya vyatirekābhyām ca ākṛtyā iti nirṇayaḥ
translated: And the determination is by concomitance and non-concomitance that it is by the form.

original: yo hi dhūmādagnitvaṃ pratipadyate tasya naicyepyākāṅkṣā sidvā /
analyzed: yaḥ hi dhūmāt agni tvam pratipadyate tasya sidvā
translated: For one who understands firehood from smoke, even if there is no desire to know, it is accomplished.

analyzed: mānasāt apacārāt iti
translated: Due to mental error.

original: yo hi jā yātmāmānyavācitāṃ hitvā kaṃ cideva viśeṣaṃ yatra saṃbandhānubhavastaṃ vācyaṃ manyate tasya sāmānyāpratīterna viśeṣāntarāpekṣā bhavatyatha vā yathā śabdātkhatantrāmākṛtiṃ buddhyate naivaṃ kadā cidākṛtimabuddhvā vyaktimiti/
analyzed: yaḥ hi hitvā kam cit eva viśeṣam yatra saṃbandha anubhavaḥ tam vācyam manyate tasya sāmānya apratīteḥ na viśeṣa antara apekṣā bhavati atha vā yathā śabdāt khatantrām ākṛtim buddhyate na evam kadā cit ākṛtim a buddhvā vyaktim iti
translated: For one who, abandoning the nature of expressing the universal, considers some particular where there is experience of the relation to be denotable, for him, due to the non-apprehension of the universal, there is no need for another particular. Or just as one understands the form from the word, but never the individual without understanding the form.

analyzed: kena tarhi go tva go ūbdayoḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: Then by what is the difference between the universal and the word 'cow'?

analyzed: vyatireka aṃśasya ekatra vivaścā
translated: The part of the negative concomitance is stated in one place.

original: gotvavāniti tu sphuṭaṃ pratyayena jātimadabhidhānaṃ vibhāgopapatteḥ /
analyzed: go tvavān iti tu sphuṭam pratyayena jātimat abhidhānam vibhāga upapatteḥ
translated: But the cognition 'having the universal of cow' is clearly expressive of the universal, because of the possibility of division.

analyzed: sāmānyasya vā upalakṣaṇa tvāt na bheda paṇa doṣaḥ
translated: Or because the universal is the indicator, there is no fault of difference.

original: bhedānāmeva cāyaṃ pratyekaṃ sarveṣāṃ vācakaḥ /🔽yastūpādīyamānatve saṃśayaḥ sa saṃkhyādhāra viṣayaḥ /
analyzed: bhedānām eva ca ayam pratyekam sarveṣām vācakaḥ  yaḥ tu upādīyamāna tve saṃśayaḥ sa saṃkhyā ādhāra viṣayaḥ
translated: And this [word] is the denoter of the individual differences, either of each one or of all.🔽But the doubt that arises in the case of what is being introduced has number as its basis.

original: uddiśyamāneṣu nirṇaya eva/🔽gavādiśabda grahaṇaṃ sarvanāmākhyāta śabdānāmantarbhāvārtham /
analyzed: uddiśyamāneṣu nirṇayaḥ eva  go ādi śabda grahaṇam sarvanāma ākhyāta śabdānām antarbhāva artham
translated: When [things] are being enumerated, there is certainty itself.🔽The mention of words like 'cow' is for the purpose of including all nouns and verbs.

original: prayojanaṃ sāmānya viśeṣa bhabda yoreka viṣayatvātsāmānyabhisṛsya viśeṣaśiṣṭenābādhaḥ pūrvapakṣe /
analyzed: prayojanam sāmānya viśeṣa bhabda yoḥ eka viṣaya tvāt viśeṣa śiṣṭena ābādhaḥ pūrvapakṣe
translated: The purpose is that since general and specific words have the same object, in the prima facie view, there is no contradiction by the specific instruction of the general meaning.

analyzed: evam vā
translated: Or thus.

analyzed: caturvidhe pade ca atra dvividhasya artha nirṇayaḥ
translated: And in this fourfold word, the determination of the two kinds of meaning is made.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda  kriyate saṃśaya utyatteḥ na epasarga nipātayoḥ
translated: The third section of the first chapter.🔽Doubt is created due to the doubt about the natural and injunctive nature of the words.

analyzed: vācaka tve pi pāścātyam anuyāti evamādiṣu
translated: Even in the case of denotativeness, the latter follows in the case of words like 'evam'.

original: pratīyate viśeṣo yaḥ saṃśayena sa nāpyate
analyzed: pratīyate viśeṣaḥ yaḥ saṃśayena sa na āpyate
translated: The particular that is understood is not obtained by doubt.

analyzed: ākhyātasya api nanu atra na yukta artha vicāraṇā
translated: But indeed, here, the consideration of the meaning of the verb is not proper,

original: dvitīyādāviyaṃ yasmādvistareṇa kariṣyate🔽pratyayārthasya bhāvasya vācyatā pratipāditā /
analyzed: dvitīya ādau iyam yasmāt vistareṇa kariṣyate  pratyaya arthasya bhāvasya vācya tā pratipāditā
translated: because this will be done in detail in the second and subsequent [sections].🔽The denotability of the entity, which is the meaning of the suffix, has been established.

analyzed: prakṛti artha viveka artham vicāraḥ kriyate dhunā
translated: The consideration is now done for the purpose of distinguishing the meaning of the root.

original: yā coktā bhāṣyakāreṇa yāgāderabhidheyatā /🔽siddhā seha vivekārthaṃ tatra bhāvasya bhāṣitā
analyzed: yā ca uktā bhāṣyakāreṇa yāga ādeḥ abhidheya tā  siddhā sā iha viveka artham tatra bhāvasya bhāṣitā
translated: And that which has been stated by the author of the Bhāṣya, that the meaning of the root is the denoted object of the verb,🔽that is established here for the sake of discrimination, and there the existence of the noun is stated.

original: nāmākhyātapade tena kasyārthasyābhidhāyake /🔽kimākṛteruta vyaktariti cintā pravarttate
analyzed: nāma ākhyāta pade tena kasya arthasya abhidhāyake  kim ākṛteḥ uta vyaktaḥ iti cintā pravarttate
translated: Therefore, when the word denoting the meaning of the root is used,🔽the question arises whether it denotes the universal or the individual.

original: kathaṃ lacaṇasaṃbandhaścintāyāḥ prakṛtena vā /🔽smṛtimūla vicāreṇa vaktavyaṃ tvidamāditaḥ
analyzed: katham lacaṇa saṃbandhaḥ cintāyāḥ prakṛtena vā  smṛti mūla vicāreṇa vaktavyam tu idam āditas
translated: Or how is the connection of the definition to be considered with the original?🔽This should be stated first by the consideration of the basis of Smṛti.

analyzed: vaktavyaḥ pūrvam artha śvet śabda rūpa nirūpaṇāt  nahi vācyam a vijñāya sādhu tvam avadhāryyate
translated: The meaning should be stated first, before determining the form of the word,🔽for correctness is not ascertained without knowing the denoted object.

analyzed: vācya mātre hi sādhu tvam avijñāte na labhyate
translated: For correctness is not obtained if the denoted object is not known merely.

original: na cākṛtyā na ca vyaktyā vinā tannopapadyate🔽vyaktirvācyeti vijñānaṃ na sanmūlamasaṃbhavāt /
analyzed: na ca ākṛtyā na ca vyaktyā vinā tat nā upapadyate  vyaktiḥ vācyā iti vijñānam na sat mūlam asaṃbhavāt
translated: And that is not possible without either the universal or the individual.🔽The knowledge that the individual is the denoted object is not based on reality, because it is impossible.

analyzed: tena na pramāṇam smṛtiḥ matā
translated: Therefore, grammar is not considered a means of knowledge, but rather a Smṛti.

analyzed: nanu ca ākṛti pakṣe pi vyaktau eva kriyā akriye
translated: But even in the case of the universal, action and non-action are possible only in the individual.

analyzed: śabda arthe saṃbhavāt tena kimarthā eṣā vicāraṇā
translated: Therefore, why is this consideration necessary?

analyzed: vyakti paśce vikalpaḥ syāt kauṇḍinye dadhi takrayoḥ
translated: If the individual were the denoted object, there would be an option in Kauṇḍinya between curd and buttermilk,

analyzed: sāmānya vākya da
translated: in the general statement.

analyzed: rbalyāt takram eva itaratra tu
translated: In the other case, it is only by force.

analyzed: procaṇam pūrvapakṣe api karttavyam laukikeṣu api
translated: Even in worldly matters, sprinkling should be done even in the bright fortnight.

analyzed: brīhiṣu śruti sāmarthyāt vā adhitvā sannidhi kramam
translated: In the case of rice, by the power of the Vedic text, the order of proximity is overridden.

original: evaṃ homepi dadhyādau prakṛte prakṛte 'tha vā /🔽prakṛte śrutivācyasya homatvasyāpi saṃbhavāt
analyzed: evam home pi dadhi ādau prakṛte prakṛte vā  prakṛte śruti vācyasya homa tvasya api saṃbhavāt
translated: Similarly, in the case of the homa of curd etc., or in each case,🔽since the nature of being a homa, which is denoted by the Vedic text, is possible in each case.

analyzed: nanu gauḥ iti śabda ādau sarvam etat vicāritam
translated: But all this has been considered in the case of words like 'cow'.

analyzed: tena tena gatārtha tvāt punar cintā na yujyate
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to think again, as it has already been dealt with by each one.

analyzed: yathā ca ākṛtiḥ ityādau bhāṣyakāreṇa ca uditam
translated: And as it has been pointed out by the author of the Bhāṣya in the case of 'ākṛti' (universal),

original: punarasyāḥ pratijñāyā heturapya bhidhāsyate🔽ukte vāpyabhidheyatve jāteḥ sadbhāvasiddhaye /
analyzed: punar asyāḥ pratijñāyāḥ hetuḥ api a bhidhāsyate  ukte vā api abhidheya tve jāteḥ sadbhāva siddhaye
translated: the reason for this proposition will also be stated.

analyzed: vyaktiḥ vācyā na vā iti etat gatārtham vicāryyate
translated: Even if denotability is stated, the discussion on whether the individual is to be denoted or not is considered to be finished in order to establish the existence of the universal.

analyzed: eka tve sati karttavyaḥ vicāraḥ śabda vācyayoḥ
translated: When there is oneness, the consideration of the denotatum and the denotator by the word should be done,

original: bheṭeta saṃśayābhāvānna cintāvasaro yataḥ🔽alaukikeca śabdārthe vācyavācakarūpayoḥ /
analyzed: saṃśaya abhāvāt na cintā avasaraḥ yatas  alaukike ca śabda arthe vācya vācaka rūpayoḥ
translated: because the occasion for thought does not arise due to the absence of doubt when they are met.🔽And in the case of the word-meaning which is not worldly, when the nature of the denotatum and denotator is unknown,

analyzed: ajñātayoḥ na jāyeta saṃdehaḥ vācya vastuni
translated: doubt does not arise regarding the denotable object.

analyzed: abheda kāraṇam ca atra pratyabhijñānam eva te
translated: And here, the very recognition is the cause of non-difference for you.

analyzed: anyat tu upacaya tvena tena cintā na yujyate
translated: But another is considered as an increase, so thinking about it is not appropriate.

analyzed: vyapadeśa ādi bhedāt ca katham bhedaḥ na jāyate
translated: And how does difference not arise due to the difference in designation etc.?

analyzed: tatra anuktam idam vaktum vicāraḥ yaḥ pravarttitaḥ
translated: This investigation is undertaken to state what has not been said there.

original: arthābhede ca cinteyaṃ śabdābhede tu satyapi /
analyzed: artha abhede ca cintā iyam śabda abhede tu sati api
translated: And this thought is possible in the case of non-difference of meaning, but even in the case of non-difference of words,

analyzed: ghaṭate kasya vācya tvam vyaktyā
translated: Whose denotability is possible, even of the individual and the action.

analyzed: bheda abheda nimittābhyām kriyate saṃśaya udbhavaḥ
translated: Doubt arises from the two causes of difference and non-difference.

analyzed: kim prāptam ucyate bhinnau śabda arthaiḥ
translated: What is the conclusion? It is said that the word and meaning are different

analyzed: loka vedayoḥ  vyapadeśasya bhinna tvāt ākhyāyāḥ lakṣaṇasya ca
translated: in the world and the Veda.🔽Because of the difference in designation and definition,

analyzed: khara uccāraṇa bhedāt ca lopa vyatyaya darśanāt
translated: and because of the difference in pronunciation, and because of the seen omission and inversion,

analyzed: tat ayuktam kriyā bhede kartṛ bhedaḥ hi nā iṣyate
translated: That is not appropriate. In the case of difference in action, difference in agent is not accepted.

analyzed: danti kartṛ tvam agneḥ ca padārthebhyaḥ pratīyate
translated: The agency of the horse is understood from the meanings of the words.

analyzed: asatā katham anyattvam karmāṇā atas pratīyate
translated: How is difference from that understood, when it is not existent?

analyzed: apūrve vṛtra śabda arthe kriyā śabde ipi alaukike
translated: In the unseen meaning of the word 'vṛtra', and in the word for action, which is not worldly,

analyzed: akriya tvāt ca bhāṣya uktaiḥ vā kyaiḥ iti abhidhāsyate
translated: And because of inactivity, it will be stated by the endings mentioned in the commentary.

analyzed: tena uktasya eva śabdasya trivṛḍha ādeḥ nava ādiṣu
translated: Therefore, of the very word 'trivṛt' etc., in the new ones,

analyzed: satyam na śabdasya
translated: That is true, but the difference in the word is not caused by the difference in meaning.

analyzed: tena vaktavyā bhinna rūpa tā
translated: Therefore, the difference in form should be stated due to the difference in pitch and so on.

original: tāveva vede śabdārtho loke yāviti bhāṣyate /
analyzed: tau eva vede śabda arthaḥ loke yau iti bhāṣyate
translated: Those two are said to be the word and meaning of the Veda in the world.

original: vedasyaiva prasajyeta sakalasyāpramāṇatā tantravārtike /🔽bhāvaḥ pratyayārthasya vidherapratipādanāt /
analyzed: vedasya eva prasajyeta sakalasya apramāṇa tā tantravārtike  bhāvaḥ pratyaya arthasya vidheḥ apratipādanāt
translated: The entire Veda would be rendered unauthoritative.🔽The meaning of the suffix is not conveyed by the injunctive suffix.

original: arthāntare ca śabdasya na prayogo vidhīyate
analyzed: artha antare ca śabdasya na prayogaḥ vidhīyate
translated: And the use of the word in a different meaning is not enjoined.

analyzed: vaidikeṣu api śabdeṣu pratyakṣeṇa punar punar
translated: Even in the Vedic words, again and again by perception,

analyzed: vibhāga śabdena śabdasya uccāraṇe sati
translated: where the word is uttered with the word 'vibhāga',

original: sarvathā śakyate bhedo na vaktuṃ śabdavācyayoḥ /
analyzed: sarvathā śakyate bhedaḥ na vaktum śabda vācyayoḥ
translated: the difference between the word and its meaning cannot be stated in any way.

analyzed: eka tve yājñikānām ca prasiddhiḥ anugṛhyate
translated: And the well-known identity of the sacrificers is favored.

analyzed: pratyakṣa pratyabhijñāte veda śabde nyarūpata
translated: In the Vedic word recognized by perception and recognition, the difference in form,

analyzed: vyapadeśa ādi bhedaḥ ca svarabheda ādi kāritaḥ
translated: and the difference in designation and so on, are caused by the difference in pitch and so on.

analyzed: na anya tvam yujyate bādhāt pratyakṣa pratyabhijñayā
translated: Difference is not proper due to contradiction by perception and recognition.

analyzed: vacana āma bhedaḥ tu śūdra varjita tā api vā
translated: Or the non-exclusion of the Shudra is the non-difference of the statement.

analyzed: na ca bhinna tvam anyeṣu prajñāta artheṣu yujyate
translated: And the difference is not proper in the other known meanings.

original: uttānānāṃ ca keṣāṃ cidahatāṃ na vidhīyate
analyzed: uttānānām ca keṣām cit ahatām na vidhīyate
translated: And for some lying on their backs, it is not prescribed to be struck.

analyzed: prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: Third section of the first chapter.

analyzed: uttāna ityādikā tena na atas bhedaḥ pratīyate
translated: Therefore, it is not understood that there is a difference from this.

analyzed: tasmāt yau eva śabda arthau loke pūrvam nirūpitā
translated: Therefore, just those two which are the meaning of the word in the world have been previously determined,

original: kimākṛteḥ padārthatvaṃ / kiṃ vyaktaḥ / kiṃ iyoriti /
analyzed: kim ākṛteḥ padārtha tvam kim vyaktaḥ kim iyoḥ iti
translated: Is the universal the meaning of the word, or the individual, or both?

original: bahavaḥ pratibhāntyatra pakṣāḥ pratipadaṃ ca ye
analyzed: bahavaḥ pratibhānti atra pakṣāḥ pratipadam ca ye
translated: Many positions appear here, and those for each word,

analyzed: jātiḥ vyaktiḥ ca saṃbandhaḥ samūhaḥ liṅga kārake
translated: The universal, the individual, the relation, the aggregate, the gender, the case endings,

analyzed: saṃkhyā ca saptamī teṣām aṣṭa pakṣī dayā dvayoḥ
translated: And number are the seven for both of them, making eight positions.

analyzed: jātiḥ vyakti viśiṣṭā vā vyaktiḥ jāti viśeṣitā
translated: The universal is either qualified by the individual, or the individual is qualified by the universal.

analyzed: jāti saṃbandhayoḥ evam sāmānya samudāyayoḥ
translated: Thus for the universal and the relation, which are the general aggregates,

analyzed: aṣṭau paścā niyoktavyāḥ pratyekam ukta vat
translated: The eight positions should be applied, as stated for each of the six.

analyzed: evam ānantyam eteṣām gamyate
translated: Thus the infinity of these eight positions is understood.

analyzed: vyakteḥ jāti viśiṣṭāyāḥ viparītam atha api vā
translated: Or the individual qualified by the universal, or the opposite of that.

analyzed: upanyāsena ca eteṣām jñeyāḥ sarve prapañcitāḥ
translated: And all of these should be known as elaborated by the statement.

original: tenādya dāveva pacau vicāryeta kimākṛtiḥ śabdārtho / vyakti riti /
analyzed: tena adya dau eva pacau vicāryeta kim ākṛtiḥ śabda arthaḥ vyaktiḥ riti
translated: Therefore, right at the beginning, the two positions should be considered: Is the universal the meaning of the word, or the individual?

original: bhāṣyakāreṇa ca saṃśayakāraṇamuktaṃ sāmānyapratyayādyaktī ca kriyāsaṃbhavādityetadayukta / vyakterapi pratoyamānatvātkathaṃ jātereva pratītirupanyasyate /
analyzed: bhāṣyakāreṇa ca saṃśaya kāraṇam uktam sāmānya pratyayāt yaktī ca kriyā saṃbhavāt iti etat ayukta vyakteḥ api pratoyamāna tvāt katham jāteḥ eva pratītiḥ upanyasyate
translated: And the author of the Bhāṣya has stated the cause of doubt as because of the cognition of the universal and the possibility of action in the individual, which is incorrect. Because the individual is also cognized, how is it that only the cognition of the universal is stated?

original: yadi ca vyakti saṃpratīyeta tataḥ saṃśaya eva na syātkimabhidhīyate 'neneti /
analyzed: yadi ca vyakti saṃpratīyeta tatas saṃśayaḥ eva na syāt kim abhidhīyate nena iti
translated: And if the individual were cognized, then there would not be doubt at all - what is meant by this?

original: na ca kriyāsaṃbhavo 'bhidheyatve kāraṇavyaktyanta rāṇāmapi prasaṅgāt /
analyzed: na ca kriyā saṃbhavaḥ bhidheya tve kāraṇa vyakti anta rāṇām api prasaṅgāt
translated: And the possibility of action is not a reason for being denoted, because it would follow for the individual and other things as well.

analyzed: tena pūrva uktam eva saṃśaya kāraṇam mantavyam
translated: Therefore, the previously stated cause of doubt should be understood.

analyzed: prayoga pratītyoḥ sādhāraṇa tvāt śāstra antare vyakti paśca abhyupagamāt saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is doubt because the cognition of the word and the understanding of the meaning are common, and because the individual is accepted in another treatise.

original: yadvā śabda uccārite sāmānyapratyayād vyaktyākṛtyoḥ sāmānyāttulyātpratyayād vyaktau ca prabdādākṛtāvālambhana sparśana śyena sadṛśacayanādi kriyāsaṃbhavātmā mānye vyaktau ca pratyayākriyāsaṃbhavāditi coktam /
analyzed: yat vā śabde uccārite sāmānya pratyayāt vyakti ākṛtyoḥ sāmānyāt tulyāt pratyayāt vyaktau ca prabdāt ākṛtau ālambhana sparśana śyena sadṛśa cayana ādi kriyā saṃbhava ātmā mānye vyaktau ca pratyaya akriyā saṃbhavāt iti ca uktam
translated: Or, it is said that when the word is uttered, there is cognition of the universal, and because the cognition is the same for the universal and the individual, and because the action such as touching, cutting, and arranging like a hawk is possible in the individual, and because the cognition and action are possible in the universal and the individual.

analyzed: kā panar ākṛtiḥ kā vyaktiḥ iti
translated: But what is the universal and what is the individual?

original: kathaṃ punarayaṃ praśno yadā gaurityetasya śabdasya kortha ityatra jātinirūpitā /
analyzed: katham punar ayam praśnaḥ yadā gauḥ iti etasya śabdasya kaḥ ṛthaḥ iti atra jāti nirūpitā
translated: How then is this question, when it is asked What is the meaning of the word 'cow'? related to the definition of the universal?

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: yenaitantra jñātamasau pṛcchati kā punarākṛtiḥ kā vyaktiriti /
analyzed: yena etat tra jñātam asau pṛcchati kā punar ākṛtiḥ kā vyaktiḥ iti
translated: By one who knows this, he asks What is the configuration? What is the individual?

original: saṃdehāḍā 'tra punarubhayasminpratīyamāne kā vyaktiḥ kiyatī vā jātiriti /
analyzed: tra punar ubhayasmin pratīyamāne kā vyaktiḥ kiyatī vā jātiḥ iti
translated: And here, when both are understood due to doubt, What is the individual? Or how much is the universal?

original: vaiparītyena vā kaścitpṛcchati yadā śāvaleyādipiṇḍānna kiṃ cid vyaktaṃ vastvantaraṃ bhinnamupalabhyate tadā kuto 'yaṃ viveko vyaktiriyaṃ jātiriyamityatha vā vyavahārārthaṃ sarvaiva cintā kriyate jāteśca padārthatvepi vyaktī kriyāsaṃbhavānniṣpayojanā cintā yatastvasaiau prayatnenaitadvicārayati tena nūnaṃ kāpyasya piṇḍādatyantabhinnavyavahārayogyā jātirabhipretetyabhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: vaiparītyena vā kaścid pṛcchati yadā śāvaleya ādi piṇḍāt na kiṃcid vyaktam vastu antaram bhinnam upalabhyate tadā kutas yam vivekaḥ vyaktiḥ iyam jātiḥ iyam iti atha vā vyavahāra artham sarvā eva cintā kriyate jāteḥ ca padārtha tve pi vyaktī kriyā saṃbhavāt niṣpayojanā cintā prayatnena etat vicārayati tena nūnam kā api asya piṇḍāt atyanta bhinna vyavahāra yogyā jātiḥ abhipretā iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Or someone asks in the opposite way, when no distinct individual substance is perceived in the spotted cow and so on, then how is this distinction made, This is the individual, this is the universal? Or else, all this consideration is done for the sake of usage. And even when the universal is the meaning of a word, since action is not possible with individuals, the consideration is purposeless. But since he investigates this with effort, the idea is that he certainly intends some universal that is absolutely different from the individual, fit for usage.

analyzed: tatra ā ca dravya guṇa karmaṇā sāmānya mātram ākṛtiḥ iti
translated: There, first, configuration is the mere universal of substance, quality, and action.

original: yau tāvadajñānasaṃśayavādinau tayoḥ svarūpakathanamātreṇaiva nirākaraṇaṃ vaktavyam /
analyzed: yau tāvat ajñāna saṃśaya vādinau tayoḥ svarūpa kathana mātreṇa eva nirākaraṇam vaktavyam
translated: As for those who speak of the universal as being neither different nor non-different, their view is to be refuted by the mere statement of its nature.

original: yastu viparītavādī tasyaiva nirākaraṇamabhidhīyate /🔽yadyapi jātirvyakteratyanta bhinnā nopalabhyate / tathāpi śavalākāra tasmiprathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yaḥ tu viparīta vādī tasya eva nirākaraṇam abhidhīyate  yadi api jātiḥ vyakteḥ atyanta bhinnā na upalabhyate tathā api
translated: As for those who speak of it as being different, their refutation is stated.🔽Although the universal is not perceived as absolutely different from the individual, still it is perceived as having a variegated form in that.

analyzed: sāmānya buddheḥ ālambanam prathama pāda uktena nyāyena a katiḥ itarā vyaktiḥ
translated: When the universal is not perceived, the individual is the basis for the cognition of the universal, as stated in the first section.

original: na cānena granthena jāteḥ sadbhāvaḥ pramāṇaṃ vā pratipādyate vyaktarvivekaḥ kevalaḥ kathyate /
analyzed: na ca anena granthena jāteḥ sadbhāvaḥ pramāṇam vā pratipādyate vyaktaḥ vivekaḥ kevalaḥ kathyate
translated: And this text does not teach the existence of the universal or its proof, but only distinguishes the individual.

analyzed: tena eva abhiprāyeṇa mātra śabda prayogaḥ nyathā tasya gatārtha tā eva bhavet
translated: With that intention, the word mere is used, otherwise it would be redundant.

analyzed: yat api ukta nūnam kā api atyanta bhinnā jātiḥ abhipretā iti
translated: As for what was said that some absolutely different universal is intended,

analyzed: tasya api uttaram dravya guṇa kamaṇām sāmānya mātram ākṛtiḥ abhipretā na atyanta vyatiriktā iti
translated: the answer to that is that mere form, which is the universal of substance, quality and action, is intended, not something absolutely separate.

original: dravyādīnāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ yatmāmānyaṃ sattārūpaṃ tadanena nirdiśyate / tannirdeśanāvāntara sāmānyānāmapi nirdeśasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: dravya ādīnām ca sarveṣām yat māmānyam sattā rūpam tat anena nirdiśyate tad nirdeśana avāntara sāmānyānām api nirdeśa siddhiḥ
translated: And the universal form of existence of all substances etc. is indicated by this. By indicating that, the indication of the subordinate universals is also established.

analyzed: yat dā
translated: What is that?

original: sāmānyaśabdasya pratyekaṃ saṃvandhāhavyatvādīni cīṇi sāmānyāni nirdiśyante sattayā vyavahārābhāvāt /
analyzed: sāmānya śabdasya pratyekam saṃvandha ahavya tva ādīni cīṇi sāmānyāni nirdiśyante sattayā vyavahāra abhāvāt
translated: The three universals such as havya etc. are indicated by the word universal individually, because of the absence of usage with existence.

analyzed: atha vā
translated: Or else,

original: mātraśabdaprayogāhavyādiṣu yāvantyavāntarasāmānyāni mahāsāmānyaṃ ca tatsarvamabhidhīyate /🔽asādhāraṇaviśeṣā vyaktiriti bahuvrīhiḥ /
analyzed: mātra śabda prayogāt ahavya ādiṣu yāvanti avāntarasāmānyāni mahāsāmānyam ca tat sarvam abhidhīyate  asādhāraṇa viśeṣā vyaktiḥ iti bahuvrīhiḥ
translated: by the use of the word 'only', all the subordinate universals and the great universal are denoted in havya etc.

original: asādhāraṇa viśeṣā yasyāṃ vyaktau seyamasādhāraṇa viśeṣā / na tvasādhāraṇāśca te viśeṣāśceti sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: asādhāraṇa viśeṣā yasyām vyaktau sā iyam asādhāraṇa viśeṣā na tu asādhāraṇāḥ ca te viśeṣāḥ ca iti sāmānādhikaraṇyam saṃbhavati
translated: The bahuvrihi compound 'asādhāraṇa-viśeṣā vyaktiḥ' means 'that individual in which there are uncommon specific attributes'. It is not possible to have co-reference by saying 'those uncommon attributes are specific'

analyzed: upariṣṭāt viśeṣa ādhārasya vyakti tva abhidhānāt
translated: because individuality is said to be the substratum of specific attributes later on.

analyzed: smṛteḥ ca
translated: And because of the Smriti.

analyzed: tena samyak abhihitam kim ākṛtiḥ vā vyaktiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, it is rightly said 'what is the form of the individual?'

original: kiṃ prāptam ālambhanaprocaṇaviśasanādiprayogacodanāyā vyaktipaśce bhāvādākṛtipakṣe cābhāvādvāhāṇo na intavyaḥ surā na pātavyetyādipratiṣedhacodanāyāśca vyaktipaścaeva saṃbhavāddevadatta gāmabhyājetyevamādilokikavyavahāra codanāyāścopapattevyaktiḥ śabdārtha iti niścīyate /
analyzed: kim prāptam ālambhana procaṇa viśasana ādi prayoga codanāyāḥ bhāvāt ākṛti pakṣe ca abhāvāt vāhāṇaḥ naḥ intavyaḥ surā na pātavyā ityādi pratiṣedha codanāyāḥ ca vyakti paśce eva saṃbhavāt devadatta gām abhyāja iti evamādi lokika vyavahāra codanāyāḥ ca upapatteḥ vyaktiḥ śabda arthaḥ iti niścīyate
translated: What is the conclusion? The injunction to perform the act of killing, sprinkling, cutting etc. is possible only if the individual is the meaning of the word, and not if the universal is. And the prohibition one should not kill an animal, one should not drink wine is possible only if the individual is the meaning of the word. And the injunction of worldly usage such as Devadatta, yoke the cow is also possible only if the individual is the meaning of the word. Thus it is ascertained that the individual is the meaning of the word.

analyzed: saṃkhyā kāraka upapatteḥ ca
translated: And because number and case endings are possible.

original: yadi hi vyaktiḥ śabdārtho bhavati tato vṛkṣau vṛkṣābhyāmiti prātipadikābhihitāsu vyaktiṣu pratyayābhihitadvitvādisaṃkhyākaraṇādikārakaṃ vobhayamupapadyate / itaratra tu jāterasaṃkhyeyatvāt kārakatvāccobhayamapyanupapannam /
analyzed: yadi hi vyaktiḥ śabda arthaḥ bhavati tatas vṛkṣau vṛkṣābhyām iti prātipadika abhihitāsu vyaktiṣu pratyaya abhihita dvi tva ādi saṃkhyā karaṇa ādi kārakam vā ubhayam upapadyate itaratra tu jāteḥ asaṃkhyeya tvāt kāraka tvāt ca ubhayam api anupapannam
translated: If the individual is the meaning of the word, then in the individuals denoted by the words tree, trees, by two trees, the number two etc. denoted by the suffix and the case ending denoting the instrument are both possible. But in the case of the universal, because it is innumerable and because it is not a case, both are impossible.
Lakshana Tantra Vartika.

original: pikavyaktyāśrayaṇaṃ cāpadyetā tathā ca sarvavaidikavākyārthānāṃ lākṣaṇikatvaṃ syāt /
analyzed: pika vyakti āśrayaṇam ca āpadyeta ā tathā ca sarva vaidika vākya arthānām lākṣaṇika tvam syāt
translated: And the individual would have to be assumed, and then the meaning of all Vedic sentences would be figurative.

original: vyaktipaśce ca puruṣo devadatta iti mukhyaśabdasāmānādhikaraṇyopapattiḥ /
analyzed: vyakti paśce ca puruṣaḥ devadattaḥ iti mukhya śabda sāmānādhikaraṇya upapattiḥ
translated: And in the case of the individual, the co-reference of the primary word is possible, as in the man Devadatta.

original: jātipakṣe lākṣaṇikadāraṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ kalpayitavyaṃ bhavet tenāpi vyaktaḥ padārthatvamava soyate /
analyzed: jāti pakṣe sāmānādhikaraṇyam kalpayitavyam bhavet tena api vyaktaḥ padārtha tvam ava soyate
translated: In the case of the class, a figurative relation would have to be assumed between the class and the individual. Even by that, the individual is understood to be the meaning of the word.

analyzed: paśum ālabheta iti ca śruteḥ hṛdaya jihā ādibhiḥ vyakti avayavaiḥ upariṣṭāt vyavahāraḥ dṛśyate
translated: And after hearing one should sacrifice an animal, the usage with the individual parts like the heart, tongue, etc. is seen later.

original: na jātyā karmmabhiśca dravyasyāpekṣitatvād vyaktipakṣepeścitābhidhānaṃ netaratra siddhasvarūpāyāśca vyaktarabhidheyatvaṃ yuktaṃ nāprasidvāyā jāterato vyaktiḥ śabdārthaḥ /
analyzed: na jātyā karmmabhiḥ ca dravyasya apekṣita tvāt na itaratra siddha svarūpāyāḥ ca vyaktaḥ abhidheya tvam yuktam na aprasidvāyāḥ jāteḥ atas vyaktiḥ śabda arthaḥ
translated: And because the substance is required by actions, and because the individual is mentioned in the case of the individual, it is proper that the individual should be denoted, not the class whose form is not established. Therefore, the individual is the meaning of the word.

analyzed: kim iti ubhayam vācyam na āśrīyate prayoga pratoti kriyā upapatteḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked why both are not accepted as denoted, because the usage is possible by indicating the action,

analyzed: na  aneka śakti kalpanā prasaṅgāt eka abhidhānena eva saṃbandhāt itaratra pratīteḥ upapanna tvāt vyakteḥ eva abhidheya tvam
translated: no.🔽Because it would lead to the assumption of multiple powers, and because the other is understood by the mere denotation of one, the individual alone is the denoted object.

analyzed: sāmānya pratyayaḥ katham iti ced vyakti saṃbandhāt upapatsyate
translated: If it is asked how the cognition of the class is possible, it will be explained by the relation with the individual.

original: yatraiva kriyānupapattistacaivārthāpattyā vyaktivacanatvaṃ yuktam / anyatra tu pūrvapratīterjātivaca natvameva nyāyyamiti cet /
analyzed: yatra eva kriyā anupapattiḥ taca eva arthāpattyā vyakti vacana tvam yuktam anyatra tu pūrva pratīteḥ jāti vaca na tvam eva nyāyyam iti ced
translated: If it is argued that the denotation of individuals is proper only where the application of the word is not possible, and in other cases the denotation of the universal is reasonable,

analyzed: na
translated: [then the answer is:] No.

original: uktamārgeṇā nekaśakti kalpanādidoṣaprasaṅgāt /🔽anavasthita śabdārthasaṃbandhāpatteḥ saṃśayāpatteśca vyaktivādinaḥ kathaṃ ninimittā vyaktyantare śabdasya pravṛttiriti cedākṛticihnanimittatvād vyaktyantare prayogasyāvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: ukta mārgeṇa aneka śakti kalpanā ādi doṣa prasaṅgāt  anavasthita śabda artha saṃbandha āpatteḥ saṃśaya āpatteḥ ca vyakti vādinaḥ katham vyakti antare śabdasya pravṛttiḥ iti ced ākṛti cihna nimitta tvāt vyakti antare prayogasya avirodhaḥ
translated: Because it leads to the fault of assuming multiple powers, as explained earlier.🔽If it is argued that the person who advocates individuals would face the fault of the relation between word and meaning being unestablished and the fault of doubt arising, how can the word be applied to another individual without a reason? If it is argued that the application to another individual is not contradictory because it is based on the mark of the universal,

original: bhāṣyakārastu kathaṃ sāmānyāvagatirityupanyasyā kṛtiścibhūtā bhaviṣyatītyuttaraṃ dadāti / tadasaṃbaddham /
analyzed: bhāṣyakāraḥ tu katham sāmānya avagatiḥ iti upanyasyā kṛtiḥ ci bhūtā bhaviṣyati iti uttaram dadāti tat asaṃbaddham
translated: the author of the commentary presents the question How is the universal understood? and gives the answer The universal will be the mark. That is irrelevant.

analyzed: katham sāmānya apratyaya kāraṇe pṛṣṭe vyakti antara prayoga nimittam kathyate
translated: When asked about the cause of the cognition of the universal, how can the reason for the application to another individual be stated?

analyzed: tena adhyāhāreṇa etat vyākhyeyam
translated: Therefore, this should be explained with an implied question.

analyzed: katham sāmānya avagatiḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked How is the universal understood?

analyzed: vyakti saṃbandhāt
translated: [The answer is:] From the connection with the individual.

analyzed: katham vyakti antare prayogaḥ cihna tvāt ākṛtaḥ iti evam
translated: If it is asked How is it applied to another individual? [The answer is:] Because the universal is the mark.🔽Thus.

original: yadā kathaṃ sāmānyāvagatiriti cedityupanyaste pūrvapañcavādī sāmānyāvagatimapotumaśakkutrannā kṛtiviśiṣṭavyaktyabhiṣāmapakṣaṃ pa prathamādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yadā katham sāmānya avagatiḥ iti ced iti upanyaste pūrvapañcavādī ākṛti viśiṣṭa vyakti abhiṣāma pakṣam prathama adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: If it be asked how there can be the cognition of the Universal, the pūrvapakṣin, being unable to set aside the cognition of the Universal, accepts the Individual as qualified by the Universal, and then proceeds to show that the Universal is the denotation of the word.

analyzed: rigṛhṇāti ākṛtiḥ ciha bhūtā viśeṣaṇa bhūtā abhidheyā bhaviṣyati  tad pratītiḥ acodyā
translated: And the Universal, being the basis of the Individual, will be the qualified denotation of the word.🔽And the cognition of the Universal will not be open to objection.

original: tena kevalā viśiṣṭā vā vyaktiḥ śabdārthaḥ /
analyzed: tena kevalā viśiṣṭā vā vyaktiḥ śabda arthaḥ
translated: Thus, either the Individual alone, or the qualified Individual, is the denotation of the word.

original: tathā ca ṣaḍ deyā ityevamādiṣu ṣaḍādikā saṃkhyopapatsyate /
analyzed: tathā ca ṣaṭ deyāḥ iti evamādiṣu ṣaṣ ādikā saṃkhyā upapatsyate
translated: And thus, in such expressions as “six should be given,” the number six and so on will be applicable.

original: anyaṃ tadvayamiti ca vyaktyantare 'nyaśabdopapattistadurmatā ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anyam tat vayam iti ca vyakti antare ca bhaviṣyati
translated: And the word “other” will be applicable to another Individual in the expression “that other one,” and that will be a well-known fact.

original: anyathā vyaktyantarānayanepi jāterananyatvādaguṇatvāccobhayamanupapannaṃ / tasmād vyaktiḥ śabdārtha iti prāpte 'bhidhīyate/
analyzed: anyathā vyakti antara ānayane api jāteḥ ananya tvāt aguṇa tvāt ca ubhayam anupapannam tasmāt vyaktiḥ śabda arthaḥ iti prāpte bhidhīyate
translated: Otherwise, even when bringing another Individual, because the Universal is the same and because it is not a quality, both are not applicable. Therefore, the Individual is the denotation of the word.

original: naitad vyaktiḥ śabdavācyeti kiṃ tvākṛtiḥ padārtha iti vi jñāyate /
analyzed: na etat vyaktiḥ śabda vācyā iti kim tu ākṛtiḥ padārthaḥ iti jñāyate
translated: To this it is said: This is not that the Individual is denoted by the word, but rather the Universal is known to be the meaning of the word.

original: śyenacitaṃ cinvīteti śravaṇādana hi śyenavyaktiṃ cayanena kuryyād ākṛtiṃ veti vākyārthī/
analyzed: śyena citam cinvīta iti hi śyena vyaktim cayanena kuryyāt ākṛtim vā iti vākya arthī
translated: One should pile up the altar in the shape of a hawk - this is heard. For one cannot make an individual hawk by piling up, or a form, is the meaning of the sentence.

analyzed: syātām
translated: They could be.

analyzed: yāvat iṣṭakā ādiḥ karttum aśakya tvāt snāyu ādibhiḥ api anirvṛtteḥ iṣṭakā bādhāt cyena vyaktaḥ prayojana kalpanā cinoteḥ a mukhya artha tvāt
translated: As long as the brick etc. are mostly incapable of being made, and are not accomplished even by sinews etc., and because of the contradiction of the bricks, the individual hawk is imagined to be the purpose. Because piling up is the primary meaning.

analyzed: smṛti parityāga prasaṅgāt ca
translated: And because of the consequence of abandoning the smrti that says the fire named after the action.

analyzed: cayanena śyena vyaktim kuryyāt iti evam tāvat na upapadyate
translated: Thus, it is not possible to say one should make an individual hawk by piling up.

original: tathā ''kṛterapoṣṭakābhiḥ kartumaśakyatvāddai vanirmitatvātprayojanakalpanāccinotera yathārthatvaprasaṅgātsmṛtibādhāccākṛtiṃ kuryyādityapi nopapadyate /
analyzed: tathā kṛteḥ apoṣṭakābhiḥ kartum aśakya tvāt dai va nirmita tvāt prayojana kalpanāt cinoteḥ a yathārtha tva prasaṅgāt smṛti bādhāt ca ākṛtim kuryyāt iti api nā upapadyate
translated: Similarly, because a form is incapable of being made by bricks, because it is divinely created, and because of the imagination of a purpose, it follows that piling up is the primary meaning. And because of the contradiction of smrti, it is also not possible to say one should make a form.

analyzed: citam agni sthannam cayanena nirvarttayet iti vākya arthaḥ
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that one should accomplish the fire altar in the shape of a hawk by piling up, by the method of elimination.

original: tatava yayā kayā ciccyenavyaktyā sadṛśasyāgneśvetu maśakyatvātsarvaṃ vyakti sādṛśyāsaṃbhavādatītānāgatavyakti sādṛśyānupapatteśca śyenākṛtisādṛśyasaṃpattisaṃbhavāccākṛtiḥ śavdārtha iti niścīyate
analyzed: yayā kayā cit cyena vyaktyā sadṛśasya agneḥ vetu maśakya tvāt sarvam vyakti sādṛśya asaṃbhavāt atīta anāgata vyakti sādṛśya anupapatteḥ ca śyena ākṛti sādṛśya saṃpatti saṃbhavāt ca ākṛtiḥ śavda arthaḥ iti niścīyate
translated: Therefore, since it is impossible to connect any particular hawk with all individuals, and since similarity is impossible for all individuals, and since similarity of past and future individuals is not possible, and since the attainment of similarity in the form of a hawk is possible, it is ascertained that the form is the meaning of the word.

analyzed: pūrvam sāmānya vijñānāt citra buddheḥ anubhavāt
translated: From the prior cognition of the universal, from the experience of the variegated cognition,

analyzed: gām ānaya iti vākyāt ca yathā ruci parigrahāt
translated: and from the sentence bring the cow, just as by the acceptance of preference,

analyzed: tasmāt ākṛti paśceṣyā cammana ādi saṃbhavāt ākṛtiḥ eva śabda arthaḥ iti siddham tantravārtike
translated: Therefore, since the form is possible in the injunction one should sacrifice with the Darśa and Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices, it is established that the form alone is the meaning of the word, in the Tantra-vārtika.

original: uktaṃ samānāyaidamarthya tasmātsarvaṃ ta dartha syāt
analyzed: uktam samānāya edamarthya tasmāt sarvam syāt
translated: It is said that this has the same purpose as the statement, therefore everything should have that meaning.

original: evaṃ smṛtisahitasya vedasya prāmāṇye siddhe 'dhunā vākyārthavyākhyānāvasare satyaparisamāpyaiva pramāṇalakṣaṇa kena saṃbandhena nāmadheyacintāyāḥ prastāvaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: evam smṛti sahitasya vedasya prāmāṇye siddhe dhunā vākya artha vyākhyāna avasare satya parisamāpya eva pramāṇa lakṣaṇa kena saṃbandhena nāmadheya cintāyāḥ prastāvaḥ kriyate
translated: Thus, when the authoritativeness of the Veda along with the Smṛti is established, now at the time of explaining the meaning of the sentence, having completed the discussion of truth, the topic of the consideration of names is taken up in connection with the definition of means of knowledge.

analyzed: ke cittāvadāḥ
translated: Some say this much.

original: kimuhnidādayo guṇasya pramāṇam / uta kriyāṇāmeva nāmadheyatveneti /
analyzed: kim uhnid ādayaḥ guṇasya pramāṇam uta kriyāṇām eva nāmadheya tvena iti
translated: Are words like huṃ etc. the means of knowing the quality, or are they names only of actions?

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

original: evaṃ sati hi samastameva śāstraṃ pramāṇanjayaṇādabhinnaṃ syāt /
analyzed: evam sati hi samastam eva śāstram pramāṇanjayaṇāt abhinnam syāt
translated: For if this were so, then the entire scripture would be non-different from the injunctions.

analyzed: sarvatra ha uta tat vicāryate kim idam vākyam asya arthasya pramāṇam uta anyasya iti
translated: For everywhere it is considered whether this sentence is the means of knowing this meaning or some other.

original: ye 'pi caite he api sūtre pūrvottarapakṣau parikalpyaikādhikaraṇatvena vyācakṣate tairapyuktaṃ samāmnāyaidamarthya mi tyanena sūtreṇa kaḥ siddhāntānabhipretaḥ pūrvapaścānuguṇo 'rtho vidhīyataiti vaktavyam/
analyzed: ye ca ete he api sūtre pūrva uttara pakṣau parikalpya eka adhikaraṇa tvena vyācakṣate taiḥ api uktam samāmnāya aidamarthyam i ti anena sūtreṇa kaḥ siddhānta anabhipretaḥ pūrva paśca anuguṇaḥ rthaḥ vidhīyate iti vaktavyam
translated: And even those who explain these aphorisms by assuming a prima facie view and a final view as one topic, by them also it must be said that by this aphorism the purpose of the recitation what meaning is stated that is favorable to the conclusion not accepted before.

analyzed: na yukta edamarthya antarbhāva vacanam udbhida ādīnām aniṣṭam
translated: The statement that the Udbhid and others are included in the purpose is not proper.

analyzed: tasmāt iyoḥ api adhikaraṇayoḥ anu mita pūrva pañcayoḥ uttara pañca sūtra dvayam etat iti vyākhyeyam
translated: Therefore, these two sections should be explained as the two subsequent aphorisms of the two preceding sections that have been inferred.

original: tatra prathamaṃ tāvadudbhidādīnudāhṛtya saṃdehaḥ kriyate / kimate kaṃ cidvameṃ pratyupayogaṃ gacchanti / uta neti /
analyzed: tatra prathamam tāvat udbhida ādīn udāhṛtya saṃdehaḥ kriyate kim ate kam cit vamem pratyupayogam gacchanti uta na iti
translated: There, first of all, having cited the Udbhid and others, doubt is created: Do they serve some purpose for anyone, or not?

analyzed: kim tāvat prāptam
translated: What is the prima facie view?

analyzed: na āyasya kriyā artha tvāt iti ānarthakyam
translated: Because they serve the purpose of an act, they are meaningless.

analyzed: āha ca
translated: And it is said:

analyzed: nahote vidhi ādiṣu antarbhavanti
translated: They are not included in injunctions and so on.

analyzed: sādhya sādhana itikartavya anabhidhāyi tvāt tāvat codanā bāhya tvam stuti buddhi abhāvāt arthavāda atirekaḥ
translated: Because they do not enjoin what is to be accomplished, the means of accomplishing it, or what is to be done, they are outside the injunctions. Because there is no conception of praise, they are redundant with Arthavada passages.

analyzed: karma aṅga bhūta evaṃsaṃjñaka prakāśayitavya artha abhāvāt mantra kārya nivṛttiḥ
translated: Because there is no such object to be revealed that would be an auxiliary to the ritual, the mantra is ineffective.

analyzed: na ca anyat veda prayojanam asti iti apramāṇam evaṃjātīyakāḥ iti
translated: And there is no other purpose of the Veda, so those of this type are not valid means of knowledge.

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: To this we reply:

original: yadā tadarthatrayānyatamārthamiti sthitaṃ tadā vicāraḥ kimarthamiti/
analyzed: yadā tad artha traya anyatama artham iti sthitam tadā vicāraḥ kimartham iti
translated: When it is established that they have the purpose of one of the three meanings of that [Veda], then the consideration is: for what purpose?

analyzed: na tāvat arthavāda tvam vākyaśeṣa tva abhāvāt
translated: First, they cannot be Arthavada passages, because they are not supplementary to an injunction.

original: kathaṃ punarayaṃ na vākyaśeṣo yāvatā vāyurvai kṣepiṣṭhetyādivadekavākyatā 'vagamyate /
analyzed: katham punar ayam na vākyaśeṣaḥ yāvatā vāyuḥ vai kṣepiṣṭhā ityādi vat ekavākyatā vagamyate
translated: But how is this not a supplementary passage, since it is understood to be a single sentence like Vayu is the swiftest?

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: That is not so.

original: vidhātavyasya hi yaḥ śeṣaḥ so 'rthavādaḥ /🔽ayaṃ tu vidhyuddeśādeva nātiricyataityavākyaśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: vidhātavyasya hi yaḥ śeṣaḥ saḥ arthavādaḥ  ayam tu vidhi uddeśāt eva na atiricyate iti a vākyaśeṣaḥ
translated: For what is a supplement to what is to be enjoined is an Arthavada passage.🔽But this does not go beyond the injunctive statement itself, so it is not a supplementary passage.

analyzed: tad saṃbhavinaḥ ca stuti upayogi tvam na yujyate iti uktam audumbara adhikaraṇe
translated: And it has been said in the section on the udumbara that it is not proper for it to be useful for praise, which is possible for it.

analyzed: na ca eka padena stutiḥ dṛṣṭā
translated: And praise is not seen to be done by a single word.

analyzed: na ced ica tām pratipadyāmahe
translated: And we do not understand it to be so.

original: yadapyuṅgedanaṃ paśūnāmanena kriyataityevaṃ prāśastyaṃ kalpyeta tadapi tṛtīyāntasamudāyāśrayabalavattarakaraṇatvaprasiddhyā bādhyate /
analyzed: yat api uṅga idanam paśūnām anena kriyate eti evam prāśastyam kalpyeta tat api tṛtīyā anta samudāya āśraya balavattara karaṇa tva prasiddhyā bādhyate
translated: And even if the praise were assumed to be in the form 'by this the killing of animals is done', that is set aside by the well-known stronger instrumentality based on the compound ending in the instrumental case.

original: anyathā hi prātipadikaprādhānyādā vāyurvai kṣepiṣṭhetivatprathameva prāyojyata /
analyzed: anyathā hi prātipadika prādhānyāt ā vāyuḥ vai kṣepiṣṭhā iti vat prathamā eva prāyojyata
translated: For otherwise, due to the primacy of the nominal stem, it would be employed in the first case itself, like 'vāyuḥ vai kṣepisthaḥ'.

analyzed: na ca asya mantra tvam tādrapyeṇa apratīteḥ
translated: And this is not a mantra, because it is not recognized as such.

analyzed: adhyetu asmaraṇa abhāvāt ca  na ca eka pada tvāt mākāṅkṣa tvam karaṇa pratītyā vā smāraka tvam
translated: And because it is not remembered as such.🔽And it is not that it is incomplete and requires something else, or that it is a reminder by the cognition of an instrument.

analyzed: na ca etad abhidheyaḥ kaścid prayoga samavāyī arthaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And no object connected with its usage is seen to be denoted by this.

analyzed: na ca asamaveta prakāśane karma aṅga tvam
translated: And there is no subsidiary nature to an action in the illumination of what is not connected.

analyzed: māntravarṇika dravya kalpanāyām api gauravam
translated: Even if a substance mentioned in the mantra is assumed, there is complexity.

original: na cāsya sūktavākavadviniyojikā śrutirasti yena māntravarṇikadravyakalpanā syāt /
analyzed: na ca asya sūktavāka vat viniyojikā śrutiḥ asti yena māntravarṇika dravya kalpanā syāt
translated: And this does not have a Vedic injunction like the Suktavaka, by which there could be an assumption of a substance mentioned in the mantra.

analyzed: na ca asya rūpam
translated: And this does not have a form connected with usage.

original: ataścāvi niyuktatvādiṣe tvādivadapi nādhyāhāreṇa nirākāṅkṣīkṛtya pra yogaḥ /
analyzed: atas ca avi niyukta tvāt iṣe tu ādi vat api na adhyāhāreṇa nirākāṅkṣīkṛtya pra yogaḥ
translated: And therefore, because it is not enjoined, like 'iṣe tvā', it is not employed by supplying what is required by ellipsis.

analyzed: sphuṭam ca brāhmaṇena eka vākya tvam iti amantra tvam
translated: And it is clear that it forms a single sentence with the Brāhmaṇa, so it is not a mantra.

analyzed: tasmāt idhi uddeśa antargatasya eva uttara adhikaraṇena vicāryate guṇa vidhiḥ nāmadheyam iti
translated: Therefore, what is included in the injunction to kindle is considered in the subsequent section as to whether it is an injunction of a quality or a name.

analyzed: tatra tāvat
translated: Regarding that, first of all,

analyzed: prātipadikam tāvat udbhedana samarthe dravye khanitra ādi avayava prasiddhyā pravartate
translated: the nominal stem operates on a substance capable of digging, like a spade, by the well-known meaning of its parts.

analyzed: na ca samudāyaḥ ṛtha antara vācī loke prasiddhaḥ
translated: And a collection is not well-known in the world to denote a different meaning.

original: na ca lokādanavagato 'rtho vedādavagamyate saṃvandhasya śāstrā hetutvāt /
analyzed: na ca lokāt anavagataḥ  rthaḥ vedāt avagamyate saṃvandhasya śāstrā hetu tvāt
translated: And a meaning not understood from the world is not understood from the Veda, because the connection is brought about by the scriptures.

original: tṛtīyāpi ca karaṇavācinī / kriyāyāśca śaktimad dravyaṃ tadādhārā vā śaktiḥ karaṇaṃ / tenodbhitsādhanako yāgo 'vagamyate /
analyzed: tṛtīyā api ca karaṇa vācinī kriyāyāḥ ca śaktimat dravyam tad ādhārā vā śaktiḥ karaṇam tena udbhid sādhanakaḥ yāgaḥ avagamyate
translated: And the instrumental case also denotes an instrument. And the instrument is either a powerful substance or the power based on that. Therefore, a sacrifice with the udbhid as its means is understood.

original: na ca yāgasyodbhittvaṃ karaṇatvaṃ vā kva citprasiddham /
analyzed: na ca yāgasya udbhid tvam karaṇa tvam vā kva cit prasiddham
translated: And nowhere is the sacrifice well-known as having the nature of udbhid or as an instrument.

original: arthavattvātpravṛttiviśeṣakaratvaṃ vidhāyakositpadapuruṣāṇāṃ pravṛttau viśeṣo 'nyathā hyanuccaritasamaiva pravṛttireṣāṃ syāt /
analyzed: arthavat tvāt pravṛtti viśeṣa kara tvam vidhāyaka usit pada puruṣāṇām pravṛttau viśeṣaḥ nyathā hi anuccarita samā eva pravṛttiḥ eṣām syāt
translated: Because it has meaning, the words and persons in the injunction make a difference in activity. Otherwise, their activity would be the same as if they were not uttered.

original: atha vā prasiddhatvāguṇavidhirarthavattvamabhidheyavattvaṃ nāmadheyatve tvartho na vijñāyataiti yojyate /
analyzed: atha vā prasiddha tvāt guṇa vidhiḥ arthavat tvam abhidheyavat tvam nāmadheya tve tu arthaḥ na vijñāyate eti yojyate
translated: Or else, the connection may be made thus: The injunction of a quality is meaningful, i.e., having a denotation, but in the case of a name, the meaning is not known.

original: atha vā bhedenārthavattvaṃ hetuḥ / uṅgitpadasya yajitaḥ phalāntaratvāt tataśca vidhipuruṣayoḥ pravṛtiviśeṣa iti vāccam /
analyzed: atha vā bhedena arthavat tvam hetuḥ uṅgit padasya yajitaḥ phala antara tvāt tatas ca vidhi puruṣayoḥ pravṛti viśeṣaḥ iti
translated: Or else, the meaningfulness is the reason for the difference, because the word 'ungit' has a different result from 'yagit', and from that there is a special activity of the enjoined person and the agent.

original: nanu nāmadheyamapi ṛtuṃ viśiṃṣadarthavatpravṛttiviśeṣakaraṃ ca syāt /
analyzed: nanu nāmadheyam api ṛtum viśiṃṣat arthavat pravṛtti viśeṣa karam ca syāt
translated: But even a name, distinguishing the sacrifice, would be meaningful and cause a special activity.

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: yadā tāvadvātunaiva lakṣaṇayā vidhiviṣayatvayogyatvādyāga viśe ṣaḥ pratipādyate tadā kimaparaṃ tatra nāma kariṣyati /🔽atha sāprathamādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yadā tāvat vātunā eva lakṣaṇayā vidhi viṣaya tva yogya tvāt yāga viśe ṣaḥ pratipādyate tadā kim aparam tatra nāma kariṣyati  atha sā aprathama adhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda
translated: When the sacrifice is first indicated by the sacrifice itself through indication, as being fit to be the content of the injunction, then what else will the name do there?

original: mānyamātramabhidhīyate tatastasyāniṣṭamevaitannāmetyasaṃbaddhaṃ siddhatvādeva ca viśeṣyasya na nāmadheyaṃ vidhāyiṣyataiti vacyati /
analyzed: mānya mātram abhidhīyate tatas tasya aniṣṭam eva etat nāma iti asaṃbaddham siddha tvāt eva ca viśeṣyasya na nāmadheyam vidhāyiṣyate eti
translated: Now, if only the general is denoted, then this is undesirable for it, so it is unconnected. And because the qualified is already established, the name will not enjoin it, this is stated.

original: yadā ca kenāpi prakāraṇodbhidādīnāṃ viśeṣavacanatvaṃ tadā tadatyantāvinābhūtasāmānyavacanatvena yajeranarthakatvam/
analyzed: yadā ca kena api prakāraṇā udbhida ādīnām viśeṣa vacana tvam tadā tad atyanta avinābhūta sāmānya vacana tvena yajeḥ anarthaka tvam
translated: And when by any means the words 'udbhid' etc. are taken as denoting particulars, then the word 'yajeta' becomes meaningless by denoting the general which is absolutely inseparable from that.

analyzed: lāghavam ca vidheḥ gu vidhau bhaviṣyati
translated: And lightness will be in the injunction of the subsidiary.

analyzed: yāga anuvādāt
translated: Because of the restatement of the sacrifice.

original: yadyevaṃ guṇāścitatvādidhiśakterna tarhi karma vidhīyate / tathā ca vihite karmaṇi kasya guṇo vidhīyataityānarthakyam /
analyzed: yadi evam guṇāḥ cita tvāt idhi śakteḥ na tarhi karma vidhīyate tathā ca vihite karmaṇi kasya guṇaḥ vidhīyate iti ānarthakyam
translated: If it is so, then the qualities like whiteness are not capable of enjoining the action. And in that case, when the action has been enjoined, whose subsidiary is enjoined? So there is meaninglessness.

analyzed: ata
translated: For that reason.

analyzed: prakṛtau jyotiṣṭomaḥ iti
translated: In the archetype, it is the Jyotiṣṭoma.

original: nanu guṇavidhipace jyotiṣṭomenetyasyāpi tatparatvādavihitameva karma gatyabhāvādidamekaṃ karmavidhānaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nanu guṇa vidhi pace jyotiṣṭomena iti asya api tad para tvāt avihitam eva karma gati abhāvāt idam ekam karma vidhānam bhaviṣyati
translated: But in the case of the injunction of the subsidiary, since the words 'with the Jyotiṣṭoma' also denote that, the action is not enjoined. And in that case, due to the absence of any other way, this alone will be the injunction of the action.

original: tayāvṛtte ca vidhāyake ca guṇasya vidhātumaśakyatvād jyotiṣṭomapadamevaikaṃ nāmadheyam /
analyzed: tayā āvṛtte ca vidhāyake ca guṇasya vidhātum aśakya tvāt jyotiṣṭoma padam eva ekam nāmadheyam
translated: And when the injunctive word has been repeated, it is not possible to enjoin the subsidiary. Therefore, the word 'Jyotiṣṭoma' alone is the name.

original: athavā tadekaṃ guṇaviśiṣṭaṃ karmavidhānamitarāṇi karmānuvādena guṇavidhānāni /
analyzed: athavā tat ekam guṇa viśiṣṭam karma vidhānam itarāṇi karma anuvādena guṇa vidhānāni
translated: Or, that alone is the injunction of the action qualified by the subsidiary. The others are injunctions of the subsidiary by restating the action.

original: nanvevaṃ sati sarvā ekāhāhīnasatracodanā jyotiṣṭomasyaiva guṇavidhidvāreṇa prakaraṇādanatiriteti karmāntarābhāvānna jyotiṣṭomaḥ kasya citprakṛtiriti ta cchabdena nābhidhātavyaḥ /
analyzed: nanu evam sati sarvāḥ ekāhāhīna satra codanā jyotiṣṭomasya eva guṇa vidhi dvāreṇa prakaraṇāt anatiritā iti karma antara abhāvāt na jyotiṣṭomaḥ kasya cit prakṛtiḥ iti tad śabdena na abhidhātavyaḥ
translated: If that is so, then all the injunctions of the one-day and the Ahargana sacrifices are subordinate to the Jyotistoma, by the door of the injunction of its accessories, and are not separate from it. Thus there being no other sacrifice, the Jyotistoma cannot be the archetype of anything, and therefore cannot be denoted by the word 'tat'.

analyzed: sidvānta abhiprāyeṇa ati ke cit
translated: Some people have said this with the intention of establishing their conclusion.

original: athavā prakriyataiti prakṛtiḥ / prakṛte jyotiṣṭoma ityarthaḥ /🔽atha vā athaiṣa jyotirityevamādīnāṃ karaṇavibhaktyākhyāta saṃsparśābhāvādguṇavidhitvānupapattere kāntena bhedakatayā karmanāmatvaṃ tadapecayā ca jyotiṣṭomaḥ prakṛtiḥ /
analyzed: athavā prakriyate eti prakṛtiḥ prakṛte jyotiṣṭomaḥ iti arthaḥ  atha vai atha eṣa jyotiḥ iti evamādīnām karaṇa vibhakti ākhyāta saṃsparśa abhāvāt guṇa vidhi tva anupapatteḥ e kāntena bhedaka tayā karma nāma tvam tad apecayā ca jyotiṣṭomaḥ prakṛtiḥ
translated: Or, that which is produced is the archetype. The meaning is that the Jyotistoma is the archetype.🔽Or, because the passages beginning with 'Now this light' do not come in contact with verbs having the instrumental case, and because it is not possible for them to be injunctions of accessories, they are names of sacrifices, distinguishing them from other sacrifices, and the Jyotistoma is the archetype in relation to them.

original: nanūtpattivākya śiṣṭena somena jyotiṣṭomena vāvarodhājjyotiṣṭome guṇāntara vidhānamayuktam /
analyzed: nanu utpatti vākya śiṣṭena somena jyotiṣṭomena vā avarodhāt jyotiṣṭome guṇa antara vidhānam ayuktam
translated: But because the Jyotistoma is restricted by the Soma mentioned in the originative injunction, it is not proper to enjoin another accessory in the Jyotistoma.

analyzed: kāmya tvāt udbhida ādayaḥ bādhakāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: The Udbhid and other sacrifices will be the overriders, because they are optional.

analyzed: nitye prayoga ca pūrva guṇasya arthavat tā
translated: And in the case of a compulsory performance, the earlier accessory has a purpose.

original: atha vā viśiṣṭavihitamapi karma svarūpamātraṃ niṣkṛṣya guṇāntare vihitaṃ naiautpattikādviśiṣyate /
analyzed: atha vā viśiṣṭa vihitam api karma svarūpa mātram niṣkṛṣya guṇa antare vihitam na aiautpattikāt viśiṣyate
translated: Or, even if the enjoined action is qualified, by extracting the mere form and enjoining it with another quality, it is not distinguished from the natural one.

analyzed: anyathā ga ti asaṃbhava ādi kalpaḥ iti manyate
translated: Otherwise, it is considered to be an assumption due to the impossibility of going.

original: phalaṃ prati tāvadvidhīyamāne parapadasaṃbandha vidhānaṃ vyavahitakalpanā dhātoḥ pārārthyamai/tpattikasomabādhaḥ /
analyzed: phalam prati tāvat vidhīyamāne para pada saṃbandha vidhānam vyavahita kalpanā dhātoḥ
translated: As for the result, when it is being enjoined, the injunction of the connection with another word is an assumption of an indirect relation, the purpose of the root is to be for another, and there is the contradiction of the natural soma.

original: anadanīyana ca khanitrādinā 'tyantāprasiddhena yāga iti doṣāstathā yāgaṃ prati guṇavidhau phalapadānarthakyam /
analyzed: ca khanitra ādinā tyanta aprasiddhena yāgaḥ iti doṣāḥ tathā yāgam prati guṇa vidhau phala pada ānarthakyam
translated: And it is a fault to say that the sacrifice is not to be done with a spade etc. which is utterly unknown. Similarly, in the injunction of a quality with respect to the sacrifice, the word denoting the result is meaningless.

analyzed: sārvakāmya prāpta jyotiṣṭoma viśeṣaṇa tve vākya bhedaḥ
translated: Or, if it is a qualification of the Jyotiṣṭoma obtained by the attainment of all desires, there is split of the sentence.

analyzed: pratyaya vyāpāra viprakṛṣṭa tā dhātu pārārthya ānadanīya yāga soma bādha vikalpāḥ ca atyanta ayuktāḥ
translated: And the remoteness from the operation of the suffix, the purpose of the root being for another, the contradiction of the sacrifice not to be done and the soma, and the alternatives are utterly unreasonable.

original: tathā viśiṣṭa vidhā sarvapārārghya maneka vidhiśaktikalpanā /
analyzed: tathā
translated: Similarly, in the injunction of the qualified, all purposefulness, the assumption of the power of multiple injunctions,

analyzed: matu artha lakṣaṇa āgamyamāna sāmānādhikaraṇya tyāgaḥ nadanīya yāgaḥ ca iti doṣāḥ
translated: the abandonment of the co-reference understood by implication through the meaning of the word, and the sacrifice not to be done - these are the faults.

analyzed: tasmāt na guṇa vidhiḥ tat darśayati
translated: Therefore, it is not an injunction of a quality. It shows that.

analyzed: itarathā śrutiḥ udbhid ādīn tadvataḥ lāyet
translated: Otherwise, the Vedic text would mention the Udbhid etc. and would imply their possessor.

analyzed: vayantī jāyet iti vā granthaḥ
translated: Or the text would be one should produce by the sacrifice.

analyzed: prātipadika sāmarthya mukkā vibhakti saṃbandhāt aṇi etat eva avagamyate iti darśayati
translated: He shows that apart from the potency of the nominal stem, this alone is understood from the connection with the case ending.

analyzed: yāgena kuryāt ityādinā
translated: By one should do with the sacrifice and so on.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: Moreover,

original: yatkaraṇābhidhāyinyā tṛtīyayetyevamādiṣu kārakāṇāṃ vibhatyarthatvābhyupagamātkathaṃ karaṇavācino hi prātipadikādityuccate /
analyzed: yat karaṇa abhidhāyinyā tṛtīyayā iti evamādiṣu kārakāṇām vibhati artha tva abhyupagamāt katham karaṇa vācinaḥ hi prātipadikāt iti uccate
translated: since it is accepted that in expressions like by the third case which denotes the instrument the case endings express the meaning of the case, how is it said that only from the nominal stem which denotes the instrument?

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: karaṇa āśraya vācinaḥ hi iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that it denotes the substratum of the instrument.

original: atha vā karaṇaśabdo yādṛśamarthaṃ bravīti tādṛśasya prātipadikaṃ vācakameva /
analyzed: atha vā karaṇa śabdaḥ yādṛśam artham bravīti tādṛśasya prātipadikam vācakam eva
translated: Or, the nominal stem is the denoter of that kind of meaning which the word instrument expresses.

original: kṛdantena hi kāraka viśiṣṭaṃ dravyamevocyate na vibhaktivaniṣkṛṭā śaktiḥ /
analyzed: kṛt antena hi kāraka viśiṣṭam dravyam eva ucyate na śaktiḥ
translated: For by a nominal affix, only a substance qualified by a case is denoted, not the potency extracted by the case ending.

original: tathā ca karaṇaṃ karaṇena karaṇāyeti ca kārakāntarayogo dṛśyate /
analyzed: tathā ca karaṇam karaṇena karaṇāya iti ca kāraka antara yogaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And thus, in expressions like the instrument by the instrument for the sake of the instrument, the connection with another case is seen.

original: anyathā hi vibhaktyabhihitenaivai kena kāra keṇa vaśīkārānna dravyaṃ kārakāntarayogaṃ pratipadyeta /
analyzed: anyathā hi vibhakti abhihitena eva e kena kāra keṇa vaśīkārāt na dravyam kāraka antara yogam pratipadyeta
translated: Otherwise, since the substance would be controlled by the case expressed by the case ending alone, it would not enter into connection with another case.

analyzed: śakteḥ tu śakti antaram na asti eva
translated: But for a power, there is no other power at all.

analyzed: tasmāt śakti upasarjana dravya vacana tvāt kṛt antānām upapannam karaṇa śabda artha vāci tvam prātipadikasya
translated: Therefore, because the nominal stems denote substances qualified by powers, it is appropriate that they express the meaning of instrumental case words.

original: tenaitaduktaṃ bhavati /🔽yadasmin vākye karaṇaṃ tadācinaḥ prātipadikāttṛtīyayotpattavyaṃ yāgaścātra phalabhāvanāyāḥ karaṇaṃ na dravyamiti vakṣyati /
analyzed: tena etat uktam bhavati  yat asmin vākye karaṇam prātipadikāt tṛtīyayā utpattavyam yāgaḥ ca atra phala bhāvanāyāḥ karaṇam na dravyam iti vakṣyati
translated: By this it is said:🔽In this sentence, the instrument should be formed from the nominal stem in the third case, and the sacrifice is the instrument of the result-producing injunction, not the substance. He will say that.

original: taca yadyudvitpadaṃ yāgavacanamevaṃ tṛtīyāntaṃ sadekavākyatāṃ yātvarthāntaravacanatve tvasaṃbaddhaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tat ca yadi udvit padam yāga vacanam evam tṛtīyā antam sat ekavākyatām yātu artha antara vacana tve tu asaṃbaddham syāt
translated: And that is a compound word denoting sacrifice, then let it form a single sentence with the word ending in the third case. But if it denotes a different meaning, it would be unconnected.

analyzed: nanu ca
translated: But is it not so?

original: yathaiva brohibhiryajeta somena yajetetyādīnāṃ karaṇabhūtayā gaikavākyatve sati tṛtīyāntatvaṃ vaiyadhikaraṇyepyavirudvamevamicāpīti /
analyzed: yathā eva brohibhiḥ yajeta somena yajeta ityādīnām karaṇa bhūta yā ga eka vākya tve sati tṛtīyā anta tvam vaiyadhikaraṇye pi avirudvam evam i cā api iti
translated: Just as in the sentences One should sacrifice with barley, One should sacrifice with soma, etc., the third case ending is not contradictory even in the absence of co-reference, when they form a single sentence with the sacrifice which is the instrument, in the same way it is here also.

analyzed: chaṭhaḥ iti
translated: The sixth means:

analyzed: cirantana taḍāga uda ka ācchādita carita dravya mucca
translated: The substance whose movement is covered by the mud of an old pond.

original: yathā tadutmāryamāṇamapi svacchandataḥ punaḥpunarudakaṃ chādayatye vaṃ yonyopi svacchandavyavacāraḥ sa chaṭha iti prasiddhaḥ /
analyzed: yathā tat utmāryamāṇam api sva chandataḥ punar punar udakam chādayati e vam sva chanda vyavacāraḥ sa chaṭhaḥ iti prasiddhaḥ
translated: Just as when the water is being churned, it again and again covers itself voluntarily, in the same way, other words also voluntarily form compounds. This is well-known as the sixth case.

analyzed: tat ucyate
translated: This is said:

original: śrīhyādayo hyatyantarūḍhāste svārthamaparityajantaḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyamapratipadyamānā gatyantarābhāvādguṇaviṣayo vijñāyante /
analyzed: śrīhi ādayaḥ hi atyanta rūḍhāḥ te svārtham a parityajantaḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyam a pratipadyamānāḥ gati antara abhāvāt guṇa viṣayaḥ vijñāyante
translated: Śrī, Hā, etc. are extremely well-known. Not abandoning their own meaning and not being in apposition, due to the absence of any other way, they are understood to be in the quality case.

original: ye punarudbhidādayo yaugikāsteṣāṃ yenaiva prakāreṇa yatnena dravyavacanatvaṃ tenaiva karmavacanatvamapyupapadyataiti pratyaśaprasidvānudāsīnāyāmanu mānenāpyajñānasaṃśayavyudāsa karaṇaṃ na duṣyati /
analyzed: ye punar udbhida ādayaḥ yaugikāḥ teṣām yena eva prakāreṇa yatnena dravya vacana tvam tena eva karma vacana tvam api upapadyate eti pratyaśa prasidva anudāsīnāyām anu mānena api ajñāna saṃśaya vyudāsa karaṇam na duṣyati
translated: But those that are etymological, like udbhid, by the same method and effort by which they are words for substances, by that same method they are also words for actions. Thus, in the absence of well-known neutrality, the removal of ignorance and doubt by inference is not faulty.

analyzed: sarva śabda artha avadhāraṇe hi ayam abhyupāyaḥ yat prasiddha sāmānādhikaraṇyam nāma
translated: For in the determination of the meaning of all words, this is the means: namely, being in apposition.

original: pradhānaṃ ca karaṇatvaṃ yāge labdhātmakaṃ śaknoti prātipadikamātmaviṣayamāpādayitum /
analyzed: pradhānam ca karaṇa tvam yāge labdha ātmakam śaknoti prātipadikam ātma viṣayam āpādayitum
translated: And the primary instrumentality, having attained its nature in the sacrifice, is able to bring about the nominal stem as its object.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

original: tvatpate hyavaśyaṃ kā cidvibhaktyarthepi pratyayasya vidhiśaktiḥ kalpyā syāt /
analyzed: tvad pate hi avaśyam kā cit vibhakti arthe pi pratyayasya vidhi śaktiḥ kalpyā syāt
translated: For, in the case of your view, it would be necessary to assume an injunctive potency of the affix even in the case of the nominal affix.

analyzed: tasmāt avayava dvāreṇa asti karmaṇi api prasiddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, even in the case of an action, there is well-known usage through the component parts.

analyzed: jyotiṣṭoma ādeḥ api sva phala udbhedana kāri tvāt etad nāma prasaṅgaḥ iti ce t
translated: If it is argued that the Jyotiṣṭoma and others would also come to have this name because they bring about the manifestation of their own fruit,

analyzed: na
translated: that is not so.

analyzed: sāmānādhikaraṇya avadhārita viṣaya viśeṣasya avayavān ca ākhyānāt
translated: Because the particular object determined by the co-reference is mentioned by the component parts.

analyzed: na ca asya jyotiṣṭoma ādibhiḥ samabhivyāhāraḥ usti
translated: And this is not mentioned along with the Jyotiṣṭoma and others.

original: atha vārthāpattivaśenaita dviśeṣaviṣayamevodbhedanaṃ nimittaṃ / na cānyatra tadastīti vyavasthā /
analyzed: atha vā arthāpatti vaśena etat dviśeṣa viṣayam evā udbhedanam nimittam na ca anyatra tat asti iti vyavasthā
translated: Or, by the force of presumption, the manifestation is the cause only in regard to that particular object, and it is not found elsewhere, so the determination is made.

analyzed: yathā sāsnādimat gata gamana viśeṣa nimitta tvam
translated: Just as the particular going in the one having dewlaps and so on will be enjoined.

original: saṃjñāsaṃjñisaṃbandha rūpeṇa vṛdvirā daijityādivadavidhānaṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyāvayavaprasidvibhyāṃ tatmiddheḥ /🔽nanu nāmaprathamādhyāyasya caturtha pāda /
analyzed: saṃjñā saṃjñi saṃbandha rūpeṇa daij ityādi vat avidhānam sāmānādhikaraṇya avayava prasidvibhyām  nanu nāma prathama adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: The वृद्धि is not an injunction in the form of the relation between the name and the named, like in the case of ऐजित्यादि, because of the determination by the co-reference and the well-known usage of the component parts.

analyzed: dheya arthaḥ na vidhīyate tad adhīna tvāt yāga viśeṣa siddheḥ
translated: But the object to be named is not enjoined, because the particular sacrifice is established as dependent on that.

original: iha hi yadyapi saṃjñāsaṃjñisāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ nāsti tathāpyātmarūpavyavacchinamevārthaṃ saṃjñā gamayatīti viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvānna bhidyate /
analyzed: iha hi yadi api saṃjñā saṃjñi sāmānādhikaraṇyam na asti tathā api ātma rūpa vyavacchinam eva artham saṃjñā gamayati iti viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvāt na bhidyate
translated: For, although here there is no co-reference of the name and the named, still the name conveys the object as distinguished from the form of the self, so there is no difference due to the relation of qualifier and qualified.

analyzed: nanu evam śabda svarūpa abhidhānam prasajyeta
translated: But in that case, it would follow that the form of the word itself is denoted.

analyzed: pratyakṣa avagata sva rūpa viśiṣṭa artha abhidhānāt aprasaṅgaḥ
translated: There is no such contingence, because the word denotes the object as qualified by a form that is perceived.

original: sarvatra hyagṛhītaviśeṣaṇā viśiṣṭabudvirna dṛṣṭā / na tvanabhihita viśeṣaṇā /
analyzed: sarvatra hi agṛhīta viśeṣaṇā viśiṣṭa budviḥ na dṛṣṭā na tu anabhihita viśeṣaṇā
translated: For everywhere, a cognition of the qualified is not seen without the qualifier being grasped, but not without the qualifier being expressed.

analyzed: na ca etāvatā śabda svarūpa āropa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And even so, there is no contingence of superimposing the form of the word.

analyzed: tad anurodhena vidyamānā atha bha viśeṣa udvaraṇāt iti uktam prāk
translated: It has been said before that the qualified is as it is in accordance with that, by the removal of the existing qualifier.

original: nāmnaiva caivamādīnāṃ prakṛtito bhado'nyathā hi tadanavacchinno yajirguṇaphancādyarthaṃ punaḥ śrutiḥ prakṛtigāmitvānnaiva karma bhindyāt /
analyzed: nāmnā eva ca evamādīnām prakṛtitaḥ hi tad anavacchinnaḥ punar śrutiḥ prakṛti gāmi tvāt na eva karma bhindyāt
translated: And in this way, for words like eva, the sense is different from the original, otherwise, the sacrifice not distinguished by that, for the sake of the subsidiary and the fruit, the repetition would not itself distinguish the action, because it goes to the original.

original: atha vā sarvanāmadheyeṣu kiṃ cidarthagatamapi viśeṣaṇamastītyaruṇaika cāyanyādivadeva viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyatā /
analyzed: atha vā sarvanāmadheyeṣu kim cit artha gatam api viśeṣaṇam asti iti aruṇa eka cāyanī ādi vat eva viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya tā
translated: Or, in all pronouns, there is some qualifier based on meaning, so there is the relation of qualifier and qualified, like in aruna and ekayana etc.

original: na ca yajyuccāraṇamantareṇāsya yāgaviśeṣanāmatvamiti na sāmānya syānarthakatvam /
analyzed: na ca yaji uccāraṇam antareṇa asya yāga viśeṣa nāma tvam iti na sāmānya sya anarthaka tvam
translated: And until the name of the sacrifice is mentioned, it cannot be known that the word is the name of a particular sacrifice.

original: parasparasaṃnidhānena hi nāmāpi yāgaviṣayaṃ yāgopyetadavacchinno na sāmānyamātraṃ prakṛto veti labhyate /
analyzed: paraspara saṃnidhānena hi nāma api yāga viṣayam na sāmānya mātram prakṛtaḥ vā iti labhyate
