analyzed: tatra api śeṣa śeṣi tvam prayojaka aprayojaka tvam kramaḥ ca bhinnānām bhavati iti na bheda lakṣaṇa a prāk ārabhyate
translated: Even there, since the relation of principal and secondary, the relation of being the motivator and the motivated, and the order, belong to different things, the definition of difference is not begun first.

original: tathā 'dhikāraḥ karmasvarūpe 'vadhārite tadyogyatayā śakyo nirūpayitumiti pañcāpi lakṣaṇāni pratīkṣate /
analyzed: tathā adhikāraḥ karma svarūpe vadhārite tad yogya tayā śakyaḥ nirūpayitum iti pañca api lakṣaṇāni pratīkṣate
translated: And authority, when the nature of the action is ascertained, can be determined by its eligibility, so all five definitions await it.

original: tathottaraḥ ṣaṭko 'tideśaviṣayatvā dupadeśajñānādhīnasiddhiḥ samastaḥ samastaṃ pūrvaṣaṭkamapekṣate /
analyzed: tathā uttaraḥ ṣaṭka utideśa viṣaya tvāt upadeśa jñāna adhīna siddhiḥ samastaḥ samastam pūrva ṣaṭkam apekṣate
translated: Similarly, the subsequent set of six, being dependent on the knowledge of the application, which is the subject of extension, requires the entire former set of six for its establishment.

analyzed: tatas ca pariśeṣa siddhaḥ yam bheda lakṣaṇasya sabandhaḥ iti atra ārabhyate
translated: And thus, this connection of the definition of difference is established by elimination, so it is begun here.

original: yadvidhaḥ karmabheda iti sādhanabhedopacārād vakṣyamāṇasūtrakramānurodhānnāmadheyaṃ saṃkhyānantaraṃ paṭhitavyaṃ sadanādarādante paṭhitam /
analyzed: yadvidhaḥ karma bhedaḥ iti sādhana bheda upacārāt vakṣyamāṇa sūtra krama anurodhāt nāmadheyam saṃkhyā anantaram paṭhitavyam sadana ādarāt ante paṭhitam
translated: The kind of difference in actions, which is figuratively called the difference in means, should be stated after number, in accordance with the order of the sūtras to be stated, but it is stated at the end out of disrespect.

original: itikaraṇo hetvarthaḥ ṣaḍvidhaḥ karmabheda etaiḥ kāraṇairiti yāvat /
analyzed: iti karaṇaḥ hetvarthaḥ ṣaḍvidhaḥ karma bhedaḥ etaiḥ kāraṇaiḥ iti yāvat
translated: The word iti has the meaning of reason, meaning that the difference in actions is of six kinds, for these reasons, up to this extent.

original: śratha vā karaṇe bhedaśabdaṃ vyutpādya sāmānādhikaraṇyenaiva śabdāntarādīni vyākhyeyāni saṃjñāśabdāntarayoḥ saṃkhyāguṇayoścāpaiaunaruktyaṃ svasthāne vacyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vā karaṇe bheda śabdam vyutpādya sāmānādhikaraṇyena eva śabda antara ādīni vyākhyeyāni saṃjñā śabda antarayoḥ saṃkhyā guṇayoḥ ca a paiaunaruktyam sva sthāne vacyāmaḥ
translated: Or else, having explained the word 'bheda' as a causative, we should explain 'śabda-antara' etc. by co-reference itself. We will explain the non-redundancy of the word 'saṃjñā' and 'śabda-antara' and the number and quality in their own place.

original: sarvatra caiṣāṃ bhinnaviṣayatvā śrutyā divasālacintā bhaviṣyatīti tadbhedapratipādanamātraṃ tātparyeṇa anyadupodvātaprasaktānuprasaktyādinā
analyzed: sarvatra ca eṣām śrutyā divasāla cintā bhaviṣyati iti tad bheda pratipādana mātram tātparyeṇa anyat upodvāta prasakta anuprasakti ādinā
translated: And in all cases, their difference of object will be inferred from the statement. Therefore, the mere teaching of their difference is the purport. Other things are brought up by the way through connection and association, etc.

original: yathedamevādhikaraṇaṃ prakṛtānuniṣpādyapūrva bhedānusāra sidhyartha mupohātatvena bhaviṣyati katara smātyadātphalena saṃbadhyamānādasarvabhedābhedāvanugantavyāviti /
analyzed: yathā idam eva adhikaraṇam bhaviṣyati katara sma atyadāt phalena saṃbadhyamānāt asarva bheda abhedau anugantavyau iti
translated: Just as this very section will be brought up by the way for the sake of establishing the difference of the unseen-before-now-produced-dharma that is related to the topic, thinking 'From which among these, when connected with the fruit, should the difference and non-difference be understood?'

original: yadā niravayavo vākyavākyārthī syātāṃ tataḥ kiṃ pratipadaṃ dharma ityādirasaṃbaddha eva vicāraḥ syādata /
analyzed: yadā niravayavaḥ vākya vākya arthī syātām tatas kim pratipadam dharmaḥ ityādiḥ asaṃbaddhaḥ eva vicāraḥ syāt atas
translated: When the sentence and sentence meaning are partless, then the consideration beginning with 'Is the dharma for each word?' would be irrelevant.

analyzed: vākye ca padānām atha u iti
translated: And in the sentence, the words are in order.

analyzed: atra api codyate
translated: Here too, it is objected:

original: yadi hi dharmasvarūpamabhidhīyeta tataḥ kiṃ padena padenoccataiti vicāro yujyate lākṣaṇike tvayuktaḥ
analyzed: yadi hi dharma svarūpam abhidhīyeta tatas kim padena padena uccatā eti vicāraḥ yujyate lākṣaṇike tu ayuktaḥ
translated: For if the nature of the dharma were being denoted, then the consideration what is denoted by each word? would be appropriate. But in the case of figurative [usage], it is inappropriate.

original: na cātra yo dharmaḥ sa kiṃ padena padenoccataityevaṃ vicāryate kiṃ tarhi yaḥ padena padenocyate sa kiṃ phalasambandhottarakālaṃ vākyārthātmanā gamyamāno dharmo bhavati athetarapadārthānugṛhīta ekaḥ padārtha iti /
analyzed: na ca atra yaḥ dharmaḥ sa kim padena padena uccatas eti evam vicāryate kim tarhi yaḥ padena padena ucyate sa kim phala sambandha uttarakālam vākya artha ātmanā gamyamānaḥ dharmaḥ bhavati atha itara padārtha anugṛhītaḥ ekaḥ padārthaḥ iti
translated: And here it is not considered in this way: Which dharma is denoted by each word? But rather, Is the dharma that is understood as the meaning of the sentence after the connection with the result, or is it a single object of a word favored by the other word-meanings?

original: tathā ca sarvairekasya dharmatvaṃ pratipāditaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tathā ca sarvaiḥ ekasya dharma tvam pratipāditam bhavati
translated: And thus it is shown by all that it is a dharma.

analyzed: sādhana mātrasya dharma tva abhyapagamāt
translated: Because only that which is merely the means of accomplishing the result is accepted as the dharma.

original: na ta sarveṣāmekaḥ kaścidarthosti yaḥ sarvaireka ityevamāśrīyeta /
analyzed: na sarveṣām ekaḥ kaścid arthaḥ usti yaḥ sarvaiḥ ekaḥ iti evam āśrīyeta
translated: And there is no single object of all of them which could be accepted as one by all.

original: yacca phalapadena sada saṃbadhyate tasyārthaṃ dharmamapūrvasādhanaṃ ca manyante /
analyzed: yat ca phala padena sada saṃbadhyate tasya artham dharmam apūrva sādhanam ca manyante
translated: And that which is connected with the word result, its meaning is considered to be the dharma and the means of accomplishing the unseen result.

original: tena kiṃ sarvāṇi padāni phalena saṃbadhyante kiṃ vā eka miti vicāraḥ /
analyzed: tena kim sarvāṇi padāni phalena saṃbadhyante kim vā ekam iti vicāraḥ
translated: Therefore, the consideration is: Are all the words connected with the result, or only one?

analyzed: kim prāptam pratipadam iti
translated: What is the prima facie view? That each word [is connected with the result].

original: kutaḥ aikarūpyeṇa sambandhaḥ pradhāne na ca sidhyati /
analyzed: kutas aikarūpyeṇa sambandhaḥ pradhāne na ca sidhyati
translated: Why? Because the connection is with the principal, not with the uniform.

analyzed: tasmāt phala padena eva sarvam saṃbadhyate padam
translated: Therefore, every word is connected only with the word 'fruit'.

analyzed: phalena yasya saṃbandhaḥ prakalpyate
translated: The unseen is assumed from that with which it is connected by the fruit.

original: yadi hi phala saṃbandhamātraparyavasāyya va vākyaṃ bhavetattaḥ kadā cidapi sarvāṇi phalena saṃbadhyeran/
analyzed: yadi hi vākyam kadā cit api sarvāṇi phalena saṃbadhyeran
translated: If the sentence were to end merely with the connection with the fruit, then at some point all would be connected with the fruit.

original: icha ta tāvanmātreṇāsiddhera pūrvamanyatkalpayitavyaṃ taccānupapatti pramāṇakaṃ / tatraikāpūrvakalpana yopapanne nādṛṣṭāntarakalpanāpramāṇamasti /
analyzed: tāvat mātreṇa asiddheḥ a pūrvam anyat kalpayitavyam tat ca anupapatti pramāṇakam tatra eka apūrva kalpana yā upapanne na adṛṣṭa antara kalpanā pramāṇam asti
translated: But since that is not established merely by that, something else must be assumed before that, and that is based on the evidence of impossibility. There, the assumption of one unseen act is appropriate, and there is no evidence for the assumption of another unseen act.

original: yo hyanekā nyapūrvāṇi kalpayati kalpayatya sāve kaṃ taccetkalpitamarthavattvādvā kyā kṣīṇā 'nyathānupapattirnāpūrvāntarasya pramāṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi anekā nyapūrvāṇi kalpayati kalpayati tat ced kalpitam arthavat tvāt vā kṣīṇā nyathā anupapattiḥ na apūrva antarasya pramāṇam bhavati
translated: For one who assumes many unseen acts, he assumes something. If that assumed is meaningful, then the impossibility in another way is exhausted. There is no evidence for another unseen act.

analyzed: tasmāt ekam eva pha la saṃbandhi tasmāt ca apūrvam itarat phanavat upakāri iti adhyavasīyate
translated: Therefore, there is only one unseen act connected with the fruit. And from that, the other is determined to be helpful like the fruit.

original: na cātra virodho bhaviṣyati nāmadheyatvena parihārāt /
analyzed: na ca atra virodhaḥ bhaviṣyati nāmadheya tvena parihārāt
translated: And there will be no contradiction here, because of the solution by way of being a name.

original: agatyā vā daśāpavitreṇa grahaṃ saṃmārśetivanmatvarthalakṣaṇāśrayaṇāt arthāītiprasādhyāṃśadvāreṇa vā dhātvarthairātmīyakaraṇagrahaṇasiddheḥ /
analyzed: agatyā vā daśā pavitreṇa graham saṃmārśa iti vat matu artha lakṣaṇa āśrayaṇāt artha aīti prasādhya aṃśa dvāreṇa vā dhātvarthaiḥ ātmīya karaṇa grahaṇa siddheḥ
translated: Or, if there is no other way, by assuming the sense of the word to be indicated by the word 'daśāpavitra', like the sprinkling of the cup, or by the means of the two parts of the word that are established by the sense, the sense is established by the objects denoted by the verbal roots.

original: evaṃ sthite kataradekaṃ saṃbadhyatāmiti sarvathānekādṛṣṭa kalpanāparicārād aniyamaprāptau uccate / tantravārtike /
analyzed: evam sthite katarat ekam saṃbadhyatām iti sarvathā aneka adṛṣṭa kalpanā paricārāt aniyama prāptau uccate tantravārtike
translated: Thus, which one should be connected? Since the assumption of many unseen things is entirely avoided, when the rule is not obtained, it is said in the Tantra-Vartika:

analyzed: pradhāne tat saṃbadhi aṅgam iṣyate
translated: The subsidiary is considered to be connected with the principal, which is connected with that.

analyzed: pradhāna aṅga tvam ekasya na ca ekanā avakalpate
translated: And the state of being a subsidiary of the principal is not possible for one alone.

original: yāvāneva hi ananyalabhyo 'rthaḥ śabdādgamyate sa sarvaḥ śabdārthaḥ /
analyzed: yāvān eva hi an anya labhyaḥ rthaḥ śabdāt gamyate sa sarvaḥ śabda arthaḥ
translated: As much as is not obtained from anything else is understood from the word, that is the meaning of the word.

original: sarvatra cākhyāte dhātvarthaśca tadanuraktā ca bhāvanā vijñāyate/
analyzed: sarvatra ca ākhyāte dhātvarthaḥ ca tad anuraktā ca bhāvanā vijñāyate
translated: And in every verb, the meaning of the verbal root and the bhāvanā tinged by it are understood.

analyzed: tasmāt bhāva artha tva vyapadeśaḥ  tad vyatiriktāḥ tu dravya guṇa śabdāḥ vijñāya dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: Therefore, it is called the meaning of bhāvanā.

analyzed: nta eva iti na pṛṣṭāḥ
translated: But the words denoting substance and quality, which are known to be different from that, are not questioned.

analyzed: tatra dravya ādi śabdānām niṣpanna artha abhidhāyinām karaṇa artha tva yogya tvāt prāpnoti phala saṃgatiḥ
translated: Among them, since the words denoting substance etc., which denote accomplished meanings, are fit for the meaning of instrument, the connection with the result is obtained.

original: sarvatra di phalaṃ sādhyatvātmirūpaṃ sādhanamapecate na sādhyāntaraṃ / nāmārthaśca siddhatvāttadapeścāpūraṇasamarthaḥ nākhyātāyaiḥ svayameva tāvatsādhyatvā / ttasmāddūvyādibhyaḥ phalamiti prāpta sūtreṇottaraṃ dīyate
analyzed: sarvatra phalam sādhya tvāt mirūpam sādhanam apecate na sādhyāntaram nāma arthaḥ ca siddha tvāt tad apeḥ ca āpūraṇa samarthaḥ svayam eva tāvat sādhya tvāt tasmāt dūvya ādibhyaḥ phalam iti prāpta sūtreṇa uttaram dīyate
translated: Everywhere, the result is to be accomplished, and requires a means, not another thing to be accomplished. And the meaning of the nominal affix is accomplished, and is capable of fulfilling that requirement, not the verb itself, because it is to be accomplished. Therefore, the result is from the root and other affixes. This is the conclusion. The reply is given by the sutra.

analyzed: phala saṃbandhaḥ hetuḥ apūrva pratipatteḥ
translated: The relation to the result is the reason for the ascertainment of the unseen potency.

analyzed: saṃbandhaḥ ca ākāḍā pūrvakaḥ
translated: And that relation is preceded by the unseen potency.

original: sā ca bhāvaśabdebhyaḥ prasappaṃnto dṛśyate na dravyaguṇaśabdebhyaḥ /🔽tasmādākhyātebhyo 'pūrvabhāvanā gamyate tatra ca dhātvarthasya karaṇatvapratipattiḥ pratyāsatteḥ/
analyzed: sā ca bhāva śabdebhyaḥ dṛśyate na dravya guṇa śabdebhyaḥ  tasmāt ākhyātebhyaḥ pūrva bhāvanā gamyate tatra ca dhātvarthasya karaṇa tva pratipattiḥ pratyāsatteḥ
translated: And that is seen to be implied by words denoting existence, not by words denoting substance and quality.🔽Therefore, from the verb, the unseen potency is understood. And there, the understanding of the root meaning as the instrument is due to proximity.

analyzed: atas tena eva phana karaṇa bhūtena anyathā anupapacyā pūrvam bhāvyate iti avadhāryyate
translated: Therefore, by that very thing which is the instrument of the result, the unseen potency is produced, because it would not be otherwise. This is determined.

original: kathaṃ punaryajyādīnpṛthakṛtyakevala pratyayavācya eva bhāvanārthī labhyate bhāvayediti /
analyzed: katham punar yajya ādīn pṛthak ṛtya kevala pratyaya vācyaḥ eva bhāvanā arthī labhyate bhāvayet iti
translated: How then is the meaning of the verb, which is the mere potency to be produced, obtained from the verb alone, without the separate mention of sacrifice and other affixes?

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: na ca dhātvantarārthaṃ yajyādayaḥ pratipādayanti svārthamācavyāpatatvāt /
analyzed: na ca dhātu antara artham yaji ādayaḥ pratipādayanti sva artham ācavyāpata tvāt
translated: And sacrifice and other affixes do not convey the meaning of another root, because they are occupied with their own meaning.

analyzed: atas śabda rahitam eva idam āropyate bhāvayet iti
translated: Therefore, this is superimposed even without the word, and one should meditate.

analyzed: krim ca
translated: And what?

original: tadyathā pikamānayetyukte yo nāmārthaṃ na pratipadyate tasmai kokina śabdameva kevalaṃ prayuñjate na kokilaḥ pika iti / tathātra yadyākhyātasya karotirṇyanto vā bhavatiḥ paryyāyaḥ tatastadarthakathane tanmātrameva prayoktavyaṃ nākhyātapratyayopi / na hi tadānoṃ vidhicya jñāyate kenāṃśena kriyā pratyāyyataiti /
analyzed: tat yathā pikam ānaya iti ukte yaḥ nāma artham na pratipadyate tasmai śabdam eva kevalam prayuñjate na kokilaḥ pikaḥ iti tathā atra yadi ākhyātasya karotiḥ ṇi antaḥ vā bhavatiḥ paryyāyaḥ tatas tad artha kathane tad mātram eva prayoktavyam na ākhyāta pratyayaḥ api na hi tadānom jñāyate kena aṃśena kriyā pratyāyyate eti
translated: Just as when it is said Bring the cuckoo, to one who does not understand the meaning, they use only the word kokila, not kokila is cuckoo. Similarly, here if the optative ending or the present participle is a synonym of the optative, then in stating its meaning, only that much should be used, not even the optative ending. For then it is not understood by which part the action is denoted.

original: atra tu bhāvayetkuryyāditi vā punarapi liṅ prayajyate eva /
analyzed: atra tu bhāvayet kuryāt iti vā punar api liṅ prayajyate eva
translated: But here the optative ending is used again, one should meditate or one should do.

original: ataśca yo 'nena yajateḥ pareṇārthaḥ pratipāditaḥ asau bhāvayaterapi pareṇa tenaivetyadhikāvāpa eva bhāvayatiḥ /🔽tasmādavaidika iti /
analyzed: atas ca yaḥ nena yajateḥ pareṇa arthaḥ pratipāditaḥ asau bhāvayateḥ api pareṇa tena eva iti adhika āvāpaḥ eva bhāvayatiḥ  tasmāt avaidikaḥ iti
translated: And therefore, the meaning of yajati that is stated after this, that same meaning is stated after bhāvayati also. Thus bhāvayati is only an additional word.🔽Therefore, it is non-Vedic.

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: To this it is said:

analyzed: sarvatra eva tāvat  sāmānādhikaraṇyena karoti arthaḥ vagamyate
translated: In every case,🔽the meaning of doing is understood by co-reference.

analyzed: karotiḥ kriyamāṇena na kaścid karmmaṇā vinā
translated: The optative is never used without an action being done.

original: bhavatyarthasya karttā ca karote karmma jāyate
analyzed: bhavati arthasya karttā ca karote karmma jāyate
translated: He becomes the agent of the meaning, and the action is performed.

original: nityaṃ na bhavanaṃ yasya yasya vā nityabhūtatā /
analyzed: nityam na bhavanam yasya yasya vā nitya bhūta tā
translated: For one who is not always existent, or for one who is always existent,

analyzed: na tasya kriyamāṇa tvam kha puṣpa ākāśayoḥ iva
translated: there is no state of being produced, like a sky-flower or space.

original: karotyarthasya yaḥ katī bhavituḥ sa prayojakaḥ /
analyzed: karoti arthasya yaḥ bhavituḥ sa prayojakaḥ
translated: One who is the agent of the meaning of 'to do' is the prompter of the one who is to be.

analyzed: bhavitā tam apecya atha prayojya tvam prapadyate
translated: Then, depending on him, it attains the state of being prompted.
The suffixes that express the activity of the prompted agent

analyzed: eyantāḥ eva prayujyante tad prayojaka karmmasu
translated: are used only in those actions that are prompted by that [prompter].

analyzed: śaktayaḥ sarva bhāvānām na anuyojyāḥ svabhāvataḥ
translated: The potencies of all things should not be questioned due to their nature.

analyzed: tena nānā vadanti arthīn prakṛti pratyaya ādayaḥ
translated: Therefore, the roots, suffixes, etc. express different meanings.

analyzed: yat tu uktam na vidhi tva vyatiriktāḥ liṅ ādayaḥ rtham vadanti iti
translated: As for what was said - that the suffixes like liṭ do not express meaning apart from the injunctive -

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: that is incorrect.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: kevalasya aprayogi tvāt kartṛ saṃkhyā ādi saṃgrahāt
translated: Because the independent [form] is not used, and because it includes the number of the agent and so on.

analyzed: rūpa avināśa siddheḥ ca pratyayaḥ pi prayujyate
translated: Even the suffix is used because the form is not destroyed.

original: bhāvanā gamyamānā ca dhātu pratyayasannidhau kasya vācyeti vispaṣṭaṃ na kadā citpratīyate
analyzed: bhāvanā gamyamānā ca dhātu pratyaya sannidhau kasya vācyā iti vispaṣṭam na kadā cit pratīyate
translated: And when the bhāvanā is understood in the presence of the root and suffix, it is never clearly understood whose expression it is.

analyzed: pratyaya artham saha brūtaḥ prakṛti pratyayau sadā
translated: The root and the affix always occur together for the purpose of conveying the idea of the root-meaning.

analyzed: prādhānyāt bhāvanā tena pratyaya arthaḥ vadhaḥ arthyate
translated: Since the root is primary, the affix is understood to be for the purpose of conveying the idea of the root-meaning.

analyzed: tathā prakṛti pratyaya ambhayoḥ
translated: Thus, the root and the affix, which always occur in a certain order,

analyzed: pratyaya śruti velāyām bhāvanā ātmā avagamyate
translated: at the time of hearing the affix, the form of the bhāvanā is understood.

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: First section of the second chapter.

analyzed: akhyā ādau api kaśe bhāvye sti eva hi bhāvanā
translated: Even in the case of akhyāti, there certainly is bhāvanā in what is to be brought about.

original: anyatrāśeṣabhāvāttuna tathā sā prakāśate /🔽yadyapi kartturaniṣpannatvād vyatiriktabhāvayitavyābhāvāt atyādiṣu prayojakavyāpāro nātīva lakṣyate tathāpi pratyayasāmarthyābhāvayatotyavagamyate /
analyzed: anyatra aśeṣa bhāvāt tu na tathā sā prakāśate  yadi api karttuḥ aniṣpanna tvāt vyatirikta bhāvayitavya abhāvāt ati ādiṣu prayojaka vyāpāraḥ na atīva lakṣyate tathā api pratyaya sāmarthyā bhāvayatā iti avagamyate
translated: But elsewhere, due to the absence of complete bhāvanā, it does not appear in that way.🔽Even though in the case of ātmanepada, etc., the activity of the instigator is not very clearly seen due to the incompleteness of the agent and the absence of anything else to be brought about, still by the power of the affix, the idea of bhāvanā is understood.

original: kimityapeci cāniṣpanne kartaryanyatkiṃ cidityakalpanādātmānamityeva sambadhyate kena bhāvanena kathamavayavajananādiprakāreṇeti /
analyzed: kim iti ca aniṣpanne kartari anyat kim cit iti akalpanāt ātmānam iti eva sambadhyate kena bhāvanena katham avayava janana ādi prakāreṇa iti
translated: And when the agent is incomplete, since nothing else can be imagined as to what it is, it is connected only with ātman, by what bhāvanā, and in what manner by the production of parts, etc.

original: trayopi tatra bhāvanāṃśā bhavanenaiva pūryante vyāpārāntarāmambhavāttatra ke cidavayavā bhāvanavyāpṛtāḥ prayujyante ke citmidbhavanāḥ prayojakāḥ /
analyzed: trayaḥ api tatra bhāvanā aṃśāḥ bhavanena eva pūryante vyāpāra antara āmambhavāt tatra ke cid avayavāḥ bhāvana vyāpṛtāḥ prayujyante ke cit mid bhavanāḥ prayojakāḥ
translated: All the three factors of the Bhavana are fulfilled by the very act of coming into existence, as there is no other operation possible. Some of the parts are employed in the operation of the Bhavana, while others are employed in the act of coming into existence.

analyzed: siddha bhavana asiddha bhavanavati ca sāmānyam ubhaya saṃparkāt bhāvanā iti ucyate
translated: And in that which is both accomplished and not accomplished, the Bhavana is spoken of as the common factor of both.

analyzed: etena jāyate niṣpadyate sidhyati ityādīni vyākhyātāni
translated: This explains the terms jāyate, niṣpadyate, sidhyati, etc.

original: astiḥ punarjjanisamānārthādbhavatesparitanī mavamyāma bhinnapansattayātmabhavanaṃ bhavagāvayatītyevamākhyātapratyayaṃ labhate /
analyzed: astiḥ punarjjani samāna arthāt bhavateḥ paritanī bhinnapan sattayā ātma bhavanam bhavagāvayati iti evam ākhyāta pratyayam labhate
translated: The word asti, however, which has the same meaning as bhavati, is used in the sense of the selfs coming into existence, which is different from the mere existence of the self, and thus it takes the affix pratyaya.

original: tatrāpi tu kālakṛtabhedapūrvettara sāmānyasattārūpeṇa pūrvavadeva prayojyaprayojakavyāpārakalpanānusataivyā /
analyzed: tatra api tu kāla kṛta bheda pūrva ittara sāmānya sattā rūpeṇa pūrva vat eva prayojya prayojaka vyāpāra kalpanā anusata evyā
translated: Even there, the distinction is made on the basis of time, and the common factor of existence is conceived as the operation of the employed and the employer, as before.

analyzed: sattyām api tu evamādiṣu bhāvanāyām niṣpanna cetana kartṛ viṣaya tvāt vidhi pratiṣedhayoḥ asambhavaḥ
translated: But even in the case of asti, etc., the injunction and prohibition are not possible, because they refer to the accomplished conscious agent.

analyzed: syāt etat
translated: This may be argued.

original: dṛṣṭo vi dhirapi tasmātprāyaṇīyasyāha ṛtvijā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ vi dhiḥ api tasmāt prāyaṇīyasya aha ṛtvijā bhavitavyam
translated: The injunction is also seen: From that, the Pravargya should be performed by the priests.

analyzed: rathantaram bhavati
translated: The Rathantara is performed.

analyzed: atra adhvaryuḥ syāt
translated: Here the Adhvaryu priest should be.

analyzed: iha ukthyāni syuḥ iti
translated: Here the Ukthya sacrifices should be.

original: satyaṃ dṛśyate na tviha pūrveṇa tulyo bhavatyarthaḥ /
analyzed: satyam dṛśyate na tu iha pūrveṇa tulyaḥ bhavati arthaḥ
translated: It is true that this is seen, but the meaning is not equal to the previous one.

original: middho hi puruṣaḥ karmasambandhanimittamṛtviktvaṃ bhavadanyaireva vākkāyamanovyāpārairbhāvayedityucyate /
analyzed: middhaḥ hi puruṣaḥ karma sambandha nimittam ṛtvij tvam bhavat anyaiḥ eva vāc kāya manaḥ vyāpāraiḥ bhāvayet iti ucyate
translated: For it is said that a person who is asleep would perform the priest-hood, which is the cause of the connection with the ritual, by means of other activities of speech, body and mind.

original: tathā rathantarādiṣu satyapi śrutyā bhavana vidhisambandhe ta tra sambhavādanumīyamānā bhāvanaiva vidhīyate /
analyzed: tathā rathantara ādiṣu sati api śrutyā bhavana vidhi sambandhe sambhavāt anumīyamānā bhāvanā eva vidhīyate
translated: Similarly, even though there is a connection with the injunction of existence by the Vedic text in the Rathantara etc., only the inferred existence is enjoined, because that is not possible.

original: yatra tviāmuko bhavediti prayogastatra bhavatestiṣṭhatyarthavācitvātmambhavatyeva vyatiriktaṃ bhāvayitavyam ityevaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: yatra bhavet iti prayogaḥ tatra bhavateḥ tiṣṭhati artha vāci tvāt mambhavati eva vyatiriktam bhāvayitavyam iti evam vijñāyate
translated: But where there is the usage may this one be, there it is understood that something other than may be is to be brought into existence, because may be denotes the meaning of to remain.

analyzed: sthānena anyat kim cit bhāvayet iti
translated: By something else in place, one should bring something into existence.

analyzed: tena bhūta bhaviṣyat varttamāna apadeśa māceṣu eva a pāramārthika bhavitṛ vyāpārasya bhāvanā tvam na vidhi ādiṣu
translated: Therefore, the nature of existence belongs only to the activity of the one who is to come into existence in the present, past and future, not in injunctions etc.

original: bhūtādikathane pi yadā samastaṃ vyāpāraṃ dhāturevopādatte nāvayavakānādikṛtabhedāśrayaṇaṃ tadā vispaṣṭādvirodhā dvātvarthamātraṃ kartṛsaṃkhyādayaśca ākhyāta padārthatvenāvadhāryante na bhāvanā /
analyzed: bhūta ādi kathane yadā samastam vyāpāram dhātuḥ eva upādatte na avayavaka an ādi kṛta bheda āśrayaṇam tadā vispaṣṭāt virodhāḥ dvātvartha mātram kartṛ saṃkhyā ādayaḥ ca ākhyāta padārtha tvena avadhāryante na bhāvanā
translated: Even in the statement of the elements, when the root itself takes up the entire operation, and does not rely on a distinction made by parts or beginning, then, due to the clear contradiction, only the meaning of the root is ascertained as the meaning of the verb, and the number of the agent etc. are understood as the meaning of the verbal suffix, not the bhāvanā.

analyzed: na ca bhāvanā avyabhicāreṇa doṣaḥ iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that there is no fault in deviating from the bhāvanā.

original: yattu kṛdanteṣvapi dhātavo bhāvānāṃ na vyabhicarantīti /
analyzed: yat tu kṛt anteṣu api dhātavaḥ bhāvānām na vyabhicaranti iti
translated: But it is said that even in the case of nominal affixes, the roots do not deviate from the bhāvanās.

original: satyaṃ dhātvarthā na vyabhicaranti taireva tu gamyamānatvādanabhidheyatvamapi śakyaṃ vaktum /
analyzed: satyam dhātvarthāḥ na vyabhicaranti taiḥ eva tu gamyamāna tvāt anabhidheya tvam api śakyam vaktum
translated: It is true that the meanings of the roots do not deviate, but it can also be said that they are not denoted, because they are only implied by those [roots].

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For example:

original: yathaiva bhāvapradhānatvādākhyāte tatsambandhādeva guṇabhūtakārakapratītisiddhernna kartṛkarmmaṇorabhidhānaṃ bhaviṣyatyevaṃ karnādyabhiṣānādeva tadanyathānapapattyā bhāvanāsiddheranabhidhānaṃ gamyamānāpedāyaiva ca karotisāmānādhikaraṇyaṃ / yathā pacatiśabdasya devadattaśabdenā /tathābhūtayaiva ca kārakasambandho 'pyupapatsyate /
analyzed: yathā eva bhāva pradhāna tvāt ākhyāte tad sambandhāt eva guṇa bhūta kāraka pratīti siddheḥ na kartṛ karmmaṇoḥ abhidhānam bhaviṣyati evam tad anyathā anapapattyā bhāvanā siddheḥ anabhidhānam gamyamāna apedāya eva ca karoti sāmānādhikaraṇyam yathā pacati śabdasya devadatta śabdena a tathābhūtayā eva ca kāraka sambandhaḥ upi upapatsyate
translated: Just as, in the case of the verb, the Nominative and Objective are not denoted, because the denotation of the verb is the principal factor, and the other factors are cognised only as related to that verb, in the same manner, the Bhavana also is not denoted, because it is cognised by the mere fact of the Nominative and Objective being related to each other. And the coextensiveness of the word karoti with the Nominative and Objective is due to the fact of the latter being implied by the former. And just as the word pacati is coextensive with the word Devadatta, so also is the word karoti with the Nominative and Objective. And it is in this way that the relationship of the Nominative and Objective with the Bhavana becomes possible.

analyzed: atha vā bhāvanā upasarjjana dhātvartha niṣpatti artha tvāt kārakāṇām dhātvarthena eva sambandha siddhiḥ
translated: Or, the relationship of the Nominative and Objective with the Bhavana may be explained on the ground that the Nominative and Objective are related to the Bhavana, only for the purpose of helping the accomplishment of the meaning of the root, which is subordinate to the Bhavana.

original: sa eva hi tāni svasiddhyarthamapekṣate bhāvanāpi ca tathābhūtānyeva tāni gṛhṇātītyaviruddhaḥ sambandhaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva hi tāni sva siddhi artham apekṣate bhāvanā api ca tathābhūtāni eva tāni gṛhṇāti iti aviruddhaḥ sambandhaḥ
translated: It is the Bhavana that requires the Nominative and Objective for its own accomplishment and the Bhavana takes up only such Nominative and Objective as are related to the meaning of the root and as such the relationship of the Nominative and Objective with the Bhavana is quite compatible.

original: kṛtyānāṃ tu praiṣavācitvātmatyapi bhāvanānabhidhāne tāvatsvārthaparthyavasānaṃ nāsti yāvadaṃśatrayaparipūrṇā bhāvanā na labdhā /
analyzed: kṛtyānām tu bhāvanā anabhidhāne tāvat svārtha parthyavasānam na asti yāvat aṃśa traya paripūrṇā bhāvanā na labdhā
translated: As for the Nominative and Objective, they are not related to the Bhavana, until the Bhavana has been duly accomplished, in all its three factors, because the Nominative and Objective are mere commands, and as such, they are not capable of being related to the Bhavana, until the Bhavana has been duly accomplished.

analyzed: kutas
translated: How so?

original: na hi puruṣaḥ svavyāpāra mutkā 'nyadanuṣṭhātuṃ śaktaḥ praiṣāścainadvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: na hi puruṣaḥ sva vyāpāra mutkā nyat anuṣṭhātum śaktaḥ
translated: For a man, being engaged in his own function, is not able to perform another; and the commands are for the purpose of that.

analyzed: m anuṣṭhāpayanti
translated: For a man, being engaged in his own operation, is not able to perform another; and the injunctions make him perform that.

original: te yadi tadvyāpāraṃ kathaṃ cinnopādayaḥ na ni yoktuṃ śakkayuḥ ityevamapi bhāvanākṣepasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: te yadi tad vyāpāram katham cit na upādayaḥ na ni yoktum iti evam api bhāvanā ākṣepa siddhiḥ
translated: If they were unable to enjoin that without somehow incorporating its operation, then also the projection of the bhāvanā is established.

original: yāvāṃśca brāhmaṇagataḥ kaścitpraiṣaḥ sa sarvaḥ prāptyabhāvādidhireva bhavatīti vināpi smaraṇena kṛtyānāṃ vidhāyakatvam /
analyzed: yāvān ca brāhmaṇa gataḥ kaścid praiṣaḥ sa sarvaḥ prāpti abhāvāt idhiḥ eva bhavati iti vinā api smaraṇena kṛtyānām vidhāyaka tvam
translated: And whatever injunction there is regarding the Brāhmaṇa, all that, being devoid of the means of knowledge, is only a statement of fact. Thus, even without recollection, the injunctions have the function of enjoining the acts.

analyzed: ayam eva ca vidhi praiṣayoḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: And this is the difference between injunction and injunction.

analyzed: tasmāt pratyaya arthī bhāvanā iti upapannam
translated: Therefore, it is proper that the bhāvanā is the meaning of the suffix.

original: nanu ca yadi prayojaka vyāpāro bhāvaneṣyate tataḥ pacāvadhiyādīni yajau ca mānasaḥ saṅkalpa ityādīnāṃ bhāvanātvaṃ taeva dhātvarthā iti dhātuvāccaiva bhāvanā syāt /
analyzed: nanu ca yadi vyāpāraḥ bhāvanā iṣyate tatas te eva dhātu arthāḥ iti dhātuvāt ca eva bhāvanā syāt
translated: But if the operation of the instigator is accepted as the bhāvanā, then the bhāvanā of such sentences as 'he should cook rice' and 'he should sacrifice' would be the mental resolve, and since those are the meanings of the verbal roots, the bhāvanā would be expressed by the verbal root itself.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: dhātvartha vyatirekeṇa yadi api eṣā na labhyate
translated: Even though this [bhāvanā] is not obtained apart from the meaning of the verbal root,

analyzed: tathā api sarva sāmānya rūpeṇa anyā avagamyate
translated: nevertheless, another [bhāvanā] is understood in the form of a universal.

analyzed: anyat eva hi yāga ādau sāmānyam karaṇa ātmakam
translated: For in the case of sacrifice etc., the general (universal) is one thing, having the nature of an instrument,

analyzed: anyat ca bhāvanā nāma sādhya tvena vyavasthitam
translated: and another thing is the bhāvanā, which is established as the object to be accomplished.

analyzed: yādṛśī bhāvanā khyāte dhātvarthaḥ ca api yādṛśaḥ
translated: The bhāvanā is one thing as expressed by the optative suffix, and the meaning of the root is another thing.

original: nāsau tenaiva rūpeṇa kathyate 'nyaiḥ padaḥ ka cit
analyzed: na asau tena eva rūpeṇa kathyate nyaiḥ padaḥ ka cit
translated: That (bhāvanā) is not expressed by that (optative suffix) alone, but by other words also.

analyzed: sambandha mānam uktam ca dhātvartha bhāvaḥ
translated: And the relation of the meaning of the root with the bhāvanā has been stated.

original: śrutyā tadekāṃśaniveśe ta vyāpāro 'syā na vidyate /🔽sambandhamātraṃ kṛtvā nivṛttavyāpārāyāṃ śrutāvanyanaraśiniveśo yogyatvādāśrayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: śrutyā tad eka aṃśa niveśe na vidyate  sambandha mātram kṛtvā nivṛtta vyāpārāyām śrutau anya nara śi niveśaḥ yogya tvāt āśrayitavyaḥ
translated: When it is included as a part of that (bhāvanā) by direct statement, it does not have any operation of its own.🔽Having merely established the relation, when the direct statement has ceased to operate, the inclusion of another part should be resorted to because of its suitability.

original: tadyadi sādhyāṃśādeka pratyayopātena pratyāsannatareṇa vidhitvena pracāvyate tato īśāntareṇa nūnaṃ sampatsyataityevaṃ pratīcyate /
analyzed: tat yadi sādhya aṃśāt eka pratyaya upātena pratyāsannatareṇa vidhi tvena pracāvyate īśa antareṇa nūnam sampatsyate iti evam
translated: If that (meaning of the root) is enjoined by the optative suffix, which is closer because it is conveyed by a single cognition from the part to be accomplished, then it is certainly connected by another means. Thus it is understood.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And further,

analyzed: bhavane yasya kartṛ tvam katham cit avadhāritam
translated: How can the instrumentality of that (meaning of the root) in the act of becoming (bhāvanā) be ascertained in some way,

original: svavākye vā 'nyavākye vā sa sādhyatvaṃ prapadyate
analyzed: sva vākye vā sa sādhya tvam prapadyate
translated: either in its own sentence or in another sentence? It becomes the object to be accomplished.

original: tato 'vadhuta svargādisādhyāṃśā bhāvanā kena bhāvaye dityevaṃ karaṇamapecate /
analyzed: tatas svarga ādi sādhya aṃśā bhāvanā kena bhāvayet iti evam karaṇam apecate
translated: Therefore, when the bhāvanā, which is the part to be accomplished such as heaven etc., is enjoined, it requires an instrument in the form by what should it be accomplished?

original: tatra ca śāstrādhīnapravṛttitvāttatmanikarṣādāvāśrīyamāṇe pramāṇāntarācca yogyāyogyatvayorajñānādvidhyavirodhācātyanta pratyāsatcyupasthita dhātvarthā tikramakāraṇābhāvātsarvaphalabhāvanānāṃ ca kena cidvātvarthaviśeṣeṇa vinā 'nupapatteryā genetyevaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: tatra ca śāstra adhīna pravṛtti tvāt tad sanikarṣa ādau āśrīyamāṇe pramāṇa antarāt ca yogya ayogya tvayoḥ ajñānāt vidhi avirodhāt ca atyanta pratyāsatcī upasthita dhātvartha atikrama kāraṇa abhāvāt sarva phala bhāvanānām ca kena cid vātvartha viśeṣeṇa vinā nupapatteḥ yā gena iti evam vijñāyate
translated: And there, since the activity is dependent on the scripture, and since the meaning of the root is presented very closely by the proximity of the injunctive suffix, and since the fitness or unfitness is not known from other means of knowledge, and since there is no contradiction with the injunction, and since there is no cause for transgressing the meaning of the root which is presented by the proximity, and since all the results are not possible without some particular meaning of the verb, it is understood in this way: 'by that'.

original: yadyapi ca yāga svayameva tāvadaniṣpanastathāpi svasādhana niṣpāditaḥ santmādhayiṣyati /
analyzed: yadi api ca svayam eva tāvat aniṣpanaḥ tathā api sva sādhana niṣpāditaḥ
translated: And even though the sacrifice itself is not yet accomplished, it will be accomplished by its own means of accomplishment.

original: sarvameva ca kadā cinniṣpannaṃ kadā cidaniṣpannam/
analyzed: sarvam eva ca kadā cit niṣpannam kadā cit aniṣpannam
translated: And everything is sometimes accomplished and sometimes not accomplished.

original: na ca prāk śākhapravṛtternniṣpattiḥ ka cidupayujyate phalasiddhikālamānopayogitvātkaraṇaniṣpatteḥ /
analyzed: na ca prāk śākhā pravṛtteḥ ka cit upayujyate phala siddhi kāla māna upayogi tvāt karaṇa niṣpatteḥ
translated: And prior to the commencement of the branch, no accomplishment is of any use, because the accomplishment of the instrument is of use only at the time of the accomplishment of the result.

analyzed: pramāṇa vaśāt ca tri kāla varttinām api sādhana tva avirodhaḥ
translated: And by the power of the means of knowledge, even things existing in the three times are not contradicted in being the means.

analyzed: tasmāt yāga ādīnām karaṇa tvam tat ca apūrva dāreṇa iti tad śabdebhyaḥ pūrva pratītiḥ
translated: Therefore, the sacrifice and so on have the nature of instruments, and that is by means of the unseen potency. Thus the unseen potency is understood from the words.

analyzed: atas ca evam api sūtra arthaḥ sambhavati
translated: And for this reason also, the meaning of the aphorism is possible in this way.

original: ye bhāvārthāḥ bhāvanāprayojanāḥ karmmaśabdā yajyādayaḥ tebhyaḥ kriyā pratīyeteti /
analyzed: ye bhāva arthāḥ bhāvanā prayojanāḥ karmma śabdāḥ yaji ādayaḥ tebhyaḥ kriyā pratīyeta iti
translated: Those words denoting action, such as 'yaj' etc., which have meanings that are states and are the purpose of the state, from them the action is understood.

original: nanu coktana karmakaraṇa sambandha nyāyena sakarma kaṣātuyuktādevākhyātādbhāvanā 'vagatiḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu ca uktana karma karaṇa sambandha nyāyena sa karma kaṣātu yuktāt eva ākhyātāt bhāvanā avagatiḥ prāpnoti
translated: But it has been said that the cognition of the state should be obtained only from a verb that is connected with an object by the principle of the relation between the object and the instrument.

analyzed: ta thā hi
translated: Because it is like this:

original: yadi vā sarvadhāḍhanāṃ sakarmakatvāpattiratha vā 'karmmakebhyo bhāvanayā na bhavitavyam /
analyzed: yadi vā sarva dhāḍhanām sakarmaka tva āpattiḥ atha vā karmmakebhyaḥ bhāvanayā na bhavitavyam
translated: Either all states would become connected with an object, or there should not be any state from verbs without objects.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: środanaṃ pacati grāmaṃ gacchatīti dhātvarthāpavargalabhyamekaṃ karma / apara punabhāvanākarma /
analyzed: środanam pacati grāmam gacchati iti dhātvartha apavarga labhyam ekam karma punar bhāvanā karma
translated: In 'he cooks rice' and 'he goes to the village', the object is obtained from the meaning of the root. But another is the object of the state.

original: tatra kadā cidvātvarthakammaiva bhāvanākammatvamapi pratipadyate pākanādanaṃ bhāvayatīti /
analyzed: tatra kadā cit vātvartha kammā eva bhāvanā kamma tvam api pratipadyate pākanādanam bhāvayati iti
translated: There, sometimes the object of the root itself becomes the object of the state also, as in 'he causes the cooking of rice'.

original: kadā citpunaḥ svakarmma viśiṣṭadhātvarthayuktā bhāvanā karmāntareṇa yujyate grāmagamanena svārthaṃ bhāvayediti odanapākena ceti /
analyzed: kadā cit punar sva karmma viśiṣṭa dhātvartha yuktā bhāvanā karma antareṇa yujyate grāma gamanena sva artham bhāvayet iti odana pākena ca iti
translated: But sometimes the state, connected with the object of the root qualified by its own object, is connected with another object, as in 'he would accomplish his purpose by going to the village' and 'by cooking rice'.

original: taccaitaddvātvarthātparataḥ tadavāpyamātratvena gamyamānaṃ dhātvarthāntaratirohitaṃ bhāvanākarmmatayā sarvatrāvadhārthyate /
analyzed: tat ca etat dvātvarthāt paratas tad avāpya mātra tvena gamyamānam dhātvartha antara tirohitam bhāvanā karmmatayā sarvatra avadhārthyate
translated: And that, being understood as merely to be attained from the object denoted by the verbal root, is everywhere considered as the object of the verb, as the action and the object, the object denoted by the verbal root being concealed.

analyzed: tat ca prāyeṇa evam kāma śabdena eva saṃvandham āpadyate
translated: And that generally comes to be connected with the word 'desire' (kāma) in this way:

analyzed: sukha kāmaḥ āsīta svāsthya kāmaḥ śīyata iti
translated: 'One should sit desiring happiness; one should lie down desiring health.'

original: satyapi āsiśetyorakarmakatve yaḥ pratyayena karotyaryobhihitaḥ tatkarmmatvena ca svādīnyavadhāryante /
analyzed: sati api āsi śetyoḥ akarmaka tve yaḥ pratyayena tad karmma tvena ca sva ādīni avadhāryante
translated: Even though 'ās' and 'śe' are intransitive, the words 'svā' etc. are determined as the objects by the object-meaning expressed by the suffix.

original: tena karoteḥ sarvadā sakarmakatvāda karmmakākhyātānāmapi ca tatmāmānādhikaraṇyadarśanā tkiṃ karotyāste kiṃ karoti śete iti vimādiṣvapi sakarmikā bhāvanā
analyzed: tena karoteḥ sarvadā sakarmaka tvāt a karmmaka ākhyātānām api ca tad māmānādhikaraṇya darśanāt kim karoti āste kim karoti śete iti vima ādiṣu api sakarmikā bhāvanā
translated: Therefore, because 'to do' is always transitive, and because even intransitive verbs are seen to have objects, in sentences like 'What does he do? He sits' and 'What does he do? He lies down', the action is transitive.

analyzed: tat ujjhitvā eva putrāḥ karmma tvam bhāvanā āśritam
translated: The sons, having abandoned that, depend on the action as the basis of the action.

original: āsanaśayanādau dina niyamenānantaryeṇa vedaṃ taditi vā karma nirūpyate / tenākamakā abhidhīyante /
analyzed: āsana śayana ādau dina niyamena ānantaryeṇa vedam tat iti vā karma nirūpyate tena akamakāḥ abhidhīyante
translated: The action is determined as sitting, lying down, etc., as daily, as immediate, or as 'that' (tad), by which they are said to be intransitive.

original: pacigamyādīnāṃ tu vikvidyattatsaṃyujyamānasākṣātmambandhikamrmmāvyabhicārātmakarmakatvaṃ / na tu bhāvanāviśeṣaṇe kaścidiśeṣaḥ /🔽seyaṃ bhāvanā aṃśayatantravārtike /
analyzed: paci gami ādīnām tu na tu bhāvanā viśeṣaṇe kaścid iśeṣaḥ  sā iyam bhāvanā aṃśayatantravārtike
translated: As for the roots pac, gam and the like, their direct connection with the object to which they are applied is not contradicted, and so they have the nature of having the object as their content, and not any qualification of the bhāvanā.

original: paripūrṇā satī sarvakaraṇāṃnāmupāyānanugṛhītānāṃ karaṇatvānupapatteḥ kathaṃ bhāvayeditītikarttavyatāmapekṣate /
analyzed: paripūrṇā satī sarva karaṇāṃnām upāya ananugṛhītānām karaṇa tva anupapatteḥ katham bhāvayet iti itikarttavyatām apekṣate
translated: This bhāvanā, when complete, requires the manner-of-performance, asking how should one effect it?, because the nature of an instrument is not possible for the means that are not assisted by all the instruments.

original: sā ca pratyakṣādīnāmanugrāhaka darśanaśaktyabhāvādatyantaśāstragamyeti yathāsannikaghaṃ tadasaṃbhavādā yathā kathaṃ cidupasthāpyamānā śāstrānusāreṇa śrutyādyupadeśena codanāmāmānyādyatideśena vā atyantādṛṭopakāradvāreṇānyathānupapattyā kalpyate /
analyzed: sā ca pratyakṣa ādīnām darśana śakti abhāvāt atyanta śāstra gamyā iti yathā sannikagham tad asaṃbhavāt ā yathā katham cit upasthāpyamānā śāstra anusāreṇa śruti ādi upadeśena codanā māmānya ādi atideśena vā atyanta adṛṭa upakāra dvāreṇa anyathā anupapattyā kalpyate
translated: And that [manner-of-performance] is to be imagined by the utmost application to the scriptures, because of the absence of the power of perception etc. to assist [the bhāvanā], and because of the impossibility of [the manner-of-performance] being presented in any way according to proximity. It is imagined by the utmost application to the scriptures, by the teaching of the śruti etc., or by the extension of the injunction etc. through the door of utterly unseen assistance, by the non-applicability of any other [means].

analyzed: tatas paripūrṇa tvāt anuṣṭhātum yogyā iti vidhīyate
translated: Then, because of its completeness, it is fit to be performed, and so it is enjoined.

analyzed: tad vidhānāt ca artha apatyā yāga ādi vidhānam iti upapannam
translated: And because of that injunction, by presumption, the injunction of the sacrifice etc. is established. Thus the meaning of the verb is reasonable.

original: bhavanti ke citkarmmaśabdā yāgo yajanamijyeti udāharttavye tatmāmānādhikaraṇyasiddha gye nai kacikāyudāharaṇaṃ yāgādikaraṇatvacodanottarakālabhāvika rmaśabdatve na pāratantryāttujñānam/🔽svatantrāṇāṃ kathaṃ cidapi bhāvārthatvāśavāsvaṃbhavāt /🔽yāgādayo hi svātantryeṇāpi kadā cidanumānād bhāvārthīśaṅkāviṣayāḥ syuriti /🔽ke cidbhāvārthī na karmaśabdā yathā bhāvayetkuryyāditi codāharaṇaṃ bhūtyādayastu prayojyavyāpāravacanatvānnaiva yathāvarṇitabhāvārthā ityanudāharaṇam/
analyzed: bhavanti ke cid karmma śabdāḥ yāgaḥ yajanam ijyā iti udāharttavye yāga ādi karaṇa tva codana uttara kāla bhāvi karma śabda tve na pāratantryāt tu jñānam  svatantrāṇām katham cit api bhāva artha tva āśava asvaṃbhavāt  yāga ādayaḥ hi svātantryeṇa api kadā cit anumānāt bhāva arthī śaṅkā viṣayāḥ syuḥ iti  ke cit bhāva arthī na karma śabdāḥ yathā bhāvayet kuryyāt iti ca udāharaṇam bhūti ādayaḥ tu prayojya vyāpāra vacana tvāt na eva yathā varṇita bhāva arthāḥ iti anudāharaṇam
translated: Some words denoting action, such as 'yajati', 'yajate', 'yajyate', are to be cited as examples, but the citation is not in the case of words denoting action that come after the injunction of the instrumentality of sacrifice etc., because of dependence on that.🔽Because it is not possible for independent [words] to be the meaning of a verb in any way.🔽For sacrifice etc., even if independent, might sometimes be the object of doubt as the meaning of a verb due to inference.🔽Some words denoting action are not words denoting action, such as 'bhāvayet', 'kuryāt'. This is an example. But words like 'bhū' are not as described as the meaning of a verb, because they denote the activity of one who is employed.

original: atha vā dvitīyasūtrārthavyākhyānena bhāvanāprayojanatvamaṃgavācitve nāstīti vināpi sakalārthābhidhānādbhavanti bhāvārthāḥ /
analyzed: atha vā dvitīya sūtra artha vyākhyānena bhāvanā prayojana tvam aṃga vāci tve nā asti iti vinā api sakala artha abhidhānāt bhavanti bhāva arthāḥ
translated: Or, if the purpose of the Bhāvanā is explained by the meaning of the second Sutra, then even without the mention of the entire meaning, the Bhāvanās are established, as there is no mention of the parts.

original: kathaṃ punaramī na karmmaśabdāḥ / yadā dhātumātraṃ karmma śavdatvenoktaṃ nirviśeṣasya sāmānyasyānuṣṭhā tuma śakyatvāda karmmaśabdatvam /
analyzed: katham punar amī na karmma śabdāḥ yadā dhātu mātram karmma śavda tvena uktam nirviśeṣasya sāmānyasya anuṣṭhā tum śakya tvāt karmma śabda tvam
translated: How then are these not words denoting action? When only the verbal root is said to be a word denoting action, the general without distinctions cannot be performed, so it is not a word denoting action.

analyzed: a taḥ viśeṣa vācinām eva dhātūnām karmma śavda tva grahaṇāt acodyam etat
translated: This is not a problem because only verbal roots that denote distinctions are taken to be words denoting action.

original: yadi hi prayenacitrādarśa paurṇamāsaśabdāḥ phalaiḥ saṃbadhyeran tato yāgakaraṇatvābhāvāttatsāmānādhikaraṇyanimittanāmadheyadvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yadi hi paurṇamāsa śabdāḥ phalaiḥ saṃbadhyeran tatas yāga karaṇa tva abhāvāt tad sāmānādhikaraṇya nimitta nāmadheya dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: If words like 'prayaścitta' and 'darśapūrṇamāsa' were primarily connected with results, then due to the absence of being the instrument of sacrifice, the reason for co-reference would not be established, and therefore the injunction of accessories would not be possible.

analyzed: nvā anupapatteḥ prasiddhi ādibhiḥ guṇa vidhi tvam eva syāt atas sthitaḥ etasmin adhikaraṇe iti āha
translated: Therefore, due to the impossibility of that, the injunction of accessories would be by well-known usage and other means. Thus, this is the conclusion of this section.

original: kasmātpunaridaṃ tatraiva na nītaṃ pramāṇantavagonā saṃbandhādatha nāmadheyatvaṃ kasmādatra nānīyate bhedalakṣaṇenāsaṃbandhāttasmādyathānyāsameva sthitayorarthātpaurvāparthyasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: kasmāt punar idam tatra eva na nītam saṃbandhāt atha nāmadheya tvam kasmāt atra na ānīyate bheda lakṣaṇena asaṃbandhāt tasmāt yathānyāsam eva sthitayoḥ arthāt paurvāparthya siddhiḥ
translated: Why is this not brought there itself as a means of knowledge? Because of the connection. If it is a name, why is it not brought here in the definition of difference? Because of non-connection with the characteristic of difference. Therefore, the establishment of sequence is from the meaning itself, as it stands in the original order.

analyzed: na ca eṣām arthi tā iti phala pada abhiprāyam
translated: And these are not desired. This is with the intention of the word 'fruit'.

analyzed: vi vibhakti tvāt iti saṃbandha nimitta ākhyāta vibhakti vigamāt atha vā niṣpanna artha abhidhāyi sup vibhakti viśeṣa yogaḥ vi vibhakti tvam
translated: Because of the presence of different case endings. Because of the absence of the case endings that indicate the cause of the connection, or because of the presence of a particular case ending that expresses the accomplished meaning, there is the presence of different case endings.

analyzed: tasmāt na dravya ādi śabdānām phala saṃbandhaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, there is no connection of the words denoting substance etc. with the fruit.

analyzed: āha ca  sādhya sādhana saṃbandhaḥ sarvadā bhāvanā āśrayaḥ
translated: And it is said:🔽The relation between the object to be accomplished and the means of accomplishment always depends on the bhāvanā.

analyzed: tena tasya na siddhiḥ syāt bhāvanā pratyaya āhate
translated: Therefore, its establishment would not be possible, obstructed by the cognition of the bhāvanā.

original: yadi hi bhāvanāvacanasyaivāpūrvapratipādakatvamiṣyate dhātorvā pratyayanirapekṣasya tato nāmapakṣo durbalaḥ syā / dikṣa tu yathaiva dhātoḥ pratyayasaṃbandhānugṛhītasya bhāvanānurañjananimittaṃ karaṇavācitvaṃ bhavatyevaṃ nāmapadasthāpītya viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi bhāvanā vacanasya eva apūrva pratipādaka tvam iṣyate dhātoḥ vā pratyaya nirapekṣasya tatas nāma pakṣaḥ durbalaḥ tu yathā eva dhātoḥ pratyaya saṃbandha anugṛhītasya bhāvanā anurañjana nimittam karaṇa vāci tvam bhavati evam viśeṣaḥ
translated: For if the word expressing the act of bringing about is held to denote the unseen potency, or if the verbal root by itself, independently of the affix, is held to do so, then the theory of names would be weak. But just as the verbal root, aided by the connection with the affix, comes to denote the instrument for the purpose of embellishing the act of bringing about, in the same way the word denoting the name also does. So there is no difference.

original: yeṣāmutpattau sve prayoge rūpopalabdhistāni nāmāni tasmāttebhyaḥ parākāṅkṣā bhūtatvātsve prayoge yaduktaṃ yadai kasmādapūrvaṃ tadā itarattadarthaṃ bhaviṣyatīti tadganaṃ tāvadvastudharmeṇa viśeṣaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: yeṣām utpattau sve prayoge rūpa upalabdhiḥ tāni nāmāni tasmāt tebhyaḥ parā ākāṅkṣā bhūta tvāt sve prayoge yat uktam kasmāt apūrvam tadā itarat tad artham bhaviṣyati iti tadganam tāvat vastu dharmeṇa viśeṣam darśayati
translated: Those which have their form perceived in their own usage in the origination, they are names. Therefore there is no expectancy beyond them, because they are complete in their own usage. What was said - when one thing is not seen, then the other will be for that purpose - that is shown to be a special property of the thing.

original: katham🔽ekasmādadṛṣṭe kalpite yadotarad dṛṣṭārthatvena tādarthaṃ bhajate tato lāghavaṃ labhyate /
analyzed: katham  ekasmāt adṛṣṭe kalpite yadā utarat dṛṣṭārtha tvena tādartham bhajate tatas lāghavam labhyate
translated: How?🔽When one thing is imagined to be not seen, if the other serves as for that purpose with the purpose of being seen, then lightness is obtained.

original: asya tu tādarthyasiddhaye tato'pi punaradṛṣṭaṃ kalpyataeva tato varaṃ phalenaiva sarvāṇi saṃbaddhāni /
analyzed: asya tu tādarthya siddhaye tatas api punar adṛṣṭam kalpyate eva tatas varam phalena eva sarvāṇi saṃbaddhāni

original: na ca saṃbandhavaiyaktemāśrayaṇaṃ nāmnaśca phalasaṃbandhe' vaśyaṃ dhātvarthastadanugrahārtho'bhyupagantavyaḥ /

translated: And in the connection of the name with the result, it is not necessary to accept that the meaning of the root, for the purpose of assisting that, is to be understood as connected.

original: na hi nāmārthastamapeścate śabdaprayogavelāyāmeva niṣpannatayā gamyamānatvādapekṣaṇīyasya vā siddhatvenāyogyatvātprayujyate 'sminniti cābhidheyaeva pra yogaḥ /

original: tadādhāraiva hi niṣpanna rūpopalabdhiranutpannatve kriyā pasya vaktavye vināśitva pradarśanaṃ niṣpannasyāpi kṣaṇikatvena panaḥ punarniṣpatyapekṣopapatteḥ /

translated: For the perception of the accomplished form is only based on that. If the non-arisenness of the action is to be stated, the demonstration of destructibility is appropriate, because even of what is accomplished, the requirement of another accomplishment is possible due to momentariness.

original: tebhyaḥ parākāṅkṣānyākāṅkṣā niṣpādyatvena vā pradhānākāṅkṣā na vidyataiti adhyāhāraḥ /

original: sarvābhivyaktīnāṃ cayānyatamasaṃskāradvāratvātsaṃskārāntaramavaśyaṃ kalpanīyaṃ tataḥ punaḥ sa eva keśaḥ ityapramāṇatā /
analyzed: sarva abhivyaktīnām caya anyatama saṃskāra dvāra tvāt saṃskāra antaram avaśyam kalpanīyam tatas punar saḥ eva keśaḥ iti apramāṇa tā
translated: And since the modification of any one of all the manifestations is the door to the modification of the others, another modification must necessarily be assumed. Therefore, that very hair is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: yadi ca kiyānantaramapūrvamupalabhyeta tato 'bhivyajyate iti brūyāma /
analyzed: yadi ca kiyān antaram apūrvam upalabhyeta tatas bhivyajyate iti brūyāma
translated: And if something new were perceived immediately after the action, we would say it is manifested.

analyzed: yadi ca asya prāk astitve pramāṇam bhavet
translated: And if there were a valid means of knowledge for its prior existence.

original: na tu tadubhayamapyastīti sarvathā nāstyapūrvaṃ na caitatsūtraṃ tatpratipādane vispaṣṭamityavyākhyānametat /
analyzed: na tu tat ubhayam api asti iti sarvathā na asti apūrvam na ca etat sūtram tad pratipādane vispaṣṭam iti a vyākhyānam etat
translated: But neither of these two exists. Therefore, the new thing does not exist in any way, and this aphorism is not clear in teaching that. Therefore, this is a bad explanation.

analyzed: atra ucyate
translated: To this we say:

original: yadidaṃ svamatiparikalpitaṃ vigrahava divā'pūrvaṃ bhavadbhinirākriyatena tenāsmākaṃ kiṃ cidvirudhyate /
analyzed: yat idam sva mati parikalpitam vigrahava divāpūrvam tena asmākam kim cit virudhyate
translated: The new thing imagined by your own mind, which has a form, is refuted by you. We do not contradict anything by that.

original: yato naitattādṛśaṃ kasya cidiṣṭaṃ / kiṃ tarhi karmabhyaḥ prāgayogyasya karmmaṇaḥ puruṣamya vā yogyatā śāstragamyā yā parā sāpūrva miṣyate /
analyzed: yatas na etat tādṛśam kasya cit iṣṭam kim tarhi karmabhyaḥ prāk ayogyasya karmmaṇaḥ puruṣamya vā yogyatā śāstra gamyā yā parā sā apūrva miṣyate
translated: Because such a thing is not accepted by anyone. What then? The ability of a person who is not fit for action prior to the action, or the ability that is known from the scriptures, is considered to be the new thing.

original: pradhānakarmaṇāmaṅgakarmaṇāṃ vā prākaraṇātsvargādiprāptyayogyāḥ puruṣāḥ kratavaśva svakāryyāyogyāḥ /
analyzed: pradhāna karmaṇām aṅga karmaṇām vā prākaraṇāt svarga ādi prāpti ayogyāḥ puruṣāḥ kratavaḥ ca sva kāryya ayogyāḥ
translated: Men who are unfit for attaining heaven etc. due to the primary actions or subsidiary actions, and sacrifices that are unfit for their own purpose, due to the context.

original: tāmubhayīmapyayogyatāṃ vyudasya pradhānairaṅgeśya yogyatoṣajanyanaitya va saṃ sarveṇṇābhyupagantavyam/
analyzed: tām ubhayīm api ayogyatām vyudasya sam
translated: Having rejected both these kinds of unfitness, the fitness arising from the principal and subsidiary acts should be accepted by all.

analyzed: asatyām tasyām akṛta sama tva prasaṅgāt
translated: For if it did not exist, the act would be as good as not done.

original: saiva ca puruṣagatā ṛtugatā vā yogyatā śāstre 'sminnapūrvamityapadigyate /
analyzed: sā eva ca puruṣa gatā ṛtu gatā vā yogyatā śāstre smin apūrvam iti apadigyate
translated: And that very fitness, whether in the person or in the season, is called an unseen (result) in this scripture.

original: yattu pratyakṣādigamyatvamasya nāstīti / satyaṃ śrutārthāpattivyatiriktairna gamyate sa tvadoṣaḥ kiṃ kāraṇam /
analyzed: yat tu pratyakṣa ādi gamya tvam asya na asti iti satyam śruta arthāpatti vyatiriktaiḥ na gamyate sa tu adoṣaḥ kim kāraṇam
translated: As for the fact that it is not known by perception etc., it is true that it is not known by anything other than inference and presumption, but that is not a fault. Why?

analyzed: na arthāpattiḥ ava ekā pramāṇam tasya vā iṣyate
translated: Presumption is not accepted as a separate means of knowledge for that.

original: śabdakadeśabhāvācca svārtheṣvāgama eva naḥ🔽kṣaṇikatvena sarvatra naikasyāpi hi karmmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: śabdaka deśa bhāvāt ca sva artheṣu āgamaḥ eva naḥ  kṣaṇika tvena sarvatra nā ekasya api hi karmmaṇaḥ
translated: And because it is a part of verbal testimony, for us it is only verbal testimony with regard to its own object.

analyzed: katham cit yugapad vṛttiḥ phale kim uta bhūyasām
translated: And because of momentariness, no single action can ever function simultaneously in any way, how much less so many.

analyzed: śaktibhiḥ sarva bhāvānām vyavahāra anupāti tā
translated: All things have potencies that conform to worldly usage.

original: tenānyadeśakālepi rūpe tābhiḥ sa sidhyati🔽yāgādeva phalaṃ taddhi śaktidvāreṇa sidhyati /
analyzed: tena anya deśa kāle api rūpe tābhiḥ sa sidhyati  yāgāt eva phalam tat hi śakti dvāreṇa sidhyati
translated: Therefore, even when in a different place or time, it is established by those (potencies).🔽The result arises only from the sacrifice, for that is established by way of potency.

analyzed: sūkṣma śakti ātmakam vā tat phalam eva upajāyate
translated: Or that result arises in the form of subtle potency.

analyzed: kāṣṭhaiḥ paktavyam iti ukte nirdiṣṭā jvalana kriyā
translated: When it is said that cooking should be done with fuel, the act of burning is indicated.

analyzed: aṅgure jāyamāne ca vṛścaḥ upi utpannaḥ iṣyate
translated: And when a sprout is being born, the cutting is also considered produced.

analyzed: vināśi tvena vijñātam sādhanam loka vedayoḥ
translated: The means of knowledge, known as destruction, is accepted in both worldly and Vedic usage.

analyzed: sambhāvita sāmarthya sthāyi tvam codyate katham
translated: How is the permanence, which is considered capable, being disputed?

analyzed: na ca atikrānta yāgebhyaḥ puruṣebhyaḥ phala udgatiḥ
translated: And the result does not arise from persons who have passed beyond the sacrifice.

analyzed: viśeṣaḥ tava na asti hi
translated: There is no difference for you between what is passed and what is not passed.

analyzed: aṅga madhye prakārakaḥ
translated: If it were to be done even in the middle of the limbs, it would be of that kind.

analyzed: prasaṅga siddheḥ aṅgānām aprāptiḥ vikṛtau bhavet
translated: Due to the establishment of the consequence, there would be non-attainment of the limbs in the modified form.

original: eko rogo hṛto yasya yasya vā 'pahṛtā daśa /
analyzed: ekaḥ rogaḥ hṛtaḥ yasya yasya vā pahṛtāḥ daśa
translated: For one from whom one disease is removed, or for one from whom ten are removed,

analyzed: arogi tve tayoḥ bhedaḥ na kaścid api dṛśyate
translated: no difference whatsoever is seen in their state of being disease-free.

original: na ca karmmavināśebhyaḥ svargādi śrūyate phalam /
analyzed: na ca karmma vināśebhyaḥ svarga ādi śrūyate phalam
translated: And the result of heaven, etc., is not heard to arise from the destruction of the action.

analyzed: viparyyayāt ca na etebhyaḥ jātam yāgasya tat bhavet
translated: And due to the opposite, that would not be produced from these for the sacrifice.

analyzed: aihikam ca api putra ādi krama janma svabhāvakam
translated: And the worldly result, such as a son, etc., which have the nature of being born in sequence,

analyzed: na karmma anantaram kaścid phalam labdham vyavasthati
translated: no one is seen to obtain the result immediately after the action.

original: cirakālopabhogaphantrātmakatvākāmādīnāṃ kiyānantaraṃ tādātmyāsambhave sati yatraivāntarāje nimittaṃ soṇaṃ tatraivāpāraḥ prasajyetetyavaśyaṃ samastopabhogaṃ yāvadavasthitena kena cihnavitavyam /
analyzed: cira kāla upabhoga phantra ātmaka tva akāma ādīnām kiyān antaram tādātmya asambhave sati yatra eva antarāje nimittam soṇam tatra eva apāraḥ prasajyeta iti avaśyam samasta upabhogam yāvat avasthitena kena cihnavitavyam
translated: For if the nature of desire, etc., is not possible immediately after the enjoyment of objects for a long time, then the result would follow in the very next moment, wherever the cause is present. Therefore, someone must remain until the complete enjoyment of all objects.

analyzed: tatas ca prāk eva prayogāt ityam avadhāraṇāt karṭa vaiguṇya ābha jhyā arthāpatteḥ anaikāntika tvam iti ayuktam etat
translated: And then, because of the restriction expressed by the word 'first', the non-eternality of the inference of the deficiency of the agent is not proper. Therefore, this is improper.

original: yattu pratiṣedheṣu na stra gamyamapūrvamityucyate vidheyebhyo yathā 'pūrvaṃ vidhiśāstreṣu gamyate /
analyzed: yat tu pratiṣedheṣu na gamyam apūrvam iti ucyate    vidheyebhyaḥ yathā pūrvam vidhi śāstreṣu gamyate
translated: As for what is said regarding prohibitions, that no unseen result is understood - just as an unseen result is understood from injunctions in the scriptures of injunctions,

analyzed: tathā eva pratiṣedhebhyaḥ pratiṣedhaiḥ tat ucyate
translated: in the same way, a prohibition is said to be understood from prohibitions.

analyzed: kartā iva ca āśrayaḥ tasya kriyā ca sthitā
translated: And the agent is its substratum, and the action also remains.

analyzed: ātma vāde sthitam hi etat kartṛ tvam sarva karmasu
translated: For this agency in all actions is established in the doctrine of the self.

analyzed: yadi sva samavena eva śaktiḥ iṣyeta karmmaṇām
translated: If the power of actions is held to belong to itself alone,

original: tadvināśe tato na syātkartṛsthā tu na naśyati
analyzed: tad vināśe tatas na syāt kartṛ sthā tu na naśyati
translated: then it would not exist upon the destruction of that, but that which resides in the agent does not perish.

analyzed: śaktiḥ kāryya anumeya tvāt yad gatā evā upayujyate
translated: The power is inferred from the effect, and is employed only in what belongs to it.

analyzed: tad gatā eva abhyupetavyā kha āśrayā anya āśrayā api vā
translated: That alone should be accepted as the purpose, whether it is the substratum or not.

analyzed: tādarthyena hi śeṣa tvam na āśrayāyi bhāvataḥ
translated: For, the subsidiary nature is due to the purpose, not due to being related to the substratum.

analyzed: rāja arthī nitya muṣṭaḥ vahati kuṅkumam
translated: One who desires the king's welfare always carries saffron in his fist.

analyzed: arthāpattar iha apūrvam pūrvam ekam pratīyate
translated: In the case of presumption, a prior unseen act is first understood.

analyzed: tatas tad siddaye bhūyas syāt apūrvā antara pramā
translated: Then, for its establishment, another unseen act would be cognized later.

analyzed: pramāṇavanti adṛṣṭāni kalpyante su bahani api
translated: Even very good unseen things are imagined to be the means of knowledge.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa śata bhāgaḥ api na kalpyaḥ hi apramāṇakaḥ
translated: Even a hundredth part of the unseen cannot be imagined without evidence.

analyzed: āvṛttibhiḥ yyathā adhyāye saṃskāraḥ bhavati kramāt
translated: Just as there is an impression in the chapters by repetition in order,

analyzed: vākya avayava rūpeṇa tathā pūrvam bhaviṣyati
translated: in the same way, the unseen will be in the form of the parts of the sentence.

analyzed: na eka rūpā eva bhāvānām abhivyaktiḥ pratīyate
translated: The manifestation of things is not seen to be of one form.

original: ātmasthonmīlanaṃ tena vyaktirasya bhaviṣyati🔽tasmādastyapūrvaṃ sūtrasyāpi ca na prakṛtīprayikamanyamarthaṃ pa śyāmaḥ /
analyzed: ātma stha unmīlanam tena vyaktiḥ asya bhaviṣyati  tasmāt asti apūrvam sūtrasya api ca na prakṛtī prayikam anyam artham
translated: Therefore, its manifestation will be the unfolding within the self.🔽Therefore, the unseen exists. And we do not see any other purpose of the sūtra.

analyzed: tena ārambha codanā eva apūrvasya api codanā iti ayam eva arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the very injunction of commencement is the injunction of the unseen. This is the meaning.

original: yadi punaḥ phalavacanasāmarthyāttadeva tadapi naṣṭamityapūrva kalpanānipramāṇakatvaṃ mantrāno barametadityāha /
analyzed: yadi punar phala vacana sāmarthyāt tat eva tat api naṣṭam iti apūrva kalpanā nipramāṇaka tvam baram etat iti āha
translated: If, on the other hand, it is assumed that the same thing is destroyed by the force of the statement of the result, then the assumption of an unseen thing becomes unestablished, as the mantra alone is the basis for this.

original: na hi karmaṇāṃ rūpamu palabhāmacaityayuktaṃ rūpaśabdāvibhāgācetyatra pratyakṣopalabdhyabhidhānāt /
analyzed: na hi karmaṇām rūpam rūpam a ca iti ayuktam rūpa śabda avibhāgāt ca iti atra pratyakṣa upalabdhi abhidhānāt
translated: For we do not perceive the form of actions, as there is no distinction between the form and the word in the perception of the object of thought.

original: yāgaprastāve ca sati tasyācalanātmakatvādyadāśrayaṃ deśāntaraṃ prāpayatītyasambaddham /
analyzed: yāga prastāve ca sati tasya acalana ātmaka tvāt yat āśrayam deśa antaram prāpayati iti asambaddham
translated: And when there is the occasion of sacrifice, since it has the nature of non-motion, it is not connected with the statement that it conveys its basis to another place.

analyzed: atrā ucyate tantra vārtika
translated: To this it is said:

original: yadyapi karmmasvarūpamupalabhyate tathāpi kālāntarāṣasthānābhāṃvād na tadupayujyataiti nopalabhāmahaityucyate
analyzed: yadi api karmma svarūpam upalabhyate tathā api na tat upayujyate eti na upalabhāmahe iti ucyate
translated: Even though the form of the action is perceived, still it is not used due to the destruction of the place at a different time, so it is said that we do not perceive it.

original: na hi saṅkalpamātreṇa phalaniṣpattiḥ samastātmamastetikarttavyatākācca karmmaṇaḥ phalaśravaṇā / ttatra dvyavadānaprakṣepādīnāṃ gra iṇāsādanādīnāṃ ca saṃyogavibhāgaphalatvātsthāyitve tadāśraye pāvaśyaṃ bhavitavyam/
analyzed: na hi saṅkalpa mātreṇa phala niṣpattiḥ samasta ātma masta itikarttavyatākāt ca karmmaṇaḥ phala śravaṇāt tatra dvi avadāna prakṣepa ādīnām ca saṃyoga vibhāga phala tvāt sthāyi tve tad āśraye bhavitavyam
translated: For the accomplishment of the result is not by mere intention. The action, along with the entire nature of the procedure, is heard to have a result. There, since the results of the conjunction and disjunction are the pouring of the two ladles and the bringing of the sacrificial grass etc., it is necessary that there be a basis for that in the case of permanence.

analyzed: na ca asau asti
translated: And that does not exist.

analyzed: na ca abhivyaktam rūpam upalabhyate
translated: And the manifest form is not perceived.

analyzed: saṅkalpa ādīnām api saṅkalpa antara ādi tirodhānāt na atra svarūpa avasthāna upapattiḥ
translated: Even for intention etc., because of being obstructed by another intention etc., their continued existence in their own form is not possible.

analyzed: avasthānam ca ātma samavetasya vā syāt pradeyam dravya samavetasya vā
translated: And the continued existence would be either inherent in the self or inherent in the substance to be given.

original: na tāvadātmani calanaṃ samavaiti sarvavyāpinaḥ saṃyujyamānaviyujyamānadeśāsambhave calitumasāmarthyāt /
analyzed: na tāvat ātmani calanam samavaiti sarvavyāpinaḥ saṃyujyamāna viyujyamāna deśa asambhave calitum asāmarthyāt
translated: First, motion does not inhere in the self, because for the all-pervading [self], there is no possibility of a place to be joined to or separated from, and so it is not capable of moving.

analyzed: katham sarva vyāpi tvam asya iti ced sarvatra upalabhyamāna kāryatvāt
translated: If it is asked how it is all-pervading, it is because its effects are perceived everywhere.

original: apratyayena hi caitanyasvabhāvasyātmano 'stitvamātramavagamyate na tu deśataḥ kālato vā viśeṣyate /
analyzed: apratyayena hi caitanya svabhāvasya ātmanaḥ stitva mātram avagamyate na tu deśataḥ kālataḥ vā viśeṣyate
translated: For by non-perception, the existence of the self, which has consciousness as its nature, is only understood, but it is not qualified in terms of space or time.

analyzed: tatas ca
translated: And from that.

original: anavacchinnasāvaṃ vastu yaddeśakālataḥ /🔽tannityaṃ vibhu cecchantītyātmano vibhuteṣyate
analyzed: anavacchinna sāvam vastu yat deśa kālataḥ  tat nityam vibhu ca icchanti iti ātmanaḥ vibhu tā iṣyate
translated: That entity which is not limited in space and time,🔽they [the Mīmāṃsakas] desire it to be eternal and all-pervading, so the all-pervasiveness of the self is accepted.

analyzed: śarīra mātra antargata ātma vādī tvā
translated: But the one who asserts the self to be within the body only.

analyzed: nanu te deva deśa antarāt āgamanasya liṅgam
translated: Surely, the coming from another place is the mark of that [motion].

analyzed: atas ca viruddha cetu tvam asya iti
translated: And therefore, it has contradictory consciousness.

analyzed: kutas
translated: How?

original: yadi hi śarīrāiddipi kiṃ cidātmakāyyamupalabhemahi śarīrāntare sukhaduḥkhādīnyā tataḥ sarvagatatvamadhyavasyema/🔽yatastu svaśarīrāntarvaryeva kāryaṃ yatra yatra ca tadgatistatra tatra paryyāyepopalabhyate taccarīrakārthyavadeva tatmahitagatasyopapatsyate/
analyzed: yadi hi kim cit ātma kāyyam upalabhemahi śarīra antare sukha duḥkha ādīn yā tatas sarvagata tvam adhyavasyema  yatas tu kāryam yatra yatra ca tad gatiḥ tatra tatra tat carīra kārthya vat eva tat mahita gatasya upapatsyate
translated: For if we could perceive anything belonging to the self in the body, then we could infer its omnipresence from the presence of pleasure, pain, etc. in another body.🔽But since the effect is only within one's own body and its movement is perceived in turn everywhere, it will be established that the self's presence is like the body's purpose.

original: a nyathā hi śarīramapi sarvagataṃ syā / tasmāccharīravadevāsya tatra tatra gamanāpatteḥ sutarāṃ sakriyatvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: nyathā hi śarīram api sarva gatam tasmāt śarīra vat eva asya tatra tatra gamana āpatteḥ sutarām sa kriya tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Otherwise, the body too would be omnipresent. Therefore, because it would follow that this [self] moves to each place like the body, it is even more reasonable to conclude that it is active.

analyzed: sandehaḥ vā astu sādhāraṇa anaikāntika tvāt
translated: Let there be doubt, because of the lack of a common property.

analyzed: āha ca
translated: And it is said:

analyzed: tatra uttaram na hi asati āgamane kim cit hirudvam iti
translated: The answer there is: without movement, nothing is perceived.

original: yeṣāṃ tu na tu tadeveti pāṭhaḥ teṣāṃ siddhāntavādyeva paryāyeṇa sarvatrātmakāryopacambhanamāgamana liṅgatveṣya viśiṣṭamāśaṅkayottaraṃ vadatīti granthayojanā /
analyzed: yeṣām tu na tu tat eva iti pāṭhaḥ teṣām siddhāntavādī eva paryāyeṇa sarvatra ātma kārya upacambhanam āgamana viśiṣṭam āśaṅkayā uttaram vadati iti grantha yojanā
translated: But for those whose reading is not that very same, the commentator on the conclusion himself raises the doubt that the self's purpose is accomplished everywhere in turn, and considers movement to be the distinguishing mark, and gives the answer. This is the plan of the text.

analyzed: katham punar idam uttaram na hi asatī āgamanā eti
translated: But how is this answer: without movement?

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For this is how:

original: pareṇāpi hi śakyaṃ vadituṃ na hi sati gamane kiṃ ciddiruddhamiti /
analyzed: pareṇa api hi śakyam vaditum na hi sati gamane kim cit diruddham iti
translated: For the opponent too can say that when there is movement, nothing is contradicted.

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: To this we reply:

original: parisaṃkhyārūpeṇā satyevāgamane na kiṃ ciddiruddhaṃ sati tu bahu viruddhamityāha /
analyzed: parisaṃkhyā rūpeṇa sati eva āgamane na kim cit viruddham sati tu bahu viruddham iti āha
translated: In the form of an exclusion, when there is no movement, nothing is contradicted. But when there is movement, much is contradicted. Thus he says:

analyzed: tat upavayete
translated: That is not possible.

original: yadā mūtānāmapi sūkṣmāṇāṃ candrādityaprakāśādīnāṃ na mṛ tpiṇḍādibhiḥ saha mitratvamupapadyate / tannayana vā mayanaṃ / tadā tmanaḥ svabhāvanātyantāmūrttasya jñānasaṃtānasya vā bhūtairmitvaṃ bhavediti kula etat /
analyzed: yadā mūtānām api sūkṣmāṇām candra āditya prakāśa ādīnām na mṛ t piṇḍa ādibhiḥ saha mitra tvam upapadyate vā tadā tmanaḥ sva bhāvanā atyanta amūrttasya jñāna saṃtānasya vā bhavet iti kule etat
translated: When even subtle things like the light of the moon and sun do not have friendship with clay balls etc., and there is no connection between them, then it is not possible for the self, which is completely immaterial by nature, or for the continuum of consciousness, to have friendship with material elements. This is the conclusion.

original: yopi syādvādī bahvātmanāṃ śarīrādatyantavyatirekālābhādastyeva mūrttatvaṃ jīvasyeti brūyāttasyāpi itaremarāśrayaprasaktiḥ miśratvānmūrttatvaṃ mūrttatvācca miśrabhāva iti /
analyzed: yaḥ api syādvādī bahu ātmanām śarīrāt atyanta vyatireka alābhāt asti eva mūrttatvam jīvasya iti brūyāt tasya api itara imara āśraya prasaktiḥ miśra tvāt mūrtta tvam mūrtta tvāt ca miśra bhāvaḥ iti
translated: Even if there were an opponent who, because of the non-apprehension of the complete separation of the self from the body etc., would say that the individual soul does indeed have materiality, even for him there would be the contingence of being a mixture, because of materiality, and because of being a mixture, there would be materiality.

original: ta smāt muktāvasthā nidarśanena ukṣaṇatosyā mūrttatvāt na śarīrasaṃparkanimittamūrttatvasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: ta smāt mukta avasthā nidarśanena ukṣaṇataḥ asyāḥ mūrtta tvāt na śarīra saṃparka nimitta mūrtta tva siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, because of the establishment of materiality by the example of the liberated state, the materiality caused by contact with the body is not established.

original: tataśca śarīrādanyaḥ senāsaṃpṛktaścāspatvācca anākṛṣyamāṇaḥ śarīraṃ gacchati tadgatākāśapradeśavadātmā paścānniḥsṛtastatraiva tiṣṭe /nna hi tasya vāyanā pṛthivyādibhirbī preraṇaṃ yena svatantraparaprerito vā gacchen/
analyzed: tatas ca śarīrāt anyaḥ senā saṃpṛktaḥ ca āspatvāt ca an ākṛṣyamāṇaḥ śarīram gacchati tad gata ākāśa pradeśa vat ātmā paścāt niḥsṛtaḥ tatra eva tiṣṭet na hi tasya preraṇam yena svatantra para preritaḥ vā gacchet
translated: And then, being different from the body, and being connected with the army, and being not drawn by the body, the soul goes to the place of the body, like the space in the place of the body, and having come out from there, it remains there only. For it has no motion by the earth etc., by which it would go either independently or impelled by another.

original: jvālāprabhṛtīnāṃ tu sparśavattvādvāyunā preryamāṇānāmulmukādinā vā nīyamānānāṃ yuktaṃ gamanam /
analyzed: jvālā prabhṛtīnām tu sparśavat tvāt vāyunā preryamāṇānām ulmuka ādinā vā nīyamānānām yuktam gamanam
translated: But in the case of flame etc., which are tangible, it is proper that they should go, being impelled by the wind or being carried by a firebrand etc.

original: tena kevalaṃ śarīraṃ gacchat acetanaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tena kevalam śarīram gacchat acetanam syāt
translated: Therefore, the mere body going would be insentient.

original: sarvagatatve tu yatra yatra gamyate tatra tatrātmānusyūtirasti iti yuktā caitanyānuvṛttiḥ /
analyzed: sarvagata tve tu yatra yatra gamyate tatra tatra ātma anusyūtiḥ asti iti yuktā caitanya anuvṛttiḥ
translated: But in the case of omnipresence, since it is present everywhere, it is proper that sentience should continue, since there is continuity of the soul wherever it goes.

analyzed: yathā pūrva ākāśa pradeśa tyāge sarva gata tvāt eva pa reṇa avakāśa dāna siddhiḥ
translated: Just as, when the previous space is abandoned, the subsequent space is established by omnipresence itself.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: jñāna saṃta ti pakṣaḥ tāvat nirākṛtaḥ
translated: the view of the continuity of knowledge has been refuted.

analyzed: tatra nityaḥ san ātmā śarīra abhyantara varttī
translated: There, being eternal, the soul is within the body.

original: yadā hyaṇamātra ātmā bhavati tadā yāvāneva pradeśa viśeṣadvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yadā hi aṇ mātraḥ ātmā bhavati tadā yāvān eva dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: For when the soul becomes atomic, then it is of the same size as the space in the body.

original: stanādhiṣṭhitaḥ tanmātragatānāmeva sukhaduḥkhādīnāmupalabdhiḥ prāpnoti / tamaścaikammin kṣaṇe śiraḥpādavedanānubhavo na syāt /
analyzed: stana dhiṣṭhitaḥ tanmātra gatānām eva sukha duḥkha ādīnām upalabdhiḥ prāpnoti tamaḥ ca ekammin kṣaṇe śiraḥ pāda vedanā anubhavaḥ na syāt
