translated: If the soul were located in the breasts, then the experience of pleasure, pain, etc. would be confined to those parts alone. And in one moment, there would be no experience of pain in the head and feet.

original: atha laghusaṃcāritvāttatra tatropacabhyataityucyate na tatra pramā pāmasti /
analyzed: atha laghu saṃcāri tvāt tatra tatra upacabhyate iti ucyate na tatra pramā
translated: If it is said that it is perceived there because it moves quickly, we have no proof of that.

original: na ca kālabhedo lakṣyane / anava sthitasyopalabdhikālāsaṃbhavānnaikatrāpyupalabhyeta tasmādakalpaneyam /
analyzed: na ca kāla bhedaḥ lakṣyane anava sthitasya upalabdhi kāla asaṃbhavāt na ekatra api upalabhyeta tasmāt akalpanā iyam
translated: And the difference in time cannot be observed, because for what is not permanently located, the time of perception is impossible, so it would not be perceived even in one place. Therefore, this is not to be imagined.

original: śarīrāvayavānāṃ cāpariśoṣaṇaṃ puṣṭyādi cātmādhiṣṭhitānāṃ bhavati mṛtāvasthāyāṃ viparyayadarśanā / ttatra ya evāvayavastenotsṛṣṭaḥ sa eva mṛtavacchuṣye /datha śarīraparimita āpaṇābhyupagamyate tatrāpi bara dṛṣṭaṃ kalpanīyam
analyzed: śarīra avayavānām ca a pariśoṣaṇam puṣṭi ādi ca ātma dhiṣṭhitānām bhavati mṛta avasthāyām viparyaya darśanāt tatra yaḥ eva avayavaḥ tena utsṛṣṭaḥ saḥ eva mṛta vat śuṣyet atha śarīra parimitaḥ āpaṇa abhyupagamyate tatra api bara dṛṣṭam kalpanīyam
translated: And the non-drying up of the parts of the body and nourishment, etc. occur when controlled by the soul, because the opposite is seen in the state of death. There, the very part that is abandoned by it dries up like a dead body. If the body is accepted to be limited, even there, what is seen should be imagined.

original: sarve hyavayavasadbhāvādayaḥ pratyakṣādyaviṣayāḥ santa utprekṣāmātrekarūyante te śavdavacceca pi pratyākhyeyāḥ /
analyzed: sarve hi avayava sadbhāva ādayaḥ pratyakṣa ādya viṣayāḥ santaḥ utprekṣā mātra ikarūyante te pratyākhyeyāḥ
translated: For all the parts of the body, existence, etc. are not objects of perception, etc., and are merely imagined. And like words, they should be rejected.

original: śarīramācāvadhikānāṃ caiṣāmutprekṣitu mapyānantyamaśakyaṃ na caiṣāṃ dravatvādinā vina kaścitsaṃśleṣa heturvidyane /
analyzed: śarīra mācau adhikānām ca eṣām utprekṣitu mapi ānantyam aśakyam na ca eṣām drava tva ādinā kaścid saṃśleṣa hetuḥ
translated: And for these, which are more than the body, even if their infinity is imagined, it is impossible to conceive, and there is no cause for their conjunction other than fluidity, etc.

analyzed: na ca asaṃśliṣṭānām eka jīva ārambha sāmardhyam
translated: And for those not conjoined, there is no capacity to produce a single living being.

original: sarvasaṃyogānāṃ ca viyogāvinābhūtatvād ghaṭāditulya kadā cijjīvasya pradhvaṃso bhavet /
analyzed: sarva saṃyogānām ca viyoga avinābhūta tvāt ghaṭa ādi tulya kadā cit jīvasya pradhvaṃsaḥ bhavet
translated: And since all conjunctions are inseparable from disjunction, the living being would sometimes be destroyed, like a pot, etc.

original: gātracchede ca tadarttināṃ jovāvayavānāṃ tato niḥstyāvaśiṣṭe śarīrabhāge punaḥ praveśa ityetadapramāṇakam /
analyzed: gātra chede ca tad arttinām jova avayavānām tatas niḥstyā avaśiṣṭe śarīra bhāge punar praveśaḥ iti etat apramāṇakam
translated: And in the case of cutting off a limb, the living being parts of those affected would re-enter the remaining part of the body - this is not supported by any means of valid knowledge.

original: yattu viyojitamātrāṇāṃ istādīnāṃ sphuraṇaṃ dṛṣṭaṃ / tada bhighāta preritavāyunimittamiti na tāvatā jīvākyavānuganirvijñāyate /
analyzed: yat tu viyojita mātrāṇām ista ādīnām sphuraṇam dṛṣṭam tat abhighāta prerita vāyu nimittam iti na tāvatā
translated: As for the throbbing seen in the separated heart, etc., that is caused by the wind impelled by the blow. It is not ascertained by that alone that the living being is conscious.

original: tathā sati saṃkocavikāsāveteṣāṃ bhavata ityatra tantravārtike /
analyzed: tathā sati saṃkoca vikāsau eteṣām bhavataḥ iti atra tantravārtike
translated: Thus, in the Tantravartika, it is said that contraction and expansion occur for these.

analyzed: na kim cit pramāṇam paśyāmaḥ
translated: We do not see any means of valid knowledge for that.

analyzed: dīpa prabhā prabhṛtīnām tu katham cit pratyavya tvāt upapadyete
translated: But for lamplight, etc., it is somehow possible due to their being momentary.

original: na ca pradīpaprabhāyāḥ saṃkoco bhavati bharāvādikādane śeṣaprabhāvināśādanāvṛtā hi jvālā S'tmasamīpe prabhāmaṇḍalamārabdhaṃ samarthā nācchāditā /
analyzed: na ca pradīpa prabhāyāḥ saṃkocaḥ bhavati bharāva ādika adane śeṣa prabhā vināśāt anāvṛtā hi jvālā stma samīpe prabhā maṇḍalam ārabdham samarthā na ācchāditā
translated: And the light of a lamp is not contracted by the presence of a covering, etc., because the remaining light is not destroyed. For a flame, when uncovered, is capable of producing a circle of light near itself, and is not obscured.

original: etenaiva ca vikāso 'pi pratyuktaḥ anyaeva hyavayavāstatra pracīyamānā vistāraṃ janayanti na tāvatāmeva vikāsaḥ /
analyzed: etena eva ca vikāsaḥ api pratyuktaḥ anye eva hi avayavāḥ tatra pracīyamānāḥ vistāram janayanti na tāvatām eva vikāsaḥ
translated: And by this very [argument] expansion is also refuted. For it is the very different parts that, when accumulated, produce extension, not the expansion of those very [parts].

original: sparśavatāṃ ca parasparadeśapratibandhāddeśāntaravyāptyā vikāso ghaṭate / jīvāvayavānāṃ tvamūrttatvātsarveṣāṃ samānadeśatvāvighātānnitya maṇumā tratvaprasaṅgaḥ syāt /
analyzed: sparśavatām ca paraspara deśa pratibandhāt deśa antara vyāptyā vikāsaḥ ghaṭate jīva avayavānām tu amūrtta tvāt sarveṣām samāna deśa tva avighātāt nitya maṇu mā tra tva prasaṅgaḥ syāt
translated: And expansion is possible by the pervasion of another place, because of the obstruction of the space of tangible [objects]. But for the parts of the soul, because of the immateriality, the impossibility of the constant minuteness would result from the non-obstruction of all being in the same place.

original: kathaṃ caikamya jīvasya putikā hastagarīraparimitā saṃkocavi kāsau yujyete /
analyzed: katham ca ekamya jīvasya putikā hasta garīra parimitā saṃkoca vi kāsau yujyete
translated: And how is the contraction and expansion of the soul, which is one, possible in the limited space of the body?

original: maraṇakāle cāntarābhavaśarīrasaṃcaraṇaṃ taccāsti kena citpratibandhena sadapi na gṛhyate / tena ca śarīrāntare jīvaniśśepa ityādi niṣpramāṇakam /
analyzed: maraṇa kāle ca antarābhava śarīra saṃcaraṇam tat ca asti kena cit pratibandhena sat api na gṛhyate tena ca śarīra antare jīva niśśepaḥ ityādi niṣpramāṇakam
translated: And the passing of the intermediate state body into the body at the time of death, and that it exists but is not perceived due to some obstruction, and the dependence of the soul on another body, etc., are all without evidence.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva gata tvam
translated: Therefore [the soul] is all-pervading.

analyzed: yat tu gyāmāka taṇḍula mātra ādi pradarśanam upaniṣatsu tākya antara pradarśita vibhu tvasya eva sataḥ svakṣma grahaṇa gocara tvāt
translated: As for the mention of giving only a handful of wild rice and so on in the Upanishads, it is because the omnipresence that has been shown by other commentaries is within the range of subtle perception.

analyzed: yat api dvaipāyanena uktam
translated: And what has been said by Dvaipayana:

original: aṣṭhamātraṃ puruṣaṃ niścakarṣa banādyama iti tadapi kāvyaśobhārthaṃ vimpraṣṭamṛtyavyavahāra praśaṃsanārthaṃ ca pativratāpraśaṃsāpare vākye prajāpativapotkhedanādivad draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: aṣṭha mātram puruṣam niścakarṣa banāt yamaḥ iti tat api kāvya śobhā artham ca pativratā praśaṃsā pare vākye prajāpati vapā utkhedana ādi vat draṣṭavyam
translated: He drew out the man of eight measures from the womb, that too should be seen as like the churning of the body of Prajapati and so on, in a sentence praising the chastity of a wife, for the purpose of praising the conduct of the one who is free from death and for the purpose of the beauty of poetry.

original: tathā hi tenaiva gītādiṣu anekaprakāraṃ savaigatatvaṃ varṇitam/
analyzed: tathā hi tena eva gīta ādiṣu aneka prakāram sa vaigata tvam varṇitam
translated: For thus, by him alone, in the Gita and so on, omnipresence of many kinds has been described.

original: nanu ca sarvagatatve vyomavatsarvaśarīreṣveka evātmā prāpnoti/
analyzed: nanu ca sarvagata tve vyoma vat sarva śarīreṣu ekaḥ eva ātmā prāpnoti
translated: But if he is omnipresent like space, then the self would be only one in all bodies.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: śarīra bhūya svāt pratiśaroram ca sukha duḥkha upalabdhi vyavasthā darśanāt
translated: Because the arrangement of the experience of pleasure and pain is seen to be according to the multiplicity of bodies.

analyzed: itarathā hi eka śaroreṇa eva caritārtha tvāt aneka śarīra vaiyarthyam syāt
translated: Otherwise, since the purpose would be served by only one body, many bodies would be useless.

analyzed: janma antara śarīra vat adoṣaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is no fault, like the bodies in other births, it is not so.

original: tatra kamāntaravaśenopabhogāntarārthaṃ punaḥ punarārambhātsarvaśarīragata khādyapana bdhiśca pratiśarīraṃ syāt /
analyzed: tatra kama antara vaśena upabhoga antara artham punar punar ārambhāt sarva śarīra gata khādi apana bdhiḥ ca pratiśarīram syāt
translated: There, due to the influence of other desires, for the sake of other enjoyments, the restriction of food and drink throughout the body would be for each individual body, due to the repeated commencement.

analyzed: anyadīyaiḥ ca indriyaiḥ śarīra antara gatasya ātmīya tvāt upalabdha randhava dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: And for one present in another body through other people's senses, there would be no selfhood, like the perception of the second foot.

analyzed: dhis ādīnām abhāvaḥ syāt
translated: And there would be no soul, etc.

analyzed: varṇa viśeṣa vyavasthayā ca karma codanā bhedaḥ na syāt
translated: And due to the restriction of specific colors, there would be no difference in the injunctions of actions.

analyzed: ekasya eva ātmanaḥ tena tena śarīreṇa saṃbadhyamānasya sarva varṇa upapatteḥ
translated: Because for one soul only, connected with this and that body, all colors are possible.

analyzed: ātma nānātve tu adoṣaḥ
translated: But in the plurality of souls, there is no fault.

analyzed: sarveṣām api ca sarvagata tve mūrti rahita tva ātma māna deśa vṛya virodhaḥ
translated: And in the case of all being all-pervading, there is contradiction due to the absence of a place occupied by the body, because of the absence of form.

analyzed: tad apekṣayā eva ca caitanya ātmaka tva ādya vibhāgāt ca upaniṣatsu aikātmya vyavahāraḥ
translated: And it is only in relation to that that the usage of oneness in the Upanishads is due to the absence of division in the form of consciousness.

analyzed: katham sarveṣām sarva śarīraiḥ saṃbandhāt anyadīya sukha duḥkha ādi anupalabdhiḥ
translated: But how, even in the absence of knowledge, is there non-perception of the happiness, sorrow, etc. of others due to the connection of all with all bodies?

analyzed: ke cit tāvat āhuḥ
translated: Some say this much:

original: śarīrapariṇātmavādino 'pi kincāyaṃ tulyo doṣastasyāpi garbhātma samānadeśatvānmāśejñastadgatāni sukhādīnyapalabheta /
analyzed: kinca ayam tulyaḥ doṣaḥ tasya api garbha ātma samāna deśa tvāt māśejñaḥ tad gatāni sukha ādīni apalabheta
translated: Even for those who believe the self to be transformed into the body, this same fault would apply. He too, being in the same place as the self in the womb, would perceive the pleasures etc. there.

original: tatra yastasya parihāraḥ sa sarvātmanāṃ sarvaśarīreṣu bhaviṣyatotyadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ tasya parihāraḥ sa sarva ātmanām sarva śarīreṣu
translated: The answer to that would be the same for all selves in all bodies, so it is not a fault.

original: yadyatropapattirucyeta na tu parapakṣamā myāpattirevopapatti / stasya ca tava cobhayorapyanyena parthyanuyogāt/
analyzed: yadi atrā upapattiḥ ucyeta na tu stasya ca tava ca ubhayoḥ api anyena parthyanuyogāt
translated: If an argument is stated here, but it is not an argument to refute the opponent's position. It is an argument for both him and you, because both are subject to the same objection by others.

analyzed: api ca tasya tvac indriya parimāṇa tvāt
translated: Moreover, because of the finiteness of his skin sense organ,

original: antaḥ śarīrākāśe bāhyavadevātmano 'nabhyupragama/nnaiva garbhaśarīreṇa mātṛkṣetrajñasya prāptirasti yena tudoṣatā sthāna /
analyzed: antar śarīra ākāśe bāhya vat eva ātmanaḥ garbha śarīreṇa mātṛ kṣetrajñasya prāptiḥ asti yena
translated: the self is not perceived in the space within the body as if it were external. The individual soul in the mother's body does not have contact with the fetus's body, by which there would be the fault of contact.

analyzed: tasmāt evam pariharttavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be answered like this:

original: yadi hyātmanaḥ sukhādīnāṃ ca samānadeśalakṣaṇa eva saṃbandha upabhogakāraṇamidhyeta tatoyaṃ doṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadi hi ātmanaḥ sukha ādīnām ca samāna deśa lakṣaṇaḥ eva saṃbandhaḥ upabhoga kāraṇam idhyeta tatas yam doṣaḥ syāt
translated: If the relation of the self and pleasures etc. were only in the same place and were the cause of experience, then this fault would arise.

original: iha tu cakṣurādīnāmiva kṣetrajñayogyatālakṣaṇaḥ saṃbadha / stana yathaiva tvagindriyeṇa sparśasamānadeśānāmapi rūpāḍhīnāmagrahaṇam / evamanyenātmanānyadīyadharmmādharmmopāttasakhaduḥkhādyagrahaṇam/🔽tasmādātmavādoktakhasvābhibhāvavyavasthānādadoṣaḥ/
analyzed: iha tu cakṣuḥ ādīnām iva kṣetrajña yogyatā lakṣaṇaḥ yathā eva tvac indriyeṇa sparśa samāna deśānām api rūpa āḍhīnām agrahaṇam evam anyena ātmanā anyadīya dharmma adharma upātta sakha duḥkha ādya grahaṇam  tasmāt ātmavāda ukta kha sva abhibhāva vyavasthānāt adoṣaḥ
translated: But here, like the eye etc., the relation is characterized by the fitness of the experiencer. Just as by the skin sense organ, even objects of the same place as touch are not grasped, so by another self, the happiness, sorrow etc. obtained by the virtues and vices belonging to another are not grasped.🔽Therefore, there is no fault due to the establishment of the self's own manifestation as stated in the doctrine of the self.

analyzed: evam sarva gata tvāt sivam ātmanaḥ niśca la tvam
translated: Thus, due to being all-pervading, the self's non-apprehension is established.

analyzed: atha yava dāna samavetam āsīt tatas āha
translated: Now, if it existed as connected with the body, he says:

analyzed: tat vinaṣṭam iti
translated: That is destroyed.

analyzed: na ca tasya avināśaḥ tad viparīta dravya antara upannambhāt
translated: And it is not indestructible, because of the appearance of another substance contrary to it.

original: na cāsya gra pratibandhahetuḥ kaścidasti yena na gṛhyeta /
analyzed: na ca asya pratibandha hetuḥ kaścid asti yena na gṛhyeta
translated: And there is no cause of obstruction to its apprehension by which it would not be grasped.

original: athārthāpatyā gra haṇapratibandhādi kalpyeta tathā'pi satyapūrvāhahunaramadṛṣṭaṃ dṛṣṭaviparītaṃ ca kalpayitavyaṃ tāvada vinaṣṭamāste/
analyzed: atha artha apatyāḥ haṇa pratibandha ādi kalpyeta tathā api dṛṣṭa viparītam ca kalpayitavyam tāvat a vinaṣṭam āste
translated: If, even so, the cause of obstruction to apprehension is imagined due to presumption, then even so, an unseen thing prior to that and contrary to what is seen would have to be imagined as remaining destroyed.

original: tathā na dṛśyate tathā pratibandhahetuḥ /🔽tasyāpyadarśana nimittaṃ cetyevaṃ tasya tasyānyadityavyavasthā /
analyzed: tathā na dṛśyate tathā pratibandha hetuḥ 🔽tasya api adarśana nimittam ca iti evam tasya tasya anyat iti avyavasthā
translated: It is not seen in that way, and there is a cause of obstruction in that way.🔽And if the cause of its non-apprehension is another, then there is no establishment of that.

original: tathā kṣaṇikasya karmmaṇaḥ sthānamanupalavdhikāraṇaṃ ca kalpyamityatigauravam /
analyzed: tathā kṣaṇikasya karmmaṇaḥ sthānam anupalabdhi kāraṇam ca kalpyam iti ati gauravam
translated: Similarly, for an instantaneous action, a place and a cause of non-perception would have to be postulated, which is too complicated.

analyzed: evam anāśrita kamrma avasthāna kalpanāyām
translated: Thus, in postulating the duration of action without a substratum.

analyzed: atha ātma āśritam eva saṃyoga vibhāgau akurvat āsīt tatra api dvaṣṭa viparyaya adṛṣṭa kalpane sthānām
translated: If it existed as dependent on the self itself, producing conjunction and disjunction, there too, the postulation of duration would be like postulating the unseen by reversing what is seen.

original: tasmādaramapūrvakalpana meveti siḍūṃ mūnādhikaraṇaprayojanam /🔽dravyādīnāṃ phannasaṃvandhe teṣāmadṛṣṭārthatvātkarmmaṇāmiva pratinidhyabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt aram apūrva kalpanam meva iti  dravya ādīnām phanna saṃvandhe teṣām adṛṣṭa artha tvāt karmmaṇām iva pratinidhi abhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, the purpose of the section is established as simply not postulating anything new.🔽When substances etc. are related to the whole, they are for an unseen purpose, like actions, so there is no substitute.

original: karmmaphanna saṃbandhe tu dravyādaḥ karmotpattyā ''dṛṣṭārthatvātmamāna kāryyatvajñānādasti pratini dhiḥ /
analyzed: karma phanna saṃbandhe tu dravyādaḥ karma utpattyā dṛṣṭārtha tva ātma māna kāryya tva jñānāt asti pratini dhiḥ
translated: But when actions are related to the whole, substances etc. are for an unseen purpose by the production of the action, so there is a substitute due to the knowledge of being an effect.

analyzed: katham tarhi pūrvapakṣavādinaḥ prakrānta aparisamāpti doṣa abhāvaḥ
translated: How then is there no fault of incompleteness of what has been begun for the proponents of the prima facie view?

original: samāpanīyameva karmma yena kena cid dravyeṇa /
analyzed: samāpanīyam eva karmma yena kena cit dravyeṇa
translated: The action is to be completed by some substance or other.

original: sadṛśopādane tu na yatitavyaṃ sahabhādapi phanāprāptaḥ / karmaṇaścāvihitasādhana vi śeṣasyānapekṣitasadṛśacādyena kena citsiddhena ca tatpūrve dravyasya pratinidhirityucyate anyārthatvāt asādṛśyāca /
analyzed: sadṛśa upādane tu na yatitavyam karmaṇaḥ ca avihita sādhana vi śeṣasya anapekṣita sadṛśa ca ādyena kena cid siddhena ca tad pūrve dravyasya pratinidhiḥ iti ucyate anya artha tvāt asādṛśyāt ca
translated: But when a similar substance is used, no effort need be made, as the result is obtained even from a co-existent substance. And a substitute for the original substance is said to be used when the particular means of an action is not prescribed, and when the result is accomplished by something else not requiring a similar substance.

original: pūrvadravyaṃ hi phannādyapravṛttamāsīdidānīmānīyamānaṃ tu pratyavāyaparihārāya dvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: pūrva dravyam hi phanna ādya pravṛttam āsīt idānīm ānīyamānam tu pratyavāya parihārāya dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: For the original substance was not used for the result etc., but now it is brought in to avoid a transgression.

analyzed: naimittika phalāya vā pravṛtasya karmaṇaḥ siddhi artham iti
translated: Or for the sake of accomplishing an action that has been undertaken for the sake of the result of a rite.

analyzed: nāmadheya siddhiḥ api prayojanam eva
translated: The establishment of a name is also a purpose.

analyzed: sā te pūrva ukta tvāt na pradarśitā
translated: That is not shown because it has been mentioned before.

analyzed: ākhyāta tva aviśeṣeṇa bhūtaiḥ bhavya artha janmanaḥ
translated: Even though there is no difference in being denoted by verbs, the future is born for the sake of the present.

analyzed: siddhe ca sādhya tā śaktaḥ sarva ākhyāta pradhāna tā
translated: And when that is established, the potency to be accomplished is the predominance of all verbs.

analyzed: nāma ākhyāta artha saṃbandhe yat aklṛpta prayojanam
translated: That which has no established purpose in the connection of the meaning of the name with the meaning of the verb,

analyzed: tasya adṛṣṭārtha tā yuktā na itarasya apramāṇikā
translated: it is proper that it should have an unseen purpose, not the other, which is not authoritative.

original: tu yadravyaṃ na cikīyete tāni pradhānaTHIS bhūtāni dravyasya guṇabhūtatvāt
analyzed: tu yad dravyam na cikīyete tāni bhūtāni dravyasya guṇa bhūta tvāt
translated: But those substances which are not to be used, those primary substances are subordinate to the substance, because of being subordinate to the substance.

original: yaiḥ karmmabhirdravyaṃ svarūpato dharmmato vā na karttumiṣyate yathā prayājādibhiḥ tāni svasādhanāni prati pradhānabhūtatvād adṛṣṭārthāni bhavanti
analyzed: yaiḥ karmmabhiḥ dravyam svarūpataḥ dharmmataḥ vā na karttum iṣyate yathā prayāja ādibhiḥ tāni sva sādhanāni prati pradhāna bhūta tvāt adṛṣṭa arthāni bhavanti
translated: Those acts by which a substance is not intended to be made either in its own form or in its properties, like the Prayāja etc., are for the sake of unseen results with regard to their own means, because they are principal.

original: pradhāne hi śrutaṃ dravyaṃ nāṅgadravyasya bādhakam /
analyzed: pradhāne hi śrutam dravyam na aṅga dravyasya bādhakam
translated: For in the principal, the substance mentioned does not obstruct the substance of the subsidiary.

analyzed: prayāja ijyā ājyavat tena intau syāt brohya bādhanam
translated: Therefore, in the Injunction, there would be the obstruction of the Brīhi by the Vāja.

original: nanu ca pūrvapaḍho 'pi pradhānaprayukta śrī hyāśrayatvena prakṛtāvaprayojakatvātprayaṅgave carau pradhānenāgṛhyamāṇān brocīnavaghāto na labhate /
analyzed: nanu ca pradhāna prayukta hi āśraya tvena prakṛtau aprayojaka tvāt prayaṅgave carau pradhānena agṛhyamāṇān brocīn avaghātaḥ na labhate
translated: But even in the former view, the Vāja is not obtained for the striking of the Brīhi, because it is not grasped by the principal, the two sacrificial ladles, since it is not a prompter in the preparation by way of being the substratum.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: The first section of the second chapter.

analyzed: tulyaḥ hi śākhā ādi āga avaghātayoḥ
translated: For the connection with Brīhi is the same for the cutting of the branches etc. and the striking of the Vāja.

analyzed: vājina ijyā ādi tunyam ca na aprayojaka lacaṇam
translated: And the Vāja is not a non-prompter in the Jyotiṣṭoma.

analyzed: dharma mātre tu karma syāt anirvṛtteḥ prayāja vat
translated: But in the case of mere properties, there would be an act, because of non-completion, like the Prayāja.

analyzed: sruc paridhi agni puroḍāśa saṃmārgāṇām uttara uttara pradhāna pratyāsatti bhedena udāharaṇa pṛthakkam
translated: The Sruk, Paridhi, Agni, and Puroḍāśa are cited separately by the difference of the proximity to the principal in the order of their mention.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: tatra pūrvapakṣavādī pūrvoktenaiva yaidravyaṃ na cikīrghya ityanena pradhānakarmmalakṣaṇenāca dravyeṇa niṣpāditaṃ kammaṃ na kiṃ cittasya pratyupakurva dṛśyate /
analyzed: tatra pūrvapakṣa vādī pūrvoktena eva yaiḥ dravyam na cikīrghyaḥ iti anena dravyeṇa niṣpāditam kammam na kim cittasya dṛśyate
translated: There, the proponent of the prima facie view, by the very same reason stated earlier, that the substance is not intended, and by the characteristic of the principal action indicated by the word 'not', the action accomplished by the substance is not seen to serve any purpose of the mind.

analyzed: tasmāt pradhāna karmma saṃmārga prokṣaṇa ādi iti
translated: Therefore, the principal action is the act of sweeping, sprinkling, etc.

analyzed: anyatas siddha śeṣāṇām yeṣām dṛṣṭā upakāri tā
translated: For those whose assistance is seen in what is accomplished elsewhere,

analyzed: teṣām na apūrvam asti iti inti ādīnām udāhṛtiḥ
translated: they do not have an unseen result. This is an example of the offerings, etc.

analyzed: tat nāma pramāṇam yuktam yat ekāntikam
translated: That is said to be a valid means of knowledge which is absolute.

original: anaikāntikī ca prādhānye dvitīyā / guṇabhūtadravyopadeśe'pi hṛṣṭatvātmaktūn juhotīti /
analyzed: anaikāntikī ca prādhānye dvitīyā guṇa bhūta dravya upadeśe api hṛṣṭa tvāt saktūn juhoti iti
translated: And in the case of the principal action, the second is inconclusive. Even in the teaching of a substance that is subordinate, due to the presence of joy, one offers oblations with the darbha grass.

analyzed: tathā prayāja śeṣeṇa havīṃṣi abhidhārayati iti antareṇa api dvitīyām ājya prādhānyam dṛṣṭam
translated: Similarly, in 'one should consecrate the oblations with the remainder of the prayāja', even without the second case, the primacy of the clarified butter is seen.

analyzed: atas śrī navanti iti atra ubhaya saṃbhave pi upakāra darśana kṛtam eva dravya prādhānyam
translated: Therefore, in 'one who desires heaven should offer the darbha grass', even though both are possible, the primacy of the substance is due only to the seen assistance,

analyzed: na dvitīyā kṛtam
translated: not due to the second case.

analyzed: na ca tat saṃmāgam prokṣaṇa ādiṣu asti iti iha api dvitīyayā dravyam eva upadiśyatām iti
translated: And that is not present in the case of sweeping, sprinkling, etc. Therefore, even here, let the substance alone be indicated by the second case.

analyzed: na tad artha tvāt loka vat tasya ca śeṣa bhūta tvāt
translated: Not so, because it is for that purpose, like in ordinary usage, and because that is subordinate.

analyzed: tiṣṭhatu tāvat prayogaḥ
translated: Let the application remain for now.

analyzed: kim kāraṇam
translated: What is the reason?

original: yadi hyācārasyaikarūpyaṃ bhavennaiva smṛtayaḥ prayatnena dhāran /
analyzed: yadi hi ācārasya aikarūpyam bhavet nā eva smṛtayaḥ prayatnena dhāran
translated: For if there were uniformity in practice, the Smritis would not be carefully preserved with effort.

original: sa eva tu saṃkīrṇatvādasphuṭaḥ smaraṇena pratipācyate /
analyzed: saḥ eva tu saṃkīrṇa tvāt asphuṭaḥ smaraṇena pratipācyate
translated: But that itself, being mixed, is unclear and is clarified by memory.

analyzed: smaryate ca dvitīyāyāḥ prādhānyam arthaḥ  karmmaṇi dvitīyā karttuḥ īkṣitatamam karma iti
translated: And the secondary nature of the accusative is remembered.🔽The accusative is the most desired object of the verb, as stated in The accusative is the most desired object of the verb.

original: tathā lokavedayoḥ prayujyate ghaṭaṃ karoti brījīnavaintīti /
analyzed: tathā loka vedayoḥ prayujyate ghaṭam karoti brījīnavaintī iti
translated: And it is used in both ordinary usage and the Vedas, as in He makes a pot, he cooks rice, he prepares vegetables.

original: yāni ca loka vyabhicārāśaṅkāsthānāni tānyudāharati /🔽taṇḍulānodanaṃ paca balbajān śikhaṇḍakān kuru tasantravārtike/
analyzed: yāni ca vyabhicāra āśaṅkā sthānāni tāni udāharati  taṇḍulān odanam paca balbajān śikhaṇḍakān kuru tasantravārtike
translated: And he cites the places where there is doubt of contradiction in ordinary usage:

analyzed: paḍunānadya
translated: He cooks rice with rice, he prepares vegetables with vegetables, he grinds with a stone, he cuts with a knife.

original: taṇḍulairbalvajairiti ca prayoktavye yā dvitīyā prayujyate tannūnaṃ tṛtīyā samānārthā seti gamyate /
analyzed: taṇḍulaiḥ balvajaiḥ iti ca prayoktavye yā dvitīyā prayujyate tat nūnam tṛtīyā samāna arthā sā iti gamyate
translated: He cooks rice with rice, he prepares vegetables with vegetables - when the accusative is used, it is understood that the third case having the same meaning is used.

analyzed: tatra ucyate
translated: To that, it is said:

original: yadā padārthāntarabhūtaudanaśikhaṇḍakrasādhanatvena taṇḍujabalvajā vivacyante tadā tṛtīyāntapadabhājo bhavanti /
analyzed: yadā taṇḍu ja balvajāḥ vivacyante tadā tṛtīyā anta pada bhājaḥ bhavanti
translated: When rice and barley are meant as the means of accomplishing the cooked rice and barley which are different from the other ingredients, then they become components of the accusative case.

original: yadā tu bhojanayogyaudanāvasthā pariṇatirūpeṇa taṇḍulā māīvotpatyarthaṃ ca śikhaṇḍakā kāreṇa balvajā dṛśyante /
analyzed: yadā tu bhojana yogya odana avasthā pariṇati rūpeṇa taṇḍulāḥ māīva utpati artham ca śikhaṇḍakā kāreṇa balvajāḥ dṛśyante
translated: But when the rice is seen in the form of a transformation into the state of cooked food fit for eating, and the barley in the form of the barley grains for the purpose of producing the barley,

original: tathā vedavākyāvagataguṇabhāvāśca te dravyamādhanake 'gnihotre sukhaṇḍitāstiṣṭhanto ramaṇīyatvātkasyāścid brāhmaṇyāḥ svakarmmaśobhādarśanārthaṃ taṇḍunnā homasaṃbadhitvenābhipretāḥ /
analyzed: tathā veda vākya avagata guṇa bhāvāḥ ca te dravya mādhanake gnihotre su khaṇḍitāḥ tiṣṭhantaḥ ramaṇīya tvāt kasyāścid brāhmaṇyāḥ sva karmma śobhā darśana artham taṇḍunnāḥ homa saṃbadhi tvena abhipretāḥ
translated: and they are also understood as having the nature of accessories through the Vedic statements, they remain well-arranged in the Agnihotra sacrifice which has substances as its means, for the purpose of showing the beauty of one's own action like some beautiful Brahmin woman. They are intended to be connected with the oblation through the rice grains.

original: saivaṃ preṣyati guṇakāmā vā yajamāna taṇḍunnāndya juhudhīti / tadā dvitīyārthabhākkaṃ bhavati bhavati hi loke bahuprakārā vivaśceti /
analyzed: sā evam preṣyati guṇa kāmā vā yajamāna taṇḍun nāndya juhudhi iti tadā dvitīya artha bhākkam bhavati bhavati hi loke bahu prakārā
translated: Thus she instructs: O sacrificer, desiring the accessory, offer the oblations of rice grains. Then it becomes a component of the accusative case, for there are many kinds of statements in the world.

original: guṇabhūte 'pyarthe kena ci tkāraṇena kaścitprādhānyāṃśo vivacyate tathā pradhānabhūteṣu guṇāṃśaḥ /
analyzed: guṇa bhūte pi arthe kena cit kāraṇena kaścid prādhānya aṃśaḥ vivacyate tathā pradhāna bhūteṣu guṇa aṃśaḥ
translated: Even in a subordinate meaning, some part of the primary meaning is sometimes stated to be primary, and similarly, in the primary meanings, the subordinate part.

analyzed: kaḍhā cit ubhau cit na ubhau
translated: Sometimes both, sometimes neither.

original: na ca yadvivacyate ta cchabdenā bhidhātavyamityasti pramāṇaṃ / vivakṣāsaṃpattyarthaṃ tu lakṣaṇādyupāyāntarāśrayaṇaṃ na svārthatyāgaḥ /
analyzed: na ca yat vivacyate tat śabdena abhidhātavyam iti asti pramāṇam vivakṣā saṃpatti artham tu lakṣaṇa ādi upāya antara āśrayaṇam na svārtha tyāgaḥ
translated: And there is no proof that what is denoted by the word cannot be denoted by the word itself. But in order to accomplish the speaker's intention, one resorts to other means such as definition, not abandoning one's own meaning.

analyzed: tasmāt prādhānyam eva dvitīya arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the secondary meaning is indeed the primary meaning itself.

analyzed: katham tu sakka ādiṣu guṇa tvam iti
translated: But how can it be a quality in the case of saktu etc.?

original: taducyate🔽dvitīyā tāvatkarmatvaṃ pradhāna rūpamātmaśaktyā vadati tatvica bannavratā kāraṇāntareṇa virudhyamānatvānnāśrīyate /
analyzed: tat ucyate  dvitīyā tāvat karma tvam pradhāna rūpam ātma śaktyā vadati kāraṇa antareṇa virudhyamāna tvāt na āśrīyate
translated: That is said:🔽First, the secondary case ending denotes the nature of being the object of an action as the primary meaning. But that is not accepted because it is contradicted by another cause.

original: tena tū kāraka viśeṣātmakatvādyatkārakamāmānyamavinābhūtaṃ ucyate tada dvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: tena tu kāraka viśeṣa ātmaka tvāt yat kārakam āmānyam avinābhūtam ucyate dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: But because it has the nature of a particular case, whatever general case is said to be inseparable,

analyzed: viruddha tvāt vivacyate
translated: it is distinguished due to contradiction.

original: tatraitāvānartho vijñāyate homasya kārakaṃ saktava iti /
analyzed: tatra etāvān arthaḥ vijñāyate homasya kārakam saktavaḥ iti
translated: In that, this much meaning is understood: saktu is the instrument of homa.

original: na ca sāmānya nirviśeṣa vyavahārakṣamamiti viśeṣāpeśśāyāṃ karaṇatvaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: na ca sāmānya nirviśeṣa vyavahāra kṣamam iti viśeṣa apeśśāyām karaṇa tvam bhaviṣyati
translated: And a general thing without particulars cannot be used in discourse. Therefore, when there is consideration of particulars, it will be the nature of an instrument.

analyzed: dravyāṇām karmma saṃyogaḥ eti bhūta bhavya mamuccāraṇa nyāyāt
translated: By the rule of the connection of substances with actions, it will be the nature of an instrument.

original: kathaṃ punaḥ saktuprādhānya vivakṣā viru dhyate /
analyzed: katham punar saktu prādhānya vivakṣā viru dhyate
translated: But how is the intention of saktu being the primary meaning contradicted?

original: tatrāha🔽yasya hi dravyasya va cidupayogo nirvṛtto bhaviṣyatīti vā 'vadhārthyate tatsaṃskārāītvātkarmma prati prādhānyaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: tatra āha  yasya hi dravyasya cit upayogaḥ nirvṛttaḥ bhaviṣyati iti vā tad saṃskāra aī tvāt karmma prati prādhānyam pratipadyate
translated: To this he says:🔽For that substance whose use has been accomplished or is desired to be accomplished, because it is to be consecrated, it becomes primary with respect to the action.

original: yatpunarnopayuktaṃ nopayocyate vā tasya saṃskāro niṣprayojana iti tadvidhānavākyānarthakyaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: yat punar na upayuktam na upayā ucyate vā tasya saṃskāraḥ niṣprayojanaḥ iti tad vidhāna vākya ānarthakya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: But for that which is not used or is not being used, its consecration is purposeless, so there would be the consequence of the uselessness of the injunction of that.

original: tecāmo saktavo na homātprāgupayujyante nova bhamma mādbhāvādbhasma viniyogavacanābhāvācca /
analyzed: saktavaḥ na homāt prāk upayujyante na uva bhamma māt bhāvāt bhasma viniyoga vacana abhāvāt ca
translated: And those barley grains are not used before the oblation, nor after the oblation, because of the absence of an injunctive statement for ashes.

original: tasamastaṃ vākyamanarthakaṃ bhavata dvitīyā vā lakṣaṇa /
analyzed: vākyam anarthakam bhavata dvitīyā vā
translated: So the entire sentence becomes useless, or the second is a figurative indication.

original: vṛtteti / sthita tvāhedaprāmāṇyasya lakṣaṇā grahītavyā /🔽mukhyārthaprayogo dyotsargikatvādapavādadarśanena bhrāntitvaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: vṛttā iti sthita tva aha idam prāmāṇyasya lakṣaṇā grahītavyā  mukhya artha prayogaḥ bhrānti tvam pratipadyate
translated: Having said this, the indication of invalidity should be accepted.🔽The application of the primary meaning becomes mistaken due to the appearance of an exception, because it is optional.

analyzed: sarvatra eva lakṣaṇa āśrayaṇam ānarthakya prasaṅga nimittam
translated: In every case, the reliance on figurative indication leads to the consequence of uselessness.

analyzed: anyathā mukhya artha upapatteḥ
translated: Otherwise, because the primary meaning is possible.

original: tena virodhātmaktu sādhanakahoma vidhānaṃ prakaraṇasaṃbandhi gṛhyate /
analyzed: tena virodha ātmaktu sādhanaka homa vidhānam prakaraṇa saṃbandhi gṛhyate
translated: Therefore, due to contradiction, the injunction of the oblation with the means is taken as connected with the context.

original: nanu saktūnāmapi iti homavantaḥ saktatropi jyotiṣṭomasyopakṛtyārthavanto bhavivyantītyāha /
analyzed: nanu saktūnām api iti homavantaḥ saktatraḥ upi jyotiṣṭomasya upakṛtya arthavantaḥ bhavivyanti iti āha
translated: But even in the case of barley-meal, the Jyotiṣṭoma, along with the oblations, will serve a useful purpose by helping the barley-meal.

original: siddhāntavādī tu chanjena homasādhanībhūtānāme vārthavattvamabhyupagacchati ko vā brūne neti /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī tu chanjena homa sādhanībhūtānām e vā arthavat tvam abhyupagacchati kaḥ vā na iti
translated: The upholder of the conclusion, however, accepts the usefulness of the barley-meal only as a means of accomplishing the oblation through the barley-meal. Who can say no?

analyzed: sarvatra eva ca
translated: And in every case,

analyzed: yathā homaḥ kriyā ātmaka tvāt kim iti apekṣamāṇaḥ pradhāna kathaṃbhā tantra vārtika
translated: just as the oblation, being of the nature of an action, requires the question why?, and is accepted as a subsidiary to the Jyotiṣṭoma by the Jyotiṣṭoma's how?

original: venetya manugrā cakatvena gṛhyate naivaṃ dravyam /
analyzed: gṛhyate na evam dravyam
translated: The substance is not accepted in the same way.

analyzed: na ca tasmāt adṛṣṭaka rūpanā kriyā nirvarttya tvāt apūrvāṇām
translated: And it is not because of that that the unseen results are accomplished by the action, because the unseen results are to be accomplished by the action.

original: yatrāpi tāvad dravyaṃ sājhātphalāya caudyate yathā godohanena paśukāma iti tatrāpyanyaprayojanakriyādvāramantareṇa nāpūrvaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra api tāvat dravyam yathā godohanena paśu kāmaḥ iti tatra api anya prayojana kriyā dvāram antareṇa na apūrvam bhaviṣyati
translated: Even in the case where the substance is enjoined for a shared result, like One desiring cattle should offer with the milking of the cow, even there the unseen result will not occur without the door of an action having another purpose.

original: kimuna yadā na kasya cidaṅgatvena saktavaḥ śrūyante /
analyzed: yadā na kasya cit aṅga tvena saktavaḥ śrūyante
translated: What then when the barley-meal is not heard as a subsidiary to anything?

analyzed: na ca kim cit kalpanā pramāṇam asti
translated: And there is no means of knowledge in the form of assumption.

analyzed: dvitīyā iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is the second,

analyzed: na hi iti uttaram
translated: the answer is no, because it is not so.

original: dvitīyā hi saktūnāṃ prādhānyaṃ vadantī homaṃ tadarthaṃ kuryyānna saktubhyo 'pūrvamiti pravipattim /
analyzed: dvitīyā hi saktūnām prādhānyam vadantī homam tad artham kuryyāt na saktubhyaḥ pūrvam iti pravipattim
translated: For the second case would indicate the primacy of the barley-meal, and would lead one to perform the oblation for that purpose, not for the barley-meal to produce an unseen result.

analyzed: tena dvitīyā prasādāt bhavet ḍomaḥ
translated: Therefore, by the favor of the second case, the oblation would have barley-meal as its purpose.

analyzed: katham nāma homa vyāptāḥ saktavaḥ syuḥ iti
translated: How could the barley-meal be pervaded by the oblation?

analyzed: na anyammai prayojanā yā śravaṇa
translated: There is no other purpose for the hearing.

original: te cāmo bhavanti home kute saktavo homasambadvā iti prāgeva prayojanalābhātparthyavasitā dvitīyā niṣprayojaneṣvapi / homaṃ prati prādhānyamātreṇa karmmatva siddheḥ /
analyzed: te ca amaḥ bhavanti home saktavaḥ homa sambadvāḥ iti prāk eva prayojana lābhāt parthyavasitā dvitīyā niṣprayojaneṣu api homam prati prādhānya mātreṇa karmma tva siddheḥ
translated: And they become in the oblation, how are the barley-meal connected with the oblation? Even before the attainment of the purpose, the second case is concluded even in the purposeless, because the nature of being an action is established merely by primacy with respect to the oblation.

original: tatra siddhe vākyārthe paścānna puruṣasya kratorvopayujyantaiti jñātvā tadvacanādvā'dṛṣṭaṃ kalpyeta prādhānyajñānaṃ vā bhrāntiriti /
analyzed: tatra siddhe vākya arthe paścāt na puruṣasya kratoḥ vā upayujyante eti jñātvā tad vacanāt vā adṛṣṭam kalpyeta prādhānya jñānam vā bhrāntiḥ iti
translated: There, when the meaning of the sentence is established, they are not useful to the person or the sacrifice afterwards. Knowing this, an unseen result would be imagined from that statement, or the knowledge of primacy would be a mistake.

analyzed: tatra ai
translated: There, that is not so.

analyzed: na tad vacanāt śakyam anyat kalpayitum iti
translated: It is not possible to imagine anything else from that statement.

analyzed: nyāyyā
translated: The primacy is proper.

original: tataśva tṛtīyārthasiddiriti matvā mahābhāṣyakāreṇoktaṃ tṛtīyāyāḥ sthāne dvitīyeti /
analyzed: tatas ca tṛtīyā artha siddiḥ iti matvā mahābhāṣya kāreṇa uktam tṛtīyāyāḥ sthāne dvitīyā iti
translated: And from that, the meaning of the third case is established. Thinking this, the author of the Mahābhāṣya said that the second case should be used in place of the third.

original: tena vaiṣamyaṃ homasaṃmārgayoḥ / saktūnāṃ niṣprayojanatvena tadarthatvātpuroḍāmādeśvānyaśeṣabhāvena parthyagnikaraṇa/disaṃskārāītvāt /
analyzed: tena vaiṣamyam homa saṃmārgayoḥ saktūnām niṣprayojana tvena tad artha tvāt puroḍāma ādeḥ ca anya śeṣa bhāvena parthyagnikaraṇa di saṃskāra aītvāt
translated: Therefore, there is a difference between the Homa and the Sammārga. The Saktu being purposeless, it is for that purpose, while the Puruṣa is a subsidiary to something else, and the Pārthāgnikaraṇa is a sanctification.

original: dṛḍhe ca śāstrārthe 'vasthite dṛṣṭopakārābhāve'pyadṛṣṭa kalpanā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dṛḍhe ca śāstra arthe vasthite dṛṣṭa upakāra abhāve pi adṛṣṭa kalpanā bhaviṣyati
translated: And when the meaning of the scripture is firm and established, even in the absence of an apparent benefit, an unseen one will be assumed.

original: loke'pyadṛṣṭārthāḥ saṃskārā ācārādgamyanta yathā gra/māntarādāgatānāṃ śāntyarthamagninnavaṇadadhyaścataprabhṛteḥ śirasa uparibhrāmaṇaṃ śacideśapratiṣṭhāpanaṃ ca /
analyzed: loke api adṛṣṭa arthāḥ saṃskārāḥ ācārāt gamyanta yathā grama antarāt āgatānām śānti artham agni nnavaṇa dadhyaścata prabhṛteḥ śirasaḥ upari bhrāmaṇam śaci deśa pratiṣṭhāpanam ca
translated: Even in the world, sanctifications with unseen purpose are understood from practice, just like the whirling of fire, curd, etc. over the head and the placing on the head of a pure place for those who have come from another village for the sake of peace.

analyzed: na ca asya anupapattiḥ ācāra prāmāṇyāt
translated: And there is no inconsistency in this, because of the authoritativeness of practice.

analyzed: tena adṛṣṭa arthānām api tulya śruti tva ātmikaḥ guṇa bhāvaḥ
translated: Therefore, even for those with unseen purpose, there is a quality of equality in the Vedic text.

original: nanvevaṃ sati sarvatra prayojanavattā kṛtameva dravyaprādhānyamiti na vaktavyaṃ dvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: nanu evam sati sarvatra prayojanavat tā kṛtam eva dravya prādhānyam iti na vaktavyam dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: If that is so, then everywhere the purposefulness is accomplished, and the predominance of the substance need not be stated.

original: mulya śrutitvāditi / darśayitavye vā yatra prayojanavattā nirapekṣaṃ dvitīyākṛtameva prādhānyaṃ kevalaṭatīyākṛto vā guṇabhāva iti /
analyzed: śruti tvāt iti darśayitavye vā yatra prayojanavat tā nirapekṣam dvitīyā kṛtam eva prādhānyam kevala ṭatīyā kṛtaḥ vā guṇa bhāvaḥ iti
translated: Because of the direct statement of the price. Or it should be shown where the primary nature is solely due to the accusative case, independent of the presence of a purpose, or the subordinate nature is solely due to the instrumental case.

original: taducyate /🔽prādhānyaṃ tāvadaindryā gāīpatyamupatiṣṭhataityatra liṅgādindrārthatvāvagateḥ gāīpatyaikavākyatvācca tātmādhana kendropasthānaprasaṅge kevala dvitīyākṛtameva gāīpatyaprādhānyam /
analyzed: tat ucyate  prādhānyam tāvat aindryā gāīpatyam upatiṣṭhate iti atra liṅgāt indra artha tva avagateḥ gāīpatya ekavākya tvāt ca kevala dvitīyā kṛtam eva gāīpatya prādhānyam
translated: That is said.🔽First, in the case of The Aindrī verse worships the Gāyatrī, since the connection with Indra is understood from the indicative mark and because of being syntactically connected with the Gāyatrī, when the worship of Indra is implied, the primary nature of the Gāyatrī is solely due to the accusative case.

original: tathā sūkta vākena prastara mityubhayoḥ prayojanavattvāviśeṣe kevalaḍhatīyākṛ sūktabākasya prastarapraharaṇāṅgatvaṃ tena vibhaktibhirevāṅgāṅgibhāve 'bhidhīyamāne niṣprayojanatvamapavādo na tu prayojanasadasadbhāvenāṅgāṅgitvamiti vivekaḥ /
analyzed: tathā sūkta vākena prastaram iti ubhayoḥ prayojanavat tva aviśeṣe sūkta bākasya prastara praharaṇa aṅgatvam tena vibhaktibhiḥ eva aṅga aṅgi bhāve bhidhīyamāne niṣprayojana tvam apavādaḥ na tu prayojana sat asat bhāvena aṅga aṅgi tvam iti vivekaḥ
translated: Similarly, in With the Sūktavāka, the grass bundle, when both have the same purposefulness, the Sūktavāka is the subsidiary of the grass bundle-offering solely due to the instrumental case. When the relation of primary and subsidiary is expressed by the case endings themselves, the absence of purpose is an exception, but the primary-subsidiary relation is not based on the presence or absence of purpose. This is the distinction.

analyzed: prayojanam tu adhikaraṇasya na samyak anumanyante
translated: However, they do not fully agree on the purpose of the section.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: To explain:

original: hyutpattivākyā kevala pradhānārthatvena jñāyamānā yuktaṃ yadaṅgeṣu na bhavantoti /
analyzed: hi utpatti vākyā kevala pradhāna artha tvena jñāyamānā yuktam yat aṅgeṣu na bhavanti iti
translated: Indeed, the originative injunctions are known to have only the primary meaning, so it is proper that they are not subsidiaries.

original: śamīmayatvādi tu srugādimātrānuvādena vidhīyamānaṃ sarveṣāṃ vā śeṣatvasyātatprayuktatvā dityanena vākyasaṃyogabalīyastvātprakaraṇagamya pradhānārthatvabādhenāṅgapradhānārthaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: śamīmaya tva ādi tu sruc ādi mātra anuvādena vidhīyamānam sarveṣām vā śeṣa tvasya a tad prayukta tvāt iti anena vākya saṃyoga balīyaḥ tvāt prakaraṇa gamya pradhāna artha tva bādhena aṅga pradhāna artham vijñāyate
translated: As for the injunction of being made of the shami wood and so on, it is understood to be for the purpose of both the subsidiary and the primary, by setting aside the primary meaning understood from the context, because the connection with the sentence is stronger than the connection with the context, since it enjoins being made of the shami wood and so on by way of a restatement of the ladle and so on, or because the subsidiary nature of all of them is not caused by that.

original: na cātra viśeṣaṇaṃ kiṃ cidupāttaṃ yena pradhānaga tasrugādimātrapratītiḥ syā / tsadapi voddiśyamānaviśeṣaṇatvānna vivacyeta /
analyzed: na ca atra viśeṣaṇam kim cit upāttam yena pradhāna ga ta sruc ādi mātra pratītiḥ syāt sat api vā uddiśyamāna viśeṣaṇa tvāt na
translated: And here there is no qualifying term stated by which there would be the understanding of only the ladle and so on connected with the primary. Even if it were stated, it would not be expressed due to being a qualifier of what is being referred to.

original: tasmātpūrvapace 'pi yāni ca pradhānasaṃvandhīni khugādīni yāni cārādupakārakasaṃmārgādisaṃbandhīni tāni sarvāṇi śamomayītvādiyuktānītyayukto nānāvṛścanuksaṃmārgaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt pūrva pace yāni ca pradhāna saṃvandhīni khuga ādīni yāni ca ārāt upakāraka saṃmārga ādi saṃbandhīni tāni sarvāṇi śamaḥ mayī tva ādi yuktāni iti ayuktaḥ nānā vṛśca nuc saṃmārgaḥ
translated: Therefore, even in the former case, all those things connected with the primary such as the ladle and so on, and those connected with the subsequent benefit such as sweeping and so on, all of them are endowed with being made of the shami wood and so on. So the sweeping of the various blades is not appropriate.

analyzed: syāt etat mukhya arthaḥ vā aṅgasya a codita tvāt iti vaikṛta viśeṣāṇām kevala pradhāna artha tvāt na iha aṅga pradhāna artha tā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: This may be said: The subsidiary is for the primary, because it is not enjoined. So the particular modifications will be only for the primary, and not for both the subsidiary and the primary here.

analyzed: tat ayuktam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: yajñātharvaṇaṃ vai kāmyā iṣṭayastā upāṃśu karttavyā iti hi pradhānaireva kāmya śabdopāttairupāṃśutvaṃ saṃbadhyamānamaṅgasyā coditamiti vacyate / na cātra tādṛśaḥ pradhānasaṃyoga iti vaiṣamyam /
analyzed: yajñātharvaṇam vai kāmyāḥ iṣṭayaḥ tāḥ upāṃśu karttavyāḥ iti hi pradhānaiḥ eva kāmya śabda upāttaiḥ upāṃśu tvam saṃbadhyamānam aṅgasya ā coditam iti vacyate na ca atra tādṛśaḥ pradhāna saṃyogaḥ iti vaiṣamyam
translated: The Atharva Veda is indeed the source of optional sacrifices. They should be performed in a low voice, because the property of being performed in a low voice, which is connected with the optional sacrifices mentioned by the word 'kāmya' (optional), is enjoined for the subsidiary (sacrifices) by the principal (sacrifices) themselves. And here there is no such connection with the principal (sacrifices), so it is not similar.

original: nanu cātideśikatvāda prāptāvastheṣvaṅgeṣu śamīmayotvādyupadigyamānaṃ pradhānamātrārthaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: nanu ca atideśika tvāt prāpta avastheṣu aṅgeṣu śamīmaya tva ādi upadigyamānam pradhāna mātra artham bhavet
translated: But since it is a transfer (of injunctions), the injunctions of the materials made of Śamī wood etc. would be for the sake of the principal (sacrifices) alone, when the subsidiaries are in a state of being obtained.

analyzed: na ai iti evam bhavitum
translated: It cannot be so.

analyzed: evam hi
translated: For it is thus established:

original: avaśyaṃ cānekārthavidhyanupapatteḥ srugādīnyanuvaditavyāni te na pratyakṣopi sannupadeśo 'tideśaṃ tāvatpratīcate /
analyzed: avaśyam ca aneka artha vidhi anupapatteḥ sruc ādīni anuvaditavyāni te na pratyakṣaḥ api san upadeśa utideśam tāvat pratīcate
translated: And because it is not possible to have injunctions of many purposes, the ladle etc. must be referred to. Even though the direct statement is not present, the transfer (of injunctions) is at least accepted.

original: tatra yāvatā kālena pradhānassrugādīni prāpnuvanti tāvataivāṅgasrugādīnyapītyaviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tatra yāvatā kālena pradhānaḥ sruc ādīni prāpnuvanti tāvatā eva aṅga sruc ādīni api iti aviśeṣaḥ
translated: There is no difference, because in the same amount of time that the principal ladle etc. are obtained, the subsidiary ladle etc. are also obtained.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: Moreover,

original: ya eva hi saṃmārgasucī varjjanopāyastenaiva prayājādisrugvarjanamapi prāpnoti / na caitadiṣṭaṃ yuktyabhāvāt /
analyzed: yaḥ eva hi saṃmārga sucī varjjana upāyaḥ tena eva prayāja ādi sruc varjanam api prāpnoti na ca etat iṣṭam yukti abhāvāt
translated: by the same means of avoiding the purification of the sprinkling, the avoidance of the ladle etc. in the Prayāja etc. is also obtained. And this is not accepted, because it is not reasonable.

original: yadyapi ca kiṃ citpradhānamātra saṃbandha kāraṇaṃ bhavettathāpi saumikavedidakṣiṇānyāyena prasaṅgasiddhenaṃ prākṛtajātyupasaṃgraho yujyate /
analyzed: yadi api ca kim cit pradhāna mātra saṃbandha kāraṇam bhavet tathā api saumika vedi dakṣiṇā nyāyena prasaṅga siddhena prākṛta jāti upasaṃgrahaḥ yujyate
translated: And even if there were some cause for the connection with the principal act alone, still, in accordance with the principle of the southern altar of the Soma-sacrifice, it is proper to include the original class by implication.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And further,

analyzed: paridhiḥ iti agni paridhāna artham dravyam ucyate
translated: the word 'paridhi' denotes a substance for the purpose of enclosing the fire.

original: tathā homādyarthā juṅkādayastatra saṃmārgasyārthābhidhānakarmma cetyaprayojakatvamapi śakyaṃ vaktum/
analyzed: tathā homa ādi arthāḥ juṅkā ādayaḥ tatra saṃmārgasya artha abhidhāna karmma ca iti aprayojaka tvam api śakyam vaktum
translated: Similarly, the Juhu and other vessels are for the purpose of oblations etc. There, it can also be said that the purpose of the Sammārga is to express the action, and so it is not a proper reason.

original: tataśca bāṇavatparidhiśravaṇe yadi tāvadaparicitādvitīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: tatas ca bāṇa vat paridhi śravaṇe yadi tāvat aparicitā dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: And therefore, like an arrow, if the paridhi is heard, then if it is not known from another,

original: neva palāśādīnāṃ mārṭi apariṣaya eva saṃsṛṣṭā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: na iva palāśa ādīnām mārṭi a pariṣayaḥ eva saṃsṛṣṭāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: the Palasha and other woods would be mixed in the absence of paridhi itself.

original: atha tānapi pariddhīta /tataḥ kṛte paridhāne prākṛtārthatā na syāt /
analyzed: atha tān api kṛte paridhāne prākṛta artha tā na syāt
translated: If they are also enclosed, then after the paridhi is done, it would not have the original purpose.

analyzed: na ca tulya arthānām samuccayaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: And the combination of those with the same purpose is not seen.

analyzed: tasmāt na paridhi antaram utpādanīyam
translated: Therefore, another paridhi is not to be produced.

original: avabhṛthasya tvapūrvatvādyāvadaktamātra parthyavasāyinaḥ sāṅgasya cāpsu coditasya kena saṃmārge 'gnirvā prāpnoti yenotpādyeta /
analyzed: avabhṛthasya tu apūrva tvāt yāvat akta mātra parthyavasāyinaḥ sa aṅgasya ca apsu coditasya kena saṃmārge gniḥ vā prāpnoti yena utpādyeta
translated: But since the Avabhṛtha is a new rite, and the one ending with the recitation of the mantra is enjoined along with its parts in the water, by what is the fire obtained in the Sammārga by which it would be produced?

analyzed: tasmāt da prayojanāni etāni
translated: Therefore, these are purposeless.

analyzed: tasya udāharaṇam tu ekam satyam
translated: But there is one example of that, which is true.

original: tatra hi māṃsaṃ tu savanīyānāmiti sidvāntātpuroḍāśamātreṇā saṃvadhyamānaṃ tara samayatvamasavanīyatvānna parthyagnikaraṇapuroḍāśena saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: tatra hi māṃsam tu savanīyānām iti sidva antāt puroḍāśa mātreṇa ā saṃvadhyamānam samaya tvam asavanīya tvāt na parthyagnikaraṇa puroḍāśena saṃbadhyate
translated: For there, because of the conclusion but the meat is for the Savaniya cakes, the time which is not connected with just the cake is not connected with the cake for the purpose of being taken around the fire, because of not being Savaniya.

analyzed: na hi savanīya aṅge savanīya śabda prayogaḥ
translated: For there is no use of the word Savaniya for a part of the Savaniya.

analyzed: savana saṃbandhi vi saya tvāt
translated: Because it has the object of being related to the Savana.

analyzed: savanīya aṅgasya ca a savana artha tvāt tatra api tu vrīhi maya tvam durlabham
translated: And because the part of the Savaniya is not for the purpose of the Savana, even there the nature of being made of rice is difficult to obtain.

analyzed: brohibhiḥ yajata eti pradhāna puroḍāśa mātreṇa teṣām saṃvandhāt
translated: Because of their connection with just the principal cake of rice, with the words worship with rice.

analyzed: evam tarhi aniyata dravyaka tā paryagnikaraṇa puroḍāśasya iti yojanam
translated: If it is so, then the purpose is that the cake for being taken around the fire has a variable substance.

analyzed: tat api ayuktam
translated: That also is not proper.

original: tathā sati kāṃsyabhojinyāyena tarasamayaparthyagnikaraṇenaiva śāstrārthopapatteḥ siddhāntārthasadṛśakarmaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tathā sati kāṃsyabhoji nyāyena tarasa maya parthyagnikaraṇena eva śāstra artha upapatteḥ siddhānta artha sadṛśa karma prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If it is so, then because the purpose of the scripture is established by just the cake for being taken around the fire of a variable substance, by the principle of the eater of bronze vessels, there is the undesirable consequence of the connection with an action similar to the purpose of the conclusion.

original: tasmātkathaṃ citprakṛtī brīhimayapuroḍāśaya hāttatmādhanatvaṃ śāstrakatatvātprāpnotīti vaktavyam /
analyzed: tasmāt katham cit prakṛtī śāstra kata tvāt prāpnoti iti vaktavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be said that somehow the cake made of rice of the archetype obtains the nature of being taken around the fire, because of being enjoined by the scripture.

analyzed: tatra api tu ekacāyanī nyāyena aprayojaka tvāt tad abhāve lopa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Even there, due to the reason of the one-day ritual, it is not a proper reason, so in its absence, there is the possibility of omission.

analyzed: tena etat eva prayojanam iti āśrayaṇīyam
translated: Therefore, this alone must be accepted as the purpose.

original: aniyata vyakatvaṃ vā /🔽na cāṃtra kāṃsyabhojinyāyaḥ saṃbhavati /
analyzed: aniyata vyaka tvam vā  na ca aṃtra kāṃsya bhoji nyāyaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: Or, the number is not fixed.🔽And the rule of eating from a bronze vessel is not possible here.

analyzed: māṃsena puroḍāśa tva an abhivyaktaḥ
translated: The nature of a cake is not manifested by meat.

analyzed: savanīya puroḍāśe katham iti ced
translated: If it is asked how in the Savaniya cake,

original: naiva tatra puroḍāśatvamiṣṭaṃ vacanādapuroḍāśātmakameva māṃsaṃ puroḍāśasya sthāne vidhīyate yathā dhānādīnām /
analyzed: na eva tatra puroḍāśa tvam iṣṭam vacanāt a puroḍāśa ātmakam eva māṃsam puroḍāśasya sthāne vidhīyate yathā dhānā ādīnām
translated: it is not at all desired that it is a cake there. By the statement, only the meat, which is not of the nature of a cake, is prescribed as a substitute for the cake, just like grains and so on.

original: na hi kathaṃ cidapi māṃsena dhānādayo bhavanti /
analyzed: na hi katham cit api māṃsena dhānā ādayaḥ bhavanti
translated: For in no way do grains and so on become meat.

original: ataśca praiyaṅgavanyāyena pradhānamātre māṃsena puroḍāśo nivarttitaḥ /
analyzed: atas ca praiyaṅgava nyāyena pradhāna mātre māṃsena puroḍāśaḥ nivarttitaḥ
translated: And therefore, by the rule of the Priyangava, the cake is replaced by meat in the principal part alone.

original: paryagnikaraṇaṃ tu puroḍa śa sādhana kamevā sattvaniyatadravyako tantravārtike /
analyzed: paryagnikaraṇam tu sattva niyata dravyaka
translated: But the act of encircling with fire is only a means for the cake, and it is established that it has a substance that is fixed by nature, either by the rule of the Tantravartika,

original: vā kathaṃ ciddhā prakṛtidarśanena brīhiyavadravyakaṃ iti sthitam /
analyzed: vā katham cit hā prakṛti darśanena brīhi yava dravyakam iti sthitam
translated: or somehow by the appearance of the archetype, it has the substance of rice and barley.

original: etāni ca prayojanāni khuksamārgasya prakṛtau bahasādhanatvāt kapiñcalanyāyena tritvasya śāstrīyatvāt pātrāvivṛdvāvapi paśucāturmāsyeṣu tisra eva saṃmāṭantyāḥ pūrvapakṣe /
analyzed: etāni ca prayojanāni khuk samārgasya prakṛtau baha sādhana tvāt kapiñcala nyāyena tri tvasya śāstrīya tvāt pātra avivṛdvau api paśu cāturmāsyeṣu tisraḥ eva saṃmāṭantyāḥ pūrvapakṣe
translated: And these purposes are that in the original, the Khukṣa-path is a means of accomplishing many things, and because the number three is scriptural by the principle of the Kapiñjala bird, even in the case of the vessels, in the animal Chaturmasya sacrifices, only three are anointed in the bright fortnight.

analyzed: siddhānte tu sarvāḥ saṃskārasya prati pradhāna āvartti tvāt
translated: But in the conclusion, all are. Because the consecration recurs for each principal act.

original: tathā paśunyāyena vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyatvāt eka eva saṃmārṭavyaḥ paridhiḥ pūrvapakṣe /
analyzed: tathā paśu nyāyena vivakṣita eka saṃkhya tvāt ekaḥ eva saṃmārṭavyaḥ paridhiḥ pūrvapakṣe
translated: Similarly, by the principle of the animal, because the number one is intended, only one enclosing stick is to be anointed in the prima facie view.

analyzed: siddhānte tu sarve
translated: But in the conclusion, all.

analyzed: yatra ca paridhi vivṛddhiḥ tatra viśeṣaḥ
translated: And where there is an increase in the enclosing sticks, there is a difference.

analyzed: evam eka puroḍāśe paryagnikaraṇam sarva puroḍāśe ca vaktavyam
translated: In the same way, the carrying around of the fire should be stated for the single cake and for all cakes.

analyzed: tathā api viṣaye laukikam syāt iti evam agnim upanidhāya
translated: Still, it is as if the worldly [enclosing sticks] were the object, thus it is as if praising while placing the fire.

analyzed: ki kā agni saṃmārga karaṇam pūrvapakṣe
translated: What is the anointing of the fire in the prima facie view?

analyzed: siddhānte tu tasya aprayojana tvena a saṃskārthya tvāt sarveṣām ā havanīya ādīnām iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: But in the conclusion, because it is not purposeful and not for consecration, all the Ahavaniya and so on. This is the difference.

analyzed: stuta śatrayoḥ tu saṃskāraḥ devatā abhidhāna tvāt
translated: But the consecration of the Stomas and Shatas is by the indication of the deity in the Yajyas.

analyzed: yaiḥ tu dravyam stotra śastra upanyāsaḥ
translated: The introduction of the Stotra and Śastra is as an exception to the statement that those for whom the substance is desired.

original: stutireva stotraṃ śavamapi saivāpragotamantra sādhyā guṇaguṇisavandhakorttanaṃ ca stutiḥ śiṣyate/
analyzed: stutiḥ eva stotram sādhyā guṇa guṇi savandha korttanam ca stutiḥ śiṣyate
translated: Praise itself is Stotra, and that very Śastra which is not recited by Gotama is remembered as the praise that establishes the relation between the quality and the possessor of the quality.

analyzed: sā ca prathamam guṇa guṇibhyām nirvarttyate
translated: And that is first accomplished by the quality and the possessor of the quality.

analyzed: tad abhāve śabda uccāraṇa mātrasya stuti tva a vyapadeśāt
translated: In the absence of that, mere utterance of the word is not designated as praise.

analyzed: tatra guṇānām tāvat a kamma aṅga tayā niṣprayojana tvāt ekāntena stuti artha tā
translated: Among them, the qualities, being not part of the action, are entirely for the purpose of praise, because they are purposeless.

original: tannirvarttitā tu stutiḥ kiṃ stutyasya smārakatvena śeṣībhavatyata svaprādhānyenādṛṣṭārthā bhavatīti /
analyzed: tad nirvartti tā tu stutiḥ kim stutyasya smāraka tvena śeṣībhavati atas sva prādhānyena adṛṣṭa arthā bhavati iti
translated: But is the praise accomplished by them subsidiary by reminding the object of praise, or does it have an unseen purpose by its own predominance?

analyzed: kim prāptam
translated: What is the conclusion?

analyzed: yat yatra a vidyamāna arthaḥ mantraḥ stotum prayujyate
translated: If a mantra whose meaning is not present is used for praise,

analyzed: tasya arthena apakṛṣṭa tvāt prāpta bādhaḥ prasajyate
translated: then because it is removed by its meaning, there is the undesirable consequence of the contradiction of what is obtained.

original: ya eva hi abhivatībhirindraḥ sṭṛyate sa eva māhendragraheṇejyate tatra satyevārthe kimityapakarṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yaḥ eva hi abhivatībhiḥ indraḥ sṭṛyate saḥ eva māhendra graheṇa ijyate tatra sati eva arthe kim iti apakarṣaḥ syāt
translated: For indeed, Indra who is praised by the Abhivītīs is worshipped by the Māhendra cup. There, when the meaning is present, why should there be removal?

original: na ca yāvatkarmāṅgabhūterthe vidyate tatsarvaṃ mantreṇābhidhātavyaṃ / nyūnamadhikaṃ vā 'sau yadabhidhātuṃ samarthastadabhidhatte /
analyzed: na ca yāvat karma aṅga bhūta irthe vidyate tat sarvam mantreṇa abhidhātavyam nyūnam adhikam vā sau yat abhidhātum samarthaḥ tat abhidhatte
translated: And it is not necessary for the mantra to express everything that is a part of the ritual action. He expresses only what he is able to express, whether less or more.

analyzed: tena nirguṇa indra prakāśanam guṇasya atantra tvāt prakaraṇa labhya tvāt ā nirguṇa dravya prakāśana vat eva
translated: Therefore, the declaration of the qualified Indra is not to be inferred, because the quality is not essential, and because it is understood from the context, like the declaration of the unqualified substance.

analyzed: na śruti samavāyi tvāt
translated: Not because of being connected with the Vedic text.

analyzed: na etat asti nirguṇa indra abhidhānāt anutkarṣaḥ iti
translated: This is not so, that there is no inference because of the declaration of the unqualified Indra.

analyzed: prasajyate eva utkarṣaḥ
translated: The inference does indeed follow.

original: kutaḥ🔽yadyavayavavyutpattyā mahāṃśvāsāvindraśceti evaṃ mahendra śabdamancācaścāṇaistadvitānugamaḥ kriyeta / tata indra eva guṇamā viśi ṣṭo'sya grahasya devateti gamyeta /
analyzed: kutas  yadi avayava vyutpattyā mahāṃśva asau indraḥ ca iti evam mahendra śabdam ancā caḥ ca aṇaiḥ tad vita anugamaḥ kriyeta tatas indraḥ eva guṇa mā viśi ṣṭaḥ asya grahasya devatā iti gamyeta
translated: Why?🔽If the word Mahendra were explained by etymological derivation as Indra of great breath, and if the meaning of the word Mahendra were to be inferred by the etymological derivation, then it would be understood that Indra alone, qualified by the quality, is the deity of this cup.

analyzed: na tu evam asti
translated: But this is not so. The word Mahendra, which is established as denoting something different from Indra, is understood by the predominance of the meaning of the whole.

analyzed: tathā hi  vyutpādyate mahā indra śvedākya bheda ādi duṣyati
translated: For example:🔽The explanation of Mahendra leads to the fault of sentence division and so on.

analyzed: avyutpattī mahendra arthaḥ sphuṭam vastu antaram bhavet
translated: If the meaning of Mahendra were not etymologically explained, it would clearly be a different entity.

analyzed: samarthaḥ pada vidhiḥ
translated: The injunction of a word is capable.

analyzed: samarthānām prathama āha iti ca samāsa tad vita vṛtyoḥ viśeṣaṇam
translated: And 'the first is for capable ones' is a qualification of the compound and its secondary suffix.

analyzed: atas tad abhāva na ekayā bhavitavyam
translated: Therefore, it should not be by even one of those.

original: yadi yugapatmamāsatadvitāvanvākhyāyete tato naikatrāpi sāmarthya labhyate /
analyzed: yadi yugapad ma māsa tad vitau anvākhyāyete tatas na ekatra api sāmarthya labhyate
translated: If the compound and the secondary suffix are explained simultaneously, then capability is not obtained in even one place.

analyzed: kutas
translated: How?

original: ekārthobhāvalacaṇaṃ vyapebālakṣaṇaṃ vā sāmarthyamubhayathā'pi sāpekṣasya nāvakalpate /
analyzed: vā sāmarthyam ubhayathā api sāpekṣasya na avakalpate
translated: The definition of single meaning or the definition of dependence is capability, but in both ways it does not apply to what depends on another.

analyzed: katham  hi anye na e ka artha tā iṣyate
translated: How?🔽For indeed, when not depending on another thing, another is accepted as having a single meaning.

analyzed: sa apekṣaḥ tu anya viciptaḥ na aikāthya pratipadyate
translated: But what depends on another, being directed to another, does not attain a single meaning.

analyzed: vyapekṣā punar āhatya vigata apekṣa tā ucyate
translated: And dependence is again said to be free from dependence when combined.

analyzed: dūre sau iti evam asamartha tā
translated: If there is dependence, then it is far away, thus it is incapable.

analyzed: krameṇa ākhyāyamāneṣu vākya bhedaḥ
translated: Or if explained in sequence, there is a split of the sentence due to the utterance.

analyzed: kṛtvā samāsam uccāya punar śabda dvayam bhavet
translated: Having made the compound, the two words would occur again.

original: mahendra iti hi syānna cendra viśeṣaṇaṃ mahattvam /
analyzed: mahā indraḥ iti hi syāt na ca indra viśeṣaṇam mahat tvam
translated: For indeed, it would be 'mahendra', but greatness is not a qualification of Indra.

original: na hyupasarjanamabhibhūta svārthavṛtti viśeṣaṇāntaraiḥ saṃyujyate / na ca samāsārthe vṛttasyeti vākyabheda mātreṇaivocyate/
analyzed: na hi upasarjanam abhibhūta sva artha vṛtti viśeṣaṇa antaraiḥ saṃyujyate na ca samāsa arthe vṛttasya iti vākya bheda mātreṇa eva ucyate
translated: For a subordinate word, whose denotation is overridden, does not combine with other adjectives. And it is said to be merely a split of the sentence, because it does not occur in the meaning of the compound.

original: tena kramavṛttirapi nāstoti pratipādya punargyugapadvṛttimeva doṣāntarābhidhitmayopanya tantravārtike/
analyzed: tena krama vṛttiḥ api na asti iti pratipādya tantravārtike
translated: Therefore, even though it occurs in sequence, it is not, and again, the simultaneous occurrence is presented by him in the Tantravartika, with the mention of another fault.

analyzed: syati
translated: It is stated.

analyzed: aikaśabdye parārtha vat iti anena nyāyena indra śabdasya mahat tva taddhitā  prati vairupya nimitta vākya bheda prasaṅgaḥ
translated: In the case of the same word, by the principle that it is like the meaning of another, the suffix of greatness to the word Indra🔽leads to the undesirable consequence of split of the sentence due to the difference in the cause of the change.

analyzed: vidhi aneka vyāpāra ātmaka śvāparaḥ vākya bhedaḥ
translated: And there is another split of the sentence due to the nature of the many operations of the injunction.

analyzed: tathā hi  vyapadeśāt ca
translated: Thus,🔽and due to the difference in designation,

analyzed: vyapadeśa bhedāt ca bhedaḥ
translated: and due to the difference in the designation, there is a difference.

analyzed: evam ca mantrayoḥ vyavasthā bhaviṣyati
translated: And in this way, there will be a restriction of the two mantras.

analyzed: itarathā vikalpe paḥ bādhaḥ syāt
translated: Otherwise, in the case of an option, there would be contradiction.

analyzed: asati ca artha bhede mantra bhedaḥ syāt a dṛṣṭa artha tā prasajyeta
translated: And in the absence of a difference in meaning, there would be a difference in the mantras, leading to the undesirable consequence of having a purpose that is not seen.

original: evaṃ vyākhyāyamāne tu ruḍhive tadvite sati /
analyzed: evam vyākhyāyamāne tu ruḍhive tad vite sati
translated: But when it is explained in this way, and there is a well-established usage and knowledge of that,

analyzed: agnīṣoma ādayaḥ sarve rūḍhi tvāt na didevatāḥ
translated: all the gods like Agni and Soma, due to their well-established nature, are not the deities.

analyzed: mahat indra śabdayoḥ tāvat avaśyam pṛthak artha abhidhāna śaktiḥ kalpayitavyā
translated: In the case of the words 'maha' and 'indra', the power to denote distinct meanings must necessarily be assumed.

analyzed: tayoḥ ca guṇa guṇi abhidhāyi tvāt viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya ātmaka tvam avadhāritam
translated: And since they denote the quality and the possessor of the quality, their nature as qualifier and qualified is ascertained.

original: tatra yāvadeva saṃhatābuccāritau tāvadeva pūrvānubhūtārthasaṃbandhitayā viśiśarthapratyayo jāyate /
analyzed: tatra yāvat eva saṃhatau uccāritau tāvat eva pūrva anubhūta artha saṃbandhi tayā jāyate
translated: As long as they are uttered together, the cognition of the qualified meaning arises through its connection with the previously experienced meaning.

analyzed: na ca asya nivarttakam kim cit asti
translated: And there is nothing to set aside this [cognition].

original: na ca samudāyasyā pūrva śaktyantarakalpanāpramāṇaṃ vidya santravārtike /
analyzed: na ca śakti antara kalpanā pramāṇam
translated: And there is no evidence for assuming another power of the whole prior to [the powers of] the parts.

analyzed: te
translated: They are not.

analyzed: labdha ātmikā ca samudāya prasiddhiḥ avayava prasiddhim bādhate
translated: And the well-known usage of the whole sets aside the well-known usage of the parts.

analyzed: na ca avayava artha rahita artha antara prayogam vispaṣṭam antareṇa tad ātmanā ābhaḥ
translated: And without a clear usage of a meaning different from the meaning of the parts, there is no cognition of it as such.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: What's more,

original: pratyakṣepi tāvadarthe 'nekaśabdaśaktaḥ kalpanā niṣpramāṇikā / kimuta yatrārtha sadbhāvo 'pi kalpanīyaḥ /
analyzed: pratyakṣe api tāvat arthe neka śabda śaktaḥ kalpanā niṣpramāṇikā kim uta kalpanīyaḥ
translated: Even in the case of a directly perceived object, the assumption of the power of many words is unjustifiable. How much more so in a case where the very existence of the object is to be imagined.

original: tadihendra śabdaprayogānyathānupapatyendrastāvadadṛṣṭo 'pi kalpyate / tatra yadi punamahendraśabdaprayogānyathā'nupapattirbhavettatorthāntaraṃ mahendro nāma ka lapyeta /
analyzed: tat iha indra śabda prayoga anyathā anupapatya indraḥ tāvat adṛṣṭaḥ api kalpyate tatra yadi punar mahendra śabda prayoga anyathā anupapattiḥ bhavet tatas ṛtha antaram mahendraḥ nāma ka lapyeta
translated: Therefore, here, due to the impossibility of using the word Indra otherwise, Indra is imagined even though not seen. If there were then an impossibility of using the word Mahendra otherwise, then another meaning named Mahendra would be imagined.

original: yadā tu pūrvakalpitābhyāmeva mahadindrapadaśaktibhyāṃ prayogaḥ sidhyati / sa eva cārthaḥ kiṃ cidviśiṣṭa pratyabhijñāyate / kastadārthāntaraṃ kalpayituṃ śakṣyati /
analyzed: yadā tu pūrva kalpitābhyām eva mahat indra pada śaktibhyām prayogaḥ sidhyati saḥ eva ca arthaḥ kim cit viśiṣṭa pratyabhijñāyate kaḥ tadā artha antaram kalpayitum śakṣyati
translated: But when the usage is accomplished by the power of the words Mahā and Indra, which have already been imagined, and that very meaning is recognized as slightly distinguished, who will be able to imagine another meaning?

original: tasmādindra eva mahattvaviśiṣṭo mahendro nānya iti siddham/
analyzed: tasmāt indraḥ eva mahat tva viśiṣṭaḥ mahendraḥ na anyaḥ iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that Mahendra is Indra himself, distinguished by greatness, and not another.

original: naca samāsaṃ kṛtvā tadvite kriyamāai kasya cidasāmarthyaṃ samāsavelāyāṃ tadvitavelāyāṃ cāpekṣaṇīyārthāntarānupādānāt /
analyzed: na ca samāsam kṛtvā tadvite kriyamāai kasya cit asāmarthyam samāsa velāyām tadvita velāyām ca apekṣaṇīya artha antara anupādānāt
translated: And after making the compound, when the case endings are being added, there is no incapacity of any [word], because no other meaning to be considered is added at the time of making the compound or at the time of adding the case endings.

analyzed: na ca dvis uccāraṇa nimitta vākya bheda prasaktiḥ sakad uccārita eka pada upātta aneka artha kathanāt
translated: And there is no occurrence of sentence division caused by the repetition [of the word], because many meanings are stated by the inclusion of a single word uttered once.

analyzed: vṛtti yā ātmakam hi māhendra padam
translated: For the word Mahendra has the nature of a vrtti [a case ending].

analyzed: ekaikā ca vṛttiḥ vākya arthe varttate
translated: And each vrtti occurs in the meaning of the sentence.

original: tatra ya yorvākyayorathā māhendrapanopātau tau tābhyāṃ nirbhidya kathyete /
analyzed: tatra yau vākyayoḥ athā tau tābhyām nirbhidya kathyete
translated: Of these two sentences, the words 'mahendra' and 'mahindra' are explained by being broken up into those two [parts].

analyzed: yat ca atra asakṛt uccāraṇam dṛśyate na tat veda vacanasya eva
translated: And the repetition that is seen here is not of the Vedic text itself.

original: na hi kadā cidapyevaṃrūpo vedo 'sti mahāṃcāsāvindraśca mahendro devatā asyeti māhendraḥ /
analyzed: na hi kadā cit api evaṃrūpaḥ vedaḥ u sti mahān ca asau indraḥ ca mahā indraḥ devatāḥ asya iti māhendraḥ
translated: For the Veda never has such a form as 'maha' and 'indra' and 'mahindra' are the deity of this [sacrifice].

original: na caitadeva vaidikaṃ padamevaṃ vibhajyate vibhāgasya pauruṣeyatvenāvaidikatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: na ca etat eva vaidikam padam evam vibhajyate vibhāgasya pauruṣeya tvena avaidika tva āpatteḥ
translated: And this very Vedic word is not divided in this way, because the division would be non-Vedic due to being human.

analyzed: kiṃtu
translated: But

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: First section of the second chapter.

analyzed: vicitra śaktīni hi padāni eka aneka padārtha pratīteḥ
translated: For words have various powers, as is seen from the cognition of one or many meanings.

original: tathaiṣāmarthakathanaṃ kadā citpadenaivānyena kriyate kadācidvākyena / tenāpyekenāne kena vā dvipadena bahupadena veti vaicityam /
analyzed: tathā eṣām artha kathanam kadā cit padena eva anyena kriyate kadācid vākyena tena api ekena ane kena vā dvi padena bahu padena vā iti vaicityam
translated: So the explanation of their meanings is sometimes done by another word, sometimes by a sentence, and even by that, by one or many words, by two words or many words.

original: tadyathā kaḥ pikaḥ kokinaḥ ka aupagavaḥ upagorapatyam /
analyzed: tat yathā kaḥ pikaḥ kokinaḥ kaḥ aupagavaḥ upagoḥ apatyam
translated: For example, 'kaḥ pikaḥ' (what is a cuckoo?), 'ko kikīhiḥ' (what is a kokila?), 'kaḥ kaupagavaḥ' (what is a cowherd?), 'upagaur apatyam' (the offspring of a cow),

analyzed: upagunā vā sva kāntāyām utpāditaḥ
translated: or 'upagu-nā' (by Upagupta), 'svakāntāyāṃ' (in his own beloved), 'utpāditaḥ' (produced).

original: tathā pacatītyukte pākaṃ paragāmi phacamekaḥ karttā pūrvāparībhūtaṃ varttamānakāle nirvarttayatīti kathyate /
analyzed: tathā pacati iti ukte pākam para gāmi karttā pūrvāparībhūtam varttamāna kāle nirvarttayati iti kathyate
translated: Similarly, when it is said he cooks, it is said that one person, the cook, causes the cooking to go to another, and accomplishes it in the present time, with a sequence of earlier and later [stages].

analyzed: na ca evam kathayatām vākya bhedaḥ prasajyate
translated: And for those who speak thus, there is no fault of split-sentence.

analyzed: na vā śabda artha tvam adhyavasīyate
translated: Nor is it determined that the meaning is the meaning of the word.

original: evameva yadi māhendrapadopātto 'rthastadaspṛśabhireva śabdaśaktividbhiḥ puruṣaiḥ skhavākyenaikenānekena vā ka thyate kastatra vākyabhedaḥ / śatakṛtvo 'pi hi svavākyamuccāryamāṇaṃ na vedaṃ dūṣayati /
analyzed: evam eva yadi māhendra pada upāttaḥ rthaḥ tad aspṛśabhiḥ eva śabda śakti vidbhiḥ puruṣaiḥ skha vākyena ekena anekena vā ka thyate kaḥ tatra vākyabhedaḥ śata kṛtvas hi sva vākyam uccāryamāṇam na vedam dūṣayati
translated: In the same way, if the meaning conveyed by the word Mahendra is spoken of by persons who know the power of words, without touching that [word], either by one sentence or by many sentences, then what is the split-sentence there? Even if one's own sentence is uttered a hundred times, it does not invalidate the Veda.

original: na ca tadīyo 'rthaḥ kathyamānaḥ pauruṣeyatvaṃ bhajate /
analyzed: na ca tadīyaḥ rthaḥ kathyamānaḥ pauruṣeya tvam bhajate
translated: And the meaning conveyed by it does not become human.

analyzed: avaśyam ca anekaḥ rthaḥ puruṣaiḥ
translated: And necessarily, many meanings are spoken of by men.

original: kathyamānaḥ krameṇa kathayatavyaḥ / so 'pi ca prakṛtipratyaya paurvāparyeṇetyevaṃ kathyate /
analyzed: kathyamānaḥ krameṇa kathayatavyaḥ ca prakṛti pratyaya paurvāparyeṇa iti evam kathyate
translated: When spoken of, they must be spoken of in sequence. And that too is spoken of in the sequence of primary and secondary suffixes,

analyzed: māṃsu āsau indraḥ ca ityādi
translated: like maṃsvasāviṃdratyādi.
