analyzed: yathā iṣṭa viniyogam tu sarva artham vastu laukikam
translated: but the worldly object can be used as desired for all purposes.

original: yadi tvānantaryāviśeṣādrajāśayetyanenāpi saṃbandho'bhyupagamyeta tato yathāniveśaṃ prayogātpurastādevāsya prayogaḥ prāpnoti/
analyzed: yadi tu ānantarya aviśeṣāt raja āśaya iti anena api saṃbandhaḥ abhyupagamyeta tatas yathāniveśam prayogāt purastāt eva asya prayogaḥ prāpnoti
translated: However, if the connection with rāja-śaya is accepted even on the basis of the non-distinction of immediate sequence, then its use would be obtained even before the use according to the original placement.

original: tamādapi na vaidikaḥ śeṣaḥ iti prāpte ucyate /
analyzed: tamāt api na vaidikaḥ śeṣaḥ iti prāpte ucyate
translated: Even from that, it is said that the Vedic remainder is not obtained.

analyzed: vimuktavya amṛtau vede laukika avasara sthitiḥ
translated: The worldly one is in the place of opportunity in the Veda, which is free from bondage and immortal.

analyzed: tad vyāpāra vimoka ca sakala anveṣaṇa kṣaye  prakṛtau arthaḥ pratyaye nu iṣyate punar
translated: And when the search for all is destroyed by the release of its operation,🔽The meaning in the original is sought again in the suffix.

analyzed: pade svasmin alabdhaḥ tu prārthanīyaḥ pada antare
translated: But not found in its own word, it should be sought in another word.

original: tadiha rajāśayāharāśayāvākyayoḥ śeṣaḥ svapadasva vākyayorajamyamānatvā ḍākyāntare nūna mityupasaṃdriyate /
analyzed: tat iha śeṣaḥ vākyayoḥ ajamyamāna tvā ḍākya antare nūnam miti upasaṃdriyate
translated: Therefore, here the remainder of the sentences of the Rājasūya and Āharagava sacrifices is understood as another sentence, because it is not enjoined in its own words or in its own sentence.

original: sa ca yādṛgākāścitastāhagavai kānantaraṃ purastādupalabhyate anyasya vyavahitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca yādṛś ākāścitaḥ tāhagavai ka anantaram purastāt upalabhyate anyasya vyavahitaḥ
translated: And that is connected with those two, being heard immediately before and after, while being separated from another.

original: yadyapi cāsau prathamamantre kṛtārthatvānna nāvākāṅkṣati tau tu tena vinānupapadyamānāvātmasamīpe 'nyasyānāmnānādevaṃ puruṣaṃ prayu ghnāte /
analyzed: yadi api ca asau prathama mantre kṛtārtha tvāt na na ava ākāṅkṣati tau tu tena vinā anupapadyamānau ātma samīpe nyasya an āmnānāt evam puruṣam ghnāte
translated: Although that has served its purpose in the first mantra and does not require the two, those two, being incomplete without it, connect the person in this way, because another is not mentioned near itself.

original: sarvasamīpe sakṛtpaṭhitumaśakyaḥ pramāṇāntaranabhyatvācca punaḥ punaraśrāvitoyamāvayorapyarthenāmnātaḥ śeṣo naikasyaiva sannighiviśeṣanimittabhrāntyā kalpayitavya iti yadyapi ca purastādālocyate / tathāpi yatpradeśavarttitvena tābhyāṃ kāścitastatraiva viniyujyate /
analyzed: sarva samīpe sakṛt paṭhitum aśakyaḥ pramāṇa antar anabhya tvāt ca punar punar a śrāvitaḥ yam āvayoḥ api arthena āmnātaḥ śeṣaḥ na ekasya eva sannighi viśeṣa nimitta bhrāntyā kalpayitavyaḥ iti yadi api ca purastāt ālocyate tathā api yat pradeśa vartti tvena tābhyām kāścitaḥ tatra eva viniyujyate
translated: Being unable to be recited once near all, and not heard again and again due to not being known by other means of knowledge, this remainder, though mentioned for the sake of both, should not be imagined as belonging to only one due to the error of a specific proximity. Although it is considered before, still it is employed by those two right there, by virtue of being in that region.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: sa hi sakṛdāmnāyamānaḥ sarveṣāmīsite pradeśe na śakya ā mnātumityekasya yathākramamāmnāta itarayośca yāvatā buddhiviṣa yatāmāpadyate / tataśca gṛhītaḥ san svayamapi pradeśāntare sthātumasamarthastābhyāmapi cānyavṛttitvenānākāṅkṣitaḥ pūrvatra caparastādbhāvitayā dṛṣṭasāmarthyaḥ parastādeva nivecyate /
analyzed: sa hi sakṛt āmnāyamānaḥ sarveṣām īsite pradeśe na śakyaḥ ā mnātum iti ekasya yathākramam āmnātaḥ itarayoḥ ca yāvatā buddhi viṣa ya tām āpadyate tatas ca gṛhītaḥ san svayam api pradeśa antare sthātum asamarthaḥ tābhyām api ca anya vṛtti tvena an ākāṅkṣitaḥ pūrvatra caparastāt bhāvitayā dṛṣṭa sāmarthyaḥ parastāt eva nivecyate
translated: And this being once laid down, it cannot be laid down in the case of all the other parts of the sentence, and hence it is laid down in the case of one only, in due order, and in the case of the other two, it is laid down only so far as it comes within the range of the understanding. And thus being taken up, it is itself unable to stand in any other part of the sentence, and it is not desired by the other two as being employed elsewhere, and being found to be effective in the previous part of the sentence, it is laid down in the subsequent part, by virtue of its being mentioned there.

original: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu prathama dvitīyayormadhye pāṭhādagṛhyamāṇaviśeṣaḥ śeṣa ubhayorapyānantaryeṇaiva saṃbandhītyuklā tṛtīyasya vyavadhānādasaṃbandhamāśaṅṅkyārthitvāviśeṣādubhayoḥ samudāyāpādanenāvyavadhāne sādhite samudāyaśeṣatvameva sāī prāpnotītyāśaṅṅkya tasyāsadhyavārtika /
analyzed: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu prathama dvitīyayoḥ madhye pāṭhāt agṛhyamāṇa viśeṣaḥ śeṣaḥ ubhayoḥ api ānantaryeṇa eva saṃbandhi iti uklā tṛtīyasya vyavadhānāt asaṃbandham āśaṅṅkya arthi tva aviśeṣāt ubhayoḥ samudāya āpādanena avyavadhāne sādhite samudāya śeṣa tvam eva sāī prāpnoti iti āśaṅṅkya tasya asadhya vārtika
translated: But the author of the Bhāṣya has said that the remainder, which is not found to be specified in the middle of the first and second, is connected with both only by immediate sequence. Fearing that the third would be unconnected on account of the intervening space, he has proved its immediate sequence by the inclusion of both, on account of the equality of the desire for it. When this has been accomplished, the doubt arises that it would be the remainder of the whole. Fearing this, he has proved that it is the remainder of the second only.

original: prayogāītvātprayogāī samudāyisaṃbandhaḥ / tatrāpi tayoḥ prādhānyādanyathā ca nairākācyānupapatte pratyekaṃ sakalaśeṣasaṃvandhasiddhirityavadhārgya punarvyākhyānāntaramārabdham /
analyzed: prayoga aī tvāt prayoga aī samudāyi saṃbandhaḥ tatra api tayoḥ prādhānyāt anyathā ca nairākācya anupapatte pratyekam sakala śeṣa saṃvandha siddhiḥ iti avadhārgya punar vyākhyāna antaram ārabdham
translated: Because of being in the context, the relation of the components is in the context. Even there, because of the predominance of those two, and because of the impossibility of the absence of purpose otherwise, the relation of each with the entire remainder is established. Thus, having understood this, another explanation is begun again.

analyzed: api ca sākāṅkṣasya saṃnnidhau iti
translated: Moreover, of that which has expectancy, in proximity.

analyzed: tatra
translated: There, some have resorted to just the option of explanation.

original: apare tu vadanti pūrvatrāparitoṣa duttaraṃ kṛtam
analyzed: apare tu vadanti pūrvatra a paritoṣa duttaram kṛtam
translated: But others say that the previous one is not satisfied, and the subsequent one is done.

original: samudāyatvaṃ hyekakārthyatvenai ka śabdopādānena vā bhaveta / nacācaikamapyasti /
analyzed: samudāya tvam hi eka kārthya tvena eka śabda upādānena vā bhaveta
translated: For, collectivity could be by having the same purpose or by the use of a single word, and neither of those exists.

original: nancidame kakārthyatva me kavākya śeṣagrahaṇaṃ nāma /
analyzed: śeṣa grahaṇam nāma
translated: And this is the having the same purpose, the taking of the remainder of a single sentence.

original: aho nu khalu mantrāṇāṃ kāryaṃ vijñātam /
analyzed: aho nu khalu mantrāṇām kāryam vijñātam
translated: Oh, indeed the purpose of the mantras is known!

analyzed: apekṣā hi tatra ubhayoḥ syāt
translated: For there would be expectancy of both.

analyzed: katham tat karthyam iti ucyate  śeṣaḥ ca asau samudāya tva āpattiḥ yuktā
translated: How is that said to have the same purpose?🔽And that is the remainder of those two. It is not proper to have collectivity by that alone.

original: paścādapi vā samudāyibhyāmeva tasya saṃgatiriṣṭeti ādita eva samudāyatvaṃ na labhyate /
analyzed: paścāt api vā samudāyibhyām eva tasya saṃgatiḥ iṣṭā iti āditas eva samudāya tvam na labhyate
translated: Or even later, its connection is accepted only with the two components. Thus, collectivity is not obtained right from the beginning.

original: yadi sa samudāyatvamāpannau tataḥ punaḥ pratyekaṃ saṃbandha iti rājaikaputrakrīḍā ''padyate /
analyzed: yadi sa samudāya tvam āpannau tatas punar pratyekam saṃbandhaḥ iti rāja eka putra krīḍā padyate
translated: If they become a collection, then again there is a relation between each individual. This leads to the play of the king's only son.

original: purastādeva ca prayogaḥ prāpnoti tathābhūtena samudāyānantaryyāt /
analyzed: purastāt eva ca prayogaḥ prāpnoti tathābhūtena samudāya ānantaryyāt
translated: And the application would occur even before, because of the immediate sequence of the collection in that way.

analyzed: na vā gṛhyamāṇa viśeṣa tvam deśa bheda nimittam nantra bhadāt
translated: Or the non-specification of the object is not due to the difference of place, but from the statement of the mantra.

original: prathamasya hyasau yathākācite deśe sthito notarayoḥ /
analyzed: prathamasya hi asau yathākācite deśe sthitaḥ na utarayoḥ
translated: For this is situated in some place of the first, not of the other two.

analyzed: tasmāt idam eva vyākhyānam
translated: Therefore, this is the only explanation.

original: yo hi bahūnāṃ saṃbandhitvena sakadāmnāyate tasyāvaśyaṃbhāvye kenānantaryyamiti na tadeva tadā saṃbandhakāraṇatvenāśrīyate /
analyzed: yaḥ hi bahūnām saṃbandhi tvena sakadā āmnāyate tasya avaśyaṃbhāvye kena ānantaryyam iti na tat eva tadā saṃbandha kāraṇa tvena āśrīyate
translated: For one who is enjoined simultaneously as related to many, there must be immediate sequence with something. Therefore, that itself is not accepted as the cause of relation at that time.

analyzed: manāpi asmāt eva kāraṇa cayāt saṃbandha siddheḥ
translated: And the relation is established from this very collection of causes.

analyzed: sannidhi viśeṣāt nu ta dvitīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: But from the special proximity, the application is by the second.

analyzed: dāya pratipattyā bhavati bhrāntiḥ
translated: The error is due to the special proximity.

original: sā tu sākāṅkṣayogyasaṃnnicitasaṃvandhyantaradarśanānnivarttate / yathā dhātvarthādiṣu vidhibuddhirguṇādyupādānasāmarthyā /devaṃ hi tatra jñāyate /
analyzed: sā tu sākāṅkṣa yogya saṃnnicita saṃvandhi antara darśanāt nivarttate yathā dhātvartha ādiṣu vidhi buddhiḥ guṇa ādi upādāna sāmarthyāt evam hi tatra jñāyate
translated: But that is removed by seeing another related object that is fit to be desired, just as the notion of injunction in the meanings of roots is removed by the capacity to take up qualities etc. For that is indeed known there.

original: sarvārtho 'yamāmnāyamānaḥ sarvasādhāraṇānantaryyā saṃbhavādvākyaikatvācca kasya cidekaya mamope padyate /
analyzed: sarva arthaḥ yam āmnāyamānaḥ sarva sādhāraṇa ānantaryyā saṃbhavāt vākya ekatvāt ca kasya cit ekaya mama upe padyate
translated: This injunction, being enjoined for all purposes, is accomplished by the unity of the sentence, or by the impossibility of a common sequence for anyone.

analyzed: tammāt akāraṇam ānantaryam iti
translated: Therefore, the sequence is not a cause.

original: sannighiriti buddā viparivṛttiḥ /🔽sā cānantarye saṃbaddhapadavyavāye ca bhavati /
analyzed: sannighiḥ iti viparivṛttiḥ  sā ca ānantarye saṃbaddha pada vyavāye ca bhavati
translated: The reversal is the change of order.🔽And that occurs in the case of sequence and interruption of connected words.

analyzed: saṃbaddha pad vyavadhiḥ api ānantaryya prakāraḥ eva
translated: The interruption of connected words is also a type of sequence itself.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: yā te agne rajāśayetyanenāpekṣitaḥ śeṣaḥ parastādajabhyamānaḥ purastātparāvṛttyālocyamāno labhyate tanūrvarṣiṣṭheti /
analyzed: yā te agne rajā śayā iti anena apekṣitaḥ śeṣaḥ parastāt ajabhyamānaḥ purastāt parāvṛttya ālocyamānaḥ labhyate tanūḥ varṣiṣṭhā iti
translated: The remainder required by the sentence O Agni, whose abode is in the dust is obtained when looked at by a reversal to the front, as the body, the most excellent, which is being uttered later.

original: yadā ca tatrārūḍhastadā harāśayetyasyānantarībhūtaḥ punarevameva tṛtīyenāpi saha saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: yadā ca tatra ārūḍhaḥ tadā hara āśaya iti asya anantarībhūtaḥ punar evam eva tṛtīyena api saha saṃbadhyate
translated: And when one has ascended there, then whose abode is in the dust becomes sequential, and again thus only, it is connected with the third.

analyzed: tatas param tu anyasya an āmnānāt tāvatī eva upacoyate
translated: But after that, due to the non-mention of another, it is concluded right there.

original: sarvacaivamapeścā purastātparastācca prasṛtakacāru hotareṣāmanantarībhavantī tāvaḍhapekṣyamāṇā nigṛhṇāti yāvatkiṃ cinna yogyamastyayogyaṃ copacabdham /
analyzed: purastāt parastāt ca
translated: And in the same way, the sequence spread out in front and behind of the other Hotr priests, becoming sequential, is concluded as much as is required, as long as there is nothing suitable and the unsuitable is concluded.

analyzed: tatas sarvam ālocitam apasaṃhṛtya nivartate
translated: Then, having considered everything, it ceases.

original: yadyapi ca krameṇoccāraṇātsaṃnikarṣaviprakarṣai pratīyete tathāpi nityatvādvedasyānantare dūrasthe ca yugaparhapecā saṃbandhaśceti paścādavagamānna prāmāṇye kaścidviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api ca krameṇa uccāraṇāt saṃnikarṣa viprakarṣaiḥ pratīyete tathā api nitya tvāt vedasya anantare dūra sthe ca saṃbandhaḥ ca iti paścāt avagamāt na prāmāṇye kaścid viśeṣaḥ
translated: And even though they are cognized as near and far due to utterance in sequence, still, because the Veda is eternal, the connection is simultaneous with the immediate and the distant, and since the understanding comes later, there is no difference in validity.

original: evaṃ vākye paḍhānāṃ prakaraṇe ca vākyānāṃ saṃbandho yāvatmākāṅkṣeṇa tatsaṃbandhāṇa parasyāpyanantarīkarttu' samarthena vyavadhānam /
analyzed: evam vākye paḍhānām prakaraṇe ca vākyānām saṃbandhaḥ yāvat mākāṅkṣeṇa parasya api anantarīkarttu samarthena vyavadhānam
translated: Thus, in a sentence, the relation of the words is by expectancy, and in a context, the relation of the sentences is by expectancy, up to the point where another sentence capable of connecting it is able to make it immediate.

analyzed: a vyavadhāne
translated: When there is no interruption, there is disconnection.

original: virodhinā padenāvyavadhāne viprakṛṣṭatve bhavati saṃbandhe ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: virodhinā padena avyavadhāne viprakṛṣṭa tve bhavati saṃbandhe iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: when there is no interruption by an opposing word, the relation becomes distant.

analyzed: tasmāt anuṣaṅgaḥ samāptiḥ
translated: Therefore, the conclusion is by implication.

original: anuṣajyataityanuṣaṅgaḥ sa eva samāpyate teneti samāptiḥ tantravārtika /
analyzed: anuṣajyate eti anuṣaṅgaḥ saḥ eva samāpyate tena iti samāptiḥ tantravārtika
translated: The implication is that it is implied. That itself is concluded by it. That is the conclusion.

original: yatra tāvaccheṣiṇaḥ sākāṅkṣāstatraivamatha yatra nairākāṅjyaṃ sarveṣu śeṣidhvekaḥ śeṣaḥ sākāṅamaḥ padyate yathā citpatistvā punātvityeteṣāmante macchidreṇetyādistana kathamiti /
analyzed: yatra tāvat śeṣiṇaḥ sākāṅkṣāḥ tatra evam atha yatra nairākāṅjyam sarveṣu śeṣidhu ekaḥ śeṣaḥ padyate yathā citpatiḥ tvā punātu iti eteṣām ante katham iti
translated: Where the subsidiaries are incomplete and expectant, it is so. But where there is no expectation, all the subsidiaries being complete, only one subsidiary is expectant, as in 'May the lord of thought purify you'. How is this?

analyzed: kim prātar
translated: What is the prima facie view?

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: ānantaryya viśeṣeṇa dyayam punātu iti etena saṃbadhyate
translated: This is connected with 'may the lord of thought purify you' by the special proximity.

original: sa pcaika eva triṣvapi vākyeṣu / tadekatvā cārthasyāpyekatvam /
analyzed: sa pca ekaḥ eva triṣu api vākyeṣu tad eka tvā ca arthasya api eka tvam
translated: And that is the same in all three sentences. And because of the oneness of that, the meaning is also one.

analyzed: na ca kāraka bhedāt tasya bhedaḥ bhavati
translated: And it is not differentiated by the difference of the instrument.

analyzed: yena cit pati ādi saṃbadvādasya ananya tvam vijñāyate
translated: And by which the oneness of that is known due to the connection with the lord of thought etc.

original: na cācchidraṃphetyevamarthā kriyā / yena sakṛtsaṃbandhena saṃtuṣyet🔽śravaṇānāṃ vyavasthā hi bhinnāpūrvaprayuktitaḥ /
analyzed: na ca acchidraṃphā iti evamarthā kriyā yena sakṛt saṃbandhena saṃtuṣyet  śravaṇānām vyavasthā hi bhinna apūrva prayuktitaḥ
translated: And the action is not one whose meaning is 'without blemish' etc., by which it would be satisfied with a single connection.🔽For the arrangement of the recitations is different due to the employment of different apūrvas.

analyzed: kart antara avarodhāt ca cit pati ādeḥ asaṃkaraḥ  tasmāt punātuśabdaḥ yam sarva mantra gataḥ api san
translated: And due to the obstruction of other instruments, the lord of thought etc. are not mixed up.🔽Therefore, this word 'may the lord of thought purify' is used in all the mantras.

analyzed: sarve pecyate tantravārtike
translated: It is said in the Tantravārtika that all of them are purified by the lord of thought.

analyzed: vyavāyāt na anuṣajyate
translated: It is not added due to the interruption.

analyzed: pratyudāharaṇa tvena sannidheḥ evam ucyate
translated: It is said in this way for the sake of an example,

analyzed: asaṃbandha tirodhāne vaiṣamyāt na anuṣajyate
translated: in the case of the obstruction of a non-relation, it is not added due to inequality.

analyzed: āmnāyamānam hi anuṣajyamānam antargatam mantra nirūpaṇāyām
translated: For what is being recited is added internally in the definition of the mantra.

original: iti śrībhaṭṭakumārilaviracite mīmāṃsātantravārtike dvitīyasyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pādaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī bhaṭṭa kumārila viracite mīmāṃsātantra vārtike dvitīyasya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter of the second chapter of the Mimamsa Tantra composed by the revered Bhatta Kumarila.

analyzed: tatra śabda antaram sāvat spaṣṭa tvāt prathamam udāhiyate
translated: There, the other word is first cited because it is clear.

original: ekānekākhyāta pratyayasaṃbaddhāḥ sarve dhātavo yajati dadāti juhoti nirvapati gṛhṇāti stṛṇāti śaṃsati staiauti ityevamādaya udāharaṇam /
analyzed: eka aneka ākhyāta pratyaya saṃbaddhāḥ sarve dhātavaḥ yajati dadāti juhoti nirvapati gṛhṇāti stṛṇāti śaṃsati iti evamādayaḥ udāharaṇam
translated: All roots connected with the singular and plural verbal endings, such as yajati (sacrifices), dadāti (gives), juhoti (offers oblations), nirvapati (pours out), gṛhṇāti (takes), stṛṇāti (spreads), śaṃsati (praises), stauti (praises), etc., are examples.

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: The second section of the second chapter.

analyzed: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu svatva parityāga aṃśena yajati ādi trayam pratyāsanna artha tvāt sutarām abhinnam ābhāsate iti udāhṛtam
translated: But the author of the commentary has cited the three beginning with yajati (sacrifices) as very similar due to their proximity in meaning by way of the relinquishment of ownership.

analyzed: tatra pūrvapakṣa caividhya darśanāt saṃbhaya upanyāsaḥ api tad anuguṇaḥ pratibhāti
translated: There, the statement of possibility also appears to be in accordance with that, due to the seen variety of prima facie views.

analyzed: tat yathā
translated: For example.

original: tisro bhāvanāḥ kimekamapūrvaṃ kurvanti uta cīniti / tathā trayo dhātvarthāḥ kimekī bhāvanā viśiṣanti uta tisraḥ / tathā trayo dhātavaḥ kimekaṃ dhātvarthaṃ vadanti uta cīni / ti /
analyzed: tisraḥ bhāvanāḥ kim ekam apūrvam kurvanti uta tathā trayaḥ dhātvarthāḥ kim bhāvanāḥ viśiṣanti uta tisraḥ tathā trayaḥ dhātavaḥ kim ekam dhātvartham vadanti uta
translated: Do the three bhāvanās produce one unseen result, or three? Similarly, do the three meanings of roots distinguish one bhāvanā, or three? Similarly, do the three roots express one root meaning, or three?

original: kārya śabdapūcāpūrvabhāvanā dhātvartheṣu upakāryatvāviśeṣeṇa prayujyate bhāvanā dhātvarthadhātavo hyeṣāmutpādanena viśeṣaṇena pratipādanenopakārakatvātmāghanatvenābhidhīyante /
analyzed: śabda pūcāpūrva bhāvanā dhātvartheṣu upakārya tva aviśeṣeṇa prayujyate bhāvanā dhātvartha dhātavaḥ hi eṣām utpādanena viśeṣaṇena pratipādanena upakāraka tva ātma āghana tvena abhidhīyante
translated: The word bhāvanā is used in the meanings of root, object, and unseen result, because of the non-distinction of being to be helped. The roots are said to be helpers by producing, distinguishing, and expressing them.

analyzed: kutas saṃśayaḥ
translated: Why is there doubt?

original: atha vā pāramārthiko'trāyamekaḥ saṃśayaḥ / kiṃ dhātvarthacayānuraktaikā bhāvanā / atha vā pratidhātvarthaṃ bhāvanābheda / iti /
analyzed: atha vā pāramārthikaḥ utra ayam ekaḥ saṃśayaḥ kim dhātvartha caya anuraktā ekā bhāvanā atha vā prati dhātvartham bhāvanā bhedaḥ iti
translated: Or, this is a real doubt here: Is there one bhāvanā connected with the collection of root meanings, or is there a difference in bhāvanā for each root meaning?

analyzed: bhāvanā eka dhātvartha anuraktā karma śabdena ucyate
translated: Bhāvanā is said to be one, connected with the root meanings, by the word 'action'.

original: tasyā eva śabdāntarādi bhedakaṃ bhaviṣyati / apūrvasyāna bhidheyatvātkarmabhedānuniṣpādye va taditina pṛthagvicāramarhati /
analyzed: tasyāḥ eva śabda antara ādi bhedakam bhaviṣyati apūrvasya an abhidheya tvāt karma bheda anuniṣpādye tat iti na pṛthak vicāram arhati
translated: That itself will be distinguished by another word. Since the unseen result is not to be expressed, it does not deserve separate consideration as being produced by the difference in action.

original: prāsaṅgikastu dhātvarthaikatvopanyāsaḥ kathamapyasārvatrikaḥ sanyajyādiṣu bhaviṣyatīti nātīva tantrokrttavyaḥ /
analyzed: prāsaṅgikaḥ tu dhātvartha eka tva upanyāsaḥ katham api asārvatrikaḥ san yaji ādiṣu bhaviṣyati iti na atīva tantra ukrttavyaḥ
translated: But the incidental mention of the unity of the meaning of the root is somehow not universal, and will occur in the case of sacrifice etc. Therefore, it is not to be excessively insisted upon.

original: tataścaitadapi saṃśayakāraṇaṃ pūrvapaśavādinaḥ pratibhāti / kiṃ dhātvarthānpratyupādīyamānā bhāvanā pratyekaṃ samāpyate / athavā te tāṃ pratyupādīyamānāḥ saṃhatya viśiṃṣantī / ti/
analyzed: tatas ca etat api saṃśaya kāraṇam pūrvapaśavādinaḥ pratibhāti kim dhātvarthān pratyupādīyamānā bhāvanā pratyekam samāpyate athavā te tām pratyupādīyamānāḥ saṃhatya viśiṃṣanti iti
translated: And therefore, this also appears as a cause of doubt to the proponents of the former view: Is the bhāvanā, which is presented in relation to the meanings of the root, completed individually, or do those [meanings of the root], which are presented in relation to it, collectively specify it?

analyzed: kim tāvat prāptam saṃhatya iti
translated: What is the prima facie view? That [they are presented] collectively.

original: tatra samudāyaścikīrṣitaḥ samudāyādekamapūrve na vā śābdaḥ samudāya ityādiṣu punaḥ punaḥ samudāyaśabdoccāraṇādapūrvekatvābhidhānācca tisṛbhyo bhāvanābhya ekamapūvaimiti pūvaḥ pacaḥ /
analyzed: tatra samudāyaḥ cikīrṣitaḥ samudāyāt ekam apūrve na vā śābdaḥ samudāyaḥ ityādiṣu punar punar samudāya śabda uccāraṇāt apūrva ekatva abhidhānāt ca tisṛbhyaḥ bhāvanābhyaḥ ekam iti pūvaḥ pacaḥ
translated: There, because of the repeated utterance of the word 'collection' in [passages] such as 'The collection is desired, one unseen [result] from the collection or not', and because of the statement of the oneness of the unseen [result] from the three bhāvanās, the prima facie view is that there is one unseen [result] from the three bhāvanās.

analyzed: iyam vā upapattiḥ
translated: This is the reasoning.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa śruta virodhe tu satya dṛṣṭam prakalpate
translated: But when there is a contradiction with what is seen and heard, what is unseen is imagined.

analyzed: ca avirodhi tve siddhe na aneka kalpanā
translated: And when the non-contradiction with the one is established, there is no imagination of many.

analyzed: tat eva āca
translated: That itself is said.

analyzed: pratyaya artha pradhāna tvāt pratidhātu na bhidyate
translated: Because the meaning of the suffix is primary, it is not differentiated by each root.

analyzed: tatra upadīyamāna tvāt vātvarthaḥ saṃhatāḥ punar
translated: There, the meanings of the words are combined because they are presented there.

original: pramiddhe bhāvanābheda bhāvyabhedo niyogataḥ /🔽na cāso samudāyatvameka śabdyādineṣyate
analyzed: pramiddhe bhāvanā bheda bhāvya bhedaḥ niyogataḥ  na samudāya tvam eka śabdi ādinā iṣyate
translated: When the conception is different, the thing to be accomplished is necessarily different.

analyzed: a ca ucyate
translated: And that is not accepted as the nature of the whole by one word, etc.🔽And it is said:

analyzed: yathā rakta upadhānena nirudve sphaṭike sati
translated: Just as when a crystal is placed on a red object,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa ādi codanā yuktam gamyate sphaṭika antaram
translated: another crystal is understood to be connected with the injunction of black, etc.

original: yasmātprakṛtipratyayayoḥ svārthābhidhāne smṛterācārācca nitya vivakṣitakramatvena pūrvaprayuktaprakṛtyarthavyāpteṣu prattipattṛṣu prattyāṃśaḥ sannipatan kṛtānubandhameva svārthaṃ vadati tasmānna kadā citpratyayārthaḥ śuddho labhyate/
analyzed: yasmāt prakṛti pratyayayoḥ svārtha abhidhāne smṛteḥ ācārāt ca nitya vivakṣita krama tvena pūrva prayukta prakṛti artha vyāpteṣu prattipattṛṣu prattyāṃśaḥ san nipatan kṛta anubandham eva svārtham vadati tasmāt na kadā cit pratyaya arthaḥ śuddhaḥ labhyate
translated: Because it is remembered that the root and suffix denote their own meanings, and because of practice, the suffix, being of a fixed order, occurring in the audience already pervaded by the meaning of the root used earlier, speaks of its own meaning as connected with what is done. Therefore, the meaning of the suffix is never obtained as pure.🔽As it is said, the second case ending, occurring from the base,

original: yathoktaṃ prātipadikāduccarantī dvitīyā dvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda /🔽divibhaktiḥ prātipadikārtho viśeṣaka ityāceti /
analyzed: yathoktam prātipadikāt uccarantī dvitīyā dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda  di vibhaktiḥ prātipadika arthaḥ viśeṣakaḥ
translated: the case ending is the meaning of the base, the qualifier.

analyzed: prayoga vākya śeṣa bhāvena hi samudāyasya sattā saṃbandhaḥ iti
translated: For the existence of the whole is related to the context of the sentence of usage.

original: ekāpūrvakalpanayā di samudāyānuraktabhāvanākalpamataṃ phalasaṃbandha nimittā vāpūrvakalpanā/
analyzed: eka apūrva kalpanayā samudāya anurakta bhāvanā kalpa matam phala saṃbandha nimittā vā apūrva kalpanā
translated: The idea that the injunction is connected with the result by the assumption of an unseen potency produced by the combination of the individual unseen potencies of the component parts, is not tenable.

original: prayogavākyaśeṣa bhāvena votpattivākyānāṃ phalasaṃbandho bhavati na svarūpaiḥ/
analyzed: prayoga vākya śeṣa bhāvena vā utpatti vākyānām phala saṃbandhaḥ bhavati na svarūpaiḥ
translated: The injunctive sentences are connected with the result either as supplementary to the procedure, or as the originative injunctions, not by their own forms.

original: avatarūpāṇi ca karmāṇi prayogavākyena gṛhyante ityavagate bheda na śakyānye kī kartuṃ / na ca dadātijuhotyoḥ prayogavākyaśeṣabhāvaṃ paśyāmo yajeta svargakāma iti kevala yā gaśravaṇā / nna ca tena dānahomo labhyete /
analyzed: ca karmāṇi prayoga vākyena gṛhyante iti avagate bheda na śakyāni kartum na ca dadāti juhotyoḥ prayoga vākya śeṣa bhāvam paśyāmaḥ yajeta svarga kāmaḥ iti na ca tena dāna homaḥ labhyete
translated: And when it is understood that the rites are grasped by the injunctive sentence in their own forms, they cannot be taken as different. And we do not see the injunctive sentence as supplementary to the giving and offering, because of the mere hearing of 'one desiring heaven should sacrifice', and giving and offering are not obtained from that.

analyzed: sva artha tyāga prasaṅgāt ubhaya āśrayaṇe vā yugapad śati lakṣaṇa āpattiḥ doṣaḥ
translated: And if both are resorted to, there is the fault of the simultaneity of the two contradictory characteristics.

analyzed: tasmāt na samudāya kalpanā asti
translated: Therefore there is no assumption of a combination.

analyzed: atas ca dhātu anya tvena pada anta ra tvāt keva viśiṣṭa tā gamyate
translated: And hence, being a different word due to the difference in the verbal root, the mere qualified nature is understood.

analyzed: na ca jñāna antareṇa nivarttate
translated: And it is not set aside by another cognition.

analyzed: na ca sva tva āpāḍhana abhyadhika tvāt
translated: And there is no identity of the verbal root, because of the excess of the meaning of the root in the sense of sprinkling and the sense of taking away.

analyzed: na ca tyāga mātra lakṣaṇā sva artha vṛtti tvena api vākya samavāya upapatteḥ
translated: And it cannot be merely a statement of giving, because even in the case of its having its own meaning, the connection with the sentence is possible.

original: na ca dāviṇāni nāma guṇaḥ kaścitprasiddha iti sāmānādhikaraṇyānnāmadheyatvameva yuktam /
analyzed: na ca dāviṇāni nāma guṇaḥ kaścid prasiddhaḥ iti sāmānādhikaraṇyāt nāmadheya tvam eva yuktam
translated: And since no quality called 'dāviṇa' is known, it is proper that it is a name by reason of the co-ordination.

analyzed: atas ca vākya ānarthakyam mā abhūt iti homaḥ vidhīyate
translated: And therefore, in order to avoid the meaninglessness of the sentence, the homa is enjoined.

original: dadātinā tu yāgamanūdya guṇe vidhīyamāne hiraṇyātreyasaṃbandhe vākyabhedaprasaṅgādguṇādapi bhedaḥ saṃbhavatītyacaikaguṇo ekasyaiva punaḥ śrutiraviśeṣādanarthakaṃ hi syāt
analyzed: dadātinā tu yāgam anūdya guṇe vidhīyamāne hiraṇyātreya saṃbandhe vākya bheda prasaṅgāt guṇāt api bhedaḥ saṃbhavati iti ekasya eva punar śrutiḥ aviśeṣāt anarthakam hi syāt
translated: But when the sacrifice is referred to by 'dadāti' and a quality is enjoined in connection with gold and a cow, there would be syntactical split, so the difference is possible even from the quality. Thus, the repetition of the same thing with one quality is meaningless due to the absence of distinction.

analyzed: śabda antara adhikaraṇa pratyudāharaṇa rūpeṇa abhyāsasya pūrvapakṣaḥ sukham abhidhīyate eti tad anantaram ārambhaḥ
translated: The prima facie view of repetition is stated easily in the form of a counter-example to the Adhikaraṇa on the different words, so the commencement is after that.

analyzed: tatra samidhaḥ yajati tata vārtika
translated: There, the aphorism is: He offers the kindling wood, then the commentary.

original: nūmapātaṃ yajatītyādiṣu samidādiśabdānapoddhṛtya yajatītvetatpañcakṛtvo 'bhihitaṃ kimekasya karmaṇo vācakamathāne kasyetyudāhṛtaṃ tadākṣipyate
analyzed: yajati ityādiṣu samidh ādi śabdān apoddhṛtya yajati iti etat pañca kṛtvas bhihitam kim ekasya karmaṇaḥ vācakam atha ane kasya iti udāhṛtam tat ākṣipyate
translated: In the cases of 'He offers the oblation to Agni', 'He offers the oblation to Soma', etc., the word 'yajati' (offers) is repeated five times after extracting the words like 'samid' (kindling wood), etc. Is it the denoter of one action or of many? This is stated and then it is objected.

original: ṣaḍapi bhedahetavaḥ pṛthagbhūtāḥ svasāmarthyamācavyāpāraphalā darśayitavyāḥ / tadyāvadatra guṇanāmadheyayorbhedakaratvaṃ nāpanīyate na tāvadabhyāsasya parabhāgalābho'stītyanyadudāharttavyam/
analyzed: ṣaṭ api bheda hetavaḥ pṛthak bhūtāḥ sva sāmarthya māca vyāpāra phalāḥ darśayitavyāḥ tat yāvat atra guṇa nāmadheyayoḥ bheda kara tvam na apanīyate na tāvat abhyāsasya parabhāga lābhaḥ usti iti anyat udāharttavyam
translated: All the six causes of difference, being distinct, should be shown to have their own independent operation and result. As long as the difference between quality and name is not removed here, the repetition does not gain anything from the latter part, so another example should be cited.

analyzed: na ca tat saṃbhavati kutas
translated: And that is not possible. Why?

original: aindravāyavaṃ gṛhṇātītyevamādoni hi sarvāṇi paramparā saṃgacyai/tpattikaguṇayogādbhidyante /
analyzed: aindra vāyavam gṛhṇāti iti evamādoni hi sarvāṇi paramparā
translated: Because all these, beginning with he takes the Aindravayava, are combined in a series. They are distinguished by the quality of being produced together.

original: bhinne juhoti skanne juhotī tyādonyapi phalaṃ vā karmasannidhāvityanena nyāyena nimittaṃ pratyupādīyamānatvādbhidyante /
analyzed: bhinne juhoti skanne juhoti tyādoni api phalam vā karma sannidhau iti anena nyāyena nimittam pratyupādīyamāna tvāt bhidyante
translated: When distinguished, they are distinguished by the principle that he offers when cut and he offers when spilled, etc., are taken as the occasion for another result in the proximity of the action.

analyzed: nimitta saṃbandha paratvāt ca na abhyāsa ānarthakyam iti abhedaka tvam
translated: And because it is concerned with the connection with the occasion, the repetition is not meaningless. Thus it is not a cause of non-difference.

original: ye tu pañcaśāradīyeṣu tānparyagnikṛtāṃstānparyagnikṛtānityevamabhyāsamudāharanti teṣāṃ prākṛta paryagnikaraṇānuvādaprasmaraṇasāmarthyaṃ tat /
analyzed: ye tu pañcaśāradīyeṣu tān paryagnikṛtān tān paryagnikṛtān iti evam abhyāsam udāharanti teṣām prākṛta paryagnikaraṇa anuvāda prasmaraṇa sāmarthyam tat
translated: But those who cite the repetition as those that have been encircled with fire, those that have been encircled with fire in the Pañcaśāradīya, their ability to remember the restatement of the original encircling with fire is that.

original: na vā 'tra yajatiḥ śrūyate yasyābhyāsādbhedaḥ syāditi na kiṃ cidudāharaṇam /
analyzed: na vā tra yajatiḥ śrūyate yasya abhyāsāt bhedaḥ syāt iti na kim cit udāharaṇam
translated: Or, in this case, there is no injunctive word heard, from the repetition of which there could be difference. So there is no example at all.

analyzed: yathā udāhṛtedhu eva tu samādhiḥ
translated: But the reconciliation is just as stated.

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: Second quarter of the second chapter.

original: yānyupādeyārthāni nāmapadāni tāni tāvadākhyātaparatantratvāttadanusāroṇi santi tadvṛttiṃ pratīcante / taccetprakṛte niviṣṭaṃ nāmapadamapi tasyaiva guṇavidhirnāmadheyaṃ vā /
analyzed: yāni upādeya arthāni nāma padāni tāni tāvat ākhyāta paratantra tvāt tad anusārīṇi santi tad vṛttim tat ced prakṛte niviṣṭam nāma padam api tasya eva guṇa vidhiḥ nāmadheyam vā
translated: Those nominal words which have a meaning to be added, since they depend on the verb, follow it, and are directed towards its function. If that is included in the original, then even that nominal word is either an injunction of an accessory of that, or a name.

original: atha tenāpūrva pa rikalpita / matastadgāmi nāmapadamityevaṃ bhedābhedayosvagatayoḥ pa svādāgacchatmamidādipadama kiṃcitkaratvādudāste tena tadpohatyākhyātamācaṃ vicāryate /
analyzed: atha tena apūrva pa rikalpita mataḥ tad gāmi nāma padam iti evam bheda abhedayoḥ svagatayoḥ kiṃcitkara tvāt udāste tena tat apohati ākhyāta mācam vicāryate
translated: If, on the other hand, an unseen result is assumed by that, then that nominal word goes to that. Thus, the difference and non-difference are understood from the words themselves. The word 'idam' etc. remains neutral, since it does nothing. Therefore, the function of the verb is considered to exclude that.

analyzed: nanu evam sati saṃjñā guṇayoḥ abhedaka tva pramaṅgaḥ
translated: If that is so, then there is an opportunity for the name and quality not to be differentiators.

original: tatra to bhedako yatrākhyātapaḍhana vyāpriyate tathā codāhariṣyati /
analyzed: tatra bhedakaḥ vyāpriyate tathā ca udāhariṣyati
translated: There, the differentiator is where the verb and nominal word operate. And he will cite it thus:

analyzed: atha eṣa jyotiḥ vājibhyaḥ vājinam iti
translated: This light is the prize for the prize-winning horses.

original: vājine tāvannaivākhyātapadaṃ śrūyate / jyotirādākpyākhyātasya guṇa phalasaṃbandhavyāpāreṇa prakṛtaniveśasaṃbhave sati tataḥ pūrvapravṛttayā saṃjñayaiva bhedo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vājine tāvat na eva ākhyāta padam śrūyate jyotiḥ ādākpya ākhyātasya guṇa phala saṃbandha vyāpāreṇa prakṛta niveśa saṃbhave sati tatas pūrva pravṛttayā saṃjñayā eva bhedaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: In the case of the word 'vājinī', the verb is not heard at all. When it is possible for the verb 'jyotiṣṭoma' to be connected with the result by the operation of connecting the subsidiary with the primary, the difference will be made by the name itself, which occurs earlier.

original: yatrāpyākhyātasya svarasena prakṛtakarmaniveśopalave sati tatrāsaṃbhavan guṇo vidhīyate tatrāpyasau bhedakā / yathācaivābhyupetyavāde vakṣyati ma eṣa devatāyāgasaṃbandho vidhoyamāna ityādi /
analyzed: yatra api ākhyātasya svarasena prakṛta karma niveśa upalave sati tatra asaṃbhavan guṇaḥ vidhīyate tatra api asau bhedakā yathā ca eva abhyupetya vāde vakṣyati me eṣa devatā yāga saṃbandhaḥ vidhoyamānaḥ ityādi
translated: Even where the verb is capable of connecting the primary action by its own force, and the subsidiary is enjoined there also, that is the cause of difference. And as it will be said in the doctrine of acceptance, 'this connection of the deity with the sacrifice is being enjoined' and so on.

original: taccākhyātasya bhedaśaktau vihatāyāṃ bha batauti tadeva tāvatprathamaṃ parokṣyate /
analyzed: tat ca ākhyātasya bheda śaktau vihatāyām bha bata iti tat eva tāvat prathamam parokṣyate
translated: And that is said when the power of the verb to cause difference is destroyed. That itself is to be examined first.

original: kimekamapūrvamiti phastutaḥ karmabhedābhedopanyāso / yadā kimekaṃ karmāpūrvaṃ codayacyuta pañcāpi karmaṇyapūrvāṇīti /
analyzed: kim ekam apūrvam iti phastutaḥ karma bheda abheda upanyāsaḥ yadā kim ekam karma apūrvam codaya cyuta pañca api karmaṇi apūrvāṇi iti
translated: The statement of the difference or non-difference of actions is based on the question whether there is one unseen result or five unseen results. When it is asked whether there is one action and one unseen result, or whether there are five unseen results in the action.

analyzed: kim prāptam ekam apūrvam iti
translated: What is the conclusion? There is one unseen result.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: C yathaiva yajatiśabdaḥ sakṛtpratyakṣeṇāvagataḥ punaruccāraṇesa eveti pratyabhijñānānna bhidyate/
analyzed: yathā eva yajati śabdaḥ sakṛt pratyakṣeṇa avagataḥ eva iti pratyabhijñānāt na bhidyate
translated: Just as the word 'yajati', once understood by perception, is not differentiated by recognition as the same when uttered again,

original: tathā tadarthoopi / yathā cātraiva buddhabodhanakṛtpratyakṣa manarthakamapi bhavanna śaknoti śabdāntaratvaṃ karttu /mevaṃ punaḥ śrutirarthāntaratvam/
analyzed: tathā yathā ca atra eva buddha bodhana kṛt pratyakṣa manarthakam api bhavan na śaknoti śabda antara tvam karttum evam punar śrutiḥ artha antara tvam
translated: And so also the meaning of that [word]. And just as here itself, the perception that awakens the Buddha is meaningless but still cannot make it a different word. In the same way, the Vedic text does not make it a different meaning.

original: na hyānarthakyaṃ nāma va citpramāṇavarge'ntarbhavati /🔽yacca vedo 'vabodhayati tanmātrameva tatpramāṇavādibhirabhyupagantavyam /
analyzed: na hi ānarthakyam nāma cit pramāṇa varge antarbhavati  yat ca vedaḥ vabodhayati tanmātram eva tat pramāṇa vādibhiḥ abhyupagantavyam
translated: For meaninglessness does not fall into any class of valid cognition.🔽And whatever the Veda makes known, that alone must be accepted as valid by those who uphold the Veda.

original: tadihaikaśabdenābheda vedenāvagamite yo 'nyatvaṃ kalpayati tena veda evāpramāṇīkṛtaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tat iha eka śabdena abheda vedena avagamite yaḥ nya tvam kalpayati tena vedaḥ eva a pramāṇīkṛtaḥ syāt
translated: Therefore, when non-difference is understood by the Veda through one word, one who imagines difference would make the Veda itself invalid.

analyzed: na ca pramāṇa avagatam ānarthakyam doṣāya
translated: And what is known by a valid means of knowledge cannot be faulted by meaninglessness.

analyzed: asti vā iyam api gatiḥ
translated: And this is also a way out.

original: prayogavacanasaṃspṛṣṭaḥ śabdo 'rthamavadadhatsvayaṃ prayogitvena gṛhyataitya / thavābhīkṣṇyādicotanārtho'bhyāso bhaviṣyatyasti hi loke dvirvacanādatirekeṇāpi yāvatkṛtvobhyaste vivaścitārthaprakāśanaṃ bhavati tāvatkṛtvo 'bhyāsastathā ca pañcendropākhyāne vṛddhakumārīvaraprārthane patiṃ me dehīti pañcakatvobhyāsaḥ śrūyate /
analyzed: prayoga vacana saṃspṛṣṭaḥ śabdaḥ rtham avadadhat svayam prayogi tvena bhaviṣyati asti hi loke dvirvacanāt atirekeṇa api vivaścita artha prakāśanam bhavati tāvat kṛtvas bhyāsaḥ tathā ca pañca indra upākhyāne vṛddha kumārī vara prārthane patim me dehi iti śrūyate
translated: The word, coming in contact with the statement of the performance, while denoting the meaning, is itself apprehended as being performed. Thus, the repetition will serve the purpose of indicating the frequency, etc. For in the world, the indication of the repeated meaning is done as many times as the repetition is done, even when there is no repetition beyond the twofold statement. And in the request for the boon of an elderly unmarried girl in the Pañceṃdropakhyāna, the repetition of the fivefold Give me a husband is heard.

original: na ca yathā tatra devatāyāḥ chalagrāhitvamevamiha kasya cidyena patipañcakabatpañcayāgakalpanā syāda /tha vā sarveṣvapyuccāraṇeṣu vidhāvāśrīyamāṇe karmaikatvaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: na ca yathā tatra devatāyāḥ chala grāhi tvam evam iha kasya cit yena pati pañcaka bat pañca yāga kalpanā syāt atha vā sarveṣu api uccāraṇeṣu vidhau āśrīyamāṇe karma eka tvam vijñāyate
translated: And just as there the deity is grasped by the word deva, so here there is no one else by whom the five sacrifices can be imagined like the five husbands. Or, when injunction is accepted in all the utterances, the oneness of the action is understood.

analyzed: yathā śākhā antarīyeṣu jyotiṣṭoma ādi vākyeṣu
translated: Just as in the statements about the Jyotiṣṭoma, etc. in the different recensions.

original: tena tulyārthānāṃ vaikalpikatvāttadeva karma kadā citmamiḍākyenābhidhāsyate kadā cittanūnapādākyena /
analyzed: tena tulya arthānām vaikalpika tvāt tat eva karma kadā cit mama iḍākyena abhidhāsyate kadā cit tanūnapād ākyena
translated: Therefore, since those having the same meaning are optional, that same action will sometimes be denoted by the statement about the Ṛc, sometimes by the statement about the Tānūnaptra.

original: na hi samānakāryatvena brohiyavayore kasyā nartha kyā darthāntara sādhakatvaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: na hi samāna kārya tvena brohi yavayoḥ e kasyāḥ artha kyāt artha antara sādhaka tvam vijñāyate
translated: For it is not known that the two words 'brahman' and 'yava' have the same effect, and that one is the means of accomplishing a different purpose.

original: atha vā tanūnapāḍhādidevatā vidhānārthatvānnānarthakāṃ karmavidhāne hi sati nāmadheyatvaṃ bhaveda / nuvāde tu nāmadheyavidhirna saṃbhavatīti guṇavidhitvaṃ tasmādapyakarmāntaram/
analyzed: atha vā tanūnapāḍha ādi devatāḥ vidhāna artha tvāt na anarthakām karma vidhāne hi sati nāmadheya tvam bhavet a nuvāde tu nāmadheya vidhiḥ na saṃbhavati iti guṇa vidhi tvam tasmāt api a karmāntaram
translated: Or, because of the purpose of enjoining the deity Tanūnapāt etc., it is not meaningless. For if the injunction of the rite were to be the name, then the injunction of the name would not be possible in the case of a restatement. But because of the injunction of the quality, it is not a different rite. Therefore, it is not a different rite.

original: yatrāpi ca pradeśāntara tāveva śabdārthoṃ/🔽pratyabhijñāyete tatrāpi hi gṛhānnirgadvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīya pāda /
analyzed: yatra api ca tau eva śabda arthau  pratyabhijñāyete tatra api hi gṛhāt nirga dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīya pāda
translated: And even where the same words and meanings are found in a different section,🔽they are recognized as the same. Even there, when one goes out of the house,

analyzed: tasya punar gṛha jana pratyabhijñāyām iva artha antara tvam aśakyam vaktum
translated: and then returns to the house, it is not possible to say that the house and the people in it are different, as in the case of recognizing the house and the people in it.

analyzed: kim uta idānīm antara viparivṛttyā
translated: How much more so in the case of the cow to be released, which has undergone a change immediately after?

analyzed: yadi ca pratyuccāraṇam artha anya tvam bhavet tadā nitya vyakti śabda artha tva pramaṅgaḥ
translated: And if the meaning were different with each utterance, then there would be an occasion for the meaning of the word to be a transient individual.

analyzed: gatvā divat na ca eteṣu yāga tvam vyatiricyate
translated: Having gone to heaven, the nature of being a sacrifice does not differ in them.

original: vyaktyaikatve nirūḍhaṃ ca kathaṃ karmāntaraṃ bhavet
analyzed: vyaktyā ekatve nirūḍham ca katham karma antaram bhavet
translated: And how could it be a different rite when the unity of the individual is well-established?

analyzed: ākhyāta pratyayaḥ pūrvam vidhatte karma śaktitaḥ
translated: The verbal suffix first enjoins the action by its own potency.

analyzed: anyena ākṣipta śaktiḥ tu tat ākāṅkṣati anūditam
translated: But when its potency is projected by another, it then desires what is stated subsequently.

analyzed: anuvāda viśeṣa tvam prakṛta pratyayāt bhavet
translated: The character of being a restatement would be due to the suffix denoting the primary act.

analyzed: tad māmānya pravṛttiḥ tu sva vākyat eva labhyate
translated: But the engagement of that in another act is obtained only from its own sentence.

original: vidhāyikā hi śrutiranyānāścitā dhātvarthabhāvanayoreva saṃniruvā tatraivāprāptaviṣayasvabhāvaṃ vidhitvaṃ prasuvānā pañcamasthānākhyapramāṇakṛtāṃ prāptabuddhimupammṛdya vidheyatvaśramaṃ karmāntaraṃ ka lpayati /
analyzed: vidhāyikā hi śrutiḥ anya an āścitā dhātvartha bhāvanayoḥ eva tatra eva aprāpta viṣaya svabhāvam vidhi tvam prasuvānā pañcama sthāna ākhya pramāṇa kṛtām prāpta buddhim upammṛdya vidheya tva śramam karma antaram ka lpayati
translated: For the injunctive word, not being enjoined by another, enjoins only the action and the bhāvanā (the activity of the agent), and there it produces the injunctive nature, which is by its very nature confined to what is not obtained, and having produced that, it sets aside the cognition produced by the means of knowledge called the fifth case (the dative), and imagines a different action to be enjoined.

original: sa cedvidhiḥ śrutimanurudhyeta karmāntaramadhyavamyatya / ya sannidhiṃ tato na karmāntaratvam /
analyzed: sa ced vidhiḥ śrutim anurudhyeta sannidhim tatas na karma antara tvam
translated: And if that injunction were to follow the injunctive word, it would imagine a different action, but because of proximity, it is not a different action.

original: yatra punarvidhiśrutiranyatra vyāpriyate tatrāvirodhātsaṃnidhikṛtaṃ kakatvajñānaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: yatra punar vidhi śrutiḥ anyatra vyāpriyate tatra avirodhāt saṃnidhi kṛtam ka ka tva jñānam bhavati
translated: But where the injunctive word operates elsewhere, there the cognition of the act being done, produced by proximity, is not contradicted.

analyzed: tasmāt iha vidheya yāga vyakti phana tva upātta sāmānya ekatva nimittā eva pratyabhijñāna bhrāntiḥ
translated: Therefore, here the recognition is a mere illusion, based on the oneness of the general nature obtained by the individual sacrifice to be enjoined and the result.

analyzed: na hi vyakti pratyabhijñāne kim cit kāraṇam asti
translated: For there is no reason at all for the recognition of the individual.

original: yadaca paramārthena pratyabhijñāyate tadekatve na kaściḍivādastathā ci
analyzed: yat a ca paramārthena pratyabhijñāyate tad ekatve na kaścid vivādaḥ tathā
translated: When something is really recognized, there is no dispute about its oneness. Thus,

original: nanu cātra yaji śrutyaivaika karma vijñānānna vaktavyaṃ sannidhikṛtamevaikatvamiti/
analyzed: nanu ca atra yaji śrutyā eva eka karma vijñānāt na vaktavyam sannidhi kṛtam eva eka tvam iti
translated: But here, since only one action is known through the Vedic injunction itself, it should not be said that oneness is due to proximity.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: vyaktayaḥ hi vidhīyante sāmānyena upalaḥ citāḥ
translated: For the individuals are enjoined, being perceived by the universal.

analyzed: tasmāt tad gata meva atra bheda abheda nirūpaṇam
translated: Therefore, the determination of difference and non-difference here pertains only to that.

original: yanmātramekaṃ karmeti svarūpeṇa vadhāryate /🔽tataḥ paraṃ na bhedosti prāktasmādbhedaniścayaḥ
analyzed: yanmātram ekam karma iti sva rūpeṇa vadhāryate  tatas param na bhedaḥ usti prāk tasmāt bheda niścayaḥ
translated: That much alone is ascertained as one action by its own nature.🔽Beyond that, there is no difference; the ascertainment of difference is prior to that.

original: na ca yatra pratyakṣeṇa kevalena bhedo'vagamyate tadevaikaṃ bhidyate /
analyzed: na ca yatra pratyakṣeṇa kevalena bhedaḥ uvagamyate tat eva ekam bhidyate
translated: And where difference is understood only by perception, that alone is divided.

original: śabdasyāpi prāmāṇyā viśeṣāt ato'tra śabdāntarādiṣaṭkāvadhireva bhedo 'vadhārayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: śabdasya api prāmāṇyā viśeṣāt atas utra śabda antara ādi ṣaṭka avadhiḥ eva bhedaḥ vadhārayitavyaḥ
translated: Because of the non-distinction of the word also, therefore, the difference here should be ascertained up to the group of six beginning with another word.

original: na hīṣṭipaśusomaikā hāhī nasatreṣu paropādhirbhedapratyayo viparyeti vā kadā cit /
analyzed: na hi iṣṭi paśu soma ekā hāhī na satreṣu para upādhiḥ bheda pratyayaḥ viparyeti vā kadā cit
translated: For the cognition of difference due to external adjuncts does not change or ever go wrong in the Ishti, animal sacrifice, Soma, and Satra sacrifices.

original: tena tāsu vidheyarūpāsa vyaktiṣveva nityāskhabhivyañjakāni bhidyante /
analyzed: tena tāsu vyaktiṣu eva bhidyante
translated: Therefore, in those individual entities that are to be enjoined, the eternal and non-eternal manifestors are distinguished.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca phala svarūpa siddhiḥ yāga tvam eva na anyat kim cit
translated: And from them, the establishment of the form of the result is only the nature of being a sacrifice, not anything else.

analyzed: nanu eka aha tva ādīni api avāntara sāmānyāni iṣyante
translated: But are not the sub-universals such as being a one-day sacrifice also accepted?

analyzed: na kāla viśeṣa yogāt eva daṇḍi ādi vat abhinna śabda pratyaya pravṛtti siddheḥ
translated: No. Because the application of the same word and cognition is established by the connection with a particular time itself, like in the case of daṇḍī etc.

original: ekena hyahnā yogāḍhakāitvam yāḍhibhirahīnatvaṃ pragdādaśāhātma tu kathamapyubhayātmā tadavadhikameva cāsahasra saṃkhyavatmarakānayoga nimitta satratvaṃ havirviśeṣayogādiṣṭyāditvamiti siddham /
analyzed: ekena hi ahnā yoga āḍhaka ai tvam tu katham api ubhaya ātmā tad avadhikam eva satra tvam haviḥ viśeṣa yogāt iṣṭi ādi tvam iti siddham
translated: For, by one day there is the nature of being a yoga-āḍhaka, by āḍhakas there is the nature of being a hyahna, and by the first twelve days there is somehow a nature of both. And the nature of being a sattra with a limit of that, with a number of one thousand, is due to the connection with a particular oblation, and the nature of being an iṣṭi is established.

analyzed: punar tathā api asmat paśca avirodhaḥ
translated: Even if the sub-universals are again assumed, even then there is no contradiction in our view.

original: evaṃ yadi jyotiṣṭomatvādīni deśakālādibhedācca tāktayotyantātira kiṣyo bhavanti tathāpyadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: evam yadi jyotiṣṭoma tva ādīni deśa kāla ādi bhedāt ca bhavanti tathā api adoṣaḥ
translated: Thus, if the universals such as being a jyotiṣṭoma are completely different due to the differences of place, time etc., even then there is no fault.

original: tathā yadyapi devatoddeśadravyatyāgātmakatvātsarva evaiko yāgaḥ kalpya'te teṣvapi bhedapramāṇaistadanuṣṭhānanānātvāvagamāyavahārasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: tathā yadi api devatā uddeśa dravya tyāga ātmaka tvāt sarvaḥ eva ekaḥ yāgaḥ kalpyate teṣu api bheda pramāṇaiḥ tad anuṣṭhāna nānātva avagamāt avahāra siddhiḥ
translated: And even if all of them are assumed to be one sacrifice, because of the offering of substances intended for the gods, yet the establishment of usage for the understanding of the diversity of their performance is by the means of knowing the distinctions among them.

analyzed: nanu evam mati jyotiṣṭoma graha abhyāsa vat mamidh ādi yāga abhyāsa ghu akarma antara tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If so, then there would be the undesirable consequence of the repetition of the Jyotiṣṭoma and the grasping of the Soma being a separate ritual.

original: sarvathā tāvadaparvamedāirmavyavasthāḍhīni si dhyanti / tathāpi tu yeha karmabhedabuddhigrahayāgeṣu cābhyāsabhedadvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda /🔽prasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: sarvathā tāvat aparva meda airma vyavasthā āḍhīni si dhyanti tathā api tu yā iha karma bheda buddhi graha yāgeṣu ca abhyāsa bheda dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda  prasiddhiḥ
translated: In any case, the distinctions based on the absence of a fixed point are certainly established. However, in the case of the Jyotiṣṭoma and the grasping of the Soma, the notion of the repetition of the ritual is well-known.

original: tacaitannimittam i sakalayāgarūpānuṣṭhānabhedacodanā tatra punaḥ samastābhyāsātmakasya jyotiṣṭomasaṃjñatvādyadyapi pratyabhyāsa yāgatvamasti na ta jyotiṣṭomatvamityabhyāse avayavabuddhirnetaratrāvayavyantararūpānupādānāditi viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tat ca etad nimittam sakala yāga rūpa anuṣṭhāna bheda codanā tatra punar samasta abhyāsa ātmakasya jyotiṣṭoma saṃjña tvāt yadi api prati abhyāsa yāga tvam asti na jyotiṣṭoma tvam iti abhyāse avayava buddhiḥ na itaratra avayavi antara rūpa anupādānāt iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: And that is the reason why the injunction of the distinction in the performance of the entire form of the sacrifice is there. Moreover, because of the name Jyotiṣṭoma belonging to the form consisting of the repetition as a whole, although there is the nature of being a sacrifice for each repetition, it is not the nature of being a Jyotiṣṭoma. Thus, the notion of parts is in the repetition, but not in the other case, because of the non-inclusion of another form consisting of the whole. This is the distinction.

analyzed: ca prayojanam paśu soma adhikaraṇe vacyāmaḥ
translated: And the purpose of this knowledge we will state in the section on the animal and Soma sacrifices.

analyzed: tasmāt abhyāsitavyaḥ yāgaḥ iti ca bhāṣyam etat paśyanā eva
translated: Therefore, the commentary the sacrifice should be performed should be seen by one who sees this.

original: athavā bhināskheva vyaktiṣu sāmānyāpecamabhyāsavacanam /🔽nanūktaṃ na śakkrotyarthāntaraṃ vidhātumiti vidhiśaktestanūnapādādidevatābhidhānāpe sati viparivṛtya virodha iti manyase /
analyzed: athavā vyaktiṣu sāmānya apecam abhyāsa vacanam  nanu uktam na sati viparivṛtya virodhaḥ iti manyase
translated: Or, the statement of repetition is indeed with respect to the individual universals.🔽But it has been said that it cannot enjoin another object. You think that there is a contradiction due to the reversal of the injunctive power, in the absence of the designation of the deity Tanūnapāt etc.

original: tatra tatprakhyaṃ cānyaśāstramityevaṃ samidādipadānāṃ kramaviniyuktaiva liṅgamantravarṇakalpitadevatāsaṃbandhadvāreṇa nāmadheyatve sati avidheyatvānnāsti vidhiśaktyākṣepa iti vaktavye devatāyāgasaṃvandha vidhānopanyāsobhyupetyavādena /
analyzed: tatra tad prakhyam ca anya śāstram iti evam samidh ādi padānām krama viniyuktā eva liṅga mantra varṇa kalpita devatā saṃbandha dvāreṇa nāmadheya tve sati avidheya tvāt na asti vidhi śakti ākṣepaḥ iti vaktavye devatā yāga saṃvandha vidhāna upanyāsaḥ abhyupetya vādena
translated: There, it should be said that the indication of the words samid etc. is only in the order of injunction, through the connection with the deity imagined by the indicative power of the mantra, when it is a name, and not being enjoined, there is no transference of the injunctive power. The statement of the injunction of the connection between the deity and the sacrifice is a concession.

original: yattāvadbhavānaprāptatvātprathamasya yāgavi dhitvaṃ manyate tadayuktaṃ tasyāpi pradhāna yāgānuvādatvāt /
analyzed: yat tāvat bhavān aprāpta tvāt prathamasya yāga vi dhi tvam manyate tat ayuktam tasya api pradhāna yāga anuvāda tvāt
translated: As for your opinion that the first is not obtained and therefore is the injunction of the sacrifice, that is incorrect, because that also is a restatement of the principal sacrifice.

analyzed: tatra samidh ādi śabdaiḥ dravyam devatā vā vidhīyate
translated: There, is the substance or the deity enjoined by the words samid etc.?

original: ubhayamapi cāgneyo 'ṣṭākapāla ityādibhirutpattivākyairvihitena dravyadevatena viru dhyate /
analyzed: ubhayam api ca āgneyaḥ u ṣṭākapālaḥ ityādibhiḥ utpatti vākyaiḥ vihitena dravya devatena viru dhyate
translated: And both of these are contradicted by the substance and deity enjoined by the originative injunctions beginning with 'Agneyo aṣṭākapālo' (one having eight potsherds is for Agni).

original: avaśyaṃ caitadvākyakṛto yāgasaṃbandhaḥ karttavyaḥ / saca yā gāntarāite na saṃbhavatīti pratipādite guṇavidhitve karmāntaratvamāpadyate /
analyzed: avaśyam ca etad vākya kṛtaḥ yāga saṃbandhaḥ karttavyaḥ sa ca na saṃbhavati iti pratipādite guṇa vidhi tve karma antara tvam āpadyate
translated: And this connection of the sacrifice must necessarily be made by the sentence, and that is not possible with another sacrifice. When it is established that it is an injunction of a subsidiary, it becomes a different ritual act.

original: evaṃ pūrvatra karmaṇyuttarottara guṇaviṣyasaṃbhavātsarveṣāṃ karmāntaratvamiti vyartho guṇavidhyapanyāsaśramaḥ /
analyzed: evam pūrvatra karmaṇi uttara uttara guṇa viṣi asaṃbhavāt sarveṣām karma antara tvam iti vyarthaḥ guṇa vidhi apanyāsa śramaḥ
translated: Thus, in the previous case, due to the possibility of the subsequent subsidiaries in the ritual act, all are different ritual acts. So the effort to explain the injunction of subsidiaries is pointless.

analyzed: guṇa vidhi tvam api
translated: The nature of being an injunction of a subsidiary is also refuted.

original: na tāvad dravyamohana śabdena saṃbhavatīti vyākhyātaṃ sakvadhikaraṇe /
analyzed: na tāvat dravya mohana śabdena saṃbhavati iti vyākhyātam saku adhikaraṇe
translated: It has already been explained in the previous section that it is not possible by the word 'substance' (in the injunction).

original: viśeṣeṇa ca yajateḥ karmabhūtadravyasaṃbandho na ghaṭate / na vāyaṃ devatāvidhiriti navame vacyate /
analyzed: viśeṣeṇa ca yajateḥ karma bhūta dravya saṃbandhaḥ na ghaṭate na vā ayam devatā vidhiḥ iti navame vacyate
translated: And in particular, the connection with the substance that is the object of the root 'yaj' (to sacrifice) is not possible. And it is said in the ninth (chapter) that this is not an injunction of a deity.

analyzed: tasmāt karma vidhibhiḥ eva bheda siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, the establishment of difference is by the injunctions of ritual acts alone.

analyzed: aṅga pradhāna cintā iyam caturtha adhyāya gocaraḥ
translated: This consideration of subsidiaries and primary acts is the domain of the fourth chapter.

analyzed: kena nāma prasaṅgena prastutāḥ bhedalaṇe
translated: By what topic is the consideration of difference presented?

analyzed: na bhede ca dṛṣṭa sāmarthya sama prādhānya siddhaye
translated: And when the capacity is seen in difference, for the establishment of equality and primacy,

analyzed: katham śabda antara abhyāsau hetu tvena upavatā
translated: How are the repetition of different words brought in as the reason?

analyzed: sādhāraṇam dravyam devatā mā anna varṇikī
translated: The common substance is the deity, not the class.

analyzed: rūpavantau atas yāgau vidhīyete pṛthaktayā
translated: The two sacrifices, possessing form, are enjoined separately.

analyzed: niveśaḥ keṣu tcit tu eva pṛthak kena abhidhānayoḥ
translated: The arrangement of the two expressions is in some cases itself separate.

original: phalaṃ ca tadviśiṣṭebhya iti sāmyaṃ na yujyate
analyzed: phalam ca tad viśiṣṭebhyaḥ iti sāmyam na yujyate
translated: And the result is from those qualified by that. Such equality is not proper.

analyzed: prasiddhena a pramiddhasya nityam iṣṭam viśeṣaṇam
translated: The well-known is always desired as a qualifier of the unknown.

analyzed: tasmāt yajī anurodhena
translated: Therefore, in accordance with the sacrifice, the name is

analyzed: nirūpyate
translated: determined.

original: vāccakālayujo yāgāḥ prakṛtāḥ manti ke cana /
analyzed: yāgāḥ prakṛtāḥ manti ke cana
translated: Some sacrifices are connected with the time of the verbal root, and are considered to be in the original.

analyzed: dvi saṃkhyā utpatti yuktāḥ ca prasiddhiḥ yeṣu vidyate
translated: And those in which the well-known connection with the origination of two is found.

original: yadyāpyāgneyādiṣu svābhidheyakānayogātprātipadikaṃ varttata tathāpi teṣāṃ bahutvād dvitvānapapattera samarthaṃ padaṃ / yatrāpi dvitvamastyāghārayorājyabhāgayorvā tatrāpi prātipadikasyātyanta maśaktiḥ /
analyzed: yadi api āgneya ādiṣu sva abhidheyaka anayogāt prātipadikam varttata tathā api teṣām bahu tvāt dvi tva anapapatteḥ a samartham padam yatra api dvi tvam asti āghārayoḥ ājyabhāgayoḥ vā tatra api prātipadikasya atyantam aśaktiḥ
translated: Even though in the case of the Āgneya and others, the nominal stem exists due to the non-connection with its own denotation, still, because of their plurality, duality is not possible, so the word is not capable. Even where there is duality, such as in the case of the Āghāra and Ājyabhāga libations, there too the nominal stem is utterly incapable.

original: na cārthaprakaraṇaśabdānta rairvispaṣṭaṃ sāmānādhikaraṇyamasti / yena kena cidvarṇasāmānyādākhyāvikāranyāyena gauṇatvena vā tadviṣayatvamadhyavasīyeta/
analyzed: na ca artha prakaraṇa śabda antaraiḥ vispaṣṭam sāmānādhikaraṇyam asti yena kena cit varṇa sāmānyāt ākhyā vikāra nyāyena gauṇa tvena vā tad viṣaya tvam adhyavasīyeta
translated: And there is no clear co-reference with the words of the context and the object, by which its object could be determined either by the principle of figurative use based on the similarity of some letters, or by the secondary sense.

analyzed: kasmāt punar imau eva apūrvī pūrṇamāsī amā vā asyā saṃghakī hai
translated: Why are these two alone the new full moon and new moon sacrifices?

analyzed: yāgau phakhāya na vidhīyete  tathā hi tantra vārtika
translated: The two sacrifices are not enjoined.

analyzed: siddhānte pi ta yāgābhyām śabdābhyām anukīrttita
translated: Thus, in the Siddhānta, they are mentioned by the words of the two sacrifices.

analyzed: tau eva samudāyau hai
translated: Those two collections alone

analyzed: vidhāsyaṃta phalam prati
translated: will enjoin the result with respect to it.

original: na hyaṣṭānāṃ kālasaṃyoge satyavadhāraṇe heturasti / yenānayoreva phalasaṃvandhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na hi aṣṭānām kāla saṃyoge sati avadhāraṇe hetuḥ asti yena anayoḥ eva phala saṃvandhaḥ syāt
translated: For when the eight are connected with time, there is no reason for restriction, by which the connection with the result would be of these two alone.

analyzed: myāt etat
translated: This may be said:

original: eteṣāṃ madhye yayoḥ kayośiyataphala saṃbandha iti tadayuktam
analyzed: eteṣām madhye yayoḥ saṃbandhaḥ iti tat ayuktam
translated: Which two of these have the connection with the result? That is not proper.

original: vinā viśeṣahetunā yāgatvakāla saṃbandhasāmye sati yāveva gṛhītau tatraivetareṣāṃ prādhānyaprāmāṇyabhājāṃ satāmaṅgatvāpānāt viruddhatā syāt /
analyzed: vinā viśeṣa hetunā yāga tva kāla saṃbandha sāmye sati yau eva gṛhītau tatra eva itareṣām prādhānya prāmāṇya bhājām satām aṅga tva apānāt viruddha tā syāt
translated: Without a special reason, when the similarity of being sacrifices and being connected with time is there, then the other two, which are taken as primary and authoritative, would become subsidiary, leading to contradiction.

original: atha vikalpena sarveṣāṃ pāściko 'nugrahaḥ karupeta tatrāpi tasyaiva kadā citpradhānatvaṃ kadā cidaṅgatvamiti vipratiṣiddham/
analyzed: atha vikalpena sarveṣām tatra api tasya eva kadā cit pradhāna tvam kadā cit aṅga tvam iti vipratiṣiddham
translated: If, on the other hand, it be held that all the subsidiaries are helpful to the Primary, by way of option, then, in that case, it would be necessary to admit that sometimes the Agnèya is the Primary and sometimes it is the subsidiary and this would be a selfcontradiction.

original: ubhayātmanāṃ cāṅgatayā pravṛtteḥ pradhānatvena ca nivṛtterāgneyādīnāṃ vikṛtigamane yāvajjīvaṃ saṃśayaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: ubhaya ātmanām ca aṅga tayā pravṛtteḥ pradhāna tvena ca nivṛtteḥ āgneya ādīnām vikṛti gamane yāvajjīvam saṃśaya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And as a matter of fact, we find that the Agnèya, etc., are employed as subsidiaries, and yet they are found to be set aside as primaries and as such, if they were to go over to the Vikṛti, there would be a doubt as to their being performed throughout life.

analyzed: kena cit avāntara sāmānya avacchedena saṃkhyeyeṣu varttante
translated: The numbers are all found to be applicable to things that are included under certain general properties.

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: Second Pada of the Second Adhyaya.

original: na vāpūrvayoragneyādīnāṃ vā samastānā mekadeśe vā kiṃ cida vāntarasāmānyaṃ dṛśyate yena dvitvamavadhāyeta /
analyzed: na vā apūrvayoḥ agneya ādīnām vā samastānām eka deśe vā kim cit a vāntara sāmānyam dṛśyate yena dvi tvam avadhāyeta
translated: Nor do we find any such general property in the Agnèya, etc., which are not already known, or in the Agnèya, etc., taken as a whole, or in any one of them, on the basis of which the number two could be ascertained.

original: ya eva hi gṛhīta staṣyaitra yāgāntarāpekṣayāhūtena bahutvena kevalātmā peśeṇa caikatvena dvitvaṃ bādhyate /
analyzed: yaḥ eva hi gṛhītaḥ yāga antara apekṣayā āhūtena bahu tvena kevala ātmā peśeṇa ca eka tvena dvi tvam bādhyate
translated: Because the number two is always ascertained in reference to two distinct things and as such, when the number two is ascertained in reference to the Agnèya, etc., which are all included under the general property of sacrifice, it is set aside by the number many, which is ascertained in reference to the other sacrifices that are brought in by the Injunction of the Jyotishtoma and by the number one, which is ascertained in reference to the Agnèya, etc., taken as a whole.

analyzed: tatas ca dvivacanasya aprasiddhiḥ
translated: And thus the number two becomes set aside and hence the Dvivacana cannot be admitted to be a Mantra.

original: siddhānte tu śabdadayena samudāyadvayāpādanāda samudāyī kṛtayāga vaicacapaṭyādavāntaradharmayogātsaṃbhavati ditvayogastadaśena ca kālayogākathaṃ ciddarśapūrṇamāsaprātipadikayorapi vṛttisiddhirityupapadyate yāgaviśeṣaṇatvaṃ / na tu pūrvapace samudāyatvāpādanābhāvātsaṃkhyāvṛttiriti prakṛtayāgamātraeva phala saṃbandhaḥ atha kasmādaṣṭāveva yāgāḥ paurṇamāsya māvāsyā kālagatadvitvāpekṣayā labdhaviśeṣaṇāḥ santo na vidhīyante /
analyzed: siddhānte tu śabda dayena samudāya dvaya āpādanāt samudāyī kṛta yāga avāntara dharma yogāt saṃbhavati ca cit darśa pūrṇamāsa prātipadikayoḥ api vṛtti siddhiḥ iti upapadyate yāga viśeṣaṇa tvam na tu pūrvapace samudāya tva āpādana abhāvāt saṃkhyā vṛttiḥ iti prakṛta yāga mātraḥ eva phala saṃbandhaḥ atha kasmāt aṣṭau eva yāgāḥ paurṇamāsya māvāsyā kāla gata dvi tva apekṣayā labdha viśeṣaṇāḥ santaḥ na vidhīyante
translated: But in the Siddhānta, by the word, two collections are produced, and by the connection of the subsidiary dharma of the uncollected sacrifice, the connection with eight is possible, and by that, somehow the application of the words Darśa and Pūrṇamāsa is also established, so the qualification of the sacrifice is appropriate. But in the previous view, due to the absence of the production of the collection, the application of number is not possible, so the connection with the result is only with the primary sacrifice. Now, why are only eight sacrifices, having obtained the qualification by the relation of duality with the time of the full moon and new moon, not enjoined?

original: yathā siddhānte samudāyagata dvitvāpeścayā ṣaḍ vidhāmyante /🔽neharśanāsphuṭena prakṛtayāgamātrāvalambyākhyātaṃ śakyaṃ nivarttayitum /
analyzed: yathā siddhānte  na iha ṛśanā sphuṭena prakṛta yāga mātra avalambya ākhyātam śakyam nivarttayitum
translated: As in the Siddhānta, six are enjoined by the relation of duality with the collection.🔽The statement based on the mere primary sacrifice is not able to be refuted by the unclear perception here.

original: na cātyantavyatirekātkālagatā saṃkhyā yāga sāmānādhikaraṇyanirdeśā bhavati /
analyzed: na ca atyanta vyatirekāt kāla gatā saṃkhyā yāga sāmānādhikaraṇya nirdeśā bhavati
translated: And due to the complete difference, the number related to time is not stated in apposition with the sacrifice.

analyzed: samudāya mamudāyinoḥ tu vyatirekāt aviruddhaḥ saṃkhyā saṃbandhaḥ siddhānte
translated: But in the established view, the relation of number with the whole and the constituent parts is not contradictory, due to the absence of distinction.

original: tasmātpūrvapace yajivaśenaiva nāmapadavṛttera viśeṣeṇa sarve yāgāḥ samapradhānāḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt pūrvapace yaji vaśena eva nāma pada vṛtteḥ a viśeṣeṇa sarve yāgāḥ sama pradhānāḥ
translated: Therefore, in the first alternative, due to the application of the name based on the sacrificer alone, all sacrifices are equally primary without distinction.

analyzed: tathā prāpte bhidhīyate
translated: When this is the conclusion, it is stated:

analyzed: prakaraṇam paurṇamāsī amāvāsyā saṃyuktayoḥ ālambanam syāt  prakriyate eti prakaraṇam
translated: The context would be the basis for the conjunction of the full moon and new moon sacrifices.

original: athavā prakaraṇaṃ tayoḥ sahakāri bhavettataśca tanmātrapratipādyo 'tha grahītavyaḥ /
analyzed: athavā prakaraṇam tayoḥ sahakāri bhavet tatas ca grahītavyaḥ
translated: Or, the context would be their co-operating factor, and then it should be taken as to be stated only by that.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: na hyanena yajinā paurṇamāsyamāvasyāpaḍhābhyāṃ vā yāgamātre buddhiḥ kriyate/
analyzed: na hi anena yajinā vā yāga mātre buddhiḥ kriyate
translated: For this sacrifice does not produce the idea of mere sacrifice through the full moon or new moon rites.

analyzed: na ca prakṛta karma gracaṇam tvatpaḥ asti
translated: And there is no mention of the original action in your view.

original: tatrājñātarūpe sati apūrve karmaṇi na kathaṃ citpravarttyata /
analyzed: tatra ajñāta rūpe sati apūrve karmaṇi na katham cit pravarttyata
translated: There, when the form is unknown, it does not in any way engage in the unseen action.

original: tataṅkaca vākyamevānarthakaṃ bhave / tprakṛtagrahaṇe tu teṣāṃ dravyadevatāyogādetatkālavarttitvācca rūpajñānādarthavaśvam/
analyzed: tataṅka ca vākyam eva anarthakam bhave t prakṛta grahaṇe tu teṣām dravya devatā yogāt etad kāla vartti tvāt ca rūpa jñānāt arthavaśvam
translated: Then the sentence would be meaningless. But when the original is mentioned, they have a form known through the connection with the substance and deity, and through existing at that time, so they are meaningful.

analyzed: nanu uktam matyace pi asti dravya devatam iti
translated: But it has been said that even in the other view, there is a substance and deity.

original: satyam /🔽yathā kathaṃ cimabhyeta dravyaṃ sādhāraṇaṃ sthitam /
analyzed: satyam  yathā katham cim abhyeta dravyam sādhāraṇam sthitam
translated: True,

analyzed: tathā api devatā na asti iti arūpa tvāt na mucyate
translated: but even so, since the deity does not exist, being formless, one is not liberated.

original: yadi hi sarvalokaprasiddhaḥ kālona na samaveyāttatastadatikrameṇa karmaṇī gṛhayātām/
analyzed: yadi hi sarva loka prasiddhaḥ na samaveyāt tatas tad atikrameṇa karmaṇī gṛhayātām
translated: If time, well-known to all people, were not connected, then the two actions would be taken as transgressing that.

original: api copapannatarā kālavacanatve sa pramī / tasya sarvacaiva kālasyādhikaraṇatvānna karmaṇodhikaraṇatvāhitopādhyāyasya dvitīya pāda /
analyzed: api ca upapannatarā kāla vacana tve sa pramī tasya sarva ca eva kālasya adhikaraṇa tvāt na karmaṇā udhikaraṇa tva āhita upādhyāyasya
translated: Moreover, it is more reasonable to assume that it is a statement about time. Since all time is the substratum, it is not the substratum of the action. The second quarter of the chapter on the teacher.

analyzed: anupapatteḥ yathā katham cit kalpanīyam syāt
translated: Due to the impossibility, it would have to be imagined somehow.

original: yattu kiṃ kālasya mantrasaṃbandheneti / yadi tādarthya evaikaḥ saṃbandho bhavetma cātrāsmābhirucyeta tata evaṃ yujyate vaktum idda svājyabhāgau prati tā darthye vyavasthite saṃkare ca prāpte kālabhedena prayujyamānayarmantrayorvyavasthāmācaṃ kriyate vārcaghno paurṇamāsīsthayorājyabhāgayovṛdhanvatī amāvāsyāsthayoriti /
analyzed: yat tu kim kālasya mantra saṃbandhena iti yadi tādarthye eva ekaḥ saṃbandhaḥ ca atra asmābhiḥ ucyeta tatas evam yujyate vaktum su ājyabhāgau prati te darthye vyavasthite saṃkare ca prāpte kāla bhedena prayujyamānayoḥ mantrayoḥ vyavasthāmācam kriyate paurṇamāsī sthayoḥ ājyabhāgayoḥ vṛdhanvatī amāvāsyā sthayoḥ iti
translated: As for the question of what is the connection of time with the mantra, if the only connection were that of purpose, and if we were to say this here, then it is proper to say that those two Ajyabhagas, which are established for that purpose, and which have become mixed, are distinguished by the difference in time, and the distinction is made between the two Ajyabhagas occurring in the Paurnamasi, one being the Varcasvat and the other the Vrdhanvati, occurring in the Amavasya.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

original: sarvacaivākāṅkṣāpūrvakaḥ saṃvandho bhavatyā / jyabhāgau ca prajñātāgrīṣomadevatyau tadabhidhānamamarthamantrākāṅkṣitvāt ayatnena mantrān gṛhṇota / svatpane tvapūrvayoḥ karmaṇora jñātadevatatvānna mantrāpevā / tataśca mantratadviśeṣa dvitvāḍhi kalpanādanapeścitānekārthavidhiprasaṅgaḥ saṅgaḥ /
analyzed: saṃvandhaḥ bhavatyā jyabhāgau ca prajñāta agrīṣoma devatyau tad abhidhāna mamartha mantra ākāṅkṣi tvāt ayatnena mantrān gṛhṇota tu apūrvayoḥ karmaṇoḥ a jñāta devata tvāt na mantra apevā tatas ca kalpanāt aneka artha vidhi prasaṅgaḥ saṅgaḥ
translated: And all connections are preceded by a desire. And the two portions of clarified butter are well-known to be dedicated to Agni and Soma. Therefore, because they desire mantras that express that, they would take the mantras without effort. But in your view, because the two new rites have a known deity, there is no need for mantras. And then, because of the assumption of mantras and their specific duality, etc., there is the undesirable consequence of the injunction of multiple meanings.

original: punaśca māntravarṇikānekadevatā kalpanā / na hoka karmaṇo nekayā devatayānekayānuvākyayā kāryamasti /
analyzed: punar ca māntravarṇikā aneka devatā kalpanā na ha uka karmaṇaḥ na ekayā devatayā anekayā anuvākyayā kāryam asti
translated: And again, the assumption of multiple deities mentioned in the mantras. For one rite, there is no need for multiple deities and multiple anuvakyas.

analyzed: punar ca a śrutayā jyā kalpanā āśrayaṇām ājyabhāgayoḥ ca a śruta puronubākyā kalpanam
translated: And again, the assumption of an unheard deity for the two portions of clarified butter, and the assumption of an unheard puronuvakya.

analyzed: yat ca ekā yājyā ekā vā anuvākyā bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And that there will be one yajya or one anuvakya.

analyzed: na tad na vākyā samākhyā bādhāt
translated: That is not so, because the name of the anuvakya is contradicted.

original: api ca tvatpakṣa liṅgasyāviniyojakatvāt vākye ca karaṇatvenāśrayaṇāt vaiṣṇavī manū cetyādi baḍhadṛṣṭārthapramatarna prakāśakatā prakāśyenānapeścitatvāt /
analyzed: api ca tvad pakṣa liṅgasya aviniyojaka tvāt vākye ca karaṇa tvena āśrayaṇāt vaiṣṇavī manū ca ityādi prakāśaka tā prakāśyena an apeścita tvāt
translated: And moreover, in your view, because the indicative mark is not a determiner, and because the anuvakya is mentioned as the instrument in the sentence, the assumption of the mantras dedicated to Vishnu and dedicated to Manu etc. is not a revealer, because it is not desired by what is to be revealed.

analyzed: mā kannātaḥ ca varam ārāt upakāraka tvam
translated: And the deity of the mantra is not the principal, because it is a mere helper.

original: ājyabhāgayoḥ punarditvātprajñāta hidebatatvācca prakāṇyā kā ḍināḥ prakāśakā mantrāḥ niṅgakrama viniyuktāḥ santaḥ ekāntena dṛṣṭārthatāṃ pratipadyante /
analyzed: ājyabhāgayoḥ punar di tvāt prajñāta hi devata tvāt ca prakāśakāḥ mantrāḥ niṅga krama viniyuktāḥ santaḥ ekāntena dṛṣṭārtha tām pratipadyante
translated: But in the case of the two portions of clarified butter, because of the mention of the deity and because of the well-known fact that mantras are illuminators, the mantras that are employed in the order of the ritual come to have a clearly visible purpose.

original: tatra ca mantrataviśeṣaditvādiṣu prāpteṣu kāladdāraṇa vyavasthāmātravidhānālāghavaṃ vākyasya / na vā'narthakyaṃtantravārtike /
analyzed: tatra ca vyavasthā mātra vidhāna alāghavam vākyasya na
translated: And when the specific mantras and so on are obtained there, because of the injunction of the mere establishment of the order by the word, the sentence is light. It is not meaningless. In the Tantra-Vartika.

analyzed: naci sannidhāna avasthā siddhā
translated: And the state of being present is not established.

analyzed: tasmāt na devatā vidhiḥ a saṃbandhāt
translated: Therefore, the injunction of the deity is not from the connection.

original: ataśca rūpavattvāt akarmāntaratā kiṃ punaḥ samastānuvādasya prayojanaṃ / paśya
analyzed: atas ca rūpavat tvāt a karma antara tā kim punar samasta anuvādasya prayojanam paśya
translated: And therefore, because of having form, there is no difference in the action. What is the purpose of the restatement of the whole?

analyzed: uccate
