original: vaiśvadevīti hi strīpratyayena samānapadgatenaiva strodravyaṃ kimapi sannicitamityavadhāryate /
analyzed: vaiśvadevī iti hi strī pratyayena samāna pad gatena eva stro dravyam kim api sannicitam iti avadhāryate
translated: For by the feminine ending in 'vaiśvadevī', which has the same form as the feminine noun, it is determined that some feminine substance is collected.

original: na ca vājinasya khītvaṃ sannidhirvāstīti anāśrayaṇam /
analyzed: na ca vājinasya khī tvam sannidhiḥ vā asti iti anāśrayaṇam
translated: And since there is no connection or proximity of the Vājapeya, it is not taken.

analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: vājibhyaḥ vājinam kuryāt iti na eva asti saṃgatiḥ
translated: there is no connection at all with 'one should perform the Vājapeya for the Vājas'.

analyzed: tatra dāna adhyāhāra kalpanā
translated: There, the assumption of the insertion of the gift is necessary.

analyzed: na ca atra sāmānādhikaraṇyam ṣaṣṭhīm ca paṇyāmaḥ
translated: And here we do not find co-reference or the genitive case.

original: na ca vājibhya iti kāraka vibhaktiḥ kriyāpadādanyena saṃbadhyate na ceca tadupāttam/
analyzed: na ca vājibhyaḥ iti kāraka vibhaktiḥ kriyā padāt anyena saṃbadhyate na ced ca tat upāttam
translated: And the instrumental case ending in 'vājibhyaḥ' is not connected with a word denoting an action, and that is not taken.

analyzed: tatra adhyā cāra kalapanāt ekaḥ viprakarṣaḥ
translated: There, the assumption of insertion is one kind of remoteness.

analyzed: tripada saṃbandha gauravāt aparaḥ
translated: Another is the difficulty of connecting with three words.

analyzed: itaratra api yajika rūpa nāda viśeṣaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is argued that there is no difference in the other case also due to the assumption of the yaji-form,

original: na / tasyasaṃbandhottara kālānumeyatvā / dvaiśvadevyāmikṣeti hi niṣpanne saṃvandhe yajiranumīyate na tadadhīnā saṃbandhapratītiḥ /
analyzed: na tasya saṃbandha uttara kāla anumeya tvāt vaiśvadevī āmikṣā iti hi niṣpanne saṃvandhe yajiḥ anumīyate na tad adhīnā saṃbandha pratītiḥ
translated: no, because that is to be inferred after the connection. For in 'vaiśvadevyāmiksā', after the connection is established, the yaji is inferred, not the cognition of the connection dependent on that.

original: tava tu parakhatvāpādanāsaṃbhavātma ca bhaviṣyatyarthasaṃbandhārtham / āditaśca dravyadevatāpakavākyatva siddhaye dadātiriti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: tava tu ca bhaviṣyat artha saṃbandha artham āditas ca dravya devatā paka vākya tva siddhaye dadātiḥ iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: But in your case, because it is impossible to make it dependent on another, it will be for the purpose of connecting with the meaning. And the difference is that the word 'dadāti' is used at the beginning for the purpose of establishing the sentence as enjoining a substance and a deity.

original: kalpite dadātau kārakayoḥ parasparasaṃbandhābhāvāttena tāvatma saṃva ndhaḥ /
analyzed: kalpite dadātau kārakayoḥ paraspara saṃbandha abhāvāt tena saṃva
translated: In the assumed 'dadāti', due to the absence of mutual connection between the two kārakas, the connection is with that.

analyzed: tatas eka artha tvāt paraspara niyamaḥ iti viprakṛṣṭa tā
translated: Then, due to having the same meaning, there is mutual restriction, so it is remote.

analyzed: na tu āmicāyām tait kim cit iti sannikarṣaḥ
translated: But in the case of 'āmiśa', there is nothing to make it remote, so it is proximate.

analyzed: sati api ca vāji vājinayoḥ sākṣāt saṃvandhe vaiyadhikaraṇyāt viprakṛṣṭa tvam
translated: And even though there is a direct connection between 'vāji' and 'vājinī', due to being in different cases, it is remote.

analyzed: vaiśvadevyāḥ mitā iti tu sāmānādhikaraṇya ātman nikṛṣṭa tā
translated: But in 'vaijadevyāmi', due to being in the same case, it is proximate.

original: tathā ca vayati samarthatarāṇi hi samānavibhaktīni bhavanti durbalo vivibhaktiriti/
analyzed: tathā ca vayati samarthatarāṇi hi samāna vibhaktīni bhavanti durbalaḥ vivibhaktiḥ iti
translated: And thus, those in the same case are more powerful, while those in different cases are weaker.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

analyzed: saṃpradāna tva mātram ca caturthī vājinām vadet
translated: And the fourth case would denote mere dative in the case of 'vājin'.

analyzed: devatā lakṣyamāṇā tu vājine
translated: But when the deity is indicated, again in 'vājin',

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīya pāda
translated: Second quarter of the second chapter.

original: vājibhya iti rūpasāmānyātprasaktaṃ sadyāvatpañcamotvamapanīya caturthītvaṃ sādhyate tāvanmativikṣepaḥ /
analyzed: vājibhyaḥ iti rūpa sāmānyāt prasaktam sat yāvat pañcamī tvam apanīya caturthī tvam sādhyate tāvat mati vikṣepaḥ
translated: And when the doubt is removed by the statement of the reason, the doubt is removed by the statement of the reason.🔽But even in the case of a nominal affix, the meaning of the word is doubtful due to the presence of many meanings. This is the same.

analyzed: nanu taddhite pi anekā pati ādi artha saṃdecāt tulyam etat  viṣamaḥ upanyāsaḥ
translated: The example is not similar.

analyzed: śabda saṃdehaḥ mayā upanyastaḥ tvayā artha saṃdehaḥ
translated: I have cited a doubt regarding the word, you have cited a doubt regarding the meaning.

analyzed: sarvathā tāvat tad vita tvam asaṃdigdham
translated: In any case, the fact of its being a dvandva compound is undoubted.

original: arthaḥ punayogyatvāditarāsaṃbhavena devatātmako nirpoṣyate bhavatastu nirṇo te'pi śabde catuṭayarthānekatvādupapadakāra kalavaṇa saṃdehādastyeva viprakarṣaḥ /
analyzed: arthaḥ punar yogya tvāt itara asaṃbhavena devatā ātmakaḥ nirpoṣyate bhavataḥ tu śabde
translated: But the meaning is determined as being the deity by fitness and the impossibility of any other meaning. For you, even though determined, there is still a difference due to the doubt regarding the meaning of the word being many due to the nominal affix.

original: nenārthasaṃdeha ubhayoḥ samatvānneka śvodyate śabda saṃdehattva sādhāraṇatvāccoditaḥ /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ sama tvāt śva udyate śabda
translated: Thus, the doubt regarding the meaning is cited by both being equal, and the doubt regarding the word is cited due to its being common.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And

original: yathā cotpattiśiṣṭasya balīyastvaṃ na ca kriyāmācaṃ niṣkṛṣya guṇāntaraṃ vidhātuṃ śakyate tathoktaṃ citrādhikaraṇe vaiśvadevādhiraṇe ca /
analyzed: yathā ca utpatti śiṣṭasya balīyaḥ tvam na ca kriyā mācam niṣkṛṣya guṇa antaram vidhātum śakyate tathā uktam citra adhikaraṇe vaiśvadeva adhiraṇe ca
translated: Just as the strength of what is prescribed in the origination is not able to be separated from the action and another quality enjoined, as stated in the section on Citra and in the section on Vaishvadeva.

analyzed: vaiśvadeva adhikaraṇa nyāyena ca prakaraṇam apekṣitavyam
translated: And by the principle of the section on the Vaiśvadeva, the context should be expected by the other Vājapeya sentence.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: dravya devata saṃbandhaḥ yāga mātram apekṣate
translated: The connection between the substance and the deity requires only the mere sacrifice.

analyzed: āmiyā yāge eva iti tatra
translated: If it were only the Āmikṣā sacrifice, there would be no context there.

analyzed: vājinaḥ iti hi avayava prasiddhyā viśva devāḥ pratyāyyante
translated: For by the well-known meaning of the component parts, the Viśvedevas are indicated by the word Vājapeya.

original: vākyārthaccāvayavārthī samuccitya saṃvandhaṃ kalpayitvā sā bhavantī śrutimātropanipātalabhyāyāḥ samudāyaprasiddherdurbalā bhavatīti dubelataraḥ saṃyogo vājinasya /
analyzed: samuccitya saṃvandham kalpayitvā sā bhavantī śruti mātra upanipāta labhyāyāḥ samudāya prasiddheḥ durbalā bhavati iti dubelataraḥ saṃyogaḥ vājinasya
translated: And that [connection] becomes weaker than the well-known meaning of the whole, which is obtained by mere proximity to the Vedic text, after having imagined the connection by combining the meaning of the component parts and the meaning of the sentence. Thus the connection of the Vājapeya is even weaker.

analyzed: vājiśabdaḥ upi vā śva suniḥ svabhāvataḥ
translated: Or the word Vāja is naturally the Sun,

analyzed: kleśanā eva vinā kāryāt viśva deveṣu varttate
translated: it exists only in the Viśvedevas without an object.

original: sarve hyagnyādayaḥ puroḍāgādibhirannairvājino vijñāyante tatrāmijhāyāṃ tāvadannaśabdaḥ prayukto na puroḍāśādā vityekaḥ klemaḥ /
analyzed: sarve hi agni ādayaḥ puroḍāga ādibhiḥ annaiḥ vājinaḥ vijñāyante tatra āmijhāyām tāvat anna śabdaḥ prayuktaḥ na puroḍāśa ādau iti ekaḥ klemaḥ
translated: For all the deities beginning with Agni are known as Vāja by the food offerings beginning with the puroḍāśa. There, in the Āmikṣā [offering], the word for food is used, not for the puroḍāśa, etc. - this is one difficulty.

original: punarapi cāmikṣāmātragrahaṇe sati vaiśvadevyāmikṣayaiva tadvatāṃ grahaṇamityaparaḥ /
analyzed: punar api ca āmikṣā mātra grahaṇe sati vaiśvadevya āmikṣayā eva tadvatām grahaṇam iti aparaḥ
translated: And again, when only the Āmikṣā is taken, only the Āmikṣā for the Viśvedevas is taken - this is another difficulty.

original: tataśca svarasena śrutiranyatrāpi varttamānā satī prakaraṇenaiva viśeṣe sthāpayitavyā / na ca tatra kiṃ cinnimittamasti /
analyzed: tatas ca svarasena śrutiḥ anyatra api varttamānā satī prakaraṇena eva viśeṣe sthāpayitavyā na ca tatra kim cit nimittam asti
translated: And so, the word being used in its natural sense in other cases also, it has to be restricted to a particular case by the Context; and there is no reason for such restriction in this case.

analyzed: guṇa bhāvena upādīyamāna tvāt devatāyāḥ
translated: For the Deity is taken as a subordinate factor.

original: saṃskāryatve ca vrohīnprocatītyādiṣviva kathaṃ cidapūrvasādhanalaśaṇayā prakadvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: saṃskārya tve ca vrohīn procati ityādiṣu iva katham cit apūrva sādhana laśaṇayā
translated: And if the Deity were to be sanctified, then, in the case of such sentences as ‘Vrohinam prokṣati’, the Deity would have to be taken as indirectly indicating the Apūrva, just as the material Vrohin is.

analyzed: ta grahaṇam bhaveta na ca atra tat asti
translated: But there is no such indication in the case in question.

analyzed: vinā api tena karmaṇā prayoja navat tva upapatteḥ
translated: Because the Deity is not the prompting factor in the action, even without such an indication.

original: kāmaṃ vājinasyaiva pratipattiḥ saṃskāro bhaveta / na devatāyāḥ /🔽prakṛtagrahaṇe cāgnyādīnāṃ sadbhāvādanavadhāraṇam /
analyzed: kāmam vājinasya eva pratipattiḥ saṃskāraḥ bhaveta na devatāyāḥ  prakṛta grahaṇe ca agni ādīnām sadbhāvāt anavadhāraṇam
translated: It may be that the Vājini is sanctified, and not the Deity.🔽And if the word ‘pratigrhya’ be taken as referring to the original material, then, inasmuch as Fire and the rest are present in the case of the Vājapēya also, the word cannot be taken as restricting the Deity to the Agnēya and the rest only.

original: atha viśvadeveṣu sarve saṃgṛhītā bhaviṣyantīti teṣāṃ grahaṇam /
analyzed: atha viśvadeveṣu sarve saṃgṛhītāḥ bhaviṣyanti iti teṣām grahaṇam
translated: If it be argued that the word ‘pratigrhya’ would be taken as referring to the Agnēya and the rest, because it is only these that are included in the Vishvadeva offerings, then, in that case, the word ‘pratigrhya’ would be taken as referring to the Agnēya and the rest, because it is only these that are included in the Vishvadeva offerings.

analyzed: nada yuktam
translated: This is not right.

analyzed: sarva saṃgrahasya apramāṇaka tvāt  bahuvacana śrutyā sarvagra haṇam iti ced
translated: Because there is no authority for the inclusion of all.🔽If it be argued that the inclusion of all is indicated by the Plural number in the word ‘pratigrhya’, then, that cannot be right; because the Plural number is quite compatible with the three Deities Agnēya, etc.

original: na tasya triṣveva caritārthatvāt na / triṣvavadhāraṇajñānamiti cet /
analyzed: na tasya triṣu eva caritārtha tvāt na triṣu avadhāraṇa jñānam iti ced
translated: If it be argued that the Plural number is not compatible with the three, unless there is a restriction of the three only, then, that cannot be right; because the restriction of the three only is not compatible with the Plural number.

original: na makhyaṃ cāpūrvacoda nāmo kavadityavadhāraṇahetu sadbhāvāt /
analyzed: na makhyam ca apūrva coda nāma u kavat iti avadhāraṇa hetu sadbhāvāt
translated: And the principal is not enjoined as something new, because there is a reason for the restriction, like in the case of the word 'cow'.

analyzed: tasmāt na viśvedeva grahaṇe kim cit pramāṇam
translated: Therefore, there is no evidence for the inclusion of the Viśvedevas.

original: sākāṅkṣā ca devatā dravyeṇa saṃbadhyeta mā cātra vājiśabdena dravyavatyevo /pādīyamānā nirākāṅkṣava pratyāyiteti na dravyāntarasaṃbandhaṃ kṣamate / tasmādatulyavannatvam /
analyzed: sa ākāṅkṣā ca devatā dravyeṇa saṃbadhyeta mā ca atra vāji śabdena dravyavatī eva upādīyamānā pratyāyitā iti na dravya antara saṃbandham kṣamate tasmāt atulya vanna tvam
translated: And the deity, being in need of something, would be connected with the substance. And here, the substance is not mentioned as being complete in the word 'vāji', so it does not allow a connection with another substance. Therefore, it is not the same as the non-comparable.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what?

original: anyena navaruddhe hi guṇo yatra vidhīyate /
analyzed: anyena nava ruddhe hi guṇaḥ yatra vidhīyate
translated: Where a quality is enjoined in what is already restricted by another,

original: tasminguṇavidhiḥ śakya iti karma na bhidyate
analyzed: tasmin guṇa vidhiḥ śakyaḥ iti karma na bhidyate
translated: the injunction of that quality is possible, so the action is not differentiated.

original: homo hi prakṛtaḥ śuddhaḥ svavākyādavadhāritaḥ /🔽sosmin didhiviśiṣṭatvādvibhāgenaiva gamyate
analyzed: homaḥ hi prakṛtaḥ śuddhaḥ sva vākyāt avadhāritaḥ  saḥ usmin didhi viśiṣṭa tvāt vibhāgena eva gamyate
translated: For the pure homa is the original, determined by its own statement.🔽That is understood only by division, because it is qualified by the injunction in it.

analyzed: tāni utpattim apekṣante sā ca avyavahitā yatas
translated: Those depend on origination, and that is uninterrupted.

analyzed: tu atyakṣam prasajyate

analyzed: phalam hi śrutam etasmin karmataḥ tat ca yujyate

original: nāsminparama sādṛśyaṃ dṛśyate kṛṣihomayoḥ /🔽kiṃ citmādṛśyadṛṣṭistu dravyepyastītya niścayaḥ

analyzed: a tas vacanāt kārya kāraṇayoḥ eva gamya gamaka bhāvaḥ bhāṣyakāra abhi dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda

analyzed: pretaḥ iti ke cit manyante
translated: Some people think that the word 'preta' (departed) is used here.

analyzed: tattva yuktam
translated: This is not correct.

analyzed: akārya kāraṇa bhūtānām api anitya tva kṛtaḥ ṛtu ādīnām gamya gamaka bhāva prasiddha
translated: Even for things that are not cause and effect, like the sacrificial post and so on, the relation of probans and probandum is well-known based on impermanence.

original: tasmāniṅgameva vyāpyatvena dṛṣṭaṃ sapane vyāpakasyānyatra sādhyabhūtasya gamakatva saṃbhāvanayā gṛhyamāṇaṃ kāraka mityukta miti draṣṭavyam /

translated: Therefore, it should be seen that the probans, which is seen to be pervaded, is accepted as the probans of the pervaded, which is to be established elsewhere, by the possibility of being the probans.

analyzed: evam ca hetu adhikaraṇe vyākhyātam
translated: And this is explained in the section on the probans.

analyzed: tathā ca vivṛṇoti

analyzed: tasmāt mādṛśyam api sādhakam asādhakam vā iti

original: yadi tarhi parīkṣitena ca kāraṇenābhihitena kāryamidamabhidhīyate /

analyzed: danā indriya kāmasya iti atra vākye yat karma tat phannavat karma tvāt kuṣi ādi vat
translated: in the sentence 'for one desiring the sense organs', the action is like the result, because it is an action, like plowing and so on.

original: karmamādhyaṃ vedaṃ phalaṃ phanmatvād śrīhyādivat ityetadnumāyātha yatkarma tatphannavaditi pratisādhanābhidhānenānai kānti kī karoti /
analyzed: karma mādhyam vā idam phalam phanma tvāt śrīhi ādi vat iti etat anumāya atha yat karma tat phanna vat iti karoti
translated: The result is the effect of the action, because it is a result, like the curd etc. This is the inference. He states the counter-argument that the action is the cause of the result.

original: uparate karmaṇi dravyāpaṇa tantvādīnāṃ tatsaṃyogādīnāṃ ca dravyāntaraṃ paṭādi phannaṃ dṛṣṭamiti /
analyzed: uparate karmaṇi tantu ādīnām tad saṃyoga ādīnām ca dravya antaram paṭa ādi phannam dṛṣṭam iti

analyzed: uparata grahaṇam ca karma vyatireka pradarśana artham
translated: The word 'ceased' is used to show the difference from action.

original: evaṃ hi śate kadā cidihāpi karmanimittameva phalaṃ vadet /

translated: Thus, even in a hundred cases, one might sometimes speak of the result as caused by the action here.

analyzed: tena bravīti
translated: Therefore, he says:

analyzed: indriya kāma vākye dadhi phalavat dravya tvāt tantu vat
translated: In the sentence about desiring the sense organs, curd is the result, because it is a substance, like a thread.

analyzed: indriyam vā dravyam janyam phanna tvāt paṭa ādi vat

analyzed: api ca kṛṣeḥ na adṛṣṭam iti hetoḥ virudva tvam vadati

original: yathaiva hyayaṃ hetuḥ karmaṇaḥ phalavatvaṃ phalamya vā karmajanyatvaṃ sādhayati evaṃ dṛṣṭaphalatva ma śabdagamya phannatvaṃ brīhyādyanyatamaphalatvaṃ vā sādhayati /
analyzed: yathā eva hi ayam hetuḥ karmaṇaḥ phalavatvam phalamya vā karma janya tvam sādhayati evam dṛṣṭa phala tva śabda gamya phanna tvam brīhi ādi anyatama phala tvam vā sādhayati
translated: Just as this reason proves that the result is the effect of the action or the action is the cause of the result, similarly it proves that the result is seen, is not conveyed by words, or is one of the results like rice etc.

analyzed: tasmāt na eva jātīyaka kārya kāraṇa bhāve samasta hetu doṣa saṅgāt etat bhavati
translated: Therefore, this does not happen due to the collection of all the faults of the reason in the case of a causal relation of the same kind.

analyzed: kvacid
translated: In some cases, it is seen,

analyzed: ṭāt anyatra adṛṭa sthā api siddhiḥ iti
translated: and in some cases, it is established even where it is not seen.

original: yadyetadanumānaṃ tvayaiva nirākṛtaṃ kathaṃ tarhi homānnyāyyaṃ phanamityucyate /

analyzed: śabdena avagamyam etat phalam iti bhāva artha adhikaraṇa upanyāsena uttaram
translated: The answer is given by introducing the topic of the section on the meaning of the verb.

analyzed: tasmāt bomāt phalam iti nyāyyam

analyzed: dadhnaḥ phalam iti ca anyāyyam iti artha siddham mad yat ucyate tat tulya bannavatva nirākaraṇa artham
translated: And it is improper to say that the result is from curd. This is the meaning that is established. It is said to remove the similarity with the word 'madhu'.

original: kaḍhā cihni iyamapi nyāyyaṃ bhavet /🔽api ca dadhyubhayamasamarthaṃ kartumiti/

translated: Sometimes this may also be proper.🔽Moreover, curd is incapable of doing both.

analyzed: na tāvat karma anapekṣasya dadhnaḥ karaṇa tvam asti
translated: First, curd does not have the nature of an instrument that does not depend on the action,

analyzed: yena kevalam phanna saṃbandhī iva syāt
translated: by which it would be related only to the result.

original: ata ubhayatra vi dhātavyaṃ / na ca taccakyamiti /
analyzed: atas ubhayatra vi dhātavyam na ca tat cakyam iti
translated: Therefore, it should be enjoined in both places, and that is not possible.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For instance,

analyzed: dadhi abhayam amamartham iti yathāśrutena paravacanena vamtva sāmarthyam eva uktam iti dṛśyate

original: na brūmaḥ ekasyobhayoḥ prayojanaṃ na yuktamiti /
analyzed: na brūmaḥ ekasya ubhayoḥ prayojanam na yuktam iti
translated: We do not say that it is not proper for one thing to serve two purposes.

original: na vayaṃ vastusāmarthyamapahumahe / kiṃ tarhi samarthepi vastunyavicitāḍhanuṣṭhānādavabhyaṃ dadhyabhayārthatvena vidhātavyam /

translated: We do not deny the capacity of a thing. But even in a capable thing, due to the non-performance of what is desired, it should be enjoined as having the purpose of churning for curd.

analyzed: na ca etat asti aneka saṃbandha karaṇe vākya bheda pramaṅgāt
translated: And this is not so, because of the possibility of split-of-the-sentence in the making of multiple connections.

analyzed: sannikṛṣṭa asaṃbhavena viprakṛṣṭaḥ ūrthaḥ vidhīyate
translated: The remote meaning is enjoined by the impossibility of the proximate.

original: tadiha dadhihomasaṃbandha saṃnikṛṣṭa dadhiphalasaṃbandhe ca viprakṛṣṭe yugapachighoyamāne yugapadeva saṃbhavāsaṃbhavāvabhyupetavyau syātām /

original: tammādanyataraparityāge sati tvatpaścasivirbhavatīti saṃnikṛṣṭa vaśena ḍhayapi homena saṃbadhyate sopi phaleneti karmayukte sati phanne siddhaṃ karmāntaratvamiti
analyzed: tammāt anyatara parityāge sati tvad paśca siviḥ bhavati iti saṃnikṛṣṭa vaśena homena saṃbadhyate saḥ api phalena iti karma yukte sati phanne siddham karma antara tvam iti
translated: Therefore, when one is abandoned, the other remains. Thus, the word 'api' is connected with the homa by the proximity of the other, and that also with the result. When the action is connected with the result, the difference of the action is established.

analyzed: bhavet phala śrutiḥ yā tu guṇa saṃvarite vidhau
translated: But that mention of the result is in an injunction qualified by the accessory,

analyzed: sā tad gata vidhi spṛṣṭā tena yāti ekavākya tām
translated: it comes into syntactical connection with that by touching the injunction contained in it.

analyzed: praśnaḥ
translated: The question is:

original: siddhāntavādī tu pratyayārthavidhitvaṃ dhātvarthānuvādatvaṃ ca tyanupapattekha yataḥ kurtāvaddhātoḥ para uccārayitavyaḥ /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī tu pratyaya artha vidhi tvam dhātvartha anuvāda tvam ca yatas kurtāvat dhātoḥ paraḥ uccārayitavyaḥ
translated: But the proponent of the established view says that the injunctive nature of the suffix and the descriptive nature of the verbal root are not tenable, because the suffix should be pronounced only after the root 'kur' (to do).

analyzed: tatas ca vibhaktam juhuyāt iti
translated: And therefore, seeing the two as distinct, one should offer the oblation.

original: nanu śrutyā homasaṃbaddha meṣa yatra ka cana dhātāvupādātavye prāpte prakaraṇaprāptahomopādānamabhāvanocyate /
analyzed: nanu śrutyā yatra ka cana dhātau upādātavye prāpte prakaraṇa prāpta homa upādānam abhāvanā ucyate
translated: But it is said that the oblation obtained through context is not mentioned, because when the verbal root to be used is obtained through the Vedic text as connected with the oblation,

analyzed: satyam bhāva artha adhikaraṇa nyāyena śruti valīyaḥ tva aprāptaḥ nuvadiṣyate
translated: It is true that it will be mentioned by the reasoning of the section on the meaningfulness of the root, because the Vedic text is stronger.

original: yathā ca na vibhaktervacanamevaikaṃ prayojanamiti devamanyatrāśritam /
analyzed: yathā ca na vibhakteḥ vacanam eva ekam prayojanam iti devam anyatra āśritam
translated: And just as it is not the only purpose of the case-ending to express, it is relied upon elsewhere.

original: iha ca ye bhavadīyaṃ pakṣamāśrayeste śrutima grahādiṣu kārakamātrapratipattyarthamuccāryamāṇanāntarīyakatvāpavādheraṃstarām /
analyzed: iha ca ye bhavadīyam pakṣam āśrayeḥ te graha ādiṣu kāraka mātra pratipatti artham uccāryamāṇa nāntarīyaka tva apavādheran tarām
translated: And those who accept your view will more readily accept the non-obstruction of the suffix in the case of the words 'graha' etc., which are uttered only for the purpose of expressing mere kārakas.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: tyaya anugraha artham api dhātuḥ uccāryamāṇaḥ saṃbandha bacāt avivakṣitam api sva artham pratyāyayati
translated: Even when the verbal root is uttered for the purpose of assisting the suffix, it conveys its own meaning, which is not intended, by virtue of expressing the relation.

analyzed: na hi tasya artha pratyāyana mātram eva ekam prayojanam iti vaktavyam
translated: For it cannot be said that the sole purpose of that [root] is merely to convey its meaning.

original: nanūcyamāne 'pi iti pratyayānugrahārthaṃ dhāturustokāryavidhisaṃbhave tāvadvidhāyako bahutarārthavidhānamupeca te/
analyzed: nanu ucyamāne pi iti pratyaya anugraha artham tāvat vidhāyakaḥ bahutara artha vidhānam te
translated: Even when the verbal root is uttered for the purpose of assisting the suffix 'ti', if the injunction of the root's meaning is possible, it is more reasonable to accept the injunction of the root's meaning.

original: homasya ca phanabhāvanākaraṇatvādbhāvayeṭindriyaṃ homenetyecāryamāṇaḥ svārthaṃ pratyāyayatīti/
analyzed: homasya ca phana bhāvanā karaṇa tvāt bhāvayet indriyam homena iti ā icāryamāṇaḥ sva artham pratyāyayati iti
translated: And since the homa is the instrument of the bhāvanā, when it is uttered as 'bhāvayed indriyam homena', it conveys its own meaning.

original: na cāsya grahakatvavada vivadyāvamavasthitasya karaṇabhūtenaiva daghnā samatvātsaṃvandhe 'nupapadyamākāraṇaṃ kiṃ ciḍhasti /
analyzed: na ca asya karaṇa bhūtena eva daghnā sama tvāt saṃvandhe kim cit hasti
translated: And there is no incompleteness in the relation of the root and suffix, as in the case of the word 'graha', where the root is already established without dispute, because it is equal to the curd, which is the instrument.

original: tasmādyathābhilaṣita kevalakarotyarthāsaṃbhane 'vaśyaṃ matvarthanakṣaṇā parigrahītavyā dadhimatā homeneti /
analyzed: tasmāt yathā abhilaṣita vaśyam matvā artha nakṣaṇā parigrahītavyā dadhimatā homena iti
translated: Therefore, in order to avoid the impossibility of the mere injunctive sense being what is desired, the affix of the possessive sense must necessarily be accepted, as in 'with curd by the offering'.

analyzed: vāda samartham eta diti
translated: This is capable of being argued.

original: naiṣa doṣaḥ /🔽satyapi homasaṃbandhe karotyana ca tasyāṃ kiṃ citpramāṇamasti /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ  sati api homa saṃbandhe ca tasyām kim cit pramāṇam asti
translated: This is not a fault.🔽Even though there is a connection with the offering, there is no evidence at all for the affix in that.

analyzed: na ca dadhi śabdasya asati rtha anapāyāt tāvat mātreṇa prayojana siddhiḥ
translated: And the word 'curd' does not serve its purpose merely by that, without the loss of its meaning.

original: yastu homasaṃbandha kṛto pravṛttinimitte karmanāmadheyatvaṃ ghaṭate /
analyzed: yaḥ tu pravṛtti nimitte karma nāmadheya tvam ghaṭate
translated: But the connection with the offering that is made is possible as the name of the action, in the prompting cause.

original: soyamubhayasmād bhraṣṭo viśeṣo nāsau kiṃ cidviruṇaddhi /
analyzed: saḥ ayam ubhayasmāt bhraṣṭaḥ viśeṣaḥ na asau kim cit viruṇaddhi
translated: That special [meaning] which has fallen away from both [the possessive and injunctive senses] does not contradict anything.

original: prakārāntareṇa vā bhāvanāṃ dadhiśabdo 'narthaka eva prāpnoti /
analyzed: prakāra antareṇa vā bhāvanām dadhi śabdaḥ narthakaḥ eva prāpnoti
translated: Or the word 'curd' would be meaningless in another way with regard to the action.

analyzed: tatas ca śabda dharma saṃnikarṣa anuviśecyati
translated: And then it would be modified by the proximity of the property of the word.

original: nanvevaṃ sati sa eva doṣa iti /
analyzed: nanu evam sati saḥ eva doṣaḥ iti
translated: If that is so, then that is the very fault.

original: aparityajyagraheṇa dharmyeva śabdaḥ parityāgādvādhita iti bādhyetatarāṃ śrutiḥ /
analyzed: a parityajya graheṇa dharmyā iva śabdaḥ parityāgāt vādhitaḥ iti bādhyetatarām śrutiḥ
translated: The word itself is contradicted by the property being taken without being abandoned, or by the abandonment, and so the Vedic text would be contradicted even more.

analyzed: mānaḥ api homaḥ balāt kāraṇībhavati iti manyate
translated: And the offering is considered to be the cause by force.

analyzed: tu na kasya
translated: But in the view that the word of the conclusion is uttered simultaneously with the word of the injunction, there is no word below any word.

analyzed: tatra etat ucyate
translated: Regarding this, this is said.

analyzed: judo tvā āha
translated: Juda says:

original: vākyāntarābhyastamya juhuyāditi śabdasyaitatmā madhyaṃ hotīti śabdo bādhita iti tatparihārārthamāha avaśyaṃ juṅayena taveyaṃ bhrāntirbhavati homa eva karaṇamiti /
analyzed: juhuyāt iti śabdasya etat mā madhyam hoti iti śabdaḥ bādhitaḥ iti tad parihāra artham āha avaśyam tava iyam bhrāntiḥ bhavati homaḥ eva karaṇam iti
translated: The word juhuyāt is overridden by the word etad in the sentence This is the middle part of the word juhuyāt. To avoid that, he says: You necessarily have this confusion that the instrument is only the homa.

analyzed: nipuṇatas tu yāt iti vaktavyam
translated: But it should be said more precisely.

original: katham /🔽pabhyatāṃ yathaiva pratyāsatteḥ sādhyāṃpramupadhāvannayogyatvātpracyāvyate tathātra daṣipadānurodhena sādhanāṃbhā / dyathā ca tatra pratīyana dadhīndriyasaṃbandho bhāvanāpratyayādinā /
analyzed: katham  yathā eva pratyāsatteḥ sādhya āṃpram upadhāvan ayogya tvāt pracyāvyate tathā atra daṣi pada anurodhena sādhanā aṃbhāḥ dyathā ca tatra dadhi indriya saṃbandhaḥ bhāvanā pratyaya ādinā
translated: How?🔽Just as, due to proximity, one turns away from the object to be accomplished and turns towards the means, because it is suitable, in the same way, here, due to the requirement of the word daśi, the means is turned away from the object to be accomplished. And just as there the connection of curd with the sense organ is understood by the word bhāvanā,

original: pratyayastāvadavaśyameva dadhīndriyaviśiṣṭāṃ bhāvanāṃ vidhātumuccārayitavyaḥ / saca kevalaprayogāsaṃbhavādvānuvyaniriktaprakṛ ṅgīkṛtam/
analyzed: pratyayaḥ tāvat avaśyam eva dadhi indriya viśiṣṭām bhāvanām vidhātum uccārayitavyaḥ sa ca kevala prayoga asaṃbhavāt vā anuvyanirikta prakṛ ṅgīkṛtam
translated: The suffix must be uttered to enjoin the bhāvanā qualified by the sense organ of curd. And that, due to the impossibility of mere usage, is taken as having the same form as the nominal affix.

original: daṣisaṃbandho 'pi cāsya prakaraṇādevāśrayāḥ davivakṣitāmapi saṃkhyā pratyāyayatīti vacyate tathā 'tra pra mānaṃ bhāvanāviśeṣaṇa maṃśāntare 'vasthina mevamichāpi guṇāśrayatvenāvasthāsyate /
analyzed: ca asya prakaraṇāt eva āśrayāḥ ca asya prakaraṇāt eva āśrayāḥ tathā mānam bhāvanā viśeṣaṇam mevam ichā api guṇa āśraya tvena avasthāsyate
translated: And the connection with the injunction is also understood from the context itself. It is said that even the number, which is desired to be expressed, is conveyed. Similarly here, the means of knowledge is a qualification of the bhāvanā, and remains in a different part. In this way, even when it is the substratum of the guṇa, it will remain as the substratum.

analyzed: yathā uktam vṛtti kāraṇa
translated: As it has been said by the author of the Vṛtti:

analyzed: homa āśritaḥ guṇaḥ phanḍam sādhayiṣyati iti
translated: The guṇa dependent on the homa will accomplish the result.

original: kaḥ punarāśrayāśrayisaṃbandho nāma kiṃ kena kathaṃbhāvavyatirikta utāvyatirikta iti /
analyzed: kaḥ punar āśraya āśrayi saṃbandhaḥ nāma kim kena kathaṃbhāva vyatiriktaḥ uta avyatiriktaḥ iti
translated: What is the relation of substratum and superstratum? Is it different from what, by what, and how, or is it not different?

analyzed: ke cittāvadāḥ
translated: Some say:

analyzed: vyatiriktaḥ eva ayam iti
translated: This is indeed different.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: yathaivāṃśatrayāpekṣā bhāvanā 'nyatra gamyate tathā guvaśiṣṭāyāṃ caturtheśo 'pyapekṣyate
analyzed: yathā eva aṃśa traya apekṣā bhāvanā nyatra gamyate tathā caturtha īśaḥ api apekṣyate
translated: Just as the bhāvanā is understood to depend on the three parts elsewhere, in the same way, even the fourth part is required in the remaining guṇa.

analyzed: ke
translated: Some say:

analyzed: agnihotram eva itikarttavyatā iti
translated: The agnihotra itself is the procedure.

analyzed: te tu ayuktam
translated: But that is not correct.

analyzed: karaṇa vyatirikta tvāt itikarttavya tāyāḥ
translated: Because the procedure is different from the instrument.

original: homasya ca prāmuktena nyāyena karaṇāṃśāvyatirekādato 'gnipraṇayanādikaivāgnihocetikatrttavyatetyu cyate /
analyzed: homasya ca nyāyena karaṇa aṃśa avyatirekāt atas gni praṇayana ādikā eva agnihoca itikatrttavyatā iti u cyate
translated: And because the homa is not different from the part of the instrument, as explained by the above reasoning, therefore it is said that the procedure of the agnihotra is only the bringing of the fire and so on.

analyzed: kutas etat iti
translated: Where is this from?

analyzed: katham a dhātvartha sthā itikarttavya tā saṃbandhaḥ iti abhimānāt
translated: How is there a connection with the injunction that is not related to the meaning of the root? Because of the idea that it is so.

analyzed: phala sādhanasya dadhnaḥ iti
translated: Of curd, which is the means of accomplishing the result.

original: yathaiva homasya karaṇatvāditikarttavyatānugrāhyatvaṃ bhavati evaṃ tata eva kāraṇāno 'pīti/
analyzed: yathā eva homasya karaṇa tvāt itikarttavyatā anugrāhya tvam bhavati evam tatas eva u pi iti
translated: Just as the offering is to be favored by the injunction because it is the instrument, in the same way it is so for that very reason.

analyzed: asyāḥ ca iti karttavya tāyāḥ sannidhānāt iti  saṃsthā adhikaraṇa vipratiṣiddha samāna vidhāna tva abhyupagama āpatte codanā liṅgasya ca iti
translated: And because of the proximity of this injunction.🔽And because of the acceptance of the contradiction in the section on the establishment, and the similarity of the injunction.

analyzed: punar atideśa nyāya upanyāsāt asaṃbaddha tvam
translated: And because of the uselessness of the statement of proximity, due to the repetition of the method of extension.

analyzed: yadi tāvat mannidhānāt saṃbadhyate kim codanā liṅga sadbhāvana
translated: If it is connected by proximity, what is the use of the existence of the injunction?

original: atha codanāliṅga sadbhāvaḥ pramāṇaṃ sa dūrasthasyāpya viśiṣṭa iti vyarthā sannidhānavācoyuktiḥ /
analyzed: atha codanā liṅga sadbhāvaḥ pramāṇam sa dūra sthasya api a viśiṣṭaḥ iti vyarthā sannidhāna vācoyuktiḥ
translated: Or if the existence of the injunction is the means of knowledge, then even the distant one is specified, so the statement of proximity is useless.

original: ata evaṃ vaktavyam āśrayayopasthitena homenopakāra pradānakrameṇetikarttavyatāyāḥ sannidhānādavideśanimittasya ca codanāliṅgasya juhotyarthasya darśanāt /
analyzed: atas evam vaktavyam āśrayayā upasthitena homena upakāra pradāna krameṇa itikarttavya tāyāḥ sannidhānāt avideśa nimittasya ca codanā liṅgasya juhoti arthasya darśanāt
translated: Therefore it should be stated thus: Because of the proximity of the injunction by the offering that is present through the process of bestowing benefit, and because of the perception of the meaning of the word 'juhoti' which is the cause of non-separation and is the injunction.

original: yasmādeva cāyaṃ codanāliṅgatvena ja hotyarthaḥ prakaraṇātprāpto 'nuvadivyate tasmādasyotpatteḥ phalaṃ vā prati pratyayo na vidhāyakaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt eva ca ayam codanā liṅga tvena ha iti arthaḥ prakaraṇāt prāptaḥ tasmāt asya utpatteḥ phalam vā prati pratyayaḥ na vidhāyakaḥ
translated: And since this meaning of the injunction is obtained through the connection with the injunction and is reiterated, therefore the injunction is not for the result of that origination.

analyzed: kena prāptasya anuvādaḥ iti ced
translated: If it is asked how the reiteration of what is obtained is possible,

original: ata āha na cānyadbomasyotpattivākyaṃ vidhāyakaṃ nāstīti /
analyzed: atas āha na ca anyat bomasya utpatti vākyam vidhāyakam na asti iti
translated: then he says: And there is no other statement of origination for the curd that is injunctive.

analyzed: ke cit anyathā vacanasya artham varṇayanti
translated: And some explain the meaning of this statement in another way.

analyzed: na ca anyat dadhi phalāt indriyāt agnihotra homasya svarga ādi phalam na asti
translated: And there is no other result of the Agnihotra offering than heaven, such as curd, fruit, etc.,

analyzed: sva vākyena prāpta tvāt iti
translated: because it is obtained by its own statement.

analyzed: tattva na āśaṅkitā prastuta upanyāsāt asaṃbaddham iti pūrva uktam eva jyāyaḥ
translated: That is not suspected. The introduction of what is relevant is unconnected, so the previously stated is better.

original: tasmānna karmāntaraṃ / kiṃ tarhi tasminneva karmaṇi danaḥ phalaṃ homaścānugrāhakaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt na karma antaram kim tarhi tasmin eva karmaṇi danaḥ phalam homaḥ ca anugrāhakaḥ
translated: Therefore it is not a different ritual. Rather, in that same ritual, the curd is the result and the offering is the helper.

analyzed: athavā tena eva tantra vārtika
translated: Or, by that very reason,

original: kāraṇena dadhiśabdasyāpramāḍhapāṭhāt kevanācca dadhnaḥ phalasid dhyasaṃbhavādumaya siraskāreṇa saṃbandhādeva phalamubhayośca dadhihomayostādarthyam /
analyzed: kāraṇena dadhi śabdasya apramāḍha pāṭhāt kevanāt ca dadhnaḥ phala sid dhi asaṃbhavāt umaya siraskāreṇa saṃbandhāt eva phalam ubhayoḥ ca dadhi homayoḥ tādarthyam
translated: because of the doubtful reading of the word curd and because the result cannot be accomplished by curd alone, the connection itself is the result through the consideration of both, and both the curd and the offering are for that purpose.

original: atra tu pūrvoktena nyāyena dadhihomasaṃbandhakṛto vākyasyāsya caikavākyatvābhāvādhiphalasaṃbandhaṃ cānirvṛtte homasaṃbandhaḥ prākaraṇiko nāstītyanenaiva vākyena homasaṃbandhaṃ kṛtvā phalaṃ prati vidhāvāśrīyamāṇe'nekārthavidhānādākya bhedaḥ syāt /
analyzed: atra tu pūrva uktena nyāyena dadhi homa saṃbandha kṛtaḥ vākyasya asya ca eka vākya tva abhāva ādhi phala saṃbandham ca anirvṛtte homa saṃbandhaḥ prākaraṇikaḥ na asti iti anena eva vākyena homa saṃbandham kṛtvā phalam prati vidhau āśrīyamāṇena eka artha vidhānāt ākya bhedaḥ syāt
translated: But in this case, due to the reasoning stated earlier, this sentence does not form a single sentence with the connection of curd and homa, and since the connection with the result is not accomplished, the connection with homa, which is relevant, is not present. When the connection with homa is made by this very sentence and the injunction regarding the result is accepted, there would be sentence split due to the injunction of multiple meanings.

original: ato dadhna eva phannamityeṣaiva vyākhyā yujyate /
analyzed: atas dadhnaḥ eva phannam iti eṣā eva vyākhyā yujyate
translated: Therefore, this very explanation that the result belongs to curd alone is appropriate.

original: tathā ca samā prāvupasaṃhṛtaṃ tasmāddaghno homena saṃbadhyamānātphala miti /
analyzed: tathā ca samā prau upasaṃhṛtam tasmāt daghnaḥ homena saṃbadhyamānāt phalam iti
translated: And thus it is concluded: The result belongs to that which is connected with the homa of curd.

analyzed: tena yat vā iti vikalpa mātra pradarśana artham draṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, the words or that should be seen as merely showing the option.

analyzed: anye tu vadanti
translated: But others say:

original: eka evāyaṃ paścaḥ sopapattika ādita ārabhyopasaṃhiyate /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva ayam paścaḥ sa upapattikaḥ āditas ārabhya upasaṃhiyate
translated: This is a single sentence beginning with the reason and ending with the conclusion.

analyzed: ta sma ainaḥ phannam
translated: Therefore, the result belongs to that.

analyzed: atas dadhi śabdasya vivakṣita tvāt iti ca pāṭhaḥ
translated: Therefore, the reading is also because the word curd is intended.

analyzed: atha vā iti tu pramāda likhitam iti
translated: But or that is written out of carelessness.

analyzed: śakya parihāram tu idam
translated: But this can be avoided.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: yadaiva dadhnendriyakāmasya bhāvayediti saṃbadhyate tadaiva karaṇabhūtāighnaḥ phalamityavagamāt karaṇatvānyathānupapattikāritaḥ kriyāmātrasaṃbandho 'vagamyate śaktirūpa eva ca kriyākārakayoḥ saṃbandha iti karaṇa vibhaktyantargatatvātpratyayārthasya ca prādhānyāt prātipadikārthopasarjanaḥ saṃbandha eva phalāya vidhīyate /
analyzed: yadā eva dadhnā indriya kāmasya bhāvayet iti saṃbadhyate tadā eva karaṇa bhūta aighnaḥ phalam iti avagamāt karaṇa tva anyathā anupapatti kāritaḥ kriyā mātra saṃbandhaḥ vagamyate śakti rūpaḥ eva ca kriyā kārakayoḥ saṃbandhaḥ iti karaṇa vibhakti antargata tvāt pratyaya arthasya ca prādhānyāt prātipadika artha upasarjanaḥ saṃbandhaḥ eva phalāya vidhīyate
translated: And as soon as the sentence is construed as “he should offer the curd for one who desires the senses,” it is understood that the curd, which is the instrument, is the result. Therefore, the connection with mere action is understood to be caused by the impossibility of the instrumental case being anything else. And the relation between action and its instrument is only of the nature of potentiality. Since the meaning of the suffix is included within the instrumental case, and since the meaning of the base word is subordinate, the relation itself, which is subordinate to the meaning of the base word, is enjoined for the sake of the result.

original: tasmiṃstu vihite pūrvavadeva prakaraṇātkriyāviśeṣo homo labhyate /
analyzed: tasmin tu vihite pūrva vat eva prakaraṇāt kriyā viśeṣaḥ homaḥ labhyate
translated: But when that is enjoined, just as before, the particular action of oblation is obtained from the context.

original: tatra tu dravyadevatāsaṃbandhanyāyena kriyākāra kasaṃbandhasya phalasaṃbandhe vṛtte kosau kriyāviśeṣa ityapekṣāyāṃ viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyasaṃbandhaṃ karttu prakaraṇena homa upanīyate /
analyzed: tatra tu dravya devatā saṃbandha nyāyena kriyākāra ka saṃbandhasya phala saṃbandhe vṛtte kaḥ asau kriyā viśeṣaḥ iti apekṣāyām viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya saṃbandham karttu prakaraṇena homaḥ upanīyate
translated: But there, by the application of the relation between substance and deity, when the relation between action and its instrument is applied to the relation with the result, the question arises “What is that particular action?” In anticipation of this question, the oblation is brought in by the context to establish the relation between qualifier and qualified.

original: tenoccate dadhihomasaṃbandhaḥ phalāya vidhīyate iti /🔽tataśvātha veti sadvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: tena uccate dadhi homa saṃbandhaḥ phalāya vidhīyate iti  tatas śva atha vā iti sa dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: Therefore, it is said that the relation between curd and oblation is enjoined for the sake of the result.🔽And from that, the correct reading is indeed “atha vā” (now or else).

analyzed: myak pāṭhaḥ eva
translated: This is the second section of the second chapter.

analyzed: samāpti upasaṃhāraḥ tu ā dya pakṣasya draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: But the conclusion of the completion should be seen as the end of the alternative.

original: atha vā 'syaiva saṃbadhyamānagrahaṇena daśupasarjana saṃvandha nirdeśa ityadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: atha vā sya eva saṃbadhyamāna grahaṇena daśa upasarjana saṃvandha nirdeśaḥ iti adoṣaḥ
translated: Or, this very [word] is connected with the word 'grahaṇa' (taking), and the connection of the word 'daśa' (ten) is stated. Thus there is no fault.

original: nandadhneti cendriyakāmasyeti ca padadvayavyāpāra dvākyaṃ bhidyeta/
analyzed: nandadhnā iti ca indriya kāmasya iti ca pada dvaya vyāpāra dvākyam bhidyeta
translated: If it is said that there is a connection with 'nandhana' and 'indrakāma', the sentence would be split into two parts.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: na eva hi aneka saṃbandhāt vākya bhedaḥ prasajyate
translated: For, even from the connection with many, there is no split of the sentence.

original: aneka vidhiśaktyā hi bhedo / nāsti ca sotra naḥ
analyzed: vidhi śaktyā hi bhedaḥ na asti ca naḥ
translated: For, the split is due to the power of many injunctions, and we do not have that here.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For example,

analyzed: revatī vāravantīya saṃbandhavya amṛte vidhau
translated: apart from the injunction that is separated from the connection of Revatī and Vāravantīya,

analyzed: śrūyate phalam atrā api na vidhīyate
translated: the result is heard here also, so the sacrifice is not enjoined.

original: yastu revatīvāravantīyasaṃbandhotpattividhānāttasya ca phalaṃ prati vidhānātpratyayāvṛttilakṣaṇo vākyabheda āśayane sopi nāśaṅkitavyaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu revatī vāravantīya saṃbandha utpatti vidhānāt tasya ca phalam prati vidhānāt pratyaya āvṛtti lakṣaṇaḥ vākya bhedaḥ āśayane saḥ api na āśaṅkitavyaḥ
translated: But that connection of Revatī and Vāravantīya, which is enjoined by the injunction of origination, and whose result is enjoined, the split of the sentence characterized by the repetition of the verb should not be suspected.

analyzed: svayam eva veḍhena tad phannamya upātta tvāt
translated: Because it is taken as having its own result by the word itself.

original: revatīṣu vāravantīyaṃ kṛtveti niṣpādite hi saṃbandhe yajeḥ pareṇa liṅā phantasaṃbandhaḥ kevantaḥ karttavyaḥ /
analyzed: revatīṣu vāravantīyam kṛtvā iti niṣpādite hi saṃbandhe yajeḥ pareṇa liṅā phanta saṃbandhaḥ kevantaḥ karttavyaḥ
translated: For, when the connection is accomplished by the statement 'having made Vāravantīya in the Revatī verses', the connection with the result by the optative ending after 'yajeḥ' (should sacrifice) should be made only.

analyzed: tena na avṛtti doṣaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, there will be no fault of repetition.

original: tatrāpyādhāranirdeśādrevatīnāṃ parārthanā prādhānyādvāravantīya phalaṃ prati vidhīyate /
analyzed: tatra api ādhāra nirdeśāt revatīnām parā arthanā prādhānyāt vāravantīya phalam prati vidhīyate
translated: Even there, due to the indication of the basis, the Revatīs are enjoined for the purpose of the result of the Vāravantīya, due to their being for the sake of others and being primary.

original: guṇopādānavaśena dhātvarthāduttārito vidhāyakaḥ phalāya guṇaṃ vidadhadyadanyatrājñātaśeṣatvaṃ vidhatte /
analyzed: guṇa upādāna vaśena dhātvarthāt uttāritaḥ vidhāyakaḥ phalāya guṇam vidadhat yat anyatra ajñāta śeṣa tvam vidhatte
translated: The injunctive, extracted from the meaning of the root by the force of the mention of the subordinate factor, enjoining the subordinate factor for the result, enjoins the state of having an unknown remainder elsewhere.

original: revatyaśca saptamīnirdeśādvāravantīyaśeṣabhūtatvātprayojanāntaramanapeśamāṇā na phalena saṃbadhyante / tadguṇakaṃ tu vāravantīyaṃ dvitīyānideśādavagataprādhānyaṃ karotyabhihitāṃ bhāvanāṃ prati dhātvarthasthānīyaṃ pratīyamānaṃ prayojanāpekṣatvāta phalavattā pratipadyate /
analyzed: revatyaḥ ca saptamī nirdeśāt vāravantīya śeṣa bhūta tvāt prayojana antaram an apeśamāṇāḥ na phalena saṃbadhyante tad guṇakam tu vāravantīyam dvitīyā nideśāt avagata prādhānyam karoti abhihitām bhāvanām prati dhātvartha sthānīyam pratīyamānam prayojana apekṣa tvāt phalavat tā pratipadyate
translated: And the Revatīs, due to being mentioned in the seventh case, being a subordinate part of the Vāravantīya, not indicating another purpose, are not connected with the result. But the Vāravantīya, along with that subordinate factor, being understood to be primary due to being mentioned in the second case, being understood as equivalent to the meaning of the root in relation to the enjoined action, attains the state of having a result due to requiring a purpose.

analyzed: atha ca ubhaya tiraskāreṇa api saṃbandhāt eva phannam iti vaktavyam
translated: And it should be said that the result is due to the connection itself, even by the exclusion of both.

original: evaṃ ca sati viparivṛttiprāpno yajiḥ / prakṛtārthāvalambī vaitacchandaḥ / tasmācca yajisamānādhikaraṇātparā ṣaṣṭhī phalavatā guṇena saha prakaraṇātprāptamāśrayā śrayisaṃbandhaṃ vadantī / pramāṇābhāvācāyāntarāsaṃbandhāttannivṛttirūpapravṛtta evakāraḥ / pūrvoccaritena va canāntareṇa ca prāptamagniṣṭomasāmasaṃbandhaviśiṣṭaṃ vāravantīya /dvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: evam ca sati viparivṛtti prāpnaḥ yajiḥ prakṛta artha avalambī vaitat chandaḥ tasmāt ca yaji samāna adhikaraṇāt parā ṣaṣṭhī phalavatā guṇena saha prakaraṇāt prāptam āśrayā āśrayi saṃbandham vadantī pramāṇa abhāvāt ācāya antara asaṃbandhāt tad nivṛtti rūpa pravṛttaḥ eva kāraḥ pūrva uccaritena va cana antareṇa ca prāptam agniṣṭoma sāma saṃbandha viśiṣṭam vāravantīya dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: And this being so, the sacrifice would be subject to modification. This injunction is based on the original meaning. Therefore, the genitive case ending in the word 'varavantiya' which is in apposition with the word 'yaji' expresses the relation of substratum and superstratum along with the fruitful quality, which is obtained from the context. And the word 'eva' is used to exclude the connection with another deity due to the absence of any other evidence. The word 'varavantiya' which is connected with the agnishtoma-saman is obtained from the previously uttered sentence and another sentence.

analyzed: mityādi vat sarva karma antara tvāt nitya prāptam anūdyamānam na pratyayam āyāmayiṣyati
translated: And this being so, the sacrifice would be subject to modification. This injunction is based on the original meaning. Therefore, the genitive case, which is in apposition with the sacrifice, expresses the relation of the qualified to the qualifier, which is obtained from the context, along with the qualified result. And the word eva, which has the form of the exclusion of that, is only in the injunction, due to the absence of a connection with another means. The Vāravantīya, which has the connection with the Agniṣṭoma-Sāman as obtained by the previously uttered word and another statement, is not to be enjoined, because it is all a different ritual due to the statement beginning with 'mita'.

analyzed: karma antara pakṣe tu sarvam aprāpta tvāt vidhātavyam
translated: But in the case of a different ritual, everything is to be enjoined because it is not obtained.

analyzed: na ca tat labhyate
translated: And that is not obtained.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: eka śaktiḥ svabhāvena sarva deva vidhāyakaḥ
translated: By nature, it has the power to enjoin only one thing at a time.

analyzed: alpa artha vidhi saṃtuṣṭaḥ na aneka artha vidhi kṣamaḥ
translated: Being content with the injunction of a small meaning, it is not capable of enjoining many meanings.

original: āśrayatvena gṛhṇāti yo guṇāḥ prakṛtī kriyām /
analyzed: āśraya tvena gṛhṇāti yaḥ guṇāḥ prakṛtī kriyām
translated: That which takes up the qualities as the basis of the action,

analyzed: tad saṃbandha anuvāḍha tvāt tatra bhedaḥ na gamyate
translated: And because of the connection with that, the difference is not understood there.

analyzed: tathā hi  devatā dravya kartṛbhyaḥ na atiriktam apekṣate
translated: It is like this.🔽The sacrifice does not require anything more than the deity, the substance, and the agent.

analyzed: yāgaḥ sādhanam iti evam sāmnā na eva eṣa sādhyate
translated: In this way, it is not accomplished by the Sāman as the means.

analyzed: āha ca
translated: And it is said:

analyzed: stotra sādhana bhūta tvam sāmnaḥ yogyatayā sthitam
translated: The Sāman's nature as the means of praise is established by suitability.

original: stotraṃ ca prakṛtaṃ nāstītyāśrayo na pratīyate
analyzed: stotram ca prakṛtam na asti iti āśrayaḥ na pratīyate
translated: And the praise is not the subject matter, so the basis is not understood.

analyzed: phacāya vihitam sāma svatantram rūpa mātrataḥ
translated: But the Sāman, which is enjoined, is independent, only by its form.

analyzed: veda svādhyāyam eva ekam utpatti artham apekṣate
translated: It requires only the study of the Veda for the purpose of origination.

analyzed: na eka prayatna mādhya tvam kriyā antara viśeṣaṇe
translated: The fact of being accomplished by a single effort is not a qualification of another action.

analyzed: tena kriyām vidhāya anyaḥ tatra kāryaḥ punar vidhiḥ
translated: Therefore, after enjoining the action, another injunction is to be made there.

analyzed: kṛtvāśabda artham eva ekam gṛhṇote bhāvanā uttarā
translated: The two, taking only the meaning of the word 'having done', are followed by the injunction.

analyzed: saḥ api kha gocara prāptam grahīṣyati viśeṣaṇam
translated: He also will take the qualification that has come within the range of the bird.

original: revatovāravantīyasaṃbandhaṃ niṣpādyottarabhāvanāpekṣo 'vasthitaḥ svaviśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭaḥ kṛtvāśabdārthaḥ kratunā gṛhyate /
analyzed: revatovāravantīya saṃbandham niṣpādya uttara bhāvanā apekṣaḥ sva viśeṣaṇa viśiṣṭaḥ kṛtvā śabda arthaḥ kratunā gṛhyate
translated: Having accomplished the connection with Revanta and Vāravantīya, the meaning of the word 'having done', which is dependent on the subsequent injunction, remains qualified by its own qualification, and is taken by the sacrifice.

analyzed: atas ca sva viśeṣaṇāḥ ca iṣaḥ eva kratoḥ
translated: And therefore, the sacrifice is only by its own qualifications.

original: sa tu tatsaṃbandhaṃ sākṣāḍhanupajīvangu ṇabhūtatvādaṅgeṣu niścipannatideśavijñātasthānavāravantīyavaśena revatīrapi tadviṣayāḥ kalpayati /
analyzed: sa tu tad saṃbandham sākṣāt han upajīvan gu ṇa bhūta tvāt aṅgeṣu niścipan atideśa vijñāta sthāna vāravantīya vaśena revatīḥ api tad viṣayāḥ kalpayati
translated: But that (connection) being directly dependent on the connection with the Vāravantīya, and being subordinate to it, it is transferred to the subsidiaries. And by the force of the Vāravantīya known through the transfer, it imagines the Revatī verses also to be about that (Vāravantīya).

original: tena yadyapi atra vākye 'gniṭomasāma na vidhīyate tathāpi ṛtuviśeṣaṇamapi tatra saṃkrāmatītyadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: tena yadi api atra vākye gniṭoma sāma na vidhīyate tathā api ṛtu viśeṣaṇam api tatra saṃkrāmati iti adoṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, although in this sentence the Sāman of the Agniṣṭoma is not enjoined, still the qualification of the Ṛtu is transferred there. So there is no fault.

analyzed: atas ca prakṛta yāga saṃbandhaḥ tvad pate vāravantīyasya na asti
translated: And therefore, according to your view, the Vāravantīya has no connection with the original sacrifice.

analyzed: paśya
translated: See.

analyzed: ātmanā hi akriyā rūpaiḥ guṇaiḥ āśrīyate kriyā
translated: For an action is enjoined by its own non-action forms, i.e., by its own qualities.

analyzed: kriyayā kim prayojanam
translated: What is the use of an action for the singing of the Vāravantīya?

original: sarvacaiva yatredaṃ kṛtvedaṃ kuryāditi śrūyate tatra yadi tāvakvāntadhātuvācyā kriyā 'nyata eva prāptā tato nimittārthaṃ śravaṇāṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yatra idam kṛtvā idam kuryāt iti śrūyate tatra yadi kriyā nyatas eva prāptā tatas nimitta artham bhavati
translated: And in all cases where this is heard: Having done this, one should do this, if the action denoted by the verbal root is obtained from elsewhere, then the hearing serves the purpose of an occasion.

original: atha tu na prāptā tata uttarasyāḥ karaṇaṃ pūrvanirvṛtyutta rakālatvena vihitaṃ tāmananuṣṭhāya yathā karttuṃ na śakyataityarthā davaṇyaṃ karttavyā satī vihitavadvijñāsyate /
analyzed: atha tu na prāptā tatas uttarasyāḥ karaṇam pūrva nirvṛti utta ra kāla tvena vihitam tām an anuṣṭhāya yathā karttum na śakyate eti arthā davaṇyam karttavyā satī vihita vat vijñāsyate
translated: But if it is not obtained, then the performance of the subsequent one, which is enjoined as occurring after the prior one has been accomplished, cannot be done without performing that. Thus, being something to be done, it is understood as if it were enjoined.

original: na ceha revatīvāravantoyasaṃbandhaḥ prāgvidheḥ kutaścitprāpto yena nimittatayā 'śrīyeta /
analyzed: na ca iha revatī vāravantoya saṃbandhaḥ prāk vidheḥ kutaścid prāptaḥ yena nimitta tayā śrīyeta
translated: And here, the connection between Revati and Vāravantīya is not obtained prior to the injunction, by which it could be accepted as the occasion.

analyzed: tasmāt anuṣṭheyaḥ eva vijñāyate
translated: Therefore, it is understood as something to be performed.

original: yadi tarhyanuṣṭheyatvena saṃbandhaḥ upapannaḥ kathamuttarayā'nuṣṭheyatvopāttayaiva saha saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: yadi tarhi anuṣṭheya tvena saṃbandhaḥ upapannaḥ katham uttarayā anuṣṭheya tva upāttayā eva saha saṃbadhyate
translated: If then the connection is established as something to be performed, how is it connected with the subsequent one, which is also to be performed?

analyzed: tad artham āha
translated: For this purpose, he says:

analyzed: dvau etau atha kṛtvā iti eṣa śabdaḥ śaknoti vaditum iti
translated: This word 'atha' is able to express both.

original: kathame kenā nekārthāvagatiriti cedata āha dṛṣṭā hi ka cidiyamapi gatiḥ /
analyzed: katham e kena aneka artha avagatiḥ iti ced atas āha dṛṣṭā hi ka cit iyam api gatiḥ
translated: If it is asked how there is understanding of multiple meanings, he says: This mode is seen even in some cases.

original: yathā śoṣamānayeti pramāṇāntaraprāptepyānayatau raktośvaśvodyamāno na raktāśvaśabdābhyāmivābhihito vākyabhedaṃ janayati /
analyzed: yathā śoṣam ānaya iti pramāṇa antara prāpte ipi ānayatau na rakta aśva śabdābhyām iva abhihitaḥ vākya bhedam janayati
translated: For example, in 'Bring the red horse', even though 'bring' is obtained from another means of knowledge, when it is being uttered, it does not generate a split in the sentence as if it were expressed by the words 'red horse'.

original: tathā ''tra klāśabdopāttā nirvṛttiḥ pūrvakālatvaṃ ca iti /
analyzed: tathā tra klā śabda upāttā nirvṛttiḥ pūrva kāla tvam ca iti
translated: Similarly, the accomplishment denoted by the word 'kṛt' and the prior-ness are also [not enjoined].

analyzed: atha vā
translated: Or,🔽🔽

analyzed: tatra eva na vidhīyeta viśeṣaṇa viśeṣaṇam
translated: the qualification of a qualification is not enjoined there.

analyzed: yatra dravya aṅga bhūtam tat na karma aṅgam pratīyate
translated: Where it is a part of the substance, it is not understood to be a part of the action.

analyzed: nanu revatyaḥ api vidhīyante eti
translated: But the Revatī verses are also enjoined.

original: yadi śrutamātrānupātyevānekārthatvaṃ bhavettata eṣa parihāraḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadi śruta mātra anupāti eva aneka artha tvam bhavet tatas eṣa parihāraḥ syāt
translated: If the plurality of meanings were to be accepted merely on the basis of what is heard, then this objection might be possible.

analyzed: ete te sarve vidhīyamāna tvāt prayojana bhūtāḥ tasmāt aneka artha tvam asti eva iti
translated: But all these are purposeful because they are being enjoined. Therefore, there is indeed plurality of meanings.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: vidheya mātram api atra na arthaḥ iti abhidhīyate
translated: Even what is merely to be enjoined is not said to be the meaning here.

analyzed: pradhāna vidhi yukta ūrthaḥ sa ca ekaḥ tra vidhīyate
translated: The meaning connected with the principal injunction, and that alone is enjoined here.

original: yāgaṃ hi phanne vidadhatpratyayo na viprakuṣyate /
analyzed: yāgam hi phanne vidadhat pratyayaḥ na viprakuṣyate
translated: For the suffix denoting the result does not deviate from enjoining the sacrifice.

analyzed: na ca anutpa tti paraḥ man utpattim api kalpayiṣyati
translated: And it will not be concerned with origination, but will assume origination also.

original: anekārthavidhānaṃ ca yayevotpattividhau karmavidhānanimittaṃ labhyate tathā phanavidhāvapi dvitīyādhyāyasya dvitīya pāda /
analyzed: aneka artha vidhānam ca yayā iva utpatti vidhau karma vidhāna nimittam labhyate tathā phana vidhau api dvitīya adhyāyasya dvitīya pāda
translated: And the plurality of meanings is obtained as the basis for enjoining the action in the injunction of origination, in the same way it is also in the injunction of the result.

analyzed: phala uddeśena karma vidhānāt iti evam manyamānaḥ vadati
translated: Thinking thus, he says:

original: atha revatoṣu kṛtena vāravantoyena paśukāmo yajeteti /🔽stotradvāreṇa yāgamāghanatvopapatteḥ karatoyeṣā /
analyzed: atha revatoṣu kṛtena vāravantoyena paśu kāmaḥ yajeta iti  stotra dvāreṇa yāga māghana tva upapatteḥ
translated: Now, one desiring cattle should sacrifice with the Vāravantīya, whose Revatī verses have been made.🔽Because the sacrifice can be enjoined through the stotra, the Vāravantīya is the means.

analyzed: atha vā ityaṃbhūta naṇā anena eva itthaṃbhūtena paśu kāmaḥ yajeta iti
translated: Or, one desiring cattle should sacrifice with the Vāravantīya, which has such and such verses.

analyzed: tatra uttaram
translated: To that, the answer is:

analyzed: na evam śakyam ṛgantara pramāṇa ahi śeṣa dānāt vaiguṇyam iti
translated: It is not possible to have a double result by the application of another means of knowledge.

original: yadi tadevedaṃ karma tatastatya vāyavyāsvagniṣṭomasāma vihitaṃ tahagantara revatyākhye gīyamānaṃ pūrvavihitavāyavyākhyaviśeṣajñānādviguṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yadi tat eva idam karma vāyavyāsu agniṣṭoma sāma vihitam revatī ākhye gīyamānam pūrva vihita vāyavya ākhya viśeṣa jñānāt viguṇam bhavet
translated: If this is the same ritual, then the Agniṣṭoma Sāman prescribed in the Vāyavīya verses would become double by the knowledge of the previously prescribed Vāyavīya verses, when sung in the Revatī verses.

original: na ncidānīmevātmīye pakṣe bhavataiva tatra revatīṣa ṛccanyānyapi sāmāni prāpnuvanti evaṃ paryanuyuktenābhihitaṃ / naiṣa doṣaḥ/
analyzed: na na idānīm eva ātmīye pakṣe bhavatā eva tatra revatī iṣaḥ ṛc canyāni api sāmāni prāpnuvanti evam paryanuyuktena abhihitam na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: And now, even in your own view, other Sāmans would be obtained in the Revatī verses there. When questioned thus, it is said: This is not a fault.

original: kṛtveti hi nirvṛttaḥ saṃbandho yāgāyo cyate /

analyzed: dvau etau arthau kṛtvā iti eṣa śabdaḥ śaknoti vaditum iti
translated: This word 'having done' is able to express both these meanings.

original: siddhāntavādī tvapūrvakarma vidhāvanekārthavidhānaṃ śakyaṃ nānyatreti manyamāna āha /

translated: The upholder of the conclusion, however, thinking that in the injunction of a new rite, the enjoining of multiple meanings is possible, but not elsewhere, says:

translated: When there is a statement, it is possible in your view, but when there is no statement, except for the mere mention of the Vāravantiya, it is impossible in the Revatī verses that are not being performed.

original: paraḥ punarāha vacanaṃ tarhi bhaviṣyatīni tenaivābhiprāyeṇa /
analyzed: paraḥ punar āha vacanam tarhi bhaviṣyatīni tena eva abhiprāyeṇa
translated: The opponent again says: Then there will be a statement with that very intention.

original: phaje viśiṣṭa karmavidhānātkṛtvāśabdasya cāvidhāyakatvāt yajiranuvāda iti ca satyapi phalaṃ prati vidhātumutpatyavidhānābhiprāyeṇa /
analyzed: viśiṣṭa karma vidhānāt kṛtvā śabdasya ca a vidhāyaka tvāt yajiḥ anuvādaḥ iti ca sati api phalam prati vidhātum utpatya vidhāna abhiprāyeṇa
translated: Because of the injunction of a qualified rite in the Jyotiṣṭoma, and because the word kṛtvā is not injunctive, and because the word yaji is a restatement, even when the intention is not to enjoin in relation to the result,

analyzed: siddhānta vāḍhī sva abhipreta ane ka artha vidhi anyathā anupapatti phalam kathayati
translated: The upholder of the conclusion states the purpose of the non-establishment of the enjoined meaning that he intends.

original: yadi baca naṃ siddhaṃ tarhi karmāntaram /
analyzed: yadi siddham tarhi karma antaram
translated: If the statement is established, then it is a different rite.

original: na pūrvasyaivānito guṇavidhānamiti /🔽nanu tato yajeneti yāgānuvādāditi /
analyzed: na pūrvasya eva an itas guṇa vidhānam iti  nanu tatas yajena iti yāga anuvādāt iti
translated: It is not the injunction of a quality to the previous one from this.🔽But because of the restatement of the sacrifice with yajeta,

analyzed: vacanena a nirākṛta tvāt adya api sva paśvam eva bīyāṃsam manyate
translated: Because it is not refuted by the statement, he still considers the animal to be the object of the sacrifice.

analyzed: na evam śakyam iti siddhānta vivaraṇam
translated: The explanation of the conclusion is that it cannot be so.

original: yadi hi revatīguṇakaṃ vāravantīyaṃ yāgaṃ prati guṇatvena vidhīyate tato'vaśyaṃ sa uddeṣṭavyaḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi revatī guṇakam vāravantīyam yāgam prati guṇa tvena vidhīyate tatas vaśyam saḥ uddeṣṭavyaḥ
translated: For if the Vāravantiya, qualified by the Revatī verses, is enjoined as a quality in relation to the sacrifice, then it must be mentioned.

original: tataścoddiśyamānatvādeva phalapadaṃ na tena guṇena vā saṃbadhyataityanarthakameva syāt / saṃbadhyamānaṃ vā vākyaṃ bhindyāt /
analyzed: tatas ca uddiśyamāna tvāt eva phala padam na tena guṇena vā saṃbadhyate iti anarthakam eva syāt saṃbadhyamānam vā vākyam bhindyāt
translated: And then, because it is being mentioned, the word 'fruit' would not be connected with that quality, so it would be meaningless. Or if it were connected, it would split the sentence.

original: guṇaviśiṣṭakarma vidhāne vā pratyabhijāyamānatvāde kāntena karmāntaratvam /
analyzed: guṇa viśiṣṭa karma vidhāne vā karma antara tvam
translated: Or if a rite qualified by a quality is enjoined, then because it is recognized, it is a different rite from the one already known.

analyzed: na ca yat papūra kāmaḥ yajeta iti aprāpta tvāt anuvādaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: And in 'one desiring heaven should sacrifice with the Paurnamāsī', the injunction is not possible because it is not obtained.

analyzed: etena revatīvāravantoya vidhim pratyasya nimitta tvam pratyuktam
translated: By this, the fact that it is the cause in relation to the injunction of the Revatī and Vāravantiya is answered.

original: ataśca na vāravantīyaṃ kena cihnalavattareṇa pramāṇena revatībhiḥ saṃbaddhamiti viśeṣahānādiguṇaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: atas ca na vāravantīyam kena cit hna lavattareṇa pramāṇena revatībhiḥ saṃbaddham iti viśeṣa hāna ādi guṇam bhavet
translated: And therefore, since the Vāravantiya is not connected with the Revatī verses by any other slight means of knowledge, it would have the quality of losing the specific.

analyzed: atha yāga saṃbandhī nuvādaḥ iti
translated: Now, if it is a restatement connected with the sacrifice.

original: guṇādeva phanne sati prakaraṇādavagataṃ yāgāṅgatvamasmin vākyenuvadiṣyanaiti/
analyzed: guṇāt eva phanne sati prakaraṇāt avagatam yāga aṅga tvam asmin
translated: When the fruit is obtained only from the quality, it will restate the subordinate nature of the sacrifice obtained from the context in this sentence.

analyzed: kaḥ punar āśraya āśrayi saṃbandhāt pūrva nirākṛtāt asya viśeṣaḥ yena upanyasyate
translated: But what is the difference between this and what has been previously rejected on the ground of the relation of substratum and what is to be subsumed?

analyzed: saḥ ucyate
translated: That is being stated.

original: tatra hyānarthakyāttadaṅgeṣu ityetanirākṛta / maṅgatvajñāne tu tatsaṃbhavādagniṣṭomasāmasaṃbandhaḥ sulabha ityabhiprāyaḥ /

translated: For there, it has been rejected on the ground of uselessness in the subsidiaries. But the intention is that when the nature of being a subsidiary is known, the connection with the Agniṣṭoma Sāman is easily understood, because it is possible.

analyzed: tat nirākaroti
translated: He rejects that.

analyzed: prakaraṇāt vi vākyam balavattaram iti
translated: A sentence is stronger than the context.

original: yāyisaṃbandho hi phalasaṃvandhānuguṇatvātsaṃbhavangṛhyate ma tuna saṃbhavati ityuktam /
analyzed: yāyi saṃbandhaḥ hi phala saṃvandha anuguṇa tvāt saṃbhavan gṛhyate ma tu na saṃbhavati iti uktam
translated: For the connection with the going is accepted when possible, because it is in accordance with the connection with the result, and it is not possible, as stated.

analyzed: aṅga āṅgi saṃvandhaḥ tu kathaṃbhāva grahaṇāt syāta
translated: But how can there be a relation between the subsidiaries and the primary, due to the apprehension of the manner of the ritual?

original: tacca nāsti asaṃyukta prakaraṇāditi va cyati /
analyzed: tat ca na asti asaṃyukta prakaraṇāt iti
translated: And that does not exist, because it is not connected with the context, he says.

analyzed: saṃyuktam ca etat phalena
translated: And this is connected with the result.

analyzed: tasmāt avirodhāt guṇa phanna viśiṣṭa karma antara vidhānam
translated: Therefore, due to non-contradiction, there is the injunction of a different action qualified by the result of the subsidiary.

analyzed: tat ca etat syāt
translated: And this may be so.

analyzed: sati api karma antara tve tad anugṛhītāt guṇāt eva phalam iti
translated: Even if it is a different action, the result comes only from the subsidiary that assists it.

analyzed: tat vikalya bhāva artha adhikaraṇa nyāyena pratyaya saṃnikarṣeṇa saṃbandha avagamān nirākaroti
translated: He rejects that by the reasoning of the section on the meaning of the verb being incomplete, because the connection with the result of the sacrifice is understood through proximity with the ending.

analyzed: tasmāt karma vidhiḥ
translated: Therefore, it is an injunction of an action.

original: aya punarviśiṣṭe yāge vidhīyamāne kriyāntarasyāgniṭomasāno viśeṣaṇena kathaṃ saṃbandha iti /
analyzed: punar viśiṣṭe yāge vidhīyamāne kriyā antarasya agniṭoma sāno viśeṣaṇena katham saṃbandhaḥ iti
translated: And when this is enjoined in a special sacrifice, how is there a connection with another action by specifying the Agniṣṭoma Sāman?

analyzed: tatra uttaram
translated: The answer to that is:

analyzed: vacanāt iti
translated: By the statement.

analyzed: pragukta nyāye na ātideśikam vacanam draṣṭavyam
translated: The statement should be seen as not extending by the principle stated earlier.

analyzed: agniṣṭoma sāmnaḥ kāryaḥ iti
translated: Of the Agniṣṭoma Sāman.

original: na kiṃ cidagniṣṭomākhyaṃ sāmāvasthitaṃ vi dyate yasya vāravantīyaṃ kāryāpannamiti kalpate /
analyzed: na kim cit agniṣṭoma ākhyam sāma avasthitam vi dyate yasya vāravantīyam kārya āpannam iti kalpate
translated: Nothing called Agniṣṭoma is found to exist, of which the Vāravantīya is taken as to be done.

analyzed: tena
translated: Therefore, the second quarter of the second chapter of the original.
It is said with the intention of the application of the Jeya Jīyaka.

original: atha vāgniṣṭomasāmna iti stotrasyaiva kārye tādarthena varttivyataityarthaḥ /
analyzed: atha vā agniṣṭoma sāmnaḥ iti stotrasya eva kārye tādarthena
translated: Or, in the case of the Agniṣṭoma Sāman, the meaning is that the stotra itself exists for that purpose.

analyzed: tasmāt mameṣu karma yuktam phalam syāt iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that the result should be connected with these actions.

analyzed: punar vidhāna sāmarthyāt sva artha tvāt ca phala śruteḥ
translated: Again, by the power of the injunction and because the mention of the result is for its own sake,

analyzed: phanna bhayaḥ tu alābhāt ca hi iṣāheḥ aparam phanam
translated: and because of the non-attainment of the desired result, the other result is the result of the Hīṣ.

analyzed: sarvasya ca ukta kāma tvāt tasmin kāma śrutiḥ syāt nidhana arthā punar śrutiḥ
translated: And because all have been said to be desired, the mention of desire in that would be for the purpose of the Nidhana, the repetition of the mention.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

original: doṣāvṛṣṭiṃ kuryāttāṃ ca nidhanabhūteneti vākyabhedaḥ / tadasaṃbandhe cānarthakyama asmatyate na kiṃcidanarthakaṃ / sarvasya saubharamya va canāntarairuktavṛṣṭyādi kāmatvena tatpadānāṃ ca prāptatvāvīṣādisaṃbandhamātre vidhīyamāne vākyabhedābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: doṣa avṛṣṭim kuryāt tām ca nidhana bhūtena iti vākya bhedaḥ tad asaṃbandhe ca ānarthakyam na kiṃcid anarthakam sarvasya saubharamya na kiṃcid anarthakam sarvasya cana antaraiḥ ukta vṛṣṭi ādi kāmatvena tad padānām ca prāpta tvāt īṣā ādi saṃbandha mātre vidhīyamāne vākya bheda abhāvaḥ
translated: And if it were to enjoin the performance of the dosha-vrishti, and that too by means of the nidhana-bhūta, there would be split of the sentence. And if it were not connected with that, it would be meaningless. But nothing is meaningless here. For all of it is said to be for the purpose of the saubhadra sacrifice by other statements, and the words are already obtained as expressing the desired rain etc. So there is no split of the sentence if only the connection with the dosha etc. is enjoined.

analyzed: na ca vacanam anarthakam nidhana viśeṣa niyama artha tvāt
translated: And the statement is not meaningless, because it serves the purpose of restricting the specific nidhana.

original: vināpi ca guṇakāmatvenāstyevātra sāmānya viśeṣalakṣaṇā bādhaḥ saubharaśabdasya sarvabhaktisāmānyavacanatvātsaubharaśrutyā hi parokṣavṛtyā nidhanāntaraṃ prāpnoti / idaṃ punaḥ pratyakṣaṃ / tammāinnīyaḥ /
analyzed: vinā api ca guṇa kāma tvena asti eva atra sāmānya viśeṣa lakṣaṇā bādhaḥ saubhara śabdasya sarva bhakti sāmānya vacana tvāt saubhara śrutyā hi parokṣa vṛtyā nidhana antaram prāpnoti idam punar pratyakṣam
translated: And even without the desire for a quality, there is still the indication of the general and specific in this, because the word saubhadra denotes the general of all the bhaktis. For by the hearing of saubhadra, it would obtain another nidhana by indirect indication, but this is direct. Therefore it should be followed.

original: yathā cārthāḍhāttipyamāṇaṃ śrautena nivarttyate tathā parokṣavṛtyāpīti /
analyzed: yathā śrautena nivarttyate tathā parokṣa vṛtyā api iti
translated: And just as what is being done by the meaning is set aside by what is heard, so too by indirect indication.

original: atha vā sobharaśabdavācyāyā gītenaiva kiṃ cidvādhyate aravidhānenāśarāntaramātrabādhanāt/
analyzed: atha vā sobhara śabda vācyāyāḥ gītena eva kim cit vādhyate ara vidhānena a śara antara mātra bādhanāt
translated: Or, something is set aside by the singing denoted by the word saubhadra, because by the injunction of the aruṇa, only another nidhana is set aside.

original: yadi hi gītyantarāvayavo vidhīyeta tataḥ saubharāvayavāpi bādhyeta / stobhāvara bādhastvayaṃ nidhanaviṣaya ityadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: yadi hi gīti antara avayavaḥ vidhīyeta tatas saubhara avayavā api bādhyeta stobhāvara bādhaḥ tu ayam nidhana viṣaye iti adoṣaḥ
translated: For if a part of another song were enjoined, then even the parts of the Saubhara would be contradicted. But this contradiction of the Stotra is with regard to the Nidhana, so there is no fault.

analyzed: tasmāt ni ghana niyama arthā punar śrutiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the repetition is for the purpose of restricting the Nidhana.

analyzed: evam tu vyākhyāyamāne asti kim cit vācyam
translated: When explained in this way, there is something to be said.

analyzed: tat ucyate
translated: That is said:

analyzed: hi iṣ iti nidhanam iti vyavahita kalpanā doṣāt a niṣṭaḥ saṃbandhaḥ
translated: The connection with the Nidhana is not established due to the fault of assuming an indirect indication by the word hīṣ.

analyzed: tathā uttarapakṣe pi  nidhane ced ṛṣṭi kāma viśeṣite
translated: Similarly, in the subsequent view also.🔽If the injunction of hīṣ is in what is qualified by one desiring rain,

analyzed: viśiṣṭa artha anuvāda tvāt vākya bhedaḥ sphuṭaḥ bhavet
translated: then due to the statement of a qualified meaning, the split of the sentence would be clear.

analyzed: vṛṣṭi kāma padena eva saṃbandhe sati saṃśayaḥ
translated: When there is a connection only with the word one desiring rain, there is doubt.

analyzed: phalena sādhanena iti vākya
translated: Due to the dependence on the power of the sentence, whether by the result or by the means.

original: phalasaṃbandhapace tu na prayogavacanaḥ samartha ityarthavattā /
analyzed: phala saṃbandha pace tu na prayoga vacanaḥ samarthaḥ iti arthavat tā
translated: But in the case of the connection with the result, the statement of the application is not capable, so it has meaning.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

analyzed: anyathā anena saubharam prakaraṇa avagatam api vṛṣṭi sādhana śakti yuktam lakṣyeta
translated: Otherwise, even though the Saubhara is understood from the context, it would be indicated as having the power to bring about rain.

analyzed: na ca tad āśrayaṇe kim cit prayojanam asti
translated: And there is no purpose in relying on that.

original: tathā śruticakṣaṇāviṣaye ceti bruvatā bhāṣyakārasyāpyetadeva vyākhyānamabhipretamiti gamyate /
analyzed: tathā śruti cakṣaṇā viṣaye ca iti bruvatā bhāṣyakārasya api etat eva vyākhyānam abhipretam iti gamyate
translated: And by saying that it is also in the domain of Vedic injunction, it is understood that even the author of the Bhāṣya intended this very explanation.

analyzed: siddhāntaḥ tu
translated: The conclusion is this:

original: sarvasyaiva saubharasyāyaṃ kāmasaṃyogaḥ pūrvokta eva pratyabhijñāyamānaḥ koryata iti nāpūrvaphalapratipattiḥ /
analyzed: sarvasya eva saubharasya ayam kāma saṃyogaḥ pūrva uktaḥ eva pratyabhijñāyamānaḥ koryate iti na apūrva phala pratipattiḥ
translated: This connection of desire with the entire Saubhāra, which is recognized as stated earlier, is reiterated, so there is no teaching of a new result.

original: kimarthā tu prāptasya punaḥ śrutirityata āha nidhanārthā punaḥ atiriti /
analyzed: kimarthā tu prāptasya punar śrutiḥ iti atas āha nidhana arthā punar atiḥ iti
translated: But for what purpose is there a repetition of what has been obtained? To this he says: The repetition is for the sake of the Nidhana.

analyzed: kasmāt punar śruti upāttena phalena eva hi īṣā ādayaḥ na saṃbadhyante
translated: But why are the Hiṃkāra and other sounds not connected with the result obtained through the Vedic injunction itself?

analyzed: tatra ucyate
translated: To this it is said:

analyzed: yathā eva vāravantoyam na iṣṭam āśrayam āpta vat
translated: Just as the Vāravantiya does not obtain the support of the Neṣṭa,

analyzed: phale tathā eva hoṣa ādi na āpnoti āśrayam ocitam
translated: in the same way the Hiṃkāra and other sounds do not obtain the support that is released.

original: na tāvatsaubharāvayavena nidhanena sādhitena prakaraṇanabhyasaubharaṃ sādhitaṃ bhavati avayavasya saubharatvenāpratītaḥ /
analyzed: na tāvat saubhara avayavena nidhanena sādhitena prakaraṇa anabhya saubharam sādhitam bhavati avayavasya saubhara tvena apratītaḥ
translated: The Saubhāra is not accomplished by the context through the Nidhana, which is accomplished as a part of the Saubhāra, because the part is not recognized as being the Saubhāra.

original: na ca yathā śaknu yāttathā 'śrayedityeṣā kalpanāstītyuktam /
analyzed: na ca yathā śaknu yāt tathā śrayet iti eṣā kalpanā asti iti uktam
translated: And there is no assumption that it should be supported in whatever way it can, as stated.

original: upetyāpi tvāyatvamaneka prastāvādibhaktini saubhare katamasyāṃ bhaktau doṣādayaḥ prayujyantāmiti naiva jāyate /
analyzed: upetya api prastāva ādi bhaktini saubhare katamasyām bhaktau doṣa ādayaḥ prayujyantām iti nā eva jāyate
translated: Even if they were to come, it would not be possible to determine in which part of the Saubhâra the defects and the rest are to be employed, as there are many parts such as the Prastāva and the rest.
