translated: Among them, for some, the word 'alabhati' is well-known as a synonym for 'yajati' even in the previous section, for others, it is known as denoting one who performs sacrifices. Both of these are considered to be so even by the author of the commentary.

original: tatrāpūrvayāgavidhānaṃ prāpta vā vatmavidhānamiti pūrvapakṣe dvaitam /
analyzed: tatra apūrva yāga vidhānam prāpta vā vatma vidhānam iti pūrvapakṣe dvaitam
translated: There, in the prima facie view, there are two possibilities: either it enjoins a new sacrifice or it enjoins the method of the previously enjoined sacrifice.

original: siddhāntastu dravyadevatāsaṃbandhānyathānupapatyā pūrvamasmābhiryajaḥ kalpito nādṛṣṭapūrvaśaktyā labhatyabhidhānena vyabhicāryanumānābhāsena vā / na cehāmāvastīti yāvaduktatā /
analyzed: siddhāntaḥ tu dravya devatā saṃbandha anyathā anupapatyā pūrvam asmābhiḥ yajaḥ kalpitaḥ na adṛṣṭa pūrva śaktyā labhati abhidhānena vyabhicāri anumāna ābhāsena vā na ca iha āmau asti iti yāvaduktatā
translated: But the conclusion is that the word 'yajati' was previously assumed by us due to the impossibility of the connection between the substance and deity in any other way, not by the unseen power, nor by the fallacious inference of contradiction through the word 'alabhati'. And since there is no such thing here, it is as much as has been said.

original: tathā ca dohanādisaṃskāra karmaprāyadanamupapadyate dṛṣṭārthatvaṃ ca gopranavana hetutvāt
analyzed: tathā ca dohana ādi saṃskāra karma prāyadanam upapadyate dṛṣṭārtha tvam ca go pranavana hetu tvāt
translated: And thus the consecration of milking etc. is proper as a subsidiary of the rite, and it has a visible purpose because it is the cause of bringing the cow.

analyzed: saṃyuktaḥ tu artha śabdena tad arthaḥ śruti saṃyogāt
translated: But it is connected with the word 'artha' (meaning) due to its connection with the Vedic text.

original: pūrvamānnambhasya pratyudāharaṇa / midaṃ tu carudvāreṇa nirvāpasya / devatāśaṅkā cātrābhyantare'dhiketyārambha / statrautpattikameva caruparoḍāśādonāṃ yāgāṅgatvaṃ / sarvathā caitasyātmīyatvaparityāgaḥ kartavyaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvam ānnambhasya pratyudāharaṇam idam tu caru dvāreṇa nirvāpasya devatā āśaṅkā ca atra abhyantaredhikā iti ārambhaḥ tatra autpattikam eva caru paroḍāśa ādonām yāga aṅga tvam sarvathā ca etasya ātmīya tva parityāgaḥ kartavyaḥ
translated: The previous one is an example, but this is by way of the Charu offering. And the doubt about the deity here is begun with the excess inside. And there, the fact that the Charu, Purodasha, and Drona are parts of the sacrifice is natural. And in every way, this must be given up as one's own.

analyzed: cammu paddhāti iti ca dvitīyā nirdeśāt upadhānam pratipattiḥ
translated: And because of the use of the accusative case in upa-dhātvā, the placing is the act of offering.

original: na cānyatrānupayuktasya pratipattiryuktā ityākāṅkṣite yo gyatvāt yāgopayogitvameva vijñāyate /
analyzed: na ca anyatra anupayuktasya pratipattiḥ yuktā iti ākāṅkṣite yaḥ gya tvāt yāga upayogi tvam eva vijñāyate
translated: And it is not proper to offer what is not useful elsewhere. When this is desired, because of the connection, it is understood that it is useful for the sacrifice.

original: vākyaśeṣe ca bṛhaspatiḥ śrayamāṇo yadi vidhyadeśena saṃvadhyate ānarthakyameva syāt /
analyzed: vākya śeṣe ca bṛhaspatiḥ śrayamāṇaḥ yadi vidhi adeśena saṃvadhyate ānarthakyam eva syāt
translated: And in the remainder of the sentence, if Brihaspati is mentioned and is connected with the injunction, it would be meaningless.

original: tasmādāgne prakṛtikaṃ bāīspatyacaruyāgaṃ nirvartya śeṣakāryāntarāṇyakṛtvā upadhātavyaśvarurityevaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: tasmāt āgne prakṛtikam bāīspatya caru yāgam nirvartya śeṣa kārya antarāṇi a kṛtvā upadhātavī aśvaruḥ iti evam prāptam
translated: Therefore, it is concluded that after performing the sacrifice of the Charu dedicated to Brihaspati, which has the Agni as its deity, and without doing other subsidiary acts, the Charu should be placed.

original: evaṃ prāpte brūmaḥ carvādīnāṃ svabhāvena naidamarthyamavasthitam /
analyzed: evam prāpte brūmaḥ caru ādīnām svabhāvena na aidamarthyam avasthitam
translated: Having reached this conclusion, we say: The Charu and others do not naturally have this meaning.

analyzed: yathāpramāṇam eva eṣām viniyogaḥ vagamyate
translated: Their application is understood according to the authority.

analyzed: na ca iyam pratipattiḥ iti prathamam prayojanavat tva anavagamāt
translated: And this is not an injunction, because the purposefulness is not understood at the outset.

original: artha karmaṇyapi copadhānaṃ prati prādhānyamasti tenāsaṃskṛta stha na nirvarttayatīti dvitīyā nirdeśāvirodhaḥ
analyzed: artha karmaṇi api ca upadhānam prati prādhānyam asti tena asaṃskṛta stha na nirvarttayati iti dvitīyā nirdeśa avirodhaḥ
translated: And in the case of a ritual, there is primacy with respect to the placing, therefore it does not accomplish the unrefined, so there is no contradiction with the second statement.

analyzed: novāra saṃbandhaḥ san bṛhaspatiḥ carau anumātavyaḥ
translated: The connection with the oblation should be inferred to be with Brihaspati.

analyzed: tathā vākya śeṣa sthaḥ vidhi uddeśam anākājita devatā saṃbandham netavyaḥ
translated: Similarly, in the remaining sentence, the injunction should be taken to have an unestablished connection with the deity.

original: yeṣāṃ ca bāīspratyo bhavatīti carusāmānādhikarapayena taddhitena vākyaśeṣe devatāśrayaṇaṃ teṣāmapi prathamamupadhānārtha vidhyaddeśāt siddhenākāṅkṣitatvāddevatā vidhātumaśakyeti vartamānāpadeśānurodhena yādṛśaṃ vayamasya bāīspratyatvaṃ vartamānaṃ paṇyāmastādṛśamevaitat praśaṃsā kīrtitamityavagamāt ya eva śākhāntarīyasya vacanasya bṛcaspatervā etadannamityetasyārthaḥ sa eva bāīspatyo bhavatītyatyāpi taitirīyavacanasya niścīyate /
analyzed: yeṣām ca bāīspratyaḥ bhavati iti caru sāmānādhikarapayena taddhitena vākyaśeṣe devatā āśrayaṇam teṣām api prathamam upadhāna artha vidhyat deśāt siddhena ākāṅkṣita tvāt devatā vidhātum aśakyā iti vartamāna apadeśa anurodhena yādṛśam vayam asya bāīspratya tvam vartamānam tādṛśam eva etat praśaṃsā kīrtitam iti avagamāt yaḥ eva śākhāntarīyasya vacanasya bṛcaspateḥ vai etat annam iti etasya arthaḥ saḥ eva bāīspatyaḥ bhavati iti atyāpi ta
translated: And in the case of those also who, by the sentence in continuation, or by the affix in the word Bṛhaspatisya, which is in apposition with the word caru, have recourse to the deity, even for them, the deity cannot be enjoined, because what is already accomplished, being not required, cannot be enjoined, in the sentence in continuation of the injunction of the first placing. Hence, in accordance with the statement of the present tense, we understand that the praise of the Bṛhaspatisya is stated to be just of that kind which we find to be the present state of the Bṛhaspatisya.

original: tasmā deṣopi na yajimaddacana iti yāvaduktatva siddhiḥ
analyzed: na yajimat dacanaḥ iti yāvat ukta tva siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, this also is not a sentence enjoining a sacrifice. Thus, the conclusion is as stated.

analyzed: na ca tvaṣṭuḥ abhāvena pratyabhijñāyate saḥ
translated: And it is not recognized as the same due to the absence of Tvaṣṭṛ.

analyzed: paryagnikṛta yogāt ca vākya bhedaḥ prasajyate
translated: And due to the connection with the paryāgni rite, there would be a split of the sentence.

original: na cāsau kālasya baktā yena paryagnikaraṇakāla evotsṛjatīti kalpyeta
analyzed: na ca asau kālasya baktā yena paryagnikaraṇa kāle eva utsṛjati iti kalpyeta
translated: And that is not the time for the sacrifice, by which it could be assumed that he releases it at the time of the paryāgni rite.

analyzed: etena avasthāvi dvitīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: By this, the third section of the second chapter is concluded.

analyzed: dhiḥ pratyuktaḥ
translated: The objection is answered.

analyzed: ca udakena eva tāvat paryagnikaraṇa avasthaḥ utsṛjyate eti prāpitam
translated: It has been established that the one who has performed the paryanjikaraṇa rite should be released by the injunction itself.

analyzed: atha uttarā avasyā parisaṃkhyā ucyate tatra vidoṣa svam uktam eva
translated: Now, if a restrictive rule is stated for the subsequent part, then the fault has already been stated.

original: tammānna pūrvakarmaṇi kiṃ cidvidheyamasya vākyasyeti karmāntarameva dravyadevatā saṃyuktaṃ / devatāguṇasāmānyena ca pūrvaprakṛtika magniṣomoya prakṛtikameva vā vidhīyataiti prāpte 'bhighīyata
analyzed: tammāt na pūrva karmaṇi kim cit vidheyam asya vākyasya iti karmāntaram eva dravya devatā saṃyuktam devatā guṇa sāmānyena ca pūrva prakṛtikam magniṣoma uya prakṛtikam eva vā vidhīyate iti prāpte bhighīyata
translated: Therefore, nothing is to be enjoined in the previous rite by this sentence. Thus, it is concluded that it is a completely different rite connected with a substance and deity, and by the commonality of the quality of the deity, either the previous archetype or the agnistoma archetype is enjoined. This being the case, it is stated:

original: pātnovataśabdastāvat manovāyāmivāgniśabdaḥ satyapyubhayaviśiṣṭatve śaknoti prakṛtaṃ yāgaṃ vaktaṃ / paryagnikṛtamutsṛjanīti prakaraṇāt tasyaiva guṇavidhivijñāyate
analyzed: pātnovata śabdaḥ tāvat manaḥ vāyām iva agni śabdaḥ sati api ubhaya viśiṣṭa tve śaknoti prakṛtam yāgam paryagnikṛtam utsṛjani iti prakaraṇāt tasya eva guṇa vidhiḥ vijñāyate
translated: As for the word pātnīvat, like the word agni, even though it qualifies both, it is able to refer to the previously mentioned sacrifice. From the context, it is understood that the paryanjikṛta is to be released. This is known as the injunction of a quality of that [sacrifice].

original: tatakhaitāvantyevā syāṅgānītyavadhāraṇāt svarūpaprāptimā codakenāpi siddherutarāṅgāvacchedārthamevedaṃ vākyamiti phalena vya padapūtvāvaccheda iti /
analyzed: etāvanti eva sya aṅgāni iti avadhāraṇāt sva rūpa prāptimā codakena api siddheḥ utara aṅga avaccheda artham eva idam vākyam iti phalena iti
translated: Therefore, since it is determined that there are only that many subsidiary parts, and since the attainment of its own form is accomplished even by the injunction, this sentence is only for the purpose of limiting the subsequent subsidiary parts. Thus, the limiting of the individual parts is by the result.

original: evaṃ ca sati yāgāntarāpūrvāntarānumānādikkeśo na bhavatīti /
analyzed: evam ca sati yāga antara apūrva antara anumānāt ikkeśaḥ na bhavati iti
translated: And in this case, there is no need for inferring a different sacrifice and a different apūrva.

original: na ca parapadasaṃbandhavidhānaviprakarṣaḥ /🔽paryagnikaraṇānta viśiṣṭe tatmarge vidhīyamāne yadyapyutsargasvarūpaṃ prāptameva tathāpi saduddeśenāṅgakalāpa tantravārtika /
analyzed: na ca para pada saṃbandha vidhāna viprakarṣaḥ  paryagnikaraṇa anta viśiṣṭe vidhīyamāne yadi api utsarga svarūpam prāptam eva tathā api sat uddeśena aṅga kalāpa tantra vārtika
translated: And there is no remoteness from the injunction of connection with another word.

analyzed: vidhāna ainatya nta viprakarṣa ātma eva vidheya tvena uktaḥ
translated: When the path ending with the paryanjikaraṇa is enjoined as qualified, although the form of the general rule is indeed obtained, still it is stated as something to be enjoined by the collection of subsidiary rites with the purpose of establishing it, due to extreme remoteness from the injunction.

original: tvatpace tu dadhnendriya kāmasyetyādiṣviva dhātogatyantapārāyaṃ syā / tasmādapyakarmāntaratvam /
analyzed: tvad pace tu dadhnā indriya kāmasya ityādiṣu iva syā tasmāt api akarma antara tvam
translated: But in your case, like in the case of one desiring sense organs with curd, etc., there would be a verbal root ending in the third person singular. Therefore, it is not a separate ritual.

original: prakaraṇādapi ca paryagnikaraṇāntāṅgagrahaṇamiddheḥ patnīvatagrahaṇaṃ tyānuvāḍhatvāḍhatantramiti viśiṣṭānuvādaikadeśe vyapadeśo pānnambha parihāra / stasmādga / pavidhiriti siddham
analyzed: prakaraṇāt api ca paryagnikaraṇa anta aṅga grahaṇam iddheḥ patnīvata grahaṇam iti viśiṣṭa anuvāda eka deśe vyapadeśaḥ siddham
translated: And due to the context, the taking of the wife is not dependent on the taking of the subsidiaries ending with the paryanjikaraṇa, because it is a restatement. Therefore, the designation in one part of the restatement of the qualified is not a refutation. Therefore, it is established that it is an injunction of the gāyatrī.

analyzed: prakṛtāt api bhettṛ tvam nāmadheye vyavasthitam
translated: The quality of being a distinguisher is established in the name even from the original.

analyzed: kim uta aprakṛtebhyaḥ tra yatra na eva asti abhedaṣīḥ
translated: What to speak of here where there is no possibility of non-distinction from the non-original?

original: na tannāmadheyaṃ prakṛtī kasya cit prasiddhaṃ yasya punaḥ śrutisāmarthyād dvirabhyāsaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: na tad nāmadheyam prakṛtī kasya cit prasiddham yasya punar śruti sāmarthyāt dvis abhyāsaḥ kriyate
translated: That name is not well-known to anyone in the original, but whose repetition is done twice by the power of the Vedic text.

analyzed: tasmāt gṛhṇāti codanā sāmānyena jyotiṣṭoma prakṛtiḥ ekāhaḥ uyam codyate iti manyāmahe
translated: Therefore, we think that this one-day rite is the archetype of the Jyotiṣṭoma, because of the general injunction to take.

analyzed: na va vatma anambha tulya tvam
translated: But we do not accept mere similarity.

original: ekatra yajateḥ pratyaścatvāt anyatra cāvyabhicāriṇyā saṃjñayā 'nyatve kalpite gṛhṇātinā samastajyotiṣṭomadharmaprāpterdravyadevatāsaṃbandhasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: ekatra yajateḥ pratyaśca tvāt anyatra ca avyabhicāriṇyā saṃjñayā nya tve kalpite gṛhṇātinā samasta jyotiṣṭoma dharma prāpteḥ dravya devatā saṃbandha siddhiḥ
translated: Because in one case the word 'yajati' is used, and in the other case, even if the difference is assumed due to the invariable designation, the connection between the substance and deity is established by the attainment of all the Jyotiṣṭoma rites through the word 'gṛhṇāti'.

analyzed: atas yāga antara tvam iti prāpte bhidhīyate
translated: Therefore, it is concluded that it is a different sacrifice. This is said:

original: devatā tāvat dūrabhraṣṭaiva yadi gṛhyamāṇaṃ dravyaṃ tadapi na kena cidupāttam /
analyzed: devatā tāvat dūra bhraṣṭā eva yadi gṛhyamāṇam dravyam tat api na kena cit upāttam
translated: First of all, the deity is far removed. If the substance being taken is also not taken by anyone,

original: na hi jātyā guṇena ca vinā dravyamupalacayituṃ śa kyam /
analyzed: na hi jātyā guṇena ca vinā dravyam upalacayitum
translated: for a substance cannot be indicated without a class and a quality.

original: na ca yāge'navadhārite jyotiṣṭomavadbhāvorita yena somagrahaṇametaditi vijñāyate /
analyzed: na ca yāgena avadhārite yena soma grahaṇam etat iti vijñāyate
translated: And when the sacrifice is not determined, it is not known by which it is known that this is the Soma-taking like in the Jyotiṣṭoma.

original: na ca gṛhṇātirjyotiṣṭomaṃ na vyabhicarati upādānamātravacanatvāt /
analyzed: na ca gṛhṇātiḥ jyotiṣṭomam na vyabhicarati upādāna mātra vacana tvāt
translated: And 'gṛhṇāti' does not deviate from the Jyotiṣṭoma, because it denotes mere taking.

original: na caite yāganāmanī yena taṃ bhindyātāṃ / grahaṇasāmānādhikaraṇyādvi tannāmatvamanayo / rivyataevāsmābhiratra grahaṇabhedaḥ /
analyzed: na ca ete yāga nāmanī yena tam bhindyātām grahaṇa sāmānādhikaraṇyāt vi tad nāma tvam anayoḥ
translated: And these are not the names of sacrifices, by which they would contradict it. The fact that these are names of sacrifices is due to the co-reference with the word 'grahaṇa'. We ourselves have pointed out the difference in the act of taking here.

analyzed: na ca tāvatā yāga antara tvam bhavati
translated: And merely by that, it does not become a different sacrifice.

analyzed: dravya devatā saṃyoge api ca evaṃjātīyakānām yaji māvam nirākatam
translated: And in the case of the connection of substance and deity, the existence of the act of sacrifice in such cases has been denied.

original: acodakāca saṃskārā itya / ca punastadapi na vidyate
analyzed: a codakāḥ ca saṃskārāḥ ca punar tat api na vidyate
translated: And the purificatory acts are not injunctive. And that also does not exist here.

analyzed: agniḥ tu liṅ darśanāt kratu śabdaḥ pratīyeta
translated: But the word 'kratu' would be understood in the case of 'agni' due to the indication of the liṅ.

analyzed: sampravārtika
translated: The commentary is composed.

analyzed: agnim cinuta eti atra api cedhā eva saṃdehaḥ
translated: Even in the case of 'one should pile up the agni', there is doubt.

original: yadā 'gnimagniṣṭomādi saṃstheryā gairanuyajatītyukte yadyagniryāga evamasāvanuyaṣṭuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: yadā agnim agniṣṭoma ādi saṃstheḥ yā gaiḥ anuyajati iti ukte yadi agniḥ yāgaḥ evam asau anuyaṣṭum śakyate
translated: When it is said that one should sacrifice to the agni after the agniṣṭoma and other sacrifices, if the agni is a sacrifice, then it can be sacrificed to.

original: savaṃtra hi tumlyarūpāṇāṃ tutyadharmaṇā vibhāge paurvāparyaṃ bhabati /
analyzed: savaṃtra hi tumlya rūpāṇām tutya dharmaṇā vibhāge paurvāparyam bhavati
translated: For when there is a division of the similar forms by the property of repetition, there is sequence.

original: tadyathā devadattamanugakatīti yadi devadattopi gachatyevamanugamanamavakalpate tathā 'nuyajanamapi /
analyzed: tat yathā devadattam anugakati iti yadi devadattaḥ api gacchati evam anugamanam avakalpate tathā nuyajanam api
translated: For example, if it is said 'he follows Devadatta', if Devadatta also goes, then following is possible. Similarly, the sacrifice after is also possible.

original: tasmāt śrunānumitetikartavya nāṣat ṛtuvidhānametaditi paścime tu vyā'gniśemādibhyaḥ paścāt kiyamāṇoyaṃ tadaṅgameva bhavatīti phalaśrutirarthavādaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tasmāt ṛtu vidhānam etat iti paścime tu paścāt kiyamāṇā iyam tad aṅgam eva bhavati iti phala śrutiḥ arthavādaḥ syāt
translated: Therefore, this is an injunction of the sacrifice, which has as its procedure that which is inferred from the Veda. But in the latter case, this being performed after the Agnihotra etc., it becomes only an auxiliary to that. The mention of the result would be a commendatory statement.

original: pūrvatra tu svatantratvāt phalamātreyo nirdeśa/ diti phavidhitvātpuruṣārthamiti viśeṣaḥ
analyzed: pūrvatra tu svatantra tvāt phalam ātreyaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: But in the former case, due to its independence, the mention is only of the result. Thus, the difference is that it is for the purpose of man because it is an injunction of the result.

analyzed: na dhagni śabdaḥ udbhida ādi vat yaugikaḥ
translated: The word 'agni' is not etymological like 'udbhid' etc.

analyzed: na api vākya bheda tad prakhya tajhapadeśa tvaiḥ yuktaḥ yena karma nāmadheya tvam vijñāyate
translated: Nor is it known to be the name of a rite by reason of syntactical split, similarity, or injunction, by which it would be known to be the name of a rite.

original: yattu tatprakhyamastītyuktaṃ bhavettadyadi ṛtvaṅgatvenāgnividhīyate / sa tu prāptakratvaṅgabhāva eva cayanasaṃskāratayā śrūyate
analyzed: yat tu tat prakhyam asti iti uktam bhavet tat yadi ṛtu aṅga tvena agni vidhīyate sa tu prāpta kratu aṅga bhāvaḥ eva cayana saṃskāra tayā śrūyate
translated: But what has been said to be similar would be so if it were enjoined as a part of the sacrifice. But it is heard as the consecration of the collection itself, having already become a part of the rite.

original: katamadravyamiti cayanasāmānādhikaraṇyāvirodhābhiprāyeṇa praśnaḥ siddhāntavādī tu śrīhīnavadantītivat vaiyadhikaraṇyenaiva saṃskāryasaṃskāra saṃbandhopapatteravirodhaṃ matvāca yadetat jvalanaiti /
analyzed: katama dravyam iti cayana sāmānādhikaraṇya avirodha abhiprāyeṇa praśnaḥ siddhānta vādī tu śrīhīn avadanti iti vat vaiyadhikaraṇyena eva saṃskārya saṃskāra saṃbandha upapatteḥ avirodham matvā ca yat etat jvalana eti
translated: And the question What is the substance? is asked with the intention of not contradicting the co-reference with collection. But the proponent of the conclusion, thinking that the relation of the consecrated and the consecration is possible only by different substrata, like shrīhīnavat, and considering that there is no contradiction, says This which is burning etc.

original: tasmādagniśabdasya prasiddhārtha grācitvāccinoteśca yāgābhidhānāśaktadravya devatābhāvāccāgniṃ cayanena saṃskarotītyetāvāneva codanātha 'va dhāryate🔽yadi hyayamagniśabdaḥ samānādhikaraṇaḥ syāttato dukhaṃ nīyeta /
analyzed: tasmāt agni śabdasya prasiddha artha grāci tvāt cinoteḥ ca yāga abhidhāna aśakta dravya devatā bhāvāt ca agnim cayanena saṃskaroti iti etāvān eva codanā atha dhāryate  yadi hi ayam agni śabdaḥ samāna adhikaraṇaḥ syāt tatas dukham nīyeta
translated: Therefore, because the word 'agni' has its well-known meaning, and because the word 'cinoti' is incapable of denoting sacrifice, and because there is no substance or deity, the injunction is to be taken only as far as 'he adorns Agni by the act of piling'.🔽For if this word 'agni' were in apposition, then it would be difficult to construe.

analyzed: yadi ba eṣā karmaṇi dvitīyā syāt
translated: And if this were the accusative in the sense of object,

analyzed: ayam tu vyabhikaraṇaḥ
translated: but this is a different case.

analyzed: karmapravacanīya yukta dvitīyā atra ayam arthaḥ agni cayanam anu agniṣṭoma ādibhiḥ yaṣṭavyam iti
translated: Here the meaning is that the act of piling up the fire-altar should be performed along with the Agniṣṭoma and other sacrifices.

analyzed: na ca avaṇyam tunya jātīyayoḥ eva paurvāparyam bhavati
translated: And there is no contradiction, because sequence is possible only between things of the same class.

analyzed: atulya jātīyayoḥ api paurṣāparyam bhavati
translated: Sequence is possible even between things of different classes.

analyzed: tathā pākam anubhuṅkte iti avirodha upapatteḥ
translated: For example, 'after cooking, he eats' - because there is no contradiction.

analyzed: tad saṃyogāt ṛtuḥ tad ākhyaḥ syāt tena dharma vidhānāni
translated: The sacrifice should be named after that, because of its connection with it, and the injunctions are for that purpose.

original: agneḥ stotramityādiṣvagatyāśrayaṇaṃ jvalanena saṃbaddhaṃ stha ucyate nāpi tadvān kratuḥ /
analyzed: agneḥ stotram ityādiṣu agati āśrayaṇam jvalanena saṃbaddham sthaḥ ucyate na api tadvān kratuḥ
translated: In expressions like 'the praise of Agni', it is said that the fire-altar is connected with the burning, not the sacrifice.

analyzed: na ca ekatra khacaṇa āśrayaṇam iti sarvaca eva sā śrayitavyā iti
translated: And since it is not based on one place, it should be based on all.

original: tasmātmatyāṃ gatau dravyavacanatvameva yutam /🔽yatvacaivādhikaraṇe bhāṣyakārāntareṇāgneḥ phalavadaphalatvaprākṛtavaikṛtatvanityānityatvottara vedivikārāvikāratvavicāraḥ kṛtaḥ sa udāharaṇāntaredhvadhikaraṇāntarasiddha iāsaṃbaddhopi smaraṇamātra darpeṣovanyasta ityupeścitavyaḥ🔽dvitīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /🔽prakaraṇāntare prayojanānyatvama🔽gataṃ guṇalakṣaṇabhedaprasaktānuprasaktaṃ kīdṛśo guṇaḥ pūrva trāsaṃbhavan bhinatti kīdṛśo vā tatraiva saṃbhavatīti /
analyzed: tasmāt matyām gatau dravya vacana tvam eva yutam  yat vaca eva adhikaraṇe bhāṣyakāra antareṇa agneḥ phalavat aphalatva prākṛta vaikṛta tva nitya anitya tva uttara vedi vikāra avikāra tva vicāraḥ kṛtaḥ saḥ udāharaṇa antara idhu adhikaraṇa antara siddhaḥ smaraṇa mātra iti upeścitavyaḥ  dvitīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda  prakaraṇa antare prayojana anya tvam  gatam guṇa lakṣaṇa bheda prasakta anuprasaktam kīdṛśaḥ guṇaḥ bhinatti kīdṛśaḥ vā tatra eva saṃbhavati iti

original: yathaiva vannabhyāṃ pāṭaliputre vā agnihotrādiśabda uccāryamāṇo nārthāntaraṃ pratipādayati evaṃ prakaraṇāntarepi /
analyzed: yathā eva pāṭaliputre vā agnihotra ādi śabdaḥ uccāryamāṇaḥ na artha antaram pratipādayati evam prakaraṇa antare api
translated: Just as the words agnihotra and so on, when uttered in Pāṭaliputra, do not convey a different meaning, so also in a different context.

analyzed: na hi prakaraṇa antaram tasya artha abhidhāna śaktim abhivyanakti
translated: For a different context does not manifest its power to denote that meaning.

original: na cāvaśyamaṅgaireva kratvantaraṃ gantavyaṃ pradhānamapi paripūrṇe karaṇāśe tantravārtika /
analyzed: na ca avaśyam aṅgaiḥ eva kratu antaram gantavyam pradhānam api paripūrṇe karaṇa āśe tantra vārtika
translated: And it is not necessary that another ritual should be performed only by the subsidiaries. Even the primary act, when the desire for the instrument is complete,

analyzed: sva bhabdena vidhīyamānam virudhyate
translated: is contradicted when enjoined by its own word.

analyzed: tasmāt evam api tāni eva agni docā ādīni iti prāptaḥ ucyate
translated: Therefore, even so, those very agnihotra and so on are obtained. This is said:

original: yadi hi māsaḥ śuddvo vidhoyeta tataḥ pūrvakarmānuvāde buddhirbhavedapi /
analyzed: yadi hi māsaḥ tatas pūrva karma anuvāde buddhiḥ bhavet api
translated: If the month were enjoined as pure, then even on the restatement of the previous act, the idea might be that.

original: na tvetadasti upasaduttarakālatvena śravaṇāt vidyamānābhirupasadbhiḥ śakyaḥ kālo lacayitum /
analyzed: na tu etat asti upasad uttara kāla tvena śravaṇāt vidyamānābhiḥ upasadbhiḥ śakyaḥ kālaḥ lacayitum
translated: But this is not so, because of the hearing as subsequent to the Upasads. The time can be indicated by the existing Upasads.

original: na ca naiyamika tāḥ svārthāḥ parārthā vā vidyante /
analyzed: na ca naiyamika tāḥ svārthāḥ parārthāḥ vā vidyante
translated: And the regular ones do not exist for their own sake or for another's sake.

original: yadi tu tāstaduttarakājavaṃ māsava vidhīyeran evaṃ satyane kāryaviṣānādvākyabhedaḥ syāt
analyzed: yadi tu tāḥ tat uttara kājavam vidhīyeran evam kārya viṣānāt vākya bhedaḥ syāt
translated: But if those were enjoined as subsequent to that, and as the month, in that case, due to the absence of a single purpose, there would be split of the sentence.

analyzed: yadi api prakṛte tasmin agnihotre bhavet idam
translated: Even if this were to be in that very agnihotra of the original,

analyzed: tathā api asaṃbhavāt tasmin brūyāt karma antare guṇaḥ
translated: Even so, due to impossibility in that, one should say the quality is in another ritual.

analyzed: tatra etat syāt iti
translated: In that case, this may be - even if it is the performance of the upasad, due to the continuation, the agnihotra is to be performed.

analyzed: sa dayaktam
translated: That is said.

analyzed: kutas
translated: From where?

original: tatrānuṣaṅgo yukto yaca tena vināna kiṃ cidukta bhavati /
analyzed: tatra anuṣaṅgaḥ yuktaḥ yat ca tena vinā na kim cit ukta bhavati
translated: There the continuation is proper, since nothing is said without that.

original: yathā'traiva māsaṃ vaiśvadevenetyādiṣu yāvat yajataiti nānuṣajyate tāvaśa kiṃ ciduktamityavagyamanuṣaktavyam /
analyzed: yathā atra eva māsam vaiśvadevena ityādiṣu yāvat yajata eti na anuṣajyate kim cit uktam iti avagyam anuṣaktavyam
translated: Just as in these very [passages] beginning with For a month with the Vaisvadeva, as long as one should sacrifice is not continued, it is understood that something is to be continued.

analyzed: i ca punar śapūrṇamāma ādi vākyāni tāvat skha padeḥ eva nirākāṅkṣībhūtāni
translated: And again, the sentences beginning with the full moon sacrifice become complete in themselves.

original: paściritvetyayamapi pūrvacaiva caritārthatvānna kiṃ cidapekṣate tatra na kaścidapi ceturasti yenānuṣajyeta /
analyzed: paściritvā iti ayam api caritārtha tvāt na kim cit apekṣate tatra na kaścid api cetuḥ asti yena anuṣajyeta
translated: Even after that, this having performed also does not depend on anything, because it has already served its purpose before. There is not even one word by which it could be continued.

analyzed: yantu vākya bheda prasati artha mevā anuṣaṅgam icchet kuryāt api saḥ
translated: But one who wishes to have continuation only to avoid the split of the sentence, he may do so.

original: tatra tu punaḥ punaścaritve tyasya vidhānāt yāvadanuṣaṅgamupasadāmanuṣṭhānaṃ prāpnoti/
analyzed: tatra tu punar punar caritvā ityasya vidhānāt yāvadanuṣaṅgam upasadām anuṣṭhānam prāpnoti
translated: But there, due to the injunction of having performed again and again, the performance of the upasads would be obtained as long as the continuation.

analyzed: aniṣṭam ca etat veda abhyanujñāna abhāvāt
translated: And this is undesirable, because there is no sanction of the Vedas.

original: athāgnihotrasyaiva purastātkṛtābhiḥ sarvānuṣaṅgārtha saṃpādanamityucyeta tathā sati śabdoccāraṇamapyevamevāvasthitam agnihotrādīnāṃ pāṭhakamānurodhena upakariṣyatīti nārtho 'nuṣaṅgeṇa /
analyzed: atha agnihotrasya eva purastāt kṛtābhiḥ sarva anuṣaṅga artha saṃpādanam iti ucyeta tathā sati śabda uccāraṇam api evam eva avasthitam agnihotra ādīnām pāṭhakam anurodhena upakariṣyati iti na arthaḥ nuṣaṅgeṇa
translated: If it be said that the connection of the other sacrifices with the Agnihotra is accomplished by the performance of the latter before the others, then, in that case, the mere utterance of the word would also be of use, in accordance with the order of the recitation of the Agnihotra and other sacrifices, and there would be no need for the connection.

analyzed: tasmāt naiyākhyānam upapadyate iti evam varṇanīyam
translated: Therefore, it should be stated that the explanation is not tenable.

original: idda tāvat naiva prakaraṇāntara sadbhāvāta bhedo 'vagamyate kiṃ maī pūrva prakaraṇavicchedāt
analyzed: tāvat na eva prakaraṇa antara sadbhāvāt bhedaḥ vagamyate kim prakaraṇa vicchedāt
translated: Now, the difference is not understood from the existence of a different context, but from the interruption of the previous context.

analyzed: sarvatra ca vicchinna prakaraṇasya karmaṇaḥ saṃvandhi tantra vārtika
translated: And in all cases, the connection of the interrupted action is heard in the manner of the Tantravārtika.

analyzed: di prakāram śrūyate
translated: It is heard in the manner of the Tantravārtika.

analyzed: upādeyam anupādeyam ca
translated: It is to be adopted and not to be adopted.

original: tatra yadupādeyaṃ yathā ''vanīyapratipaḍhādi tatpradeśāntarasthoddeśanāpi śakyaṃ vi dhātum /
analyzed: tatra yat upādeyam yathā vanīya pratipaḍha ādi tad pradeśa antara stha uddeśanā api śakyam vi dhātum
translated: Among them, what is to be adopted, like the Avānyapraitipaḍha etc., that can be enjoined even when located in a different region.

original: yattvanupādeyaṃ deśakālanimittaphala saṃskāryātmakaṃ tasya pradeśāntarāvasthitamya karmapratividhyaśaktareṣā vacanavyatirbhavati /
analyzed: yat tu anupādeyam deśa kāla nimitta phala saṃskārya ātmakam tasya karma pratividhi aśaktā eṣā vacana vyatiḥ bhavati
translated: But what is not to be adopted, which consists of place, time, cause, result, and modification, for that, when located in a different region, the ability to repeat the action is not possible, and this statement is contradicted.

analyzed: tatra eva karma kartavyam iti
translated: There itself, the action should be performed.

original: atha nopanayati tataḥ sa evotpādayatyapīti nirūpyate /
analyzed: atha na upanayati tatas saḥ eva utpādayati api iti nirūpyate
translated: If, on the other hand, it is not enjoined, then it is produced by that very (injunction). This is being determined.

original: tadiha māsastāvat dūrasthahomānuvādena na śakyate vidhātuṃ / na hi kaścidbomādyanurodhenādyaiva māsaṃ saṃpādayituṃ samartha / stenātyantaṃ svatantramanupādeyaṃ māsameva pratiṣhomādiṣu vidhīyamāneṣu dūrasthairutpattividhibhirutpādanaśaktāvalupyamānāyāmidānīmevotyattiḥ kriyate /
analyzed: tat iha māsaḥ tāvat dūra stha homa anuvādena na śakyate vidhātum na hi kaścid boma ādi anurodhena adya eva māsam saṃpādayitum samarthaḥ stena atyantam svatantram anupādeyam māsam eva pratiṣhoma ādiṣu vidhīyamāneṣu dūra sthaiḥ utpatti vidhibhiḥ utpādana śaktau alupyamānāyām idānīm eva utyattiḥ kriyate
translated: Here, the month cannot be enjoined by the mention of the distant Homa. For no one is able to accomplish the month from the very beginning in accordance with the Homa etc., therefore, being completely independent and not to be taken up, the month itself is enjoined in the Homa etc. being performed, by the originative injunctions that are distant, the production is taken away, and the production is done now itself.

original: na cotpannasya punarutpattiḥ saṃbhavatītyapūrvavidhānaṃ vijñāyate /🔽nanu cāgnihotrāḍhipadenotpattisahacāriṇā tatkatpattāṣapanīyamānīyāṃ māsasaṃbandhamājavyāpato 'yaṃ vidhidvitīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: na ca utpannasya punarutpattiḥ saṃbhavati iti apūrva vidhānam vijñāyate  nanu ca agnihotra āḍhi padena utpatti sahacāriṇā māsa saṃbandham āja vyāpataḥ yam
translated: And the production of what is already produced is not possible, so it is understood that something new is enjoined.

analyzed: r utpādaka tvāt inyeta
translated: But by the word 'Agnihotra', which accompanies the origination, this injunction, being brought by the Apūrva, is taken away from the connection with the month, because it is the producer.

analyzed: tatas ca
translated: Therefore,🔽and from that,

original: yatra vākyāntaragatamapi sannidhānamātrādeva pratyabhijñāyamānaṃ na bhidyate tatra skhavākyagatena nāmnopanīyamānaṃ na pratyabhi jāsyataiti kuta etat /

analyzed: satre tu yajya śravaṇāt nāma mātra upanīta prakṛta yāga pratyabhijñānāt tad bhāvanā mātra bhedaḥ

analyzed: tasmāt mādhu uktam prakaraṇa antare prayojana anyatvam iti

original: bhāṣyakāra upasadbhiścaritveti tavacitakāla mevānupādeyarūpaṃ bhedacetutvena darśayatīti draṣṭavyam /

original: siddhāntavādī tu svargakāmādhikaraṇasiddhaṃ pratyarthaṃ cābhisaṃyogāditi phaloddeśyatvaṃ matvā vadati na śakyate phalaṃ vidhātumiti /

analyzed: śrāi ca

analyzed: tasmāt karmāntarāṇi iti prāpte abhidhīyate

analyzed: jyotiḥ ādi vat etad śabdasya satyām

analyzed: tasmāt saṣṭhakta karma antarenya haviṣkaḥ yāgaḥ iti

analyzed: ca tat tathā eva upapadyate

analyzed: jīvana dhātvartha parityāgena kānja abhyāsau vidhīyete
translated: And in your case, the repetition of kā and ja is enjoined by abandoning the meaning of the root jīva.

analyzed: tena lakṣaṇā paryavasāyī vidhiḥ prāpnoti
translated: Therefore, the injunction is concluded by implication.

original: tatraitat syādyā'vajjovamiti yāvacchabdaḥ śrutyaiva kājaṃ bravīti /
analyzed: tatra etat syāt yāvajjovam iti yāvat śabdaḥ śrutyā eva kājam bravīti
translated: In that case, this may be said: The word yāvat (as long as) directly states kā and ja.

original: tadyathā yāvaddoī svapiti /🔽yuktamatra kālagrahaṇaṃ vartamānāpadeśo hyayaṃ nātra kā cinnimitāpekṣā tena śrutivṛttaṃ dohanamatikramya kābo gṛhṇate/
analyzed: tat yathā yāvaddoī svapiti  yuktam atra kāla grahaṇam vartamāna apadeśaḥ hi ayam na atra kā cit nimita apekṣā tena śruti vṛttam dohanam atikramya gṛhṇate
translated: Just as one sleeps as long as the milking is going on.🔽Here it is proper to take the time, for this is a statement about the present and does not depend on any cause. Therefore, it takes the time beyond the milking which is expressed by the Vedic text.

original: yadi tvicāpi yāvaddocaṃ svapyāṭāsīta veti vidhīyeta tataḥ kena vā dohasya nimitvaṃ vāyeta
analyzed: yadi yāvaddocam svapya āṭāsīta vā iti vidhīyeta tatas kena vā dohasya nimi tvam vāyeta
translated: But if even once it were enjoined that one should sleep or sit as long as the milking is going on, then by what would the milking be made the cause?

original: na ca yāvacchabdaḥ kālavacanaḥ ka cit prasiddhaḥ kriyāmeva ta mamāptiparyantatvena viśinaṣṭi /
analyzed: na ca yāvat śabdaḥ kāla vacanaḥ ka cit prasiddhaḥ kriyām eva mama āpti paryanta tvena viśinaṣṭi
translated: And the word yāvat (as long as) is not known to denote time. It distinguishes the action itself as extending up to the attainment.

analyzed: kriyā kālayoḥ abhedāt na na ca pā iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is not so because there is no difference between action and time,

original: kiyatā kānlena gaurduhyataityukte niyatānyeva muhūrtādīni pariccheda katvenopādīyante
analyzed: kiyatā kānlena gauḥ duhyate iti ukte niyatāni eva muhūrta ādīni pariccheda ka tvena upādīyante
translated: When it is said for how long should the cow be milked?, only fixed units like muhurtas etc. are taken as the limiting factors.

original: tadabhyāsavaśena tu vyāvahārikāṇāmapi prāyikaparimāṇajāmāta paricchedakatvaṃ bhavati/
analyzed: tad abhyāsa vaśena tu vyāvahārikāṇām api bhavati
translated: But due to the repetition of that, even for ordinary people, the limiting factor arises from the approximate measure.

original: na ca jīvanaṃ nāma nimeṣādivantriyataparimāṇaṃ yena paricchedakatva sāmarthyāt kālatvenāśrīyate
analyzed: na ca jīvanam nāma nimeṣa ādi vat triyata parimāṇam yena paricchedaka tva sāmarthyāt kāla tvena āśrīyate
translated: And life is not a measure like a moment etc., by which it is accepted as time due to the capacity of being a limiting factor.

original: na hokena prayogeṇa jīvakālo 'varudhyate /tantravārtika /🔽vitatenāparijñānādanyathā vā vṛthāśrutiḥ /
analyzed: na ha ukena prayogeṇa jīva kālaḥ varudhyate tantra vārtika  vitatena aparijñānāt anyathā vā vṛthāśrutiḥ
translated: For the duration of life is not determined by a single performance.

original: anabhyastaṃ prayuñjāno yadi tāvat vitatya prayukta jīvanaparimitasya kānasyāntarā kiṃ cit karmāvayavaṃ yadā kadā cit kurvāṇaḥ tato maraṇasyā nirūpitakālatvādyadi kathaṃ cidantyāyāmavasthāyāṃ samāpayet na ca mriyeta tadūne kāle samāpanādayathā coditāpattiḥ /
analyzed: anabhyastam prayuñjānaḥ yadi tāvat vitatya jīvana parimitasya antarā kim cit karma avayavam yadā kadā cit kurvāṇaḥ tatas maraṇasya a nirūpita kāla tvāt yadi katham cit antyāyām avasthāyām samāpayet na ca mriyeta tad ūne kāle samāpanāt ayathā ca udita āpattiḥ
translated: If one who is not well-versed in the use of words uses them in an extended sense, then while performing some part of the ritual at some point in the life-span, due to the undetermined time of death, if somehow he completes it in the final stage but does not die, there is the fault of not performing as prescribed due to completing it in less time.

original: śrathā samāpya mriyeta tathāpi prakrāntāsamāpanaṃ doṣaḥ syāt /
analyzed: śrathā samāpya mriyeta tathā api prakrānta a samāpanam doṣaḥ syāt
translated: Or if he completes it and then dies, there is still the fault of not completing what has been begun.

original: na ca sarvasvāra vacanamasti yena mṛtepi samāpyeta /
analyzed: na ca vacanam asti yena mṛte pi samāpyeta
translated: And there is no statement of the entire property, by which it would be completed even when the person dies.

original: sāyaṃprātacodane ca yāvajjīvakāmya codanāsamīpānāta satyo vinā pramāṇena kevapna kāmya viṣaye kalpanoye syātāmamminpakṣaṃ / yadi tu tadanurodhena sakṛdeva prayujyobhayaṃ saṃbhāvitamiti manyeta tathā paurṇamāsyāṃ paurṇamāsyā ya jeteti codite tadekadeśakaraṇenāpi śāstrārtha saṃbhāvyataiti na vyāpyate
analyzed: sāyam prāta codane ca vinā pramāṇena vinā pramāṇena viṣaye kalpanoye syātām ammin pakṣam yadi tu tad anurodhena sakṛt eva prayujya ubhayam saṃbhāvitam iti manyeta tathā paurṇamāsyām paurṇamāsyāḥ jetā iti codite tad eka deśa karaṇena api śāstra artha saṃbhāvyate eti na vyāpyate
translated: And in the injunctions for evening and morning, and in the injunction for as long as one lives, because of the proximity of the injunction, if there were any imagination in the matter of mere desire, without any evidence, it would be in this case. But if one thinks that both are possible by being employed once in accordance with that, then even by performing a part of it, the purpose of the scripture is accomplished, when it is enjoined on the full moon day, One should sacrifice on the full moon day. Thus it is not pervaded.
The Vedic text, which has the result of excluding other days except the lunar day,

analyzed: vyātau api tatra myāt na tu i cā evam pratīyate
translated: even in the case of pervasion, is not understood in this way.

original: sarvathā divasāntarāṣṭyatikramya paurṇamāsyāṃtāvat kṛtaṃ karma tāvanmātraṃ ca śāstreṇītaṃ na vyāpti / ritaratra punarjīvitavyatirikta kākāsaṃbhavāyavacchedyaṃ na kiṃ cidastīti vyatāvasatyāṃ samastameva vākyamanarthakaṃ syāt /
analyzed: sarvathā na kṛtam karma tāvat mātram ca na vyāptiḥ na kim cit asti iti vyatau asatyām samastam eva vākyam anarthakam syāt
translated: In every way, the act performed on the full moon day, having transcended all other days, is just that much enjoined by the scripture, and there is no pervasion. But in the other case, there is nothing to be excluded except the time remaining after one's life, so in the absence of pervasion, the entire sentence would be meaningless.

original: sāyaṃprāta śvodanayorapi jīvanakālāntargateḥ siddhatvāt yāvacchandaśva samastajīvitāvidhiprarigrahārtha ekadeśānuṣṭhāne dvitīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /
analyzed: sāyam prāta śva udanayoḥ api jīvana kāla antargateḥ siddha tvāt eka deśa anuṣṭhāne dvitīya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Because it is already established that the evening and morning meals also fall within the period of life, the injunction to live as long as one wishes is for the purpose of including the entire life. When one part is performed, the other is not performed.

analyzed: bādhitaḥ syāt
translated: Because it is already established that the evening and morning meals also fall within the period of one's life, and because the injunction to eat as much as one desires is for the purpose of including the entire life, if only a part is performed, it would be contradicted.

original: ataḥ sāyaṃprātacodanāmiśreyamabhyāsamanācipantī na śaknoti puruṣaṃ niyoktumityaparihāryā lakṣaṇa
analyzed: atas sāyaṃprāta codanā miśrā iyam abhyāsam an ācipantī na śaknoti puruṣam niyoktum iti aparihāryā lakṣaṇa
translated: Therefore, the injunction to eat in the evening and morning, being mixed with the injunction to eat as much as one desires, is not able to bind a person, and so it is not to be avoided. The characteristic

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: is as follows.

original: atha yoyaṃ mama doṣaḥ sa tavāpi doṣa eva / vaktavyo vā vi śeṣaḥ
analyzed: atha yaḥ iyam mama doṣaḥ sa tava api doṣaḥ eva vaktavyaḥ vā vi śeṣaḥ
translated: Now, this fault of mine is also your fault. Or, the difference should be stated.

analyzed: mama pratidinam sarva sva odana arthaḥ samāpyate
translated: My purpose of eating all my wealth every day is completed.

analyzed: kāmya vat ca pṛthak tā īśa tava tu ante samāpyate
translated: And like the optional, the difference is yours, but it is completed at the end for you.

original: tava punarjīvita parimitakāna vidhānāt karmaṇe parisamāptasyaivaindravāyavādigra cābhyāmatulyamanuṣṭhānaṃ taccaitat yāvajjīvacodanākṛtamityāpannamabhyāsavidhānam /
analyzed: tava punar jīvita parimitakāna vidhānāt karmaṇe parisamāptasya eva aindra vāyava ādi gra cābhyām atulyam anuṣṭhānam tat ca etat yāvat jīva codanā kṛtam iti āpannam abhyāsa vidhānam
translated: But for you, because the injunction is limited to the duration of life, the performance of the Indra-Vayu and other grahas is unequal to the completion of the rite itself, and that is obtained as the injunction of repetition created by the injunction to eat as long as one lives.

analyzed: yat tu arthāt abhyāsaḥ iti
translated: But it is said that repetition is implied.

original: liṅdarśanācca karmadharme hi prakrameṇa niyamyeta tatra cānarthakamanyasyāt
analyzed: liṅ darśanāt ca karma dharme hi prakrameṇa niyamyeta tatra ca anarthakam anyasyāt
translated: And because of the indication of the gender, it would be restricted by the procedure in the case of a property of the action, and in that case it would be meaningless for another.

analyzed: atipattiḥ iti svadharma atikramaḥ abhidhīyate
translated: Atipatti is said to be the transgression of one's own duty.

original: prakrameṇa hi karmakānaṃ saṃspaśadanatikrāntamityabhidhīyate /🔽na ca kaścidapi pūrṇamāsayājī sannaprakramamāṇa eva jovanama tinlaṅghanyati na sai/
analyzed: prakrameṇa hi karma kānam saṃspaśat anatikrāntam iti abhidhīyate  na ca kaścid api pūrṇamāsa yājī eva na sai
translated: For by the performance, the contact of the rites is not transgressed, it is said.

analyzed: darśa pūrṇamāma yājī syāt
translated: And no one who is performing the full moon sacrifice, having begun, would transgress the vow. He would not be a performer of the new and full moon sacrifices.

original: atha svakālāparisamāpanamatipātanamucyeta tathā mṛtasya tadbhavatītyanarthakameva prāyaścittavidhānam /
analyzed: atha sva kāla a parisamāpanam atipātanam ucyeta tathā mṛtasya tat bhavati iti anarthakam eva prāyaścitta vidhānam
translated: If it is said that atipatti means not completing it at its own time, then that would be the case for one who has died, so the injunction of the penance would be meaningless.

original: matya hi pratimāsaṃ darśapūrṇamāsaprakrama samāptyojavane nimitte vidhānāt saṃbhavati atikramastaduttarakālaśca prāyaścittaviṣayatvena /
analyzed: hi pratimāsam darśa pūrṇamāsa prakrama samāpti ojavane nimitte vidhānāt saṃbhavati atikramaḥ tad uttara kālaḥ ca prāyaścitta viṣaya tvena
translated: For when the performance of the new and full moon sacrifices is enjoined every month, the transgression is possible at the completion of the performance, and what comes after that is the subject matter of the penance.

original: nanu pūrvapaścepi pra timāsamabhyāsābhyupagamāt tadatikramanimittaprāyaścitta vidhānaṃ bhaviṣyati/
analyzed: nanu timāsam abhyāsa abhyupagamāt tad atikrama nimitta prāyaścitta vidhānam bhaviṣyati
translated: But even in the former and latter cases, since the repetition every month is accepted, the injunction of the penance caused by the transgression of that will occur.

analyzed: na śakyam evam vaditum
translated: It cannot be said in this way.

original: yatra hi nimitta yaccoditaṃ mena tatra bhavitavyam na yatheṣṭa / miha ca paurṇamāsyamāvāsyātipattirnimittatvena śrutā na cābhyāsastacchabdavācyaḥ
analyzed: yatra hi tatra bhavitavyam na yathā iṣṭam iha ca paurṇamāsī amāvāsyā atipattiḥ nimitta tvena śrutā na ca abhyāsaḥ tad śabda vācyaḥ
translated: For where the cause is enjoined, there it must be, not as one wishes. And here the completion of the full moon and new moon sacrifices is heard as the cause, and the repetition is not denoted by that word.

analyzed: vyapavarga ca darśayati syāt
translated: And it shows the end. There would be non-difference in the case of a single time.

original: darśapūrṇamā māviṣṭveti pūrveṇaiva nyāyenāśeṣābhyāmanirvṛtyuttarakālaṃ somayāgaḥ syāt /
analyzed: darśa pūrṇamāsau iṣṭvā iti pūrveṇa eva nyāyena aśeṣābhyām anirvṛti uttara kālam soma yāgaḥ syāt
translated: Having performed the new moon and full moon sacrifices, the Soma sacrifice would be performed after the completion of both, by the same reasoning as before.

analyzed: na ca mṛtena asau kartum śakyaḥ
translated: And that cannot be performed by one who is dead.

analyzed: anitya tvāt tu na evam syāt
translated: But because of impermanence, it would not be so.

analyzed: yat etat muṃktakam abhihitam etat eva sūtra ārūḍham karoti
translated: But what has been stated separately, he makes that fit to be mounted on the aphorism.

analyzed: niyama paḥ hi etat evam syāt
translated: For this would be so only if there were a restriction.

analyzed: anitya tvāt tu bhavati a ce na evam syāt
translated: But because of impermanence, it would not be so.

original: athavā yāvajjīvaśabdena kāle guhyamāṇe lakṣaṇādoṣa uktaḥ tamabhyupetyābhidhīyate satyāmapi cakṣaṇāyāmanityatvāt naivaṃ syāt /
analyzed: athavā yāvat jīva śabdena kāle guhyamāṇe lakṣaṇā doṣaḥ uktaḥ tam abhyupetya abhidhīyate satyām api cakṣaṇāyām anitya tvāt na evam syāt
translated: Or, when the word 'as long as one lives' is taken as indicating time, the fault of indication has been stated. Accepting that, it is said. And even with indication, it would not be so because of impermanence.

original: tannāma kālopalakṣaṇaṃ yuktaṃ yannityaṃ kiyatāpi kālenāvinābhūtaṃ / yadahacandramā na dṛśyate tāmamāvāsyāṃ vidyādityādivat /
analyzed: tat nāma kāla upalakṣaṇam yuktam yat nityam kiyatā api kālena avinābhūtam yat aha candramāḥ na dṛśyate tām amāvāsyām vidyāt ityādi vat
translated: That indication of time is proper which is permanent and not absent even for some time, like 'one should know the new moon when the moon is not seen' and so on.

original: na ca sarvaprāṇabhṛtāmeva jīvanaparisamāptiryataḥ kutaścit vyavasthita svarūpā yayā kālo lacyeta / tadetadevamāpadyate yadaivedaṃ bhavati tataścānityatvānnimittamevaitaditi siddham /
analyzed: na ca sarva prāṇabhṛtām eva jīvana parisamāptiḥ yatas kutaścid vyavasthita sva rūpā yayā kālaḥ tat etat evam āpadyate yadā eva idam bhavati tatas ca anitya tvāt nimittam eva etat iti siddham
translated: And it is not that the end of life for all living beings is determined by anything, by which time could be indicated. This is what happens - when this happens, and because of impermanence, this is established as the cause.

analyzed: katham tarhi niyata nimitta tvāt nityam iti ucyate yāvaṣkarīrabhāvi tva abhiprāyam etat iti adoṣaḥ
translated: But how then is it said to be eternal because of having a fixed cause? This is meant with the intention that it lasts as long as the body exists, so there is no fault.

original: kartustaddha maniya mātkālaśāstraṃ ni mittaṃ syāt
analyzed: kartuḥ tad ha ma niya māt kālaśāstram ni mittam syāt
translated: The time treatise would be the cause, because of the desire of the agent for that.

original: kartṛdharmapane yadidaṃ tvadabhimataṃ yāvajjīvamiti kānaśāstra midaṃ nimittaṃ bhaviṣyatītyetāvatsūtram /
analyzed: yat idam tvad abhimatam yāvajjīvam iti kāna śāstram idam nimittam bhaviṣyati iti etāvat sūtram
translated: If this is the cause, then this time treatise would be the cause, as much as one desires for one's whole life. This is the sutra.

original: yattu bhāṣyakāraṇa vyapavargadarśanamuktaṃ tadyadi darśapūrṇamāsāvitadevā bhipretaṃ tataḥ punarukta / mathānyattadapyandā tatvānna jñāyate /
analyzed: yat tu bhāṣya kāraṇa vyapavarga darśanam uktam tat yadi tat api andā ta tvāt na jñāyate
translated: But the commentary states that the view of final release is mentioned. If that is what is intended by the new and full moon sacrifices, then it is a repetition. If it is something else, that also is not known.

analyzed: tena ananta rājā ūnayā evam yojayitavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be connected like this:

original: tvatpace vikṛtīnāmavyapavargaḥ syāt matyace tu tāmāṃ vyapavargadarśana siddhānta upapatsyate /
analyzed: tvad pace vikṛtīnām avyapavargaḥ syāt matyace tu tāmām vyapavarga darśana siddhāntaḥ upapatsyate
translated: In your view, there would be no final release for the modifications, but in the view of the final release of all, the conclusion will be appropriate.

analyzed: atha vā nigamana sam etat iti vyākhyeyam
translated: Or else, this should be explained as a conclusion.

analyzed: athavā sūtrakāreṇa kartṛ dharmaḥ niyamaḥ yam iti uktam
translated: Or else, the author of the sutra has stated that this is a rule regarding the qualities of the agent.

original: yāvajjovaśabdamya tu kā gatiriti nābhihitamata āī /
analyzed: tu kā gatiḥ iti na abhihitam atas
translated: But what is the position of the word 'as long as one lives'? This has not been stated.

analyzed: evam sati kāna śāstram eva nimittam syāt
translated: If this is so, then the mere injunction itself would be the reason.

original: athavā 'gnihotre darśapūrṇamāsayostāvat yāvajjīvagrahaṇāt kartṛdharmaniyamatvaṃ bhavet paśusomacāturmāsye tu katham /
analyzed: athavā gnihotre darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ tāvat yāvat jīva grahaṇāt kartṛ dharma niyama tvam bhavet paśu soma cāturmāsye tu katham
translated: Or, in the Agnihotra and Darsha-Purnamasa, due to the use of 'as long as one lives', it would be a rule regarding the qualities of the agent, but how about the Pashu, Soma and Chaturmasya?

analyzed: tat ucyate
translated: That is said.

original: tatrāpi vīmāyukta kānaśāstrameva nimittaṃ syā / dvamante vamante jyotiṣetyādi /
analyzed: tatra api nimittam syāḥ dvamante vamante jyotiṣā ityādi
translated: Even there, the mere injunction would be the reason, like 'those who desire heaven, those who desire heaven, those who desire light' etc.

analyzed: na tāvat etat kāmyamya upadiśyate
translated: This is not taught as something to be desired.

original: sahi yāvadicchamaṅgatvenaiva sthitatvāt naivaṃ vaktuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: sa hi yāvadiccham aṅga tvena eva sthita tvāt na evam vaktum śakyate
translated: Because it exists only as a subsidiary as long as desired, it cannot be stated in this way.

original: athāpi naiyamikasya sakuprayogaḥ syātatrāpi vīmānarthikā bhavet /
analyzed: atha api naiyamikasya sa kuprayogaḥ syāt atra api bhavet
translated: Even if the performance of the obligatory rite were to occur there, it would be meaningless.

analyzed: na ca vasanta iyattā avadhāraṇā pramāṇam asti
translated: And there is no means of determining the extent of spring.

analyzed: tasmāt yāvajjovam ye vamantāḥ tedhu iti vijñāyate
translated: Therefore, it is understood that those who live as long as they live, they are the ones who desire heaven.

original: saptamyapi ca bhinne jonatyādivat nimittārthā bhaviṣyati / tenocyate sarvatraivajātīyaka kartṛdharmaniyamāvadhāraṇātkālaśāsvaṃ nimitta māstraṃ pratyetavyam /
analyzed: saptamī api ca bhinne jonati ādi vat nimitta arthā bhaviṣyati tena ucyate sarvatra eva jātīyaka kartṛ dharma niyama avadhāraṇāt kāla śāsvam pratyetavyam
translated: And the seventh case also will have the sense of the cause, like the instrumental case in 'jonatyādi'. Therefore, it is said that the time rule should be understood as the cause, from the determination of the restriction of the property of the agent in all such cases.

analyzed: etena eva paśu cāturmāsya ādiṣu api naiyamika tva siddhiḥ
translated: By this alone, the establishment of the obligatory nature is also in the animal sacrifices and the four-monthly sacrifices etc.

analyzed: śākhā antare yathā karma kuttra rūpam pratīyate
translated: Just as a ritual is understood in one branch,

analyzed: kiṃcid guṇa samāmnānāt ca evam veda antareṣu tat
translated: and in other Vedas, it is the same due to the mention of some qualities.

analyzed: dvitīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: Second Chapter, Fourth Section.

analyzed: pṛṣṭha daya vikapaḥ syān śākhā antara vidhānataḥ
translated: The Pṛṣṭha etc. should be optional due to the injunction in another branch.

original: ma ca prakṛtitaḥ prāptaḥ karmaikatve vṛthā bhavet
analyzed: ma ca prakṛtitaḥ prāptaḥ karma eka tve vṛthā bhavet
translated: And what is obtained from the archetype would be useless in the unity of the ritual.

analyzed: ekam vā saṃyoga rūpa codana ākhyāvi śeṣāt
translated: Or it is one, due to the non-distinction of the form of connection and the injunction.

analyzed: sarva ca pratyabhijñānāt
translated: And due to the recognition in all, by the form of transference, the secret etc.,

original: ekakarmatvavijñānaṃ na bhākhākhapagacchati🔽svādhyāyagrahaṇenaikā śākhā hi parigṛhyate /
analyzed: eka karma tva vijñānam na  svādhyāya grahaṇena ekā śākhā hi parigṛhyate
translated: The knowledge of the unity of the ritual does not go to another branch.🔽By the mention of one's own study, only one branch is taken up.

original: ekārthānāṃ vikalpaśca karmaikatve bhaviṣyati🔽śākhayā hokayā yogāihakarmāvabodhanam /
analyzed: eka arthānām vikalpaḥ ca karma eka tve bhaviṣyati 🔽śākhayā ha ukayā yoga aiha karma avabodhanam
translated: And in the unity of the ritual, there will be an option of those having the same meaning.🔽The understanding of the ritual here is by connection with one branch.

analyzed: yujyate karma nānātvāt na eka mākha upanakṣaṇam
translated: It is proper due to the diversity of actions, not the momentary nature of a single action.

analyzed: kṛtakam ca abhidhānam
translated: And the designation is artificial.

analyzed: kṛṣimam kāṭhaka a yukta māyā pravacanāt iti
translated: The Kaṭhas and Kāṭakas are connected with agriculture, as stated in the scriptures.

original: na vā 'nādīni bhidyante karmāṇyādimatā satā yadyapi kāṭhakāderjāternityatvānnityaivākhyā tathāpi pravacananimitteyaṃ smaryate /
analyzed: na vā na ādīni bhidyante karmāṇi ādimatā satā yadi api kāṭhaka ādeḥ jāteḥ nitya tvāt nityā eva ākhyā tathā api pravacana nimittā iyam smaryate
translated: Even though the name is eternal due to being derived from Kaṭha and so on, it is still remembered as the basis for the scriptures.

original: na ca karmāṇi procyante śabdaviṣayatvāt pravacanasya /
analyzed: na ca karmāṇi procyante śabda viṣaya tvāt pravacanasya
translated: And actions are not mentioned, because the scriptures deal with words.

original: tasmādapi na saṃjñayā karmabheda iti ekatvepi param🔽na ca kapālasaṃkhyābhedāi bhedaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt api na saṃjñayā karma bhedaḥ iti eka tve pi param  na ca kapāla saṃkhyā bhedāt bhedaḥ
translated: Therefore, even in unity, the difference of actions is not due to the name.🔽And the difference is not due to the difference in the number of potsherds.

analyzed: tāṃbandhi hāra bheda an abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the difference in the number of potsherds is not accepted.

analyzed: tasmāt ekasmin iva karmaṇi sādhana vikalpaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, in a single action, there will be an option of means.

analyzed: nanu ca utpatti vākya śiṣṭa tvāt dikalpaḥ na asti iti uktam na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: But it has been said that there is no option due to being taught by the originative injunction. This is not a fault.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ utpatti vākya śiṣṭa tva aviśeṣeṇa tulya bala tvāt
translated: Because both are equally strong, without any distinction in being taught by the originative injunction.

original: kathaṃ punaraneka vākyotpādita syaikatvaṃ vijñāyataiti tasyottarasūtre pa ricāraṃ vakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: katham punar aneka vākya utpādita sya eka tvam vijñāyate eti tasya uttara sūtre paricāram vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: But how is the unity of what is produced by many statements known? We will discuss that in the next aphorism.

analyzed: āgneya vat punarvacanam
translated: Repetition like in the case of the Āgneya.

analyzed: anubhāṣaṇa sūcam etat
translated: This is an indication of the repetition.

original: atha vā punaruktatva paricārārtha me vai mat /
analyzed: atha vā punar ukta tva paricāra artha me vai mat
translated: Or, the repetition is for the purpose of serving the same purpose again.

analyzed: punar ameḥ arthavāda guṇa artha tvena anyathītvāt
translated: Because of the difference in meaning due to the purpose of the restatement being for the purpose of the qualities.

analyzed: a dvirvacanam vā śruti saṃyoga avi śeṣāt
translated: Or, there should not be a second statement, because of the non-difference in connection with the Vedic text.

analyzed: disīya vyāyāne parivāra antara nivṛtti athe
translated: In the case of the Dīkṣā and Upavita, it is for the purpose of precluding other alternatives.

analyzed: vābhandaḥ
translated: Vābhravya.

analyzed: tat ca anya arthā punar nirbhavati yatra bāvanmātram eva śrūyate
translated: And that is repeated for a different purpose where only the word is heard.

analyzed: yatra ca eka vākya gatam vidheya antaram vidyate
translated: And where there is another object of injunction within the same sentence.

original: na lie tadekamapi / samastetikataṃvyatopeta pradhānapunaḥ śrutiśravaṇāt /🔽etameva śrutisaṃyogāvi hinīvāṇyāpaśya caturtha pāda /
analyzed: na tat ekam api pradhāna punar śruti śravaṇāt  etam eva caturtha
translated: Not even that one, because of hearing the repetition of the principal along with the entire injunction.

analyzed: śeṣam manyate
translated: This very one is considered a remainder because of the non-difference in connection with the Vedic text.

analyzed: na ca eṣā punaḥśrutiḥ
translated: And this is not a repetition.

analyzed: kutas  yugapad punar śruti kalpanā
translated: How?🔽The assumption of repetition is not simultaneous with that.

analyzed: na hi tatra ekam ākhā vat krameṇa adhyayanam sthitam
translated: For there is no study in order, like a single branch.

analyzed: saṃpradāya āgatām mukkā khām samāyā nibandhinīm
translated: Except for the tradition that has come down, which is binding on the branches.

original: śākhā śākhāntaraṃ yuktaṃ nādhyetuṃ mahaśe śrame
analyzed: śākhā śākhā antaram yuktam na adhyetum mahaśe śrame
translated: It is proper for a branch to study another branch, not with great effort.

analyzed: caturtha pāda
translated: The second half of the fourth quarter.

original: pradhānānyapi prādhānyena yajamānaniyamaṃ pratyapramavantībhiḥ samāvyābhirarthamānamuddiśya vidhīyamānāni sarvaśākhāgatānyeka kaṃ puruṣamupatiṣṭhante /
analyzed: pradhānāni api prādhānyena yajamāna niyamam sarva śākhā gatāni eka kam puruṣam upatiṣṭhante
translated: Even the principal acts, being enjoined by the same general injunctions with regard to the restriction on the sacrificer, are performed on one person mentioned in all the branches, with reference to the same purpose.

original: tatraikaphalatvādasamuccaye yena kena cit mādhyamāne phate 'nyeṣāṃ vaiyathyaṃ prasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tatra eka phala tvāt asamuccaye yena kena cit nyeṣām vaiyathyam prasaṅgaḥ
translated: There, due to having the same result, if the result is obtained by any one means, the uselessness of the others follows in the absence of combination.

original: atha teṣāṃ vikalpenārthavattvaṃ tadaraṃ śākhāntarāṇāmeva vyavasthitapratipādyānāmanāṅavataraṃ parikalpitamityapunaruktatā /
analyzed: atha teṣām vikalpena arthavat tvam tat aram śākhā antarāṇām eva vyavasthita pratipādyānām anāṅavataram parikalpitam iti apunarukta tā
translated: If they are useful by option, then the settled subjects of the other branches are imagined to be included without repetition.

analyzed: saṃprekṣā
translated: The statement of completion is due to consideration.

analyzed: artha a saṃniveḥ ca
translated: And due to the absence of connection with the meaning.

original: ekasya vedavṛcasya kiṃcitkarmaphantāśrayāt evaṃ śākhāḥ prasidhyanti bahubhākhekabudhavat /
analyzed: ekasya evam śākhāḥ prasidhyanti
translated: Thus the branches are established, like many scholars in one branch, based on the results of some acts of one Vedic branch.

original: yadi pratibhākhaṃ karmabhedaḥ syāt asamāptivaditi vā chedaḥ /
analyzed: yadi karma bhedaḥ syāt asamāpti vat iti vā chedaḥ
translated: If there were a difference in the acts for each branch, it would be like an incomplete act, or so it is cut off.

original: karmabhedapace yāvadeva yeṣāṃ mana ekamalābhāvādādita evārabhya bhidyamānatvāta samastakasamāmnānaṃ tāvadeva teṣāṃ samāpyataiti na brūyuratrāsmākaṃ na mapyapuṣpaphacāntaranbāt bujhāntaravat vedāntarāpayevocceran /
analyzed: karma bheda pace yāvat eva yeṣām manaḥ eka mala abhāvāt āditas eva ārabhya bhidyamāna tvāt samastaka samāmnānam tāvat eva teṣām samāpyate eti na brūyuḥ atra asmākam na bujha antara vat
translated: In the case of the difference of rites, they would not say that for those whose mind is not one due to lack of wealth, it is completed only up to where it is begun and divided, and that it is completed only up to that. For us also, it is not due to the difference of flowers, but due to the difference of understanding, like the difference of Vedas.

analyzed: samāpyate eti
translated: It is completed.

analyzed: ancārohāḥ nāma sthala ārohaṇa mantrāḥ teṣu maināna śākhā antarāṇi
translated: And the Anāroha mantras are the mantras for ascending the land. In them, the branches of the Mānas are different.

original: ekakarmamūnā vidhiskandharūpatve samotikarmayaṇīyānāṃ samāpyate nāsmākamityabhighānādadhyetṝṣṇāmapi kavyatāyāḥ kacit kiṃ cidaṣikamityālocca sārūpyādupapatraḥ maikatvaṃ prasidvamityavamīyate
analyzed: vidhi skandha rūpa tve samāpyate na asmākam iti abhighānāt adhyetṝṣṇām api kavya tāyāḥ kacid kim sārūpyāt upapatraḥ mā eka tvam prasidvam iti avamīyate
translated: In the form of a collection of injunctions lacking a single rite, it is completed for those to be performed together. It is not for us. Due to the statement, even the desire to study is slightly modified in some places due to the similarity of the rite. It is understood that the oneness is well-known due to similarity.

analyzed: puṃsām vikalpante vidhāyakāḥ
translated: The injunctions that are combined in one place for men are optional.

original: tatsamopasamāmnātaṃ grāhyaṃ prakaraṇasya ca śākhāntareṣu vikalpamāneṣu yayaiva pradhānaṃ vidhīyate 'rthinastadīyaḥ kathaṃbhāvastāmeva vyāpnoti na śākhāntarāṇi /
analyzed: tad sama upasamāmnātam grāhyam prakaraṇasya ca śākhā antareṣu vikalpamāneṣu yayā eva pradhānam vidhīyate rthinaḥ tadīyaḥ kathaṃbhāvaḥ tām eva vyāpnoti na śākhā antarāṇi
translated: That which is mentioned together should be accepted, and also of the context. When the options are different in the other branches, the one by which the principal is enjoined for the seeker, its manner of being pervades only that, not the other branches.

original: atavānyagatā guṇāḥ kathaṃbhāvena nāpekṣitāḥ prayogavacanenānupasaṃcatā nāṅgaṃ bhavantīti nānuṣṭheyā / stataśca vākyasaṃyuktānāmapatvādiṣīyamānānāmastyupasaṃharaṇaśaktiriti /
analyzed: guṇāḥ kathaṃbhāvena na apekṣitāḥ na aṅgam bhavanti iti na anuṣṭheyāḥ statas ca vākya saṃyuktānām apatva ādi ṣīyamānānām asti upasaṃharaṇa śaktiḥ iti
translated: Therefore, how can the qualities present in other sacrifices not be required? Since they are not combined by the statement of application, they do not become subsidiary and are not to be performed. And therefore, since those connected in a sentence are being considered, there is the power to include them.

analyzed: na tu etat yuktam iva
translated: But this does not seem proper.

analyzed: tathā ci
translated: Thus,

analyzed: prativedam api ca prakaraṇam puruṣasya dharmān upadiśati
translated: and for each Veda, the context teaches the duties of the person.

original: na ca tat vedāntarasthaṃ pratyapramāṇaṃ / tathā śākhāntarepi draṣṭavyam/
analyzed: na ca tat veda antara stham prati apramāṇam tathā śākhā antare pi draṣṭavyam
translated: And that is not a non-means of knowledge for what is in another Veda. It should be seen thus in other branches also.

original: karmadharmāścaite vijñāyante taca karma śākhāntareṣvapi tadevetyaṅgatvāviśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: karma dharmāḥ ca ete vijñāyante tat ca karma śākhā antareṣu api tat eva iti aṅga tva aviśeṣaḥ
translated: And these are known as the duties of the ritual, and that ritual is the same even in other branches, so there is no difference in being a subsidiary.

original: yadyapi prakaraṇarūpamanyat tathāpi śākhāntarasthenānenaitepi dharmā gṛhītā ityavadhāraṇāt na svaprakaraṇagṛhītebhyo viśiṣyante /
analyzed: yadi api prakaraṇa rūpam anyat tathā api śākhā antara sthena anena ete api dharmāḥ gṛhītāḥ iti avadhāraṇāt na sva prakaraṇa gṛhītebhyaḥ viśiṣyante
translated: Even though the form of the context is different, still these duties are grasped by this one present in another branch, so they are not distinguished from those grasped in their own context due to the determination.

original: sarvākhapi ca śākhākhadhika viṣayo na kathaṃ cit śākhayā parimitā bhavantītyalpa evāyāsa iti nāśaktiḥ /
analyzed: ca viṣayaḥ na katham cit śākhayā parimitāḥ bhavanti iti alpaḥ eva āyāsaḥ iti na aśaktiḥ
translated: And the entire subject matter of all the branches is not in any way limited by a branch, so the effort is very small, so there is no inability.

analyzed: cayaḥ upapanna tvāt na bhedam kalpayati
translated: And in the case of the desire for completion, he does not imagine a difference due to the fact of being engaged.

analyzed: samāptiḥ pūrvavat tvāt yathā jñāte pratīyate
translated: The completion is understood as known before, because of the prior mention, just as it is known.

original: ekatvepi samāptirliṃṅgatvenoktā samāptivacca saṃpreśceti samāptivacanaṃ nānātvepi /🔽tatra pratyayānumāritvā dekatvasyaiva sādhikā tadvacanasyeyamupapattiḥ pūrvatvādityārambhāpeścatvāt /
analyzed: ekatve api samāptiḥ liṃṅga tvena uktā samāpti vat ca saṃpreḥ ca iti samāpti vacanam nānātve api  tatra pratyaya anumāri tvāt eka tvasya eva sādhikā tad vacanasya iyam upapattiḥ
translated: Even in oneness, completion is mentioned as a mark, and like the mention of completion, the mention of connection is also in diversity.🔽There, the statement of that is the proof that oneness is to be established by inference from the effect, because of the prior mention and because of the prior mention of the beginning.

original: athavā śabdaprayogasya prasiddhipūrvakatvādyādṛśīṃ vayaṃ samāptiṃ paṇyāmastādṛgyāmayaṃ prayukta iti niścinumaḥ /
analyzed: athavā śabda prayogasya prasiddhi pūrvaka tvāt yādṛśīm vayam samāptim paṇyāmaḥ tādṛśyām ayam prayuktaḥ iti niścinumaḥ
translated: Or, because the use of words is preceded by well-known facts, we conclude that he uses it in the same way as we know completion.

original: sa ca vastunyasamāptepi tacchākhāvijñeyapadārthanamāptau prayukta iti dṛśyate ta smādavirodhaḥ
analyzed: sa ca vastuni asamāpte pi tad śākhā vijñeya padārtha namāptau prayuktaḥ iti dṛśyate smāt avirodhaḥ
translated: And that is seen to be used even when the substance is incomplete, upon the completion of the object to be known in that branch. Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: dravye vā coditatvāvināmavyavasthā sthānnirdeśād vyavatiṣṭheta tasmānnityānuvādaḥ syāt
analyzed: dravye vā codita tva avinām avyavasthā sthāt nirdeśāt vyavatiṣṭheta tasmāt nitya anuvādaḥ syāt
translated: Or, in the substance, because of being enjoined, the non-distinction is determined by the location, it would be a permanent restatement.

original: atha yaduktamekādaśinyāṃ pacave disaṃmānadarśanaṃ na syādii/
analyzed: atha yat uktam ekādaśinyām na syāt iii
translated: Now, what was said about the Ekādashinī, the appearance of the Pāchāgni and the Samāna would not be there.

original: tatra brūmaḥ anyathāpi tu naivāti panavedyādimānatā /
analyzed: tatra brūmaḥ anyathā api tu na eva ati
translated: There we say: But in another way also, it is not indeed possessed of the Pāchāgni and so on.

analyzed: ekādaśinī abhāvena stūyate tu eka yūpa tā
translated: The oneness of the sacrificial post is praised by the absence of the Ekādashinī.

analyzed: babhva vātika
translated: It is indeed so.

analyzed: guṇa arthā vā punar śrutiḥ
translated: Or the repetition is for the purpose of qualities.

analyzed: saṃsthā vyavasthā arthā vā bṛhat rathantarayoḥ punar śrutiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Or the repetition of the Brihat and Rathantara is for the purpose of establishing the order of the parts.

analyzed: api vā krama saṃyogāt vidhi pṛthaktvam ekasyām vyavatiṣṭheta
translated: Or, due to the connection with the sequence, the separateness of the injunctions would be determined in one.

analyzed: pratibhākham vā vidhi pṛthaktvam vyavatiṣṭheta
translated: Or, the separateness of the injunctions would be determined for each.

original: tathā sati hi kramabhedaṃ na yāsyanti svaśākhāvidhitāḥ kiyā / parimāṇaṃca maharti nānyatvaṃ pratipayate
analyzed: tathā sati hi krama bhedam na yāsyanti sva śākhā vidhi tāḥ kiyā parimāṇam ca maharti na anya tvam pratipayate
translated: For if that were so, those enjoined in their own branch would not have a difference in sequence. And the measure does not indicate a difference.

original: tenaiva gatatvādavācamiti cet ma sūtrakārasyācaiva prathamābhidhānāt🔽dvitopādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /🔽tasmāttadeveti matena karma bhinnaṃ kathaṃ cit pratibhākhamiṣṭam /🔽na kāraṇaṃ saptamamasti cānyadato yathoktaiva tu bhedasiddhiḥ /
analyzed: tena eva gata tvāt avācam iti ced sūtrakārasya a ca eva prathama abhidhānāt  dvitā upādhyāyasya caturthaḥ  tasmāt tat evā iti matena karma bhinnam katham cit  na kāraṇam saptamam asti ca anyat atas yathā uktā eva tu bheda siddhiḥ
translated: If it is argued that it is useless because it is already covered by that, it is not so, because the author of the sutras has mentioned it first.

original: iti mahakumārilakṛtau tantraṭīkāryā dvitīyādhyāyasya turīyacaraṇaḥ samāptaḥ samāptava dvitīyādhyāyaḥ /
analyzed: iti maha kumārila kṛtau tantra ṭīkāryāḥ dvitīya adhyāyasya turīya caraṇaḥ samāptaḥ samāptava dvitīya adhyāyaḥ
translated: The fourth section of the second chapter of the commentary on the Tantra composed by the great Kumaril is complete. The second chapter is complete.

analyzed: śubham
translated: Auspicious.

analyzed: atha atas śeṣa lakṣaṇam
translated: Now, therefore, the definition of the remainder.

analyzed: param śiṣṭam yāvat kaṃcana caṇam
translated: The most important thing left is the remainder of the verse.

analyzed: tat sarvam vaktum ārabdham atha atas śeṣantaḥ ṛṇam
translated: All that is begun to be stated, then the remainder is debt.

analyzed: yat tu śeṣaḥ para artha tvāt iti anantara caṇam
translated: But what remains is for the sake of another, the next verse.

analyzed: tatva
translated: That is indeed the sphere of the cow and so on.

analyzed: samā mayaḥ ḍedhā vigṛhe iyoḥ vākya arthayoḥ pradarśanīyaḥ
translated: The similarity should be shown between the two meanings of the two sentences.

original: sarveṣāṃ di jahaṇāntarārthānāṃ prayojyāprayojya prayojakāprayojakaṣadvidhāmaniyamaphalavakarmaviṣayaka saṃdhikārarūpāppāṃ tāvadaṅgātmaka śeṣa viśeṣa prakāratvākaṇāntaragocarāṇāmapi śeṣana cappāntargatatvāvadhāraṇa sthitiḥ
analyzed: sarveṣām sthitiḥ
translated: The determination that even those which are the subject of the different types of subsidiaries, which are of the nature of the injunctions of all the twice-born, which are of the nature of the injunctions of the necessary and unnecessary, the enjoiner and the non-enjoiner, the two kinds of injunctions, the non-injunctions, the fruit, the subsidiary acts, and the subject matter, are included within the remainder.

analyzed: prayojakāḥ prayoktāraḥ śeṣāṇām eva
translated: The enjoiners are the performers of only the subsidiaries.

analyzed: kramaḥ api śeṣaḥ eva ika prayoga vacana āśrayaḥ
translated: The sequence also is only a subsidiary, based on the statement of a single performance.

original: eka phaṇasādhanānāmarthānī chokaphavadupakāro panivadvānāṃ vaika prayogavacanacoditānā yogapaścānuṣṭhāna /
analyzed: prayoga vacana coditānām yoga paśca anuṣṭhāna
translated: The simultaneous performance of those whose means of accomplishing the single fruit are either helpful like the principal or like the subsidiaries, and which are enjoined by the statement of a single performance.

original: bhakteḥ sāmathryaināṅgabhūtaḥ krama āpadyamānaḥ śrutthaṃpaṭhana sthānamukhyapravṛttikakamākhyapramāṇaṣaṭ kavaśena vyavasthāpyate
analyzed: bhakteḥ sāmathryā enā aṅga bhūtaḥ kramaḥ āpadyamānaḥ ka vaśena vyavasthāpyate
translated: The order, which becomes a subsidiary of devotion, when it occurs, is established by the six means of valid knowledge called scripture, inference, analogy, testimony, presumption, and verbal testimony.

analyzed: vayati puruṣa karma artha tvāt iti jaiminiḥ
translated: Jaimini says that the person is for the sake of action.

analyzed: tathā nāmnā avaśeṣāṇām śeṣiṇā saptama ādibhiḥ
translated: Similarly, by the seventh and other [verses], the remaining [parts] are determined along with the principal [part], which is not mentioned by name.
The determination of the remaining [parts], along with their nature, size, etc.

original: saptamenātideśena śeṣāḥ santoti sādhite /🔽tatoṣṭame naye yasya yasasesi nirūpaṇā
analyzed: saptamena atideśena śeṣāḥ santi iti sādhite  tatas uṣṭame naye nirūpaṇā
translated: When the remaining [parts] are established by the seventh [verse], which is a transfer [of the topic],🔽Then in the eighth method, the determination of what is to be done and what is to be done is [made].

analyzed: prayoga parimāṇam ca tat tantra āvāpa lakṣaṇam
translated: And the size of the application, which is characterized by the inclusion of that [topic].

analyzed: etat eva prasaṅgena para artha aṅga upajīvanāt
translated: This very [topic] is employed incidentally, because it depends on the parts that serve the purpose of others.

original: māthaśavda ānantaryapūrva prakṛtāpeścādhikārāṇāmekaṃ sarvā gvā vivacitvā prayujyate /
analyzed: ānantarya pūrvaḥ sarvāḥ gvā
translated: The word atha is used with the desire to include all [topics], such as immediate succession, prior topic, and the beginning of a new topic.

analyzed: pūrva prakkṛtam apejya śeṣa lakṣaṇam ārabhyate
