analyzed: tatas bhedaḥ tu asti e ka saṃskṛteḥ
translated: If the action is connected even as one, then it is understood to be fruitless. But there is a difference in the refinement.

original: tasmād dravyaguṇayorniyama siddhera tya ruṇā śabda sṭye vai katva saṃvandhasya pṛthaka prayojanamiti saṃskāryaṃ tvopapattiḥ
analyzed: tasmāt dravya guṇayoḥ niyama siddheḥ vai ka tva saṃvandhasya pṛthaka prayojanam iti saṃskāryam tvā upapattiḥ
translated: Therefore, the connection of the substance and quality is established by rule. The word is not by the deity. The connection of the quality is a separate purpose. The refinement is reasonable.

original: mandayuktika evāyamabhyupagamaḥ yadguṇamevā śra tena guṇenopakartavyamiti🔽sākṣādayogya saṃbandhāḥ kriyāsaṃbandhini sthitāḥ /
analyzed: manda yuktikaḥ eva ayam abhyupagamaḥ yad guṇam tena guṇena upakartavyam iti  sākṣāt ayogya saṃbandhāḥ kriyā saṃbandhini sthitāḥ
translated: This acceptance is of little reasoning. The quality by which it is heard should be helped by that quality.🔽The qualities, being directly unfit for connection, remain connected with the action.

analyzed: asaṃbadvaiḥ asaṃvadvāḥ sādhayanti guṇāḥ kriyām
translated: Being unconnected or connected, the qualities accomplish the action.

original: na tu tadgataguṇapradhānatvayoḥ kaścidviśeṣa iti tayorupekṣā
analyzed: na tu tad gata guṇa pradhāna tvayoḥ kaścid viśeṣaḥ iti tayoḥ upekṣā
translated: But there is no difference between the quality and the principal in that. Therefore, they are ignored.

analyzed: etāvat ca saṃbandhe kāraṇam
translated: And this much is the cause in the connection.

analyzed: yā guṇasya upakurvāṇam ātmasāt kurute guṇam
translated: That which helps the quality makes the quality its own.

analyzed: grahīṣyatitarām eṣā tam tu saṃskārya vartinam
translated: But this (word 'agni') will very much grasp that which is to be consecrated.

original: yathā pradhānagataḥ ko nu khannu mama pradhānasyopakurvantyāḥ kiṃ ciḍhanugrahaṃ kuryāditi /
analyzed: yathā pradhāna gataḥ kaḥ nu khannu mama pradhānasya upakurvantyāḥ kim cit anugraham kuryāt iti
translated: Just as one might think, Who would do me, who am engaged in the principal act, some favor?

analyzed: mahāḥ ca ayam anugrahaḥ yat pradhāna iyattā avadhāraṇam nāma
translated: And this is a great favor, namely the determination of the extent of the principal act.

original: sa evātra nyāya ityaviruddhaṃ pradhānāśrayaṇāṃ guṇatvam
analyzed: saḥ eva atra nyāyaḥ iti aviruddham pradhāna āśrayaṇām guṇa tvam
translated: That alone is the rule here, so the dependence on the principal is not contradictory.

original: tatrāpi hi dravyadevatāyāgaviśiṣṭabhāvanāvidhipara vākye yadi liṅgasaṃkhyāsaṃbandhoparaḥ kriyāyāṃ dravye vā vidhīyate tato vākyaṃ bhidyeteti śakyaṃ vaditum🔽ta dikṣaitāvāneva viśeṣovaśiṣyate yad graha uddiśyamānaḥ pa śarupāḍhīyamānaḥ / na caitāvatā kiṃ citsidhyati /
analyzed: tatra api hi dravya devatā yāga viśiṣṭa bhāvanā vidhi para vākye yadi liṅga saṃkhyā saṃbandha uparaḥ kriyāyām dravye vā vidhīyate tatas vākyam bhidyeta iti śakyam vaditum  yat grahaḥ uddiśyamānaḥ na ca etāvatā kim cit sidhyati
translated: For there too, in a sentence that enjoins the bhāvanā qualified by substance, deity, and sacrifice, if the connection of gender and number is enjoined in the action or in the substance, then it can be said that the sentence is split.🔽But by this much, nothing is accomplished.

analyzed: anyathā syāt
translated: Otherwise, even by the mere difference in the connection with the sacrifice and the cup, the establishment of what is intended and what is not intended would be established.

original: api cāsminneva vākye grahamuddiśya saṃmārge vidhīyamāne pi daśāpavitrata dekatvādīnāṃ vivābhyupagamyate na ca vākyadaḥ / tathā grahaikatvepi bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: api ca asmin eva vākye graham uddiśya saṃmārge vidhīyamāne na ca vākya daḥ tathā graha ekatve api bhaviṣyati
translated: Moreover, in this very sentence, when the sprinkling is enjoined with reference to the cup, the oneness of the ten-purity-threads etc. is accepted, and not by the sentence. And so it will be even with the oneness of the cup.

original: yasta padāntaropādānāt viśeṣaṃ brūyāt tasya sarvatra yaḥ kaścidviśeṣostotina kka cid dṛṣṭāntenopamā tulyanyāyānāṃ viṣayābhāvāt
analyzed: pada antara upādānāt viśeṣam brūyāt tasya sarvatra yaḥ kaścid kka cit dṛṣṭāntena upamā tulya nyāyānām viṣaya abhāvāt
translated: One who would speak of a distinction due to the use of a different word, for him any distinction whatsoever that is stated would not be seen anywhere, due to the absence of a similar case for comparisons.

analyzed: pada antara gataḥ yasya guṇa ubhīṣṭaḥ vivaścitaḥ
translated: For one whose quality, desired and determined, is contained in a different word,

analyzed: tasya tulya pada upāttaḥ katham syāt avivakṣitaḥ
translated: how could that, stated with the same word, be unintended?

original: anyathā hi vināpi graheṇa saṃmārge kṛte tatkṛtaḥ śāstrārtho bhavet/🔽atha prāptatvād grahasyāvi dhānamacyeta tadayuktam
analyzed: anyathā hi vinā api graheṇa saṃmārge kṛte tad kṛtaḥ śāstra arthaḥ bhavet  atha prāpta tvāt grahasya avi dhānam acyeta tat ayuktam
translated: For otherwise, even without the cup, when the sprinkling is done, the purpose of the scripture would be accomplished by that.🔽If it is argued that the injunction of the cup is not stated because it is already obtained, that is not correct.

original: a thāsau yāge'prāpto vidhīyate tad grahasyāpyaviśiṣṭam
analyzed: a tha asau yāge prāptaḥ vidhīyate tat grahasya api a viśiṣṭam
translated: For if it is enjoined in the sacrifice because it is not obtained, that is no different for the cup.

original: śakyaṃ hi yo graha itivadyaḥ parityapi vaktum
analyzed: śakyam hi yaḥ grahaḥ itivat yaḥ pariti api vaktum
translated: For it is possible to say which is the cup or which is the abandonment just as it is said which is the sacrifice.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For thus:

original: tasmādviśiṣṭa saṃbhārgaviṣyāopād grahatvavade katvasyāpi vidhisaṃsparśe satyarthād guṇapradhānabhāva ityekatvaṃ niṣprayojanatvād guṇabhūtaṃ grahaśca prayojanakattvātpradhānabhūtaḥ
analyzed: vidhi saṃsparśe sati arthāt guṇa pradhāna bhāvaḥ iti ekatvam niṣprayojana tvāt guṇa bhūtam grahaḥ ca prayojana ka ttvāt pradhāna bhūtaḥ
translated: Therefore, just as the grasping is enjoined, so also the oneness is enjoined. Thus, the relation of subordinate and principal is understood from the injunction itself. The oneness being purposeless is subordinate, while the grasping being purposeful is principal.

original: saha vidhyavidhī yuktau na caikapadagocarau /🔽padabhedona ca nyāyyaḥ prakṛtipratyayau prati
analyzed: saha vidhi avidhī yuktau na ca eka pada gocarau  pada bhedaḥ ūna ca nyāyyaḥ prakṛti pratyayau prati
translated: They are connected with injunction and prohibition, but not with a single word.🔽And the difference in words is not proper with respect to the root and the suffix.

original: na ca vibhaktiḥ padāntaraṃ / svātantrye pāniyatapūrvāparatvena cāprayujyamānatvāt /
analyzed: na ca vibhaktiḥ pada antaram svātantrye ca a prayujyamāna tvāt
translated: And the case ending is not a different word, because it is not used independently with a fixed order of sequence.

analyzed: gamaka tvāt padam iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is a word because it conveys meaning, it is not so.

original: dhūmādiṣvaniprasaṅgāde kasminnapi cākhyātā ḍhipratyayenai korthaḥ pratīyataiti pratyarthaṃ padatvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: dhūma ādiṣu ani prasaṅga āt e kasmin api ca ākhyātā ḍhi pratyayena e kaḥ ṛthaḥ pratīyate eti pratyartham pada tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Because of the undesirable consequence in the case of smoke etc., and because the meaning is understood by the verbal suffix in any case, there would be the undesirable consequence of every meaning being a word.

original: padamiti ca laukikaḥ śabdaḥ sa yatra lokena prayujyate yatra ca smaṭebhiḥ smaryate na tato 'panetuṃ śakyate /
analyzed: padam iti ca laukikaḥ śabdaḥ sa yatra lokena prayujyate yatra ca smaṭebhiḥ smaryate na tatas upanetum śakyate
translated: And the word word is a common word. It cannot be taken away from where it is used by the world and where it is remembered by the Smritis.

analyzed: sup tiṅ antam padam iti ca smṛtiḥ
translated: The Smriti says that a word ends with a case ending.

analyzed: tatra eva ca pada śabdaḥ prayujyate 🔽vārtika
translated: And the word word is used only there.

original: vibhaktyu pāttakamaṃtvavivakṣā cediheṣyate /🔽saṃkhyāpi tadupāttatvānna śakyā na vivacitum🔽tadica yadi tāvatsaṃkhyāparityāgādvibhaktiḥ parityaktā tataḥ karmatvaparityāgopi prāpnoti🔽prayojanavattvāt saṃskāryatvamiti cet na / kārakavibhaktimantareṇa kriyāsaṃbandhābhāvāt /
analyzed: ced iha iṣyate  saṃkhyā api tad upātta tvāt na śakyā na vivacitum  tat i ca yadi tāvat saṃkhyā parityāgāt vibhaktiḥ parityaktā tatas karma tva parityāgā upi prāpnoti  prayojanavat tvāt saṃskārya tvam iti ced na kāraka vibhaktim antareṇa kriyā saṃbandha abhāvāt
translated: If it be held that the caseending is not meant to be significant here, then, inasmuch as the number also would be included in the said caseending, it could not be significant.🔽And if the caseending be abandoned on the ground of the number being abandoned, then the Nominative character also would have to be abandoned.

original: na hyavibhaktikasya gra ha ityetāvataḥ saṃmātyanena saṃbandhovakalpate🔽saṃmārgo yadi sarveṣāmekatvasyā vivakṣayā /
analyzed: na hi avibhaktikasya gra haḥ iti etāvataḥ saṃmā ati anena saṃbandhaḥ uvakalpate  saṃmārgaḥ yadi sarveṣām eka tvasyāḥ vivakṣayā
translated: If it be argued that the Nominative character is retained because it serves a useful purpose, we deny this because, in the absence of the caseending, there can be no connection with the verb.

original: na kasya cihnavedeṣa grahakarmāvivacayā🔽śrutaśabdābhidheyānāṃ nārthānāṃ yugapattathā /🔽grahaṇāgrahaṇaṃ yuktamakukkuṭipākavat atra pratividhīyate🔽yadā hi grahaikatvoddeśena saṃmārgo vidhīyate tadohiśyamānayoḥ parasparasaṃbandhābhāvātpratyekaṃ vākyaparisamāptilakṣaṇatṛtīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: na kasya cihna veda eṣa graha karma a vivacayā 🔽śruta śabda abhidheyānām na arthānām yugapad tathā 🔽grahaṇa agrahaṇam yuktam a kukkuṭi pāka vat atra pratividhīyate 🔽yadā hi graha ekatva uddeśena saṃmārgaḥ vidhīyate paraspara saṃbandha abhāvāt pratyekam vākya parisamāpti lakṣaṇa tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: For instance, the mere word graham, which is devoid of the caseending, cannot be construed with the verb sammāyêti.🔽If the Smārta Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti Smṛti

analyzed: stāvat ekaḥ vākya bhedaḥ
translated: First, there is only one split of the sentence.

original: upādeyanānātve punaḥ sarvaviśiṣṭabhāvanāprayojana tvāde kakāryatve tyāñjasyenaivaikavākyatvaṃ syāt
analyzed: upādeya nānātve punar sarva viśiṣṭa bhāvanā prayojana tvāt e ka kārya tve syāt
translated: But when there is multiplicity of what is to be adopted, then, because of the purpose of the bhāvanā qualified by all, there would be syntactical unity by the very fact of the non-difference of the effect.

original: uddiśyamānānāṃ punaravaśīkṛtatvātpratye kaṃ kriyāgrahaṇasāmarthyātkriyaiva vaśīkṛtā tairākṛṣyata ityekai kasvānyonyanirapekṣasya kartavyatāvagamyate/
analyzed: uddiśyamānānām punar avaśīkṛta tvāt pratye kam kriyā grahaṇa sāmarthyāt kriyā eva vaśīkṛtā taiḥ ākṛṣyate iti ekai ka sva anyonya nirapekṣasya kartavyatā avagamyate
translated: But since those that are referred to are already controlled, by the power of the verb's grasping the action, the action itself is drawn by them as controlled. Thus, the duty of each one, independent of the other, is understood.

original: tadiha graha ekatvanirapekṣaḥ saṃskartavyaḥ / ekatvamapi grahanirapekṣaṃ saṃskartavyam/
analyzed: tat iha grahaḥ ekatva nirapekṣaḥ saṃskartavyaḥ ekatvam api graha nirapekṣam saṃskartavyam
translated: Here, the grasping should be refined without regard to oneness. Oneness also should be refined without regard to grasping.

original: tatra yadi tāvad grahagatamevaikatvaṃ saṃskriyate tataḥ sāpekṣakaraṇādubhayornirapekṣasaṃbandhāvadhṛtaṃ prādhānyaṃ vihanyeta /
analyzed: tatra yadi tāvat graha gatam eva ekatvam saṃskriyate tatas sāpekṣa karaṇāt ubhayoḥ nirapekṣa saṃbandha avadhṛtam prādhānyam vihanyeta
translated: There, if oneness belonging to the grasping is refined, then, because of the dependence of the instrument, the primacy determined by the relation of both without dependence would be obstructed.

original: atha dravyāntaragataṃ / tat na jāyeta kimiti /
analyzed: atha dravya antara gatam tat na jāyeta kim iti
translated: If it belongs to a different substance, why would it not be produced?

original: na grahavatkiṃ cidekaṃ nāma prakaraṇe paśyāmaḥ
analyzed: na grahavat kim cit ekam nāma prakaraṇe paśyāmaḥ
translated: We do not see any oneness like the grasping in the context.

analyzed: na teṣām api baha tvāt kim iti nirūpaṇa aśaktaḥ
translated: Because of the multiplicity of those also, why is it not possible to determine?

original: atha sarveṣāṃ kamānna bhavati na / tatrāpi coditānyacoditakaraṇāpatteḥ
analyzed: atha sarveṣām bhavati na tatra api codita anya codita karaṇa āpatteḥ
translated: If it does not occur from all the rites, then also there would be the fault of using both enjoined and not-enjoined instruments.

original: guṇabhūtena ho kenaikatvayuktena kriyā mādhyamānā nānyamapekṣataiti yatkiṃ cidapyupādāya śāstrārthaḥ kṛtaḥ syātprādhānye punayaṃdevaikatvayuktaṃ na gṛhyeta tasyaiva vaiguṇyaṃ prasajyeta
analyzed: guṇa bhūtena ho kena ekatva yuktena kriyā na anyam apekṣate eti yat kim cit api upādāya śāstra arthaḥ kṛtaḥ syāt prādhānye punar ayam deva ekatva yuktam na gṛhyeta tasya eva vaiguṇyam prasajyeta
translated: When a quality is the principal factor, the action does not require anything else. Thus, the purpose of the scripture could be accomplished by taking up anything. But if the principal factor were to be taken up, then the oneness associated with it would not be grasped, and that itself would lead to an imperfection.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For instance,

original: sarveṣvapi saṃskriyamāṇeṣvanuṣṭhānabelāyā me kaika eva dṛśyate tasmādavirodha ityucyate
analyzed: sarveṣu api saṃskriyamāṇeṣu anuṣṭhāna belāyāḥ me kaikaḥ eva dṛśyate tasmāt avirodhaḥ iti ucyate
translated: at the time of performance, only one is seen to be consecrated among all those being consecrated. Therefore, it is said there is no contradiction.

original: nahi kaścidapi yugapadaneka grahaṃ saṃmārṭi / tataśca vivakṣitepi sādṛśameveti mandaṃ vivakṣāphalam
analyzed: nahi kaścid api yugapad aneka graham saṃmārṭi tatas ca vivakṣite api sādṛśam eva iti mandam vivakṣā phalam
translated: For no one can simultaneously consecrate many. Therefore, even if similarity is intended, the result of the intention is weak.

original: naitadasti pratyekaṃ gṛhyamāṇānāṃ tahadeva saṃskā re sati yogapadyaprasaṅgābhāvā / dabhyupetyavādamātraṃ caitatsvatantrai katvāpratīteḥ
analyzed: na etat asti pratyekam gṛhyamāṇānām tahat eva saṃskāre sati yogapadya prasaṅga abhāvāt abhyupetya vāda mātram ca etat svatantra eka tva apratīteḥ
translated: This is not so. When each is being consecrated, there is no possibility of simultaneity if it is consecrated in the same way. And this is merely an assumption based on the acceptance of the independence of each.

original: yadyapi ca dravyāntaragatatvena tadvivakṣitameva tathāpi grahasya tāvadavivaścitamiti siddhaḥ sarveṣāṃ saṃmārgaḥ
analyzed: yadi api ca dravya antara gata tvena tat vivakṣitam eva tathā api grahasya tāvat avivaścitam iti siddhaḥ sarveṣām saṃmārgaḥ
translated: Even if it is intended as belonging to another substance, still the cup is not intended. Thus, the consecration of all is established.

original: śraya tu guṇabhūtamekatvaṃ vidhoyeta tatra dvitīyā tāvad gu pābhāvaṃ naiva bravītīti vyākhyātaṃ sakkadhikaraṇe /🔽sā yadyavivajitehitārthā kārakamātralacaṇārtheti vivacchate tataḥ sa eva tāvadeko doṣa ityekatvavacca grahasyāpi guṇātvaprasaṅgaḥ
analyzed: tu guṇa bhūtam ekatvam vidhoyeta tatra dvitīyā tāvat na eva bravīti iti vyākhyātam  sā yadi a vivajita īhita arthā kāraka mātra lacaṇa arthā iti vivacchate tatas saḥ eva tāvat ekaḥ doṣaḥ iti eka tva vat ca grahasya api guṇa atva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: But if the subordinate oneness were enjoined, there the second case does not at all express the absence of a second, as explained in the section on the saktu.🔽If it is argued that it has the purpose of indicating the mere instrument when the intended meaning is not excluded, then that alone is a fault, so like oneness, the cup would also be a subordinate factor.

original: tacaitalyāt aika rūpyārthamekatvavad gra isyāpi tāvad guṇatvamevāvagamayet / tataḥ prayojana vattāvaśena grahasya prādhānyam
analyzed: tad caitalyāt aikarūpya artham eka tva vat tāvat guṇa tvam eva avagamayet tatas prayojana vat tā vaśena grahasya prādhānyam
translated: And this would make the cup a subordinate factor like oneness for the sake of having a single form, so its predominance is due to the presence of a purpose.

original: kathamādāvasanneva guṇabhāvo vivacyate /🔽kathaṃ ca saṃbhavacchabdādarthātprādhānya miṣyate
analyzed: katham ādau asanna eva guṇa bhāvaḥ  katham ca saṃbhavat śabdāt arthāt prādhānya miṣyate
translated: How can the state of being a subordinate factor be asserted at the beginning when it is not established?🔽And how is predominance desired from the word 'sam-bhava' by implication?

original: athāsya kathaṃ cidasaṃbhavaṃ kalpayitvā jakṣaṇāśrīyate tataḥ punaḥ saṃbhavakalpanā virodhātmatyapi prayojanavave śākhavaśena guṇatvaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: atha asya katham cit asaṃbhavam kalpayitvā jakṣaṇā āśrīyate tatas punar saṃbhava kalpanā śākha vaśena guṇa tva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: If, assuming some impossibility of this, the cup is accepted, then again, due to the contradiction of assuming possibility, there would be the undesirable consequence of the cup being a subordinate factor due to the presence of a purpose.

original: yugapasaṃbhavāsaṃbhavaparigra dātprādhānya guṇatvayoḥ prādhānyānocanena vilepāca śabdakteśaḥ
analyzed: yugapad saṃbhava asaṃbhava parigra dāt prādhānya guṇa tvayoḥ vilepāt ca
translated: Due to accepting simultaneity and impossibility, the predominance and subordination of the cup and the act of besmearing are indicated by the word 'pra-dhānya'.

original: na hyartho nāma kiṃ citpramāṇaṃ / kiṃ tarhi śabdaśakti kalpanā hetuḥ /
analyzed: na hi arthaḥ nāma kim citpramāṇam kim tarhi śabda śakti kalpanā hetuḥ
translated: For the object is not a means of knowledge at all. What then? It is the cause of the imagination of the power of the word.

original: ataścāneka kalpanānimitto hyastyeva vākya bhedaḥ🔽vidhīyamānamapyarthamanyato vāvadhāritam /
analyzed: atas ca aneka kalpanā nimittaḥ hi asti eva vākya bhedaḥ  vidhīyamānam api artham anyatas vā avadhāritam
translated: And therefore, the difference of sentence is indeed due to many causes of imagination.🔽Even what is enjoined, the meaning which is ascertained from elsewhere,

original: avaśyaṃ bhāvinaṃ prāpya na śabdonyatra vartate
analyzed: avaśyam bhāvinam prāpya na śabdaḥ nyatra vartate
translated: having become necessarily existent, the word does not operate elsewhere.

original: śrutyā cāvaśyaṃ bhāvini grahaprādhānyavidhāne labhyamāne ko jātu cidarthātleśena kalpayiṣyati
analyzed: śrutyā ca avaśyam bhāvini graha prādhānya vidhāne labhyamāne kaḥ jātu cit arthāt leśena kalpayiṣyati
translated: And when it is obtained by the injunction of the primacy of the cup in what is necessarily to be done by the Vedic text, who will ever imagine it by a mere part of the meaning?

analyzed: tasmāt śabda sāmarthyāt ubhayatra prādhānyam grahītavyam
translated: Therefore, by the power of the word, the primacy should be understood in both cases.

analyzed: bhāṣyam api eteṣu eva vākya bhedeṣu yojitavyam
translated: The commentary should also be applied to these very cases of difference of sentence.

original: yadya pyeṣā ṣaṣṭhī viśe ṣaṇatvād guṇabhūtamivāgniṃ pratipādayati tathāpi saṃbandhāntarābhāvādaṅgāṅgisaṃbandha eva jñāyate /
analyzed: yadi a pi eṣā ṣaṣṭhī viśe ṣaṇa tvāt guṇa bhūtam iva agnim pratipādayati tathā api saṃbandha antara abhāvāt aṅga aṅgi saṃbandhaḥ eva jñāyate
translated: Even though this genitive case expresses the fire as if it were a subordinate factor due to its being a qualifier, still, due to the absence of any other relation, the relation of primary and secondary is known.

original: tatrāpyagneḥ prayojanakattvātṛṇāpacayasya tadabhāvāt rājñaḥ puruṣa ityatra yathā rājā puruṣasya svāmyevamagnistṛṣṇāpacayasya svāmītyetadeva gamyate
analyzed: tatra api agneḥ prayojanaka tvāt ṛṇa apacayasya tad abhāvāt rājñaḥ puruṣaḥ iti atra yathā rājā puruṣasya svāmī evam agniḥ tṛṣṇā apacayasya svāmī iti etat eva gamyate
translated: Even there, since the fire is the purpose-maker and the burning of the grass is not that, just as in the case of the king's man, the king is the master of the man, so also the fire is the master of the burning of the grass, this alone is understood.

original: tṛṇānītyetadapi bahuvacanamavivakṣitamiti vyākhye yam tathā bhinne juhotītyādiṣu /
analyzed: tṛṇāni iti etat api bahuvacanam avivakṣitam iti vyākhye yam tathā bhinne juhoti ityādiṣu
translated: The plural number in the word 'tṛṇāni' is also to be explained as not significant, just as in the case of such sentences as 'bhinne juhoti' (offers the oblation when the cup is broken).

original: yadi tāvabhinnaika tvayorniyo gavikalpasamuccayādibhirnimittatvaṃ saptamyocyeta tataḥ pratyekaṃ vākyaparisamāpteḥ parasparasaṃbandhābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: yadi tau abhinna eka tvayoḥ niyaḥ ga vikalpa samuccaya ādibhiḥ nimitta tvam saptamyā ucyeta tatas pratyekam vākya parisamāpteḥ paraspara saṃbandha abhāvaḥ
translated: If the genitive ending is used to denote the causal relation between the non-different and the one, and the alternatives of option and combination, then, because each sentence is complete in itself, there is no mutual connection between them.

original: athaikatvamupādeyatvena pratipādyeta bhinnamanupādeyatvena tato yadyapi guṇatvapradhānatvavirodho nāsti tathāpi pūrvavadeva virodhaḥ /
analyzed: atha ekatvam upādeya tvena pratipādyeta bhinnam anupādeya tvena tatas yadi api guṇa tva pradhāna tva virodhaḥ na asti tathā api pūrvavat eva virodhaḥ
translated: If oneness is taught as something to be adopted, and difference as not to be adopted, then, although there is no contradiction between being a subordinate and being a primary, there is still the same contradiction as before.

analyzed: eka vākya tve na a tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: In the case of syntactical unity, the third case ending is not appropriate.

analyzed: na arūpa tvam nāma iti avivakṣā
translated: The meaning of 'not having the form' is not intended.

original: nanu bahuṣu vivaściśeṣa bahuvacanamitya vivacitopya vidyamānortho na śakyo vaktumiti manyate /
analyzed: nanu bahuṣu vidyamāna ūrthaḥ na śakyaḥ vaktum iti manyate
translated: He thinks that even if the plural number is not intended in many, the meaning that exists cannot be stated.

original: tatra vedasya nityatvādyathocaritārthānveṣaṇamātre puruṣāṇāṃ vyāpāra iti na karteva paryanuyujyate /
analyzed: tatra vedasya nitya tvāt yathā ucarita artha anveṣaṇa mātre puruṣāṇām vyāpāraḥ iti na kartā iva paryanuyujyate
translated: There, because the Veda is eternal, the function of men is merely to search for the meaning as uttered, so it is not to be questioned like an author.

analyzed: tena prātipadika artha anugraha arthā vibhaktiḥ iti draṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be seen that the case ending is for the purpose of assisting the meaning of the basic noun.

original: api ca grahaḥ prātipadikārtha iti yadānviṣyamāṇamapi kriyā saṃbandhitvaṃ na ghaṭate tadā tulyāyāmavivaśāyāṃ varaṃ dravyaviśeṣaṇameve damityabhiprāyaḥ /
analyzed: api ca grahaḥ prātipadika arthaḥ iti yadā anviṣyamāṇam api kriyā saṃbandhi tvam na ghaṭate tadā tulyāyām avivaśāyām varam dravya viśeṣaṇam idam iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: Moreover, when even after searching, the connection with action does not hold, then the intention is that it is better to take it as a qualifier of the substance, in the absence of any other choice.

original: tataśca saṃmārgastena vināpya vigupo jātisaṃkhyā caiṣā pratyekaṃ saṃmṛjyamānavyaktigatā vā samathaṃnīyā
analyzed: tatas ca saṃmārgaḥ tena vigupaḥ jāti saṃkhyā ca eṣā pratyekam saṃmṛjyamāna vyakti gatā vā
translated: And from that, the purification is not lost even without that, and this number of classes is to be brought together either in each individual being purified or in the class.

analyzed: saṃskārāt vā guṇānām avyavasthā
translated: Or, due to the embellishment, there is no restriction on the qualities.

original: ekatvavadeva grahatvasyāpi pradarśanārthatvācca sameṣvapi saṃmārga ityupanyasya pradarśanārthatve pramāṇābhāvādvākyena ca saṃbandhopādānāt gracādavacchidya śrutvā kevala saṃmārgavidhāna tpūrvapakṣaḥ parigṛhītaḥ iha tvavaghātādivadeva bhaṅgodvārā kartavyo
analyzed: eka tva vat eva graha tvasya api pradarśana artha tvāt ca sameṣu api saṃmārgaḥ iti upanyasya pradarśana artha tve pramāṇa abhāvāt vākyena ca saṃbandha upādānāt gracāt avacchidya śrutvā parigṛhītaḥ iha tu avaghāta ādi vat eva kartavya upāyaḥ
translated: Just like oneness, because the state of being a cup is also for the purpose of indication, even in similar cases, the purification is brought up. But in the case of the word 'sammārjanī', the prima facie view is accepted that it is an injunction of mere purification, because there is no evidence for the purpose of indication in the connection with the sentence, and because it is heard as delimited by the cup. But here, like pounding and so on, it should be done through the door of breaking.

original: satyaṃ nāramyeta yadi grahādhikaraṇenā vivadyā kānuṣyabuddhirnayādevaṃ tvekatva vivaśvāsaṃtrāsitaḥ sarvamevāvivakṣitaṃ manyate /
analyzed: satyam na āramyeta yadi sarvam eva avivakṣitam manyate
translated: It is true that it would not be contradicted if there were no dispute with the cup section. But the human intellect is frightened by the fear of contradiction in oneness, and thinks that everything is not intended.

analyzed: karma bhedāt bhede sati yukta avaghāta āḍhīnām vyavasthā
translated: Or, if the Agneya and other acts are different due to the difference in the unseen potency, then the arrangement of the threshing and other acts is proper.

original: jyotiṣṭoma karmāstvekatvā de kā pūrva sādhanayorgrahacamasayoīrmasaṃkara ityabhiprāyaḥ
analyzed: jyotiṣṭoma karma astu ekatvāt kā pūrva sādhanayoḥ graha camasayoḥ īrma saṃkaraḥ iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The intention is that in the Jyotiṣṭoma ritual, due to the oneness of the prior means, the grasping and drinking vessels are not mixed.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: First section of the third chapter.

analyzed: vyavasthā vā arthasya śruti saṃyogāt tasya śabda pramāṇāt
translated: The arrangement is due to the connection of the meaning with the Vedic text, because that is the authority of the word.

analyzed: yathāsthūnam tāvat uttaram
translated: For the time being, the answer is like the post.

original: yāsaṃbandhe sati saṃmārgavidhānābhāvādavaṇyaṃbhāvitvācca saṃbandhyantarasya na kevalasaṃmārgavidhānam /
analyzed: yā saṃbandhe sati saṃmārga vidhāna abhāvāt avaṇyaṃbhāvi tvāt ca saṃbandhi antarasya na kevala saṃmārga vidhānam
translated: When there is no connection, there is no injunction of the smearing, and because of the implied nature of the other connected object, there is no injunction of mere smearing.

original: atha vā grahaśabdena yadapūrvaṃ lakṣitaṃ tatprayukta vāḍyavasthā
analyzed: atha vā graha śabdena yat apūrvam lakṣitam vāḍī avasthā
translated: Or, the arrangement of the object indicated by the word graha is employed.

original: ānarthakyāttadaṅgeṣu🔽yadi matadaśāranirvājapeyasyeti vidhīyate yūpaśabdo yathā kathaṃ cittaḍhanuvādaḥ tataḥ ṣoḍaśipāce niveśaḥ /
analyzed: ānarthakyāt tad aṅgeṣu  yadi vidhīyate yūpa śabdaḥ yathā katham cit tad anuvādaḥ tatas niveśaḥ
translated: Due to the uselessness, in the subsidiaries of that.🔽If it is considered that the seventeen-poured Vajapeya is enjoined, then the word yūpa is somehow a restatement, and from that the insertion in the sixteen-poured.

original: athāpi yo vājapeyasya saṃbandhī ma saptadaśāraniriti vidhīyate tathāṣyevam /
analyzed: atha api yaḥ vājapeyasya saṃbandhī mā saptadaśa araniḥ iti vidhīyate tathā aṣi evam
translated: Or even if that which is related to the Vajapeya is enjoined as the seventeen-poured, even then it is the same.

original: atha yo yūpaḥ sa saptadaśāraniriti vacanavyattiḥ vājapeyaśabdo yathā kathaṃ cidviśeṣaṇaṃ prakaraṇa prāptānuvādo vā tatastadaṅgapaśuyūpasyedaṃ paribhāṣāmiti /
analyzed: atha yaḥ yūpaḥ sa saptadaśa araniḥ iti vacana vyattiḥ vājapeya śabdaḥ yathā katham cit viśeṣaṇam vā tatas tad aṅga paśu yūpasya idam paribhāṣām iti
translated: Now, the word 'yūpa' is a reference to the sacrificial post which is seventeen aratnis high, or the word 'vājapeya' is a qualification of some sort, or it is a restatement of what is obtained from the context. Therefore, this is a definition of the sacrificial post which is an auxiliary of that animal sacrifice.

analyzed: kim prāptam
translated: What is the conclusion?

analyzed: agatyā lakṣaṇā vṛttiḥ samabhivyāhṛteḥ bhavet
translated: The word 'yūpa' would be used as a definition only out of necessity, because of the co-occurrence of the two words.

analyzed: na ca ūrdhva pātra saṃbandhī yūpa śabdaḥ pratīyate
translated: And the word 'yūpa' is not understood to be related to the upper vessel.

original: asti tveṣāpi jitṛtīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /🔽jñāsā yadi bājapeyasya sākṣādyūpaḥ syāditi /
analyzed: asti tveṣā api ji tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda  jñāsā yadi bājapeyasya sākṣāt yūpaḥ syāt iti
translated: But there is this possibility too, if the sacrificial post were directly of the Vajapeya.

analyzed: yadā tu sa na upalabdha tā
translated: But when it is not obtained, it is remembered as a later addition.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

analyzed: sākṣāt tāvan saptadabha aratni tvam yujyate iti uktam
translated: It has been said that the quality of being seventeen aratnis high is not appropriate in the direct sense.

original: saṃbandhimātramapyanirdiṣṭaṃ vājapeyasyetyetāvanmātreṇa na jñāyeta yūpaśabdārthastvatatsaṃbandhitvāt dūrabhraṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: saṃbandhi mātram api anirdiṣṭam vājapeyasya iti etāvat mātreṇa na jñāyeta yūpa śabda arthaḥ tu a tad saṃbandhi tvāt dūra bhraṣṭaḥ
translated: Even a mere relation, if not specified, would not be known merely by the word 'of the Vajapeya'. But the meaning of the word 'yūpa', being unrelated to that, is far removed.

analyzed: tasmāt yathā uktam eva asya viśeṣaṇa tvam adhikāra prakaraṇa prāptam manu vadiṣyati
translated: Therefore, its qualification is as stated, and it will restate what is obtained from the context of the topic.

analyzed: vakṣyati hi etat ced na
translated: For it will say this: If it is argued that it is a modification of the Araḍi, no.

original: tadākye hi tadarthatvādityatra yathā prakaraṇavaśena tadupakārimātre dharmā vidhīyante na sājhāḍhaṅgeṣveva kevale dhviti /
analyzed: tad ākye hi tad artha tvāt iti atra yathā prakaraṇa vaśena tad upakāri mātre dharmāḥ vidhīyante na kevale
translated: For example, in the sentence because it is for that purpose, just as rituals are enjoined by the context as merely helpful to that, not only as mere auxiliaries to the sāmnāḍa,

analyzed: tasmāt kena cit pramāṇena virodhaḥ iti
translated: therefore there is no contradiction with any means of knowledge.

analyzed: kutas
translated: How so?

original: na tāvadabhikramaṇena domaṃ karotīti vaktaṃ śakyama to na prayājaiḥ saṃvadhyate /
analyzed: na tāvat abhikramaṇena domam karoti iti vaktam śakyam a tasmāt na prayājaiḥ saṃvadhyate
translated: It cannot be said that he makes the doer of the abhikramaṇa, therefore it is not connected with the prayājas.

analyzed: tatas ca aruṣṇa adhikaraṇa pūrva paśca vat vākya bhedaḥ syāt
translated: And then there would be a split of the sentence like in the section on aruṇa, first and last.

analyzed: nanu anena eva na anyatra api ana bhiniveśaḥ iti aruṇa a codyam eva
translated: But this very reason does not lead to attachment elsewhere, so the objection about aruṇa is itself.

analyzed: parihāra śva ākhyāte karnar guṇa bhūta tvācā homa saṃbandhāḥ
translated: And the answer is that because of being subordinate to the verb, they are connected with the homa.

original: na juhotinā gṛhītena prayājādīnāṃ karcā saṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: na juhotinā gṛhītena prayāja ādīnām karcā saṃbandhaḥ
translated: The connection of the prayājas etc. is not grasped by the word juhoti.

original: anyatra tu prakaraṇagṛcītasya pradhānabhūtasya kartuḥ saṃbandhī na virokyate /
analyzed: anyatra tu prakaraṇa gṛcītasya pradhāna bhūtasya kartuḥ saṃbandhī na virokyate
translated: But the connection of the principal agent grasped by the context is not contradicted elsewhere.

analyzed: sākāṅkṣam tu ekavākyam syāt asamāsam hi pūrveṇa
translated: But that which is incomplete would be a sentence with the preceding, for it is not compounded.

original: sarvathā tāvadabhikrāmamityetatpadaṃ na kriyāntaramantareṇa nirākāṅkṣī bhavati/
analyzed: sarvathā tāvat abhikrāmam iti etat padam na kriyāntaram antareṇa nirākāṅkṣī bhavati
translated: In any case, the word abhikramaṇam is not complete without another verb.

original: na hyetad dravyasaṃbandhaṃ kathaṃ ciḍhapi bravīti /
analyzed: na hi etat dravya saṃbandham katham cit api bravīti
translated: For it does not in any way speak of a connection with a substance.

analyzed: tasmāt prakṛta prayāja yahi joka vākya tvāt adartham vijñā yate
translated: Therefore, because of being a sentence about the Prayāja offerings related to the original context, it is understood to have the same purpose.

analyzed: śakkoti ca kartṛ pratyānatti karaṇena tat upakartum
translated: And it is able to assist that by means of the instrument that is dependent on the agent.

original: apekṣitā cāhavanīyapratyāsattiradhvaryoḥ prayājairarupaṇatvavadeva vārthād dravyasaṃbandha iti karturupasarjanatvepi na kaścid doṣaḥ /
analyzed: apekṣitā ca āhavanīya pratyāsattiḥ adhvaryoḥ prayājaiḥ a rupaṇa tva vat eva vā arthāt dravya saṃbandhaḥ iti kartuḥ upasarjana tve pi na kaścid doṣaḥ
translated: And the proximity to the Āhavanīya fire, which is required for the Adhvaryu priest, is like the non-application of the Prayājas, so the connection with the substance is by implication. Thus, even though the agent is subordinate, there is no fault.

analyzed: evam tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: And thus, the first section of the third chapter.

analyzed: pakāra rūpeṇa karmāṇi karma mādhyam bhavati iti etat api siddham
translated: It is also established that the action is the means in the form of the object.

original: yadapyasamātaṃ hi pūrveti tanna vākyāmamāpyabhiprāyeṇa kiṃ kaīsamāptaṃ hyabāntaraprakaraṇaṃ pūrveṇa prayājasvarūpaguṇavidhinevarthaḥ
analyzed: yat api a samātam hi pūrvā iti tat na pūrveṇa prayāja sva rūpa guṇa vidhinā iva arthaḥ
translated: As for what was said earlier, that is not completed, that is not by the intention of the sentence. Rather, the intermediate section is completed, just like the injunction of the nature and qualities of the Prayājas by the previous one.

analyzed: saṃdigdhe vyavāyāt vākyam eda syāt
translated: In case of doubt, there would be a division of the sentence due to the interruption.

original: middhe karmaṇāṃ karmasamavāye 'dhunāvāntaraprakaraṇamahāprakarāyoḥ katarahiniyojaka mityupavītamudāhṛtaṃ tatra sāmighenyanuvā ka vibhāgapradarśanaṃ sāmidhenīprakaraṇa sadasadbhāvavivekāryam /
analyzed: middhe karmaṇām karma samavāye dhuna avāntara prakaraṇa mahā prakara ayoḥ iti upavītam udāhṛtam tatra
translated: In sleep, when there is a combination of actions, which of the two, the minor context and the major context, is the determiner? The Upamshuyaja is cited as an example. There, the demonstration of the division by the Samidheni verses is the purpose of distinguishing the presence or absence of the Samidheni context.

analyzed: nanu darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ eva prakaraṇam iti mahā prakaragā grasta tvāt na eva avāntara prakaraṇāni āvirbhavanti
translated: But it is argued that since it is completely absorbed in the major context of the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices themselves, the minor contexts do not manifest at all.

analyzed: na etat evam  na anya prakaraṇa āpattiḥ saṃskāraḥ vā vidanti tam
translated: This is not so.🔽They do not know that it is not a part of another context, or that it is a sanctificatory rite.

original: dṛṣṭepi ca phannenaiva sāpekṣā na pravartate /
analyzed: dṛṣṭe api ca phannena eva sa apekṣā na pravartate
translated: Even when the result is seen, it does not operate by itself alone, but requires something else.

analyzed: dṛṣṭena eva tu kena api sa upāyena nivartyate
translated: But it is set aside by something else that is seen.

original: evaṃ tarhi tasya sannikarṣeṇa balīyasvāttadaṅgatvenaiva bhavitavyamiti kuto mahāprakaraviniyogāśahā/
analyzed: evam tarhi tasya sannikarṣeṇa balīya svāt tad aṅga tvena eva bhavitavyam iti kutas mahā prakara viniyoga āśa hā
translated: If that is so, then since that (result) is stronger due to its proximity, it must be a part of that (Upamshuyaja) itself. How then can there be a possibility of its being connected to the major context?

original: uccate /🔽satyametadevaṃ syādyadi tasya nivitpadavyavadhānena tṛtīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: uccate  satyam etat evam syāt yadi tasya nivid pada vyavadhānena tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: It is said:

analyzed: prakaraṇa viccheda āśaṅkā na syāta
translated: This would indeed be so if there were no doubt about the interruption of the context due to the intervention of the word 'nivit'.

original: evaṃ tarhi vicchinne tasmina jitaṃ mahāprakaraṇeneti
analyzed: evam tarhi vicchinne jitam mahā prakaraṇena iti
translated: If so, then when that is interrupted, it is won by the great context.

analyzed: abhitas sāmidhenīnām kīrtanāt prakriyā sthitā
translated: The procedure stands due to the recitation of the Samidhenis around.

analyzed: prakaraṇe pāṭhaḥ nividām atha vā aṅga tā
translated: The recitation in another context is the subsidiary nature of the Nivids.

analyzed: vicchinnā sāmighenīnām nividbhiḥ prakriyā yatas
translated: Because the procedure of the Samidhenis is interrupted by the Nivids.

original: na hi kāmyaiḥ punaḥ kalpaiḥ saṃdhātuṃ sā hi śakyate
analyzed: na hi kāmyaiḥ punar kalpaiḥ saṃdhātum sā hi śakyate
translated: For that cannot be connected again by optional Kalpas.

original: yadi punarnividoṅgaṃ bhaveyustato godohananyāyenāśrayadapi tāvatkāmyeṣu prakaraṇānuvṛttiḥ syādathāpi kā myānāmaṅgatvaṃ bhavettathāpi pūṣā dyana mantraṇavatprakaraṇāvādhaṃ niviḍhāṃ kathaṃ ciḍhanusaṃdhānenādhyavasthema
analyzed: yadi punar nividaḥ oṅgam bhaveyuḥ tatas godohana nyāyena aśrayat api tāvat kāmyeṣu prakaraṇa anuvṛttiḥ syāt atha api kā myānām aṅga tvam bhavet tathā api niviḍhām katham cit anusaṃdhānena adhyavasthema
translated: If the Nivids were to become subsidiaries, then even by the principle of the milking of a cow, there would be continuation of the context in the optional ones. Even then, if the Nivids were to become subsidiaries, then also, like the mantra recitation of Pushan etc., we would somehow maintain the Nivids by connecting them with the context, despite the obstruction of the context.

original: nanu ca yadi vicchinne prakaraṇe kāmyāḥ kalpāḥ śrayante tata ekaviṃśatyā pratiṣṭhāṃ bhāvaroṭikamāniyeta prakaraṇe nāśraye'nupanīyamāne sākāṅkṣatvādaparipūrṇatā prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu ca yadi vicchinne prakaraṇe kāmyāḥ kalpāḥ śrayante tatas ekaviṃśatyā pratiṣṭhām bhāvaroṭikam āniyeta prakaraṇe na āśrayet upanīyamāne sākāṅkṣa tvāt aparipūrṇa tā prāpnoti
translated: If the optional Kalpas are performed in an interrupted context, then one should seek stability with twenty-one in the context where it is not performed, because it would be incomplete due to having a requirement when not continued.

original: atha vākyenāśraya upanīyeta tataḥ prāpte karmaṇi saṃvandhayakaraṇādvākyaṃ bhidyeta /
analyzed: atha vākyena āśrayaḥ upanīyeta tatas prāpte karmaṇi vākyam bhidyeta
translated: Or if the basis were to be brought in by the sentence, then when the rite has been accomplished, the sentence would be split due to the connection of the instrument.

original: tatra yadi vākyamedo 'bhyupagarakheta kathaṃ cidvā pariṭriyeta tato retīvāravantīyasaubharādiśvapyevameva vākyena prakṛtāśrayadānāsiddhānta hāniḥ /
analyzed: tatra yadi vākya medaḥ katham cit vā pariṭriyeta tatas
translated: If the sentence were somehow to be accepted as incomplete, then even in the case of the Retivāra, Varavantiya, Saubhara, etc., there would be the same loss of the established conclusion due to the non-establishment of the basis brought in by the sentence.

original: thāśrayāmārthaṃ kathaṃ cidanuvarteta prakaraṇaṃ tata upavītamapi tathaiva prāpnoti sarvathā saṃkaṭametat
analyzed: katham cit anuvarteta prakaraṇam tatas upavītam api tathā eva prāpnoti sarvathā saṃkaṭam etat
translated: If the basis were somehow to continue for the sake of the basis, then even the Upavīta would be obtained in the same way. This is a difficult situation in every way.

original: guṇātkāmā na yuktotra vicchinnaprakriyāśrayāt /🔽anekārthavidhiḥ śakyo nāpūrvātkarmaṇo binā /
analyzed: guṇāt kāmāḥ na yuktā utra vicchinna prakriyā āśrayāt  aneka artha vidhiḥ śakyaḥ na apūrvāt karmaṇaḥ binā
translated: Here, the result from the quality is not proper, due to the discontinuity of the basis of the procedure.🔽The injunction of multiple meanings is possible only without a new rite.

original: naivātrai kaviṃśatyā darguṇātphalaṃ kiṃ taī tāvantīkaviṃśatyādarguṇātphalaṃ yāḍhivāya vaḍhevānenāpi viśiṣṭaṃ karma vidhīyate /
analyzed: na eva atra kaviṃśatyāḥ darguṇāt phalam kim tāvantī kaviṃśatyāḥ arguṇāt phalam vaḍhā iva anena api viśiṣṭam karma vidhīyate
translated: Here, the result is not from the quality of the twenty-one, but from the twenty-one with the quality. Even by this, a qualified rite is enjoined.

analyzed: tatas ca bhāva artha adhikaraṇa nyāyena dhātvarthāt phanam
translated: And then, by the principle of the section on the meaning of existence, the result is from the meaning of the root.

analyzed: atas ekaviṃśati āḍhi viśiṣṭega anuvacanena pratiṣṭhā ādi sādhayet
translated: Therefore, one should accomplish the establishment, etc., by the repetition qualified by the twenty-one, etc.

original: kathamityanubrūyāditi śabdamāmānyā saṃkhyā pratyāsatteśca sāmidhenyanuvacanavaditi ga myate /
analyzed: katham iti anubrūyāt iti śabda māmānyā saṃkhyā pratyāsatteḥ ca sāmidhenī anuvacana vat iti ga myate
translated: How? One should repeat the word. It is understood that the number is obtained from the proximity, like the repetition of the Sāmidhenī verses.

analyzed: tatas ca prāptiḥ
translated: And from that, the obtainment of the number and the other duties of the Ācamanīyas.

original: ya dīpi cātra karmāntaratvākarmāntaratvayoḥ phalaṃ nāsti tathāpi vākyamevamavakalpataitītyaṃ varṇitam/
analyzed: ca atra karma antara tva akarma antara tvayoḥ phalam nā asti tathā api vākyam evam varṇitam
translated: And although here there is no result of the difference or non-difference of the rites, it has been said that the sentence is possible in this way.

analyzed: na tu evam sati etāni anuvacana antarāṇi darśa pūrṇamāmābhyām a gṛhīta tvāt prathamā iva prayoktavyāni
translated: But when it is so, these other repetitions should be performed first, not taken from the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices, because they are not grasped.

analyzed: na tāvat etena asmad pakṣaḥ nivartyate
translated: First, this does not refute our position.

analyzed: sarvathā upavītasya tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: And the wearing of the sacred thread is for all purposes in every way.

analyzed: dveḥ
translated: There are two.

analyzed: na ca svatantraḥ prayogaḥ syāt
translated: And the performance would not be independent.

original: kutaḥ🔽yo hi nigaḍha prāk sāmidhenogyaḥ prayujyate sa nivitpadavaḍheva na sāmidhenyaṅgam /
analyzed: kutas  yaḥ hi nigaḍha prāk sāmidhenī gyaḥ prayujyate sa nivid pada vaḍhā iva na sāmidhenī aṅgam
translated: Why?🔽For he who is employed before the Sāmidhenī verses is not a part of the Sāmidhenī verses, just like the word Nivita.

analyzed: tad anantara tvena vā ucyamānāsu anubrūyāt iti vidhiḥ na svatantrāṇām
translated: Or the injunction to repeat, stated as being immediately after that, is not for independent [actions].

original: tadyadi pṛthak prayogaḥ syāttataḥ sāmidhenyaṅgamātragrahaṇāditareṇa nigadena vinānuvacanatvaṃ vi inyeta
analyzed: tat yadi pṛthak prayogaḥ syāt tatas sāmidhenī aṅga mātra grahaṇāt itareṇa nigadena vinā anuvacana tvam vi inyeta
translated: If the recitation were separate, then because only the Sāmidhenī auxiliaries would be taken, the recitation would be without the other recitation, as indicated by the word anu (after).

original: ekaviṃśatyādibhistāvadavaṇyaṃ sāmidhenyaḥ saṃkhyātavyāstāsvāgnisamindhanaṃ prakāśayantyaḥ sāmidhenya ityucyante
analyzed: ekaviṃśati ādibhiḥ tāvat avaṇyam sāmidhenyaḥ saṃkhyātavyāḥ tāsu agni samindhanam prakāśayantyaḥ sāmidhenyaḥ iti ucyante
translated: First, the Sāmidhenīs should be counted with the twenty-one and so on. In them, those that illuminate the kindling of the fire are called Sāmidhenīs.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: sarvāskhe vikṛtiṣu yatprākṛtāṅgamadhye na paṭhitaṃ tadaklṛpropakāratvātprākṛtairni/
analyzed: vikṛtiṣu yat prākṛta aṅga madhye na paṭhitam tat a klṛpra upakāra tvāt prākṛtaiḥ ni
translated: Whatever is not recited among the original auxiliaries in all modifications is not useful for the modification, so it is taken by the original ones.

original: kāṅkṣīkṛte prakaraṇe paścādāgaccha saṃni dhiviṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: kāṅkṣīkṛte prakaraṇe paścāt āgaccha saṃni dhi viṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: When the context is made desirous, the subsequent one becomes the object of the Saṃnidhi (proximity).

original: sa cāvirodhe viniyukta virodhe tu di devanādivatprakaraṇena bādhyate /
analyzed: sa ca avirodhe viniyukta virodhe tu devanā ādi vat prakaraṇena bādhyate
translated: And that is employed in the absence of contradiction, but in contradiction it is contradicted by the context, like the Ājyabhāga offerings.

analyzed: tasmāt kṛtsna darśapūrṇamāsa artham u pavītam iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that the girdle is for the purpose of the entire Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa.

analyzed: ānarthakyāt tad aṅgeṣu iti pavamāna haviṣṇu vijñāyante
translated: Due to the uselessness, the Pāvamānī and Haviṣ offerings are known to be for its auxiliaries.

analyzed: tathā prāpte bhidhīyate
translated: When this is the case, it is said:

analyzed: prakaraṇa agamyām pavamāna haviṣām ādhāna artha tām bādhitvā vākyena agni artha tā vijñāyate
translated: Overriding the purpose of the Ādhāna (installation of the sacred fires) of the Pāvamānī and Haviṣ offerings, which come through the context, their purpose for the fire is known through the sentence.

original: saptamī caikatra dvitīyārthaṃ ja kṣayati anyatra svārthameva vadatīti virodhaḥ /
analyzed: saptamī ca ekatra dvitīyā artham kṣayati anyatra sva artham eva vadati iti virodhaḥ
translated: And in one place the seventh case has the sense of the second, as in 'he burns', while in another it expresses its own meaning, so there is a contradiction.

analyzed: tathā ca viśvajit ādīnām aśruta phalānām aṅgatva prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And thus there would be the undesirable consequence of the Viśvajit and other sacrifices, whose fruits are not mentioned, being subsidiary.

analyzed: sarvam ca ayuktam etat
translated: And all this is improper.

original: ni vpannaścāhavanīya upadiśyate niṣphalakarmānurodhena ca bhātṛtīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: ni vpannaḥ ca āhavanīyaḥ upadiśyate niṣphala karma anurodhena ca
translated: And the Āhavanīya is taught as already accomplished, and the details are enjoined in accordance with the already accomplished ritual,

analyzed: vinīyam saṃjñā vijñāyate
translated: and the name is understood as already known.

original: tasmātkalaivaṃ varṇanīyam ḍe hote vākye tulyarūpe pavamāna haviṣprakaraṇo ekam aparamanārabhyavāde /
analyzed: tasmāt kalā evam varṇanīyam ḍe hote vākye tulya rūpe ekam aparam anārabhya vāde
translated: Therefore, it should be described thus: In a sentence where the form is the same, one is in the context of the Pavamāna oblations, the other is in the independent injunction.

original: tatra prākaraṇikena niṣpādyamānatvātmaṃskārāpekṣiṇa āhavanīyasyāphalānāṃ pavamāna haviḥprabhṛtīnāṃ saṃskāratvena vidhāna / manāramyavādena tu niṣpannasya sataḥ sarvakarmāyaddiśyādhika raṇatvena vidhānaṃ tasmādavirodha iti
analyzed: tatra prākaraṇikena āhavanīyasya aphalānām pavamāna haviḥ prabhṛtīnām saṃskāra tvena vidhānam anāramya vādena tu niṣpannasya sataḥ sarva karma ayat diśya adhikaraṇa tvena vidhānam tasmāt avirodhaḥ iti
translated: There, because it is being accomplished by what is in the context, the Āhavanīya, which requires consecration, is enjoined as the consecration of the Pavamāna oblations etc., which are without fruit. But by the independent injunction, it is enjoined as the additional consecration of what is already accomplished, for all rituals. Therefore there is no contradiction.

analyzed: kim anena aśruta apanāśana anyathā api etat upapadyate eva
translated: What is the use of this? Even without the unseen, this is possible.

analyzed: vadanti sāmidhenī vat nividā ugni samindhanam
translated: They say the Nivids are like the Sāmidhenīs, the kindling of the fire.

original: saṃyuktatvādatastāsāṃ nāṅgaṃ prakaraṇena tāḥ🔽mādhāraṇyena saṃyogaḥ saṃdigdhaḥ kālakarmabhiḥ /
analyzed: saṃyukta tvāt atas tāsām na aṅgam prakaraṇena tāḥ  mādhāraṇyena saṃyogaḥ saṃdigdhaḥ kāla karmabhiḥ
translated: Because of their connection, therefore, they are not subsidiary by context.🔽The connection is doubtful due to the uncertainty of time and action.

original: viruddhaḥ karmasaṃbandhe na kramaḥ kālasaṃgatau🔽mithaśvānarthasaṃbandhādiṣṭo nāṅgāṅgisaṃgamaḥ /🔽na hāsyanuvākyānāṃ pradhānararthasaṃgatiḥ
analyzed: viruddhaḥ karma saṃbandhe na kramaḥ kāla saṃgatau  mithaśca anartha saṃbandhāt iṣṭaḥ na aṅga aṅgisaṃgamaḥ  na ha asi anuvākyānām pradhāna ṛ artha saṃgatiḥ
translated: In the case of connection with action, sequence is contradictory; in the case of connection with time, not so.🔽The connection of subsidiary and primary is not enjoined due to the connection with something meaningless.🔽The anuvakyas do not have a connection with the primary meaning.

analyzed: na eva vidyamāna arthā
translated: These two ending with the new moon of Asvayuja do not have any existing meaning.

analyzed: tasmāt kāla arthaḥ eva ayam saṃyoga uṅga aṅgi kalpanāt
translated: Therefore, this connection is only for the sake of time, due to the assumption of subsidiary and primary.

analyzed: nyāyyaḥ pūrva pratīta tvāt kānaḥ hi duratikramaḥ
translated: It is proper, because of being known first; for what is known is difficult to overcome.

original: na tāvaṭe kavākyatvaṃ dṛśyate yogyatā samā avāntarakathaṃbhāvastadānīṃ nāvagamyate
analyzed: na tāvaṭe kavākya tvam dṛśyate yogyatā samā avāntara kathaṃbhāvaḥ tadānīm nā avagamyate
translated: First, the connection is not seen; the suitability is the same. At that time, the intermediate meaning is not understood.

original: na cottareṇāsāvaklṛpraprayojanābasthena śa kyaḥ pūrayitu / mevaṃ tasyāpyuttareṣeti yāvatpradhānaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: na ca uttareṇa asau a klṛpra prayojana apasthena śa kyaḥ pūrayitu mā evam tasya api uttareṣā iti yāvat pradhānam prāptam
translated: And that cannot be fulfilled by the subsequent one, which is not established with a purpose, saying it is the same for the subsequent one. As long as the primary is obtained.

original: yadyevaṃ tato yontarāle guṇakāmaḥ tena saha sarvamāghastya maṅgaṃ saṃbadhyeta/
analyzed: yadi evam tatas yaḥ antarāle guṇa kāmaḥ tena saha sarvam āghastya maṅgam saṃbadhyeta
translated: If so, then in the interval, one desiring a quality would connect everything with the primary.

analyzed: na eva pradhānam yāvat prāpnuyāt avāntara kathaṃbhāvasya niṣpanna tvāt iti
translated: Not until the primary is obtained, because the intermediate meaning is accomplished.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: yāvat antam ga chata iti anuṣaṅga adhikaraṇe vyākhyātam
translated: It has been explained in the Anushanga Adhikarana that after mentioning the connection with something else, it goes up to the end, based on the main topic.

analyzed: nanu evam sati sarva avāntara prakaraṇa ucchedaḥ eva prāpnoti
translated: If that is so, then the termination of all the intermediate contexts would be obtained.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: The first section of the third chapter.

analyzed: vākyānām ca samāpta tvāt
translated: And because the sentences are complete,

analyzed: itas ca ānantaryama pramāṇam
translated: And for this reason, immediate sequence is the means of knowledge.

original: yata ekavākyatālakṣaṇameṣu pratyekaṃ dṛśyate na sarveṣu /
analyzed: yatas eka vākya tā lakṣaṇam eṣu pratyekam dṛśyate na sarveṣu
translated: Because the characteristic of being one sentence is seen in each of these, not in all.

analyzed: tasmāt api nā anyonya artha tā
translated: Therefore, they cannot have a mutual meaning.

original: śakyate hi dvidevatyaḥ saṃjāyitu me kayā /
analyzed: śakyate hi dvidevatyaḥ saṃjāyitu me kayā
translated: It is possible for a sacrifice to two deities to be produced by some means.

analyzed: manotāyām iva agninā
translated: Like Agni and Soma in the Manota offering to Agni.

analyzed: tathā pātnovate pi uktā tena tvaṣṭuḥ atantra tā
translated: Similarly, it is stated in the Patnivata sacrifice, therefore Tvastra's independence.

original: tathā ḍityasya māteti mātā ḍitthaḍavityayoḥ tantravārtike /
analyzed: tathā ḍityasya mātā iti mātā tantravārtike
translated: Similarly, the mother of Ditya, the mother of Ditya and Dhavita, in the Tantravārtika.

analyzed: vyavasthā vā arthasya śruti saṃyogāt liṅgasya arthena saṃbandhāt lakṣaṇa arthā guṇa śrutiḥ
translated: The arrangement is due to the connection with the Vedic text, and due to the connection of the indicative mark with the meaning, the mention of the subsidiary is for the purpose of identification.

analyzed: yathā eva hi graha tvena camasāḥ na upalacitāḥ
translated: Just as the goblets are not indicated by the nature of being cups,

analyzed: āgneya tvam tathā na syāt dvi devatya upalakṣaṇam
translated: Similarly, the nature of being dedicated to Agni would not be an indication of the sacrifice to two deities.

analyzed: na hi vyāsaṅgi vijñānam ekena vyapadiśyate
translated: For a cognition that is connected with many is not denoted by one word.

analyzed: na agnīṣomīyaḥ āgneyaḥ aindrāgnaḥ vā tat ucyate
translated: It is not said that the animal dedicated to Agni and Soma is either dedicated to Agni or to Indra and Agni.

analyzed: āgneyaḥ iti yaḥ nirapeca agni devatyaḥ saḥ abhidhīyate
translated: What is denoted by the word 'dedicated to Agni' is that which has Agni as its deity, independently of anything else.

original: na ca dvidevatye nirapekṣognirdevatā tenāyaṃ tadvito nāgnīṣomādigatāgniśabdādutpadyataiti na tadarthasya devatātvamāha /
analyzed: na ca dvi devatye nirapekṣā ugniḥ devatā tena ayam tad vitaḥ na agnīṣoma ādi gata agni śabdāt utpadyate iti na tad arthasya devatā tvam āha
translated: And in what is dedicated to two deities, Agni is not the deity independently of anything else. Therefore, this word does not arise from the word 'Agni' occurring in 'dedicated to Agni and Soma', etc. Thus it does not indicate the deity-hood of that meaning.

original: yatra tvasau nirapekṣo devatā sa śakya āgneya iti vaktum /
analyzed: yatra tu asau nirapekṣaḥ devatā sa śakyaḥ āgneyaḥ iti vaktum
translated: But where that (Agni) is the deity independently of anything else, it can be said to be 'dedicated to Agni'.

original: yattu prāśitravaḍhiti tatrocyate /🔽deśaviśeṣajrakṣaṇārthāsminnāgneya guṇa śrutiḥ sāmānyavākyena sarvatra prāśināvadāne prāpte mastakavitṛtīyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yat tu prāśitra vat iti tatra ucyate  deśa viśeṣa jrakṣaṇa arthā asmin āgneya guṇa śrutiḥ sāmānya vākyena sarvatra prāśinā avadāne prāpte mastakavitṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pāda
translated: As for what is said about the portion for the deity in the Prāśitra, there it is said:🔽The mention of the quality 'dedicated to Agni' is for the purpose of enjoining a particular place, when the general statement has made the offering of the Prāśitra everywhere possible.

original: roga viśeṣa vidhānārthame tadvacana miti vaiṣamyam
analyzed: roga viśeṣa vidhāna artham e tadvacanam iti vaiṣamyam
translated: The statement of that (quality) is for the purpose of enjoining a particular deity, while the statement of the portion for the deity is for the purpose of enjoining a particular place. This is the inequality.

analyzed: uktam kātyāyanena iha dṛṣṭvā śātapathīm śrutim
translated: Kātyāyana has said here, having seen the Śāṭyāyanī Śruti:

original: taṃ caturddhā kṛtvā puroḍāśaṃ barhiṣadaṃ karotīti /
analyzed: tam caturddhā kṛtvā puroḍāśam barhiṣadam karoti iti
translated: Having divided that (cake) into four parts, he places it on the sacrificial grass.

analyzed: ayā ucyate
translated: This is said:

analyzed: avaśyam eva sāmānyam viśeṣam prati gacchati
translated: The general (rule) must apply to the particular.

original: gatamātraṃ ca tattena viśeṣe sthāpate dhruvam
analyzed: gata mātram ca tat tena viśeṣe sthāpate dhruvam
translated: And as soon as that is gone, it is certainly established in a particular.

original: iti śrībhaṭṭakumārilakhāmiviracite tantravārtika tṛtīyasyādhyāyasya prathamaḥ pādaḥ samāptaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī bhaṭṭa kumārila khāmi viracite tantra vārtika tṛtīyasya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ pādaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first chapter of the third chapter composed by Bhatta Kumarila in the Tantravartika.

analyzed: artha abhivāna saṃyogāt mantreṣu śeṣa bhāvaḥ syāt tasmāt utpatti saṃbandhaḥ rthena nitya saṃyogāt
translated: The subsidiary nature in mantras would be due to their connection with the expression of meaning, therefore the relation of origination is with the meaning due to the eternal connection.

analyzed: idānīm liṅga viniyogaḥ stūyate
translated: Now the application based on indication is praised.

analyzed: ciṅgam nāma sāmarthyam
translated: Indication is the ability of mantras to convey meaning.

original: tacca mukhye gauṇe ca kena citprakāreṇa vi dyate /
analyzed: tat ca mukhye gauṇe ca kena cit prakāreṇa
translated: And that is found in some way in the primary and secondary meanings.

original: tatra viniyogaḥ kiṃ mukhyaevārthe bhavatta gauṇapati saṃdehe naiva gauṇo nāma kaścidastīti mandāna āha ka punarmukhyaḥ ko vā gauṇa iti /
analyzed: tatra viniyogaḥ kim mukhyaḥ eva arthe saṃdehe na eva gauṇaḥ nāma kaścid asti iti āha ka punar mukhyaḥ kaḥ vā gauṇaḥ iti
translated: There, is the application only in the primary meaning or in the secondary meaning? In doubt, some say there is no such thing as a secondary meaning at all.

original: tatmidvisūtre tu siddhe gauṇe tannimittabhedaḥ svārthāparityāgavṛttitvaṃ ca vyākhyātamityayamarthādvicāraḥ pūrvaṃ pratyetavyaḥ /
analyzed: tu siddhe gauṇe tad nimitta bhedaḥ svārtha aparityāga vṛtti tvam ca vyākhyātam iti ayam arthāt vicāraḥ pūrvam pratyetavyaḥ
translated: But when the secondary meaning is established in the two sutras, the difference based on that and the nature of functioning without abandoning one's own meaning are explained. Thus this consideration is to be understood from the meaning first.

analyzed: tatra ca
translated: And there,

analyzed: śākhā ādibhyaḥ yaḥ iti evam iva arthe mukhyaḥ iti ayam
translated: from the parts etc., what is like this is primary. This is the meaning.

analyzed: śabdaḥ śabda abhidheya tvāt sarveṣu eva prasajyate

analyzed: kaḥ ca atra viśeṣaḥ

original: sati yājyātve tad mairbhavitavyam /🔽āsīno yajatyanavānaṃ yajati /
analyzed: sati yājyā tve tat maiḥ bhavitavyam  āsīnaḥ yajati an avānam yajati
translated: If it is the Yajya, then it must be so.🔽One sacrifices while sitting, one sacrifices without interruption.

analyzed: yājyāyāḥ adhi vaṣaṭkaroti

analyzed: paronuvākyām ca prathamam tyādibhiḥ

original: atha stutimātraṃ tato naiṣāṃ kaścidādartavya iti /
analyzed: atha stuti mātram tatas na eṣām kaścid ādartavyaḥ iti
translated: If it is mere praise, then none of these should be followed.

original: kiṃ prāptaṃ bhavitavyaṃ dharmeḥ yayejyate mā yājyā sūktavākena cejyate tammādasti yājyātvam /

analyzed: tatra etat yāt a khī liṅga tvāt anuci tantravārtike

analyzed: samidh ādi yājyāsu anakṣu api yājcā tva prasiddheḥ

original: athocyetāvardhaveṣu darvihomasādhaneṣu satyapi yāgakaraṇatve yājyātvaṃ na dṛṣṭamato naitaṭai kāntikaṃ kāraṇamiti /

original: yatraiva yājyāśabdaḥ prayuktaḥ saiva kevannā yājyā tena tarhi saktavāka eva yājyetyatrāpi prayogādbhavitavyaṃ dhamaiṃ / na cāsyaupacārikatvaṃ mukhyakāraṇasannidheḥ pratyakṣatvāt /
analyzed: yatra eva yājyā śabdaḥ prayuktaḥ sā eva kevannā yājyā tena tarhi saktavākaḥ eva yājyā iti atra api prayogāt bhavitavyam dhamaim na ca asya aupacārika tvam mukhya kāraṇa sannidheḥ pratyakṣa tvāt

analyzed: caitreṇa yena ijyate tat vastu yājyā iti

analyzed: tathā sati sūktavākre api prasaṅgaḥ

analyzed: yājyā tvam ca tyajyamāna haviḥ devatā uddeśa artha vihita mantra tvena avadhāritam
translated: And the yājyā-ness is ascertained as the mantra enjoined for the purpose of dedicating the oblation to the deity.

analyzed: na ca sūktavākaḥ tyajyamāna prastara devatā uddeśa artham utpannaḥ

original: iṣṭadevatābhidhāna svarūpatvā / liṅgaṃ śrutyā bādhyataiti cet na /

analyzed: tena svatas tāvat na yājyā tvam

translated: Because of the connection with the Yājyā, it is a sacrifice. Because of the connection with the Yājyā, it is a Yājyā.

translated: That the entire [Sūktavāka] should be used in each [sacrifice].

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: tatas śva a sūktavākena eva prahṛtaḥ syāt
translated: And therefore, it would be struck only by the Sūktavāka.

analyzed: yathārtha vā śeṣa bhūta saṃskārāt
translated: Or, it is in accordance with the fact, because of the embellishment being subsidiary.

analyzed: evamādīnām apakarṣaḥ iti uktam stuta śastra adhikaraṇe pūṣa ādi anumantraṇeṣu ca uktam
translated: Thus, it has been said that there is a removal of such things as these in the section on praise and benediction, and also in the case of the anumantrana of Pushan and others.

original: yadyetāni kevalapraharaṇāṅgabhūtāni devatānta rāṇi bhaveyustata ubhayatra sakataḥ prayujyeta /
analyzed: yadi etāni kevala praharaṇa aṅga bhūtāni devatā anta rāṇi bhaveyuḥ tatas ubhayatra sakataḥ prayujyeta
translated: If these were deities belonging only to the act of striking, then it would be used in both cases equally.

original: taeva tviāpyagnyādayaḥ pratyabhijñāyantaiti na bhedaheturakhyata śveṣṭa devatāprakāśanopajīvitvādaprayojakaṃ pradaraṇaṃ sūktavākasya pradhānaprayutadevatāśrayatvātta tadadhīnaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: te eva tu iā api agni ādayaḥ pratyabhijñāyante iti na bheda hetuḥ akhyata devatā prakāśana upajīvi tvāt aprayojakam pradaraṇam sūktavākasya pradhāna prayuta devatā āśraya tvāt tad adhīnam vijñāyate
translated: But those very Agni and others are recognized, so the difference is not stated. The striking is not a reason, because it depends on the indication of the deity, since the Suktavaka is connected with the principal deity.

original: tāni ca pradhānāni yathādevataṃ prayuñjate nāviśeṣeṇa /
analyzed: tāni ca pradhānāni yathādevatam prayuñjate na aviśeṣeṇa
translated: And those principal (sacrifices) are performed according to the deity, not without distinction.

analyzed: tasmāt apakarṣaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, there is a removal.

analyzed: vidhiḥ yadi pradhānānām itikartavya tām prati
translated: If the injunction is with regard to the principal (sacrifices) as to what should be done,

original: ubhe prati tataḥ kṛtsnaḥ muktavāko bhavedayam
analyzed: ubhe prati tatas kṛtsnaḥ mukta vākaḥ bhavet ayam
translated: then this entire Suktavaka would be with regard to both.

original: tṛtīyādhyāyasya dvitīya pāda /🔽yāgasya phanna saṃvandhātpratyeka samavāyinaḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya dvitīya pāda  yāgasya phanna saṃvandhāt pratyeka samavāyinaḥ
translated: The second section of the third chapter.

analyzed: samudāyaḥ phala arthaḥ syāt iti kena avagamyate
translated: How is it understood that the collection is for the sake of the result, since each is a constituent of the sacrifice, which is connected with the result?

original: bindau ca samudāye ca toyaśabdo yatheṣyate /
analyzed: bindau ca samudāye ca toya śabdaḥ yathā iṣyate
translated: Just as the word 'water' is used optionally for the drop and the collection,

analyzed: saṃsargi dravya rūpa tvāt sūktavāka padam tathā
translated: so is the word 'sūktavāka' due to its being of the nature of a substance related to the collection.

analyzed: tena tridhā eva mantavyaḥ saktavākaḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: Therefore, the sūktavāka is to be considered as established in three ways only,

original: svādhyāye karmakāle ca prakṛtau vikṛtāvapi🔽niṣkraṣṭadevato madhye prakṛtī samudāyayoḥ /
analyzed: svādhyāye karma kāle ca prakṛtau vikṛtau api  niṣkraṣṭadevataḥ madhye prakṛtī samudāyayoḥ
translated: in the study of one's own Veda, at the time of ritual, and also in the archetype and the ectype.🔽The deity extracted in the middle of the archetype and the collection,

analyzed: sūrya ādi pada madhyaḥ ca vikṛtau avadhāryate
translated: and the word 'sūrya' etc. in the middle is determined in the ectype.

analyzed: liṅga krama samākhyānāt kāmya yuktam samāmnānam
translated: The recitation of the desired rites is based on the indication of gender, order, and designation.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda
translated: Second section of the third chapter.

original: yena krameṇaindrāgnādīni kāmyāni karmāpayāmnātāni tenaiva krameṇa tadaivatyāni kāmyasamākhyāyuktāni yājyāpurona vākyāyugannāni tāni kiṃ kramamunlaṅghya taddevatvakarmamānārthāni liṅgāivanti uta kena ciprakāreṇa tādeva kāmyāviṣṭiṣu yathākramaṃ viniyujyanta iti /
analyzed: yena krameṇa aindrāgna ādīni kāmyāni tena eva krameṇa tad daivatyāni kāmya samākhyā yuktāni tāni kim kramam unlaṅghya tad deva tva karma māna arthāni uta kena kāmyā viṣṭiṣu yathākramam viniyujyante iti
translated: In the order in which the desired rites beginning with the Indra-Agni rite are enjoined, in that same order, at that very time, the pairs of yājyā and puronuvākyā mantras with the designation of being desired rites and having those deities are mentioned. Do they, like the mantras indicated by gender, override that order and become connected with the rites having those deities, or are they somehow employed in the desired rites in the proper order?

analyzed: udāharaṇa baḍatvam hi mūca upātta viśeṣaṇa viṣaya prakalpanā artham
translated: For the purpose of assuming the object of the qualification mentioned in the sūtra, the statement of an example is made.

analyzed: tatra liṅgāt sarva artha tve prāpte bhidhīyate
translated: There, when it is obtained that it has all meanings due to the indication, it is said

analyzed: liṅgam hi devatā saṃbandham kuryāt
translated: The indication would establish the connection with the deity.

analyzed: na ca tad svarūpa prayuta tve phalam asti
translated: And there is no result in the case of its being connected with the form.

original: yajña saṃbandhitā tadanuraktadevatā saṃbandhitā vā naitāvatā vākyaprakaraṇādirahitena śakyopādātum /
analyzed: yajña saṃbandhi tā tad anurakta devatā saṃbandhi tā vā na etāvatā vākya prakaraṇa ādi rahitena śakyā upādātum
translated: The connection with the sacrifice or the connection with the deity associated with it cannot be accepted by this much which is devoid of sentence, context etc.

original: na ca jñāyate kāṃśe viniyoga iti /
analyzed: na ca jñāyate ka aṃśe viniyogaḥ iti
translated: And it is not known in which part the application is.

analyzed: tena avaśyam samākhyā tāvat āśrayaṇīyā
translated: Therefore, the designation must be resorted to.

original: tayā hi yajñasaṃbandhaḥ kārya viśeṣaśva sidhyatījyate 'nayeta yāgasaṃbandhaḥ tasyāśca iviḥpradānārthatvātkāryaviśeṣo 'pyavadhṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tayā hi yajña saṃbandhaḥ kārya viśeṣaḥ ca sidhyati ijyate nayeta yāga saṃbandhaḥ tasyāḥ ca iviḥ pradāna artha tvāt kārya viśeṣaḥ u pi avadhṛtaḥ
translated: For by that, the connection with the sacrifice and the particular rite are accomplished. It is said that the connection with the sacrifice is by this. And because it has the meaning of the gift of the deity, the particular rite is also determined.

original: tataśca kena yajñena saṃbandha iti liṅgāttaddevatyeneti vijñāyate /
analyzed: tatas ca kena yajñena saṃbandhaḥ iti liṅgāt tad devatyena iti vijñāyate
translated: And then, by which sacrifice is the connection? It is understood from the indication that it is with that which has the deity.

analyzed: nanu eva sapi iṣṭam na sidhyati eva
translated: But even this is not accomplished.

analyzed: katham na sidhyati
translated: How is it not accomplished?

original: yadā kāmyaṃ yājyākāṇḍamityetāvatyā samā khyayā kāmyeṣṭiviṣayatvaṃ niyatam /
analyzed: yadā kāmyam yājyā kāṇḍam iti etāvatyā samā khyayā kāmya iṣṭi viṣaya tvam niyatam
translated: When it is fixed that the topic of the yājyā is optional by this much designation, it is fixed that it pertains to the optional sacrifice.

analyzed: api ca
translated: Moreover,

original: yadyapi samākhyā yajñamātra saṃbandhaṃ kuryāttathāpi balīyasā krameṇa bādhyetaiva /
analyzed: yadi api samākhyā yajña mātra saṃbandham kuryāt tathā api balīyasā krameṇa bādhyeta eva
translated: Even if the name were to establish the connection with the sacrifice alone, it would still be overridden by the stronger order.

analyzed: tasmāt kāmya iṣṭi yuktam eva etat mamāmnānam iti
translated: Therefore, this mention is only in connection with the optional sacrifice.

analyzed: kimartham ubhayam mūtritam iti
translated: For what purpose is both mentioned?

original: kramānugṛhītena niṅgenaiva kāgyeṣṭiviṣayatva saṅke / ratha vā kāmyaṃ yājyākāṇḍa mityetāvataiva sarvaṃ siddhamiti manyate /
analyzed: krama anugṛhītena niṅgena eva kāmyam yājyā kāṇḍam iti etāvatā eva sarvam siddham iti manyate
translated: He thinks that by the order alone, the connection with the optional sacrifice is established, or that the section on the optional yājyā mantras is enough to establish everything.

analyzed: tau ca abhiṣīyate
translated: And that is not accepted.

original: satyamaindrāgnādiṣu liṅgakramamātreṇāpi sidhyehacāṃ yājyānuvākyātvā danyatrāviniyogā / dyāni tvāgneyādīni karmāṇyagnaye vratapataya ityevamādicoditānitatra sthānadayaṭacāmagniprakāśane sāmidhenītvaṃ yājyānuvākyātvaṃ ca /
analyzed: satyam aindrāgna ādiṣu liṅga krama mātreṇa api sidhya ihacām yājyā anuvākyā tvāt anyatra aviniyogāt yāni tu āgneya ādīni karmāṇi agnaye vratapataye iti evamādi coditāni tatra sthāna daya ṭacām agni prakāśane sāmidhenī tvam yājyā anuvākyā tvam ca
translated: It is true that in the Aindrāgna and other sacrifices, the status of yājyā and anuvākyā is established even by the mere indication and order, and is not applied elsewhere. But those rites beginning with the Āgneya, enjoined by statements like to Agni, the lord of vows, there the status of being a Sāmidhenī and yājyā-anuvākyā is determined by the proximity of the word agni.

analyzed: sāptadabhyāmnānāt ca asti sāmidhenīnām he ṛcau pratyapekṣā
translated: And because of the mention in the Sāptādhyāyī, the Sāmidhenīs have a dependence on the two Ṛc verses.

original: tatra yadi yājyāsamākhyā viniyojikā nāśrīyeta tataḥ sāmidhenīṣvapi liṅgakramāvupapadyate iti /
analyzed: tatra yadi yājyā samākhyā viniyojikā na āśrīyeta tatas sāmidhenīṣu api liṅga kramau upapadyate iti
translated: There, if the name yājyā were not to be the determiner, then the indication and order would be appropriate even in the Sāmidhenīs.

analyzed: prathama atikrame kāraṇa abhāvāt tacā eva viniyogaḥ prāpnoti
translated: In the first case, due to the absence of a reason, the application would be just that.

analyzed: samākhyayā tu tat nivartitam bhavati
translated: But it is set aside by the name.

analyzed: tena tarhi tanmātram eva astu na arthaḥ liṅga kramābhyām iti
translated: Therefore, let it be just that much, there is no purpose in the gender and sequence.

analyzed: tat ucyate
translated: That is said.

original: yadyatreṣṭiparimitā evātyantaṃ taddaivatyā śvānāyeran tata etadevaṃ syā /dicha tvanyadevatyasya svānurūpayājyānuvākyāpūritasya karmaṇaḥ krame yā āgneyya ṛcaḥ padyante tāḥ samākhyayā kevajayā viniyujyamānā yājyākārye viniyajyeran /
analyzed: yat yatra iṣṭi parimitāḥ eva atyantam tad daivatyā śvānāyeran tatas etat evam syāt icha tu anya devatyasya sva anurūpa yājyā anuvākyā pūritasya karmaṇaḥ krame yāḥ āgneyyaḥ ṛcaḥ padyante tāḥ samākhyayā kevajayā viniyujyamānāḥ yājyā kārye viniyajyeran
translated: If the Atikchandas verses were to be exclusively belonging to the Ishti, then this would be so. But for a ritual that is filled with anurupa Yagyas and Anuvakyas belonging to other deities, the Agni verses that occur in the sequence are employed by the name alone, and would be employed in the Yagya function.

original: na cāsti saṃbhavaḥ viciṅgatvādanyābhyāṃ talliṅgābhyāṃ bādhitatvāt /
analyzed: na ca asti saṃbhavaḥ viciṅga tvāt anyābhyām tad liṅgābhyām bādhita tvāt
translated: And it is not possible, because they are overridden by the other two that have that gender.

original: tenāviniyogaevaṅgakramāśrayaṇe punaḥ samākhyāyāṃ nivṛttavyāpārāyāṃ tābhyāṃ viniyoge sati sāmidhenīṣu prayogaḥ siddho bhavati /
analyzed: tena a viniyoga evaṅga krama āśrayaṇe punar samākhyāyām nivṛtta vyāpārāyām tābhyām viniyoge sati sāmidhenīṣu prayogaḥ siddhaḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, in the absence of application, when the name has ceased to function in the sequence, the application by those two is established in the Samidhenis.

analyzed: tam viṣayam darśayati
translated: He shows that object.

original: āgnivāruṇyā iṣṭeryājyāpurīnuvākye paṭhitvā saumārairaudrīṇāmiṣṭonāṃ yājyāpuronuvākyāvanāgatāsu manoṣṭacaḥ padyante /
analyzed: āgnivāruṇyāḥ iṣṭeḥ yājyā purīnuvākye paṭhitvā saumāraiḥ audrīṇām iṣṭonām yājyā puronuvākyau anāgatāsu manoṣṭacaḥ padyante
translated: The mantras of the mind-offering are recited after reciting the yājyā and puronuvākyā mantras of the Agni-Vāruṇa sacrifice, before the yājyā and puronuvākyā mantras of the Soma-Agni and other sacrifices.

analyzed: tāḥ sāmidhenoṣu dhāyyāḥ avanti iti
translated: They are considered to be dhāyyā mantras in the sāmidhenī verses.

analyzed: tathā pṛthu pājavatyau api draṣṭavye
translated: Similarly, the pṛthu-pāja and vāja-tyā mantras should be seen.

original: tatrāpi pūrvasyāḥ sāmidhenīkramamatikramya yājyāpuronuvākyottara kālapāṭhāduttareṣṭiviṣayatvaṃ vijñāyate /🔽yadi ca kramo nāśrīyeta tato liṅgasamākhyāmātreṇa prathamamaitṛtīyādhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: tatra api pūrvasyāḥ sāmidhenī kramam atikramya yājyā puronuvākyā uttara kāla pāṭhāt uttara iṣṭi viṣaya tvam vijñāyate  yadi ca kramaḥ na āśrīyeta tatas liṅga samākhyā mātreṇa
translated: There also, it is understood that they pertain to the latter sacrifice, because they are recited after the yājyā and puronuvākyā mantras, having passed over the sequence of the sāmidhenī verses of the former.

original: ndrāgnayugalaṃ dvitīyasyāmaindrāgnyāṃ viniyujyeta dvitīyaṃ ca pra thamāyāṃ / krame tu sati samākhyātaḥ pūrvataraṃ tena kratusaṃbandhakaraṇāttatsaṃniruddvameva ciṅgaṃ śrutiṃ kalpayanīti akrama viniyo gaḥ parihato bhavati /
analyzed: dvitīyasyām aindrāgnyām viniyujyeta dvitīyam ca pra thamāyām krame tu sati samākhyātaḥ pūrvataram tena kratu saṃbandha karaṇāt tat saṃniruddvam eva ciṅgam śrutim kalpayani iti a krama viniyaḥ gaḥ parihataḥ bhavati
translated: And if the sequence were not to be honored, then the pair Indra and Agni would be applied to the second sacrifice to Indra and Agni by mere indication and designation, and the second to the first. But when there is a sequence, the designation applies earlier, because it causes the connection with the sacrifice. Therefore, the indication is considered to be a direct statement. Thus the application without sequence is avoided.

analyzed: tasmāt samyak sūcitam iti
translated: Therefore, it is rightly indicated.

analyzed: adhikāre ca mantra vidhiḥ a tad ākhyeṣu śiṣṭa tvāt
translated: And the injunction of mantras in the context is in the at-named sacrifices, because of the practice.

original: jyotiṣṭome prathamamāgneyyainyādayaḥ stotraśastrādisādhanatvenāgna āyāhi vītayaityevamādayo viśeṣa rūpeṇammātā vi hitāśca punaśca sāmānyenāgneyyāgnī pramupatiṣṭhataityādiṣūpadiśyante /
analyzed: jyotiṣṭome prathamam āgneyyai nyādayaḥ stotra śastra ādi sādhanatvena agne āyāhi vītaya iti evamādayaḥ viśeṣa viśeṣa hitāḥ ca punar ca sāmānyena āgneyyā agnī pram upatiṣṭhate ityādiṣu upadiśyante
translated: In the Jyotiṣṭoma, the Agnèya, Aindravāyava, etc. are enjoined in the specific form O Agni, come with the Vaitahavya etc., as the means of stotra, śastra, etc. They are again enjoined in the general form One worships Agni with the Agnèya etc.

original: tatra saṃdehaḥ kiṃ tayatiriktā grahītavyā uta tā vā anyā vā 'tha vā tā eveti granthāttrayaḥ pakṣāḥ pratibhānti /
analyzed: tatra saṃdehaḥ kim tayā atiriktāḥ grahītavyāḥ uta tāḥ vā anyāḥ vā vā tāḥ eva iti granthāt trayaḥ pakṣāḥ pratibhānti
translated: There is doubt - should other animals be taken besides those, or those or others, or those very animals? Three alternatives appear from the text.

original: na tviāprakṛtā evetyasya pakṣasya pramāṇamasti /🔽mahatā hi prabandhenā viśeṣagrahaṇaṃ pratipādyate na kevalāprakṛtaniścayo yena hi pramāṇenāgneyośabdāviśeṣeṇāprakṛtā gṛhye rastenaiva prakṛ tā api /
analyzed: na tu iā prakṛtāḥ eva iti asya pakṣasya pramāṇam asti  mahatā hi viśeṣa grahaṇam pratipādyate na kevala aprakṛta niścayaḥ yena hi pramāṇena āgneya śabda aviśeṣeṇa aprakṛtāḥ gṛhye tena eva prakṛ tāḥ api
translated: But there is no evidence for the view that only those not already enjoined are to be taken.🔽For it is taught by a long series of arguments that only those not already specified are to be taken, not merely those not already enjoined, by which evidence those not already specified would be taken by the word Agnèya without distinction.

original: na ca kiṃ citkāraṇamasti yena prakṛtāḥ parityajyera / nna ca bhāṣyakāraṇa trayaḥ pakṣāḥ pradarśitāḥ kiṃ tarhi aviśeṣapaśca evādāvapiśabdarahitenāprakṛtaśabdena parigṛhītaḥ /
