Thus, that which is not a subordinate factor, or which is not incompatible with the former meaning, is not taken as syntactically connected with it, simply because it is not required.

original: na cāvidyamānena pūrvabādhaḥ śakyataiti pūrvabanīyastvaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: na ca a vidyamānena pūrva bādhaḥ śakyate eti pūrvabanīyaḥ tvam bhavati
translated: And that which is not there cannot set aside what has been already cognised; hence the former meaning remains unshaken.

original: nadi vidhyarthavādayoḥ samānaviṣayatvāt yāvadevārthavāde vedāḥ saṃkīrttitāḥ tāvadeva kimapyeṣāṃ vidhāyataityetadavadhatam /
analyzed: nadi vidhi arthavādayoḥ samāna viṣaya tvāt yāvat eva arthavāde vedāḥ saṃkīrttitāḥ tāvat eva kim api eṣām vidhāyate iti etat avadhatam
translated: Because the injunctive and explanatory passages have the same subject matter, it is determined that whatever is mentioned in the explanatory passage, that much is to be enjoined by them.

original: tataśca kimeṣāṃ vidheyamityetāvanmaśate na tu kasya kiṃ vidhāsyataiti /
analyzed: tatas ca kim eṣām vidheyam iti etāvat maśate na tu kasya kim vidhāsyate eti
translated: And therefore, this much is to be enjoined by them, but not this by whom.

original: tenottaramādavayavāda peścitamātraṃ gṛhyate vidheyaṃ vāpeścitaṃ na vidhiviṣaya ityuccaitvādimācaṃ saṃbadhyate na tu ṛgādayaḥ /
analyzed: tena uttaramāt avayavāt a peścita mātram gṛhyate vidheyam vā apeścitam na vidhi viṣaye iti uccais tva ādi mācam saṃbadhyate na tu ṛk ādayaḥ
translated: Therefore, only what is mentioned by the subsequent explanatory passage is taken as to be enjoined, and what is mentioned is not the object of the injunction, so the highness etc. is connected, but not the Ṛg etc.

original: tata svāvivaścitatvānnaivaiṣāṃ vidhyuddeśestitvamiti nārthavādaṃ bādhante arthavādasya eva tu vidhyuddeśaviṣayatvenāpi / vedovadhāryate /
analyzed: tata na eva eṣām vidhi uddeśa īstitvam iti na arthavādam bādhante arthavādasya eva tu vidhi uddeśa viṣaya tvena api
translated: Therefore, because of their not being mentioned, they do not have the nature of injunctions, so they do not contradict the explanatory passage. But the explanatory passage itself is determined as the object of the injunction.

analyzed: tasmāt alaṇa artha tvam ṛga ādīnām
translated: Therefore, the Ṛg etc. have the purpose of being taken.

original: vedaśva vyāpakatvāda hetunakṣaṇayuktaḥ sanna śaknotyevāvayavaṃ lakṣayitu /nṛgādayastu niyamyatvāsamudāyaṃ caścayanti yathā cānyatrārthavādānāmanuvādatvajñaḥ tantravārtike /
analyzed: hetu nakṣaṇa yuktaḥ san na śaknoti eva avayavam lakṣayitu nṛga ādayaḥ tu niyamya tva a samudāyam yathā ca anyatra arthavādānām anuvāda tva jñaḥ tantravārtike
translated: And the Veda, being all-pervading and not having a reason, is not able to indicate a part. But the Ṛg etc. indicate the collection to be regulated. And just as elsewhere the explanatory passages are known to be restatements, in the Tantra-vārttika.

original: kṣaṇāvṛttiradoṣaḥ tathācārthavādāvagataviṣaye vidhau ṛgādiśabdānāmanuvādakatvāt ṇāyāmapyadoṣa / stenaiṣā vacanavyaktiḥ yasmādevamete vedā jātāsta māṭepāmuccaisvādi karttavyamiti vaktavye tamevārthasiddhamaṅgīkṛtya ṛgādaya uccāryante anyathā hyasaṃbaddhameva syāt /
analyzed: kṣaṇa āvṛttiḥ adoṣaḥ tathā ca arthavāda avagata viṣaye vidhau ṛk ādi śabdānām anuvādaka tvāt stena eṣā vacana vyaktiḥ yasmāt evam ete vedāḥ jātāḥ uccaisva ādi karttavyam iti vaktavye tam eva artha siddham aṅgīkṛtya ṛk ādayaḥ uccāryante anyathā hi asaṃbaddham eva syāt
translated: The repetition of the Vedas is not faulty. And in an injunction where the object is known from the Arthavada, the words of the Rig Veda etc. are restatements, so there is no fault even in the injunction. Therefore, this is the expression of the statement: Since the Vedas have arisen in this way, it should be said that they should be recited loudly etc. However, accepting that very thing which is established by the meaning, the Rig Veda etc. are uttered. Otherwise, it would be meaningless.

analyzed: vidhi artha vādayā unnanā viṣaya tvāt tasmāt veda adhikāraḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the authority over the Vedas is because they are not the subject matter of injunctions and Arthavadas.

analyzed: vyatikrame yathāśruti iti ced  anubhāṣaṇam etat
translated: If it is argued that it is as heard in case of transgression,🔽this is a repetition.

analyzed: veda saṃyogān prakaraṇena bādhyeta
translated: Due to the connection with the Vedas, it would not be contradicted by the context.

analyzed: bādheta iti vā pāṭhaḥ
translated: Or the reading is it is contradicted.

analyzed: dharma upadeśāt ca na hi dravyeṇa saṃbandhaḥ
translated: And because of the teaching of dharma, there is no connection with the substance.

original: jātadharmapakṣe ṛyadhyūḍhaṃ sāma gāyavyavasāmayoraviyomādvagdharmeṇaiva sāmadharmasiṭṭevṛthā punarupadeśaḥ /
analyzed: jātadharma pakṣe ṛi adhyūḍham sāma gāya vyavasāmayoḥ aviyomāt vac dharmeṇa eva sāma dharma siṭṭe vṛthā punar upadeśaḥ
translated: In the case of the dharma of the born, the Sama is sung in the Rya and Dhyu forms. Due to the dharma of the Avya and Sama, the teaching of the Sama dharma is in vain.

original: na hi kaścitmāmādhārabhūtāmṛcamuccairuccārayan sāmānyanyathoccārayituṃ samartho / vedādhikāre tvanyadṛgvedena vidhīyate anyacca sāmavedenetyartha vadupadeśadvayam /
analyzed: na hi kaścid mām ādhāra bhūtām ṛcam uccais uccārayan sāmāni anyathā uccārayitum samarthaḥ veda adhikāre tu anyat ṛgvedena vidhīyate anyat ca sāmavedena iti artha vat upadeśa dvayam
translated: For no one, reciting the Ṛg verse which is the basis of the Sāman, is able to recite the Sāman in a different way. But in the case of the Vedas, the injunction is different in the Ṛg Veda and different in the Sāman Veda.

analyzed: bha viṣyati iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the other (Sāman) would also apply to the purpose of the heart of Prajāpati without Ṛk, it is not so.

analyzed: tasya jyotiṣṭoma an aṅga tvāt
translated: Because that (Sāman) is an auxiliary of the Jyotiṣṭoma.

analyzed: prakaraṇe hi ayam stotra sāmnām upadeśaḥ
translated: For this teaching of the Sāmans of the stotra is in the context.

analyzed: na ca teṣām anukāṇām prayoga ulpa viṣaya tvāt ca manda parihṛtam eva ānarthakyam
translated: And there is no application of those Sāmans, and the purposelessness is only slightly removed due to the limited scope.

analyzed: tasmāt api veda adhikāraḥ iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that the authority is over the Vedas.

analyzed: guṇe svarūpataḥ dharmaḥ paraḥ
translated: In the case of a quality, the dharma is in its own form, and another through the door of the primary.

analyzed: yatra syāt tatra vijñeyam guṇa dharmasya bādhanam
translated: Where that is, there should be known the annulment of the dharma of the quality.

analyzed: avaśyam karttavye nyatara dharma atikrame guṇa dharmaḥ tikramitavyaḥ
translated: When one of the two dharmas must necessarily be transgressed, the dharma of the quality should be transgressed.

analyzed: tathā hi pradhānam aviguṇam kṛtam bhavati
translated: For in this way, the primary is made faultless.

analyzed: tat ca guṇa nyāpi kāryam
translated: And that should be done even by the quality.

analyzed: saḥ upi hi tad artham eva pravartate
translated: For he also proceeds for that very purpose.

original: yadi tvātmīyadharmānurodhena pradhānaṃ viguṇaṃ kuryāttatosya yadarthaiva pravṛttistadeva dīyeta /
analyzed: yadi tu ātmīya dharma anurodhena pradhānam viguṇam kuryāt tatas asya yad arthā eva pravṛttiḥ tat eva dīyeta
translated: If, however, the Principal be made defective, in deference to the properties of the Ādhyāya.

original: tatkharūpe ma guṇe jāte yadyapyaṅgaṃ viguṇameva tathāpi tatra guṇatvasyācikorṣitatvānna kaścidvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tad kharūpe ma guṇe jāte yadi api aṅgam viguṇam eva tathā api tatra guṇa tvasya ācikorṣita tvāt na kaścid virodhaḥ
translated: Even though the Subsidiary would, in that case, be defective, yet, inasmuch as the property of being defective would not be desired in it, there would be no contradiction at all.

analyzed: tammāt ḍhādhānasya yāzarvedika tvāt tad aṅga bhūtānām sāmnām upāṃśu tvam karttavyam iti
translated: From all this it follows that, inasmuch as the Ādhāna is connected with the Yajurveda, the Sāmasongs, which are the subsidiaries of that Ādhāna, should be sung in a low voice.

original: nanu yāvanmātramādhānasya yajurvedavihitaṃ tanmātrasyaivopāṃśatvamityavagamānnaiva sāmagānasya prāpnoti pradhānamātraṃ cāṅgāntarāṇi ca yājurvedikāni tena teṣāṃ kevalamupāṃtvamiti /
analyzed: nanu yāvanmātram ādhānasya yajurveda vihitam tad mātrasya eva upāṃśu tvam iti avagamāt na eva sāma gānasya prāpnoti pradhāna mātram ca aṅga antarāṇi ca yājurvedikāni tena teṣām kevalam upāṃtvam iti
translated: But inasmuch as it is only that much of the Ādhāna as is laid down in the Yajurveda that is to be done in a low voice, it follows that the singing of the Sāmasongs is not to be done in a low voice. And further, inasmuch as the Principal and the other subsidiaries are all laid down in the Yajurveda, it is only the Principal and the other subsidiaries that are to be done in a low voice.

original: naitadevaṃ vacyati hi aṅgāni tu vidhānatvātpradhānenopadiśyeranniti /🔽tathā vidhestvekaśrutitṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīya pāda /🔽tvādaparyāya vidhānāditi /
analyzed: na etat evam vacyati hi aṅgāni tu vidhāna tvāt pradhānena upadiśyeran iti 🔽tathā vidheḥ tu ekaśruti tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīya pāda 🔽tvāt aparyāya vidhānāt iti
translated: This is not so because it has been declared that the subsidiaries are to be performed in the same manner as the Principal.🔽And again, because the Injunction is one only, and because there is no other Injunction, it follows that the Sāmasongs are to be sung in a low voice.

original: tasmātpradhānaprayogavacanaparigṛhītatvādanyatrāmṛtyajñānāmaṅgānāṃ yatraiva pradhānaṃ tatraiva vidhi / rataśca sāṅgasyaitra pradhānasya yājurvedikatvādupāṃśutvenaiva bhavitavyamiti /
analyzed: tasmāt pradhāna prayoga vacana parigṛhīta tvāt anyatra amṛtya jñānām aṅgānām yatra eva pradhānam tatra eva vidhiḥ rataḥ ca sa aṅgasya etra pradhānasya yājurvedika tvāt upāṃśu tvena eva bhavitavyam iti
translated: Therefore, since they are included in the statement of the principal application, the auxiliaries other than the known ones are enjoined only where the principal is, and since the principal with its auxiliaries belongs to the Yajur Veda, it should be done only in a low voice.

original: evaṃ tarhi svayamevāṅgānāṃ yājurvedikatvādupāṃśatvaṃ na guṇapradhānadharmavirodhadvāraṃ yacca sāmagatamupāṃśutvaṃ tadaṅgavarttitvādu cai stvena tulyaṃ / naitattatra varttamānaṃ pradhānasyeti śakyaṃ vadituṃ / nāpi tadgate bādhite pradhānadharmabādho na hi tadā pradhānamupāṃśu na kṛtaṃ syā /datha kena citprakāreṇāṅgadharmepi pradhānasyābhidhīyate tata uccaimtvamapi pradhānadharma eva svāditi punastulyabanatvam /
analyzed: evam tarhi svayam eva aṅgānām yājurvedika tvāt upāṃśa tvam na guṇa pradhāna dharma virodha dvāram yat ca sāma gatam upāṃśu tvam tat aṅga vartti tvāt u caistvena tulyam na etat tatra varttamānam pradhānasya iti śakyam vaditum na api tad gate bādhite pradhāna dharma bādhaḥ na hi tadā pradhānam upāṃśu na kṛtam syāt atha kena cit prakāreṇa aṅga dharme api pradhānasya abhidhīyate tatas uccaimtvam api pradhāna dharmaḥ eva svāt iti punar tulya bana tvam api pradh
translated: If so, then the low voice of the auxiliaries themselves belonging to the Yajur Veda is not the door for the conflict of the qualities and principal attributes. And the low voice that is in the Sama Veda is equal to the high voice because it exists in the auxiliaries. It cannot be said that this, existing there, belongs to the principal. Nor is there conflict of the principal attribute when that is contradicted, for then the principal would not have been done in a low voice. If in some way the attribute of the auxiliary is also stated for the principal, then the high voice is also only an attribute of the principal, and so there is equality again.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

original: yadi hi yajurvedaevaiṣāmutpattiḥ syāt tatsvarūpanimitta mevopāṃśutvaṃ sthā / deteṣāṃ tu sāmavedotpannānāṃ svarūpata uccaistva prasaṅge pradhāna saṃparśa nimittamupāṃśutvamiti pradhānadharmatā /
analyzed: yadi hi yajurvedaḥ eva eṣām utpattiḥ syāt tad svarūpa nimittam eva upāṃśu tvam sthā deteṣām tu sāmaveda utpannānām svarūpataḥ uccaistva prasaṅge pradhāna saṃparśa nimittam upāṃśu tvam iti pradhāna dharma tā
translated: For if their origin were only in the Yajur Veda, then the low voice would be due to their own nature alone. But for them, produced in the Sama Veda, when there is a possibility of loudness due to their own nature, the low voice is due to the contact with the principal rite, so it is a property of the principal.

original: nanu yajurvedena sāṅgaṃ kuryādityupabandhātmāṅgasyaivopāṃśutva mityavadhāraṇādastyevāṅga svarūpa saṃsparśa iti /
analyzed: nanu yajurvedena sa aṅgam kuryāt iti upabandha ātma aṅgasya eva upāṃśu tvam iti avadhāraṇāt asti eva aṅga svarūpa saṃsparśaḥ iti
translated: But since there is the connection one should perform with the Yajur Veda along with its auxiliaries, and since the low voice belongs only to the auxiliary, due to the restriction, there is indeed contact with the nature of the auxiliary.

analyzed: na  sa aṅga kathanena eva a prādhānya nirdeśāt
translated: No.🔽Because by the statement along with its auxiliaries, the non-priority of the auxiliary is indicated.

analyzed: upasarjana bhūta aṅgam hi pradhānam evam niddiśyate
translated: For an auxiliary, which is subordinate, is thus indicated as the principal.

original: tena pradhānameva yājurvedikamupāṃśutvaṃ tu taddharma eva sannaṅgānyupasarpannevaṃ kathyate/
analyzed: tena pradhānam eva yājurvedikam upāṃśu tvam tu tad dharmaḥ eva san aṅgāni upasarpan evam kathyate
translated: Therefore, the principal itself belongs to the Yajur Veda, but the low voice is only its property, and it is said to be thus when it approaches the auxiliaries.

analyzed: na tu evam eva codanā api asti
translated: But there is no such injunction at all.

original: tataḥ pradhānadharmeyamaṅgaṃ prāptotikramyeta / pradhānena hi svadharmeṅgeṣu vikṣiptaḥ sa yatraiva vādhitastatraiva pradhānaṃ viguṇaṃ na tvevamuccaistvaṃ pradhānadharma ityavadhāryate/
analyzed: tatas pradhāna dharmā iyam aṅgam prāptā utikramyeta pradhānena hi svadharma iṅgeṣu vikṣiptaḥ sa yatra eva vādhitaḥ tatra eva pradhānam viguṇam na tu evam uccaistvam pradhāna dharmaḥ iti avadhāryate
translated: Then, this subsidiary would be obtained by exceeding the principal dharma. For the principal is scattered among its own dharmas in the subsidiaries. Where it is contradicted, there the principal is defective, but the loudness is not determined to be a principal dharma in the same way.

analyzed: na hi aṅga dharmāḥ pradhānāni saṃkrāmanti
translated: For the dharmas of the subsidiaries do not transfer to the principal.

original: nanvevamapyaṅgadharmaḥ sākṣātprāpnoti pradhānadharmaḥ punaḥ paradāreṇa parokṣa tantravārtike /
analyzed: nanu evam api aṅga dharmaḥ sākṣāt prāpnoti pradhāna dharmaḥ punar para dāreṇa parokṣa tantravārtike
translated: Even so, the dharma of the subsidiary is directly obtained, while the principal dharma is indirectly obtained through another's wife.

analyzed: iti viparītam balābalam prāpnoti
translated: Thus, the strength and weakness are reversed.

original: satyaṃ sāśātprāptāṅgadharmaḥ śīprataramavagamyate prayogavacanagrahaṇottara kālaṃ tu paścātana eva pradhānadharmaḥ paurvāparye pūrvadaurbalyaṃ prakṛtivadityeva bādhate /
analyzed: satyam sa āśāt prāpta aṅga dharmaḥ śīprataram avagamyate prayoga vacana grahaṇa uttara kālam tu paścātanaḥ eva pradhāna dharmaḥ paurvāparye pūrva daurbalyam prakṛti vat iti eva bādhate
translated: True, the dharma of the subsidiary is directly obtained and understood more quickly, but the later principal dharma, after the time of grasping the statement of the performance, is indeed contradicted by the rule that the prior is weaker than the subsequent, as in the original.

analyzed: nanu yājurvedika jyotiṣṭoma ādi aṅgānām stotra śastra ādīnām api anena eva nyāyena upāṃśu tvam prāpnoti
translated: But in the same way, the loudness of the subsidiaries of the Jyotiṣṭoma etc. of the Yajur Veda, such as the stotra and śastra, would also be obtained.

analyzed: satyam prāpnoti vacanāt tu sarvatra svara antara ja ābhaḥ
translated: It is true that it would be obtained, but everywhere the difference in pitch is due to the statement.

original: kathaṃ darśapūrṇamāsayostāvaḍedadvayavihiteṣvaṅgeṣu nānāvedambare prāpte guṇāmukhyavyatikramanyāyena yājurvedikapradhā nadharma upāṃśutvaṃ prāpnoti /
analyzed: katham darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ tāvat ḍeda dvaya vihiteṣu aṅgeṣu nānā veda ambare prāpte guṇa āmukhya vyatikrama nyāyena yājurvedika pradhā na dharmaḥ upāṃśu tvam prāpnoti
translated: How is it that in the subsidiaries enjoined by the two Vedas in the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices, when the option of different Vedic recitations arises, the Upaṃśu nature, which is the principal Dharma of the Yajurveda, is obtained by the principle of disregarding the subsidiary and regarding the primary?

original: tato vācanikaḥ kharo bhavati ma ndrayājyabhāgāntaṃ paraṃ madhyamayottamayānyājādīti /
analyzed: tatas vācanikaḥ kharaḥ bhavati ma ndrayā ājyabhāga antam param madhyamayā uttamayā anyāja ādi iti
translated: Then the Vedic injunction becomes stronger, not the human injunction. The first part is recited in a low voice, the middle part in a medium voice, and the last part in a loud voice.

original: tathā vikṛtīnāmiṣṭipaśubandhādīnāmetasminneva prākṛte svaratraye prānuvati pratyakṣopadeśavaśena pradhānavedasvaraprasaktau tadgrahaṇādvā svadharmā syādityanena nyāyena prayogavacanasya codakāpekṣitvena durbalatvā codaka prāpita svaragrahaṇameveṣṭam /
analyzed: tathā vikṛtīnām iṣṭi paśubandha ādīnām etasmin eva prākṛte svara traye prānuvati pratyakṣa upadeśa vaśena pradhāna veda svara prasaktau tad grahaṇāt vā svadharmā syāt iti anena nyāyena prayoga vacanasya ca udaka apekṣi tvena durbala tvā codaka svara grahaṇam eva iṣṭam
translated: Similarly, in the modifications like Iṣṭi and Paśubandha, when the recitations of the principal Veda are connected by the direct injunction within this same original set of three recitations, the acceptance of those by the principle stated as the subsidiary would have its own Dharma is desirable, because the statement of performance is weak in requiring an injunction, and the acceptance of the recitations brought by the injunction is desirable.

original: evaṃ jyotiṣṭomāṅgānāmapi dīkṣaṇīyādīnāṃ prākṛte svare prāpte pratyacopadeśavaśena bādhyamāne codakabalīyastvena punarusthite jyotiṣṭomasya yājurvedikatvāt klṛptopakāraprākṛtadharmā grahaṇācca guṇamukhyavyatikramanyāyenaiva tadgatopāṃśutvadharmaprasaṅga sati yāvatyā vācā kāmayeta tāvatyā dīkṣaṇīyāyāmanubrūyādityete svarāḥ gumukhyavyatikrama nyāyaba /🔽dhenaiva sāṅgānāṃ prāptāḥ/🔽tathā jyotiṭomasya vācanikasavanavibhāga vihitamandra madhyamottamocāraṇāvadhāraṇāttadaṅgānāmapi sarveṣāṃ prākṛtatulyamandra madhyamottamoccāraṇānyeva pradhānadvāreṇa prāptāni /
analyzed: evam jyotiṣṭoma aṅgānām api dīkṣaṇīya ādīnām prākṛte svare prāpte pratyaca upadeśa vaśena bādhyamāne ca udaka balīyaḥ tvena jyotiṣṭomasya yājurvedika tvāt klṛpta upakāra prākṛta dharmāḥ grahaṇāt ca guṇa mukhya vyatikrama nyāyena eva tad gata upāṃśu tva dharma prasaṅga sati yāvatyā vācā kāmayeta tāvatyā dīkṣaṇīyāyām anubrūyāt iti ete svarāḥ  dhenā eva sa aṅgānām prāptāḥ  tathā jyotiṭomasya vācanika savana vibhāga vihita mandra madhyama uttama uccāraṇa avadhāraṇāt tad aṅgānām api sarveṣām prākṛta tulya mandra madhyama uttama uccāraṇāni eva pradhāna dvāreṇa prāptāni
translated: Similarly, in the case of the Dīkṣaṇīyā and other rites which are subsidiaries to the Jyotiṣṭoma, the natural accent being obtained, when it is set aside by the direct injunction, and again established by the greater authority of the injunction, because the Jyotiṣṭoma belongs to the Yajurveda, and because the natural characteristics which have already served their purpose are taken in, the characteristic of being recited in a low voice which belongs to the Jyotiṣṭoma comes in by the same principle of the reversal of the primary and the secondary.🔽And the same principle applies to the case of the Dīkṣaṇīyā and other rites which are subsidiaries to the Jyotiṣṭoma.🔽Similarly, because the Jyotiṣṭoma has the restriction of being recited in a low, medium, or high voice as laid down by the division of the Savanas by the text, therefore the recitation in a low, medium, or high voice which belongs to all its subsidiaries also comes in by the same principle of the reversal of the primary and the secondary.

original: tato yatkiṃcit prācīnamagnoṣomoyāttenopāṃśu carantītyapāṃśutve sāṅgānāṃ dīkṣaṇītṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: tatas yat kiṃcid prācīnam agniḥ uṣomaḥ uyāt tena upāṃśu caranti iti apāṃśu tve sa aṅgānām dīkṣaṇītṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Therefore, in the case of the Dīkṣaṇīyā and other rites which are subsidiaries to the Jyotiṣṭoma, the recitation in a low voice comes in by the same principle of the reversal of the primary and the secondary.

original: yādīnāṃ prāpte pradhānamācavācidīkṣaṇīyādiśabdoddeśena vi hitāḥ pradhānamātreṣvete svaraviśeṣā bhavanti /
analyzed: ya ādīnām prāpte pradhāna mātra vāci dīkṣaṇīya ādi śabda uddeśena vi hitāḥ pradhāna mātreṣu ete svara viśeṣāḥ bhavanti
translated: The special tones for the principal rites are prescribed in the Dīkṣaṇīyā and other rites mentioned by the words ending in the nominal affix.

original: yāvatyā vācā kāmayeta tāvatyā dīkṣaṇīyāyāmanubrūyānmandraṃ prāyaṇīyāyāṃ mandrataramātithyāyāmupāṃpūsarasvati tatropāṃśutvasya pūrveva sarvavyāpinopāṃśutvavidhinā prāptatvāddīṛṇīyādisvara praśaṃsārtho nityānuvāda eva /
analyzed: yāvatyā vācā kāmayeta tāvatyā dīkṣaṇīyāyām anubrūyāt mandram prāyaṇīyāyām mandrataram ātithyāyām upāṃ pū sarasvati tatra upāṃśu tvasya pūrvā iva sarva vyāpinā upāṃśu tva vidhinā prāpta tvāt dīṛṇīya ādi svara praśaṃsā arthaḥ nitya anuvādaḥ eva
translated: One should recite the Dīkṣaṇīyā with as much voice as one desires, the Prāyaṇīyā with a low tone, the Ātithyā with an even lower tone. There, since the quality of being recited in a low voice is already obtained by the earlier injunction of being recited in a low voice that applies to everything, this is only a permanent restatement for the praise of the tones of the Dīkṣaṇīyā and others.

original: śragniṣomīye tu savanavibhāgasvareṇaiva mandrayājyabhāgāntamityādiprākṛta svarapratiprasavaḥ savanavibhāgatulyaṃ vā sāṅgaṃ prayogaṃ tredhā vibhajya mandramadhyottamoccāraṇasaṃpādanaṃ kāryam /
analyzed: śragniṣomīye tu savana vibhāga svareṇa eva mandrayā ājyabhāga antam ityādi prākṛta svara pratiprasavaḥ savana vibhāga tulyam vā sa aṅgam prayogam tredhā vibhajya mandra madhya uttama uccāraṇa saṃpādanam kāryam
translated: But in the Agnīṣomīya, the special tones of the divisions of the Soma sacrifice itself, such as up to the end of the Yājyā portion with a low tone, are a prohibition of the original tones. Or, dividing the performance along with its auxiliaries into three parts, equal to the divisions of the Soma sacrifice, one should accomplish the recitation of the low, medium and high tones.

analyzed: etena anubandhya avabhṛthaḥ dayanīya udavasānīyāsu api uccāra viśeṣāḥ vyākhyātāḥ
translated: By this, the special tones in the Anubandhyā, Avabhṛtha, Daṇḍakā, Udavasānīyā are also explained.

original: mutyā kālasavanīyādīnāmapyevaṃ kharaṃ prāpte prātaḥ savanādyantargatatvādyathā savanameva kharā bhavanti /
analyzed: mutyā kāla savanīya ādīnām api evam kharam prāpte prātaḥsavana ādi antargata tvāt yathā savanam eva kharāḥ bhavanti
translated: And the tones of the Kālastoma, Savanīya and others, which are obtained in the same way, are low, because they are included in the morning Soma pressing and others, they are low according to the pressing.

original: nanu ruva naśabdānāṃ somayāgāvayavavacanatvāddī kṣaṇīyādyaṅgavattadīyakharābhāvapramaṅga iti cet na /🔽saptamīnirdeśena tatkāla prayujyamātvamātrāśrayaṇāt
analyzed: nanu kṣaṇīya ādi aṅga vat tadīya khara abhāva pramaṅgaḥ iti ced na  saptamī nirdeśena
translated: If it be said that the words 'ruva' and 'na' denote parts of the Soma sacrifice, and hence the absence of those sounds is enjoined as a subsidiary to the Dīkṣaṇīyā and other sacrifices, it is not so.

analyzed: saptamyām tu tad ādhāraḥ yāvān mantraḥ prayujyate
translated: Because by the use of the locative case, only the fact of being employed at that time is meant.

original: tasya sarvasya mandrādisvarayogoṅgamāśritaḥ🔽stotraśālā nuvākyā diśeṣasta savanasya yaḥ /
analyzed: tasya sarvasya mandra ādi svara yoga uṅgam āśritaḥ  stotraśālā anuvākyāḥ diśeṣasta savanasya yaḥ
translated: But in the locative case, the entire mantra which is employed as the basis for that is🔽dependent on the connection with the low and other tones of that.🔽The Stotra, Śālā, Anuvākyā and other subsidiaries of the Soma sacrifice

analyzed: tasya ete yuktāḥ mandra ādayaḥ kharāḥ
translated: are connected with the low and other tones, as they are not present in the six.

analyzed: yathā hi śakuniḥ vṛce puṣpa ādi api tathā iṣyate
translated: Just as a bird is considered to be in a tree even when it is in a flower,

analyzed: tatas śva ādheya dharmaḥ ūrthaḥ saḥ vidhīyate
translated: and therefore the property of being an offering is enjoined even in that case.

analyzed: nānā veda svaraḥ tasmāt stotra ādeḥ prāptaḥ āditaḥ
translated: Therefore, the tone of the different Vedas is obtained from the beginning of the Stotra and other rites,

analyzed: pradhāna aṅga tayā paścāt upāṃśu tvena bādhitaḥ
translated: and is later overridden by the quality of being whispered, as a subsidiary to the primary rite.

analyzed: etena sarve jyotiṣṭoma vikārāḥ vyākhyātāḥ
translated: By this, all the modifications of the Jyotiṣṭoma sacrifice are explained.

analyzed: punar idānīm kharasya avakāśaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: But now, where will there be an opportunity for the tone of the different Vedas?

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

original: tadgrahaṇādā svadharmā syādadhikārasāmarthyāda vyaktaḥ śeṣe itivatkalpanīyaḥ yatprākṛtasvarāṅgayuktāyāṃ vikṛtau vedāntaroyamapūrvamaṅgaṃ codyataiti /
analyzed: tad grahaṇāt ā svadharmā syāt adhikāra sāmarthyāt vyaktaḥ śeṣe iti vat kalpanīyaḥ yat prākṛta svara aṅga yuktāyām vikṛtau
translated: And because of the mention of that, its own nature would be due to the power of the context, like in the case of the injunction of the remaining. It should be assumed that in a modified ritual connected with the original Svaru, a new subsidiary is enjoined in that very Veda.

analyzed: nanu tatra api guṇa mukhya vyatikrama nyāyena pradhāna dharma bhāvaḥ eva
translated: But even there, by the principle of the conflict between the subsidiary and the primary, it is only the nature of the primary that is accepted.

original: evaṃ tarhi yā vikṛtiryaṃ sminceḍhe bhavati tasyāḥ śeṣeṣvaṅgeṣu yayāprakṛti prāpteṣu yattasminneva vedeṅgāntaramapūrvaṃ codyate sa vi ṣaya iti soṣi pradhānadvāra va javyatvāttadeva tarhi pradhānaṃ viṣaya iti na tasyāpi prakṛtāvaruddhatvānna tarhi pradhānadvāreṇāpūvasyāṅgasya prāptiriti tadeva viṣaya iti naivamapi yaḥ pradhānasya dharmastasyaiva tatrāpi bhāvāt/
analyzed: evam tarhi yā vikṛtiḥ yam smin ca īḍhe bhavati tasyāḥ śeṣeṣu aṅgeṣu yayā aprakṛti prāpteṣu yat tasmin eva veda iṅga antaram apūrvam codyate sa vi sayaḥ iti tat eva tarhi pradhānam viṣayaḥ iti na tasya api prakṛti avaruddha tvāt na tarhi pradhāna dvāreṇa apūvasya aṅgasya prāptiḥ iti tat eva viṣayaḥ iti na evam api yaḥ pradhānasya dharmaḥ tasya eva tatra api bhāvāt
translated: If so, then the subject is that in which a modification occurs, and in its remaining subsidiaries that are obtained from the original, when another subsidiary and a new ritual are enjoined in that very Veda. It is the subject because of the dependence on the primary. Then that primary itself is the subject. But that is also restricted by the original. Then the new subsidiary is not obtained through the primary. Therefore, that itself is the subject. It is not so, because even in that way, the nature of the primary is present there also.

original: api ca tredhā vibhakteṣu yajñabhāgadharme ca khare sthite yadapūrvamapi tadbhāgapāti bhavati tasya na yūpāvaṭastarapaṇabastittvamiti bhavitavyameva prākṛtena dharmeṇa /
analyzed: api ca tredhā vibhakteṣu yajña bhāga dharme ca khare sthite yat apūrvam api tad bhāga pāti bhavati tasya na yūpa avaṭa starapaṇa basti tvam iti bhavitavyam eva prākṛtena dharmeṇa
translated: Moreover, when the sacrificial portions have been divided into three parts, and the sacrificial grass and other accessories are ready, even if something new is added, it falls into one of the portions, and it does not have the nature of being placed in the hole for the sacrificial post. Therefore, it must be done with the original ritual.

analyzed: tasmāt api na asti viṣayaḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no scope for the doubt.🔽And the mention of the context would be absolutely useless.

original: prakaraṇāmnānaṃ cātyanta mevānartha kaṃ tṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /🔽syāt /
analyzed: prakaraṇa āmnānam ca atyantam eva anartha kam tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ  syāt
translated: This is the third section of the third chapter.

original: atra samādhiḥ upāṃśu yajuṣeti tāvatsarvadaviṃdo meṣvarthavahaksāmavedayorapi kāmyanaimittikeṣvaṅgeṣvarthavattā /
analyzed: atra samādhiḥ upāṃśu yajuṣā iti kāmya naimittikeṣu aṅgeṣu arthavat tā
translated: Here is the solution: As for the Upamshuyajus, it is meaningful in all Vedas, including the Samaveda. It is meaningful in the optional and occasional rites.

original: mandraṃ prātaḥmavanaityādi hi nityatvādanityaiḥ kāmyanaimittikairasaṃbadhyamānaṃ nityāṅgaviṣayameva bhavati /
analyzed: mandram hi nitya tvāt anityaiḥ kāmya naimittikaiḥ asaṃbadhyamānam nitya aṅga viṣayam eva bhavati
translated: For example, The low-pitched morning chant etc. are eternal and do not connect with the non-eternal optional and occasional rites, so they pertain only to the eternal auxiliaries.

original: tena yadṛgvedasāmavedābhyāṃ kiṃ ci kāmyaṃ naimittikaṃ vā codyate tatsarvamaccaiḥ karttavyam tathā taṃ bhinnamabhiṭaśedyate cida miśriṣa ityādi /
analyzed: tena yat ṛgveda sāmavedābhyām kim kāmyam naimittikam vā codyate tat sarvam accais karttavyam tathā tam bhinnam ityādi
translated: Therefore, whatever optional or occasional rite is enjoined by the Rigveda and Samaveda, all of that should be done with the Upamshuyajus. Thus it is said, They mix it with the Upamshuyajus etc.

analyzed: evam yājurvedikam api upāṃtvam udāharttavyam
translated: Similarly, the Upamshutva related to the Yajurveda should also be cited as an example.

original: tathā yāni sutyottara kānānyaṅgāni teṣu savanagrahaṇābhāvādyathāvedameva svara ityavabhṛthasāmādīnāmapyuccaistvasiddhiḥ anyathā hi yatheṣṭaṃ prayogaḥ syād /
analyzed: tathā yāni teṣu savana grahaṇa abhāvāt yathāvedam eva svaraḥ iti avabhṛthasāma ādīnām api uccais tva siddhiḥ anyathā hi yathā iṣṭam prayogaḥ syāt
translated: Similarly, in the subsidiaries that come after the Soma sacrifice, since there is no mention of Sāman chants, the Svaras are to be sung as in the Veda itself. Thus, the loudness of the Avabhṛtha Sāman and other Sāmans is established. Otherwise, the performance could be done as one wishes.

original: dīkṣaṇīyādiparisāmasuta prācīnamagnīṣomoyādityanenoṣāṃśutvaṃ prava rgyasāmnāṃ punaruccaiḥ pravarmyetyevamuccaimtvam /
analyzed: dīkṣaṇīya ādi parisāma suta prācīnam agnīṣoma uyāt iti anena uṣāṃśu tvam pravargya sāmnām punar uccais pravarmya iti evam uccaimtvam
translated: In the Sāmans of the Dīkṣaṇīyā and other sacrifices, the loudness is due to the statement Loudly in the east, while the loudness of the Pravargya Sāmans is due to the statement Loudly in the Pravargya.

original: ādhānamāmnāṃ tu yā jurvedika pradhāna vidhivicitatvādevopāṃśutvam /
analyzed: ādhāna māmnām tu
translated: But in the Sāmans of the Ādhāna, the quietness is due to the fact that the principal injunction of the altar is qualified.

original: ya evaṃ vidvā nvāmadevyaṃ gāyati ityādīni yajurvedavākyānyeva tasmādinadāharaṇam /
analyzed: yaḥ evam vidvāḥ nvāmadevyam gāyati ityādīni yajurveda vākyāni eva
translated: The Yajurveda statements such as One who knows thus sings the Nāmāṣṭaka are cited as examples.

analyzed: tatra ke cidāḥ
translated: Regarding them, some say:

original: svarūpotpattimātrāpekṣayā mena kriyataiti na kāraka hetvabhiprāyeṇopanyāsa iti /
analyzed: svarūpa utpatti mātra apekṣayā mena kriyate eti na kāraka hetu abhiprāyeṇa upanyāsaḥ iti
translated: The statement is made with reference to the mere origination of the form, not with the intention of stating the instrumental cause.

original: tattu na yuktamevaṃ sati yutpattiviniyogabalābala cintaiva kriyate na gupā mukhya virodhacintā /
analyzed: tat tu na yuktam evam sati cintā eva kriyate na virodha cintā
translated: That is not correct. In that case, only the strength and weakness of origination and application are considered, not the consideration of contradiction between the principal and subsidiary.

original: tatra ca viniyogādhīnatvādanuṣṭhānā taddanīyastvamityeṣa nirṇayaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tatra ca viniyoga adhīna tvāt anuṣṭhānā tad danīyaḥ tvam iti eṣa nirṇayaḥ syāt
translated: And in that, the conclusion would be that the performance depends on application, and therefore the loudness is to be determined by that.

original: tasmātmāmaveda śākhāyāmapi kasyāṃ cidastyeṣāṃ vidhirata udāharaṇamityapare /
analyzed: tasmāt mām aveda śākhāyām api kasyām cit asti eṣām vidhiḥ atas udāharaṇam iti apare
translated: Therefore, others say that even in some branch of the Veda, there is an injunction of these, and it is not an example.

original: tadā tu yajurve ḍhapunaḥ śrutermandaṃ phalaṃ syāt /
analyzed: tadā tu śruteḥ mandam phalam syāt
translated: But then, if heard again in the Yajur Veda, the result would be slow.

original: athāpi śākhāntara vidhivadāśrīyeta svaravikalpaśca pūrvapakṣe kriyeta yadi udāhiyetānudāharaṇāttu naitadupapadyate /
analyzed: atha api śākhā antara vidhi vat āśrīyeta svara vikalpaḥ ca pūrvapakṣe kriyeta yadi udāhiyeta anudāharaṇāt tu na etat upapadyate
translated: Even if it were accepted like an injunction in another branch, and the option of the tone were performed in the prima facie view, if it were cited, it would not be proper because of the lack of an example.

original: tasmādutpatti viniyogayoreva gugāmukhyatvamityevamadhikaraṇamārabhyate yatra vedāntarotpannaṃ vasta vedāntareṇa viniyajyate tatra kimutpattivedadharmaḥ kartavyaḥ utta tantrakārtika /
analyzed: tasmāt utpatti viniyogayoḥ eva gugā mukhya tvam iti evam adhikaraṇam ārabhyate yatra veda antara utpannam veda antareṇa viniyajyate tatra kim utpatti veda dharmaḥ kartavyaḥ tantra kārtika
translated: Therefore, the origination and application have the primary nature. Thus, this section is begun. Where a thing originated in another Veda is applied by another Veda, there, should the dharma of the origination Veda be done, or the dharma of the application Veda?

original: viniyogave dadharma iti utpattiparvakatvādviniyogasyotpattivedadharma iti prāpte viniyogavedadharma iti gṛhyate/
analyzed: viniyoga ve da dharmaḥ iti utpatti parvaka tvāt viniyogasya utpatti veda dharmaḥ iti prāpte viniyoga veda dharmaḥ iti gṛhyate
translated: The prima facie view is that since the application depends on the origination, the dharma of the origination Veda should be done. But it is accepted that the dharma of the application Veda should be done.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: utpattestadarthatvādvi niyujyamānasya ca svarāpekṣitvāttadānīmeva yaḥ svarovagamyate sa eva codito notpattisthastatkāle vidhānābhāvāt /
analyzed: utpatteḥ tad artha tvāt vi niyujyamānasya ca svara apekṣi tvāt tadānīm eva yaḥ svaraḥ avagamyate saḥ eva coditaḥ na utpatti sthaḥ tad kāle vidhāna abhāvāt
translated: Because the origination is for its sake, and what is being applied requires a tone. Only that tone which is understood at that time is enjoined, not the one at the time of origination, because it is not enjoined at that time.

original: athavā naivātra vyatikramaśabdena bādho virodho vābhidhīyate kiṃ tarhi vyabhicāronyatrānyatra ca vṛttistenaivaṃ cintyate yatrotpa ttiviniyogau vyatikrāntau anyatrotpattiranyatra viniyogastatra kataravedasaṃyogo bhavatviti /
analyzed: athavā na eva atra vyatikrama śabdena bādhaḥ virodhaḥ vā abhidhīyate kim tarhi vyabhicāraḥ anyatra anyatra ca vṛttiḥ tena evam cintyate yatra utpa tti viniyogau vyatikrāntau anyatra utpattiḥ anyatra viniyogaḥ tatra katara veda saṃyogaḥ bhavatu iti
translated: Or, the word 'vyatikrame' does not here denote contradiction or conflict, but rather deviation, occurring in one place and another. Therefore, it is considered thus: Where origination and application are deviated, origination in one place and application in another, which Veda connection should there be?

original: tathaivotpattisaṃyoge vikalpe vā prāpte viniyogavedasaṃyogaḥ prādhānyādityuttaram /
analyzed: tathā eva utpatti saṃyoge vikalpe vā prāpte viniyoga veda saṃyogaḥ prādhānyāt iti uttaram
translated: When the connection with the origination Veda or option is thus obtained, the answer is that the application Veda connection is primary.

original: atha vaivaṃ cintā yatrānyatra ca pradhānam anyatra cāṅgaṃ tatrāṅgasya kena vedena vyapradeśosviti /
analyzed: atha vā evam cintā yatra anyatra ca pradhānam anyatra ca aṅgam tatra aṅgasya kena vedena
translated: Or, the consideration is thus: Where the primary is in one place and the subsidiary in another, by which Veda is the subsidiary designated there?

original: tataśca tathaiva pradhānavedana vyapadeśa iti nirṇayaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca tathā eva pradhāna vedana vyapadeśaḥ iti nirṇayaḥ
translated: And from that, the conclusion is that the primary Veda itself is the designation.

original: asmiṃstu pakṣe tadgrahaṇādvā svadharmā syādityetadvādhitvā pradhānasamākhyāta eka eva prakṛta/
analyzed: asmin tu pakṣe tad grahaṇāt vā svadharmā syāt iti etat vā adhitvā pradhāna samākhyātaḥ ekaḥ eva prakṛta
translated: But in this view, by the word 'tat', the designation of the primary is alone the subject-matter, having set aside the argument that it would have its own property.

analyzed: vikatau ca karttā prāpnoti
translated: And the performer would be obtained in the option.

original: aya tu codakabalīyasvāda ṅgaveda samā khyātakarṭa grahaṇaṃ tataḥ svaropi tathaivetyayuktaṃ pradhānasvaragrahaṇam /
analyzed: tu grahaṇam tatas svara upi tathā eva iti ayuktam pradhāna svara grahaṇam
translated: But because the injunction is stronger, the performer is taken to be designated by the subsidiary Veda. Therefore, the svaru also is the same. So the inclusion of the primary svaru is improper.

original: ata utpattiviniyogāpekṣayaivaiṣa vicāra ityeṣaiva vyākhyā śobhanā /
analyzed: atas utpatti viniyoga apekṣayā eva eṣa vicāraḥ iti eṣā eva vyākhyā śobhanā
translated: Therefore, this consideration is based only on the injunction of origination. This explanation alone is beautiful.

analyzed: tathā eva ādhāna udāharaṇam samarthitam bhavati
translated: In the same way, the example of the establishment of the fire altar becomes established.

original: yadi tu guṇamukhya vyatikamoṅgapradhānadharma virodho vyākhyāyate tatoṅgaguṇavirodhe ca tādarthyādityanena mahāpaunaruktyaṃ saṃpraghāraṇīyam
analyzed: yadi tu guṇa mukhya vyatikama ūṅga pradhāna dharma virodhaḥ vyākhyāyate tatas ūṅga guṇa virodhe ca tādarthyāt iti anena mahā paunaruktyam saṃpraghāraṇīyam
translated: But if the conflict between the secondary and primary, the contradiction of the properties of the subsidiary and primary, is explained, then in the case of a conflict between the subsidiary and secondary, it should be thoroughly repeated by this (rule) because of the purpose of that.

analyzed: na śākhā antara vat yuktī vikalpa
translated: It is not proper to have an option like in a different branch.

analyzed: veda gocaraḥ
translated: It is within the scope of the Veda.

analyzed: tāḍheikaḥ guṇa arthe
translated: In that case, one is for the purpose of the secondary.

analyzed: kaścid ekaḥ vidhāyakaḥ
translated: And one is the injunctive.

analyzed: sa tu katamaḥ iti
translated: But which one is of the Jyotiṣṭoma and so on?

analyzed: guṇānām yatra bhūyas tvam itikarttavya tā ātmakam
translated: Where there is an abundance of secondary matters, it is in the form of the procedure to be followed.

analyzed: tatra tena eva niṅgena tasya kartavya tā iṣyate
translated: There, by that very subsidiary, its performance is desired.

analyzed: yadi amya gamaka tvena sva śaktaiḥ avadhāritam
translated: If it is determined by its own power as an indicator,

original: tadatvaṃ bahu vā tasya pratītau na viśiṣyate
analyzed: tat atvam bahu vā tasya pratītau na viśiṣyate
translated: then whether it is few or many, it is not distinguished in the cognition of that.

original: tathe he tikarttavyatā liṅgatvenopanyastā mā yatrāpyalpā tatrāpi karttavyatayā vinā 'nupapadyamānā śaknotyeva gamayitum
analyzed: tathā he tikarttavyatā liṅga tvena upanyastā mā yatra api alpā tatra api karttavyatayā vinā nu papadyamānā śaknoti eva gamayitum
translated: In the same way, the procedure to be followed is presented as an indicator. Even where it is few, it is not logically possible without the performance to be done. It is certainly able to indicate.

analyzed: a saṃyuktam prakaraṇāt itika rttavya tā thi tvāt
translated: As for the word ‘asamyukta’, it is not connected with the word ‘yajati’, because it is the word ‘yajati’ that is required by the context.

original: evaṃ tāvat śrutiniṅgavākyāni pradhānajñeyasaṃkīrṇaviviktavi ṣayāṇi pratyudāharaṇaṃ vyākhyātāni/
analyzed: evam tāvat śruti niṅga vākyāni pradhāna jñeya saṃkīrṇa vivikta vi ṣayāṇi pratyudāharaṇam vyākhyātāni
translated: Thus, we have explained, by means of examples, the application of the three means of knowing Dharma, Śruti, Smṛti and Practice, to the cases of the principal and the subsidiary acts, as also to the cases of the acts being related and unrelated.

original: tatra vidhiviniyogābhidhānātmikāyāḥ śruterviniyogasāmarthyātmakasya ca niṅgasya kevalapadaprayogābhāvātpadāntarasaṃnidheravaśyaṃbhāvitvādvākya mantargataprāyameveti na sākṣāgrahaṇena sūcitam /🔽athavā veḍho vā prāyadarśanādityapakramopasaṃhāravaśenaiva vedadharmatvāvadhāraṇādidameva vākyaviniyogasūtramiti na pūrvāntargatimātreṇa vākyasya viniyojakatvaṃ vyākhyeyam /
analyzed: tatra vidhi viniyoga abhidhāna ātmikāyāḥ śruteḥ viniyoga sāmarthya ātmakasya ca niṅgasya kevala pada prayoga abhāvāt pada antara saṃnidheḥ avaśyaṃbhāvi tvāt vākyam antargata prāyam eva iti na sākṣā grahaṇena sūcitam  athavā veḍhaḥ vā prāya darśanāt iti apakrama upasaṃhāra vaśena eva veda dharma tva avadhāraṇāt idam eva vākya viniyoga sūtram iti na pūrva antargati mātreṇa vākyasya viniyojaka tvam vyākhyeyam
translated: As for Śruti, which consists of the Injunction and the Vinaya, and Practice, which consists of the Vinaya and the capability of application, they are both incapable of being expressed by the use of a single word; and hence, in the case of the word ‘yajati’, the application of the word is always dependent upon the presence of another word.🔽Or, we may take the Sutra as referring to the case of the word ‘vedānta’, which is mentioned in the Bhashya, as the word ‘vedānta’ is capable of being applied to the Upaniṣads, just as the word ‘aindrī’ is to the third mantra of the Vāmadevya Rk.🔽And in the case of the word ‘vedānta’, we find that, on account of the presence of the words ‘vedānta’ and ‘brahma’, the application of the word ‘vedānta’ to the Upaniṣads is quite possible, just as that of the word ‘aindrī’ to the third mantra of the Vāmadevya Rk.

original: yattu bhāṣyakāreṇāruṇayetyaḍhāitaṃ śakyaṃ tatrāpyaindrīvattṛtīyā śrutireva viniyojita vaktatṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /🔽m /
analyzed: yat tu bhāṣyakāreṇa aruṇayā iti aḍhāitam śakyam tatra api aindrī vat tṛtīyā śrutiḥ eva viniyojita 🔽m
translated: And in the case of the word ‘vedānta’, we find that, on account of the presence of the words ‘vedānta’ and ‘brahma’, the application of the word ‘vedānta’ to the Upaniṣads is quite possible, just as that of the word ‘aindrī’ to the third mantra of the Vāmadevya Rk.

original: atha kriyāmācasaṃbandhe śrutyā kṛte viśeṣasaṃbandho vākyenetyabhiprāyaḥ sa aintryāmapi tulyaḥ /
analyzed: atha kriyā māca saṃbandhe śrutyā kṛte viśeṣa saṃbandhaḥ vākyena iti abhiprāyaḥ saḥ aintryām api tulyaḥ
translated: If the idea is that, after the connection with the action has been established by Direct Assertion, the connection with the particular deity is established by Syntactical Connection, then this is equally possible under the Indirect Assertion also.

analyzed: tatra api cainyā iti upasthātavya mātra apekṣaṇāt gāīpatyam iti ca sādhana mātra apekṣi tvā hi śeṣa saṃbandhaḥ vākyena eva
translated: If the idea is that when the connection with the action is established by Direct Assertion, the connection with the particular deity is by Syntactical Connection, then this is equally applicable to the case of the word 'Indra'.🔽In that case also, the word 'Indra' would be taken as denoting only the deity, and the word 'Gāyatrī' would be taken as denoting only the metre. Thus the connection with the particular deity would be by Syntactical Connection only.

original: tasmādubhayatrāpi tadantargatiḥ śakyā darśayitumiti ubhayoḥ śrutivākyayorubhayamuḍhāharaṇam/
analyzed: tasmāt ubhayatra api tad antargatiḥ śakyā darśayitum iti ubhayoḥ śruti vākyayoḥ ubhayam uḍhāharaṇam
translated: Therefore, in both cases, it is possible to show that they are included in the other. Hence both Direct Assertion and Syntactical Connection are cited as examples.

original: idānīṃ bacābakhacintā pratyāsannetyuttarāṇyapi trīṇi pramāṇāni svarūpeṇa viniyogasāmathryena ca darśayati /
analyzed: idānīm bacābakha cintā pratyāsannā iti uttarāṇi api trīṇi pramāṇāni sva rūpeṇa viniyoga sāmathryena ca darśayati
translated: Now, since the consideration of the Veda is imminent, he shows the remaining three means of knowledge both in their nature and in their capacity for application.

analyzed: tatra prakaraṇam viniyoga ajñāna saṃśaya viparyayāṇām anyatamena upanyasyati sma
translated: There, the context is presented by any one of the absence of knowledge, doubt, or error regarding application.

analyzed: yāvat ca anyatra kathyate na āvat ajñānam bhavati
translated: And as long as it is spoken of elsewhere, there is no absence of knowledge.

original: atha vāsadapi prasaṅgābhāvānnākhyātaṃ syāditi saṃdeho 'tha vā naivāttara śravaṇāttatmāmarthyānamaraṇakāṅgitayogyārthapadāntarasaṃnidhānebhyo 'nyaḥ śabdaprakārosti /
analyzed: atha vā asat api prasaṅga abhāvāt na ākhyātam syāt iti vā śabda prakāraḥ asti
translated: Or, even if it does not exist, it would not be stated due to the absence of relevance. This is the doubt. Or, there is no other type of word than hearing, non-hearing, doubt, or error.

analyzed: tasmāt na prakaraṇa ādīni pramāṇa antarāṇi iti prāpte abhidhīyate
translated: Therefore, it is concluded that the context and other means of knowledge are not separate. In response, it is said:

analyzed: kramaḥ ca deśa sāmānyāt
translated: And the order is due to the common location.

original: pūrvavadeva kramasamākhyayorapyajñānādibhirupanyāsaḥ karttavyaḥ🔽vināpyanuṣṭhānadeśasāmyena yāvati pradeśe brāhmaṇe pradhānaṃ padyate māvatyeva mantreṣu mantra /stayoścāṅgāṅgyapekṣāvelāyāṃ yathāsaṃkhyatṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: pūrvavat eva krama samākhyayoḥ api ajñāna ādibhiḥ upanyāsaḥ karttavyaḥ  vinā api anuṣṭhāna deśa sāmyena yāvati pradeśe brāhmaṇe pradhānam padyate māvati eva mantreṣu mantraḥ tayoḥ ca aṅga aṅgi apekṣā velāyām yathāsaṃkhya tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Just as before, the order and the name should also be mentioned by ignorance and other means.

analyzed: nyāyena samāna deśa tvāt duddau sannidhānam bhavati
translated: Even without the similarity of the place of performance, in whatever region the main ritual is performed, in the same region the mantra is recited. And at the time of the mutual requirement of the main and subsidiary, by the rule of order, the proximity is due to the common location.

original: prathamasya ci pra dhānasya mantramanvicchannavaśyaṃ mantrasamāmnāyamādita jhāragyālocayati /
analyzed: prathamasya ci pra dhānasya mantram anvicchan avaśyam mantra samāmnāyam ādita jhāragya ālocayati
translated: Desiring the mantra for the first main ritual, one necessarily considers the recitation of the mantra from the beginning.

original: tataśca prathama eva mantraḥ prathamaṃ hṛdayamāgacchati/
analyzed: tatas ca prathamaḥ eva mantraḥ prathamam hṛdayam āgacchati
translated: And then the first mantra comes to the mind first.

original: na cāsyātikrame heturastīti sa eva gṛhyate /
analyzed: na ca asya atikrame hetuḥ asti iti saḥ eva gṛhyate
translated: And there is no reason for transgressing it, so it is accepted.

original: tathā mantrasya śeṣaṇamapeca māṇasyānayaiva prakriyayā yena śeṣiṇā saha saṃbandho bha vati tataśca tannirākāṅkṣatayā dvitīyādīnāmapyevameva dvitīyādibhireva yogena bhavitavyam/
analyzed: tathā mantrasya śeṣaṇam apeca māṇasya anayā eva prakriyayā yena śeṣiṇā saha saṃbandhaḥ bha vati tatas ca tad nirākāṅkṣa tayā dvitīya ādīnām api evam eva dvitīya ādibhiḥ eva yogena bhavitavyam
translated: Similarly, the mantra, which requires a complement, by this very process becomes connected with that which is to be completed, and then, being without desire for anything else, the second and subsequent (mantras) must also be in the same way connected only with the second and subsequent (actions).

analyzed: tatra āgneya ādi anumantraṇānām āgneya ādi niṅga tvāt tena api vyavasthā sidhyati itu avyakta liṅgam upāṃśa yāja krama adhītam dabdhiḥ nāma asi iti udāharati
translated: There, the anumantrana mantras of the agneya etc. are to be performed in connection with the agneya etc., and by that also the restriction is accomplished. Therefore, he cites the mantra named dabdhi, which is recited in the upamshuyaja sequence, having a non-specific indicator.

original: nanu vākyaprakaraṇātmarvārthatvaṃ vijñāyate taca balīya ityanyatrāpi viniyogaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: nanu vākya prakaraṇāt marva artha tvam vijñāyate tat ca balīyaḥ iti anyatra api viniyogaḥ prāpnoti
translated: But it is understood that the purpose of a sentence or context is stronger, and therefore application is obtained elsewhere also.

analyzed: atra ke cit āṅaḥ
translated: Here some say:

analyzed: upāṃśuyāja grahaṇāt dayam api anugṛhyate tasmāt tat grahaṇam iti
translated: Since the upamshuyaja is mentioned, this (mantra) is also favored. Therefore, its mention is (proper).

original: śakyaṃ tu vaktuma anugrāhya eva kramaḥ prakaraṇapratyayaviruddhatvāditi /
analyzed: śakyam tu vaktum anugrāhyaḥ eva kramaḥ prakaraṇa pratyaya viruddha tvāt iti
translated: But it can be said that the sequence is to be favored only, because it is contrary to the understanding of context.

original: śeṣasya hi sarvārthatve pratipradhānāvṛtteḥ prakaraṇāvagataṃ na śakyaṃ bādhitum /
analyzed: śeṣasya hi sarva artha tve prati pradhāna āvṛtteḥ prakaraṇa avagatam na śakyam bādhitum
translated: For when the remainder is for all purposes, the repetition for each principal (action) cannot contradict what is understood from the context.

original: tacaitāvaduttaraṃ bhavati yenye śeṣiṣṇa agneyādayaste viṣṭalaḥ kramaprakaraṇavadbhimantrānta rairavarudatvānnai namapekṣante /
analyzed: tat ca etāvat uttaram bhavati agneya ādayaḥ te viṣṭalaḥ krama prakaraṇavadbhiḥ mantra antaraiḥ avaruda tvāt na enam apekṣante
translated: And this much is the answer: Those other subsidiaries like the Agniṣṭoma are remote, because they are not directly mentioned by the mantra, like the sequence and context.

analyzed: na ca vikalpa uspaṣṭa ciṅga tvena vaiṣamyāt
translated: And there is no option, because of the inequality due to the indistinct indication.

analyzed: adṛṣṭa arthānām samuccayaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that there is combination of those serving unseen purposes, it is not so.

original: prakṛtayā gapratyavekṣaṇena dṛṣṭārthatvātsatyapi cādṛṣṭārthatve nirapekṣāṇāṃ gatvantare sati samuccayānāśrayaṇādāgneyādibhiḥ kṛtārthairupekṣitaḥ sannagatyā punasteṣveva bhavedasti cāsya gatirupāṃśuyāja iti /
analyzed: prakṛtayā ga pratyavekṣaṇena dṛṣṭārtha tvāt sati api ca adṛṣṭa artha tve nirapekṣāṇām gatu antare sati samuccaya anāśrayaṇāt āgneya ādibhiḥ kṛtārthaiḥ upekṣitaḥ san agatyā punar teṣu eva bhavet asti ca asya gatiḥ upāṃśuyājaḥ iti
translated: Because it serves a seen purpose by examining the original Agniṣṭoma, and even if it serves an unseen purpose, it does not depend on combination when there is another means, because it is neglected by the Agniṣṭoma etc. which have served their purpose. It would be in those very (Agniṣṭoma etc.) only out of necessity, and it has a means in the Upāṃśuyāja.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And further,

original: dabdhirnāmāsītya spaṣṭa liṅgoyam/🔽na ceḍaśaṃ santaṃ prakaraṇaṃ vi tantravārtika /
analyzed: dabdhiḥ nāma asi itya spaṣṭa liṅgā ūyam  na ca īḍaśam santam prakaraṇam vi tantra vārtika
translated: this one with the clear indication You are the one named Dālbhy.

original: niyoktuṃ kṣamaṃ mama tvasiśabdo yuṣmadarthaviṣayatvātmannicitamabhimukhaṃ vābhiṣatte nānya / mupāṃḍayājaśca sannihitobhimukhacetyabhidhānasāmadhyeṃ kramādupāṃśuyājaviṣayaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: niyoktum kṣamam mama tu asi śabdaḥ yuṣmad artha viṣaya tva ātman nicitam abhimukham vā abhiṣatte na anyam upāṃḍa yājaḥ ca sannihita ubhimukha ca iti abhidhāna sāmadhyem kramāt upāṃśuyāja viṣayam vijñāyate
translated: And the context, even if it were present, is not able to direct it. The word asī addresses you, the listener, because it has the sense of you, not anyone else. And the Upāṃśuyāja is known to be related to the Upāṃśu by the similarity of the words sannita and abhimukha.

analyzed: tatas ca liṅgena prakaraṇam bādhyate eva iti adoṣaḥ
translated: And so, the context is indeed contradicted by the indicative power, and there is no fault.

original: kāmyayājyā kāṇḍa kramastu vyākhyāta evānuṣṭhānadeśakramopi paśudharmāṇāmagnīṣomīyārthatvena bhaviṣyati
analyzed: kāmya yājyā kāṇḍa kramaḥ tu vyākhyātaḥ eva anuṣṭhāna deśa kramaḥ api paśu dharmāṇām agnīṣomīya artha tvena bhaviṣyati
translated: The order of the optional Yajya section has already been explained. The order of performance of the animal rites will be for the purpose of the Agnisomiya sacrifice.

original: ādhvaryavādisamākhyānāṃ vedaetra prayoga iti na laukikatvacodyaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: ādhvaryava ādi samākhyānām vedaḥ etra prayogaḥ iti na laukika tva codyam kriyate
translated: The designations of Adhvaryu and others are in the application of the Veda. The objection of being worldly is not raised.

analyzed: tatra adhvaryu vṛtta mātram eva apekṣate kim mayā kattaṃvyam iti
translated: There, it only depends on the Adhvaryu's activity: What should I do?

original: tadapekṣamāṇasya ca yadi na kutaścidviśeṣo 'vagamyate tato yatkiñciditi bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tat apekṣamāṇasya ca yadi na kutaścid viśeṣaḥ avagamyate tatas yat kiñcid iti bhaviṣyati
translated: And if no particular thing is understood for one who depends on that, then it will be anything at all.

original: tathādhvaryavasaṃjñitaṃ karma ko me karttā bhaviṣyatītyevameva śeṣamapekṣate /🔽tatra śabdajasyādita evaiṣotprekṣā pratyekaṃ bhavati yadasyādhvaryoḥ karma tadādhvaryavaśabdavācyaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tathā ādhvaryava saṃjñitam karma kaḥ me karttā bhaviṣyati iti evam eva śeṣam apekṣate  tatra śabda jasya āditas eva eṣā utprekṣā pratyekam bhavati yat asya adhvaryoḥ karma tat ādhvaryava śabda vācyam bhaviṣyati
translated: In the same way, the rite designated as Adhvaryava depends on the remaining [factors] in this way: Who will be my performer?🔽In that case, this imagination arises from the word itself, individually: When this is the Adhvaryu's rite, it will be denoted by the word Adhvaryava.

original: tathāpyasyādhvaryavasya yaḥ karttā tasyādhvaryurnāmeti prakṛtervā vikārastadanurūpo'numīyate vikārāḍā prakṛtiḥ /
analyzed: tathā api asya ādhvaryavasya yaḥ karttā tasya adhvaryuḥ nāma iti prakṛteḥ vā vikāraḥ tad anurūpaḥ anumīyate prakṛtiḥ
translated: Even so, the name Adhvaryu is inferred to be a modification that accords with the original, since the original is inferred from the modification.

original: yadyapi śabdāntaraṃ vikāra ityubhāvapyeto parasparanirapekṣau ni tyasaṃbandhī ca tathāpi nityāyā eva śabdapravṛttarnityaḥ saṃbandho nimittamiti sarvayaugikānāmevamanvākhyānam /
analyzed: yadi api śabda antaram vikāraḥ iti ubhau api etau paraspara nirapekṣau ca tathā api nityāyāḥ eva śabda pravṛttaḥ nityaḥ saṃbandhaḥ nimittam iti sarva yaugikānām evam anvākhyānam
translated: Even though the word and the modification are two distinct things, and as such are not mutually dependent, and are related to each other independently of all other things, yet the relation of the word to its denotation is eternal, and it is on the basis of this eternal relation that all etymological explanations are based.

analyzed: na hi rājya śabdasya api ādimatī pravṛttiḥ iti uktam
translated: It has been already explained that the word ‘rājan’ also has had no beginning in time.

analyzed: nimitta naimittika bhāvaḥ tu anādi tve pi śabda arthayoḥ iva idam aviruddhaḥ
translated: As for the relation of the denoted and the denotative, even though this may be beginningless, like that of the word and its meaning, it is not incompatible with the Veda.

original: tatra ke cihnadanti tṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /🔽prāgetasmātsamākhyā viniyogādadhvayrdhvādhvaryavayorasaṃbandhādaśakyaṃ yaugikatvaṃ samākhyayā vijñātum /
analyzed: tatra ke cihnadanti tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda  prāk etasmāt samākhyā viniyogāt adhvayrdhvādhvaryavayoḥ asaṃbandhāt aśakyam yaugika tvam samākhyayā vijñātum
translated: In this connection, some people argue as follows:🔽Prior to the application of the name, there is no connection between the Adhvaryu and the Adhvaryava rites, and hence it is not possible to ascertain the etymological meaning of the word ‘adhvaryava’ by the name.

original: atha tu prathamaṃ siddhe saṃbandhe paścātmamākhyāyāḥ pravṛttiḥ tato na samākhyā viniyojikā yādataḥ parasparanirapekṣayoreva rūḍhyoḥ sārūpyādupatiṣṭhamānayoreṣa viniyoga iti /
analyzed: atha tu prathamam siddhe saṃbandhe paścāt mamākhyāyāḥ pravṛttiḥ tatas na samākhyā viniyojikā yāt atas paraspara nirapekṣayoḥ eva rūḍhyoḥ sārūpyāt upatiṣṭhamānayoḥ eṣa viniyogaḥ iti
translated: If, on the other hand, the connection is established first, and then the name is applied, then the name cannot be the basis of the application; because the application is based upon the similarity of the two independently existing etymological meanings.

analyzed: na tu etat yuktam
translated: This argument, however, is not right.

analyzed: na hi ruḍhānām sārūghyāt upasthāpana sāmarthyam dharma saṃbandhe pi asti
translated: For when the words are well-known, their power to bring about the idea of the connection of the action and the agent is not there, even when there is a connection of the word with the object.

original: yathā kaṇvarathantare ra thantaradharmānnirākariṣyati kimutātra kriyākartṛsaṃbandhe pāvakāyudāharaṇaṃ vā yuktaṃ syāttasmād yaugikatvamevābhyupagantavyam /
analyzed: yathā kaṇvarathantare ra thantara dharmān nirākariṣyati kim uta atra kriyā kartṛ saṃbandhe pāvaka āyudāharaṇam vā yuktam syāt tasmāt yaugika tvam eva abhyupagantavyam
translated: As he will deny the application of the Rgveda to the Rathantara Sāman, how much more so in the case of the connection of the action and the agent? Or rather, the example of fire would be appropriate here. Therefore, it must be accepted that the words are etymological.

original: yattu prāk prayogātpramāṇaṃ nāstīti satyaṃ pratyakṣaṃ nāstīti samākhyayaivānumīyamānaṃ bhaviṣyati/
analyzed: yat tu prāk prayogāt pramāṇam na asti iti satyam pratyakṣam na asti iti samākhyayā eva anumīyamānam bhaviṣyati
translated: As for the argument that there is no means of knowing the connection before the performance, it is true that there is no perception, but it will be inferred through the designation.

original: ve hi prathamameva kriyākartṛsaṃbandho niṣpanastasminsati samākhyā pravṛttā vayaṃ tu taṃ saṃbandhaṃ pramāṇāntareṇāpratipādyamānāḥ samākhyādarśanena pratipadyāmace tena jñāyate pūrvaṃ samākhyā paścātlaṃbandha iti /
analyzed: hi prathamam eva kriyā kartṛ saṃbandhaḥ niṣpanaḥ tasmin sati samākhyā pravṛttā vayam tu tam saṃbandham pramāṇa antareṇa a pratipādyamānāḥ samākhyā darśanena tena jñāyate pūrvam samākhyā iti
translated: For the connection between the action and the agent is established first, and only after that the designation is applied. But we understand that connection through the observation of the designation, without it being taught by any other means of knowledge. Therefore, it is known that the designation comes first and the connection later.

original: vastutastu prathamameva saṃbandhaḥ sa cāpratītopi sattāmātreṇaiva samākhyāṃ pravarttitavān yadi hyeṣādimatī syāttataḥ prayoktuḥ prathamaṃ saṃbandhāvagatyā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: vastutas tu prathamam eva saṃbandhaḥ sa ca apratītaḥ api sattā mātreṇa eva samākhyām pravarttitavān yadi hi eṣā ādimatī syāt tatas prayoktuḥ prathamam saṃbandha avagatyā bhavitavyam
translated: As a matter of fact, the connection is there from the very beginning, and even though not cognised, it is this connection that serves as the basis of the said Name. If the connection were not there from the beginning, then, in that case, the person using the Name would have to be cognisant of the connection at the time of the use of the Name.

original: na ca sāna bhavatīti paryanuyujye mahi nitya saṃbandhāśrayaṇe /
analyzed: na ca sā ana bhavati iti
translated: But as a matter of fact, he is not so cognisant. Hence we conclude that the connection must be there from all eternity.🔽If it be urged that “in that case, the connection must be there from all eternity, because the Name is always used, and it is only when the connection is there that the Name can be used, and it is not possible for the Name to be used without the connection”, then, we ask, what is this connection? If it be said that “it is the relation of denoted and denoter”, then, we ask, is this relation itself eternal? or is it produced? If it is produced, then, inasmuch as the relation of denoted and denoter is not possible without the denotation, the denotation must be there from all eternity.🔽If, on the other hand, the relation of denoted and denoter is eternal, then, inasmuch as the denotation is always there, the Name must be always there.🔽If it be urged that “the denotation is there only when the connection is there”, then, we ask, what is the use of postulating the connection? As a matter of fact, the denotation is there even without the connection.

original: nanu tatra nityaprayuktayā samākhyayā nūnaṃ kaścidasti saṃbandha iti pratipādite 'nyathānupapattyā śeṣaśeṣibhāvaḥ paścāhijñāyate tasmādyaugikyaiva samākhyayā viniyoga iti miṭṭama
analyzed: nanu tatra nitya prayuktayā samākhyayā nūnam kaścid asti saṃbandhaḥ iti pratipādite nyathā anupapattyā śeṣa śeṣi bhāvaḥ tasmāt yaugikyā eva samākhyayā viniyogaḥ iti miṭṭama
translated: As a matter of fact, the connection is not always cognised, because it is not always perceived, even when the denotation is there.🔽If it be urged that “the connection is cognised by means of the Name itself”, then, we ask, is the Name itself the means of knowing the connection? Or is it the fact of the Name being used that is the means of knowing the connection? If the Name itself is the means of knowing the connection, then, inasmuch as the Name is there even when the connection is not there, the connection would be there even when it is not there.🔽If the fact of the Name being used is the means of knowing the connection, then, inasmuch as the Name is used only when the connection is there, the connection would be there only when it is there.

original: eka eva hyaruṇādiḥ śeṣaḥ śrutyā sāmānya kriyā saṃbandhī vā kyena tadviśeṣasya krayasya prakaraṇena jyotiṣṭomikasya satyapi vācanikaprakaraṇa samavāye parasparānugra inimittatvādavirodha iti bacāvalavicāro na bhavati nirviśeṣasāmānyānupapatteḥ /
analyzed: ekaḥ eva hi aruṇa ādiḥ śeṣaḥ śrutyā sāmānya kriyā saṃbandhī vā kyena tad viśeṣasya krayasya prakaraṇena jyotiṣṭomikasya sati api vācanika prakaraṇa samavāye paraspara anugra i nimitta tvāt avirodhaḥ iti bacāvala vicāraḥ na bhavati nirviśeṣa sāmānya anupapatteḥ
translated: If it be urged that “the connection is cognised by means of the Name, which

original: kraya svarūpamātraprayuktatve cānarthakatvādapekṣite hi śrutivākyābhyāṃ vākyaprakaraṇe /
analyzed: kraya svarūpa mātra prayukta tve ca anarthaka tvāt apekṣite hi śruti vākyābhyām vākya prakaraṇe
translated: And if the mere form of purchase were the only thing required, then, the sentence and the context would be meaningless.

analyzed: tasmāt karttavyam virodha gre iṇam iti
translated: Therefore, the conflict should be resolved.

analyzed: na vā karttavyam
translated: Or it should not be done.

analyzed: kutas  pramāṇam amavāyaḥ asti
translated: Why?🔽There is no evidence for the combination.

original: na hokatra saṃbhava mātraṃ samavāyaḥ kiṃ tarhi viṣayaikatvama /
analyzed: na ha ukatra saṃbhava mātram samavāyaḥ kim tarhi viṣaya eka tvam
translated: For combination is not mere possibility in one place, but rather oneness of object.

original: ica cāruṇasya kriyāsaṃbandhaḥ śrutvā tasya tu śrutikalpitasya kriyākāraka saṃbandhasya bhūyopyapekṣāvaśena krayaviṣayatvam /
analyzed: kriyā saṃbandhaḥ śrutvā tasya tu śruti kalpitasya kriyā kāraka saṃbandhasya bhūyas upi apekṣā vaśena kraya viṣaya tvam
translated: And having heard the connection of the red with the action, that connection of the action and its means, imagined by the Vedic text, becomes the object of purchase again by the power of the requirement.

original: tāvatā ca prayojanānavāpterapekṣāntare satyapūrvasaṃbandhavataḥ krayasya jyotiṣṭomārthatvamiti viṣayanānātvamataśca sarveṣāṃ viniyojakatvamaviruddham /
analyzed: tāvatā ca prayojana anavāpteḥ apekṣā antare satya pūrva saṃbandhavataḥ krayasya jyotiṣṭoma artha tvam iti viṣaya nānātvam atas ca sarveṣām viniyojaka tvam aviruddham
translated: And since the purpose is not fulfilled by that much, when there is another requirement, the purchase, which has the connection with the unseen, becomes for the purpose of the Jyotiṣṭoma. Thus there is difference of objects, and therefore the application of all is not contradictory.

original: na cātra viprakṛṣṭagrahaṇe sannikṛṣṭasya bādho dṛśyate na hi krayaṃ gṛhṇayā kriyā saṃvandhaṃ bādhate nāpi jyotiṣṭome kurvankrayatṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīya pāda /🔽saṃbandham /
analyzed: na ca atra viprakṛṣṭa grahaṇe sannikṛṣṭasya bādhaḥ dṛśyate na hi krayam kriyā saṃvandham bādhate na api jyotiṣṭome kurvan kraya tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīya pāda 🔽saṃbandham
translated: And here, in the acceptance of the remote, the near is not seen to be contradicted. For the acceptance of the purchase does not contradict the connection with the action, nor does the performance in the Jyotiṣṭoma contradict the connection with the purchase.

original: yatra tvekaḥ śeṣastāvāneva ca saṃbandhāntara virodhinaikena pramāṇenānyaśeṣyartho vijñāyate /
analyzed: yatra tu ekaḥ śeṣaḥ tāvān eva ca saṃbandha antara virodhinā ekena pramāṇena anya śeṣī arthaḥ vijñāyate
translated: Where, however, there is only one remainder, and that is known by one means of knowledge, which is incompatible with another relation, as having a different remainder,

analyzed: pareṇa taḍhava agha anupapattinā śevi antara arthaḥ  eka saṃvandham ca kṛtārthasya ākāṅkhā bhāvāt punar viniyoga antara anupapattiḥ
translated: and by the other, which is not capable of being set aside, as having a different remainder,🔽and as the relation is one, and the purpose of the one that has served its purpose is not capable of being set aside again,

original: tatra pramāṇayoḥ parasparāpacāryasamānaviṣayatvajakṣaṇaḥ samavāyaḥ tathā yatra śeṣabhedapye kasminneva śeṣiṇi tulyopakāranibandhana ekena pramāyenānyaḥ śeṣaḥ sāghanatvena pratīyate anyenāparo na caika sādhitopakāraḥ śeṣī śeṣāntaramapecate tatrāpyeka viṣayāpacāritvātsamavāyaḥ sa ca virodha evaṃ sati bhavatīti samavāyagrahaṇenaiva siddho virodhaḥ /
analyzed: tatra pramāṇayoḥ paraspara apacārya samāna viṣaya tva ja kṣaṇaḥ samavāyaḥ tathā yatra kasmin eva śeṣiṇi tulya upakāra nibandhanaḥ ekena pramāyena anyaḥ śeṣaḥ sāghana tvena pratīyate anyena aparaḥ na ca eka sādhita upakāraḥ śeṣī śeṣa antaram apecate tatra api eka viṣaya apacāri tvāt samavāyaḥ sa ca virodhaḥ evam sati bhavati iti samavāya grahaṇena eva siddhaḥ virodhaḥ
translated: there the combination is the restriction of the two means of knowledge to the same object, and where there is a difference in the remainder, but in the same substratum of the remainder, the relation of the one is the same, and one remainder is known by one means of knowledge as having a different purpose, and by the other another, and the substratum of the remainder, which has served its purpose by one, does not require another remainder, there also the combination is due to the restriction to the same object, and that combination is incompatible. Thus, the incompatibility is established by the mention of combination itself.

original: yatra punaḥ spaṣṭa eva śetrabhedo yathā samidho yajatotyādiṣu yatra vā tasyaiva kiṃ cidādhikyaṃ bhavati yathā'ruṇāyāṃ vyākhyātam tathā yatra śeṣibhedo yathāgneyādiṣvaṣṭākapālādīnāṃ yatra vā tadgatamādhiyaṃ yathā darśapūrṇamāmāṅgānāmevopakārabhedastatrāpi viṣayānyatvādamamavāya iti /
analyzed: yatra punar spaṣṭaḥ eva samidhaḥ yajata ityādiṣu yatra vā tasya eva kim cit ādhikyam bhavati yathā aruṇāyām vyākhyātam tathā yatra śeṣi bhedaḥ yathā āgneya ādiṣu aṣṭākapāla ādīnām yatra vā yathā darśa pūrṇamāma aṅgānām eva upakāra bhedaḥ tatra api viṣaya anyatvāt amamavāyaḥ iti
translated: And where there is a clear difference in the substratum, as in the case of the Samidheni verses, or where there is some additional factor in that very substratum, as explained in the case of the red cow, or where there is a difference in the substratum of the subsidiary, as in the case of the Aṣṭākapāla offerings to Agni etc., or where there is a difference in the function of the subsidiaries of the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices, even there, because of the difference in the objects, there is no combination.

original: yacca śrutvā vi niyujyate yacca samākhyayā tatsarvaṃ tulyaṃ yastu sarvāṅgajanya ekaḥ pradhānopakāraḥ tatraiṣāmaparyāya vidhānādekameva pramāṃṇaṃ śeṣatvaṃ ceti vyāpārabhedādasamavāyaḥ /
analyzed: yat ca śrutvā vi niyujyate yat ca samākhyayā tat sarvam tulyam yaḥ tu sarva aṅga janyaḥ ekaḥ pradhāna upakāraḥ tatra eṣām aparyāya vidhānāt ekam eva pramāṃṇam śeṣa tvam ca iti vyāpāra bhedāt asamavāyaḥ
translated: And what is enjoined after hearing, and what is enjoined by name, all that is equal. But where there is a single principal benefit produced by all the parts, there, because of the non-repeatable injunctions of those, there is only one valid means of knowledge, and because of the difference in function, there is no combination due to the difference in operation.

original: tathā yatra sa eva śeṣastasminneva śeṣiṇi sannikṛṣṭena viprakṛṣṭena ca pramāpona viniyujyate tatrāpyekasyaiva pramāṇatvenetarasya prayojanātarārthatvādasamavāya iti /
analyzed: tathā yatra saḥ eva śeṣaḥ tasmin eva śeṣiṇi sannikṛṣṭena viprakṛṣṭena ca viniyujyate tatra api ekasya eva pramāṇa tvena itarasya prayojana atara artha tvāt asamavāyaḥ iti
translated: Similarly, where that very subsidiary is enjoined in relation to that very substratum, both by what is proximate and what is remote, there also, because of the single valid means of knowledge, and because the other is not for the purpose of the object, there is no combination.

analyzed: tasmāt virodha viṣayam eva samavāya grahaṇam
translated: Therefore, the mention of combination is only in regard to what is contradictory.

original: tatra paṇāmapi ekacaiva balāvale kathayatavye kramavarttitvāhāco yugapadaśaktareka kasya saṃpradhāraṇā/
analyzed: tatra bala avale kathayatavye kasya saṃpradhāraṇā
translated: There, even in the case of a single word, the relation of strength and weakness should be stated in sequence, as they cannot occur simultaneously.

original: yattu dvitīyopādānaṃ tatpratiyoginā vinā baccābacakathanāśaktatenocyate iyoīyoriti /
analyzed: yat tu dvitīya upādānam tad pratiyoginā vinā
translated: But the second mention is made because it cannot be stated without its counter-part, hence it is said 'of the two'.

analyzed: eka artha vartti tvāt ā caḥ iti asya aparā vyākhyā
translated: Another explanation of 'because they occur in the same meaning' is as follows.

original: yeyaṃ bantābanavāgeṣā pratyekaṃ śrutyādiṣu samavaiti na samudāye /
analyzed: yā iyam bantā bana vāc eṣā pratyekam śruti ādiṣu samavaiti na samudāye
translated: This relation of strength and weakness occurs individually in each case of verbal testimony etc., not collectively.

original: tāni hi śeṣaviniyogenārthavanti na balābanamatastasyāḥ pratipradhānavṛttitvādayogapaścai nai kekasya saṃpradhāraṇāyāṃ karttavyāyāṃ dvitīyopādānavirodhavacābalabāghānāṃ pratiyoginyanupapattiṃ darśayitumasaṃbhavād dayodayoḥ saṃpradhāraṇetyuktam /
analyzed: tāni hi śeṣa viniyogena arthavanti na tasyāḥ saṃpradhāraṇāyām karttavyāyām dvitīya upādāna virodha vacābala bāghānām pratiyogini anupapattim darśayitum asaṃbhavāt dayā udayoḥ saṃpradhāraṇā iti uktam
translated: For those are meaningful by being employed as subsidiaries, not by strength and weakness. Therefore, because it occurs with each principal, it cannot be determined simultaneously. In the determination of one, the non-occurrence of the counter-parts of contradiction, strength and weakness is shown. Due to impossibility, the determination of the two is stated.

analyzed: taka ka dvayoḥ dvayoḥ
translated: That is, of two pairs.

original: paccabhiḥ pañcabhiḥ saha vicāre karttavye yadekekena saha kriyate tahādhitabādhyasya bādhakabādhakena bādhasya sujñānatvādyāni hi śrutibādhyainiṅgādibhirvādhyante tāni śrutvā bādhyantetarā miti na tathā saha saṃpradhārayiṣyante /
analyzed: paccabhiḥ pañcabhiḥ saha vicāre karttavye yat ekekena saha kriyate su jñāna tvāt yāni hi śruti bādhyaiḥ niṅga ādibhiḥ vādhyante tāni śrutvā bādhyante itarāḥ miti na tathā saha saṃpradhārayiṣyante
translated: When consideration is to be done with five, when it is done with each one, the contradiction of the contradicted by the contradictor of the contradictor is easily understood. For those contradicted by direct statement are contradicted by the implication, etc., and are contradicted even more when heard, so they will not be considered together in that way.

analyzed: tatra prathamam tāvalam aprāptam śruti liṅgayoḥ saṃpradhāraṇam iti
translated: There, first of all, the consideration of direct statement and implication is not reached.

analyzed: kim iha udāharaṇām iti
translated: What is the example here?

original: kevalapaprayogābhāvātmarvatra vākyatve sati na śrutiniṅgayoḥ svasāmarthyā tireko lakṣyate iti manyamānamya praśnaḥ /
analyzed: vākya tve sati na śruti niṅgayoḥ sva sāmarthyā atirekaḥ lakṣyate iti manyamānamya praśnaḥ
translated: Thinking that in this case, where there is a sentence, the difference between direct statement and implication is not observed by their own power due to the absence of application of only one, the question is asked.🔽And with the intention of the distinction to be stated, the question is: Does the worship of Indra alone have to be done, or the worship of Indra and Agni together, or the worship of Agni alone?

original: vakṣyamāṇavivekābhiprāyeṇecainyā gārhapattyamupatiṣṭhata iti kimindrasyaivopasthānaṃ ka rttavyamutendrasya gāīpatyasya vā 'tha vā samuccitayoratha vā gāīpatyasyaiveti /
analyzed: vakṣyamāṇa viveka abhiprāyeṇa icainyā gārhapattyam upatiṣṭhate iti kim indrasya eva upasthānam ka rttavyam uta indrasya gāīpatyasya vā vā samuccitayoḥ atha vā gāīpatyasya eva iti
translated: He worships the Gārhapatya fire.

original: yadi liṅgaṃ banīyastata indropasthānamatha tulyabannatvaṃ virodhaśca tato vikalpotha tulyavanatveṣyavirodhastataḥ samuccayo 'tha virodhaḥ śrutivanjoyastvaṃ ca tato gārhapatyasyaivopasthānamiti /
analyzed: yadi liṅgam banīyaḥ tatas indra upasthānam atha tulya banna tvam virodhaḥ ca tatas vikalpaḥ utha tulya vana tveṣi avirodhaḥ tatas virodhaḥ ca tatas gārhapatyasya eva upasthānam iti
translated: If the indication is stronger, then the worship of Indra, if the strength of the indication is equal, and there is contradiction, then option, if the strength of the indication is equal and there is no contradiction, then combination, if there is contradiction and the joy is like the Vedic text, then the worship of only the Garhapatya.

original: yattu siddhavadgāīpatyārthatvāṅgīkaraṇena vacanāttvayathārthamaindrī syādityuktam tadiha sthāpayiṣyamāṇaśrutibalīyatvābhiprāyeṇa /
analyzed: yat tu siddha vat gāīpatya arthatva aṅgīkaraṇena vacanāt tu ayathārtham aindrī syāt iti uktam tat iha sthāpayiṣyamāṇa śruti balīyatva abhiprāyeṇa
translated: As for what was said - that the Aindri mantra should be used as it is, due to the statement accepting the Garhapatya as if it were established, that is with the intention of establishing the strength of the Vedic text.

original: tenaiva sarvavākyatvābhiprāyeṇa śrutiliṅgerthe vā kyatvambhrāntyā punaḥ pṛcchati/
analyzed: tena eva sarva vākyatva abhiprāyeṇa śruti liṅga irthe vā kya tvam bhrāntyā punar pṛcchati
translated: With that very intention of all the sentences, he asks again out of confusion whether the sentence is in the meaning of the Vedic text or the indication.

analyzed: kā punar atra śrutiḥ kim liṅgam iti
translated: What then is the Vedic text here? What is the indication?

analyzed: tatra uttaram gārhapatya śabda śravaṇam mantra māmathrthyam ca iti
translated: The answer there is the hearing of the word Garhapatya and the purpose of the mantra.

analyzed: paraḥ punar āha
translated: The opponent says again:

original: yadyevaṃvidhapadasamūhātmake śrutiliṅge hanta tarhi vākyaṃ nāma na kiṃ cidapyasti /
analyzed: yadi evaṃvidha pada samūha ātmake śruti liṅge hanta tarhi vākyam nāma na kim cit api asti
translated: If the Vedic text and the indication consist of a collection of words of this kind, then indeed there is nothing at all called a sentence.

analyzed: tat ucyatām atha vākyam nāma kim iti
translated: Let that be stated, or what is called a sentence?

original: siddhāntavādī tu tathaiva śakyavivekajñānatvaṃ manyamāna āha /
analyzed: siddhāntavādī tu tathā eva śakya viveka jñāna tvam manyamānaḥ āha
translated: But the upholder of the Siddhānta, considering that the knowledge of the distinction is possible in the same way, says:

analyzed: saṃhatya artham abhidadhati padāni vākyam iti
translated: The words expressing the combined meaning are a sentence.

original: yadyapi ca na saṃhatānāṃ kathidekobhidheyastathāpi gamyamānābhiprāyeṇoktam /
analyzed: yadi api ca na saṃhatānām kathit ekaḥ abhidheyaḥ tathā api gamyamāna abhiprāyeṇa uktam
translated: And although there is no single object of expression for the combined [words], still it is said with the intended meaning being understood.

original: atha vaikaca kṣyamāṇārthaprayuktatayā saṃghātatvamāpāditāni yadā svārthamabhidadhati tadā tadbhūtānyeva santi vākyatvaṃ pratipadyantaiti /
