original: yadi tu patnīsaṃyājoddeśena jāghanī vidhīyate tataḥ prakṛtānuvādabuddhyanapāyāddarśapūrṇamāsayoreva jāghanovidhānam
analyzed: yadi tu patnīsaṃyāja uddeśena jāghanī vidhīyate tatas prakṛta anuvāda buddhi anapāyāt darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ eva jāghanaḥ vidhānam
translated: But if the tail were enjoined with reference to the Patnīsaṃyājas, then, since the idea of restating what has already been done would not disappear, the tail would be enjoined only in the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa sacrifices.

analyzed: param ca karma kathanam evam sati ityādi
translated: And the statement of the other rite would be thus, etc.

original: yadi punarucyate evaṃ sanīti yojyate tataḥ paricodanāchāyāpatterna ca tadyuktamuttarānabhidhānāttasmādātmavacanatvenai va yojyam
analyzed: yadi punar ucyate evam sani iti yojyate tatas paricodanā chāyā āpatteḥ na ca tat yuktam uttara anabhidhānāt tasmāt ātma vacana tvena e vā yojyam
translated: But if it is said that the word 'evam' is to be connected thus, then, because it would be like a restatement, and that is not proper due to the absence of a subsequent statement, therefore it is to be connected only as a statement of the self.

analyzed: prāpnuyāt evam
translated: It would indeed be so.

original: na kasya citpadārthasyotkarṣa idameva tu vākyaṃ vikanau kāryaṃ kurva dutkṛṣyate ityucyate
analyzed: na kasya cit padārthasya utkarṣaḥ idam eva tu vākyam kāryam iti ucyate
translated: No meaning of any word is to be taken as transferred. This very sentence is to be split up. It is said that the tail is transferred.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: jāghanyuddiśyamānā syātsaṃskāryotkarṣa kāraṇam ihopāṭīyate 'ṅgatvādyā geṣvājyavadeva sā
analyzed: jāghanī uddiśyamānā syāt saṃskārya utkarṣa kāraṇam iha upāṭīyate ṅga tvāt yā geṣu ājya vat eva sā
translated: The tail, being indicated, is the cause of the transfer of what is to be consecrated. Here it is brought up, like the clarified butter in the subsidiaries, because of its subordinate nature.

original: pa tnīsaṃyājāścānantaravihitā manasi varttantaiti na vidhātuṃ śakyante /
analyzed: pa tnīsaṃyājāḥ ca anantara vihitāḥ manasi varttante eti na vidhātum śakyante
translated: And the Patnīsaṃyājas, which are enjoined immediately after, are present in the mind, so they cannot be enjoined.

original: na ceha sthitena paśugatapatnī saṃyājānuvādo yuktastahuḍyabhāvāt /
analyzed: na ca iha sthitena paśu gata patnī saṃyāja anuvādaḥ yuktaḥ tad huḍī abhāvāt
translated: And here it is not proper to restate the Patnīsaṃyājas related to the animal, because of the absence of the head.

original: na ca jāghanyāḥ kālādivaḍhanupādeyatvaṃ yene maṃ vidhimākarṣotsaṃskāryatvāditi ced na tṛtīyāvagataguṇātvātikramapramāṇābhāvāt /
analyzed: na ca jāghanyāḥ kāla ādi vat anupādeya tvam yene mam vidhim ākarṣa utsaṃskārya tvāt iti ced na tṛtīya avagata guṇā tva atikrama pramāṇa abhāvāt
translated: And the tail is not to be taken up like the time, etc., by which it would attract the injunction due to the fact of being what is to be refined. If it be said that this is not so, because of the absence of any proof of the transgression of the quality understood from the instrumental case,

original: yadi ca kṛtārthaṃ jāghanoṃ prastutvāyaṃ vi dhiḥ pravartteta tathāpi tāvatkadā citprayājaśeṣavad dvitīyārtheḍhatoyeti vyākhyāyeta /
analyzed: yadi ca kṛtārtham jāghanīm prastutvā ayam vi dhiḥ pravartteta tathā api tāvat kadā cit prayāja śeṣa vat dvitīya artha īḍha toyā iti vyākhyāyeta
translated: and if this injunction were to operate after mentioning the tail which has served its purpose for the sake of the present, even then it might be explained as being for the sake of the second object like the remnant of the prayāja.

analyzed: sā tu apūrvā vidhīyate
translated: But that is enjoined as something new.

analyzed: tasmāt na utkarṣatan pravārtika  marhati
translated: Therefore, the statement that it attracts is not proper.

original: na ca prakaraṇabadvatvāḍhate patnīsaṃyājā utkarṣe sahate /
analyzed: na ca patnīsaṃyājāḥ utkarṣe sahate
translated: And the wife-consecrations cannot bear being attracted due to being connected with the context.

original: vākyabalīyastvāditi cenna /🔽vākyasyāpyevamādaradhikṛtāpekṣitvena prakaraṇād durbalataratvādyadi hyetadeva patnīsaṃyājānāmutpattivākyaṃ bhavet tataḥ prakaraṇādācchindyāt /
analyzed: vākya balīyaḥ tvāt iti ced na  vākyasya api evam ādara dhikṛta apekṣi tvena prakaraṇāt durbalatara tvāt yadi hi etat eva patnīsaṃyājānām utpatti vākyam bhavet tatas prakaraṇāt ācchindyāt
translated: If it be said that this is not so, because the sentence is stronger,🔽no; because even the sentence is much weaker than the context due to requiring what is more important, namely, the originative injunction. If this were indeed the originative injunction of the wife-consecrations, then it could take them away from the context.

original: ete tu vākyāntarotpattitvātsannidhivaśena yāvatā kālenaitena vākyena saṃgṛhyante tāvatā darśapūrṇamāsābhyāmapi śakyā grahītum /
analyzed: ete tu vākya antara utpatti tvāt sannidhi vaśena yāvatā kālena etena vākyena saṃgṛhyante tāvatā darśa pūrṇamāsābhyām api śakyāḥ grahītum
translated: But these, because of being originated by a different sentence, can be taken up by the new and full moon sacrifices in the same time that they are included by this sentence due to proximity.

original: na ca jāghanyāḥ phalavattvaṃ vijñātaṃ yenaiṣāṃ prayojanākāṅkṣāmapanayet /
analyzed: na ca jāghanyāḥ phalavat tvam vijñātam yena eṣām prayojana ākāṅkṣām apanayet
translated: And the fruitfulness of the tail is not known, by which it could remove the desire for a purpose of these.

analyzed: atas yāvat asau kimarthā iti ālocyate tāvat phalavat arśapūrṇamāsa prasūtena kathaṃbhāvena aṅga tvam āpāditam
translated: Therefore, as long as it is being considered for what purpose this is, in the meantime, by the fruitfulness of the new and full moon sacrifices, it has been brought under the category of subsidiary by the manner of how.

analyzed: na ca iha apūrva yāga vidhānam yajimāna tvena ā śravaṇāt
translated: And here there is no injunction of an unseen sacrifice, because it is heard as having the sacrificer as its subject.

original: patnosaṃbaddhayāgaśravaṇaṃ hyetat tatra yadi jāghanyuddeśena ca karma vidhīyate patnyaścāsya vidhīyante tatone kārthavidhānādai kaśabdye parārthavaditi vairūpyalakṣaṇo vābhedaḥ syāt/
analyzed: patnī usaṃbaddha yāga śravaṇam hi etat tatra yadi jāghanī uddeśena ca karma vidhīyate patnyaḥ ca asya vidhīyante tatas ūne ka artha vidhānāt ai kaśabdye para artha vat iti vairūpya lakṣaṇaḥ vā abhedaḥ syāt
translated: For this is the hearing of a sacrifice connected with the wife. If an action is enjoined with reference to the tail, and the wives are enjoined for it, then due to the injunction of the meaning of one word, there would be a difference characterized by dissimilarity, like that of having a different purpose.

analyzed: alpa artha vidhi saṃbhavāt ca na viśiṣṭa vidhānena parihāraḥ ghaṭate
translated: And because it is possible to enjoin a small meaning, the avoidance by enjoining a qualified [action] does not hold.

analyzed: tasmāt viśiṣṭam yāgam uddigya dravyam vidhīyate
translated: Therefore, after designating a qualified sacrifice, the substance is enjoined.

analyzed: nanu evam api viśiṣṭa anuvādāt sutarām vākyam bhidyeta
translated: Even so, due to the restatement of the qualified [sacrifice], the sentence would be split even more.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: prakaraṇāprāpteḥ patnīśabdasyātantratvādyathaivā bhikrāmaṃ juhotīti sāmānya śabdo'pyadhikārāt prayājaviṣayo bhavati /
analyzed: prakaraṇa aprāpteḥ patnī śabdasya atantra tvāt yathā eva abhikrāmam juhoti iti sāmānya śabdaḥ upi adhikārāt prayāja viṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: Because it is not obtained in the context, and because the word 'wife' is not essential, just as the general word 'juhoti' becomes related to the prayāja offerings due to the topic,

analyzed: tathā eva yat saṃyājayanti iti etāvatā eva adhikṛtāḥ patnīsaṃyājāḥ pratyeṣyante tasmāt anutkarṣaḥ
translated: Similarly, by just this much, the Patnīsaṃyājas will be understood to be the subject of the statement they perform the Patnīsaṃyājas in the same way. Therefore, there is no removal.

analyzed: eka deśe iti ced
translated: If it is argued that it is a part,

original: yadukta me kadeśadravyaścotpattau vidyamānasaṃyogādaprayojaka iti tatrocyate
analyzed: yat ukta me ka deśa dravyaḥ ca utpattau vidyamāna saṃyogāt aprayojakaḥ iti tatra ucyate
translated: what was said - that a substance which is a part is not a reason in the origination due to the connection with what exists - is stated there.

analyzed: saṃtadanam pratīkrayaṇa vat an artha lopāt syāt
translated: The connection is like the purchase, it would be due to the omission of the purpose.

analyzed: iha vākya prakaraṇayoḥ virodha avirodha cintā
translated: Here, the consideration of contradiction and non-contradiction between sentence and context.

original: jyotiṣṭome somābhiṣavādhāratvena phalakadvayamāmnātaṃ tatprakṛtya śrūyate dīrghamīme saṃtṛṇyādbhutyāiti bhittvā saṃghātayedityarthaḥ /
analyzed: jyotiṣṭome soma abhiṣava ādhāra tvena phalaka dvayam āmnātam tat prakṛtya śrūyate dīrgham īme bhittvā saṃghātayet iti arthaḥ
translated: In the Jyotiṣṭoma, two sets of fruits are mentioned as the basis for the Soma pressing. With that as the original, it is heard: The long Soma should be pressed by breaking. The meaning is: having broken, one should combine.

original: tatra ḍhīrgha somaśabdaḥ kiṃ prakṛtāveva kathaṃ cidupapadyate tataścāvirodhaḥ prakaraṇasyātha dīrghakāla satrāhī nayā hitvādanupapadyamāna utkasampradārtike /
analyzed: tatra soma śabdaḥ kim prakṛtau eva katham cit upapadyate tatas ca avirodhaḥ prakaraṇasya atha dīrgha kāla hi tvāt anupapadyamānaḥ
translated: There, does the word long Soma somehow apply to the original, and therefore there is no contradiction with the context? Or does it not apply to the long-lasting sacrifice, and therefore it is removed to the context?

analyzed: rṣet iti saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is doubt.

original: ete cātra pakṣā bhaviṣyanti kiṃ śuddha eva jyotiṣṭome niveśo dīrghayajamānake vātha vokthyādi saṃsthā svevātha vā matrāhīnayorevātha vāgniṣṭomānyamānaiti /
analyzed: ete ca atra pakṣāḥ bhaviṣyanti kim śuddhe eva jyotiṣṭome niveśaḥ dīrghayajamānake vā atha vā ukthya ādi saṃsthā su eva atha vā matra ahīnayoḥ eva atha vā agniṣṭoma anyamāna eti
translated: And here the alternatives will be: Is the insertion only in the pure Jyotiṣṭoma, or in the one with a long sacrificer, or in the Ukthya and other forms, or in the very same, or in the Mātra and Ahīna, or in the Agnistoma and other forms?

analyzed: kim prāptam dīrghasoma śabdasya iṣṭi paśu ḍhavi homa apekṣayā prakṛtau eva upapatteḥ
translated: What is the conclusion? Since the word 'long Soma' is applicable in the original context itself in relation to the Iṣṭi, animal sacrifice, and oblations on the ground,

analyzed: ca dīrghaṃsya saṃbhavāt
translated: and since the long Soma, which serves a different purpose, is possible,

original: asaṃtarddana vidhinā ca saha brohiyavavadvikalpasiddheḥ prakaraṇānugrahāyānutkarṣa iti /
analyzed: a saṃtarddana vidhinā ca saha brohi yava vat vikalpa siddheḥ prakaraṇa anugrahāya anutkarṣaḥ iti
translated: and since the option is established together with the injunction of non-sprinkling, like barley in a sacrifice, the non-transference is for the sake of favoring the context.

original: krayavaḍikalpa ityupariṣṭātsamuccaya sthāpanā tpūrvapakṣeṇa dṛṣṭānta iti vyākhyeyama /
analyzed: kraya vaḍi kalpaḥ iti upariṣṭāt samuccaya sthāpanāt pūrvapakṣeṇa dṛṣṭāntaḥ iti vyākhyeyam
translated: The conclusion that the option is like the purchase and the fee should be explained as the example for the prima facie view, since it is established later.

original: na cāvaṇyaṃ sarvatra siddhānta eva dṛṣṭānto bhavati /
analyzed: na ca avaṇyam sarvatra siddhāntaḥ eva dṛṣṭāntaḥ bhavati
translated: And there is no fault, for the conclusion is the example everywhere.

analyzed: yasya kasya cit nidarśanasya pratipatti kāraṇa tva siddheḥ
translated: Because the establishment of any example whatsoever is the cause of understanding,

analyzed: utkarṣaḥ vā grahaṇāt viśeṣasya
translated: or the transference due to the mention of the special feature,

analyzed: vākya kṛtāt vā dīrgha soma saṃyogāt utkarṣaḥ
translated: or the transference due to the connection with the long Soma created by the sentence.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: na hoṣṭipaśu darvihomāpekṣayā somasya dīrghatvaṃ yuktaṃ vijātīyatvādanupāttatvācca /
analyzed: na ha uṣṭi paśu darvi homa apekṣayā somasya dīrgha tvam yuktam vijātīya tvāt anupātta tvāt ca
translated: It is not proper to consider the Soma sacrifice as long in relation to the Ishti and animal sacrifices, because they belong to different categories and are not mentioned.

analyzed: sarvatra pratiyogini upātte dīrgha hasva ādi vibhāgaḥ bhavati
translated: The distinction of long and short, etc. is made only when there is a counter-entity mentioned everywhere.

original: na cātreṣṭavādaya upāttā yānālocya jyotiṣṭomo dīrgha ityucyeta /
analyzed: na ca atra iṣṭa vādayaḥ upāttāḥ yān ālocya jyotiṣṭomaḥ dīrghaḥ iti ucyeta
translated: And here the Ishti, etc. are not mentioned, in relation to which the Jyotistoma could be said to be long.

analyzed: nanu soma yāga bhedaḥ api anupāttaḥ eva
translated: But the difference in the Soma sacrifices is also not mentioned.

original: yadyapyanupāttastathāpi tulya jātīyatvaṃ tāvadastyapekṣākāraṇaṃ vi śeṣaṇa viśeṣyabhāvācca somatve sati dīrghatvamupādoyamānaṃ somāntaramya vyavacchedārthameva vijñāyate /
analyzed: yadi api anupāttaḥ tathā api tulya jātīya tvam tāvat asti apekṣā kāraṇam vi śeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvāt ca soma tve sati dīrgha tvam upādoyamānam soma antarasya vyavaccheda artham eva vijñāyate
translated: Even though it is not mentioned, there is still a cause for expectation in the form of belonging to the same class, and the longness, when mentioned as qualified by the quality of being Soma, is understood to be for the purpose of excluding other Somas.

original: teṣāṃ kaḥ punarghaḥ kuto vā dīrgha ityapekṣite jyotiṣṭomastāvanna kutaśviddīrgha iti tato'nye gṛhyante teṣāṃ ca prāthamyātma evāpekṣākāraṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: teṣām kaḥ punarghaḥ kutas vā dīrghaḥ iti apekṣite jyotiṣṭomaḥ tāvat na kutaśvid dīrghaḥ iti tatas anye gṛhyante teṣām ca prāthamya ātmaḥ eva apekṣā kāraṇam bhavati
translated: When it is asked which one is long and from where, and the Jyotistoma is not long from anywhere, then the others are included. And for them, the mere fact of being first becomes the cause for expectation.

analyzed: kartṛtaḥ vā viśeṣasya tad nimitta tvāt
translated: Or the distinction is due to the agent, because it is caused by that.

original: yayā kathaṃ ciddīrghamomaśabde 'vakalpyamāne na yuktaḥ prakaraṇabādhaḥ
analyzed: yayā katham cit dīrgha moma śabde na yuktaḥ prakaraṇa bādhaḥ
translated: When the word 'Soma' is somehow construed as 'long', the violation of context is not proper.

analyzed: kratutaḥ vā arthavāda anupapatte syāt
translated: It should be due to the sacrifice, because the eulogy would not be appropriate otherwise.

original: ṛtata eva dedhye samānādhikaraṇa samāsa ityarthaḥ
analyzed: ṛtatas eva dedhye samāna adhikaraṇa samāsaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the compound is in apposition, due to the truth itself.

original: dīrghe haskhe ca karttari karmaṇastulyarūpatvāddā caitahakarjā viśeṣaṇam/
analyzed: dīrghe has khe ca karttari karmaṇaḥ tulya rūpa tvāt dā viśeṣaṇam
translated: In the long and short sacrifices, the word 'da' is a qualifier of the action, because the action and the object have the same form.

analyzed: svatas viśeṣaṇam tu antaraṅgam
translated: But a qualifier from itself is more essential.

analyzed: saṃsthāsu kartṛ vat dhāraṇa artha aviśeṣāt
translated: In the modifications, like in the agent, because of the non-distinction of the purpose of holding.

analyzed: paricoḍhanā pada uttara bhūtam etat sūtram
translated: This sutra comes after the words 'paricodana' and 'apada'.

original: mā nāmāgniṣṭomasaṃsthā yāṃ niveśo bhūdukyyādiṣu tvagniṣṭomāpekṣayā dīrghasomaśabda upapahasyane prakaraṇaṃ cānugrahīṣyate /
analyzed: mā nāma agniṣṭoma saṃsthā yām niveśaḥ bhūdukyya ādiṣu tu agniṣṭoma apekṣayā dīrghasoma śabdaḥ prakaraṇam ca anugrahīṣyate
translated: Let there not be an insertion of the Agnistoma modification in the Ukthya etc., but the word 'long Soma' in relation to the Agnistoma will be used figuratively, and the context will be favored.

analyzed: tasmāt tisuṣu api saṃsthāsu niveśaḥ iti prakaraṇa a viśeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, the insertion is in all three modifications. This is the non-distinction of context.

original: saṃtarddanasya punarnityenāgrahaṇātkevacā nitya vi ṣayatvaṃ na virudhyate /
analyzed: saṃtarddanasya punar nityena a grahaṇāt kevacā nitya viṣaya tvam na virudhyate
translated: But the repetition is not contradicted as being only for the eternal, because of the non-grasping of the eternal by the eternal.

analyzed: tasmāt saṃsthā niveśaḥ iti ukta abhidhīyate
translated: Therefore, it is said that the insertion is in the modifications.

original: satyapyatra karmakāntayodorghatve tāvānevātideśaprāpto daśamaṣṭiḥ somo 'bhiṣūyate dhāraṇasya tu tulyatvādṛṣṭārthavāḍha yoranupapattiḥ syāt/
analyzed: sati api atra karmaka antayoḥ dorgha tve tāvān eva atideśa prāptaḥ daśamaṣṭiḥ somaḥ bhiṣūyate dhāraṇasya tu tulya tva a dṛṣṭa artha vāḍha yoḥ anupapattiḥ syāt
translated: Even though there is length in the action here, only that much of the tenth cup obtained by extension is pressed, but because of the equality of holding, the non-applicability of the seen and unseen purposes would be a fault.

analyzed: pradāna vivṛddhyā nyūna pātra agrahaṇāt ca somavṛddhiḥ bhabṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: The Soma would increase by the increase in the quantity given, and by taking it from a less qualified vessel.

original: viṣyatīti cenna daśamuṣṭitriparvaparimāpāyoḥ śābdatvātpradānavivṛdvistoyādivṛddhyā saṃpādanīyā tasmādaviśiṣṭaṃ dhāraṇamityuhakarṣaḥ
analyzed: viṣyati iti ced na daśa muṣṭi tri parva parimāpa ayoḥ śābda tvāt pradāna vivṛd vis toya ādi vṛddhyā saṃpādanīyā tasmāt aviśiṣṭam dhāraṇam iti uhakarṣaḥ
translated: If it is argued that this is not so, because the quantity is measured by ten handfuls and three joints, and can be accomplished by increasing the quantity given and the vessel, therefore the holding is not distinguished - this is the objection.

analyzed: anitya tvāt iti niyata parimāṇa tvasya aniyata tvāt iti manyate
translated: He thinks that it is because the fixed quantity is not fixed.

analyzed: na tu etat yuktam
translated: But this is not proper.

analyzed: kutas tantravārtika
translated: Why?

analyzed: agniṣṭoma anya mātre hi dīrgha śabdaḥ uvakalpate
translated: The word long is appropriate only in the context of the Agnistoma.

analyzed: atha anyena iti vat tasmāt saṃsthā kratu antara grahaḥ
translated: If it is different from that, then the conclusion is that the Soma-sacrifice is a different ritual.

analyzed: prakṛti vat śabda pūrṇa tvāt ca na tāsām prakaraṇam asti
translated: And because of the completeness of the word in the archetype, they do not have a context.

original: na hyetad gṛhītaṃ prākṛtaṃ kiṃ ciḍhaṅgaṃ punaruccārya vidhīyate prathamopadigyamānajyotiṣṭomadharmamadhyapātitvāditaśca na saṃsthānāṃ prakaraṇamasti /
analyzed: na hi etat gṛhītam prākṛtam kim ciḍhaṅgam punar uccārya vidhīyate prathama upadigyamāna jyotiṣṭoma dharma madhyapāti tvāt itas ca na saṃsthānām prakaraṇam asti
translated: For nothing taken from the archetype is repeated and enjoined again. Because it is included in the middle of the dharma of the Jyotistoma taught first, therefore the context of the Soma-sacrifices does not exist.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: yadi hi saṃtarddanamukthyādīnvidhāyāvāntaraprakaraṇo śrūyeta tataḥ syādapi prakaraṇagrahaṇamidaṃ tu saṃsthādhikaraṇanyāyena tadagrāhau jyotiṣṭomadharmairantaritatvānna saṃsthākathaṃbhāvānuṣaṅgena saṃ spṛśyate /
analyzed: yadi hi saṃtarddanam ukthya ādīn vidhāya avāntara prakaraṇaḥ śrūyeta tatas syāt api prakaraṇa grahaṇam idam tu saṃsthā adhikaraṇa nyāyena tad agrāhau jyotiṣṭoma dharmaiḥ antarita tvāt na saṃsthā kathaṃbhāva anuṣaṅgena sam spṛśyate
translated: For, if, after the injunction of the Samvarga, Ukthya, etc., it were heard in an intermediate section, then there might be an inclusion by the context. But this is not grasped by the principle of the section on the establishment, because it is interrupted by the characteristics of the Jyotiṣṭoma, and is not touched by the continuation of the consideration of the establishment.

original: tasmānna prakaraṇaṃ saṃsthānaṃ vā saṃsthāsu viniyojakam/
analyzed: tasmāt na prakaraṇam saṃsthānam vā saṃsthāsu viniyojakam
translated: For if, after enjoining the Sāmidhenī verses, Ukthya and other sacrifices, it were mentioned in an intermediate section, then there could be an inclusion by context. But by the principle of the section on the completion of the Jyotiṣṭoma, that is not grasped, because it is interrupted by the characteristics of the Jyotiṣṭoma. Therefore, neither context nor completion is the determiner in the completion sacrifices.

original: kiṃ taī vākyameva tacca dīrghasomatvāviśeṣātma cāhīnedhvapi tulyamiti sarvadharmatā
analyzed: kim vākyam eva tat ca dīrgha soma tva aviśeṣa ātma ca ahīnedhu api tulyam iti sarva dharmatā
translated: What then? The sentence itself. And that is the same even in the deficient, because of the absence of the distinction of being a long Soma sacrifice. Thus all the characteristics belong to it.

analyzed: tatra kim prāptam
translated: What is the conclusion there?

analyzed: naimittikam vā kartṛ saṃyogāt liṅgatantravārtike
translated: Or it is occasional, because of the connection with the agent. This is based on the indication.

analyzed: sya tad nimitta tvāt
translated: Because that is the cause of it.

original: yadi prathamaśabdoyaṃ nāma syāt jyotiṣaḥ svataḥ /
analyzed: yadi prathama śabdaḥ iyam nāma syāt jyotiṣaḥ svatas
translated: If this word 'first' were the name of the Jyotiṣṭoma itself,

analyzed: tatas evam bhavet eṣa prayoga kratu vācakaḥ
translated: then this usage would be an expression for the sacrifice.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: Third section of the third chapter.

analyzed: dvā
translated: Two

original: tannāma viśeṣavacanenopasaṃhiyate yat ṛtusaṃyomāyāsamarthaṃ kathaṃ citparokṣavṛttyā saṃyujyate yathā sāptadaśyam
analyzed: tat nāma viśeṣa vacanena upasaṃhiyate yat ṛtu saṃyoma āyā samartham katham cit parokṣa vṛttyā saṃyujyate yathā sāptadaśyam
translated: That name is concluded by the statement of the specific. It is somehow connected by indirect application with what is incapable of being connected with the sacrifice, like the Saptadaśa-stoma.

analyzed: etāvat tviā avadhārayitum śakyam
translated: This much, however, can be ascertained.

analyzed: na ayam anārabhyavādaḥ prakṛteḥ anyatra gacchati
translated: This non-beginning statement does not go elsewhere than the context.

original: yadi gacchettata iṣṭipaśubandhānapi gacchenna va gantumarhati purastādupasadāmiti /
analyzed: yadi gacchet tatas iṣṭi paśubandhān api gacchet na gantum arhati purastāt upasadām iti
translated: If it were to go, then it would go even to the Ishti and animal sacrifice, but it should not go to the statement before the Upasads.

analyzed: sthāna niyamasya tatra anupapateḥ
translated: Because the restriction of place is not possible there.

analyzed: atas yatra upasadaḥ tatra gacchati
translated: Therefore, it goes where there are Upasads.

original: tataśca prāptikālavaiṣamyātprakṛtau tāvattāḥ santītyantareṇāpi vacanaṃ gacchetkimuta yadā vi spaṣṭameva vacanaṃ / sphuṭa sāmānyasaṃbandha sthāpi caivamāderupasaṃhāra iti vyākhyātaṃ caturddhā karaṇe/
analyzed: tatas ca prāpti kāla vaiṣamyāt prakṛtau tāvat tāḥ santi iti antareṇa api vacanam gacchet kim uta yadā spaṣṭam eva vacanam sphuṭa ca evamādeḥ upasaṃhāraḥ iti vyākhyātam caturddhā karaṇe
translated: And from that, because of the difference in the time of attainment, even without a statement, it would go in the context where they exist, what to speak of when there is a clear statement. And it has been explained in the fourfold instrument that the conclusion of such statements is like this even in the case of a clear general connection.

original: tasmādutpatti viniyogābhyāmevāpunaruktatva / mevaṃ sati yeṣāṃ prakaraṇaeva pravargyapāṭhastaiḥ saha saṃgatārthatā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tasmāt utpatti viniyogābhyām eva apunarukta tvam evam sati yeṣām prakaraṇe eva pravargya pāṭhaḥ taiḥ saha saṃgata artha tā bhaviṣyati
translated: Therefore, because of the origin and application, there is no repetition. When this is so, it will be connected with the meaning of those for whom the Pravargya is recited only in the context.

original: yadi tarhi dvayorapyekavākyatvenāgniṣṭome pravṛ paktītyayamartho niṣyannastato na prathamayajñe ityetasyāprathamayajñe agniṣṭomaityevaṃ pravarttamānasya na kaściddirodha iti paryudāsānnityamevākaraṇena bhavitavyamata evaṃ varṇanīyam
analyzed: yadi tarhi dvayoḥ api eka vākya tvena agniṣṭome pravṛ pakti iti ayam arthaḥ niṣyannaḥ tatas na prathama yajñe iti etasya a prathama yajñe agniṣṭomaḥ eti evam pravarttamānasya na kaścid dirodhaḥ iti paryudāsāt nityam eva akaraṇena bhavitavyam atas evam varṇanīyam
translated: If, then, in the case of the two sentences, the meaning that the Agniṣṭoma is to be performed at the first sacrifice is obtained by syntactical connection, then there is no contradiction in the sentence that is used in the sense of not at the first sacrifice, namely, the Agniṣṭoma is not to be performed at the first sacrifice. Therefore, it should not be explained in this way.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: tataśca yasmādikalpāddibhyadbhiḥ paryudāsa āśrīyate sa tasminsatyapyāgata iti varaṃ śabdasvarasalabhyaḥ pratiṣedha evāśritaḥ / tena prathamāhāre 'gniṣṭome vikalpaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca yasmāt ikalpāt dibhyadbhiḥ paryudāsaḥ āśrīyate sa tasmin sati api āgataḥ iti varam śabda sva rasa labhyaḥ pratiṣedhaḥ eva āśritaḥ tena prathama āhāre gniṣṭome vikalpaḥ
translated: And from that, since the exclusion is accepted as beginning from that Kalpa, it is said to have come even when that exists. It is better to accept the prohibition that is obtained by the natural meaning of the word itself. Therefore, there is an option in the first Agniṣṭoma meal.

original: tatrāpi yadā keṣāṃ cidīdṛśaṃ vacanaṃ kāmaṃ yonūcānaḥ śrotriyaḥ syāttasya pravṛ'jyāditi tadā pratiprasavavacanasya vikalpakāriṇaḥ kartṛviśeṣagāmitvātadviṣaya eva vikalponyeṣāṃ nityamevābhāvaḥ
analyzed: tatra api yadā keṣām cit īdṛśam vacanam kāmam yaḥ unūcānaḥ śrotriyaḥ syāt tasya pravṛjyāt iti tadā pratiprasava vacanasya vikalpa kāriṇaḥ kartṛ viśeṣa gāmi tvāt tad viṣayaḥ eva vikalpaḥ anyeṣām nityam eva abhāvaḥ
translated: Even there, when some have such a statement as If one who is learned in the Veda desires to be a Srotriya, his initiation should be done, then, because the statement of re-permission, which causes the option, goes to a particular agent, the option is only in that case, and for others it is always non-existence.

original: satyaṃ prāptasya punarvacanaṃ tāvanmātraphalamanarthakamiti sāmarthyāt prakarṣagatirvijñāsyate /
analyzed: satyam prāptasya punarvacanam tāvat mātra phalam anarthakam iti sāmarthyāt prakarṣa gatiḥ vijñāsyate
translated: It is true that the restatement of what has been obtained has only that much result and is useless. Therefore, by implication, the superior meaning will be understood.

analyzed: yathā abhirūpāya kanyā deyā iti atra abhirūpatarāya iti gamyate
translated: As in the case of the injunction, 'The girl should be given to a handsome bridegroom,' it is understood that she should be given to one more handsome.

analyzed: anūcāna grahaṇam tu brāhmaṇasya anuvacana saṃbandhāt kṣatriya vaiṣya nivṛtti artham bhaviṣyati
translated: But the mention of the learned Brāhmaṇa is for the purpose of excluding the Kṣatriya and the Vaiśya, because the Brāhmaṇa is connected with the study of the Veda.

analyzed: tat etat atirāceṣī evam eva prāpnoti
translated: This very thing would apply to the Atiratra.

original: tana prathamayajñaiti pratiṣedhādanagniṣṭomatvena ca pratiprasavābhāvānnityameva na karttavyaḥ/
analyzed: tana prathama yajñaḥ eti pratiṣedhāt anagniṣṭoma tvena ca pratiprasava abhāvāt nityam eva na karttavyaḥ
translated: And because it is prohibited by the text, 'Not at the first sacrifice,' and because there is no re-affirmation without the Agniṣṭoma, it should never be performed.

analyzed: vikṛti antareṣu prathama prayoga anupapatteḥ nityam eva karaṇam
translated: In other modifications, the performance is always necessary, because the first performance is impossible.

original: nanu tatrāpi na prathamayajñaityatideśādagniṣṭomasvarūpasya ca pratiprasava nimittasyābhāvātprathamaprayogeṣvabhāva eva prāpnoti/
analyzed: nanu tatra api na prathama yajñaḥ eti atideśāt agniṣṭoma svarūpasya ca pratiprasava nimittasya abhāvāt prathama prayogeṣu abhāvaḥ eva prāpnoti
translated: But there also, because of the extension of the prohibition, 'Not at the first sacrifice,' and because there is no re-affirmation of the form of the Agniṣṭoma, which is the cause of re-affirmation, the absence would be proper in the first performances.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

original: prathamaśabdasyāviśeṣitasya sarvādo pravarttamānasyānyatrāpravṛtteḥ tasmātkaṃbalajyotiṣṭomaprathama prayogatṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: prathama śabdasya a viśeṣitasya sarva ādau pravarttamānasya anyatra apravṛtteḥ tasmāt kaṃbala jyotiṣṭoma prathama prayoga tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ
translated: Because the word 'first,' which is not qualified, is used in all cases, and is not used elsewhere, therefore the performance of the Kāmbala Jyotiṣṭoma is the first performance.

original: viṣaya eva caiṣa pratiṣedha iti siddham
analyzed: viṣayaḥ eva ca eṣa pratiṣedhaḥ iti siddham
translated: And thus it is established that this prohibition refers only to that.

analyzed: tat sarva artham aviśeṣāt
translated: That refers to all, because there is no distinction.

original: carau vārthoktaṃ puroḍāśe vipratiṣe dhātpaśau na syāt
analyzed: carau vā artha uktam puroḍāśe vipratiṣe dhāt paśau na syāt
translated: In the case of the rice-gruel, it is a mere statement of fact; in the case of the cake, it is a prohibition; therefore it should not be done in the case of the animal.

original: yadi kaściddadellaukikapiṣṭe pādānenāpi puroḍāśasiddheneṃkāntenārthācepa iti taṃ pratyucyate /
analyzed: yadi kaścid dadet laukika piṣṭe pādānena api puroḍāśa siddhena iṃkāntena artha ācepaḥ iti tam pratyucyate
translated: If someone were to offer it in ordinary flour, even with the accomplished cake, it would be a mere statement of fact. In response to that, it is said:

analyzed: arthe
translated: In the case of the cake.

original: nāma prākṛta upakāraḥ tasya prakṛtau peṣaṇaṃ sāghanamāsīdatastena pūrvataraprāptenoktaṃ puroḍāśe peṣaṇam /
analyzed: nāma prākṛtaḥ upakāraḥ tasya prakṛtau peṣaṇam sāghanam āsīt atas tena pūrvatara prāptena uktam puroḍāśe peṣaṇam
translated: The original benefit is grinding. That was the preparation in the original. Therefore, by that which is obtained earlier, the grinding in the cake is stated.

original: pau ca pradhāna vaiguṇyaṃ syāttadvi hṛdayādyākṛtikena tataścāvattena sāghayitavyam /
analyzed: ca pradhāna vaiguṇyam syāt tat vi hṛdaya ādi ākṛtikena tatas ca avattena sāghayitavyam
translated: And there would be a deficiency in the principal in the case of the animal. Therefore, it should be prepared with that which is cut from the heart and other parts.

original: na ca piṣṭe tadākṛtikādavadīyeta punastadākārakaraṇepi mṛdgavayādivaṅgauṇādavadīyamāne vaiguṇyameva /
analyzed: na ca piṣṭe tad ākṛtikāt avadīyeta punar tad ākāra karaṇe api mṛd gavaya ādi vaṅgauṇāt avadīyamāne vaiguṇyam eva
translated: And the form would not be cut from the flour. Even if the form is made again, if the secondary is cut from the clay, cow-dung, etc., there would be only a deficiency.

analyzed: utpādana deśāt avadyati iti ca śrūyate
translated: And it is heard that it is cut from the place of origin.

original: na ca hṛdayāde piṣṭasya jñāyeta katareṇa pradeśenedaṃ paśorutkṛttamiti /
analyzed: na ca hṛdayāde piṣṭasya jñāyeta katareṇa pradeśena idam paśoḥ utkṛttam iti
translated: And it would not be known from the heart etc. of the flour which part of the animal this is cut from.

analyzed: tasmāt carau apratiṣidm anartha prāptam ca peṣaṇam iti tatra eva vidhīyate
translated: Therefore, the grinding, which is not prohibited in the case of the rice-gruel and is obtained without purpose, is enjoined there itself.

original: nanvadantako hītihetva viśeṣātyaśupuroḍāśayorapi prāptevidānāni taccheṣāśca piṣṭvā dāsyante /
analyzed: tad śeṣāḥ ca piṣṭvā dāsyante
translated: But it is not so, because of the special reason 'because it is not death'. Even for the barley and cake, the grinding would be obtained, and the grinding and its remnants would be given after grinding.

analyzed: na ca prāpti vipratiṣedhau bhaviṣyataḥ
translated: And there would be no contradiction in the obtaining.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

original: yavadānasya pradānaprakramatvāt nāntarā peṣaṇena vyavadhānaṃ yuktaṃ / hetuvannigadasya ca stutimātrārthatvaṃ vacyate /
analyzed: yavadānasya pradāna prakrama tvāt na antarā peṣaṇena vyavadhānam yuktam hetuvat nigadasya ca stuti mātra artha tvam vacyate
translated: Because the offering of barley is in the process of offering, it is not proper to interrupt it in the middle with grinding. And it is said that the injunctive statement is only for the purpose of praise, like the reason.

original: tena svakrama sthasyaiva preṣaṇasya vidhiḥ /🔽upanītamātrameva ca peṣaṇaṃ puroḍāśe 'nuvādabuddhyā gṛhyate /
analyzed: tena sva krama sthasya eva preṣaṇasya vidhiḥ  upanīta mātram eva ca peṣaṇam puroḍāśe nuvāda buddhyā gṛhyate
translated: Therefore, the injunction is only for the grinding that remains in its own sequence.🔽And the grinding, as soon as it is brought, is accepted in the cake with the understanding that it is a restatement.

original: carau ca nivarttamānaṃ pratiprasavatvena paśau punaratyantāprāptavidhitvena /
analyzed: carau ca nivarttamānam pratiprasava tvena paśau punar atyanta aprāpta vidhi tvena
translated: And in the charu, it is reversed, and in the animal sacrifice, it is again enjoined as something not at all obtained.

analyzed: na ca etāni ekasya eva vākyasya etāvanti rūpāṇi vijñāyante
translated: And these forms are not known to belong to only one sentence to this extent.

analyzed: tatra avagya mā aikarūpye bhyupagantavye lāghavāt arthaṃvat tvāt ca pratiprasava tvam eva avadhāraṇīyam
translated: There, when uniformity must be accepted, due to lightness and meaningfulness, the reversal itself must be determined.

analyzed: evam siddham kevala caru viṣaya tvam
translated: Thus it is established that it pertains only to the charu.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: gatiḥ sarva padārthānām laukika vyavahārataḥ
translated: The course of all things is from worldly usage.

analyzed: tatra pāka viśeṣaḥ ca caru tvena a vadhāryate
translated: And there, the particular cooking is determined as the quality of the charu.

analyzed: pakṣa uktam prayojanam iti mandam phanam uktam
translated: The purpose stated in the alternative is said to be weak.

original: etāvāntamamādhiḥ aviśeṣepina puroḍāśārtha tvaṃ prayojanaṃ kiṃ tarṣi paścarthatvamiti
analyzed: etāvān tama mādhiḥ puroḍāśa artha tvam prayojanam kim tarṣi paścartha tvam iti
translated: This much is the extent of the doubt: Even without distinction, what is the purpose of being for the purpose of the cake? Is it being for the purpose of the charu?

analyzed: dharma vipratiṣedhāt ca
translated: And due to the contradiction of dharma.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: Third section of the third chapter.

analyzed: ita ca eka daivaye
translated: And for this reason, even in the case of a single deity,

original: piṃṣyādadhaṃ samastaṃ vā didevatye carau bhavān /
analyzed: samastam vā didevatye carau bhavān
translated: One should grind the entire charu dedicated to two deities, or the entire charu dedicated to one deity.

analyzed: ka vaiṣamyam
translated: In the former case, there is inequality; in the latter, there is confusion.

original: nanu caitatsarvaṃ dvidevatyeṣu bhavatopi samānaṃ tathā hi
analyzed: nanu ca etat sarvam dvi devatyeṣu bhavatā api samānam tathā hi
translated: But all this is the same even in the case of those dedicated to two deities. Thus,

original: sa cāṅgīkṛto miśrasya haviṣo miśra devatoddeśena yugapaddāne virodhābhāvāt
analyzed: sa ca aṅgīkṛtaḥ miśrasya haviṣaḥ miśra devatā uddeśena yugapad dāne virodha abhāvāt
translated: And that is accepted, because there is no contradiction in offering the mixed oblation simultaneously with the intention of the mixed deity.

analyzed: dharmeṣu evam bhavet idam
translated: This would be the case with the rites employed in the unseen potentiality of the sacrifice.

original: bhavataḥ peṣaṇaṃ tvetaddevatādharma saṃmatam🔽na ca tad didevatye tathāvasthitamityapravṛttireva /
analyzed: bhavataḥ peṣaṇam tu etat devatā dharma saṃmatam  na ca tat didevatye tathā avasthitam iti apravṛttiḥ eva
translated: But this grinding of yours is accepted as the property of the deity.🔽And that does not remain so in the case of those dedicated to two deities, so there is no engagement at all.

original: havirantareṣvapi ca hidevatyeṣvevaṃ prakāratvameveti devatā guṇabhūtā
analyzed: haviḥ antareṣu api ca hi devatyeṣu evam prakāra tvam eva iti devatā guṇa bhūtā
translated: And in the case of those dedicated to different deities, it is of this very type, so the deity is subordinate.

original: bhavatā punarasadabhyupagamena dvidevatye peṣaṇaṃ vaktumaśaknuvatā 'vaśyaṃ devatānimittatantravārtika /
analyzed: bhavatā punar asat abhyupagamena dvi devatye peṣaṇam vaktum aśaknuvatā vaśyam devatā nimitta tantra vārtika
translated: But you, being unable to explain the grinding in the two-deity offering due to accepting the non-existent, must necessarily explain it as based on the deity.

analyzed: tu tvam abhyupagantavyam
translated: But you, being unable to speak of the grinding in the two-deity offering due to accepting the non-existent, must necessarily accept the dependence on the deity.

original: tataśca devatayoḥ prādhānyāde kekā svabhāgamasaṃkīrṇaṃ prārthayataiti tathaiva dānamanuṣṭheyam
analyzed: tatas ca devatayoḥ prādhānyāt e kekā sva bhāgam asaṃkīrṇam prārthayata eti tathā eva dānam anuṣṭheyam
translated: And from that, because the deities are primary, each one should request its own unmixed portion. Thus the offering should be performed accordingly.

analyzed: tatra brūmaḥ
translated: To that we say:

original: tatrānyasya bhā mādanyama avadīyamāne vaiguṇyaṃ bhavati🔽carumiti yāgaṃ pratyupādīyamānatvena vivakṣitaikasaṃkhyasya pātrakṛtabhedāśrayaṇe śāstravādhaprasaṅgā / dato na kathaṃ cidapi pratiṣidvadharmakaṃ dvidevatye peṣaṇaṃ bhavatīti na kartavyam
analyzed: tatra anyasya bhās avadīyamāne vaiguṇyam bhavati  carum iti yāgam pratyupādīyamāna tvena vivakṣita eka saṃkhyasya pātra kṛta bheda āśrayaṇe śāstra vādha prasaṅgāḥ na katham cit api dvi devatye peṣaṇam bhavati iti na kartavyam
translated: There, when one is cut for another, there is a defect.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Because the number one, intended as being offered for the sacrifice in the word charu, would be contradicted by the scriptures if it relied on the difference created by the vessel, therefore the grinding in the two-deity offering, which has a prohibited property in no way, should not be done. Why?

original: haviṣo yadi poṣṇasya tadyāgāṅgasya vā bhavet /
analyzed: haviṣaḥ yadi poṣṇasya tat yāga aṅgasya vā bhavet
translated: If it were of the offering or of the subsidiary of that sacrifice of Pushan,

analyzed: an ukta tvāt dvi devatye na bhava iti eṣaṇam tatas
translated: because it is not mentioned, the grinding would not be in the two-deity offering. Therefore it is not to be done.

original: tenāsatyapyatra pūṣṇo devatātve samavāyamātreṇopanakṣaṇatvād iyoddeśenāpi ca tyajyamānasya samaṃ yādaśrutatvādityanena nyāyeṃnā pūṣṇo bhāga iti gamyate
analyzed: tena asati api atra pūṣṇaḥ devatā tve samavāya mātreṇa upanakṣaṇa tvāt iyaḥ uddeśena api ca tyajyamānasya samam yāt aśruta tvāt iti anena nyāyeṃna pūṣṇaḥ bhāgaḥ iti gamyate
translated: Therefore, even though Pūṣan is not the deity here, due to mere inherence, it is understood that Pūṣan's share is to be offered, by the reasoning that what is being given up is equal to what is not heard, because of being mentioned by the word 'iḍā'.

original: athāpi kiṃ na etenāśrutena kṛtenetyevamamātrapeṣaṇa mevādhyavasīyate tathāpi kena citkauśalena pākasaṃpādanayogapadyaniśśepapācaikatvayorvā guṇatvādara bāgha iti nirūpya kārya me va peṣaṇamiti
analyzed: atha api kim na etena a śrutena kṛtena iti evam amātra peṣaṇam meva adhyavasīyate tathā api kena cit kauśalena pāka saṃpādana yogapadya niśśepa pāca ekatvayoḥ vā guṇa tva ādara bāghaḥ iti nirūpya kārya me peṣaṇam iti
translated: Even if it is concluded that mere grinding is to be done by this much, even then, due to the capability of some skill in the simultaneous accomplishment of cooking, or due to the non-obstruction of the oneness of cooking, the grinding should be determined as the effect.

analyzed: tatra abhidhīyate
translated: To that, it is said:

original: tenāgneyendrapīta śabdābhyāṃ samarthāgnīndragrāhibhyāṃ videvatyāgrahaṇaṃ yukta / miha punaḥ pūṣapadasyāsamāsabhākkāt prapiṣṭabhāgaśabdayośca sāpekṣepi pūṣaṇi sāmarthyāvighātāt na kiṃci d duṣyatītyupaścajaṇatā
analyzed: tena āgneya indra pīta śabdābhyām samartha agni indra grāhibhyām videvatya a grahaṇam yuktam iha punar pūṣa padasya a samāsa bhākkāt prapiṣṭabhāga śabdayoḥ ca sa apekṣe api pūṣaṇi sāmarthya avighātāt na kiṃcid duṣyati iti upaśca jaṇatā
translated: Therefore, the mention of the deity is proper with the words 'offered to Agni' and 'drunk by Indra', which denote the capable Agni and Indra. But here, even though the word 'Pūṣan' is not a compound word, and the words 'ground' and 'share' are dependent on Pūṣan, there is no contradiction due to the non-obstruction of capability. Thus, the grinding is subsidiary.

original: na ca sadvitīyasya padantā jāyantaiti hetusāmyādyuktaṃ peṣaṇam
analyzed: na ca sa dvitīyasya pad antāḥ jāyanta eti hetu sāmyāt yuktam peṣaṇam
translated: And it is not argued that the grinding is done because words ending with a dvandva compound do not occur.

original: vacanātsarvapeṣaṇaṃ taṃ prati śāstravattvādarthābhāvāddhi carāvapeṣaṇaṃ bhavati
analyzed: vacanāt sarva peṣaṇam tam prati śāstravat tvāt artha abhāvāt hi carau apeṣaṇam bhavati
translated: Because of the statement, all grinding is for him, due to the authoritative nature of the scripture. And because of the absence of meaning, the grinding of the animal is done.

analyzed: vidhi tvāt nema piṣṭa tvam aniṅga viparyaya sādhanam ca iti atas āāha
translated: Because of the injunctive nature, the grinding on the stone is not an accessory. And the proof of the opposite is stated. Therefore he says:

original: tadyadi tāvadyaścaruḥ sa nemapiṣṭa iti vidhīyate tataḥ sarvaca viṣayāvadhāraye sati somā pauṣṇaśabda ekaṭeśānuvādonarthakaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tat yadi tāvat yaḥ caruḥ sa nema piṣṭaḥ iti vidhīyate tatas sati syāt
translated: If the gruel is enjoined as not ground on the stone, then when the object is determined in all cases, the word 'of Pūṣan' would be meaningless as a mere restatement of the one-pointedness.

original: atha somāpauṣṇamātramuddiśyate tatopi sarvapeṣaṇameva saddevatyahavi rmātrapratītyā paśupuroḍāśayorapi grahaṇāt /
analyzed: atha somāpauṣṇa mātram uddiśyate tatas upi sarva peṣaṇam eva sat devatya haviḥ mātra pratītyā paśupuroḍāśayoḥ api grahaṇāt
translated: If only the 'of Soma and Pūṣan' is specified, then even though all grinding is established by the mere understanding of the deity, the animal cake is also included.

analyzed: tatas ca pūrvavat caru śabda ānarthakya prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And then, as before, the word 'gruel' would be meaningless.

original: taṃ prati hi somāpauṣṇamaviśeṣitaṃ pratipeṣaṇasya śāstravatvaṃ viśeṣaṇārthābhāvāt /
analyzed: tam prati hi somāpauṣṇam aviśeṣitam pratipeṣaṇasya śāstrava tvam viśeṣaṇa artha abhāvāt
translated: For in relation to that, the authoritative nature of the grinding is in relation to the unspecified 'of Soma and Pūṣan', because there is no purpose for the specification.

analyzed: etasmin pakṣe carau apeṣaṇam bhavati
translated: And in this view, the grinding of the animal is done.

original: na cātyantākatirnaśyena cotsādadeśamohaḥ syāditarotmādadeśasya spaṣṭatvena ca piṣṭopi san pūṣabhāga upacacyate na sarvapreṣaṇavanmuhyeta /
analyzed: na ca atyanta akatiḥ naśyena ca utsāda deśa mohaḥ syāt itara utmāda deśasya spaṣṭa tvena ca piṣṭaḥ api san pūṣa bhāgaḥ upacacyate na sarva preṣaṇa vat muhyeta
translated: And there would not be confusion about the place of destruction by complete non-existence. The other place of destruction is clearly stated, and even though ground, the portion of Pūṣan is added, and would not be confused like all grinding.

original: atha vāsminpace vācanikatvādadṛṣṭārthe peṣaṇe satya piṣṭādevāvadīyeta /
analyzed: atha vā asmin pace vācanika tvāt adṛṣṭa arthe peṣaṇe satya piṣṭāt eva avadīyeta
translated: Or, in this case, the grinding being for an unseen purpose, on account of the Vedic injunction, the offering would be made out of the flour.

original: naci tadaitaddevatānimittaṃ peṣaṇaṃ syāt /🔽tasmātmārvatrikatva prasaṅgānna pariśeṣasiddhaṃ caroḥ peṣaṇamiti tacchra tira narthikā prāpnotyeveti carudevatāsaṃbandhavidhipare vākye nemapiṣṭatvamatṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda /
analyzed: naci tadā etat devatā nimittam peṣaṇam syāt  tasmāt mārvatrika tva prasaṅgāt na pariśeṣa siddham caroḥ peṣaṇam iti tad śra tiḥ a narthikā prāpnoti eva iti caru devatā saṃbandha vidhi pare vākye nema piṣṭa tvam a tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pāda
translated: And then this grinding would not be for the sake of the deity.

analyzed: iti avaśyam abhyupagantavyam
translated: Therefore, because of the undesirable contingency of the Vedic injunction being meaningless, the grinding of the Charu is not established by the remainder. Thus the statement of the flour being ground by the pestle and mortar would be meaningless. Therefore, in a sentence enjoining the connection of the Charu with the deity, the grinding by the pestle and mortar must necessarily be accepted.

original: na hyeṣa devatādharmo na tadbhāgasya gamyate /
analyzed: na hi eṣa devatā dharmaḥ na tad bhāgasya gamyate
translated: For this is not a property of the deity, nor is it understood to be a part of it.

analyzed: pūṣa devatya yāga artham dharmaḥ tu eṣa pratīyate
translated: This is seen to be a property for the sacrifice having Pūṣan as the deity.

original: na hi taduddeśatyāgamātreṇa bhāgo bhavati kiṃ tarhi parigraheṇa /
analyzed: na hi tad uddeśa tyāga mātreṇa bhāgaḥ bhavati kim tarhi parigraheṇa
translated: For one does not become a part merely by offering with that as the object. What then? By acceptance.

original: karmasādhano hi bhāgaśabdo bhajyataiti bhāgaḥ sevyataityarthaḥ
analyzed: karma sādhanaḥ hi bhāga śabdaḥ bhajyate eti bhāgaḥ sevyate iti arthaḥ
translated: For the word 'bhāga' (part) is a means of action. 'Bhaj' means 'to be divided', the meaning is 'to be served'.

original: na ca haviraṃśa devatā bhajame bhoktṛtvasya navame niṣedhāt /
analyzed: na ca devatā bhajame bhoktṛ tvasya navame niṣedhāt
translated: And the deity is not a partaker of a portion of the oblation, because the idea of its being an enjoyer is denied in the ninth chapter.

original: athāpi bhajettathāpi tasyāḥ prayojakatvaṃ tatraiva nivārayiṣyate /
analyzed: athā api bhajet tathā api tasyāḥ prayojaka tvam tatra eva nivārayiṣyate
translated: Even if it were to partake, even then its being the motive will be refuted there itself.

analyzed: tena devatāvat bhāga dharma tva anupapatteḥ yāga dvārā apūrva dharmaḥ eva ayam
translated: Therefore, because it is not possible for it to be a property of the deity, this is a property of the unseen potency through the sacrifice.

analyzed: navama ādi a nyāyena devatā adhika raṇa nyāyena ca vijñāyate
translated: It is understood by the method of the ninth and by the method of the deity being additional.

original: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu devatādharmatva nirākaraṇaparega yāgadharmatvamabhihita miti draṣṭavyam
analyzed: bhāṣyakāreṇa tu devatā dharma tva nirākaraṇa parega yāga dharma tvam abhihitam iti draṣṭavyam
translated: But it should be seen that the author of the commentary has stated the property of the sacrifice, being intent on refuting the property of the deity.

original: tatra vākyasaṃyogādityukte pareṇa svābhiprāye vivṛte bhāgaśabdenaiva mukhyārthāsaṃbhavādyāgopādānamiti darśayati /
analyzed: tatra vākya saṃyogāt iti ukte pareṇa sva abhiprāye vivṛte bhāga śabdena eva mukhya artha asaṃbhavāt yāga upādānam iti darśayati
translated: There, when it is said that it is due to connection with the sentence, the opponent, having explained his intention, shows by the word part itself that the sacrifice is accepted due to the impossibility of the primary meaning.

original: parasvakhokaraṇātmakasya bhāgarūpasyāvidyamānatvā / dyasta duddeśena tyajyamānatvanāmāṃśī vidyate tena yāgo lacyate / sa caikadevatye tantravārtike /
analyzed: bhāga rūpasya avidyamāna tvāt tad uddeśena tyajyamāna tva nāma aṃśī vidyate tena yāgaḥ lacyate sa ca eka devatye tantravārtike
translated: Because there is no part in the form of a share that is of the nature of the other's property, it is abandoned by designation. There is a part that is being abandoned by the name of being offered. By that, the sacrifice is indicated. And that occurs in the one-deity sacrifice.

original: pūṣaviśiṣṭeo bhavatīti tadbhāgavyapadeśo ghaṭate / dvidevatye pu narvyāsaṅgo miśraḥ saṃkalponyatareṇa vyapadeṣṭumaśakya iti /
analyzed: bhavati iti tad bhāga vyapadeśaḥ ghaṭate dvi devatye nar vyāsaṅgaḥ miśraḥ saṃkalpaḥ anyatareṇa vyapadeṣṭum aśakyaḥ iti
translated: It becomes qualified by Pūṣan. Thus, the designation as a part is appropriate. In the two-deity sacrifice, the mixed intention is attached to both. It cannot be designated by either one.

original: yathaivaindrāmasya puroḍāśaya grahasya cāgneyendrapītaśabdābhyāmagrahaṇaṃ tathaindrā pauṣṇādeḥ pūṣabhāgatvena yadyapi caivaṃvidhaśabdoccāraṇadi samāsopālambho nāsti tathāpyartha eva bhāgaśabdagrāhyo na vidyataityapravṛttiḥ
analyzed: yathā eva aindrāmasya grahasya ca āgneya indra pīta śabdābhyām agrahaṇam tathā aindrā pauṣṇa ādeḥ pūṣa bhāga tvena yadi api ca evaṃvidha śabda uccāraṇa di samāsa upālambhaḥ na asti tathā api arthaḥ eva bhāga śabda grāhyaḥ na vidyate eti apravṛttiḥ
translated: Just as the cake for Indra-Agni and the cup for Indra are not taken by the words 'drunk by Indra' in the cake and cup for Indra-Agni, similarly, although there is no fault in the compound when such words are uttered, still the meaning to be taken by the word 'share' does not exist, so there is no application.
The state of having no teeth is the reason.

analyzed: yat tvad antakaḥ ha iti hetu nidarśanāt devatā dharma tvam iti
translated: It is said that if one has no teeth, it is a characteristic of the deity, because the reason is shown.

analyzed: tatra ucyate
translated: To that it is said:

analyzed: vacanam param
translated: The statement is supreme.

analyzed: nema piṣṭa ādiṣu prāpti abhāvāt vacanam bhaviṣyati
translated: In the case of nemi-grounding etc., the statement will be due to the absence of attainment.

original: aviśiṣṭa vidhiṃ cāpekṣya viśiṣṭavidhirṭarbalo bhavati na tvatrāsāvasti
analyzed: vidhim ca apekṣya viśiṣṭa vidhiḥ ṭar balaḥ bhavati na tu atra asau asti
translated: And the stronger rule is in relation to the unspecific rule, but it is not present here.

original: iti śrīmahakumārila svāmiviracite tantravārttike tṛtīyādhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ samāptaḥ
analyzed: iti śrī maha kumārila svāmi viracite tantra vārttike tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ pādaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: Thus ends the third chapter of the Tantravartika composed by the great teacher Kumaril on the third section.

analyzed: nivītam iti manuṣya dharmaḥ śabdasya tad pradhāna tvāt
translated: The word 'nivitam' is a human characteristic because the word is primary.

original: sa eva śrutyāditritayasya prakaraṇena saha virodhāvirodhavicāraḥ /
analyzed: saḥ eva śruti ādi tritayasya prakaraṇena saha virodha avirodha vicāraḥ
translated: The same consideration of the conflict and non-conflict of the three beginning with the Vedic text with the context.

original: tatra nivītaṃ manuṣyāṇāmityacaite pakṣā bhavanti kimayaṃ śuddhamanuṣyadharmaḥ karmayuktamanuṣyadharme vā atha śuddakarmadharmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra nivītam manuṣyāṇām iti a ca ete pakṣāḥ bhavanti kim ayam śuddha manuṣya dharmaḥ karma yukta manuṣya dharme vā atha śuddha karma dharmaḥ
translated: There, the wearing of the sacred thread over the right shoulder is for men. These are the alternatives: Is this a mere human dharma, or a human dharma connected with an act? Or is it a mere dharma of an act?

original: athavā prakaraṇe yanmanuṣyapradhānaṃ karma ancāhāryapacanādi tasya dharmaḥ utāprakaraṇe yā manuṣyapūjātithyātmikā tasyāṃ niveśa iti /
analyzed: athavā prakaraṇe yat manuṣya pradhānam karma ancāhāryapacana ādi tasya dharmaḥ uta a prakaraṇe yā manuṣya pūjā ātithi ātmikā tasyām niveśaḥ iti
translated: Or is it the dharma of that act which has men as its principal element in the context, such as the cooking of the Ahavaniya fire, etc.? Or is it to be applied to that worship of men which is in the nature of hospitality, not in the context?

original: yau tu vidhyarthavādapacau tau śeṣalakṣaṇe'naupayako pramāyāca kṣaṇaviṣayatvādvidhivannigadārthavādamadhye ca nirṇotatvādiha naivopanyasanīyau /
analyzed: yau tu vidhi arthavāda pacau tau śeṣa lakṣaṇena aupayako pramāyāḥ ca kṣaṇa viṣaya tvāt vidhivat nigada arthavāda madhye ca nirṇota tvāt iha na eva upanyasanīyau
translated: But the two views of the author of the commentary are not useful in the definition of the subsidiary, because they are the subject matter of the moment, and because they have been determined in the middle of the injunction and the explanatory passage, like the injunction. Therefore they should not be mentioned here at all.

original: yastu bhāṣyakāreṇopanyāsaḥ kṛtaḥ sa kṛtvācintā nyāyeneti draṣṭavyam/
analyzed: yaḥ tu bhāṣyakāreṇa upanyāsaḥ kṛtaḥ sa kṛtvā acintā nyāyena iti draṣṭavyam
translated: But the mention made by the author of the commentary should be seen as being done by the method of considering what is to be done.

original: na hi vidhitvamanabhyupetya manuṣyadharmādipañca upapadyate iti /
analyzed: na hi vidhi tvam an abhyupetya manuṣya dharma ādi pañca upapadyate iti
translated: For the five, beginning with human dharma, are not possible without accepting the nature of an injunction.

original: vidhiriti kṛtvā prathamaṃ prastutya paścācaṇānurūpaṃ vicāryānte pūrvāvasthita mevārthavādatvamupasaṃhariṣyati /
analyzed: vidhiḥ iti kṛtvā prathamam prastutya vicārya ante pūrva avasthitam meva arthavāda tvam upasaṃhariṣyati
translated: Having first presented it as an injunction, he will later consider it according to the statement, and finally conclude that the meaning is only explanatory, as it was before.

analyzed: pareṣu api adhikaraṇeṣu etat yathāsaṃbhavam yojayitavyam
translated: This should be applied to other topics as well, as appropriate.

original: tatra vidhirvā syādapūrvavādvādamātraṃ hyanarthakamityanenaiva tā vadvidhiḥ ahīnādyadhikaraṇanyāyena ca ṣaṣṭhīśrutyā manuṣyadharmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra vidhiḥ vā syāt apūrva vāda vāda mātram hi anarthakam iti anena eva tāḥ vat vidhiḥ ahīna ādi adhikaraṇa nyāyena ca ṣaṣṭhī śrutyā manuṣya dharmaḥ
translated: There, it may be an injunction, because a mere statement of what is already known is meaningless. By this alone, it is an injunction. And by the sixth case ending, it is a human duty, by the reasoning of the section on the Ahīna sacrifice and so on.

analyzed: tantravārtike
translated: In the Tantra-vārttika.

analyzed: teṣām sva tvena tat pratīyate na manuṣyāḥ tad aṅga tvena
translated: They are understood as its owners, not humans as its subsidiary.

analyzed: guṇa vibhakti nima abhāvāt
translated: Because there is no instrumental case ending.

analyzed: arthāt eva ca tat prāpta
translated: And it is obtained by implication itself.

original: satyāṃ naiva manuṣyagrahaṇaṃ kriyeta / kṛtaṃ caitat / atopi manuṣyadharma ityavagacchāmaḥ
analyzed: satyām na eva manuṣya grahaṇam kriyeta kṛtam ca etat atas api manuṣya dharmaḥ iti avagacchāmaḥ
translated: If it were true, the mention of humans would not be made at all. And this has been done. Therefore we understand that it is a human duty.

analyzed: vidhiḥ tu a pūrvavat tvāt syāt
translated: But it may be an injunction, because it is not like what is already known.

analyzed: vidhiḥ eva ayam
translated: This is indeed an injunction.

analyzed: kutas
translated: How so?

analyzed: pūrvavat tvāt anuvādaḥ bhavet atyanta prāptau iti arthaḥ
translated: A restatement would be for the sake of what is already fully obtained. This is the meaning.

analyzed: na ca ayam atyanta prāptaḥ
translated: And this is not fully obtained.

original: tena vināpyavyagratāyāḥ śakyatvāt kaṇṭhavandhaḥ punaḥ prāyeṇāprāpta evetyasti niyama vidheravakāśaḥ

original: prakaraṇasaṃbandhe vākyasaṃbandhavādhādanvācāryādisaṃbandhe vākyabhedātprakaraṇasya ca viśeṣakatvānupapattera tithyādisaṃbandhotyantanirmūla eva/

translated: Therefore, it appears thus.

original: yāvatkiṃcinmanuṣyāḥ svārthaṃ karmānutiṣṭhanti tatra pratīcyudīcī cāṅgaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yāvat kiṃcid manuṣyāḥ sva artham karma anutiṣṭhanti tatra pratīcī udīcī ca aṅgam bhavati
translated: As long as humans perform actions for their own purpose, the west and north become auxiliaries there.

original: yāvacca darbhalavanaṃ tadantarā karttavyaṃ yāvanmīyate tatpūrṇena mātavyam /
analyzed: yāvat ca darbha lavanam tat antarā karttavyam yāvat mīyate tat pūrṇena mātavyam
translated: And as long as the darbhas are cut, that should be done in between, as long as it is measured, it should be eaten with the full (amount).

original: yāvacca snehakāryaṃ tatsarvaṃ vilīnanavanītena niṣpakkāyuta śabdavācyena karttavyam /
analyzed: yāvat ca sneha kāryam tat sarvam vilīna navanītena niṣpakka ayuta śabda vācyena karttavyam
translated: And as long as there is an act of affection, all that should be done with melted fresh butter, which is denoted by the word 'niṣpāka'.

analyzed: vi dagdha tva āśrita tve kartavye prati
translated: In the case of the other two, the burning and the resting, the connection is not to be made with the man.

analyzed: tena ca api pūrva tulya tvam sādhayitavyam iti ārambhaḥ
translated: And in that case also, the equality with the previous one is to be established - this is the beginning.

original: tatra manuṣyadharmaḥ śabdasya tatpradhānatvāditi vināpi ṣaṣṭhonirdeśādabhajanteti manuṣyasaṃbandhāttādarthyam itareṣu ṣaṣṭhyeva /
analyzed: tatra manuṣya dharmaḥ śabdasya tad pradhāna tvāt iti vinā api manuṣya saṃbandhāt tādarthyam itareṣu ṣaṣṭhī eva
translated: There, the property of man is of the word, because that is primary. Even without the sixth case indication, they do not serve. From the connection with man, there is purpose for that. In the others, it is only the sixth case.

original: tathā 'padeśo veti saukaryātprāptirabhidhīyate pūrvā cipṛṣṭhata ādityaṃ sukhaṃ vyāpriyantaiti praticīprāptiḥ /
analyzed: tathā padeśaḥ vā iti saukaryāt prāptiḥ abhidhīyate pūrvā cipṛṣṭhataḥ ādityam sukham vyāpriyante eti praticīprāptiḥ
translated: Similarly, the declaration is said to be obtained easily. And the obtaining in the west is said to be from the east, as they spread out happily behind the sun.

analyzed: kṛtvā tathā antar āja vana pūyoḥ aprayatna sādhya tvāt prāptiḥ
translated: Having done so, the obtaining of the inner and outer is from the fact that it is accomplished without effort.

analyzed: prakaraṇa samākhyābhyām ca karma dharmaḥ
translated: And by context and designation, it is a property of the ritual.

original: sarvapramāṇānugrahārthaṃ prakaraṇe manuṣyapradhāne niveśaḥ /🔽vākyena prakaraṇasamākhyayorvādhātphalakalpanābhayā ccātithyādau niveśaḥ /
analyzed: sarva pramāṇa anugraha artham prakaraṇe manuṣya pradhāne niveśaḥ  vākyena prakaraṇa samākhyayoḥ vādhāt phala kalpanā bhayā ca atithi ādau niveśaḥ
translated: For the sake of supporting all the means of knowledge, the context is placed in the man-dominated context.🔽And by the sentence, because of the contradiction of context and designation, and because of the fear of assuming a result, the placement is in the Atithya and so on.

original: tenāpi saha sambandha pramāṇābhāvātprakaraṇe sambhāvinaścānutkarṣātprācīna vidhiśeṣa tvāccārthavāda iti siddhāntaḥ /
analyzed: tena api saha sambandha pramāṇa abhāvāt prakaraṇe sambhāvinaḥ ca anutkarṣāt prācīna vidhi śeṣa tvāt ca arthavādaḥ iti siddhāntaḥ
translated: By that also, the connection is from the absence of evidence. And because of the non-elevation of what is possible in the context, and because of being a supplement to the earlier injunction, the conclusion is that it is a praise.

analyzed: samyak viṣaya anya viṣaya stuti viveka siddhiḥ
translated: The establishment of the distinction between the praise of other things and the praise of the thing known as it is heard correctly.

analyzed: tasmāt pravṛtti kaimarthya cintā pravṛttīnām api abhidhāyaka ākhyā sa vaśena aidamathyam nirūpyate iti ākhyāta śabdāḥ cintayitavyāḥ
translated: Therefore, the consideration of the purpose of engagement is determined by the power of the words expressing the engagements themselves. Thus, the words of the verb should be considered.

analyzed: tatas ca etasya sarvasya ākhyāta nirūpaṇa āyatta tvāt tad gataḥ yam vicāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And since all this depends on the determination of the verb, this consideration will be about that.

analyzed: kimākhyātena karttā abhidhīyate na iti
translated: Is the agent denoted by the verb or not?

original: tatra yadyabhidhīyate tataḥ śrītatvātprayojanākāhiṇī bhāvanā prakaraṇagamyakratvarthatvabādhanena puruṣārthā bhavati /
analyzed: tatra yadi abhidhīyate tatas bhāvanā prakaraṇa gamya kratu artha tva bādhanena puruṣa arthā bhavati
translated: If it is denoted, then the bhāvanā, which is not connected with a purpose, becomes for the sake of the person by negating the fact that it is for the sake of the ritual, which is understood from the context.

analyzed: atha na abhidhīyate tatas śruti virodha abhāvāt prakaraṇena kratu artha tā
translated: If it is not denoted, then due to the absence of contradiction with the Vedic text, it is for the sake of the ritual by the context.

original: nanu satyapi kartturabhidhāne bhāvanāpradhānatvādākhyātena to pratyupādīyamānasya śrautopi sambandhaḥ prakaraṇānuguṇatvādaviruddho naiva kratvarthatāṃ bādhate virodhinau hi tulyakakṣā sambandhī pararasparaṃ bādheyātāṃ na guṇapradhānabhūtau /
analyzed: nanu sati api karttuḥ abhidhāne bhāvanā pradhāna tvāt ākhyātena pratyupādīyamānasya śrautaḥ api sambandhaḥ prakaraṇa anuguṇa tvāt aviruddhaḥ na eva kratu artha tām bādhate virodhinau hi tulya kakṣā sambandhī pararasparam bādheyātām na guṇa pradhāna bhūtau
translated: But even if the agent is denoted, the relation of what is presented by the verbal root with the Bhavana, which is the principal factor, is not contradicted by the context, because it is in accordance with the context. It does not at all obstruct the fact that it is for the sake of the sacrifice. For, indeed, two relations of equal status would contradict each other, not one that is subordinate and one that is principal.

original: tadyathā daśāpavitreṇa grahaṃ sammātyatra daśāpavitropasarjanasya saṃmārgasya grahaṃ pratyupādīyamānasya naivamāśaṅkā bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā daśā pavitreṇa graham daśā pavitra upasarjanasya saṃmārgasya graham pratyupādīyamānasya na evam āśaṅkā bhavati
translated: For example, in the sentence He anoints the cup with the ten-piled filter, there is no doubt as to whether the anointing, which is subordinate to the ten-piled filter, is presented in relation to the cup.

analyzed: kim daśāpavitreṇa sambadhyatām uta graha iṣā iti
translated: Whether it is related to the ten-piled filter or to the cup.

original: tathā'pi guṇabhūtakartṛkāyāḥ kriyāyāḥ kratuṃ pratyupādoyamānāyā na kaścidvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tathā api guṇa bhūta kartṛkāyāḥ kriyāyāḥ kratum pratyupādoyamānāyāḥ na kaścid virodhaḥ
translated: Even so, there is no contradiction in the action of the subordinate agent being presented in relation to the sacrifice.

original: yadi tvākhyātena kartuḥ prādhānyamucceta tataḥ prakaraṇagamyena kratuprādhānyena virodhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadi tu ākhyātena kartuḥ prādhānyam ucceta tatas prakaraṇa gamyena kratu prādhānyena virodhaḥ syāt
translated: But if the primacy of the agent were expressed by the verbal root, then there would be a contradiction with the primacy of the sacrifice understood from the context.

original: yadi vā karturitra kratorapi guṇatvaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi vā kartuḥ itra kratoḥ api guṇa tvam syāt
translated: Or, if the agent were here, the sacrifice would also be subordinate.

original: tata ubhayoḥ śeṣayoḥ śeṣisamavāyavirodho lakṣyate na tu tadubhayamapyasti /
analyzed: tatas ubhayoḥ śeṣayoḥ śeṣi samavāya virodhaḥ lakṣyate na tu tat ubhayam api asti
translated: Then, in the case of the remaining two, a contradiction is seen in the combination of the remaining, but neither of the two exists.

original: ataḥ śrutyā karturguṇabhāvātprakaraṇena ca kratoḥ prādhānyānnānāviṣayatvenāsamavāyādavirodhaḥ tadbhāvādabādhaḥ syāditi/
analyzed: atas śrutyā kartuḥ guṇa bhāvāt prakaraṇena ca kratoḥ prādhānyāt nānā viṣaya tvena asamavāyāt avirodhaḥ tad bhāvāt abādhaḥ syāt iti
translated: Therefore, due to the subordinate nature of the agent by direct statement and the primary nature of the sacrifice by context, there is no contradiction due to having different objects, and there would be no obstruction due to that existence.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: yat vā etat aviśeṣeṇa sthitam krama vaśāt ubhau
translated: That which is established without distinction by the power of sequence, both

analyzed: pratyaya artham sa prakṛti pratyayau iti
translated: are for the purpose of the suffix, the original and the suffix.

original: na hyasautsargikasya nyāyasya smaraṇasya vāpavādabhūtaṃ nyāyāntaraṃ smaraṇāntaraṃ copalabhyate /
analyzed: na hi asautsargikasya nyāyasya smaraṇasya vā apavāda bhūtam nyāya antaram smaraṇa antaram ca upalabhyate
translated: For no other rule or recollection is perceived that would override the general rule or recollection.

analyzed: tena kutta dvitā anta vat eva pratyayāḥ rtha prādhānyam prāpnoti
translated: Therefore, like the suffix, the primary nature of the object of the suffix is obtained.

original: tataśca śabdenaiva dhātvarthasya śeṣatvamuktaṃ nātikramituṃ śakyate /
analyzed: tatas ca śabdena eva dhātvarthasya śeṣa tvam uktam na atikramitum śakyate
translated: And thus the subordinate nature of the root meaning by the word itself cannot be transgressed.

analyzed: nanu sāmānyam utsṛṣṭam pratīti viśeṣeṇa apodyeta
translated: But the general rule may be overridden by a particular cognition.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus:

analyzed: iyoḥ tāvat pradhānayoḥ guṇayoḥ vā sarva ca eva sambandhaḥ na avakalpate
translated: First of all, the relation of these two as primary or secondary is not possible in any way.

original: tatrāvaśyaṃ kalpanīye guṇapradhānatve yathāpratīti vyavasthā sampravārtike /
analyzed: tatra avaśyam kalpanīye guṇa pradhāna tve yathāpratīti vyavasthā sampravārtike
translated: There, in the case of the necessity of postulating the principal and subordinate, the determination is made according to the understanding, as in the Vārtika.

analyzed: vadhāryate
translated: It is ascertained.

original: tatpratītiśca yathā'nyatra prakutyarthe/pasarjana pratyayā rthaviṣayatvenopalabhyate tathā 'tra pratyayārthopasarjanaprakṛtyartha viṣayā sarvasya svasaṃvedyā /
analyzed: tad pratītiḥ ca yathā anyatra prakuti artha ipasarjana pratyayāḥ rtha viṣaya tvena upalabhyate tathā sarvasya sva saṃvedyā
translated: And that understanding, just as in other cases where the meaning of the root is the primary and the affix has the meaning as its object, so here also, the meaning of the affix has the meaning of the root as its subordinate and the meaning of the primary as its object, is to be known by each one's own experience.

analyzed: na ca tatonyat
translated: And there is no other powerful reason than that.

analyzed: tasmāt aprasaṅgaḥ karttuḥ pradhāna tvasya iti
translated: Therefore, there is no possibility of the agent being the principal.

analyzed: dhātvarthasya pradhāna tvam na tāvat iha janmani
translated: The meaning of the root is not the principal here in this birth.

original: śrautsargiko na ca nyāyo matpate hi nivasrtsyati
analyzed: śrautsargikaḥ na ca nyāyaḥ mad pate hi nivasrtsyati
translated: The natural rule will not cease to apply, for it belongs to me.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa tayā rājā puruṣasya upasarjanam
translated: The king is the subordinate of the man, as his qualifier.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: Fourth section of the third chapter.

analyzed: arthayoḥ śeṣa śeṣi tve tasya eva iṣṭā pradhāna tā
translated: In the case of two meanings being the principal and subordinate, the principal is accepted to be that alone.

analyzed: niḥsaṃdigdha pradhāna tvam pācaka ādiṣu kārakam
translated: The instrumental case has an undoubted principal meaning in 'cooks' etc.

analyzed: tathā api tu na mādathyem kriyāṇām avadhāryate
translated: However, even so, it is not ascertained in the case of actions.

analyzed: prādhānyena iha karttṛ tvam yadi nāma abhidhīyate
translated: If the state of being an agent is spoken of here as the principal,

analyzed: tatas tātparyataḥ vācyam guṇa tvam avadhāritam
translated: Then, from the context, the quality of being denoted is ascertained.

analyzed: kartṛ tvam sādhaka tvena siddham tat ca abhidhīyate
translated: The state of being an agent is established as the means of accomplishment, and that is expressed.

analyzed: svāmi tvam tu tatas paścāt pramāṇa antara gocaraḥ
translated: But the state of being a master is later the object of another means of knowledge.

analyzed: acetane api kāṣṭhādā kartṛ tvam abhidhīyate
translated: Even in an insentient thing like wood, the state of being an agent is expressed.

original: na ca tatra phalohe śastasmānnaiṣā 'vadhāraṇā🔽bibhrāṇaḥ puruṣaṃ rājā guṇatvaṃ tāvadṛcchati /
analyzed: na ca tatra phala ūhe śastasmāt na eṣā  bibhrāṇaḥ puruṣam rājā guṇa tvam tāvat ṛcchati
translated: And there is no result or cause there, therefore this is not a restriction.🔽The king, bearing the man, first attains the state of being a quality.

analyzed: svāmi tvam bhajate paścāt vivakṣā yathārūci
translated: Later, he assumes the state of being a master, the intention being according to his wish.

original: prayogaiyasya vidyamānasya tāvaḍyavasthā hitāvarthadaye sambhavati kimiti vakṣyamāpakriyopayogāpecayā vivakṣābhedamātreṇa kliṣṭāṃ vyavasthāmāśrayiṣyāmahe /
analyzed: vidyamānasya tāvat aḍyavasthā hitau artha daye sambhavati kim iti vakṣyamāpa kriyā upayoga apecayā vivakṣā bheda mātreṇa kliṣṭām vyavasthām āśrayiṣyāmahe
translated: When the existing state of a thing is possible in both cases, why should we resort to a complicated arrangement based merely on a difference in intention, requiring the use of the future tense?

original: tena bhūtaṃ nimittamālocca śabde prayujyamāne rājapuruṣa ityatropakārāṃśakṛtaṃ śeṣatvameva vivaścitamiti gamyate /
analyzed: tena bhūtam nimittam ālocca śabde prayujyamāne rāja puruṣaḥ iti atra upakāra aṃśa kṛtam śeṣa tvam eva vivaścitam iti gamyate
translated: Therefore, when the word is used with the nominal affix denoting an accomplished object, it is understood that only the state of being a subordinate, based on the aspect of assistance, is intended in the expression king's man.

original: yatrā'pi yogarbhadāsādisvāminyatyantā vidyamānameva śeṣatvaṃ tatrāpyupakārakatvasambhavādupacaritamiti draṣṭavyam
analyzed: yatra api yaḥ garbha dāsa ādi svāmini atyantā vidyamānam eva śeṣatvam tatra api upakāraka tva sambhavāt upacaritam iti draṣṭavyam
translated: Even where the state of being a subordinate is entirely absent, as in the case of a servant or a slave, it should be seen as figurative, because the capacity for assistance is possible there.

original: tirohitaṃ ca karmatvaṃ na gṛhṇīyādapi kriyām /
analyzed: tirohitam ca karma tvam na gṛhṇīyāt api kriyām
translated: And the character of being an act, even though concealed, would not be accepted as the action.

original: āvirbhūtaṃ tu kartṛtvamākhyātasthaṃ grīṣyati🔽kārakopasarjanībhūtasya dravyasya pratyāsattimātreṇa saṃkhyādayaḥ śeṣāḥ sambhaveyuste tvatyanta pratyāsanna pradhānabhūtena kārake pāpahṛtya kriyāyai nīyante /
analyzed: āvirbhūtam tu kartṛ tvam ākhyāta stham  kāraka upasarjanī bhūtasya dravyasya pratyāsatti mātreṇa saṃkhyā ādayaḥ śeṣāḥ sambhaveyuḥ te tu atyanta pratyāsanna pradhāna bhūtena kārake pāpahṛtya kriyāyai nīyante
translated: But the character of being an agent, when manifest, is accepted as denoted by the verb.🔽For a substance that is subordinate to the agent, number and other factors could be possible merely through proximity. But they are taken away from the action by the principal factor that is very proximate.

original: na tvevaṃ dhātvarthānāṃ kena cihnanavattaraṇa pramāṇena kratvarthatvamavagamyate yena kartṛtvaśeṣatā bādhyeta
analyzed: na tu evam dhātvarthānām kena pramāṇena kratu artha tvam avagamyate yena kartṛ tva śeṣatā bādhyeta
translated: But in the same way, the fact that the meanings of the verbal roots are for the sake of the sacrifice is not known by any indicative power, by which the character of being subordinate to the agent would be contradicted.

analyzed: kartṛṇām śāstra gamye rthe cetanānām adhikriyā
translated: In the matter known from the scriptures, the conscious agents have more authority.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: Fourth section of the third chapter.

analyzed: vidhiḥ ca na bhavet teṣām phala saṅkalpanā āhate
translated: For them, there would be no injunction, when the desire for the result is accomplished.

original: tenāvaśyamanuṣṭhātṛtvanīcamānaḥ puruṣaḥ kimapi mamaiṣā kriyā sākṣātparamparyeṇa vopakariṣyatotyadhyavasyati sājhādupakārake ca sambhavati na pāramparyopakāra kalpanā labhyate /
analyzed: tena avaśyam anuṣṭhātṛ tva nīca mānaḥ puruṣaḥ kim api mama eṣā kriyā sākṣāt paramparyeṇa vā upakariṣyatī iti adhyavasyati ca sambhavati na pāramparya upakāra kalpanā labhyate
translated: Therefore, a person who is bound to perform necessarily thinks, This action of mine will benefit me directly or indirectly, and when direct benefit is possible, the assumption of indirect benefit is not obtained.

original: na ca saṃskārānaīḥ karttā kratuphalādhāratvena saprayojanatvāt /🔽kastasyopakāra iti cet sarvathā tāvatmāmānyenopakāramātramavadhāritam /
analyzed: na ca saṃskāra anaīḥ karttā kratu phala ādhāra tvena sa prayojana tvāt  kaḥ tasya upakāraḥ iti ced sarvathā tāvat māmānyena upakāra mātram avadhāritam
translated: And the performer is not the agent of the embellishments, because he has a purpose, being the receptacle of the result of the sacrifice.🔽If it is asked what benefit he has, it is determined that he has some benefit in some way.

original: tāvatā ca kratvarthatvaṃ vyāvarttitaṃ tadviśeṣāvadhāraṇaṃ ca yatheṣṭaṃ kalpayiṣyate /
analyzed: tāvatā ca kratu artha tvam vyāvarttitam tad viśeṣa avadhāraṇam ca yathā iṣṭam kalpayiṣyate
translated: And by that much, the purpose for the sacrifice is excluded, and the determination of its particulars will be imagined as desired.

analyzed: na tat a cā upayujyate tasmāt na kratu artha tā
translated: That is not useful for it, therefore it is not for the purpose of the sacrifice.

original: yadyapi ca prādhānyāṃśa kartṛtvavacanenānabhihitastatra cānantargatastathāpi tadanyathānupapatyaiva pratyāyitatvātmambadhyate /
analyzed: yadi api ca prādhānya aṃśa kartṛ tva vacanena anabhihitaḥ tatra ca anantargataḥ tathā api tad anyathā anupapatyā eva
translated: And although the state of being the agent is not expressed by the statement of the principal part, and is not included there, still it is connected because it is understood by the non-applicability of anything else.

original: yathā svargakāmādiśabdena puruṣaviśeṣavacanenānuktamapi svargasya sādhyatvaṃ kalpayiṣyate /
analyzed: yathā svarga kāma ādi śabdena puruṣa viśeṣa vacanena anuktam api svargasya sādhya tvam kalpayiṣyate
translated: Just as the state of being the object to be accomplished of heaven will be imagined even though not stated by the word one who desires heaven which expresses a particular person.

original: tathā svāmitvamapi buddhipūrvakāriṇaḥ puruṣasya phalalipsayaiva ka tṛtvapratītyā pratipatsyate/
analyzed: tathā svāmi tvam api buddhi pūrva kāriṇaḥ puruṣasya phala lipsayā eva ka tṛ tva pratītyā pratipatsyate
translated: In the same way, ownership will also be understood by the person acting with intelligence through the mere desire for the result, by the understanding of being the agent.

original: tatra yathaiva devatāyāḥ karmaṇābhipreyamāṇāyāḥ prādhānyaṃ yāgasādhanatvapratipattyarthameva jñāyate na prā dhānyasvarūpaparyavasāyitvena tatheha guṇatvaṃ prādhānya siddhyarthameva draṣṭavyam
analyzed: tatra yathā eva devatāyāḥ karmaṇā abhipreyamāṇāyāḥ prādhānyam yāga sādhanatva pratipatti artham eva jñāyate na prā dhānya svarūpa paryavasāyi tvena tathā iha guṇa tvam prādhānya siddhi artham eva draṣṭavyam
translated: There, just as the predominance of the deity, which is desired by the action, is understood only for the purpose of understanding the deity as the means of sacrifice, not for the sake of establishing its own nature as predominant, so here the secondary nature should be seen only for the purpose of establishing the primary nature.

analyzed: karttā pratyaya arthaḥ tena api pratīti vaśāt bhāva  na abhyupagantavyā
translated: Even though the agent is the meaning of the suffix, it should not be accepted as the predominant factor merely on the basis of the understanding that it is so.

original: tatasyaikapratyayopādānātprādhānyācca saiva ka tarimaṅgīkarotīti na dhātvarthāṅgatā bhavatīti /
analyzed: tatasya eka pratyaya upādānāt prādhānyāt ca sā eva ka tarim aṅgīkaroti iti na dhātvartha aṅga tā bhavati iti
translated: Because it is mentioned by the same word and is predominant, it is that which the verb accepts, and therefore the meaning of the root is not subsidiary.

original: sa tu bhāvanāyāṃ vyāpṛtastāmanyathā kartumaśaknuvan dhātvartha mevāṅgīkaroti/
analyzed: sa tu bhāvanāyām vyāpṛtaḥ tām anyathā kartum aśaknuvan dhātvartham eva aṅgīkaroti
translated: But being engaged in the action, being unable to make it otherwise, it accepts only the meaning of the root.

analyzed: na ca ubhaya ātmaka tvam vipratiṣiddham viṣaya anya tvāt eva
translated: And it is not contradictory to have both natures, because the objects are different.

original: yadi dhātvarthameva prati guṇatvameva kalapyeta tataḥ sakkadupāḍhāne vipratiṣiddhamiva syāt /
