analyzed: yadi dhātvartham eva prati guṇa tvam eva kalapyeta tatas sakkat upāḍhāne vipratiṣiddham iva syāt
translated: If the secondary nature were imagined only in relation to the meaning of the root, then it would be as if contradictory in a single mention.

original: iha tu bhāvanā prati guṇatvaṃ dhātvartheṣu prādhānyamityavirodhaḥ /
analyzed: iha tu bhāvanā prati guṇa tvam dhātvartheṣu prādhānyam iti avirodhaḥ
translated: But here the secondary nature is in relation to the action, and the predominance is in relation to the meanings of the root, so there is no contradiction.

original: svabhāvaścobhayātmakaṃ vastu yadi tathaiva śabda upādatte kiṃ tatra vipratiṣidma/
analyzed: svabhāvaḥ ca ubhaya ātmakam vastu yadi tathā eva śabdaḥ upādatte kim tatra vipratiṣidma
translated: And if the nature of the thing is twofold, and the word denotes it as such, what is there to contradict?

analyzed: atha vā ekam śabdāt ekam sāmarthyāt iti avirodhaḥ
translated: Or if one is denoted by the word and the other by implication, there is no contradiction.

original: sarvathā 'sti tāvatkarttuḥ prādhānyaprasaktiriti puruṣārtho dhātvarthaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: sarvathā sti tāvat karttuḥ prādhānya prasaktiḥ iti puruṣa arthaḥ dhātvarthaḥ prāpnoti
translated: In any case, there is the possibility of the agent being primary, so the meaning of the verbal root would be for the sake of the person.

analyzed: ayam ca aparaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: And there is another distinction:

analyzed: vastu artha ātmanā ubhaya prakāra sya upasarjana tvasya ayam vivekaḥ
translated: This is the distinction between the two kinds of subservience, that which is in the form of the word-meaning and that which is in the form of the object.

original: pācakaṃ rājapuruṣaṃ cānayetyatra puruṣasthānayanasambandhinaḥ pācako rājā vā śabdārthamātratayopasarjanatvaṃ pratipanna iti śeṣatvaṃ yāvanna gacchedapi vaḍhedityevamādiṣa tu kartuḥ kāryānsarasambandhānupādānānna śabdārthopasarjanatvamākāśita miti pariśeṣādvastvarthopasarjanatvameva śeṣatvamavadhāryate /
analyzed: pācakam rāja puruṣam ca anaya iti atra puruṣa stha ānayana sambandhinaḥ pācakaḥ rājā vā śabda artha mātra tayā upasarjana tvam pratipannaḥ iti śeṣa tvam yāvat na gacchet api vaḍhet iti evamādiṣu tu kartuḥ kārya ansara sambandha an upādānāt na śabda artha upasarjana tvam ākāśitam iti pariśeṣāt vastu artha upasarjana tvam eva śeṣa tvam avadhāryate
translated: In the sentence Bring the cook and the king's man, the cook or the king, who is related to the act of bringing in the man, is understood as subservient merely as the word-meaning, so long as he is not understood as the remainder. But in sentences like He who goes, he who eats, the agent is not related to the act as a subordinate, because it is not mentioned. Therefore, by elimination, it is determined that the subservience as the remainder is only in the form of the object-meaning.

analyzed: tasmāt asti abhidhāna pace dhātvarthānām puruṣa artha tve pramāṇam iti
translated: Therefore, there is evidence in the case of denotation that the meanings of verbal roots are for the sake of the person.

original: nanvevaṃ satyanabhidhīyamāno 'pi samānapadopāttabhāvanā ucitaḥ prakaraṇātsa eva pratyāsannataraḥ śaknoti dhātvarthasya prayojanākā nirvatayitamityabhidhīyamānapaścatulyatvaṃ prāpnoti/
analyzed: nanu evam sati anabhidhīyamānaḥ pi samāna pada upātta bhāvanāḥ ucitaḥ prakaraṇāt saḥ eva pratyāsannataraḥ śaknoti dhātvarthasya prāpnoti
translated: If it be so, then, even though not directly mentioned, the Bhavana, expressed by the same word, would be the more reasonable, as being more nearly related to the object of the Injunction and as such it would be able to accomplish the purpose of the object denoted by the verbal root and thus it would come to be on the same footing as the directly mentioned object.

original: naiṣa doṣaḥ sa śabdo khacaṇā yāti yaḥ śrutyā nopayujyate /🔽śrutyarthenopayukte tu lakṣaṇā nāntarīyakī🔽vaḍhediti śrutera puruṣaḥ sampratīyate /
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ sa yāti yaḥ śrutyā na upayujyate  śruti arthena upayukte tu lakṣaṇā nāntarīyakī  vaḍhet iti puruṣaḥ sampratīyate
translated: This is not a defect because that word is taken as a mere reference which is not directly useful in the performance of the action.🔽But when it is found to be useful in the performance, by means of the meaning of the word, then the word is taken in its indirect secondary signification.

analyzed: vidhiḥ api arthavān evam kratu arthe narthakaḥ bhavet
translated: For instance, when the word vṛṣalī is heard, it is taken to mean a woman, and not a Śūdra woman.🔽Similarly, the Injunction also, though meaningless by itself, becomes useful when it is taken along with the object to be accomplished.

analyzed: siddhānte kratu saṃyuktam samāmnāyena vā ucyate
translated: In the Siddhānta, it is held that the object to be accomplished is mentioned in the Veda itself, in connection with the sacrifice.

analyzed: prakaraṇa prāptyā bādha gocaraḥ
translated: The object that is mentioned in the context, and is related to the sacrifice, sets aside the object that is mentioned in the Arthavāda passages.

analyzed: sarva ātau amatiḥ nityam śruti mūla pramāṇikā
translated: All this is based upon the eternal authority of the Veda.

analyzed: tena smṛti artha vāci tvāt na anuvādaḥ bhavet asau
translated: Therefore, it cannot be an explanation of the Smṛti, as it would be useless.

analyzed: yadi prakaraṇam tyatkā puruṣa arthā iyam miṣyate
translated: If the object mentioned in the context is held to be for the sake of man,

original: tataḥ smṛtisamānārthā naṣṭā mūlaṃ kathaṃ śrutiḥ
analyzed: tatas smṛti samāna arthā naṣṭā mūlam katham śrutiḥ
translated: then the Smṛti would have the same meaning as the lost original, and how could the original be the Veda?

analyzed: pūrvapakṣāḥ trayaḥ hi atra bhāṣyakārasya saṃmatāḥ
translated: The author of the Bhāṣya has accepted three prima facie views in this connection.

analyzed: pūrvasmin mūla mali tvam parayoḥ tu anuvāda tā
translated: In the former, it is the root, in the latter two, it is a restatement.

original: puruṣaṃ hi parityajya nānṛtaṃ prāpyate ṛtau /
analyzed: puruṣam hi parityajya na anṛtam prāpyate ṛtau
translated: For truth is not attained in the season without abandoning the man.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: Fourth section of the third chapter.

analyzed: puruṣe tat niṣiddham ced niṣiddham tanau api
translated: If it is prohibited in the man, then it is prohibited in the two also.

analyzed: vidhiḥ vā saṃyoga antarāt
translated: Or it is an injunction due to a different connection.

analyzed: kevala puruṣa artha tva pace tāvat bhāṣyakāra saṃyoga antaram varṇayati
translated: In the case of the result being solely for the man, the author of the commentary describes a different connection.

original: smṛtau hi satyaṃ brūyāditi dharmāya satyaniyamaḥ śrūyate nānṛtaṃ vadediti tvanṛtapratiṣedho bhinnau caitāvarthai na cānyat śrayamāṇamanya māṇasyānuvādo bhavati /
analyzed: smṛtau hi satyam brūyāt iti dharmāya satya niyamaḥ śrūyate na anṛtam vadet iti tu anṛta pratiṣedhaḥ bhinnau ca etau arthaiḥ na ca anyat śrayamāṇam anya māṇasya anuvādaḥ bhavati
translated: For in the Smṛti, the rule about truth is heard for the sake of dharma as one should speak the truth, but the prohibition of falsehood is one should not speak falsely. And these two are different in meaning. And what is heard cannot be a restatement of what is already known.

analyzed: tasmāt vidhiḥ
translated: Therefore it is an injunction.

original: nanu iyyeva puruṣasya vākyapravṛttiḥ satyavacanamanṛtavadanaṃ ca tatra yadā satyaṃ tanniyataṃ tadārthādevānṛtaṃ pratiṣiddhaṃ bhavatītyanuvādatvaṃ prāpnotyeva /
analyzed: nanu iyyā iva puruṣasya vākya pravṛttiḥ satya vacanam anṛta vadanam ca tatra yadā satyam tat niyatam tadā arthāt eva anṛtam pratiṣiddham bhavati iti anuvāda tvam prāpnoti eva
translated: But is not this very engagement of the man in speech - speaking the truth and speaking falsely? There, when truth is enjoined, falsehood becomes prohibited by the very meaning of that. Thus it does indeed become a restatement.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: saṃyoga antarāt eva sa nāma anuvādaḥ bhavati
translated: From a different connection. A restatement with the same name becomes so when it is ascertained to have exactly the same meaning.

analyzed: asti ca vidhi pratiṣedhayoḥ phala bhedāt artha bhedaḥ
translated: And there is a difference in meaning of injunctions and prohibitions due to the difference in their results.

analyzed: katham  prajāpati vrata stha tvāt tatra anī kṣaṇa yuktitaḥ
translated: How?🔽Because of being engaged in the vow of Prajapati, the connection there is understood through exclusion.

analyzed: paryudāsena satyasya vidhiḥ iti avagamyate
translated: It is understood that there is an injunction of truth.

analyzed: smārttaḥ puruṣa mātrasya saṃyogaḥ sva artha siddhaye
translated: The connection of a mere person is based on smrti for the accomplishment of one's own purpose.

original: ayaṃ tu ṛtusaṃyuktapuruṣārthaḥ phalāntare🔽kratavo hi svasambandhinā vidhipratiṣedhāvapekṣamāṇāstadatikrame sati viguṇā bhavanti ye puruṣagatā vidhipratiṣedhārate katvantaragatā ivāsya sadasadbhāvayoraviśiṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: ayam tu ṛtu saṃyukta puruṣa arthaḥ phala antare  kratavaḥ hi sva sambandhinā vidhi pratiṣedhau apekṣamāṇāḥ tad atikrame sati viguṇāḥ bhavanti ye puruṣa gatāḥ vidhi pratiṣedhāḥ rate katu antara gatāḥ iva asya sat asat bhāvayoḥ aviśiṣṭāḥ
translated: But this is for the purpose of a person connected with the season, with a different result.🔽For sacrifices, when they require their own injunctions and prohibitions, if there is a transgression, they become defective. Those that are injunctions and prohibitions related to a person, like those related to another action, are not distinguished in the presence or absence of this.

original: na hi teṣu guṇabuddhimatpanā yenātikame baiguṇyabuddhiḥ syāt /
analyzed: na hi teṣu yena atikame baiguṇya buddhiḥ syāt
translated: For in them there is no notion of an intelligent being as an accessory, by which there would be the notion of defect in the transgression.

original: tena darśapaurṇamāsayoranṛtaṃ vadan narakaṃ ca prāpnuyāt darśapūrṇamā saphala cāvikalamevāpnuyāt /
analyzed: tena darśa paurṇamāsayoḥ anṛtam vadan narakam ca prāpnuyāt
translated: Therefore, one who speaks falsely in the new and full moon sacrifices would go to hell, and would also obtain the new and full moon sacrifices without deficiency.

original: iti ca smṛtyarthaḥ śrataḥ punaḥ prakaraṇayuktapuruṣadharma ityatraiṣo'rtho vijñāyate /
analyzed: iti ca smṛti arthaḥ punar prakaraṇa yukta puruṣa dharmaḥ iti atra eṣa ṛthaḥ vijñāyate
translated: Thus the meaning of smrti is understood. Again, when it is said to be a human duty connected with the context, this meaning is understood.

original: varjitānutavacana kena puruṣeṇa kṛtau darśapai/rṇamāsau phalaṃ sādhayata iti /
analyzed: kena puruṣeṇa kṛtau darśa pairṇamāsau phalam sādhayataḥ iti
translated: By what person, avoiding the words of others, did he perform the Darsha and Paurnamasa sacrifices and accomplish the result?

original: prakaraṇasāmarthyāddhi puruṣagatamapūrvasāghanatvaṃ lakṣayitvā 'nṛtaṃ pratiṣidmatastadatikrame darśapūrṇamāsāpūrvameva vaiguṇyānna syāt/
analyzed: prakaraṇa sāmarthyāt hi puruṣa gatam apūrva sāghana tvam lakṣayitvā tad atikrame darśa pūrṇamāsa apūrvam eva vaiguṇyāt na syāt
translated: For by the power of the context, having indicated the quality of producing the unseen in the person, and since untruth is prohibited, if one transgresses that, the unseen of the Darsha and Paurnamasa sacrifices would not be due to the defect,

analyzed: na tu purupasya eva kaścid pratyavāyaḥ
translated: but there would be no harm at all for the person himself.

original: na hi tadānīṃ pratyavāyaḥ kalpyamānaḥ svatantrapuruṣasambandhitvena kalpayituṃ śakyate /
analyzed: na hi tadānīm pratyavāyaḥ kalpyamānaḥ svatantra puruṣa sambandhi tvena kalpayitum śakyate
translated: For when the harm is imagined at that time, it cannot be imagined as connected with an independent person.

analyzed: tasmāt asti saṃyoga antaram iti vidhiḥ
translated: Therefore, there is a different connection, and it is an injunction.

analyzed: evam śukratu dharma pace pi ṛta puruṣa pratyavāya viśeṣāt saṃyoga antaram vyākhyeyam
translated: In the same way, in the case of the dharma of the menstruating woman, a different connection should be explained due to the special harm to the truthful person.

analyzed: tena nitya anuvādaḥ tā vat na bhavati
translated: Therefore, it is not a mere restatement of what is already established.

analyzed: yaḥ tu ṛtu dharma tva tad gata puruṣa dharma tvayoḥ viśeṣaḥ tam upariṣṭāt acyāmaḥ
translated: We will discuss later the difference between being a dharma of the menstruating woman and being a dharma of the person connected with her.

analyzed: ubhayathā api vidhi siddheḥ idānom na upayujyate eti nā ucyate
translated: It is not said that since the injunction is established in both ways, it is not useful now.

analyzed: parastvai
translated: But the opponent says:

analyzed: gṛhṇīmaḥ eta dedhiḥ iti
translated: We accept this injunction, as stated in the earlier Tantravartika.

analyzed: ktena eva kāraṇena puruṣa dharmaḥ iti vadāmaḥ
translated: For this very reason we say it is a property of the agent.

analyzed: sarva ākhyāteṣu kartṛṇām iṣṭā nā eva abhidheya tā
translated: The nominative case is not intended to be expressed in all verbs.

original: yā tu tebhyaḥ pratītiḥ sā saṃyogāntarato bhavet
analyzed: yā tu tebhyaḥ pratītiḥ sā saṃyoga antarataḥ bhavet
translated: But the cognition of that from them would be due to some other connection.

analyzed: yatas kartugata saṃkhyā pratīmaḥ kavacāmataḥ
translated: Since we cognize the number belonging to the agent from the verbal ending,

analyzed: tasmāt etāvatī śaktiḥ tiṅa kāryāt pratīyate
translated: Therefore, this much power is cognized from the verbal ending.

analyzed: yathā eva kvacid ukkā api karma anyatra na vakṣyati
translated: Just as in some cases the verb does not express the number in one place,

analyzed: tathā eva etasya saṃkhyā api śabda śakteḥ vyavasthitā
translated: In the same way, this number is also determined by the power of the word.

original: yo hi manyate karmaṇaḥ ka cittiṅabhihitasaṃkhyāītvaṃ dṛṣṭamato 'nyatrāpi tena bhavitavyamiti tasya va cittiṅantābhidheyatvadarśanātmarvatrābhidheyatvamapi syāt /
analyzed: yaḥ hi manyate karmaṇaḥ dṛṣṭam atas nyatra api tena bhavitavyam iti tasya cit tiṅ anta abhidheya tva darśanāt sarvatra abhidheya tvam api syāt
translated: One who thinks that the number expressed by the verbal ending belongs to the action, and therefore it should be so in other cases as well, for him the number would be denoted by the verbal ending in this case also, because it is seen to be denoted by the verbal ending in some cases.

original: atha tatkathaṃ ciyavatiṣṭhate tataḥ saṃkhyāpi tathaiva vyavasthāsyataityacaudyametat /
analyzed: atha tat katham cit avatiṣṭhate tatas saṃkhyā api tathā eva vyavasthāsyate iti a caudyam etat
translated: If it does not exist in that way, then the number would also be determined in the same way. This is not a problem.

original: tacaitatsyāt ka tṛviśiṣṭā saṃkhyā 'bhidhīyamānā na śakyā karttāramanabhidhāya tantravārtike /
analyzed: tat ca etat syāt ka tṛ viśiṣṭā saṃkhyā abhidhīyamānā na śakyā karttāram an abhidhāya tantravārtike
translated: And this may be so - when the number qualified by the agent is denoted, it cannot be stated without denoting the agent.

analyzed: vaktum iti 🔽uccate
translated: This is said.

original: agṛhīta viśeṣaṇe tadanuraktā viśeṣyabuddhirnopajāyata iti tadguṇamādarttavyam /
analyzed: agṛhīta viśeṣaṇe tad anuraktā viśeṣya buddhiḥ na upajāyate iti tad guṇam ādarttavyam
translated: When the qualifier is not grasped, the cognition of the qualified, colored by it, does not arise, so the quality must be accepted.

original: na tvanabhihita viśeṣaṇatvena kiṃ cidduṣyati yadi nāmāna bhihitamapi viśeṣaṇaṃ kena ciḍhanyena pratyāyyamānaṃ viśiṣṭa pratyayotpādanāya paryāptaṃ bhavati kiṃ tatrābhidhānānurodhena /
analyzed: na tu anabhihita viśeṣaṇa tvena kim cit duṣyati yadi nāma anabhihitam api viśeṣaṇam kena cit hanyena pratyāyyamānam viśiṣṭa pratyaya utpādanāya paryāptam bhavati kim tatra abhidhāna anurodhena
translated: But nothing is spoiled by not being stated as a qualifier. If, indeed, a qualifier, even though not stated, is made known by something else and is sufficient to produce a cognition of the qualified, what need is there to insist on its being stated?

original: asti ceha bhāvanayaiva pratyāyitasya kartturviśeṣapaṇatvaśaktiriti nābhidhānamapecate /
analyzed: asti ca iha bhāvanayā eva pratyāyitasya karttuḥ viśeṣapaṇa tva śaktiḥ iti na abhidhānam apecate
translated: And here, the word 'bhāvanā' itself has the power to make known the agent as a qualifier, so it does not require a statement.

analyzed: sarvatra viśiṣṭa pratyayeṣu ca etat avasthitam
translated: This is the case in all cognitions of the qualified.

analyzed: na ced anyena śiṣṭāḥ iti
translated: And if it is not made known by another, it is not a qualifier.

original: tatra viśiṣṭapratyaye jāte viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyayoḥ kiṃ śabdenopāttaṃ kimanyeneti parīkṣāyāṃ yatra yatra viśeṣyamanyataḥ sidhyati tatra viśeṣago śabdavyāpāro yatra viśeṣaṇamanyato labhyate tatra viśeṣye /
analyzed: tatra viśiṣṭa pratyaye jāte viśeṣaṇa viśeṣyayoḥ kim śabdena upāttam kim anyena iti parīkṣāyām yatra yatra viśeṣyam anyatas sidhyati tatra śabda vyāpāraḥ yatra viśeṣaṇam anyatas labhyate tatra viśeṣye
translated: There, when a cognition of the qualified arises, in the examination of whether the qualifier and the qualified are expressed by the word or by something else, where the qualified is established by something else, there the word's operation is on the qualifier. Where the qualifier is obtained from something else, there it is on the qualified.

original: sarvatra ca viśiṣṭa pratyayādevārthā pattyaikasya dvayorvā 'vayavayorviśeṣaṇavi śeṣyayorvyāpāraḥ śabde kalpyate /
analyzed: sarvatra ca viśiṣṭa pratyayāt eva artha āpattyā ekasya dvayoḥ vā vayavayoḥ viśeṣaṇa vi śeṣyayoḥ vyāpāraḥ śabde kalpyate
translated: And in all cases, the operation of a word is imagined to be in respect of one or two parts, the qualifier and the qualified, only because of the comprehension of the meaning from the special conditions.

analyzed: mā ca anyathā anupapatti rūpa tvāt an anya nabhye viṣaye bhavati
translated: And let it not be said that it is not so, because it is of the nature of non-apprehension of anything else.

original: tadiha viśeṣaṇabhūtaṃ viśeṣyabhūtaṃ caikatvaṃ tāvannānyato labhyate /
analyzed: tat iha viśeṣaṇa bhūtam viśeṣya bhūtam ca ekatvam tāvat na anyatas labhyate
translated: Here, the oneness, which is the qualifier and the qualified, is not obtained from elsewhere.

analyzed: yena anabhidheyam kalapyeta
translated: By which it could be imagined to be not denoted.

original: yadi hi kartā tatpratipādayituṃ śaknuyāttata ākṛtinyāyena sa evābhidheya itarattu vyaktivadgamyamānamityā śrīyate /
analyzed: yadi hi kartā tat pratipādayitum śaknuyāt tatas ākṛti nyāyena saḥ eva abhidheyaḥ itarat tu vyakti vat gamyamānam iti ā śrīyate
translated: For if the speaker could convey that, then, by the principle of class, it alone would be denoted, and the other, being understood like the individual, would be declared.

analyzed: tasya tu vyabhicāraṇa aśakta tvāt e katvam api abhidheyam eva āśrayaṇīyam
translated: But because of the impossibility of error in that, oneness must also be accepted as denoted.

original: tataśca tatra saṃcaritāyāmabhidhānaśaktau gamyamānāpannaḥ karttā satyapi viśeṣaṇanvenābhidheyaḥ saṃpadyate /
analyzed: tatas ca tatra saṃcaritāyām abhidhāna śaktau gamyamāna āpannaḥ karttā sati api viśeṣaṇa nvena abhidheyaḥ saṃpadyate
translated: And then, when the power of denotation has been transferred there, the agent, having become understood, becomes denoted even though the qualifier is not denoted.

original: yaḍhā tvekatvameva viśeṣaṇaṃ taḍhāpyavaśyaṃ tadeva prathamāntamabhidhātavyam /
analyzed: yaḍhā tu ekatvam eva viśeṣaṇam taḍhā api avaśyam tat eva prathama antam abhidhātavyam
translated: Even when oneness itself is the qualifier, then also that ending in the first case must certainly be denoted.

analyzed: tat ced abhihitam cīpa śaktiḥ śabdaḥ karttāram anyatas sidhyantam apekṣate
translated: And if this is said, the word, which has the power of denoting, requires the agent to be accomplished from elsewhere.

analyzed: sidhyati ca tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: And it is accomplished by the third section of the third chapter.

original: sau bhāvanāta iti nābhidhānaśakti kalpanā heturbhavati /
analyzed: bhāvanātaḥ iti kalpanā hetuḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, the power of denoting is not the cause of assuming the power of denoting.

original: yattvanyānyapi kārakāṇi pratīyante na taiḥ pratītairapratītairvā kaści dupakāro'nupakāro vā bhavati /
analyzed: yat tu anyāni api kārakāṇi pratīyante na taiḥ pratītaiḥ apratītaiḥ vā kaścid upakāraḥ anupakāraḥ vā bhavati
translated: And although other instruments are understood, neither their being understood nor their not being understood is of any help or hindrance.

original: sarvathā tāvadyaḥ prārthitaḥ ka rttā sa pratītaḥ yadi tvanyadapi pratīyate kiṃ no bādhyate tena hyapratītena vayaṃ bādhyemāha nābhyadhikapratyayena /
analyzed: sarvathā tāvat yaḥ prārthitaḥ ka rttā sa pratītaḥ yadi tu anyat api pratīyate kim no bādhyate tena hi apratītena vayam bādhyema āha na abhyadhika pratyayena
translated: In any case, the desired agent is understood. If something else is also understood, what is the harm? We are hindered by that which is not understood, not by an additional cognition.

original: pratītānyapi tu karaṇādīni śabdaśaktivaśātkarca bhinnāṣiṇyā saṃkhyayā na hi tathā yadyatpratītaṃ tattad grahītavyaṃ sarvatra hi pratītyapekṣāyogyatvādigrahaṇe kāraṇaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: pratītāni api tu karaṇa ādīni saṃkhyayā na hi tathā yat yat pratītam tat tat grahītavyam sarvatra hi pratīti apekṣā yogya tva ādi grahaṇe kāraṇam bhavati
translated: But although the instruments etc. are understood, they are taken by the word's power as different from the agent by number. For it is not so that whatever is understood should be taken. For everywhere the cause of taking is the suitability of the requirement of understanding.

analyzed: tat atra ubhaya siddhena saṃkhyāyāḥ kartṛ gāmi tvena kāra kānta
translated: Here, by number, which is established on both sides, the instrument etc. are taken as going to the agent.

analyzed: eyan apeścita tvāt ayogya tvāt ca sannihitāni api na sambandhi tvam pratipadyante
translated: Because they are not mentioned, and because they are not fit (to be related), even though present, they do not attain the relation (with the number).

analyzed: na ca teṣām api tiṅ abhihita saṃkhyā abhilāṣī vidyate
translated: And they also do not desire the number expressed by the verbal ending.

analyzed: sarvatra sup abhihita saṃkhyā paricchedya tvāt
translated: Because everywhere it is to be determined by the number expressed by the secondary suffix.

original: na caiṣā saṃkhyā sāmānyarūpeṇa pratītā satī saṃvandhyantaramapecate /
analyzed: na ca eṣā saṃkhyā sāmānya rūpeṇa pratītā satī saṃvandhi antaram apecate
translated: And this number, when cognized in a general form, does not require another related object.

analyzed: kathitaḥ hi viśeṣaḥ paurvāparya niyamāt
translated: For the difference between the two, the primary and the secondary, is stated by the rule of sequence.

original: tadyāvadeveca dhātvarthaḥ pratītastāvadeva kāpi bhāvanā karttā ca kaścidbhaviṣyatītyavadhāryate /
analyzed: tat yāvat eva ica dhātvarthaḥ pratītaḥ tāvat eva kā api bhāvanā karttā ca kaścid bhaviṣyati iti avadhāryate
translated: As long as the meaning of the verbal root is cognized, it is determined that there will be some such bhāvanā and some such agent.

original: tataśca pūrvatarapratote karttari saṃkhyā kevalaivābhivoyamānā viśeṣaṇatvaṃ viśeṣyatvaṃ pratipakyate /
analyzed: tatas ca pūrvatara pratote karttari saṃkhyā kevalā eva abhivoyamānā viśeṣaṇa tvam viśeṣya tvam
translated: And then, when the agent is cognized first, the number alone being expressed is cognized as the qualifier and the qualified.

analyzed: yadā bhāvanayā karttā prathamam pratipadyate
translated: When the agent is first cognized by the bhāvanā,

analyzed: na saṃkhyā saṃgateḥ ca asti tad atikrama kārāma
translated: there is no connection with the number, because it is beyond that.

original: nācaudanavyāpārī dhātunā prādhānyenopādīyate yataḥ ka rmaṇo viśeṣapratītamya saṃkhyocyeta mā bhūttasyaiva kartṛlakṣaṇāpanatvātkarmatvamutsṛjya kartṛtva / makartṛtvādeva ca na taḍyāpāro bhāvanā /
analyzed: na aca odana vyāpārī dhātunā prādhānyena upādīyate yatas ka rmaṇaḥ saṃkhyā ucyeta mā bhūt tasya eva kartṛ lakṣaṇa āpana tvāt karma tvam utsṛjya kartṛ tvam akartṛ tvāt eva ca na tad vyāpāraḥ bhāvanā
translated: The rice, which is not the principal factor in the operation, is not taken up primarily by the verb, because the number of the verb would be understood as referring to the action, and it would not be right for it to abandon its character as the object and become the agent, merely because it is the object of that same verb. And because it is not an agent, the operation is not a bhāvanā.

original: tena tathāpi na viśeṣarūpeṇa karmaṇaḥ paryapasthānam /🔽avaśyaṃ ca puruṣavyāpāra eva prādhānyena vaktavyo 'nyathā hi pa ravyāpāre'sya niyoga eva na bhavet/
analyzed: tena tathā api na viśeṣa rūpeṇa karmaṇaḥ paryapasthānam  avaśyam ca puruṣa vyāpāraḥ eva prādhānyena vaktavyaḥ nyathā hi niyogaḥ eva na bhavet
translated: Therefore, even so, the action is not presented in a particular form.🔽And the operation of the person must certainly be stated as primary, otherwise it would not be an injunction with regard to the other.

analyzed: ākhyāta padena ca akalpitam kartṛ tvam pada antara upāttasya api nā āvirbhavet
translated: And the agency, which is not imagined by the verbal ending, would not manifest even for that which is mentioned by another word.

analyzed: tatas ca tvayā iti api yā nasyāt
translated: And therefore, even the word 'tvayā' (by you) would not be there.

original: tayāpāreṇa vānabhibhūtavyāpāraṃ karma tenānāpyamānatvātkarmatvaṃ hitvā ''virbhūtavyāpāratayā kartṛtvameva pratipadyeteti svasaṃbandhatyāgena kartṛsaṃkhyayaiva saṃbadhyeta /
analyzed: tayā āpāreṇa vā anabhibhūta vyāpāram karma tena an āpyamāna tvāt karma tvam hitvā virbhūta vyāpāra tayā kartṛ tvam eva pratipadyeta iti sva saṃbandha tyāgena kartṛ saṃkhyayā eva saṃbadhyeta
translated: Or, the action, whose operation is not suppressed by that operation, would, because it is not taken up by that, abandon its character as the object and manifest its operation as the agent itself, and would be connected only by the number of the agent, abandoning its connection with itself.

original: tena pacatiśa bdavadeva pacyataityevamādyabhihitāpi saṃkhyā 'nabhibhūtatvātkatureva prāpnoti na karmaṇa iti /
analyzed: tena pacati śa bda vat eva pacyate iti evamādi abhihitā api saṃkhyā na abhibhūta tvāt katuḥ eva prāpnoti na karmaṇaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, just like the word 'cooks', even the number expressed by 'is cooked' etc. would apply only to the agent, not to the action, because it is not overridden.

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: sarvathā
translated: In every way

original: tadyadi mama karmotpannanakārīṣvapi karttureva saṃkhyā prāpnoti/
analyzed: tat yadi mama karma utpanna na kārīṣu api karttuḥ eva saṃkhyā prāpnoti
translated: If the number applies only to the agent even in the case of actions produced by the agent,

analyzed: tava api tarhi tatra kartṛ abhidhānena bhavitavyam
translated: then in your case also it should be expressed by the nominative.

original: atha tatra tava kathaṃ citkatturanabhidhānaṃ tadanmamāpi tatsaṃkhyānabhidhānamityadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: atha tatra tava katham cit kattuḥ anabhidhānam tadat mama api tad saṃkhyā anabhidhānam iti adoṣaḥ
translated: But if in that case the agent is somehow not expressed, then in my case also the number is not expressed. Thus there is no fault.

analyzed: tat etat avagyam āvāgyām evam pariharttavyam
translated: This objection should be answered as follows:

original: sarvacaiva tāvadīpsitatamatvādastuṇaṃ kārakāntarebhyaḥ karmaṇaḥ prādhānyaṃ bhāvyāṃśena ca tayāpārasya bhāvanāntargatatvam /
analyzed: kāraka antarebhyaḥ karmaṇaḥ prādhānyam bhāvya aṃśena ca tayā āpārasya bhāvanā antargata tvam
translated: To begin with, the action is primary among the other kārakas because it is most desired. And the instrument, being included in the bhāvanā, is secondary to the action.

original: tatra yadā tatprādhānyamākhyātenaiva darśayāmīti vivacyate tadā satyapi kartuḥ śabdāryarūpeṇa niṅṅghātubhyāma bhidhīyamāna pradhānabhūtamāmānya viśeṣarūpavyāpāratve tāvatā ca kartṛtvalābhe aparamya vastunakṣāsya prādhānyasya vivakṣitatvātkarmaṇi tatsaṃkhyāyāṃ vā cakārotpattiḥ /🔽yadā tu khannu tadvidyamānamapyavivakṣitatvādvātu viśeṣavaśena vā naiva tadastītyavagamyate śabdārtharūpaprādhānyamāne vivajñā bhavati tadā supā karmaprādhānyābhivyaktimaṅgīkṛtya karttari tatsaṃkhyāyāṃ vā lakāra utpadyate /
analyzed: tatra yadā tad prādhānyam ākhyātena eva darśayāmi iti vivacyate tadā sati api kartuḥ śabda ārya rūpeṇa tāvatā ca kartṛ tva lābhe prādhānyasya vivakṣita tvāt karmaṇi tad saṃkhyāyām vā cakāra utpattiḥ  yadā tu tat vidyamānam api avivakṣita tvāt vātu viśeṣa vaśena vā nā eva tat asti iti avagamyate śabda artha rūpa prādhānya māne bhavati tadā supā karma prādhānya abhivyaktim aṅgīkṛtya karttari tad saṃkhyāyām vā lakāraḥ utpadyate
translated: When it is intended that the principal nature of that [action] is shown by the verb itself, then even though the agent is denoted by the verbal root, the action which is the principal thing is in the form of a general or specific operation. And when the agent-hood is obtained by that much, and another thing is not intended to be principal, the affix is added to the accusative or the numeral.🔽But when that [action], though existing, is not intended to be expressed, and is not understood to exist at all due to the force of the particular word, then the idea of the principal nature in the form of the meaning of the word is abandoned. Then the affix is added to the nominative or the numeral, accepting the manifestation of the accusative as principal.

original: karaṇādīnāṃ tuna vastucacaṇā nāpi śabdalacaṇā prādhānyavivacā 'stīti nityameva bāhya śabdopādeyatvam /
analyzed: karaṇa ādīnām vastu cacaṇā nā api śabda lacaṇā prādhānya vivacā sti iti nityam eva bāhya śabda upādeya tvam
translated: But for the instrument and others, there is no intention to express the principal nature either by the denotation of the word or by the indication of the word. Therefore, they are always to be added externally by the word.

analyzed: ke cit panarāḥ
translated: But some people say:

original: yadaivaṃvidhaṃ śabdasāmarthyamavagamyate yathā'yaṃ karttava saṃkhyāṃ śaknoti vaktumayaṃ karmaṇa eveti /
analyzed: yadā evaṃvidham śabda sāmarthyam avagamyate yathā ayam karttava saṃkhyām śaknoti vaktum ayam karmaṇaḥ eva iti
translated: When such a capacity of the word is understood, as that this word can express the number in relation to the agent, and this in relation to the action itself.

analyzed: pada antareṇa api bhāvanā upasthāpanam sā eva saṃkhyā na anya viṣaya tvena abhihita tvāt karttāram upādāsyate mantravārtika
translated: Even by another word, the presentation of the bhāvanā is that same number, because it is stated as not having a different object, it will be related to the agent.

original: tadyathā śoṇa gando 'ngenānupātte'pyaśve tadgataṃ guṇaṃ vadannātmanaivāśvatvamapi gamayati /
analyzed: tat yathā śoṇa gandaḥ ngena an upāttaḥ ipi aśve tad gatam guṇam vadan ātmanā eva aśva tvam api gamayati
translated: Just as in the red horse, even when the horse is not mentioned, it indicates the quality belonging to it, and thereby conveys the horse itself.

original: tathā ca satyanenaiva nyāyena sarve gavādayo 'pyanabhidheyāḥ prāpnuvanti /
analyzed: tathā ca sati anena eva nyāyena sarve gava ādayaḥ pi anabhidheyāḥ prāpnuvanti
translated: And if that is so, then by this very reasoning, all other words like cow etc. would also become inexpressible.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: etāvatī cekabdaśaktiḥ kalpitā tadgatamevaiṣā guṇaṃ bravīti /
analyzed: etāvatī ca ikabda śaktiḥ kalpitā tad gatam eva eṣā guṇam bravīti
translated: And only so much capacity of the word is imagined, it expresses only the quality belonging to that.

original: kiṃ tataḥ paraṃ śaktyantarakalpanayā pūrvayaiva vyavahāropapateḥ /
analyzed: kim tatas param śakti antara kalpanayā pūrvayā eva vyavahāra upapateḥ
translated: What is the use of imagining another capacity beyond that? The transaction is possible by that alone.

analyzed: ayam tu evamādiṣu eka śabda upātta tvena saṃbandha niyamaḥ na śabda śakti vaśena
translated: But in cases like this, the restriction of relation by the mention of the same word is not due to the capacity of the word.

analyzed: tatas kartṛ saṃkhyā ādiṣu api tat eva abhyupagantavyam iti anabhidheya tva hāniḥ
translated: Therefore, in cases of the number of the agent etc. also, that same [restriction] should be accepted. Thus there is no loss of inexpressibility.

analyzed: tatra apare manyante
translated: Regarding that, others think:

original: kathaṃ hyaśvatve 'nucyamāne tadavacchinnaraktatva pratyayo jāyeta raktatvaviśeṣo me
analyzed: katham hi aśva tve tad avacchinna rakta tva pratyayaḥ jāyeta rakta tva viśeṣaḥ me
translated: For how could the cognition of redness restricted by that [horse-ness] arise when horse-ness alone is spoken of? The redness is mine, not the horse-ness.

analyzed: aśva tvam nā eva śogṇasya viśeṣaṇa tayā iṣyate
translated: Horse-ness is not accepted as the qualifier of the horse.

analyzed: kasutīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: The fourth section of the second chapter.

analyzed: guṇa jāti antaram tu etat vaivāt tat saṃgatim gatam
translated: But this is a different quality and class, which has come to be connected with that [horse-ness].

analyzed: sarva puṃsām sva saṃvedyam pratijāti guṇa antaram
translated: The difference in qualities for each class is to be experienced by every person.

analyzed: cittasya viśeṣeṇa bhidhā
translated: And because of the difference in the mind, the mind is designated as different.

original: atha yaduktaṃ gavādiṣvapi tadgatasaṃkhyādimātrābhidhānādeva jātiviśeṣa siddheranabhidhayatvaṃ prasajyata iti /
analyzed: atha yat uktam gavādiṣu api tad gata saṃkhyā ādi mātra abhidhānāt eva jāti viśeṣa siddheḥ anabhidhayatvam prasajyate iti
translated: Now, what was said - that even in the case of cows etc., the particular class is established by the mere designation of number etc. belonging to them, so the non-designation [of the class] would follow -

analyzed: tatra bramaḥ
translated: to that we say:

original: yadi hi śoṣaṇatvādivagavāśvagatānā mekatvādīnāmapi pratyakṣeṇa viśeṣo jacyeta tata evaṃ kalpyeta /
analyzed: yadi hi śoṣaṇa tvāt iva gavāśva gatānām eka tva ādīnām api pratyakṣeṇa viśeṣaḥ tatas evam kalpyeta
translated: If the difference of the oneness etc. belonging to cows and horses, such as the quality of being red etc., were cognized by perception, then it could be imagined in this way.

original: yadi ca yathā śoṣaprātipadikama vibhaktāvayavaṃ guṇavatvayorvācaka māpadyamānamanekaśaktikalpanābhabādanyata ra vācitvenādhyavasīyamāna maśvatvasya vya bhicāritvenāgamakatvādvyabhicāriguṇāvacanatvenāvadhāritamevaṃ gotvasaṃkhyayorapi samānaśabdābhidhānabhājoranyatarasyāvyabhicāritayā vācakatvamavadhāryeta / na tu tadasti / saṃkhyāyāstāvatmarvatra paricchedātmakatvānna kaścido dṛśyate /
analyzed: yadi ca yathā śoṣa prātipadikam a vibhakta avayavam guṇava tvayoḥ vācakam āpadyamānam aneka śakti kalpanā bhavāt anyatara vāci tvena adhyavasīyamānam aśva tvasya vya bhicāri tvena āgamaka tvāt vyabhicāri guṇa vacana tvena avadhāritam evam go tva saṃkhyayoḥ api samāna śabda abhidhāna bhājoḥ anyatarasya avyabhicāri tayā vācaka tvam avadhāryeta na tu tat asti saṃkhyāyāḥ tāvat sarvatra pariccheda ātmaka tvāt na dṛśyate
translated: And if, like the verbal root ‘śuṣ’ which, though consisting of several component parts, is, on the ground of the impossibility of assuming several potencies, determined to be denotative of only one of the two meanings of ‘drying’ and ‘cutting off’, and is, on the ground of the fact that the meaning ‘cutting off’ is found to be concomitant with the meaning ‘horse’, determined to be denotative of the meaning ‘cutting off’ only, on the ground of the fact that the meaning ‘cutting off’ is found to be concomitant with the meaning ‘horse’, in the same manner, if the denotative potency of the word ‘go’ were determined in regard to either of the two meanings ‘cow’ and ‘number’ on the ground of the fact that it is not concomitant with the other meaning, then such a determination would be possible. But it is not so. As regards number, it is found to be of the nature of the limiting adjunct of the object, and as such, it is not found to be concomitant with anything.

original: na ca nāvāneka śabda ubhayorvācakatvena saṃbhāvyate /
analyzed: na ca śabdaḥ ubhayoḥ vācaka tvena saṃbhāvyate
translated: And it is not possible for a single word to be denotative of both.

original: anvayavyatirekābhyāṃ prātipadikena jātyabhidhānādvibhaktyā ca saṃkhyābhidhānā / nna cāneka śabdasyāne kārya kalpanā doṣaḥ /
analyzed: anvaya vyatirekābhyām prātipadikena jāti abhidhānāt vibhaktyā ca saṃkhyā abhidhānāt na ca aneka śabdasya ane kārya kalpanā doṣaḥ
translated: On the ground of positive and negative concomitance, it is found that the verbal root denotes the class, and the case-ending denotes the number. And there is no objection in assuming several potencies in a single word.

original: yadi tatrānekasya śabdasya śaktyanekatvaṃ na kalpyeta tato 'nyatarasyānarthakatvameva bhavet/
analyzed: yadi tatra anekasya śabdasya śakti aneka tvam na kalpyeta tatas nyatarasya anarthaka tvam eva bhavet
translated: If the potencies of a word were not assumed to be several in this case, then one of them would be meaningless.

original: na ca saṃkhyā saṃkhyeyayora vyabhicāritvaṃ yenānyataraduccamānamitarasya gamakaṃ syāt /
analyzed: na ca saṃkhyā saṃkhyeyayoḥ a vyabhicāri tvam yena anyatarat ucca mānam itarasya gamakam syāt
translated: And number is not subject to deviation between the numbered and the number, by which one, being expressed by the other, would be the indicator of the other.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus:

original: nanu ca liṅgaṃ prātipadikenaivoccamānaṃ pratijāti vilakṣa pāmavyabhicārirūpeṇa pravarttamānaṃ śoṣatvāditulyaṃ syāt /
analyzed: nanu ca liṅgam prātipadikena eva ucca mānam pratijāti avyabhicāri rūpeṇa pravarttamānam śoṣa tva ādi tulyam syāt
translated: But indeed, an indicator, being expressed only by the nominal stem, operating with a form not deviating from each individual class, would be similar to shootness etc.

analyzed: a tat evam
translated: But it is not so.

original: yadyapi ṭābādayaḥ stroliṅgasya dyotakatvānna bhedena vācakā bhavanti pūrvasyaiva ca śaktyantaramāvirbhāvayanti tathāpi prāk ṭāvādibhyo yacchabdarūpaṃ tastatāvasthe liṅge jātiṃ prati bhaktiḥ kalpitā na paścādapanetuṃ śakyā /
analyzed: yadi api ṭāp ādayaḥ stro liṅgasya dyotaka tvāt na bhedena vācakāḥ bhavanti pūrvasya eva ca śakti antaram āvirbhāvayanti tathā api prāk ṭāp ādibhyaḥ yat śabda rūpam tastata avasthe liṅge jātim prati bhaktiḥ kalpitā na paścāt apanetum śakyā
translated: Even though the suffixes like ṭāp etc. are not denotative separately because they indicate the feminine gender, and they manifest a different potency of the same [word], still the gender in its original state, before the suffixes like ṭāp etc., is imagined to have an inherent tendency towards the class, which cannot be removed later.

original: tathā yatra vi bhaktisaṃbandhāt puṃstvaṃ napuṃsakatvaṃ cābhivyajyate tatrāpyevameva jātyabhidhānaṃ yojyam /
analyzed: tathā yatra bhakti saṃbandhāt puṃstvam napuṃsaka tvam ca abhivyajyate tatra api evam eva jāti abhidhānam yojyam
translated: Similarly, even where masculinity and neuputerness are manifested due to the connection with the inherent tendency, the denotation of the class should be construed in the same way.

original: yatra tu prāgeva vibhaktestannivṛttau vā satyāṃ śuddhādeva prātipadikādanyataraliṅgapratyayo bhavati ya thā istī nā devadattaḥ śrīḥ marittoyaṃ vārīti /
analyzed: yatra tu prāk eva vibhakteḥ tad nivṛttau vā satyām śuddhāt eva prātipadikāt anyatara liṅga pratyayaḥ bhavati ya thā istī nā devadattaḥ śrīḥ marit toyam vāri iti
translated: But where the gender is already expressed before the inflexion, or where it is not expressed at all, the gender is indicated by the stem itself, as in the words 'istā devadattasya śrīḥ', 'marittam toyam vāri' (the prosperity of Devadatta is desired), (the water of death is water).

analyzed: tatra tathātva abhyupagame pi na kim
translated: Even if we accept that gender is expressed in these cases, there is no harm.

original: atha vā vināpi śabdavibhāgenārthapratītāvutpādyamānāyāṃ sarvaṃ svasaṃvedyena vibhāgena prathamataraṃ jātiṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: atha vā vinā api śabda vibhāgena artha pratītau utpādyamānāyām sarvam sva saṃvedyena vibhāgena prathamataram jātim pratipadyate
translated: Or, even without the division of words, when the meaning is being cognized, one first understands the universal through the division that is known to oneself.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And further,

original: tena kāmaṃ liṅgameva jātigamyaṃ bhavenna jātirliṅgagamyā /
analyzed: tena kāmam liṅgam eva jāti gamyam bhavet na jātiḥ liṅga gamyā
translated: the gender may indeed be understood from the universal, but the universal is not understood from the gender.

original: nityaṃ copasarjanībhūtamevaitadgamyamānaṃ nārhati prādhānyena pratīyamānāyā jātera bhiṣeyatvaṃ vārayitum /
analyzed: nityam ca upasarjanī bhūtam eva etat gamyamānam na arhati prādhānyena pratīyamānāyāḥ jāteḥ a bhiṣeya tvam vārayitum
translated: And this, which is always understood as subordinate, does not deserve to prevent the universal, which is being understood as primary.

analyzed: na ca go paśu ādi śabda dhvanyatara liṅga abhivyaktiḥ jāti vat asti
translated: And there is no manifestation of the gender of words like 'go' (cow) and 'paśu' (animal) like the universal.

original: tasmājjātistāvadabhidheyā sā yatra liṅgaṃ na vyabhicariṣyati tatra gamiṣyatyapi /
analyzed: tasmāt jātiḥ tāvat abhidheyā sā yatra liṅgam na vyabhicariṣyati tatra gamiṣyati api
translated: Therefore, the universal is to be denoted. It will be understood where the gender will not be contradicted.

original: yacāpi vyabhicāre satyanyataḥ pratīyate tatra tadeva gamakaṃ tadanugṛhītā vā jātiḥ prātipadikaṃ veti yatheṣṭaṃ kalpyate /🔽tasmānnatantravārtika /
analyzed: vyabhicāre sati anyatas pratīyate tatra tat eva gamakam tad anugṛhītā vā jātiḥ prātipadikam vā iti yatheṣṭam kalpyate  tasmāt natantra vārtika
translated: And even when there is deviation, if it is understood from something else, there it is either that itself which is the indicator, or a class aided by that, or a nominal stem, as desired.

analyzed: śoṣa ādi tulya tā
translated: Therefore, there is no equality with drying etc.

original: pacatyādiśabdeṣvapi yadi saṃkhyā sarvakārakāntaravyāvṛttarūpaṇa kartṛmātrānusāriṇī śoṇatvavadupacabhyeta tatastayā nāma karttā gamyatāṃ tāvatā 'pyana bhidheyo bhavatyeva /
analyzed: pacati ādi śabdeṣu api yadi saṃkhyā sarva kāraka antara vyāvṛtta rūpaṇa kartṛ mātra anusāriṇī śoṇa tva vat upacabhyeta tatas tayā nāma karttā gamyatām tāvatā pi an abhidheyaḥ bhavati eva
translated: Even in words like 'pacati' (cooks), if number is understood to follow only the agent, excluding all other cases, like redness, then let the agent be understood by that. Even then, it does not become inexpressible.

original: yadā tu pūrvoktena nyāyena saṃkhyābhedo na labhyate prativastu cānantānyekatvādijātyantarāṇi na śakyante kalpayituṃ tadā bhāvanāghātvarthābhyāmevopādānamādarttavyam/
analyzed: yadā tu pūrva uktena nyāyena saṃkhyā bhedaḥ na labhyate prativastu ca anantāni eka tva ādi jāti antarāṇi na śakyante kalpayitum tadā bhāvanā ghātvarthābhyām eva upādānam ādarttavyam
translated: But when number difference is not obtained by the previously stated reasoning, and innumerable other classes like oneness etc. cannot be imagined for each entity, then the meaning of the root and the affix should be accepted alone.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And further,

analyzed: yadi śoṇasya api kaścid adbhyaḥ śvam upanayet na eva asau svayam kliśyet
translated: if someone were to bring a red horse from the water, he himself would not suffer.

analyzed: saṃkhyāyāḥ ca bhāva an ādhātvarthau upanetārau iti na svayam āyasyati
translated: And the number is brought by the meaning of the root and the affix, so it does not suffer by itself.

analyzed: bhāvanā upasthāne ca uktaḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: And when the bhāvanā is present, the difference stated (is to be understood).

original: tasmādanabhidheyasyaiva kartuḥ viśeṣyatva viśeṣaṇatvopapattera pramāṇamabhidhānaśaktikalpana mityavagacchāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt anabhidheyasya eva kartuḥ pramāṇam abhidhāna śakti kalpana miti avagacchāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, we understand that the assumption of the power of denotation is not a valid means of knowledge, because only that which is not denoted can be the qualifier or the qualified.

analyzed: evam nyāyena avadhārite kaścid āgama virodham darśayan āca
translated: When this has been ascertained through reasoning, someone points out the contradiction with scripture, saying:

original: prakṛtipratyayā pratyayārthaṃ saha brūta ityācāryopadeśātkarttā śabdārthaḥ karma cetyavagamyataiti /
analyzed: prakṛti pratyayā pratyaya artham saha brūta iti ācārya upadeśāt karttā śabda arthaḥ karma ca iti avagamyate eti
translated: Because of the teacher's instruction that the root and suffix together express the meaning of the suffix, it is understood that the word's meaning is the agent and the object.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Indeed,

original: nanu sūtrārthenaivāgamavirodhe darśita prakṛtipratyayā pratyayā rthamityetadasaṃbaddvam /
analyzed: nanu sūtra arthena eva āgama virodhe darśita prakṛti pratyayā pratyayāḥ rtham iti etat asaṃbaddvam
translated: When the contradiction with scripture is shown by the meaning of the sutra itself, this statement the root and suffix together express the meaning of the suffix is irrelevant.

original: kathamasaṃbaddhaṃ yadā pūrveṇa nyāyena kartuḥ prādhānyamapi pūrvapakṣavādinā darśayitavyam /
analyzed: katham asaṃbaddham yadā pūrveṇa nyāyena kartuḥ prādhānyam api pūrvapakṣavādinā darśayitavyam
translated: How is it irrelevant? When by the previous reasoning, even the primacy of the agent must be shown by the proponent of the prima facie view.

analyzed: tat etat abhidhānam prādhānyam ca ubhayam api smṛti siddham darśayati
translated: This statement and primacy, both of which are established by smrti, are shown.

original: yasmātprakṛtipratyayau saha brūtaḥ pratyayārthaśca karttā karma ca smaryate tasmātkriyāviśiṣṭayostayorabhidhānādastyeva śrutiprakaraṇavirodha iti /
analyzed: yasmāt prakṛti pratyayau saha brūtaḥ pratyaya arthaḥ ca karttā karma ca smaryate tasmāt kriyā viśiṣṭayoḥ tayoḥ abhidhānāt asti eva śruti prakaraṇa virodhaḥ iti
translated: Because the root and suffix together express, and the meaning of the suffix is remembered as the agent and the object, therefore, because they express that which is qualified by action, there is indeed a contradiction with the Vedic text and context.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: In the third chapter, the fourth section.

original: tatra laḥ karmaṇi cetyatra tāvaḍekāntenābhidheyatvena kartṛkarmakorupādānam /
analyzed: tatra laḥ karmaṇi ca iti atra tāvat ekāntena abhidheya tvena kartṛ karmakoḥ upādānam
translated: There, in the sentence laḥ karmmaṇi ce (Panini 1.3.1), the nominative and accusative cases are mentioned as having the same meaning of being denoted.

analyzed: punar ekam abhiṣeya tva darśanam
translated: In the sentence kataraḥ (which of the two), only one is seen to be the object of abhiṣeka (consecration).

original: anyattu karttaroti parasaptamī na ca śabda saṃniveśe karttā paratrāvasthitaḥ saṃbhavatyata ānarthakyāttadaṅgeṣviti śabde kāryaṃ vijñāyate /
analyzed: anyat tu para saptamī na ca śabda saṃniveśe karttā paratra avasthitaḥ saṃbhavati atas ānarthakyāt tat aṅgeṣu iti śabde kāryam vijñāyate
translated: But in the other, the nominative case is in the locative case. The nominative cannot be located elsewhere, so it is understood that the word refers to the parts of the sacrifice, because otherwise it would be meaningless.

analyzed: tatra eṣaḥ rthaḥ kartṛ vācini sārvadhātuke pratyaye
translated: There, this is the meaning: in a verbal affix denoting the agent, the nominative case is located elsewhere.

analyzed: sarvathā tāvat pratyaya arthaḥ karttavī uktam ācāryeḥ tasmāt ayuktam anabhidheya tva anumānam iti
translated: In any case, the meaning of the affix must be done. This has been stated by the teacher. Therefore, the inference of non-denotation is incorrect.

original: taducyate🔽tatra nāmāgamavirodho yukta udbhāvayituṃ yatra nyāyāgamau samānaviṣayau bhavata / iha tu nyāyasyānya eva viṣayaḥ kiṃ vācyaṃ kiṃ gamyamānamiti /
analyzed: tat ucyate  tatra nāma āgama virodhaḥ yuktaḥ udbhāvayitum yatra nyāya āgamau samāna viṣayau bhavataḥ iha tu nyāyasya anyaḥ eva viṣayaḥ kim vācyam kim gamyamānam iti
translated: That is said.🔽There, it is proper to raise the contradiction with the Vedic texts, where logic and the Vedas have the same subject matter. But here, the subject matter of logic is different - what is denoted and what is conveyed.

original: anya eva vyākaraṇa mate / rekārthaprayuktānāṃ kaḥ sādhuḥ ko 'pabhraṃśa iti /
analyzed: anyaḥ eva vyākaraṇa mate reka artha prayuktānām kaḥ sādhuḥ kā upabhraṃśaḥ iti
translated: The subject matter of grammar is different - which is correct and which is a dialect of words used for the meaning of the root.

original: na cānya viṣayeṇānyaviṣayasya durbalasthāpi bāgho yuktaḥ kimuta vāccagamyamānaviṣayatvena pratyakṣameva sarvasvasaṃvedyasya /
analyzed: na ca anya viṣayeṇa anya viṣayasya bāghaḥ yuktaḥ kim uta vācca gamyamāna viṣaya tvena pratyakṣam eva sarva sva saṃvedyasya
translated: And it is not proper for one object to obstruct another object even when it is weak, much less when it is directly perceived, which is understood by implication.

original: tena yadyapi karttā śabdārtha iti evamācāryā vadeyustathāpi svaviṣayādanyatra vadanto nādarttavyā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: tena yadi api karttā śabda arthaḥ iti evam ācāryāḥ vadeyuḥ tathā api sva viṣayāt anyatra vadantaḥ na ādarttavyāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: Therefore, even if the teachers were to say that the meaning of a word is the agent, still they would not be contradicted when speaking about something other than their own subject matter.

original: te tu naiva tathā vadanti /🔽nanu pratyakṣameva sūtramudāhatam /
analyzed: te tu na eva tathā vadanti  nanu pratyakṣam eva sūtram udāhatam
translated: But they do not speak in that way at all.🔽But isn't the sutra itself an example of perception?

analyzed: satyam na tu
translated: True, but it is not mentioned as the form of the treatise.

analyzed: kim taka deśa ālocanena
translated: What is the use of examining a part?

original: na ca tāvanmātreṇa śāstra viśeṣodbhāvanaṃ śakyam /
analyzed: na ca tāvat mātreṇa śāstra viśeṣa udbhāvanam śakyam
translated: And the particular treatise cannot be brought out merely by that much.

analyzed: kutas
translated: How so?

analyzed: anyaḥ eva eka deśena śāstrasya arthaḥ pratīyate
translated: The meaning of the treatise is understood by one part,

analyzed: anyaḥ ca paripūrṇena samasta aṅga upasaṃhanau
translated: and by another when all the limbs are put together completely.

analyzed: viśeṣeṇa tu vyākaraṇe
translated: But especially in grammar.

analyzed: tatra ha uka ekasmin pade prāyeṇa aṣṭa adhyāyī vyāpriyate
translated: There, for the most part, the Ashtadhyayi is applied to each word.

original: tena laḥ karmaṇi cetyasyaikadeśāntara paripūrṇa yorthastena saha virodhaḥ pariharttavyaḥ /
analyzed: tena laḥ karmaṇi ca ityasya eka deśa antara yaḥ ṛthaḥ tena saha virodhaḥ pariharttavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the part laḥ karmmaṇi ca should be reconciled with the complete meaning.

analyzed: iha ca etāvatā pratyaya vidhiḥ paripūryate
translated: And here, this much is fulfilled by the rule of the suffix.

analyzed: pratyayaḥ  paraḥ ca
translated: The suffix.🔽And the following.

analyzed: āy udāttaḥ ca
translated: And the one with long ā.

analyzed: anudāttau sup tiau
translated: The two short vowels.

analyzed: dhātoḥ
translated: Of the root.

analyzed: tatra upapadam saptamī stham
translated: There, the following is in the locative case.

analyzed: ku t a tiṅ
translated: The kud- suffix.

analyzed: vā sarūpaḥ striyām
translated: Or the one without a similar vowel in the feminine.

analyzed: varttamāne laṭ
translated: In the present, the laṭ.

analyzed: karttari kṛt
translated: In the agent, the kṛt.

analyzed: laḥ karmaṇi ca bhāve ca akarmakebhyaḥ
translated: The la is in the accusative and in the neuter for the intransitive verbs.

analyzed: lasya
translated: Of the la.

analyzed: tip ādayaḥ
translated: The tib and others.

analyzed: anudātta ṅ itaḥ ātmanepadam
translated: The ātmnepad is with the anudātta ṅit.

analyzed: śeṣāt karttari parasmaipadam
translated: The parasmaipad is in the agent for the rest.

analyzed: yuṣmad asmad upapadāḥ diṣu madhyama ādayaḥ
translated: The madhyamā and others are in the yūṣmad and āsmd following.

analyzed: tiṅaḥ trīṇi cīṇi prathama madhyama uttamāḥ
translated: The tiṅs are three each, the first, middle and last.

analyzed: tāni ekavacana dvivacana ba huvacanāni ekaśas
translated: Those are singular, dual and plural, each separately.

analyzed: bahuṣu bahuvacanam  hi ekayoḥ divacana ekavacane iti
translated: In many, the plural.🔽In one and two, the singular and dual.

original: parāṇi ca saṃjñāparibhāṣādirūpeṇa lopāgamavarṇavikārādiśāstrāṇi sarvāeyekaṃ vākyam /
analyzed: parāṇi ca saṃjñā paribhāṣā ādi rūpeṇa lopa āgama varṇa vikāra ādi śāstrāṇi vākyam
translated: And the other rules such as the definition of nouns, etc., which cause elision, addition, modification of letters, etc., are all one sentence.

original: ekavākyatā ca sati viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāve bhavati nānyathā/
analyzed: ekavākya tā ca sati viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāve bhavati na anyathā
translated: And oneness of sentence occurs when there is the relation of qualifier and qualified, not otherwise.

original: sopi ca sāmānādhikaraṇyena vā bhavati samānavibhaktyantānāṃ vaiyadhikaraṇyena vā kriyākārakarūpaḥ śeṣaśeṣirūpa/
analyzed: saḥ api ca sāmānādhikaraṇyena vā bhavati samāna vibhakti antānām vaiyadhikaraṇyena vā kriyā kāraka rūpaḥ śeṣa śeṣi rūpa
translated: And that is either in apposition, with words ending in the same case, or in the form of action and instrument, or in the form of subordinate and principal, with different case endings.

original: tadihānāpayikatvādavayavāntarāṇyapecya lādeśāḥ katari karmaṇi ca bhavantye kasminnekavacanam /
analyzed: tat iha an āpayika tvāt avayava antarāṇi apecya la ā deśāḥ katari karmaṇi ca bhavanti e kasmin ekavacanam
translated: Here, because of the lack of a preceding word, the affixes are formed in relation to other parts. In which case, in which action, and in which number is the singular?

analyzed: iyoḥ ḍirvacanam
translated: In two, the dual.🔽In many, the plural. The relation of qualifier and qualified among these is established by apposition.

original: bahuṣu bahuvacanamityeteṣāṃ viśeṣaṇaviśeṣyabhāvaḥ sāmānādhikatṛtīyādhyāyasya caturtha pāda /🔽raṣyavaiyadhikaraṇya pravṛttiva cintyate /
analyzed: bahuṣu bahuvacanam iti eteṣām viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya bhāvaḥ sāmānādhika tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda  cintyate
translated: The relation of different case endings is to be considered.

original: tatra tāvaddahaḍokaśabdāḥ saṃkhyāvacanāstāmanabhidhāya saṃkhyeye vṛttyasaṃbhavādityākṛtyadhikaraṇe sthāpitam/
analyzed: tatra tāvat dahar loka śabdāḥ saṃkhyā vacanāḥ tām an abhidhāya saṃkhyeye vṛtti asaṃbhavāt iti ākṛti adhikaraṇe sthāpitam
translated: There, it has been established in the section on the nominal suffix that words like 'daśa' and 'doha' are expressions of number, and cannot be used to denote the countable object without expressing that number.

original: pātañjale'pi ca keṣu bahudhviti praśnapūrvakamupakramya tatra doṣānabhidhāya saṃkhyāvacanatvamevāvadhāritam /
analyzed: pātañjale pi ca keṣu bahudhu iti praśna pūrvakam upakramya tatra doṣān abhidhāya saṃkhyā vacana tvam eva avadhāritam
translated: And in the Pātañjaladīpikā, after beginning with the question In which many?, and pointing out the faults there, it has been determined to be an expression of number.

analyzed: bahutve dinva ekatvayoḥ iti vivaraṇāt
translated: Because of the commentary In many, the dual and singular.

original: kathamantareṇa bhāvapratyayaṃ bhāvapradhāno bhavati nirdeśa iti pṛṣṭe bhavati yadā prathama eva guṇaḥ svaprādhānyena vivacyataiti vyākṛtam /
analyzed: katham antareṇa bhāva pratyayam bhāva pradhānaḥ bhavati nirdeśaḥ iti pṛṣṭe bhavati yadā prathamaḥ eva guṇaḥ sva prādhānyena vivacyate eti vyākṛtam
translated: When asked how a statement can be predominant in meaning without a word for existence, it is explained that when the first quality itself is to be expressed as primary, then the statement is predominant in meaning.

analyzed: tathā pūrvam eva guṇaḥ kaścid vātantryeṇa vidhīyate
translated: When asked how a statement can be predominant in reference to a substance without a case-ending indicating it, it is explained that when the first quality itself is expressed as primary, then a quality is sometimes enjoined independently,

analyzed: kaścid dravya aṅga bhāvena tatas niṣkṛṣya ca aparaḥ
translated: sometimes as a subordinate part of a substance, and then another is extracted from that.

analyzed: bahu tvam upajāyate
translated: Plurality arises in a collection of innumerable things.

analyzed: iye keṣu iti bhavet tatra yadi saṃkhyeya tantra tā
translated: If there were dependence on number there, it would be in those.

analyzed: anekasmin api prāptiḥ karttari syāt tipaḥ tathā
translated: Similarly, the affix tas would be used for the agent even in more than one,

original: sarvakāraka saṃsthe ca saikatve ca pramajyate
analyzed: sarvakāraka saṃsthe ca sa eka tve ca pramajyate
translated: and it is used for all cases and for unity.

original: śāstre hi kāryavaśenāna bhidheyasyāpyabhidheyatvaṃ pāribhā tantravārtike /🔽ṣikamāśrayate /
analyzed: śāstre hi kārya vaśena an abhidheyasya api abhidheya tvam pāribhā tantravārtike  ṣikam āśrayate
translated: For in the treatise, even that which is not to be denoted is regarded as denotable on the basis of the requirement of the action.

original: na ca tāvatā loke tathaiva prasajyate na cakarmādayo 'nabhidheyā evetyetacchāmle 'bhikṣitam /
analyzed: na ca tāvatā loke tathā eva prasajyate na eva iti etat śāmle bhikṣitam
translated: And it is not the case that merely by that it follows in the same way in the world. And it is not the case that nouns and so on are not denotable at all - this has been requested by Śāṃkhakṣa.

analyzed: kim tarhi ekānta abhidheyaka tva ādi viśeṣaṇam tāvat bhavanti iti etad hi ākhyātam eva
translated: What then? It is stated that they have the qualification of being always denotable and so on.

original: tasmādviśeṣaṇatāmevaite pratipatsyante /🔽tadyatra na śāstreṇa na nyāyenābhidheyatvaprāptistatrānabhidheyā vijñāsyante /
analyzed: tasmāt viśeṣaṇa tām eva ete pratipatsyante  tat yatra na śāstreṇa na nyāyena abhidheya tva prāptiḥ tatra anabhidheyāḥ vijñāsyante
translated: Therefore, they will be taken as qualifications.🔽Where they do not attain the status of what is to be denoted by the scripture or reasoning, there they will be known as not to be denoted.

original: yatra punaḥ śāstroktāṃ viśeṣaṇatāmana bhidhīyamānāḥ pratipattuṃ na śakṣyanti tatra nyāyalabhyāmananyagatitvāt abhidheyatāmapi pratipatsyante /
analyzed: yatra punar śāstra uktām viśeṣaṇa tām an abhidhīyamānāḥ pratipattum na śakṣyanti tatra nyāya labhyām ananyagati tvāt abhidheya tām api pratipatsyante
translated: But where they cannot be understood as having the qualification denoted by the scripture, they will be understood as what is to be denoted by reasoning, because there is no other way.

analyzed: arthāpattyā vā śāstreṇa api abhidheya nayā uktāḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Or they will be considered as denoted by the scripture through implication.

analyzed: tatra bhāvanā upasthāna a viśeṣaṇa tva siddheḥ na avaśyam abhidheya tvam aṅgīkarttavyam
translated: In that case, because the number is established as not a qualification of the denoted action, it is not necessary to accept that it is necessarily what is to be denoted.

original: susu punaḥ prātipadikārthānāmekatvādona cākārakeṣu kārakāntareṣu ca vyabhicārādanyatarapratipādanaśaktau vijñatāyāmanyasya ca bhāvanāṣātvarthā dargamaka syānabhidhānānna kiṃ cidupasthāpakamastīti svayaṃ kārakamanabhidhāya tadviśiṣṭa saṃkhyā bhighānānupapatteḥ kārakamapyabhidheyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: punar prātipadika arthānām ca akārakeṣu kāraka antareṣu ca vyabhicārāt anyatara pratipādana śaktau ca anabhidhānāt na kim cit upasthāpakam asti iti svayam kārakam an abhidhāya tad viśiṣṭa saṃkhyā abhighāna anupapatteḥ kārakam api abhidheyam bhavati
translated: But in the case of the meanings of the nominal stems, because there is singularity, and because there is no invariable concomitance with other instrumental nouns, when the ability to convey one of them is known, and because the other, which is implied by the meaning of the denoted action, is not denoted, there is no indicator at all. Therefore, without denoting the instrumental itself, because it is impossible to denote the number qualified by it, the instrumental also becomes what is to be denoted.

original: nanu ca kevalakāraka padaprayogābhāvādavaṇyaṃ bhāvyākhyātapadābhihitabhāvanopanītānāmeva kārakāṇāṃ ticiva saṃkhyāsaṃbandho 'vakalpiṣyate /
analyzed: nanu ca bhāvya ākhyāta pada abhihita bhāvanā upanītānām eva kārakāṇām saṃkhyā saṃbandhaḥ
translated: But since there is no use of mere nominal stems, the relation of number with the case-endings, which are brought in by the optative verb that expresses the result, will be possible.

analyzed: katham avakalpate
translated: How is it possible?

original: yaḍhā vākye svaniyatapadakrameṣu kaā cidākhyāta śabdātprathama prayuktena subantena vṛścamiti kāraka pratyayo janyamāno nābhidhānamantareṇa sidhyati /
analyzed: yaḍhā vākye sva niyata pada krameṣu cit ākhyāta śabdāt prathama prayuktena sup antena kāraka pratyayaḥ janyamānaḥ na abhidhānam antareṇa sidhyati
translated: When in a sentence with a fixed order of words, the relation of the case-ending that is first used with the optative verb is produced, it cannot be accomplished without denotation.

original: nanu tatrāpi kriyāsaṃbandhātprākārakatvānupapattestāvatkāraka vibhaktyā notpattavyaṃ yāvatkriyāsaṃbandho nopadarśitaḥ /
analyzed: nanu tatra api kriyā saṃbandhāt prākāraka tva anupapatteḥ tāvat kāraka vibhaktyā nā utpattavyam yāvat kriyā saṃbandhaḥ na upadarśitaḥ
translated: But even there, because the state of being a case is not possible without the relation to the action, the case-ending should not be produced until the relation to the action is shown.

analyzed: tatas ca kriyā pūrvaka tvam saṃpratipadyate eti
translated: And then it is understood to be preceded by the action.

analyzed: satyam
translated: This is true.

original: vakturevaṃ / śrotā punaḥ prathamameva vṛkṣamiti śruṇoti na tena kriyā tatsaṃbandho vānyataḥ pūrvamavadhāritaḥ
analyzed: vaktuḥ evam śrotā punar prathamam eva vṛkṣam iti śruṇoti na tena kriyā tad saṃbandhaḥ vā anyatas pūrvam avadhāritaḥ
translated: This is so for the speaker. But the hearer first hears the word 'tree', and he has not previously ascertained the action or its relation to it from elsewhere.

analyzed: saṃbandhinoḥ avaśya me kasya itara nirapekṣam
translated: Of these two relata, one must necessarily be admitted to be the basis of cognition without depending on the other.

original: tadiha yadi kriyāgamyaṃ kārakaṃ tataḥ kriyā kena pratyāyyataiti vaktavyama /
analyzed: tat iha yadi kriyā gamyam kārakam tatas kriyā kena pratyāyyate eti vaktavyam
translated: Therefore, here, if the case is understood through the action, then it must be stated by what the action is made known.

original: na ca tāvaracaprātipadikaṃ kriyāyā vācakaṃ śākhādimajjātimāṃtravacanatvāt /
analyzed: na ca tāvara ca prātipadikam kriyāyāḥ vācakam śākhā ādimat jāti māṃtra vacana tvāt
translated: And the nominal stem is not the denoter of the action, because it is said to be of the class beginning with 'śākha' (branch), etc.

analyzed: nā api prātipadika arthaḥ gamakaḥ vinā aspi kriyayā upapatteḥ
translated: Nor is the meaning of the nominal stem the conveyor, because it is possible without action.

original: athocyeta na jātu citkaścinniṣkriya saṃbhavatyato'sti tiṣṭhatyādikā kā cidekāntenāciptā kriyā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: athā ucyeta na jātu cit kaścid niṣkriya saṃbhavati atas asti tiṣṭhati ādikā kā cit ekāntena āciptā kriyā bhaviṣyati
translated: If it is said that no one is ever without action, therefore there must be some action like 'exists', 'stands', etc. which is absolutely not done.

original: atha vā'stirbhavantīparaḥ prathamapuruṣo 'prayujyamāno 'pyastīti gamyataityevaṃ sakriyatvātkārakāpekṣaḥ sekyatīti /
analyzed: atha vā astiḥ bhavantī paraḥ prathama puruṣaḥ prayujyamānaḥ pi asti iti gamyate eti evam sa kriya tvāt kāraka apekṣaḥ
translated: Or it is said that the first person ending in 'ti' (exists) is understood to exist even when not used. Thus, because of having action, it requires a case.

analyzed: tat anupapannam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: tiṣṭhati ādau upāte pi kriyā mātre hi a karma ke
translated: Even when 'stands', etc. are used, only action in general is meant, not an action with an object.

analyzed: karta mātram upāttam syāt na karma ādi niyogataḥ
translated: Only the agent would be meant, not the object, etc. by rule.

original: sarvacaiva yasya kasya citkāryasya sadasadbhāvadarśanādirūisadasaḍāvātmakatvānabhyupagame satyaikarūpyaṃ parigṛhyate /
analyzed: sarva ca eva yasya kasya cit kāryasya sat asat bhāva darśana ādi rūi sat asat ātmaka tva anabhyupagame satya aikarūpyam parigṛhyate
translated: And in every case, because the existence or non-existence of any effect is seen, if the nature of being both existent and non-existent is not accepted, then oneness is adopted.

analyzed: tad sadbhāvaḥ parigrahītavyaḥ
translated: That existence should be accepted.

original: satāmapi pratibandhātkāragāntarābhāvādanyato vā siddheḥ kāryānā rambhāvirodhādasataśca kāryavelāyāṃ devairapyaprāpteranimitta kāryotpādapramādityukta saṃbandhanityatve /
analyzed: satām api pratibandhāt kāraga antara abhāvāt anyatas vā siddheḥ kārya anā rambhā virodhāt asataḥ ca kārya velāyām devaiḥ api aprāpteḥ animitta kārya utpāda pramāt iti ukta saṃbandha nitya tve
translated: Even for existent things, due to obstruction, absence of other causes, or establishment from elsewhere, there is no contradiction in the non-production of effects. And since the non-existent is not perceived even by gods at the time of producing effects, there is the fear of the production of effects without a cause. Thus, the eternality of the relation is stated.

analyzed: tad kalpitā pūrvam tāvat prayoga
translated: The power of denotation, which is imagined in relation to that, is first applied to the usage.

analyzed: viparyaye punar udāsiṣyate
translated: In the opposite case, it will be rejected later.

analyzed: labdha ātmaka tvāt dā śrauta tve sati anumāna pratyayam
translated: Since it has attained its own nature, when it is heard, it rejects the inference and is accepted as the effect.

original: ataśca siddhā supāṃkamadiyo 'pyarthāstiṅāṃ tu niyatapaurvāparyavaśādekāntena dhātvarthabhāvanābhyāmupasthāpitayoḥ kartakarmaṇoḥ paścātsaṃkhyā 'vagamyataiti na kadā cidapi kārake viśeṣago vācakatṛtīyādhyāyasya caturtha pāda /🔽śaktikalpanāvasaraḥ /
analyzed: atas ca siddhā pi arthāḥ tiṅām tu niyata paurvāparya vaśāt ekāntena dhātvartha bhāvanābhyām upasthāpitayoḥ karta karmaṇoḥ paścāt saṃkhyā avagamyate eti na kadā cit api kārake viśeṣa gaḥ  śakti kalpanā avasaraḥ
translated: And therefore, it is established that even the well-known meanings are of the endings, but due to the fixed sequence, the number is understood after the agent and object, which are presented by the root meaning and the bhāvanā, and is never an occasion for imagining the power of denotation of the instrumental case.

original: tataśca nityānumeye karṭa karmaṇo iti siddham tantravārtika /
analyzed: tatas ca nitya anumeye iti siddham tantravārtika
translated: Therefore, it is established that the agent and object are always inferred.

original: abhedavarttitvaṃ hi tatpadasāmānādhikaraṇyamasaṃdigdhavācakeṣu kṛdanteṣu paktā devadattaḥ pakka odana ityādiṣu dṛṣṭam /
analyzed: abheda vartti tvam hi tad pada sāmānādhikaraṇyam asaṃdigdha vācakeṣu kṛt anteṣu paktā devadattaḥ pakkaḥ odanaḥ ityādiṣu dṛṣṭam
translated: For the co-reference is seen in indeclinable compounds with unambiguous denotations, such as 'the cook Devadatta', 'the cooked rice', etc.

original: yatra ca kartakarmavacanatvaṃ nāsti tattra sāmānādhikaraṇyamadṛṣṭaṃ yathā pākādiśabde /
analyzed: yatra ca karta karma vacana tvam na asti tattra sāmānādhikaraṇyam adṛṣṭam yathā pāka ādi śabde
translated: And where there is no expression of agent or object, co-reference is not seen, as in the word 'cooking' etc.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: tad śabda upātta tad bhuta saṃkhyā bheda anuvarttanāt
translated: because of the continuation of the number difference expressed by that word,

original: tathaiva vācakatvaṃ syāt dṛṣṭāntau tāvihāpi ca
analyzed: tathā eva vācaka tvam syāt dṛṣṭāntau tau iha api ca
translated: the denotation would be just like that, and those two are the examples here also.

analyzed: atas ca vācakaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And therefore, the denotative word is seen to be obstructed by the case endings of the factors enjoined by the unstated context,

analyzed: pacati devadattaḥ pacyate odanaḥ iti
translated: as in 'Devadatta cooks', 'the rice is cooked'.

original: yadi hi vācakatvaṃ na syāt tato 'nabhihite karmaṇi dvitīyā kartṛkara gāyostṛtīyeti ca vibhaktiprāptirna kena citpratibadhyeta /
analyzed: yadi hi vācaka tvam na syāt tatas karmaṇi dvitīyā ca vibhakti prāptiḥ na kena cit pratibadhyeta
translated: For if there were no denotation, then the attainment of the second case ending for the unstated object and the third case ending for the agent and instrument would not be obstructed by anyone,

analyzed: yathā paccate devadatena pacati odanam iti
translated: as in 'the rice is cooked by Devadatta', 'Devadatta cooks the rice'.

original: yatastu khalu pratibandha stenāvagagyate paktṛpakvasādharmyeṇaiva vācakatvaṃ sādharmyādanya hai dharmyaṃ tadevaṃ darśayitavyam /
analyzed: yatas tu khalu pratibandhaḥ paktṛ pakva sādharmyeṇa eva vācaka tvam sādharmyāt anya dharmyam tat evam darśayitavyam
translated: But where there is a restriction, it is understood by the similarity of the cooker and the cooked itself. The denotativeness is by similarity, not by any other property. That should be shown thus.

original: yatva ca vācakatvaṃ nāsti tatva kārakavibhaktipratibandho 'pi nāsti yathā paccate devadattena pacatyodanamiti /
analyzed: ca vācaka tvam na asti na asti yathā devadattena pacati odanam iti
translated: And where there is no denotativeness, there is also no restriction by the instrumental case ending, just as in 'Devadatta cooks', 'rice is cooked'.

analyzed: itas ca bodhakaḥ
translated: And from this, the word is expressive, because it conveys a particular.

analyzed: yathā śrotra makāra stha bodhakam śabda bodhanam
translated: Just as the ear, being in the state of a listener, is expressive of sound.

original: itaścābhidhīyete viśeṣaṇaiḥ saṃbadhyamānatvādiha śobhanaḥ pacati śobhanaḥ pacyate /
analyzed: itas ca abhidhīyete viśeṣaṇaiḥ saṃbadhyamāna tvāt iha śobhanaḥ pacati śobhanaḥ pacyate
translated: And from this, it is denoted, because it is connected with qualifications. Here 'the good one cooks', 'the good one is cooked'.

original: yavānayorviśeṣaṇa saṃbandhastavābhimeyatvamapi dṛṣṭaṃ yathā śobhana paktā ramaṇīyaḥ pakka iti /
analyzed: yava anayoḥ viśeṣaṇa saṃbandhaḥ tava abhimeya tvam api dṛṣṭam yathā śobhana paktā ramaṇīyaḥ pakkaḥ iti
translated: The connection of these two with qualifications is also seen to be the object of cognition, just as 'the good cook', 'the beautiful cooked rice'.

original: yatva tvabhidheyatvaṃ nāsti tatra viśeṣaṇasaṃbandhī 'pi na dṛṣṭo yathā śobhanamāsyataiti /
analyzed: tu abhidheya tvam na asti tatra viśeṣaṇa saṃbandhī na dṛṣṭaḥ yathā
translated: But where there is no denotation, the connection with qualifications is not seen, just as in 'the good is eaten'.

original: na ca gamyamānasya viśeṣaṇasaṃbandho yathā dhūmaśabdādagneravagatasya na jvalanādibhi saṃbandha iti /
analyzed: na ca gamyamānasya viśeṣaṇa saṃbandhaḥ yathā dhūma śabdāt agneḥ avagatasya na jvalana ādibhiḥ saṃbandhaḥ iti
translated: And the connection of what is being understood with qualifications is not seen, just as the connection of fire, which is understood from the word 'smoke', with burning etc.

original: tadetatsarvaṃ nanu karttarekatvādekavacana mityādinaiva darśitatvādvāṣyakāreṇa na prapacitam /
analyzed: tat etat sarvam nanu karttar eka tvāt eka vacanam ityādinā eva darśita tvāt vāṣya kāreṇa na
translated: All this has not been elaborated by the commentator, because it has already been shown by the argument beginning with But all this is not proper, because the agent is one.

analyzed: tad gata saṃkhyā yogya tvam sāmānādhikaraṇya ādibhiḥ vinā nā upapadyate
translated: The suitability of number belonging to it does not occur without co-reference etc.

analyzed: tasmāt abhidhāna pakṣaḥ eva nyāyyaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the theory of denotation alone is proper.

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: To this we reply.

analyzed: yat tāvat uktam vācakaḥ pacati ādi śabdaḥ kartṛ karmaṇoḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyāt iti
translated: As for what was said - that the word 'pacati' etc. is denotative, because of the co-reference of agent and object -

original: tatra yadi vācakaśaktyā istitvamanumoyeta tataḥ pūrvoktanāthapattimaṅgena sarvapramāṇānupapatteranupalabdhivirodha sarvaśaktīnāṃ cārthāpattirevaikaṃ pramāṇaṃ sā cehānyathā 'pyupattarnirākṛ tā /
analyzed: tatra yadi vācaka śaktyā isti tvam anumoyeta tatas sarva pramāṇa anupapatteḥ anupalabdhi virodha sarva śaktīnām ca arthāpattiḥ eva ekam pramāṇam sā ca iha anyathā tā
translated: if existence were inferred by the power of denotation, then all means of knowledge would be impossible due to the previously stated impossibility, there would be contradiction with non-apprehension, and for all potencies, presumption alone would be the means of knowledge, and that is refuted here by another possibility,

analyzed: anumāna virodhaḥ ca  na abhidhātā kartṛ karmaṇoḥ patantra vārtika
translated: and there would be contradiction with inference.

analyzed: ca tyādi śabdaḥ tad atyanta avinābhūta artha abhidhāyi tvāt
translated: The word 'pacati' etc. does not denote agent and object, because it expresses an object that is absolutely inseparable from it.

original: yo yadatyantāvinābhūtārthābhivāyo ma tasya na vācakaḥ yathā śiṃśapāśabdo vṛkṣatvaniyataśiṃśapātvasya tathā karta karmaṇī nābhidheye tiṅā tadabhidheyāparityāgāt /
analyzed: yaḥ yad atyanta avinābhūta artha abhivāyaḥ tasya na vācakaḥ yathā śiṃśapā śabdaḥ vṛkṣa tva niyata śiṃśapā tvasya tathā karta karmaṇī na abhidheye tiṅā tad abhidheya aparityāgāt
translated: That which is never separated from a certain meaning is not a denoter of that, just as the word 'shimshapa' is not of the tree-ness determined by shimshapa-ness. Similarly, the case endings are not denotative of the case-relation, because they do not abandon what is denoted by the verbal root.

analyzed: tad yāpāra ādinā ca pratīyamāna tvāt dravya tva vat
translated: And because it is understood even by the operation of that, like substance-ness.

analyzed: tasmin eva śiṃśapā śabde catva vat
translated: And in that very word 'shimshapa', like the class.

analyzed: kāraka tvāt ākhyāta anabhidhānam karaṇa ādi vat
translated: The case endings do not denote the case-relation, like the instrument, etc.

analyzed: tiṅ śabdasya a vā ā khyāta tvāt āsyate ityādi vat
translated: Because the word 'tiṅ' is known to be a denoter, like 'āsīta' etc.

analyzed: etat api śakyam vaktum
translated: This can also be said.

analyzed: nanu acandraḥ śaśīti vade tat laukika viruddham manumānam
translated: Isn't this inference contradictory to worldly usage, like 'the moon is not the moon'?

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: yadi vayaṃ pra tyāyyatvaṃ pratyāyakatvaṃ vā ninḍavīmahi tato lokaviru iṃ brayāma /
analyzed: yadi vayam tyāyya tvam pratyāyaka tvam vā tatas im brayāma
translated: If we were to criticize the denotability or denotative nature, then we would be contradicting worldly usage.

original: vācyavācakaśaktipratiṣedhastvayaṃ kriyate na ca tena lokaprasiddhivirodhaḥ /
analyzed: vācya vācaka śakti pratiṣedhaḥ tu ayam kriyate na ca tena loka prasiddhi virodhaḥ
translated: But this negation of the relation of denoted and denoter is being done, and by that there is no contradiction with well-known usage.

original: pratyayotpādamātreṇa kṛtārthasya lokasyābhidheyagamyamānadyotya viṣaya rūpārthacatuṣṭaya vivekā nādarāt /
analyzed: pratyaya utpāda mātreṇa kṛtārthasya lokasya abhidheya gamyamāna dyotya viṣaya rūpa artha catuṣṭaya vivekāḥ na ādarāt
translated: Because the world has its purpose fulfilled merely by the production of understanding, and because of its lack of interest in distinguishing the four types of meaning - denoted, inferred, suggested, and referred to - by the four types of relation.

original: yadi tu lokaprasiddhaṃ pratyāyya pratyāyakatvamātraṃ sādhyeta tataḥ prāguktena bhāvanāhārapratītyabhyupagamātsiisādhanam /
analyzed: yadi tu loka prasiddham pratyāyya pratyāyaka tva mātram sādhyeta tatas prāguktena bhāvanā āhāra pratīti abhyupagamāt sii sādhanam
translated: But if mere being the object of cognition and the means of cognition, as well-known in the world, were to be established, then the proof would be established by the previously accepted cognition of the injunction of the bhāvanā.

analyzed: loka virodhaḥ upi tava eva āpadyeta
translated: And contradiction with the world would befall you alone.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: lokaḥ yat anyatas siddham na abhidheyam tat icchati
translated: The world desires that which is established from elsewhere not to be denoted,

analyzed: yathā śrotra gṛhīta tvāt svarūpam na abhidhīyate
translated: just as the nature [of sound] is not denoted because it is grasped by the ear.

original: yathaiva pācakādiśabdeṣu dravyaprādhānyātmattvarūpa pratyayo bhavati evaṃ suptiṅanteṣvapi syāt /
analyzed: yathā eva pācaka ādi śabdeṣu pratyayaḥ bhavati evam sup tiṅ anteṣu api syāt
