translated: Just as in words like 'cooker', the notion of the nature of the substance being primary occurs, so it would also occur in words ending in suffixes and case endings.

original: tataśca yathaiteṣveva pācakaṃ brahi pācakena kṛtaṃ pācakāya dehīti kārakāntarayogo bhavati evaṃ pacatyodanamityādiṣvapi prāpnoti /
analyzed: tatas ca yathā eteṣu eva pācakam pācakena kṛtam pācakāya dehi iti kāraka antara yogaḥ bhavati evam pacati odanam ityādiṣu api prāpnoti
translated: And from that, just as in those very [words], the connection with other factors occurs as 'cook the rice', 'cooked by the cook', 'give to the cook', so it would also occur in 'cooks rice' and so on.

analyzed: tammāt śakti mahu vyakāraka pakṣe dhī avaśyam niṣkṛṣya śakti mātram mup tiṅbhyām abhidheyam eṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, in the case of the theory of the potency being the primary factor, the mere potency must necessarily be extracted and accepted as denoted by the suffixes and case endings.

analyzed: tathā sati hi
translated: For when that is so,

analyzed: āvirbhūta ekayā śaktyā dravyam ātma vaśīkṛtam
translated: the substance, having been brought under control by the single manifest potency,

analyzed: na śakti antara yogi tvam tadā eva
translated: is not seen to be connected with another potency at that very time.

original: pacati devadatta ityava kartatvaṃ tāvadbhāvanayaiva bodhitaṃ yā 'pi saṃkhyā sā'pi tiṅā kimanyadavaśiṣyate ya darthaṃ vibhaktirutpadyeta kathaṃ punara nekakārakasaṃnipāte sati kartatvameva bhāvanayā devadattasyāvagamitaṃ na kārakāntaratvamiti /
analyzed: pacati devadattaḥ iti ava karta tvam tāvat bhāvanayā eva bodhitam yā saṃkhyā sā api tiṅā kim anyat avaśiṣyate yat artham vibhaktiḥ utpadyeta katham punar aneka kāraka saṃnipāte sati karta tvam eva bhāvanayā devadattasya avagamitam na kāraka antara tvam iti
translated: In the sentence Devadatta cooks, the fact of being an agent is indicated by the verbal suffix itself. Even the number is indicated by the verbal suffix. What else remains to be indicated by the case-ending? How is it that when many factors are present, only the fact of being an agent is understood by the verbal suffix in Devadatta, and not the fact of being another factor?

analyzed: yogyatā vaśena iti ke cit
translated: Some say it is due to suitability.

original: devadatto hi pākasya kartṛtvayogyo na karaṇakatvādiyogyaḥ /
analyzed: devadattaḥ hi pākasya kartṛ tva yogyaḥ na karaṇaka tva ādi yogyaḥ
translated: For Devadatta is suitable to be the agent of cooking, not suitable to be the instrument or any other factor.

original: na cākārakasya sataḥ śrākhyātena saṃbandho 'vakalpate /🔽tasmātkatṛtvaṃ gṛhṇātīti na tvetatkāṣṭhāni pacantītyatva saṃbhavati /🔽na hi tāni kartṛtvayogyāni kiṃ tarhi karātvāṇīti prasiddhametat /
analyzed: na ca ākārakasya sataḥ śrākhyātena saṃbandhaḥ  tasmāt katṛ tvam gṛhṇāti iti na tu etat kāṣṭhāni pacanti iti a tva saṃbhavati  na hi tāni kartṛ tva yogyāni kim tarhi prasiddham etat
translated: And it is not possible for an entity without any factor to be connected by the verbal suffix.🔽Therefore, it is said to denote the fact of being an agent. But it is not possible to say the sticks are cooking, because they are not suitable to be agents.🔽Rather, it is well-known that they are suitable to be instruments.

original: athocyeta naivāva kāṣṭhānāṃ katattvaṃ kiṃ tarhi karaṇatvamevedamuktena nyāyena kartṛtvava tvāṃ vibhatinotpādayati /
analyzed: atha ucyeta na eva ava kāṣṭhānām kim tarhi karaṇa tvam eva idam uktena nyāyena vibhatinā utpādayati
translated: If it is said that the sticks are not agents at all, but rather the fact of being an agent is produced by the case-ending according to the reasoning stated, and the sticks are only instruments,

original: evaṃ sthālī pacatotyadhikaraṇatvaṃ saptamaum taṇḍulāḥ pacantīti karmatvaṃ dvitīyām kuśūla pacatītyapādānatvaṃ pañcama brāhmaṇāpacantoti saṃpradānatvaṃ ca caturthī sarvatra yogyatvasya nirṇaya kāraṇatvāditi /
analyzed: evam sthālī pacati iti adhikaraṇa tvam taṇḍulāḥ pacanti iti karmatvam dvitīyām kuśūla pacati iti apādāna tvam pañcama brāhmaṇāḥ pacanti iti saṃpradāna tvam ca caturthī sarvatra yogya tvasya nirṇaya kāraṇa tvāt iti
translated: Thus, in 'the pot is cooking', the instrumental case is used to express the state of being the substratum; in 'the rice grains are cooking', the accusative case is used to express the object; in 'the pot is cooking', the ablative case is used to express the source; and in 'the Brahmins are cooking', the dative case is used to express the recipient. Everywhere, the reason for determining the suitability is the instrumental cause.

analyzed: tat anupapannam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: kartṛ pratīteḥ sarvasya sva saṃvedya tvāt
translated: Because the cognition of the agent is self-evident for everyone.

analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: naiveyaṃ kartṛtvapratītirnānākārakapratotireva tu satī tiṅācya kartṛtvaprasiddhivāsanāvaśena tatmāmānādhikaraṇyabuḍyā kartṛ vadābhāsate /
analyzed: na evā iyam kartṛ tva pratītiḥ nānā kāraka pratotiḥ eva tu satī kartṛ tva prasiddhi vāsanā vaśena kartṛ vat ābhāsate
translated: This is not a cognition of agency at all, but rather a cognition of various forms. Due to the impression of the well-known agency expressed by the verbal ending, it appears as if it were the agent, by the cognition of being the substratum of that.

original: yastu nipuṇa paśyati tasya bhavatyeva tava tava kāraka vivekaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tu nipuṇa paśyati tasya bhavati eva tava tava kāraka vivekaḥ
translated: But for one who sees keenly, there certainly is a discrimination of the various cases.

analyzed: tathā hi  sthālī ādeḥ yaḥ u pi kartṛ tvam tadānīm adhyavasyati
translated: This is how it is.🔽Even one who determines the agency of the pot etc. at that time,

analyzed: na ādhārāt anyathābhūtam vyāpāram saḥ api vindati
translated: he also does not find the operation to be different from the substratum.

original: sarvatraivārthadaye sambhavatyanyatararūpavivacā yuktā sambhavati ca sarvakārakāṇāṃ khavyāpārāpekṣayā kartṛtvamiti purastātpratipāditam /
analyzed: sarvatra eva artha daye yuktā sambhavati ca sarva kārakāṇām kha vyāpāra apekṣayā kartṛ tvam iti purastāt pratipāditam
translated: Everywhere, when the meaning is possible in either way, the option of one form is proper. And it has been explained before that all the instrumental factors have the nature of the agent in relation to the principal action.

original: na hi pradhānakriyāgataṃ kārakavaicityaṃ mvavyāpāraviṣayāt kartṛtvādinopapadyate /
analyzed: na hi pradhāna kriyā gatam kāraka vaicityam mva vyāpāra viṣayāt kartṛ tva ādinā upapadyate
translated: For the variety of factors in the principal action does not follow from the agency etc. which have as their object the subsidiary actions.

original: tasmā ttadeva vivacitamiti nyāyyam na kārakāntarasaṃkhyābhidhānamiti /
analyzed: tasmāt tat eva vivacitam iti nyāyyam na kāraka antara saṃkhyā abhidhānam iti
translated: Therefore, it is proper to take that alone as intended, not the indication of the number of other factors.

original: evaṃ ca sati yatkarmasaṃkhyā 'pi kvacidabhidhīyate tavoktaṃ kāraṇaṃ na ca tadanyāvastīti vyavasthā /
analyzed: evam ca sati yat karma saṃkhyā kvacid abhidhīyate tava uktam kāraṇam na ca tad anyau asti iti vyavasthā
translated: And in this case, when the number of the object is also indicated somewhere, it is as stated, and there is no other reason for it, so it is determined.

analyzed: tadā tu anabhihita adhikāraḥ yā ivam kariṣyate
translated: Then, when the number is not mentioned, it will be done in this way.

original: anabhiṣṭite karmaṇa ekatve dile bahutve cetyādi /
analyzed: an abhiṣṭite karmaṇaḥ eka tve dile bahu tve ca ityādi
translated: When the object is not mentioned, it is singular if the ending is singular, and plural if the ending is plural, and so on.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: vibhaktayaḥ vidhīyante yatra tastha viśeṣa gām
translated: Where the case endings are enjoined, there the particular is understood.

analyzed: yujyate hi na punar tad viśeṣaṇe
translated: For the non-mention is proper, but not again in the particular.

original: yasya ca karmādayo vācyā yasya ca tahiśiṣṭā ekatvādayastayorubhayorapyanabhihitatvaṃ karmādiviśeṣagām /
analyzed: yasya ca karma ādayaḥ vācyāḥ yasya ca tad viśiṣṭāḥ ekatva ādayaḥ tayoḥ ubhayoḥ api anabhihita tvam karma ādi viśeṣa gām
translated: And for both of them, whose objects are the object etc. and whose particulars are the singularity etc., there is non-mention, which is particular to the object etc.

original: anabhihite karmaṇi dvitīyā nimihite vā karmaṇi ye ekatvādayo varttante teṣu dvitīyeti /
analyzed: anabhihite karmaṇi dvitīyā vā karmaṇi ye eka tva ādayaḥ varttante teṣu dvitīyā iti
translated: In the case of an unmentioned action, the accusative case is used, or in the case of a mentioned action, those that occur as singular etc. are the second case.

original: yadyapi copasarjana karmādayastathāpi viśeṣagona saṃbadhyante /🔽samosasyaṃ hyupasarjanaṃ viśeṣaṇairna sambadhāte vākyasyaṃ tu ṛisya rājñaḥ puruṣa itivatsaṃvadhyamānaṃ dṛṣṭamevamādi /
analyzed: yadi api karma ādayaḥ tathā api saṃbadhyante  hi upasarjanam viśeṣaṇaiḥ na sambadhāte vākyasyam tu rājñaḥ puruṣaḥ iti vat saṃvadhyamānam dṛṣṭam evamādi
translated: Even though the secondary elements like action etc. are so, they are still connected with the specific.

analyzed: evam ca vṛtti vākyayoḥ viśeṣaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: For a secondary element is not connected with specifications in a compound, but is seen to be connected in a sentence, like the man of the king of the Ṛis. Thus, there will be a difference between the statement and the sentence.

original: vākyasthāca karmādayo 'taḥ satyapyupasarjanatve śakna vanti samānavibhaktikānabhihitādhikāra viśeśyatāṃ pratipattuṃ tataśca pacati devadatta iti tiṅādibhiranabhihitastha kartuḥ saṃkhyāmabhidhātuṃ tṛtīyā prāpnotyeva /
analyzed: vākya sthāḥ ca karma ādayaḥ taḥ sati api upasarjana tve śakna vanti samāna vibhaktika anabhihita adhikāra viśeśya tām pratipattum tatas ca pacati devadattaḥ iti tiṅ ādibhiḥ anabhihitasya kartuḥ saṃkhyām abhidhātum tṛtīyā prāpnoti eva
translated: And even though the action etc. in the sentence are secondary, they are still able to understand the specification by the accusative case in the case of an unmentioned action. Therefore, in Devadatta cooks, the third case is indeed obtained to express the number of the agent not mentioned by the verbal endings.

analyzed: gata artha vāda prāptiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it is obtained by the explanatory passage, that is not so.

analyzed: bhīṣma ādibhiḥ anekāntāt
translated: Because it is not so in the case of Bhīṣma etc.

analyzed: uktam hi etat kaṭa dvitīyayā ukte pi karmaṇi bhauṣama ādibhyaḥ tad utpattiḥ iti
translated: For this has been said: Even when the action is mentioned by the second case ending, it arises from Bhīṣma etc.

original: yadi ca tṛtīyā gatārthatvānnotpadyate tataḥ prathamāvācyā 'pi saṃkhyā gataiveti kāmaṃ sā notpadyate /
analyzed: yadi ca tṛtīyā gatārtha tvāt na utpadyate tatas prathamā vācyā saṃkhyā gatā eva iti kāmam sā na utpadyate
translated: And if the third case-ending is not produced because it would be superfluous, then the first case-ending also would be superfluous, so it may well not be produced.

original: kevalaprātipadika prayogāsambhavāttadutpattiriti cet /🔽na evaṃ sati yathāvihitatatoyāprasaṅgāt /
analyzed: kevala prātipadika prayoga asambhavāt tad utpattiḥ iti ced  na evam sati yathā vihita tataḥ ya aprasaṅgāt
translated: If it be said that it is produced because a mere stem cannot be used,🔽then, if that were so, there would be the undesirable consequence of the case-ending being as prescribed.

original: na caiṣa nyāyena prasaṅga āpāditaḥ kiṃ tarhyāgamena /
analyzed: na ca eṣa nyāyena prasaṅgaḥ āpāditaḥ kim tarhi āgamena
translated: And this undesirable consequence is not urged by reasoning, but rather by scripture.

analyzed: na ca āgama virodhe nyāyaḥ kārya kṣamaḥ bhavati
translated: And when there is a contradiction with scripture, reasoning cannot be effective.

original: tasmādanabhihitaśabda eva lakṣaṇayā viśeṣātmanā 'navagatṛtīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /
analyzed: tasmāt anabhihita śabdaḥ eva lakṣaṇayā viśeṣa ātmanā
translated: Therefore, in the case of the mere stem, the third case-ending, which is not actually expressed, exists by implication in the form of a particular,

original: tatve varttate pacativa vyateśabdābhyāṃ ca saṃkhyāsaṃbandhādarāhiśeṣa rūpeṇa karta karmaṇo gamyete tammāttattadvibhaktirnotpasyate kārakāntarāṇi na kadā cidevaṃ viśeṣarūpeṇa pratīya ntaiti svavibhaktaurutpādayanti /
analyzed: tatve varttate ca rūpeṇa karta karmaṇaḥ gamyete tammāt tad tad vibhaktiḥ na utpasyate kāraka antarāṇi na kadā cit evam viśeṣa rūpeṇa pratīyante eti sva vibhaktauḥ utpādayanti
translated: and by the words 'pacati' and 'vyañjati', the number is connected, and the agent and the object are understood in the form of a remainder. Therefore, the case-ending is not produced. The other cases are never understood in this way in the form of a particular, so they produce their own case-endings.

original: kārakatvāviśeṣe 'pi ca yathā karttakarmaṇoreva viśeṣapratītiḥ saṅkhyāsambandhaśca bha vatīti tathoktam /
analyzed: kāraka tva aviśeṣe ca yathā kartta karmaṇoḥ eva viśeṣa pratītiḥ saṅkhyā sambandhaḥ ca bha vati iti tathā uktam
translated: And even when there is no difference in the nature of the agent, it is explained how there is the cognition of a particular distinction between the agent and object, and how there is the relation of number.

original: yatta / bhāvotpannalakārapakṣeṇa vyabhi cāge 'neha pacyate neha bhujyate ityādiṣa pacimālavivakṣāyāṃ karta karmaṇoranāśrayaṇāt dhātvarthabhāvanayorāśayate tataścāgamakatvamiti /
analyzed: bhāva utpanna lakāra pakṣeṇa vyabhi na iha pacyate na iha bhujyate ityādiṣa paci māla vivakṣāyām karta karmaṇoḥ anāśrayaṇāt dhātvartha bhāvanayoḥ tatas ca āgamaka tvam iti
translated: When it is argued that there is inconstancy in the case of the optative suffix denoting the production of an entity, it is said that in expressions like 'he cooks here', 'he eats here', etc., where there is the intention to speak of the agent and object, they are not relied upon, but the meaning of the root and the bhāvanā are relied upon, and therefore there is no inconstancy.

analyzed: tatra ucyate
translated: To that, it is said:

analyzed: tulyaḥ abhidhāna pakṣe sa doṣaḥ śabda gocaraḥ
translated: That fault is the same even in the theory of denotation, which is the domain of words.

analyzed: vācakasya api anekāntaḥ gamakasya iva nā iṣyate
translated: The inconstancy of the denotative word is not accepted, like that of the indicative.

analyzed: lakāram yamāṇam utsṛjya ādeśāḥ gṛhyante eti śruti bādhaḥ
translated: There is contradiction with scripture, as the case endings are taken to be derived from the optative suffix, abandoning it.

original: athāpi lakārasyaiva vācyā kamadiyo 'pyucyante tathā 'pi tenānabhidhīyamānāḥ santaḥ prāgādeśotpatterna śakyāstathā 'dhyavasātum /
analyzed: atha api lakārasya eva ucyante tathā pi tena anabhidhīyamānāḥ santaḥ prāk ādeśa utpatteḥ na śakyāḥ tathā
translated: Even if the case endings are said to be denoted by the optative suffix itself, still, being not denoted by it, they cannot be ascertained in that way before the case endings are produced.

analyzed: ante ca nyāya virodhaḥ sthitaḥ eva
translated: And in the end, the contradiction with logic remains established.

original: ataśca kasmiṃścidasama ase 'vaśya kalpanoye varamabhidheyatvameva pāribhāṣikaṃ kalpita me kāntasyāśrayaṇīyatvāt /
analyzed: atas ca kasmiṃścid asama ase vaśya kalpanoye varam abhidheya tvam eva pāribhāṣikam me kāntasya āśrayaṇīya tvāt
translated: And therefore, it is better to assume the conventional meaning of the suffix itself, rather than to assume the existence of an unseen object. For the object denoted by the suffix must be accepted.

original: na hi kathaṃ cidapi lāvasthāyāmapāribhāṣikamabhidheyatvaṃ sambhavati /
analyzed: na hi katham cit api la avasthāyām apāribhāṣikam abhidheya tvam sambhavati
translated: For in no way is it possible for the object denoted by the suffix to be non-conventional in the state of the Veda.

original: tena laḥ karmaṇi cetyādeśadvāreṇa lokavedārthamarthādeśanasuta svaśāstre vyavahārārthamiti parīkṣāyāṃ yadi lokavedayostiḍācyatvaṃ yuktyā 'vakalpayiṣyate tatastādardhyaparikalpanaṃ yuktam athānavaklṛptistataḥ svaśāstrārthatvamiti /
analyzed: tena laḥ karmaṇi ca iti ādeśa dvāreṇa loka veda artham artha ādeśana suta sva śāstre vyavahāra artham iti parīkṣāyām yadi loka vedayoḥ tiḍācya tvam yuktyā tatas tādardhya parikalpanam yuktam atha anavaklṛptiḥ tatas sva śāstra artha tvam iti
translated: Therefore, in the examination of whether the suffix denotes the meaning of the Veda and the world through the medium of the substitution of the suffix 'la' for the accusative case, or for the purpose of usage in one's own scriptures, if the denotability in the Veda and the world is logically possible, then the assumption of that meaning is proper. But if it is not established, then it is the meaning of one's own scriptures.

original: tatra tu lokavedārthatvasya pūrvaṃ nirākṛtatvāt pariśeṣataḥ svaśāstrārthatā /
analyzed: tatra tu loka veda artha tvasya pūrvam nirākṛta tvāt pariśeṣataḥ sva śāstra artha tā
translated: There, however, since the meaning of the Veda and the world has been refuted earlier, it is by elimination the meaning of one's own scriptures.

analyzed: tena etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

original: pāṇinermama kartṛ karmaṇī lakārābhihite draṣṭavye iti /
analyzed: pāṇineḥ mama kartṛ karmaṇī lakāra abhihite draṣṭavye iti
translated: The agent and object denoted by the suffix 'la' should be seen as mine, the author of Panini's grammar.

original: kiṃ punarasya prayojanaṃ yadā na lokavedayoste tathopalabhyete /
analyzed: kim punar asya prayojanam yadā na loka vedayoḥ te tathā upalabhyete
translated: What is the purpose of this, when they are not perceived as such in the Veda and the world?

original: yadyapi ca tatra nāsti prayojanaṃ svaśākhe tvasti /
analyzed: yadi api ca tatra na asti prayojanam sva śākhe tu asti
translated: And even if there is no purpose there, there is in one's own branch of the Veda.

analyzed: katham nāma anabhihita adhikāreṇa lakāra prayāge tayoḥ abhihita tva āśrayaṇāt paryudāsaḥ syāt iti
translated: How can there be an exclusion by the use of the verbal ending in the context of what is not denoted, by relying on the denotation of those two?

original: tasmādyadyapi paramārthato nābhidhīyete tathā'pi śākhe 'bhihitavadāśrayaṇāinabhihitādhikāravihita bibhakto na lakṣyete iti parihṛtaḥ kārakavibhaktiprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt yadi api paramārthataḥ na abhidhīyete tathā api na lakṣyete iti parihṛtaḥ kāraka vibhakti prasaṅgaḥ
translated: Therefore, even though in reality they are not denoted, still, by relying on what is denoted as if denoted in the branches, the case endings enjoined in the context of what is not denoted are not denoted. Thus the application of case endings for the agent is avoided.

original: yattu tadviśeṣābhidhānāditi ta cchiṃśapādiśabdara nai kāntikam /
analyzed: yat tu tad viśeṣa abhidhānāt iti na aikāntikam
translated: As for what was said about the designation of its particularities, that is not reasonable for words like shimshapa.

original: śiṃśā śabdo hi na tāvaha kṣatva pārthivatvadravyatva sattā prameyatvajñeyatvānāmabhidhāyako 'tha ca tahiśeṣameva śiṃśapāmabhidhatta /
analyzed: śiṃśā śabdaḥ hi na ca tad viśeṣam eva śiṃśapām abhidhatta
translated: For the word shimshapa is not a denotator of treehood, earthiness, substantiality, existence, measurability, or knowability, yet it denotes only the shimshapa tree.

original: tena yathā 'sya sāmānyamanabhidhāya viśeṣābhidhānaśaktirna viruvyate yathā ca cakṣuṣaḥ sāmānyamanityatvamagṛhato 'pi rupagrahaṇaśaktirna virudhyate yathā ca bhavato 'pi dravyamamabhidhāyaiva tiṅā tadviśeṣaḥ kartṛtvamucyate tathā sama ka bhidhānāhate tadviśeṣasaṃkhyābhidhānaṃ draṣṭavyam /
analyzed: tena yathā sāmānyam an abhidhāya viśeṣa abhidhāna śaktiḥ na viruvyate yathā ca cakṣuṣaḥ sāmānyam anitya tvam agṛhataḥ pi rupa grahaṇa śaktiḥ na virudhyate yathā ca bhavataḥ pi dravyam am abhidhāya eva tiṅā tad viśeṣaḥ kartṛ tvam ucyate tathā tad viśeṣa saṃkhyā abhidhānam draṣṭavyam
translated: Thus, just as the power to denote the particular is not contradicted without denoting the universal, just as the power of the eye to apprehend color is not contradicted even when it does not grasp the universal impermanence, and just as even for you the particular, agency, is denoted by the verbal ending without denoting the substance, in the same way, the denotation of the particular number should be seen as not contradicting the denotation of the universal.

original: yadapi gamyamānasya viśeṣaṇasaṃbandho nāstyatastatsambandhadarśanādabhidhānamiti tadapyākṛtyaruṇādhikaraṇayorubhayathā pi darśanānnirākṛtam /
analyzed: yat api gamyamānasya viśeṣaṇa saṃbandhaḥ na asti atas tad sambandha darśanāt abhidhānam iti tat api ākṛti aruṇa adhikaraṇayoḥ ubhayathā darśanāt nirākṛtam
translated: And what is implied does not have the relation of qualification, so the denotation is due to the perception of that relation - that too is refuted by seeing both ways in the sections on the cow and the ruddy one.

original: api ca madhuro rasaḥ snigdhaḥ śoto guruścetyanenā nai kāntikatvam /
analyzed: api ca madhuraḥ rasaḥ snigdhaḥ śotaḥ guruḥ ca iti anena a naikāntika tvam
translated: Moreover, the statement the sweet taste is unctuous, the heat is heavy is not elegant.

original: ava hi madhurarasasya guṇatvāt guṇāntaraiḥ śītādibhiḥ saṃbandho nāvakalpate ityetatpratipāditaṃ dravyaṃ saṃbadhyate na ca kathaṃ cidapi rasaśabdasya dravyavacanatvam /
analyzed: ava hi madhura rasasya guṇa tvāt guṇa antaraiḥ śīta ādibhiḥ saṃbandhaḥ na avakalpate iti etat pratipāditam dravyam saṃbadhyate na ca katham cit api rasa śabdasya dravya vacana tvam
translated: For, since the sweet taste is a quality, the relation with other qualities like coolness is not possible - this is what is being taught. It is related to the substance. And in no way is the word taste a designation for a substance.

original: tathā 'khasahasreṇa nagaraṃ muṣitāmati gamyamānānāmeva sādināṃ moṣakriyāsaṃbandhaḥ /
analyzed: tathā kha sahasreṇa nagaram muṣitām ati gamyamānānām eva sādinām moṣa kriyā saṃbandhaḥ
translated: Similarly, the connection of the cavalrymen with the act of plundering is seen only when they are going to the city to plunder it with a thousand horses.

original: yatta va ciḍūmādī rūpādau vā na dṛśyate na tāvatā sarvatra sthitiḥ kalpayituṃ śakyate /
analyzed: cit dūma ādiḥ rūpa ādau vā na dṛśyate na tāvatā sarvatra sthitiḥ kalpayitum śakyate
translated: Just because it is not seen in a pot or in color etc., it cannot be assumed to exist everywhere.

analyzed: tasmāt na abhidheyaḥ karttā tatantravārtike
translated: Therefore, the agent is not denoted by the verb, as stated in the Tantravārtika.

analyzed: tasmāt ca śrauta tva abhāvāt tra prakaraṇam vādhyate
translated: And because it is not heard, the context is overridden.

original: yattu karmadharmapakṣe darśapūrṇamāsa vidhinaiva vihitatvāt prātyātmiko vidhiranardhakaḥ syāt tasmātpuruṣārthateti tatra brūmaḥ /
analyzed: yat tu karma dharma pakṣe darśa pūrṇamāsa vidhinā eva vihita tvāt prātyātmikaḥ vidhiḥ anardhakaḥ syāt tasmāt puruṣa artha tā iti tatra brūmaḥ
translated: But in the case of the property of the action, it is argued that since it is enjoined by the injunction of the new and full moon sacrifices itself, the injunction for each individual would be purposeless, and therefore it serves the purpose of man. To that we say:

analyzed: yāvat na vidhi saṃmparśaḥ tāvat na asya prayojanam
translated: As long as there is no connection with the injunction, it has no purpose.

original: vinā ca tena dhātvartho na kratvaṅgaṃ pratīyate
analyzed: vinā ca tena dhātvarthaḥ na kratu aṅgam pratīyate
translated: And without that, the meaning of the verbal root is not understood to be a part of the sacrifice.

original: smṛtau ca yadannṛtavadananimittaṃ prāyaścittaṃ tadeva kataṃtryaṃ yadyanuvādaḥ /
analyzed: smṛtau ca yat annṛta vadana nimittam prāyaścittam tat eva kataṃtryam yadi anuvādaḥ
translated: And in the Smṛti, the expiation that is for the purpose of telling a lie is the same as the sacrifice, if it is a restatement.

original: vidhau punarasya yājurvedikatvāt bhraṣasya yajurvedato yajño vinaṣṭa ityanvāhāryapacane bhuvaḥ gvāheti hotavyam /
analyzed: vidhau punar asya yājurvedika tvāt bhraṣasya yajurvedataḥ yajñaḥ vinaṣṭaḥ iti anvāhāryapacane bhuvaḥ gvāhā iti hotavyam
translated: But in the injunction, because it belongs to the Yajur Veda, if the sacrifice is destroyed due to the Yajur Veda, one should offer oblations in the Anvāhāryapachana fire with the mantra bhuvaḥ and gāyatrī.

analyzed: smṛteḥ tu anyatara mūla tva an avadhāraṇāt na veda bhreṣa nimitta prāyaścitā avadhāraṇam syāt
translated: But since it is not ascertained that Smṛti has any one of the Vedas as its source, it cannot be ascertained that the expiation is for the loss of the Veda.

original: evaṃ mūlamūlibhāvābhyupagame 'pi smṛtyaiva tadarthastadatikramañcānusṛta iti tadīyameva prāyaścittam /
analyzed: evam mūla mūli bhāva abhyupagame smṛtyā eva tad arthaḥ tad atikraman ca anusṛtaḥ iti tadīyam eva prāyaścittam
translated: Thus, even if the relation of root and derivative is admitted, since the meaning of the Veda and its transgression are followed by Smṛti itself, the expiation belongs to it alone.

analyzed: nanu tava api yājurvedika tvāt jñānāt tat veda prāyaścittam eva bhavet
translated: But for you also, since it is based on the Yajur Veda, the expiation should be that of that Veda.

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: etad ḍya āhavanīya ādi viṣaya tvāt āhitāgti adhikāram avalambate
translated: Because it has as its object the Āhavanīya fire etc., it depends on the injunction of the Āhitāgni, and the prohibition of falsehood remains for the person who has not set up the sacred fires, because it is related to the person.

analyzed: tena asya tāvat avaśyam smārttam prāyaścittam apekṣa goyam
translated: Therefore, it must certainly depend on the expiation laid down in the Smṛtis.

original: taccedapekṣita me katvānnimittasyā hitāgnerapi ta deva yuktamiti vaidikaprāyaścittābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: tat ced apekṣita me ka tvāt nimittasya ā hitāgneḥ api yuktam iti vaidika prāyaścitta abhāvaḥ
translated: And if that is required, then because of the connection with the cause, namely, the setting up of the sacred fires, it is proper even for one who has not set up the sacred fires. Thus there is no expiation laid down in the Veda.

analyzed: kim ca  yajñe nyatama vedāṅge bhraṣṭe naimittikam śrutam
translated: Moreover,🔽when one of the Vedāṅgas is lost in a sacrifice, an occasional rite is prescribed.

analyzed: a yajña aṅga vināśe tu na tasya avasarī bhavet
translated: But when there is destruction of what is not an auxiliary to the sacrifice, it would not have an opportunity.

original: sarve hi samidādayaḥ kratvantaragatāḥ skhobaśakhajapādayaśca pūrvapacavādinaḥ puruṣasaṃskārāḥ te ca yājamānāstapradhānatvātkarmavaditya nenādhikaragona yājamānāḥ syuḥ tatva samaudādaunāṃ yāgātmakatvād dravyatyāgavyāpāreṇa dīkṣaṇoyādivadubhayathāpi yājamānatvāt /
analyzed: sarve hi samidh ādayaḥ kratu antara gatāḥ skhoba śakha japa ādayaḥ ca pūrvapaca vādinaḥ puruṣa saṃskārāḥ te ca yājamānāḥ ta pradhāna tvāt karma vat iti a nena adhikaragona yājamānāḥ syuḥ yāga ātmaka tvāt dravya tyāga vyāpāreṇa dīkṣaṇoya ādi vat ubhayathā api yājamāna tvāt
translated: For all the Samid and other (subsidiary rites), as well as the Stotra, Shakha, and Japa, which are mentioned in the Purvapaksha, are purificatory rites for the person (sacrificer), and as they are subordinate to the sacrifice, they are to be performed by the sacrificer, like the principal rite, as has been established in the Adhikarana on this subject. But in the case of the Samid and other (subsidiary rites), as they are of the nature of sacrifice, they are to be performed by the sacrificer in either way, by the operation of the offering of the material, like the consecration and other (rites).

original: tahadeva ca yajamānaviṭaḍāvapi tantreṇa prayoga iti na kaściḍiśeṣo dṛśyate /
analyzed: tahat eva ca yajamāna viṭaḍau api tantreṇa prayogaḥ iti na kaścid viśeṣaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And in the case of the Stotra, Shakha, and Japa also, there is no difference seen, as they are performed collectively.

original: ye tu stotraśakhajapādayaste guṇabhūta kartṛkarmaniya masamadhīṃ pradhānaniyamānadhikṛtāṃ pradhānaugātrādimamākhyāṃ bādhitvā dantadhāvanādivadyajamāna kartakā bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: ye tu stotra śakha japa ādayaḥ te guṇa bhūta kartṛ karma niyama sama dhīm pradhāna niyama anadhikṛtām pradhāna ogātra ādimam ākhyām bādhitvā danta dhāvana ādi vat yajamāna kartakāḥ bhaveyuḥ
translated: But those Stotra, Shakha, and Japa are subordinate, and being subject to the injunctions of the agent and object, they would be performed by the sacrificer like tooth-cleaning, overriding the general injunction of the principal rite.

original: yajamānabiṭaḍau ca sādhāraṇadravyatyāganyāyena tantratvaṃ na sambhavatīti pratiyajamānaṃ bhidyeran /
analyzed: yajamāna biṭaḍau ca sādhāraṇa dravya tyāga nyāyena tantra tvam na sambhavati iti prati yajamānam bhidyeran
translated: And in the case of the Stotra and Shakha of the sacrificer, the collective performance is not possible by the principle of the offering of the common material, so they would be separate for each sacrificer.

original: pratiṣedheṣvapi ca yadā vidhyaṃśa evamavadhāritaḥ kratuyuktapuruṣopakāryanṛtavadanamiti tadā'syaivānṛtaviśiṣṭapratiṣedhādayamartho bhavati yajamānenātmasaṃskārārthamāśīḥ prayogādiṣu yaducyate tatra vaikalpikāvadhāraṇe kharūpoccārago vā mṛṣātvaṃ na karttavyamanyava tvanyeṣāṃ ca yatheṣṭavāditvamiti /
analyzed: pratiṣedheṣu api ca yadā vidhi aṃśaḥ evam avadhāritaḥ kratu yukta puruṣa upakāri anṛta vadanam iti tadā asya eva anṛta viśiṣṭa pratiṣedhāt ayam arthaḥ bhavati yajamānena ātma saṃskāra artham āśīḥ prayoga ādiṣu yat ucyate tatra vaikalpika avadhāraṇe kharūpa uccāra gaḥ vā mṛṣātvam na karttavyam tu anyeṣām ca yatheṣṭa vādi tvam iti
translated: And even in prohibitions, when the injunctive portion is ascertained in this way - that it is the speaking of untruth by a person connected with a sacrifice - then from the prohibition qualified by untruth, this meaning arises: Whatever is said by the sacrificer in the rites of invocation etc. for the purpose of self-purification, there the form of untruth, whether optional or determinative, should not be uttered, but for others there is freedom to speak as they wish.

original: śuḍakratudharmapratiṣedhe tu yāvat katau kiṃ ciddadanaṃ yajamānasyavijāṃ vā'nṛtaṃ prasajyate tatsarvaṃ na karttavyaṃ kratusaṃbandhitvāviśeṣāt ataśca yathaiva yajamānena vrīhimayaṃ saṃkalpya na yavamayo dātavyaḥ /
analyzed: śuḍa kratu dharma pratiṣedhe tu yāvat katau kim cit dadanam vā anṛtam prasajyate tat sarvam na karttavyam kratu saṃbandhi tva aviśeṣāt atas ca yathā eva yajamānena vrīhi mayam saṃkalpya na yava mayaḥ dātavyaḥ
translated: But in the prohibition of the dharma of a purified sacrifice, whatever giving of something or untruth of the sacrificer occurs in the sacrifice, all that should not be done, because of the absence of any distinction in being connected with the sacrifice. And therefore, just as the sacrificer, having resolved on rice, should not give barley,

original: tathaivādhvarthyādibhirapyanantaraṃ pakṣaṃ kariṣyāma ityuktā na lāghavādivaśena punarvisaṃvaditavyam /
analyzed: tathā eva adhvarthya ādibhiḥ api anantaram pakṣam kariṣyāmaḥ iti uktāḥ na lāghava ādi vaśena punar visaṃvaditavyam
translated: in the same way, the Adhvaryu and others, having said We will perform the sacrifice tomorrow, should not again contradict it due to lightness etc.

original: yadapi ca punaḥ saṃskārārthaṃ kiñcittadapi kratvarthāśenaiva varjayitavyam /
analyzed: yat api ca punar saṃskāra artham kiñcid tat api kratu artha āśena eva varjayitavyam
translated: And whatever else is done for the purpose of purification, that too should be avoided only as being for the purpose of the sacrifice.

original: nanu ca pratiṣedhārthe guṇabhūtaḥ puruṣaḥ tata ādhvaryavasamākhyā niyāmiketi praṇītāyanādivadadhvaryurako 'nnṛtapratiṣedhamavalambeta /
analyzed: nanu ca pratiṣedha arthe guṇa bhūtaḥ puruṣaḥ tatas ādhvaryava samākhyā niyāmikā iti praṇītāyana ādi vat adhvaryuḥ akaḥ nnṛta pratiṣedham avalambeta
translated: But in the case of a prohibition, the person is subordinate, so the designation of the Adhvaryu priest should be the determining factor, just as in the case of the Prāṇīta-ayana, the Adhvaryu priest should rely on the prohibition of untruth.

analyzed: satyam avalambeta yadi pratiṣedha arthaḥ anuṣṭheyaḥ bhavet
translated: It is true that he should rely on it if the prohibition were something to be performed.

analyzed: ayam tu anuṣṭhāna abhāva ātmaka tvāt na karttṛ viśeṣam apekṣate
translated: But this [prohibition] does not depend on a particular performer, because it is not of the nature of an action that requires performance.

original: śrutyaiva ca pratiṣedhaḥ prāptyā saṃbandhaḥ sa yatna prāptistatva khasāmadhyena gacchan na śakyate samākhyayā vārayitum /
analyzed: śrutyā eva ca pratiṣedhaḥ prāptyā saṃbandhaḥ sa gacchan na śakyate samākhyayā vārayitum
translated: And the prohibition is connected by direct statement with the attainment [of truth], and that attainment, proceeding by the shortest route, cannot be prevented by the designation [of the Adhvaryu priest].

original: nanu vadedityetāvaddidhyāṃśamātramālocyamānaṃ samākhyā niyaṃsyati tataśca pratiṣedho 'pi tadanusāritvānniyato bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nanu vadet iti etāvat didhyāṃśa mātram ālocyamānam samākhyā niyaṃsyati tatas ca pratiṣedhaḥ u pi tad anusāri tvāt niyataḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: But the designation will restrict the mere part of the injunction he should speak that is being considered, and then the prohibition will also be restricted by following that [designation].

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

original: paryavasite hi śāstrārthe tatkarttarapekṣāyāṃ satyāṃ samākhyā vatarati /
analyzed: paryavasite hi śāstra arthe tad karttar apekṣāyām satyām samākhyā vatarati
translated: For the designation occurs only when the meaning of the scripture has been completed and there is a need for its performer.

analyzed: na ca vadet iti etāvataḥ śāstra artha tvam vijñāyate
translated: And it is not known that the meaning of the scripture is merely he should speak.

analyzed: pra tiṣedha saṃvandha ādi tad anuvāda tvena sthitam
translated: The connection with the prohibition and so on remain as its restatements.

original: na cānūdyamānasya śrutamapi viśeṣaṇaṃ bhavatīti grahādhikaraṇe sādhitam /
analyzed: na ca anūdyamānasya śrutam api viśeṣaṇam bhavati iti graha adhikaraṇe sādhitam
translated: And it has been established in the section on the cups that what is being referred to cannot be a qualifier even if mentioned.

analyzed: mama ākhyayā vidhīyamāna padārtha karta viśeṣa saṃbandha māle vyāpriyate
translated: But when the meaning of the word is being enjoined by the word 'mama', it is connected with the particular action.

analyzed: tasmāt andyamāna tvāt aidanam na viśeṣyate
translated: Therefore, what is being referred to is not qualified.

analyzed: pratiṣedhaḥ tad gāmau viśeṣṭum na eva śakyate
translated: And a prohibition too cannot qualify that.

original: snānaṃ tāvadyogyatayaiva malāpakarṣaṇārthatvātpuruṣārthaṃ gamyate tīrthaviśeṣaṇaṃ ca sukhāvataratvād duḥkhāvatārādatoryādyāvartayat puruṣasyopakaroti na kratoḥ /
analyzed: snānam tāvat yogyatayā eva mala apakarṣaṇa arthatvāt puruṣa artham gamyate tīrtha viśeṣaṇam ca sukha avatara tvāt duḥkha avatārāt atorya ādi āvartayat puruṣasya upakaroti na kratoḥ
translated: As for bathing, it is understood to serve the purpose of the person, because it removes dirt by its suitability. And the specification of the sacred place is also for the ease of entry, not for the difficulty of entry. Therefore, it benefits the person who enters, not the sacrifice.

original: yadapi ca smaraṇaṃ bhojanādipūrvabhāviniyamarūpeṇa tadapi tadarthasyaiva niyamādṛṣṭaṃ puruṣagāmyeva karoti tenāvadhāritaprayojanena saṃbadhyamānamtīrthaniyamo 'pi puruṣārtho vijñāyate /
analyzed: yat api ca smaraṇam bhojana ādi pūrva bhāvi niyama rūpeṇa tat api tad arthasya eva niyama adṛṣṭam puruṣa gāmi eva karoti tena avadhārita prayojanena saṃbadhyamānam tīrtha niyamaḥ pi puruṣa arthaḥ vijñāyate
translated: And even the remembrance in the form of a rule preceding eating etc. makes the unseen result of that for the person only, because of the rule. Therefore, the rule regarding the sacred place is understood to serve the purpose of the person, being connected with what has been ascertained as the purpose.

analyzed: tāvat daṣṭam eva prayojanam avataraṇa sukham
translated: And the visible purpose of that too is the ease of entry.

original: athāpyuddhṛtodakādinivṛttirūpo niyamo na dṛṣṭaṃ sādhayatītyadṛṣṭaṃ kalpyate tathā 'pyastyeva phalaṃ tīrthameva hi sajātānāṃ bhavatīti /🔽na caivaṃ vākyāt puruṣārthasaṃyuktasya prakaraṇamauśvaramasaṃyukta prakaraṇāditi sthitatvāt /
analyzed: atha api uddhṛta udaka ādi nivṛtti rūpaḥ niyamaḥ na dṛṣṭam sādhayati iti adṛṣṭam kalpyate tathā pi asti eva phalam tīrtham eva hi sajātānām bhavati iti  na ca evam vākyāt puruṣa artha saṃyuktasya prakaraṇam auśvaram asaṃyukta prakaraṇāt iti sthita tvāt
translated: Even if it be held that the Injunction, in the form of the restriction of the water to be taken up, does not accomplish anything that is seen, and hence an unseen result has to be assumed, even so, there is a result, in the shape of the Tīrtha itself being the means of accomplishing the desired result.🔽And it cannot be urged that, in this case, the sentence, being related to the human agent, would be taken as the subject of the Injunction, and the Tīrtha, not being so related, would be taken as the object of the Injunction; because it has been already established that, between the sentence and the Tīrtha, the Tīrtha is the subject and the sentence is the object.

original: tathā yadyapi brayādityanana karttā nopāttastathā'pi jañjayamānaśabdaḥ kṛdannatvātkarttari kṛditi cānatyaparassāra puruṣasaṃyuktasyeti ka pu pā /
analyzed: tathā yadi api karttā na upāttaḥ tathā api jañjayamāna śabdaḥ kṛt anna tvāt karttari kṛt iti puruṣa saṃyuktasya iti
translated: And even though the nominative of the verb brūyāt is not directly mentioned, yet, the word jñānayamāna, being a Kṛt formation, is to be taken as denoting the nominative, and as such, being related to the human agent, it is the subject of the Injunction.

original: tṛtīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /🔽gātkarṭa viśeṣagaṇaṃ puruṣamupādatta tena svāvākyopāttana saṃyukta mantrābhidhānaṃ prakaraṇagrāhyatvaṃ na pratipadyate puruṣasaṃyoge cāstyeva tatphalam /
analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda  puruṣam upādatta tena mantra abhidhānam prakaraṇa grāhya tvam na pratipadyate puruṣa saṃyoge ca asti eva tad phalam
translated: The fourth section of the third chapter.

analyzed: prāṇa apānayoḥ ātmani dhāraṇa cirajīvi tvam
translated: The verb brūyāt directly mentions the human agent as the nominative, and as such, the Mantra, which is mentioned in the same sentence, and is not related to the human agent, cannot be taken as the object of the Injunction. And when the Mantra is related to the human agent, there is a result in the shape of the long life of the man, by the retention of the Prāṇa and Apāna breaths in the Ātman.

analyzed: tasmāt puruṣa mātra dharmāḥ evaṃjātīyakāḥ iti
translated: Therefore, such Mantras are to be used only by the human agent.

analyzed: prakaraṇa viśeṣāt ā tad yuktasya sam skāraḥ dravya vat
translated: The sanctification of the related Mantra is like that of a substance, due to the particular context.

analyzed: puruṣa dharmaḥ iti etābat līmaḥ
translated: We hold that it is a property of the person.

analyzed: yat tu puruṣa māva dharmaḥ tatas ca utkarṣaḥ iti etat asahyam
translated: But that it is a property of the person and that there is an improvement from that - this is unbearable.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: avirodha ātmam āveśe lagyamāne pramāṇayoḥ
translated: When the two means of knowledge are applied without contradiction,

original: bāgho na yujyate karttuṃ na ca dūrātphalaśrutiḥ
analyzed: bāghaḥ na yujyate karttum na ca dūrāt phala śrutiḥ
translated: obstruction is not proper to be done, nor is the mention of the result from afar.

original: yathā hi vraudyādi prokṣaṇādibhiḥ saṃbadhagramānaṃ na ca tāvatprakaraṇena viśeṣyate/
analyzed: yathā hi vraudyādi prokṣaṇa ādibhiḥ na ca tāvat prakaraṇena viśeṣyate
translated: Just as the connection of the oblation etc. with sprinkling etc. is understood, and it is not specified by the context,

analyzed: atha ca anarthaka abhaya ādi prakṛṣṭa phala kalpanā pramāṇa abhāvāt ca kratu sādhana tvena prayojanava tvāt ca prakṛtam gṛhyate
translated: and yet it is taken as related to the context due to the fear of meaninglessness, the assumption of a superior result, and the absence of a means of knowledge, and due to the purposefulness as a means of the sacrifice.

analyzed: tathā tra phala kalpanā bhavāt pratyāsatti anurodhena prākaraṇikana abhyamāna grahaṇam kriyate
translated: Similarly, here, due to the absence of the assumption of a result, the taking of the mentioned is done in accordance with the proximity,

analyzed: na hi tad sambhave labhyate
translated: for when that is possible, the assumption of another result is not obtained.

analyzed: nanu ca klṛptam eva anayoḥ phalam iti uktam
translated: But it has been said that the result of these two is already fixed.

original: satyamuktaṃ na tvaudṛśa na śabdena phalamucyate kāmaśabdopabandhābhāvāt /
analyzed: satyam uktam na tu audṛśa na śabdena phalam ucyate kāma śabda upabandha abhāvāt
translated: It is true that it has been said, but the result is not stated by such a word, due to the absence of the connection with the word 'kāma' (desire).

original: etadeva ca nāva vidhāyakaṃ śabdamupalabhāmahe ityāha /
analyzed: etat eva ca vidhāyakam śabdam upalabhāmahe iti āha
translated: And this alone we do not find a word that is injunctive, he says.

original: phalavidhānaṃ haudṛśana śabdena na kriyataiti vakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: phala vidhānam haudṛśana śabdena na kriyate eti vakṣyāmaḥ
translated: We shall show that the injunction of the result is not done by the word 'should be done'.

analyzed: itarathā punar brūyāt iti avāpi asti eva vidhi vibhaktiḥ iti ayuktam eva vidhāyaka abhāva vacanam
translated: On the other hand, if it were otherwise, one could say that the injunctive suffix is indeed present in 'should be recited', so the statement that there is no injunctive word is not correct.

analyzed: na hi dhatta eti etasya a vidhāyaka tvāt apālambhaḥ bhavati
translated: For it is not a mere quibble that 'should be done' is not injunctive.

analyzed: sarva ca eva phala aṃśasya avidheya tvāt
translated: And in all cases, the part of the result is not to be enjoined.

analyzed: tasmāt yayā uktam eva yojanīyam
translated: Therefore, what has been said should be connected.

analyzed: dravya saṃskāra karmasu iti anena ca arthavāda tvam
translated: And by this 'in substances, purificatory acts, and rites', it is said to be a commendatory statement.

original: phalaṃ tu tatpradhānāyāmiti ca kāmapadopatradāyāṃ tadarthatvam /
analyzed: phalam tu tad pradhānāyām iti ca kāma pada upatradāyām tad artha tvam
translated: But the result is in that which has that as its primary purpose, and when the word 'desire' is added, it has that as its purpose.

analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: puruṣasya saṃskārakamiti gṛhṇīma iti saṃskāraśabdoccāraṇātkratuyuktapuruṣadharmatvamabhyupagacchati na hi svatantraḥ phalavatvā tsaṃskāra ityabhidhīyate /
analyzed: puruṣasya saṃskārakam iti gṛhṇīmaḥ iti saṃskāra śabda uccāraṇāt kratu yukta puruṣa dharma tvam abhyupagacchati na hi svatantraḥ phalavatvāt saṃskāraḥ iti abhidhīyate
translated: Since the word 'purificatory act' is uttered, he admits that the quality of the person connected with the sacrifice is accepted, for an independent act that has a result is not called a purificatory act.🔽What is the intention behind the statement 'even one who performs the new and full moon sacrifices'?

original: darśapūrṇamāsāveva kurvata ityetanneti kā 'bhiprāya /🔽sarvathā tāvajjanyamānadharmatveneṣa gamyatṛtīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /
analyzed: darśa pūrṇamāsau eva kurvate iti etat na iti kā 🔽sarvathā tāvat janyamāna dharma tvena iṣa gamya tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda
translated: In any case, it is understood as being produced in some way as a quality.

analyzed: mānaḥ ānarthakyena laukikāt nivaryeta
translated: The prohibition would be meaningless due to the worldly nature.

original: yastu jyotiṣṭomādau nañjabhyamānaḥ sa dārśapūrṇamāsikavadeva saprayojana ityaśakyo varjayitumityataḥ kratumātrayuktapuruṣadharmo bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ tu jyotiṣṭoma ādau nañ jabhyamānaḥ sa dārśapūrṇamāsika vat eva sa prayojanaḥ iti aśakyaḥ varjayitum iti atas kratu mātra yukta puruṣa dharmaḥ bhavati
translated: But that which is being prohibited in the Jyotiṣṭoma etc. is purposeful like the Darśa-Pūrṇamāsa rites, and cannot be avoided. Therefore it becomes a human dharma connected with the mere sacrifice.

analyzed: asya uttaram gūḍha abhiprāyam
translated: The answer to this is based on a hidden intention.

original: saṃskṛtena tu tena prayo janaṃ nāstīti /
analyzed: saṃskṛtena tu tena prayaḥ janam na asti iti
translated: But there is no purpose served by that which is refined.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: na saṃbandhī nivatasya yathaivātithyakarmaṇā /🔽śrutyādibhira saṃyogāttathaivāsya kriyāntaraiḥ
analyzed: na saṃbandhī nivatasya yathā eva ātithya karmaṇā  śruti ādibhiḥ a saṃyogāt tathā eva asya kriyā antaraiḥ
translated: Just as the guest-honoring rite has no connection with the Nivita,🔽in the same way this [Nivita] has no connection with other rites due to lack of connection with Śruti etc.

original: vidhestve kaśrutitvādaparyāyavidhānādityatra sarveṣāmevāṅgānā meka prayojanakalpanayaikaṃ vidhiṃ vaccati /
analyzed: vidheḥ tu e ka śruti tvāt aparyāya vidhānāt iti atra sarveṣām eva aṅgānām eka prayojana kalpanayā ekam vidhim
translated: In the section on because the injunction is heard, and because there is no injunction of synonyms, it is stated that all the subsidiary rites are enjoined by a single injunction through the assumption of a single purpose.

original: sa ca prayogavacanena vidhīyamānānāṃ bhaviṣyati prātyātmikavidhīnāṃ paryāyapravṛtta /
analyzed: sa ca prayoga vacanena vidhīyamānānām bhaviṣyati prātyātmika vidhīnām paryāya pravṛtta
translated: And that will be the case for the individual injunctions that are enjoined by the statement of performance, which operate in sequence.

original: puruṣaśca yena pravartyate sa vi dhiḥ /
analyzed: puruṣaḥ ca yena pravartyate sa vi dhiḥ
translated: And the injunction is that by which the person is impelled.

analyzed: aṅga pradhānavatyām ca bhāvanāyām yugapad puruṣa ni yogaḥ
translated: And in the bhāvanā consisting of the primary and subsidiary rites, there is simultaneous connection with the person.

analyzed: tasmāt prātyātmikānām anuvāda tvam
translated: Therefore, the individual [injunctions] are restatements.

analyzed: atra abhidhīyate
translated: Here it is said:

analyzed: granthau sādhū
translated: These two statements are correct.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: pūrvastāvantra cāvihitamaṅga bhavatītyanayā copapattyā na viruḍaḥ /
analyzed: pūrvaḥ tau antra ca avihitam aṅga bhavati iti anayā ca upapattyā na viruḍaḥ
translated: First, the subsidiary nature is not enjoined by the injunction, and this is not contradicted by the reasoning stated.

original: ukta hyatahidhādanāśrīyamāṇe dhātvarthamātrasya mādhyatvānniṣprayojana ve sati na śakyamaṅagatvaṃ kalpayituṃ tena tāvaddidhiḥ /
analyzed: dhātvartha mātrasya sati na śakyam aṅaga tvam kalpayitum tena
translated: For it has been said that when the meaning of the root alone is the middle term, without the meaning of the suffix being accepted, it is not possible to assume the subsidiary nature, as it would be purposeless. Therefore, it is an injunction.

original: atha cānuvādaḥ kathaṃ parveṇa vidhināṅgatvaṃ prakalpya prayogavacanaṃ yāvannīyate tāvantaṃ ca kālamasau vidhiṇāvatiṣṭhate /
analyzed: atha ca anuvādaḥ katham parveṇa vidhinā aṅga tvam prakalpya prayoga vacanam yāvat nīyate tāvantam ca kālam asau vidhiṇā avatiṣṭhate
translated: If it is a restatement, how is the subsidiary nature established by the injunction in the original? It remains an injunction for as long as it brings the statement of application.

analyzed: prayoga vacana grahaṇe tu sati tad aṅgatā saṃsparśāt eva puruṣa pravṛtti siddeḥ anuvāda tvam
translated: But when the statement of application is taken, it is a restatement because the engagement of the person is established just by the contact with the subsidiary nature itself.

original: ataḥ prāk prayogavacanasamarpaṇāddidhiravena vinā na vyavahāraḥ sidhyatīti vidhiḥ /
analyzed: atas prāk prayoga vacana samarpaṇāt didhiravena vinā na vyavahāraḥ sidhyati iti vidhiḥ
translated: Therefore, before the statement of application is presented, the engagement is not established without the injunction, so it is an injunction.

original: uttarakāle tu tata eva pravṛttisiddheranuvāda iti ubhayamapi sādhūktam /
analyzed: uttara kāle tu tatas eva pravṛtti siddheḥ anuvādaḥ iti ubhayam api sādhu uktam
translated: But at a later time, the engagement is established just by that, so it is a restatement. Thus both statements are correct.

analyzed: vyapadeśāt apakṛṣyeta
translated: It should be removed by designation.

original: prakaraṇa honasyātyantamavidyamānatvā ḍākyasaṃyuktaddā tadbhutavidhisaṃsparśādeveti ka pu pā /
analyzed: prakaraṇa honasya atyantam avidyamāna tvā ḍākya saṃyukta ddā tad bhuta vidhi saṃsparśāt eva iti
translated: The absence of context is absolutely non-existent, and it is only because of the connection with the injunction of the original act that it is not connected with the sentence.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: The fourth section of the third chapter.

analyzed: daśa upasattvam prakaraṇena agṛhyamāṇam utkṛṣyate iti adṛṣṭānta
translated: The tenfold attendance, not grasped by context, is postponed. This is not an example.

analyzed: śaṃyau ca sarva paridānāt
translated: And in the Śānkhāyana texts, because of the giving of everything.

analyzed: śaṃthau iti brāhmaṇa avagoraṇa ādi pratiṣedha vākya upalakṣa gām
translated: The word Śānkhāyana refers to the texts prohibiting the Brahmins from looking at cows, etc.

original: tatra pūrvavadeva pakṣāḥ teṣāmapi prākaraṇikaṃ saṃbandhaiyamadhyekīkṛtya nirdaṣṭaṃ kratudharmaḥ śuddhapuruṣadharmaśceti hāveva pacau /
analyzed: tatra pūrvavat eva pakṣāḥ teṣām api prākaraṇikam saṃbandhaiyam adhyekīkṛtya nirdaṣṭam kratu dharmaḥ śuddhapuruṣa dharmaḥ ca iti hau eva pacau
translated: There, just as before, there are two alternatives. Among them, considering the contextual connection, it is determined and stated that it is a duty of the sacrifice and a duty of the pure person. Thus, there are only two alternatives.

analyzed: samastena ca an nṛta vadana pratiṣedha nyāyena kratu arthasya avagoraṇasya pramajyamānasya pratiṣedhaḥ
translated: And by the method of prohibiting lying, the prohibition of looking at cows, which is for the sake of the sacrifice, is enjoined.

analyzed: kā ca tatra pramakti
translated: And what is the injunction there?

original: caturbrāhmaṇa sādhyatvāddarśapūrṇamāsayostadāna tyartha sāmadānabhedadaṇḍeṣu pramajyamāneṣvanvāhāryadānenānamayediti gamyate /
analyzed: catur brāhmaṇa sādhya tvāt darśa pūrṇamāsayoḥ tadā ana tyartha sāma dāna bheda daṇḍeṣu pramajyamāneṣu anvāhārya dānena ānamayet iti gamyate
translated: Since the new and full moon sacrifices are accomplished by four Brahmins, when the means of persuasion - conciliation, gifts, dissension, and punishment - are being employed, it is understood that one should bend them by the Anvāhāryapachana offering.

original: yadā tanmātreṇa nānamanti tadā punaryathā dānādānatirbhavati tathā prayatyamāne laukikopāyaprasaktau satyāmayaṃ daṇḍaprakāro 'vagoraṇādiḥ pace prāproti sa pratiṣidhyate /
analyzed: yadā tad mātreṇa nānamanti tadā punar yathā dānāt ānatiḥ bhavati tathā prayatyamāne laukika upāya prasaktau satyām ayam daṇḍa prakāraḥ vagoraṇa ādiḥ sa pratiṣidhyate
translated: When they do not bow down even by that much, then when the worldly means are engaged in, as in giving and taking, this method of punishment, such as beating, is obtained. That is prohibited.

original: na karttavyaṃ tena tadyatirekopāyāntarāśrayaṇaṃ kāryamityuktaṃ bhavati tathā prāpte'bhidhīyate /
analyzed: na karttavyam tena kāryam iti uktam bhavati tathā
translated: It is said that it should not be done, so one should resort to other means apart from that. When this is obtained, it is said:

analyzed: vākyena sarva saṃyogāt sarvebhyaḥ vara dānataḥ
translated: By the sentence, due to the connection with everything, from all, due to the bestowal of boons,

analyzed: phalasya kalpita tvāt ca na iṭa prakaraṇa grahaḥ
translated: And due to the imagined nature of the result, the grasping of the context is not appropriate.

original: tāmaparudhya yajeteti hi sāmānyataḥ sarvammādeva kratvanuṣṭhānādasau nirvārttitā kathaṃ saṃvāde prasajyeta /
analyzed: tām aparudhya yajeta iti hi sāmānyatas sarvammāt eva kratu anuṣṭhānāt asau katham saṃvāde prasajyeta
translated: For it is said in general that one should sacrifice after restraining that, so how can it be connected with the performance of the sacrifice?

analyzed: puruṣasya tu svātantryāt sarva kāla saṃvāde prāpte niṣedhasya arthavat tā
translated: But due to the independence of the person, when there is connection with all times, the prohibition is meaningful.

original: yadi ca smṛtirevamarthā vidyate tato mūlamūlibhāva evābhyupagantavyaḥ na hi kena cinnityānuvādatvamuktam /
analyzed: yadi ca smṛtiḥ evamarthā vidyate tatas mūla mūli bhāvaḥ eva abhyupagantavyaḥ na hi kena cid nitya anuvāda tvam uktam
translated: And if there is a smrti with this meaning, then the relation of root and derivative should be accepted. For by no one is it said to be a mere restatement of what is already known.

analyzed: anna pratiṣedhāt ca
translated: And due to the prohibition of food.

analyzed: itas ca puruṣa māva dharmaḥ
translated: And for this reason also, it is a property of the person.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: prāyas vacana nirṇeyam saṃdigdham vastu varṇitam
translated: An object of doubt is described as one whose nature is to be determined by a majority opinion.

analyzed: asaṃdigdha pum dharmaḥ na asyāḥ annam iti smṛteḥ
translated: The nature of a man is not doubtful, because it is remembered that he is not food.

original: prakaraṇāmrānastha hotadeva prayojanaṃ kathaṃ nāma tadaṅgatvaṃ vijñāyeteti yadyaprakaraṇādhītasyāpi karmāṅgataiva syātataḥ prakaraṇāmrānamanarthakaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: prakaraṇa āmrānastha hotat eva prayojanam katham nāma tad aṅga tvam vijñāyeta iti yadi a prakaraṇa adhītasya api karma aṅga tā eva syāt atas prakaraṇa āmrānam anarthakam bhavet
translated: If even what is not mentioned in the context were to be a part of the ritual, then the mention of it in the context would be meaningless.

original: yatastu vedenaiva prakaraṇāprakaraṇāmnānavivekaḥ kṛtaḥ tato 'vagamyate nūnaṃ prakaraṇādhītānāṃ puruṣadharmatvamiti /
analyzed: yatas tu vedena eva prakaraṇa a prakaraṇa āmnāna vivekaḥ kṛtaḥ tatas avagamyate nūnam prakaraṇa adhītānām puruṣa dharma tvam iti
translated: But since the Veda itself makes a distinction between what is mentioned in the context and what is not, it is understood that indeed the duties of a man are mentioned in the context.

analyzed: adravya tvāt tu śeṣaḥ syāt
translated: But it would be a subsidiary because it is not a substance.

original: yadyapi tāvaddiśiṣṭavidhānaṃ tathā 'pi karmaśeṣa eva syādanyathā hi phalaṃ kalpyeta /
analyzed: yadi api tāvat diśiṣṭa vidhānam tathā karma śeṣaḥ eva syāt anyathā hi phalam kalpyeta
translated: Even though it is the injunction of what is enjoined, it would still be a subsidiary of the ritual, otherwise the result would have to be imagined.

analyzed: nanu kratu saṃbandhaḥ ka lpayitavyaḥ eva
translated: But surely the connection with the sacrifice also has to be imagined.

analyzed: satyam pramāṇavataḥ hi tad kalpanā
translated: True, but that is imagined only when there is evidence for it.

original: kamaiṇaśca sāmānyena prayojanākāṅkṣāyāṃ karmaivopatiṣṭhate tena tatsaṃbandhaḥ pramāṇavān na khargasaṃbandha evaṃ ca manyate /
analyzed: kamaiṇaḥ ca sāmānyena prayojana ākāṅkṣāyām karma eva upatiṣṭhate tena tad saṃbandhaḥ pramāṇavān na kharga saṃbandhaḥ evam ca manyate
translated: And when there is a general expectation of purpose, only the ritual remains, so its connection is evidenced, not the connection with the sacrifice. And thus it is thought:

original: ya thā yāgadānahī mānmuktvā nānyat pradhānakarmatvaṃ pratipadyate na ceha yāgāditvamasti saṃpradānādyabhāvāt /
analyzed: ya thā mān muktvā na anyat pradhāna karma tvam pratipadyate na ca iha yāga ādi tvam asti saṃpradāna ādi abhāvāt
translated: Just as a sacrifice or gift, being principal, does not become subordinate to anything else, and here there is no sacrifice etc. due to the absence of the recipient etc.

analyzed: atas śrī itpattikena aṅga tvena karma śeṣa tvam
translated: Therefore, it is a subsidiary by origination, and is subordinate to the ritual.

original: atha vā dhāraṇa metat śrūyate taccotpattyaiva ghāryamāṇaśeṣabhūtam /
analyzed: atha vā dhāraṇa m etat śrūyate tat ca utpattyā eva ghāryamāṇa śeṣa bhūtam
translated: Or this wearing is heard, and that, being already worn by origination, is subordinate.

analyzed: na ca laukikasya niṣprayojana tvāt saṃskāra arha tvam
translated: And the worldly one is not fit for consecration because it is purposeless.

analyzed: atas karma aṅga bhṛtayoḥ vāsaḥ hiraṇyayoḥ vidhiḥ
translated: Therefore, the injunction is for the garment and gold which are subsidiary to the ritual.

original: atha vā tata evānekārthavidhidoṣātsati ca saṃbhave balādguṇe vidhiśaktisaṃcāragājiraṇyadhāraṇaṃ hiraṇyaṃ hastena bhavati atha gṛhṇāti hiraṇya haste saṃpradāya ṣoḍaśinā stuvataityevamādivākyavihitamandā suvargātā vidhīyate vāsaḥ paridhattaiti caitahihite vāsasi śobhanatvam /
analyzed: atha vā tatas eva aneka artha vidhi doṣāt sati ca saṃbhave balāt guṇe hiraṇyam hastena bhavati atha gṛhṇāti hiraṇya haste saṃpradāya ṣoḍaśinā stuvata iti evamādi vākya vihita mandā suvargātā vidhīyate vāsaḥ paridhatta eti śobhana tvam
translated: Or, from that very fault of enjoining multiple meanings, if possible, the power of injunction is transferred to the quality by force, and the wearing of gold is enjoined as having gold in the hand, then when the Ṣoḍaśin is chanted after handing over the gold in the hand, etc., the garment is enjoined as beautiful. And the garment is enjoined as beautiful when the garment is already enjoined by the injunction One should wear the garment.

original: evaṃ ca sūtrakārāṇāṃ hi ragayamiti jātahṛpaṃ pratīyādityādiparibhāṣaṇasyaitadeva mūlam /
analyzed: evam ca sūtrakārāṇām hi ragayam iti jāta hṛpam pratīyāt ityādi paribhāṣaṇasya etat eva mūlam
translated: And this is the very basis of the sutra-writers' rule One should understand the past participle as if it were the root and so on.

original: anyathā rajatajātarūpasādhāro sati hiraṇyaśabde 'nyatarāvadhāraṇamūlamanyat kalpyaṃ syāt /
analyzed: anyathā sati hiraṇya śabde nyatara avadhāraṇa mūlam anyat kalpyam syāt
translated: Otherwise, if the word 'hiraṇya' were common to both silver and gold, the assumption of some other basis for the determination of one or the other would be necessary.

original: adravyatvāditi ca nāva dravyaṃ vidhīyate kiṃ tarhi taviśeṣamātravidhānametat ataśca yaca dravyaṃ tavānena gantavyamiti /
analyzed: adravya tvāt iti ca dravyam vidhīyate kim tarhi atas ca dravyam tava anena gantavyam iti
translated: And as for the reason 'because it is not a substance', it does not enjoin a substance at all, but rather the mere injunction of a particular quality. And therefore whatever substance there is, that should be taken by this.

analyzed: yat tu atra bhāṣyakāreṇa devatā grahaṇam kṛtam
translated: Now, the use of the word 'devatā' (deity) by the author of the Bhāṣya (commentary) here,

analyzed: tat utsū tvam ayuktam ca pradhānam hi japa ādi api
translated: That is irrelevant, for the principal (act) is the Japa (muttering of mantras) and so on.

analyzed: homāḥ tu vyavatiṣṭheran āhavanīya saṃyogāt
translated: But the Homa (oblations) would be restricted, because of the connection with the Āhavanīya (sacrificial) fire.

original: yaśca vyavatiṣṭherannete homā vaidekeṣveva na sarvatra bhaveyuḥ / kutaḥ/
analyzed: yaḥ ca vyavatiṣṭheran ete homāḥ vaidekeṣu eva na sarvatra bhaveyuḥ kutas
translated: And those that would be restricted, these Homa offerings would be only in the Vaitāna (sacrifices), not everywhere. Why?

analyzed: samāna deśa tā nityam iṣyate ṅga pradhānayoḥ
translated: The place of the subsidiary and the principal is always considered to be the same.

original: na ca kṛṣyādibhiḥ sākrameṣāṃ syāt tulyadeśatā
analyzed: na ca kṛṣi ādibhiḥ sākram eṣām syāt tulya deśa tā
translated: And with agriculture etc. their being in the same place would not be sequential.

original: varuṇo vā evaṃ gṛhṇāti yo 'śvaṃ pratigṛhṇātīti pāpena grahaṇaṃ yasmintraśvapratigṛhe sa nimittaṃ pratīyate ta dapi ca pāpagṛhaṇaṃ prāptamanadyate /
analyzed: varuṇaḥ vai evam gṛhṇāti śvam pratigṛhṇāti iti pāpena grahaṇam yasmin aśva pratigṛhe sa nimittam pratīyate tat api ca pāpa gṛhaṇam prāptam anadyate
translated: Or Varuṇa indeed takes possession of him who accepts a horse. The evil possession is understood in that which is the cause of accepting a horse. And that evil possession is obtained and is prohibited.

original: yadi hi vidhīyate tataḥ kadā cidetaddākyasāmarthyādeva vaidike'pi syāt /
analyzed: yadi hi vidhīyate tatas kadā cit etad dākya sāmarthyāt eva vaidike api syāt
translated: For if it were enjoined, then this might occur even in Vedic [acts] by the power of that sentence itself.

analyzed: na tu vidhauyate sarva phalānām avidheya tvāt
translated: But it is not enjoined, because all results are not to be enjoined.

original: na ca tatra karmavidhānaṃ vidheyasya karmaṇa pāpaphalatvāsaṃbhavāt /
analyzed: na ca tatra karma vidhānam vidheyasya karmaṇa pāpa phala tva asaṃbhavāt
translated: And here there is no injunction of the act, because for the enjoined act, the result of sin is not possible.

analyzed: na ca iha aśva pratigṛha pratiṣidhyate tad aśravaṇāt
translated: And here the acceptance of a horse is not prohibited, because that is not heard.

analyzed: nimitta saṃbandha mātra upayogāt ca
translated: And because it is useful only for the connection with the reason.

analyzed: tammāt atyanta saṃbandhāt ya tva pratiṣedhaḥ tava doṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, due to the very close connection, the prohibition is only of that [acceptance of a horse].

original: sa ca laukikasya pratiṣedho na kesariṇo dadāti nobhayatodataḥ pratigṛhṇātauti /
analyzed: sa ca laukikasya pratiṣedhaḥ na kesariṇaḥ dadāti na ubhaya todataḥ pratigṛhṇāti iti
translated: And that prohibition of the worldly [acceptance] is not of the acceptance of a horse with a mane, or of the acceptance of a horse with teeth on both jaws.

analyzed: nanu ayam api pra tiṣedhaḥ sāmānyena eva śrayate
translated: But this prohibition is heard only in general.

analyzed: satyam tanā etra tu laukikasya iti brūmaḥ
translated: True, but we say it is only of the worldly [acceptance].

analyzed: itarasya pratiṣedha viṣaya tva asaṃbhavāt
translated: Because for the other [acceptance] which is connected with a special injunction, it is not possible to be the object of prohibition.

analyzed: atas ca doṣa samabhivyāhṛtāt iṣṭiḥ api laukika viṣayā syāt
translated: And therefore, even the enjoined [acceptance] mentioned along with the fault would be of the worldly [acceptance].

original: nanu ca nimittabhāvāduddiśyamāno 'khaprātagaho na doṣeṇa viśeṣṭuṃ śakyataiti vidhīyamāneṣṭistutimātrapare doṣasaṃkīrttane vaidiko 'pi nimittaṃ bha vet /
analyzed: nanu ca nimitta bhāvāt uddiśyamānaḥ na doṣeṇa viśeṣṭum śakyate eti vidhīyamāna iṣṭi stuti mātra pare doṣa saṃkīrttane nimittam nimittam
translated: But it may be argued that since the acceptance of gifts is mentioned as the cause, it cannot be qualified by the fault. So even if the praise of the sacrifice is the sole purpose of mentioning the fault, the Vedic cause would still be there.

analyzed: uvyate
translated: This is replied to.

analyzed: viśeṣaṇa tayā nā eva doṣaḥ yam kalpyate mayā
translated: I do not imagine this fault as a qualifier at all.

analyzed: doṣa nirghāta sāmarthyāt laukika aṅga tā
translated: The worldly accessory is due to the capacity of the sacrifice to remove the fault.

original: yadi vaidike dāturiṣṭiriti kṛtvā satyapyapratigādyāthājyayājananimitte pratigṛhītṛṇāṃ pāpe doṣarahitanimittamucyate /
analyzed: yadi vaidike dātuḥ iṣṭiḥ iti kṛtvā sati api a pratiga ādya atha ājya yājana nimitte pratigṛhītṛṇām pāpe doṣa rahita nimittam ucyate
translated: If, considering that the sacrifice is for the giver in the Vedic case, even though the acceptance of gifts is the cause of the sin of the recipients due to not giving the sacrificial fee and officiating at the sacrifice, the faultless cause is mentioned.

original: tato laukike 'pi śūdrādibhya upādāne davyatyapi pratigrahītari dātustadvāreṇāduṣṭatvāddoṣarahitameva nimittam /
analyzed: tatas laukike śūdra ādibhyaḥ upādāne davyati api pratigrahītari dātuḥ tad dvāreṇa aduṣṭa tvāt doṣa rahitam eva nimittam
translated: Then, even in the worldly case, when accepting from a Shudra etc., even though the recipient is sinful, the cause is faultless, since the giver is indirectly faultless.

original: atheha pratigṛhauṭavyāpāro nimittaṃ sa ca duṣṭa iti gṛhyate tattulyaṃ vaidike 'pi /
analyzed: atha iha pratigṛhauṭa vyāpāraḥ nimittam sa ca duṣṭaḥ iti gṛhyate tat tulyam vaidike
translated: If the operation of the recipient is considered to be the cause here, and that is sinful, then that is equally so in the Vedic case also.

original: atha vaidike dāturlaukike pratīgṛhīturiṣṭiriti kalpyate tatrāpyupapattiviśeṣo vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha vaidike dātuḥ laukike pratīgṛhītuḥ iṣṭiḥ iti kalpyate tatra api upapatti viśeṣaḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: Or if it is imagined that the sacrifice is for the giver in the Vedic case and for the recipient in the worldly case, then a special reason must be stated there.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

analyzed: yaḥ śva pratigṛhāt eva doṣaḥ saḥ pratīyate
translated: The fault that arises from accepting a horse is understood from the text itself.

analyzed: dāḍha doṣaḥ tu sarvatra viśeṣyate
translated: But the fault of accepting a cow is the same everywhere, and is not distinguished from that of accepting a horse.

original: yadi pratigraho na vidhoyeta kathaṃ tasyetikarttavyatā vidhīyeta /
analyzed: yadi pratigrahaḥ na vidhoyeta katham tasya itikarttavya tā vidhīyeta
translated: If the acceptance were not enjoined, how could its procedure be enjoined?

analyzed: kim iti vā tasmin a kṛte karma vaiguṇyam syāt
translated: Or why would there be a defect in the rite if it were not performed?

analyzed: atra vadāmaḥ
translated: To this we say:

analyzed: ṛtvij gdhaḥ dakṣiṇām dadyāt iti dānam vidhīyate
translated: The priest should give the sacrificial fee - thus the giving is enjoined.

analyzed: lobhāt eva arjjana aṅga tva ātma āptaḥ teṣām pratigrahaḥ
translated: The acceptance by them is implied by the fact that it is a means of acquiring wealth due to greed.

original: karmavidhānavāko yo doṣaḥ śrūyate sa nirdhātyatvenāvadhāryate /
analyzed: karma vidhāna vākaḥ yaḥ doṣaḥ śrūyate sa nirdhātya tvena avadhāryate
translated: The fault that is heard in the text enjoining the rite is ascertained as being stated for the purpose of prohibition.

original: yaścātra doṣa upātto nāsau laukikasya satyapi pratiṣiddhatve kutaścitpramāṇadgamyate jalodaraṃ hyatra varu gagahaṇarūpeṇāpāttam /
analyzed: yaḥ ca atra doṣaḥ upāttaḥ na asau laukikasya sati api pratiṣiddha tve jalodaram hi atra
translated: And the fault that is mentioned here is not known from any source as the basis for the worldly acceptance, even though it is prohibited. For here dropsy is mentioned in the form of a fault.

original: naca kasyāñcidvaidya kasaṃhitāyāṃ laukiko śivapratigraho nidānaṃ śrūyate nāpi pratyakṣānumānādibhigamyate /
analyzed: na ca kasyāñcid vaidya ka saṃhitāyām laukikaḥ śiva pratigrahaḥ nidānam śrūyate na api pratyakṣa anumāna ādibhiḥ gamyate
translated: And the worldly acceptance of a cow is not heard as the basis in any medical treatise, nor is it known by perception, inference, etc.

original: na ca vākye na kesariṇo dadāti nobhayatodataḥ pratigṛhṇatoti śrūyate /
analyzed: na ca vākye na kesariṇaḥ dadāti na ubhaya todataḥ pratigṛhṇataḥ iti śrūyate
translated: And it is not heard in the text that he does not give to one with a mane, nor does he accept from one with teeth on both sides.

original: nāpyetasya vā kyasya tatpratipattau vyāpāro vidyamānānuvādena tatra nirghātārthakarmavidhimālaparatvāt /
analyzed: nā api etasya vā kyasya tad pratipattau vyāpāraḥ vidyamāna anuvādena tatra nirghāta artha karma vidhi māla paratvāt
translated: Nor is there any operation of this injunction in the understanding of that, because it is a mere restatement, and the injunction of the act of striking is for the purpose of destruction.

original: yastu doṣaḥ pratiṣedhavākyānnarakapātātmakaḥ kalpitaḥ sa iha nopātantravārtike /
analyzed: yaḥ tu doṣaḥ pratiṣedha vākyāt naraka pāta ātmakaḥ kalpitaḥ saḥ iha na upātantravārtike
translated: The fault that is imagined to result from the prohibitive sentence in the form of falling into hell is not mentioned here in the Vārtika.

analyzed: varuṇaḥ vai etam gṛhṇāti iti anena abhidhātum aśakya tvāt
translated: Because it is impossible to express it by the sentence Varuṇa seizes him.

original: atha pāpamātraṃ dṛṇotīti varuṇastadgṛhṇātītyevamabhidhīyate tato yā tāvaḍaruṇagṛhītaśabdasya jalodaraviṣayā samudāyaprasiddhiḥ sā parityaktā /
analyzed: atha pāpa mātram dṛṇoti iti varuṇaḥ tat gṛhṇāti iti evam abhidhīyate tatas yā tāvat aruṇa gṛhīta śabdasya jala udara viṣayā samudāya prasiddhiḥ sā parityaktā
translated: If it is said that Varuṇa seizes that because he punishes sin alone, then the well-known meaning of the compound word seized by Varuṇa as referring to dropsy is abandoned.

original: yā tvavayavaprasiḍiḥ sā vaidike'pi tyāge duḥkhadarśanāt /
analyzed: yā tu avayava prasiḍiḥ sā vaidike api tyāge duḥkha darśanāt
translated: But the well-known meaning of the component parts is not abandoned even in the Vedic text, because suffering is seen even when giving up.

original: pratigrahe ca rakṣaṇapoṣaṇādinā kleśātkiṃciharuṇātmakaṃ vidyataityeva saṃbhavatīti na śakyaṃ tadddā reṇeṣṭellaukika viṣayatvamavadhārayitum /
analyzed: pratigrahe ca rakṣaṇa poṣaṇa ādinā kleśāt kiṃcid haruṇa ātmakam vidyate eti eva saṃbhavati iti na śakyam tad ddāreṇa iṣṭet laukika viṣaya tvam avadhārayitum
translated: And because of the trouble of protecting and nourishing etc. in accepting, it is possible that there is some Varuṇa-like nature, so it is not possible to determine that it refers to the worldly object by the word Varuṇa.

analyzed: rakṣaṇa poṣaṇa dinā kleśena iti pratigrahoṭa vyāpārasya nimitta tvena a nivārita tvāt evam bravīti
translated: He says this because the operation of accepting is not prevented as the cause of the trouble of protecting and nourishing etc.

original: atha vā dāturapi prāk parakhatvāpādanādeṣa kleśo 'stīti gamayitavyam /
analyzed: atha vā dātuḥ api prāk para kha tva āpādanāt eṣa kleśaḥ sti iti gamayitavyam
translated: Or, it should be understood that this difficulty exists even for the giver, before the other's ownership is established.

analyzed: dharmaḥ upi ca śṛṇoti eva naram saṃsāra varttinam
translated: And Dharma indeed hears the man who is engaged in worldly existence.

analyzed: na hi kevala pāpena dehena ācchādyate naraḥ
translated: For a man is not covered by a body that is only sinful.

original: yatra vidhyuddeśaḥ saṃdigdhaḥ tatra vākyaśeṣānnirṇayo na virudhyate /
analyzed: yatra vidhi uddeśaḥ saṃdigdhaḥ tatra vākyaśeṣāt nirṇayaḥ na virudhyate
translated: Where the injunction is doubtful, there is no contradiction in determining it from the supplementary passages.

analyzed: sva saṃdigdhaḥ tava śeṣa bādhena eva bhavitavyam
translated: Where it is doubtful for oneself, there it must be by the contradiction of the supplementary passage, due to the absence of the object.

original: ata iha yadyapi prajāpatirvaruṇāyāśvamanayaditi prajāpatirdātā saṃkorttito varuṇaḥ pratigrahautā punaśca samvāṃ devatāmiti prajāpatireva sa mānavibhaktyantaḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyenopāttaḥ khā ca tasya devatā varuṇaḥ pūrvaṃ saṃpradānatvenopāttatvāt /🔽nātmā katṛtvasaṃ pradānatvayorvirodhinorekava kalpane 'nyatarasya gauṇatvāpatteḥ /
analyzed: atas iha yadi api prajāpatiḥ varuṇāya aśvam anayat iti prajāpatiḥ dātā saṃkorttitaḥ varuṇaḥ pratigrahautā punar ca samvām devatām iti prajāpatiḥ eva sa māna vibhakti antaḥ sāmānādhikaraṇyena upāttaḥ khā ca tasya devatā varuṇaḥ pūrvam saṃpradāna tvena upātta tvāt  na ātmā katṛ tva sam pradāna tvayoḥ virodhinoḥ eka vai kalpane nyatarasya gauṇa tva āpatteḥ
translated: Therefore, here although Prajapati is restricted as the giver in Prajapati gave a horse to Varuna, and Varuna is the recipient in Again, the deity is Samva, Prajapati is mentioned by the same case ending in apposition as that of his deity is Varuna, because he was previously mentioned as the dative.🔽The self cannot be both the agent and the dative, as these are contradictory, and if one is imagined, the other must be secondary.

analyzed: nā api prajāpateḥ varuṇaḥ dātā vibhakti vyatyaya prasaṅgāt
translated: Nor can Varuna be the giver of Prajapati, as that would lead to the reversal of case endings.

original: tena prajāpatirapūvaṃ datvā varuṇaṃ prāpta i ca iti ka pu pā / tantravārtike /
analyzed: tena prajāpatiḥ apūvam da tvā varuṇam prāptaḥ ca iti ka pu pā
translated: Therefore, Prajapati, having given a horse, obtained Varuṇa. Thus says the Kṛṣṇa Yajurveda.

analyzed: ti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: sa tathābhūtaḥ paridaurṇa udaramasya śvayathanā vi dogām /
analyzed: sa tathābhūtaḥ paridaurṇaḥ udaram asya śvayathanā vi dogām
translated: He, being such, caused his belly to swell with dropsy.

original: saetaṃ vāruṇaṃ catuṣkapālamapaśyatta niravapadipti prajāpatereva tacchabdena parāmarśāt /
analyzed: sa etam vāruṇam catuṣkapālam apaśyatta niravapat ipti prajāpateḥ eva tat śabdena parāmarśāt
translated: He saw this Varuṇa offering on four potsherds. He offered it. This is inferred from the reference to Prajapati by the word his.

original: tannirabapaditi ca kartatva nirdeśa tasyaivābakalpate na varuṇasya saṃpradānatvena sthitatvāt /
analyzed: tat nirabapat iti ca karta tva nirdeśa na varuṇasya saṃpradāna tvena sthita tvāt
translated: And the statement he offered it can be understood only of him, not of Varuṇa, because he is already established as the recipient.

analyzed: na varuṇasya ātma uddaśena yāgaḥ saṃbhavati
translated: The sacrifice cannot be for Varuṇa's own sake.

analyzed: na hi ātmane saṃkalpyamānam tyaktam syāt
translated: For what is intended for one's own self would not be given up.

original: tena prajāpatinā 'śvaṃ datvā varuṇāya varuṇagṛhautena vārugaṇa dyā tadunmocanamātmanaḥ kṛtam /
analyzed: tena prajāpatinā śvam da tvā varuṇāya varuṇa gṛhautena tat unmocanam ātmanaḥ kṛtam
translated: Therefore, by Prajapati, having given a horse to Varuṇa, by that which was dedicated to Varuṇa, that release from his own bondage was accomplished.

analyzed: atonyaḥ api da tvā evam kuryāt iti dātuḥ iti vijñāyate
translated: Therefore, it is understood that another person also, having given in the same way, should do so.

analyzed: kiṃca  yajña aṅga tvāt ca tad śeṣā pradhānena eka karṭa kāḥ
translated: Moreover,🔽and because it is a part of the sacrifice, it is a subsidiary of that, and has the same performer as the primary.

original: pradhānasya ca yaḥ karttā svāmī dātā sa vājinām
analyzed: pradhānasya ca yaḥ karttā svāmī dātā sa vājinām
translated: And the owner, the giver, of the horse is the performer of the primary.

analyzed: pūrva adhikaragonā eva etat pratipādita prāyam yat uta dātuḥ iṣṭiḥ iti
translated: This has been almost settled by the previous section, namely, that the sacrifice belongs to the giver.

original: yadā hyaśvapratigrahavataḥ karmaṇo'ṅagamevetyavadhāritaṃ tadā pradhānānāme ka deśakāla kartṛkanyāyādya eva kratoḥ karttā tenaiveyamapi karttavyā yaśca kratoḥ karttā sa khāmikarmaparikraye ityevamaśvasya dātā tasmādasaṃdigdhameva dāturiṭyā bhavitavyam /
analyzed: yadā hi aśva pratigrahavataḥ karmaṇā uṅagam eva iti avadhāritam tadā pradhānānām yaḥ eva kratoḥ karttā tena eva iyam api karttavyā yaḥ ca kratoḥ karttā sa khāmi karma parikraye iti evam aśvasya dātā tasmāt asaṃdigdham eva dātuḥ iṭyā bhavitavyam
translated: For when it has been determined that the horse is merely an accessory of the rite, then it must be performed by the same person who is the performer of the main rite, by the rule that what is subsidiary to a rite is to be done by the same person who performs the main rite, and that the giver of the horse is the performer of the rite. Therefore, it is undoubtedly to be performed by the giver.

analyzed: sā tat na vārtike
translated: This is the meaning of the aphorism.

original: marthyaṃ yatpradhānenaikakartṛkaṃ sadupakāraṃ śaknoti karttu na bhinnakartṛkam /
analyzed: marthyam yat pradhānena eka kartṛkam sat upakāram śaknoti karttu na bhinna kartṛkam
translated: That which is able to benefit when it has the same performer as the main rite, not when it has a different performer.

original: tena pradhānavadeveta raistasyā madhyātvijaṃ katavyama na yājamānamiti /
analyzed: tena pradhāna vat eva ita raiḥ tasyāḥ madhyātvijam katavyam na yājamānam iti
translated: Therefore, like the main rite, this should be performed by the priests, not by the sacrificer.

analyzed: evam siddhe vākya upakrama upasaṃhāra virodha kṛta bhrānti saṃśaya vyadāsa māva artham uttaram adhikaragām ārabdhavyam
translated: Even though this is established, the next section should be begun to remove the doubt created by the contradiction of the beginning and end of the sentence.

original: tasyāpi ca vākyasaṃbandhopakramopasaṃhārasyedvaśameva sāmarthya yahāturvidhatte na hotāvadeva vākyaṃ yāvato 'śvān pratigṛhṇīyāttāvataścatuṣkapālānvāruṇānnirvapediti /
analyzed: tasya api ca vākya saṃbandha upakrama upasaṃhārasya id vaśam eva sāmarthya ya hātuḥ vidhatte na hotā avat eva vākyam yāvataḥ śvān pratigṛhṇīyāt tāvataḥ catuṣkapālān vāruṇān nirvapet iti
translated: And the power of this also, which begins and ends with the connection of the sentence, is determined by the meaning itself, not just the sentence up to the point where he would accept so many horses, he should offer so many cakes on four pans to Varuna.

analyzed: kim prajāpatiḥ varuṇāya aśvam anaya hiti ādiḥ asya vidyate
