translated: What then? There is another beginning also, such as Prajapati led the horse to Varuna.

analyzed: sa ca dātuḥ iṣṭim pratipādayatā iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that that indicates the sacrifice of the giver who is offering.

analyzed: nanu etat api uktam vidhu pradeśa balauyaḥ tvāt ābādhyate sau iti
translated: But this has also been said: the part of the injunction is overridden by the stronger part.

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: stati labdha ātmaka tvena vidhā ha īśena bādhyate
translated: It is overridden by the injunction, which has obtained its nature.

analyzed: pratigrahītari tu ava vidhu pradeśaḥ na kalpitaḥ
translated: But the part of the injunction is not imagined in the recipient.

original: satyapi pradhānaguṇabhāve vidhārthavādānāṃ pūrvāparoccāraṇakṛto 'nyo viśeṣo bhavati /
analyzed: sati api pradhāna guṇa bhāve vidhā artha vādānām pūrva apara uccāraṇa kṛtaḥ nyaḥ viśeṣaḥ bhavati
translated: Even with the relation of primary and secondary between injunctions and explanatory passages, there is another difference made by the utterance of the former and the latter.

original: sarvacaiva tāvanmukhyaṃ vā 'pūrvacodanāllokavaditi ca śrutiliṅaṅgādhikaraṇanyāyena ca pūrvaṃ vijñānamanupajātapratiindri dvitīyavijñānāntarānutpattyavasthatvādāñjasyenātmānaṃ labhate paścāttanaṃ tu pūrvavijñānāvaruddhajñāna viṣayaupajāyamānaṃ satyāṃ virodhāvasthāyāṃ tadānuguṇyātiriktena rūpeṇotpattumeva na śaknotīti anyathātvamapi pratipadyate /
analyzed: tāvat mukhyam vā pūrva codanāt loka vat iti ca śruti liṅ aṅga adhikaraṇa nyāyena ca pūrvam vijñānam anupajāta pratiindri dvitīya vijñāna antara anutpatti avastha tvāt āñjasyena ātmānam labhate paścāttanam tu pūrva vijñāna avaruddha jñāna viṣaya aupajāyamānam satyām virodha avasthāyām tad ānuguṇya atiriktena rūpeṇa utpattum eva na śaknoti iti anyathātvam api pratipadyate
translated: And all this is primary, because of the injunction of the new, like in the world, and by the reasoning of the section on Śruti and Lin, the prior cognition obtains itself easily, being in a state where the second cognition arising from the sense organ has not yet arisen. But the subsequent one, arising with the object of knowledge obstructed by the prior cognition, is not able to arise with a form additional to that which is conducive to it, in a state of contradiction, so it also assumes a different form.

original: tadiha vidhārthavādatvakṛtaṃ viśeṣaṃ pūrvapaścādbhāvitayā 'nāśrityopakramopasaṃhārayotipratigrahītaviṣayatvena vipratipadyamānārthatvāttathā sati caikavākyatvāsambhavāt /
analyzed: tat iha vidhā artha vāda tva kṛtam viśeṣam pūrva paścāt bhāvitayā na āśritya upakrama upasaṃhārayā ūti pratigrahīta viṣaya tvena vipratipadyamāna artha tvāt tathā sati ca eka vākya tva asambhavāt
translated: Here, not relying on the difference created by being the meaning of an injunction or a praise, due to being prior or subsequent, because of having a contradictory meaning by having a subject matter different from the beginning and end, and in that case, because of the impossibility of being one sentence,

original: pṛthatke cobhayorapi parasparasaṃnidhivaśenā kalpitavidhyantara prarocanāntaraśaktyoḥ sākāṅgatvenā paripūrṇārthayorānarthakyaprasaṅgādavaśyaṃbhāvyekavākyatvavaśena samānaviṣayatve kalpyamāne'nupajātavirodhāvasthapūrvāvadhāritadātṛgāmitvaparityāgāsaṃbhavāduttara malabdhāvasthameva pratigṛhītajñānaṃ gauṇagṛhātikalpanayā dātṛviṣayatvenādhyavasauyate /
analyzed: ca ubhayoḥ api paraspara saṃnidhi vaśena ā kalpita vidhi antara prarocana antara śaktyoḥ sākāṅga tvena ā paripūrṇa arthayoḥ ānarthakya prasaṅgāt avaśyaṃbhāvi ekavākyatva vaśena samāna viṣaya tve kalpyamāna in upajāta virodha avastha pūrva avadhārita dātṛ gāmi tva parityāga asaṃbhavāt uttaram alabdha avastham eva pratigṛhīta jñānam gauṇa gṛha ati kalpanayā dātṛ viṣaya tvena adhyavasauyate
translated: And in both cases, due to the proximity of each other, the two incomplete sentences, which are complete in meaning, would be meaningless if they were to be construed as having a mutual expectancy, so they must necessarily be construed as one sentence. When this is done, and they are taken as having the same content, it is not possible to abandon the previously ascertained giver-oriented nature of the knowledge that has not yet given rise to contradiction, so the subsequent knowledge that has not yet been obtained is determined to have the giver as its object through the figurative identification of the giver with the house.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: Moreover,

analyzed: bhūyasām ca sadharma tvam asmin pace bhaviṣyati
translated: there will be many common properties in this case.

analyzed: anyathā hi bhavet pūrvam sarvam evā asamañjasam
translated: Otherwise, everything would have been incoherent before.

original: yathodāhṛtena tāttaittirīyaśākhāvākyena dāturiṣṭiḥ siḍā sā na nyāyāntareṇāpanauyate na vacanāntaregā /
analyzed: yathā udāhṛtena tāt taittirīya śākhā vākyena dātuḥ iṣṭiḥ siḍā sā na nyāya antareṇa apanauyate na vacana antaregā
translated: As stated in the Taittiriya branch text, the sacrifice for the giver is established. It is not removed by another reasoning or by another statement.

original: yadyapi pratiṣedhavacanaṃ syāt tathāpi vihitapratiṣiḍavāhikalpī bhavenna khokatanyāyavyudāsaḥ /
analyzed: yadi api pratiṣedha vacanam syāt tathā api bhavet na khokata nyāya vyudāsaḥ
translated: Even if there were a prohibitive statement, it would be a hypothetical case of prohibiting what has been enjoined, not a rejection of the present reasoning.

original: yatta pratigrahoturvidhāyakaṃ tadyadi tāvatkarmāṅgavaśena vināyupakramaviśeṣātpūrvavākyārthānusāryeva bhavati tatastenāpi dātudeva /
analyzed: pratigraha ūtuḥ vidhāyakam tat yadi tāvat karma aṅga vaśena pūrva vākya artha anusārī eva bhavati tatas tena api
translated: If the injunction of the recipient is such that it is dependent on the subsidiary of the ritual, and does not have a separate beginning, and is only in accordance with the meaning of the preceding sentence, then it is by that also.

original: atha tu svātalyāt pratigṛhṇātivaśāt pratigrahītumtataḥ pūrvavākyācca dāturityubhau kariṣyatastatpratiguhoṭagatā ca karmāṅgatvābhāvātpuruṣārthā sato laukikepi syāt /
analyzed: atha tu svātalyāt pratigṛhṇāti vaśāt pratigrahītum tatas pūrva vākyāt ca dātuḥ iti ubhau kariṣyataḥ tad pratiguhoṭa gatā ca karma aṅga tva abhāvāt puruṣa arthā sataḥ laukikā api syāt
translated: If, however, it is independent, and by the force of the verb 'pratigṛhṇāti' ('receives'), it is for the recipient, then both will be done by that and the preceding sentence. But that being a subsidiary of the ritual belonging to the recipient, being for the human purpose, would be even in the worldly (ritual).

original: yastvāvije syādityetatsūtraparaḥ san pūrva vākye nāpi pratigrahautureva vadati tena tatkartṛkāyā karmāṅgatva /
analyzed: yaḥ tu āvije syāt iti etad sūtra paraḥ san pūrva vākye na api pratigrahautuḥ eva vadati tena tad kartṛkāyāḥ karma aṅga tva
translated: But one who, following the sūtra 'yas tv avije syāt', says even in the preceding sentence only for the recipient of the gift, by that it is a subsidiary of the ritual performed by him.

original: bhāvātvijāmitareṣāṃ ca puruṣārthaphalakalpanātulyatvena lokikepi prāptau satyāṃ kena pramāṇena tasmādyajñe pratoyetetyetadabhidhīyataiti vaktavyam /
analyzed: bhāva atvijām itareṣām ca puruṣa artha phala kalpanā tulya tvena lokike api prāptau satyām kena pramāṇena tasmāt yajñe pratoyeta iti etat abhidhīyate eti vaktavyam
translated: Since the worldly (ritual) is equally obtained for the priests and others, by what evidence is it said that they are employed in the sacrifice?

analyzed: tasmāt anena tāvahātuḥ iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that it is for the recipient in that (sacrifice).

analyzed: pāna vyāpad ca tait
translated: The application of drinking is also like that.

analyzed: ayam api anāramyavādaḥ eva
translated: This is also a statement without reference to anything else.

analyzed: saumendram caru nirvapet yaḥ somam vamati iti
translated: One should offer the Sāmnāyana rice if one vomits Soma.

analyzed: tatra api pūrvavat eva adhikaraṇa hayam api vi cāryate
translated: Even there, as before, the topic is discussed.

original: laukikasomapāne rasāyanādyarthaṃ kṛte vamanena vyāpanne somendrayāgaḥ uta vaidike utobhayatrāpi /
analyzed: laukika soma pāne rasāyana ādi artham kṛte vamanena vyāpanne somendra yāgaḥ uta vaidike uta ubhayatra api
translated: When Soma is drunk for worldly purposes, such as for emetics, and is spoiled by vomiting, is the Soma-Indra sacrifice to be performed when it is for worldly purposes, or for Vedic purposes, or in both cases?

original: tava tahadityanena sāmānyapakṣo doṣāttviṣṭirlokike syādityayaṃ cātidiśyate /🔽atha vādhikaraṇaiyamapi siddhāntarūpeṇādhikaragāiye 'pyatidiśyate kena cihiśeṣeṇa pūrvapacaracanā /
analyzed: tava tahat iti anena sāmānya pakṣaḥ doṣāt tu iṣṭiḥ lokike syāt iti ayam ca atidiśyate  atha vā adhikaraṇaiyam api siddhānta rūpeṇa adhikaragāiye pi atidiśyate kena cit hi śeṣeṇa pūrvapaca racanā
translated: By saying just so, the general view is indicated, and this is also extended: The expiation should be for worldly purposes due to the fault.🔽Or this topic is also extended as the conclusion to the previous topic, with some difference.

original: tatreha tāvavairikena pānena dravyapratipādanasya kṛtatvānna kadā cid bheṣe punaḥ pratisamādhānāpekṣā 'stotyanartha kamiṣṭividhānam /
analyzed: tatra iha tau avairikena pānena dravya pratipādanasya kṛta tvāt na kadā cid bheṣe punar pratisamādhāna apekṣā staḥ iti anartha kam iṣṭi vidhānam
translated: There, first, since the substance has been presented by the worldly drinking, there is never a need to re-establish it, so prescribing an expiation is useless.

original: laukike tu vamanena vyāpanne rasāyanaguṇābhāvādindriyeṇa vīryeṇa ca vyaddhiḥ saṃbhāvyate /
analyzed: laukike tu vamanena vyāpanne rasāyana guṇa abhāvāt indriyeṇa vīryeṇa ca vyaddhiḥ saṃbhāvyate
translated: But when it is spoiled by worldly vomiting, the deficiency in the Soma-Indra sacrifice is possible due to the absence of the qualities of an elixir and the potency.

analyzed: na jalodara vat atyanta asaṃbhāvanā
translated: It is not completely impossible, like abdominal dropsy.

analyzed: tad saṃyoge ca śrūyamāṇā iṣṭiḥ tad samādhi arthā eva vijñāyate
translated: And when the expiation mentioned in connection with that is heard, it is understood to be for the purpose of rectifying that.

analyzed: tasmāt tatra syāt iti
translated: Therefore, it should be there.

original: dopāttu vaidike syādarthāhi laukike na doṣaḥ syāt
analyzed: dopāt tu vaidike syāt arthā hi laukike na doṣaḥ syāt
translated: But in the Vedic, it would be due to the connection, and in the secular, there would be no fault.

analyzed: taiḥ eva vaidika tva sāmānya ādibhiḥ vedike bhavati iti ka smāt na ucyate
translated: Why is it not said that it occurs in the Vedic due to those very commonalities of being Vedic?

original: na hi vamane vaidikatvaṃ saṃbhavati acoditatvāt ato ya eva doṣo laukikagāmitve hetuḥ sa eveha vaidika viṣayatve syāt /
analyzed: na hi vamane vaidika tvam saṃbhavati acodita tvāt atas yaḥ eva doṣaḥ laukika gāmi tve hetuḥ saḥ eva iha vaidika viṣaya tve syāt
translated: For in vomiting, being Vedic is not possible, because it is not enjoined. Therefore, the very fault that is the reason for going to the secular would be here in the case of the Vedic.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Thus it is.

original: samyak jaraṇarūpāntā pratipattirvidhīyate sadyāpadi pradhānasya na bhavetpūrvavatphalam
analyzed: samyak jaraṇa rūpa antā pratipattiḥ vidhīyate sadya āpadi pradhānasya na bhavet pūrvavat phalam
translated: The attainment ending with the form of proper digestion is enjoined. In an immediate emergency, the principal would not have the same result as before.

original: ' yaḥ somaṃ vamati sa nirvapediti yacchandata cchabdayogādyāgavamanayorekaḥ karttā gamyate /
analyzed: yaḥ somam vamati sa nirvapet iti yat chandataḥ śabda yogāt yāga vamanayoḥ ekaḥ karttā gamyate
translated: One who vomits Soma should offer it. From the connection with the word yaḥ (he who), it is understood that the same person is the performer of both the sacrifice and the vomiting.

original: tatra naimittikaṃ tāvalyāmikaḷkatvenāsaṃdigdhaṃ tenāsaṃdigdhena saṃdigdhaṃ vamanaṃ nirgīyate /
analyzed: tatra naimittikam tāvalyāmikaḷka tvena asaṃdigdham tena asaṃdigdhena saṃdigdham vamanam nirgīyate
translated: There, the occasional is undoubted due to the connection with the principal. By that undoubted, the doubtful vomiting is declared.

analyzed: tat api khāmikarṭa kam eva sat nimittam iti
translated: That also, being a mere cause, is the same as the principal.

original: na ca svatantrameva nimittaṃ śuddhenākhyātena nimittapratyayānutpādāt /
analyzed: na ca svatantram eva nimittam śuddhena ākhyātena nimitta pratyaya anutpādāt
translated: And the cause is not independent, because the pure verb does not produce the sense of cause.

analyzed: yat śabda upabaddham tad nimittam pratipādayati
translated: That which is connected with the word yaḥ (he who) conveys the cause.

original: tena cetsaṃbaddhaṃ pūrvataraṃ samānaka katvaṃ pa śvānnimittatvapratītiḥ /
analyzed: tena ced saṃbaddham pūrvataram
translated: If it is connected with that, then the cognition of the cause occurring later is due to the similarity of the previous and subsequent.

original: atharirvajo devatārtha mṛtvikaparikrayārthaṃ ca dravyaṃ tyajanti tatasteṣāṃ svātmani parikrayavirodhādavaśyaṃ tairapyanye 'dhvavadayo varītavyāḥ /
analyzed: athariḥ vajaḥ devatā artha m ṛtvika parikraya artham ca dravyam tyajanti tatas teṣām sva ātmani parikraya virodhāt avaśyam taiḥ api anye dhvavadayaḥ varītavyāḥ
translated: If they give the substance for the sake of the deity and for the purchase of the priest, then for them, due to the contradiction of purchase in their own self, others like the Adhvaryu must also be chosen.

analyzed: ādhāna gatena tu ātmanepadena agnīn āmā ghātṛ vyatirikta puruṣa saṃbandha abhāvāt vā ātma artheṣu agniṣu yaṣṭavyam
translated: But by the reflexive pronoun in the Aghāra passage, due to the absence of the connection of the fires with a person other than the Āghātr, one should perform the sacrifice in the fires for one's own sake.

original: tataśca yadi tābahāntasomakarmopakārabuḍyā kurvanti tato deśakālakabhedādviguṇaṃ na tena pradhānena gṛhyate /
analyzed: tatas ca yadi kurvanti tatas deśa kālaka bhedāt viguṇam na tena pradhānena gṛhyate
translated: And then, if they do it with the intention of helping the final Soma rite, then due to the difference in place and time, it is doubled, and is not taken by that principal rite.

original: na cāhatya deśādibheda āmnāyate yena tatsadbhāve 'pya vaiguṇyamāśraye ta /
analyzed: na ca āhatya deśa ādi bhedaḥ āmnāyate yena tad sadbhāve vaiguṇyam āśraye
translated: And the difference in place etc. is not mentioned, by which, even in the case of its existence, we would assume the defect.

analyzed: sva abhivamanena ca kṛtārtha tvāt na anena eva śākhāḥ deśa antara ādīnām anujñānam
translated: And due to having fulfilled its purpose by its own utterance, this does not allow the other branches like different places etc.

original: kathaṃ vaikameva śāstraṃ khāmiyamanapakṣe samānadeśāditvamāśrayehatvigvamane ca tadbhedam atha vātmārthabudhava te prayuktoran /
analyzed: katham vā ekam eva śāstram khāmi yamana pakṣe samāna deśa ādi tvam āśraya iha tvij vamane ca tad bhedam atha vā ātma artha budhava te
translated: How can the same scripture, in the case of the Khādira post, adopt the view of the same place, etc., and in the case of the Vāmadevya, abandon it and distinguish it? Or, if the learned ones employ it for the sake of the self,

original: evamapi kratvarthenāvadhāritamya punaḥ puruṣārthatvābhāvāttādarthena kriyamāṇasya ānardhakyameva syāt /
analyzed: evam api punar puruṣa artha tva abhāvāt tādarthena kriyamāṇasya ānardhakyam eva syāt
translated: even so, after being ascertained as for the sacrifice, the performance for that purpose would be purposeless, due to the absence of being for the sake of the person again.

original: atha tu etatsiyarthaṃ puruṣārtha taiva śāstreṇāśroyate tathā sati upasthitakratutyāgāisantrihitasvargādikalpanāñca viprakarṣaḥ /
analyzed: atha tu etad siyartham puruṣa artha tā eva śāstreṇa āśroyate tathā sati viprakarṣaḥ
translated: But if it is heard in the scripture that this is for the sake of the person, then there would be the fault of abandoning the present sacrifice and imagining a distant heaven, etc.

original: sadṛśaṃ laukikavamane 'pyetaditi na yājñe syāt tacca pūrvameva nirākṛtam /
analyzed: sadṛśam laukika vamane pi etat iti na yājñe syāt tat ca pūrvam eva nirākṛtam
translated: And this would be similar in the case of the worldly Vāmadevya also, so it would not be in the sacrifice. And that has been refuted earlier.

analyzed: tasmāt ati āmi vamane syāt
translated: Therefore, it would be in the case of the Ājya Vāmadevya.

original: atha tvadhvarkhādivamane pi khāmyeva dravyaṃ tyajet tathā sati tadeva bhinnakaṭa katvamāpadyate /
analyzed: atha tu adhva ṛkha ādi vamane dravyam tyajet tathā sati tat eva bhinna kaṭa ka tvam āpadyate
translated: But if it abandons the Khādira post even in the case of the Adhvaryu's Vāmadevya, then it would fall into the same split-cooking.

original: tatsamarthane vā 'śrutaṣaṣṭyartha kalpanā sāmānādhikaraṇyabādhaśca tathā kalpanāyāṃ ca svāmivamanasyānimittatvaprasaṅkaḥ /
analyzed: tad samarthane vā kalpanā sāmānādhikaraṇya bādhaḥ ca tathā kalpanāyām ca svāmi vamanasya animitta tva prasaṅkaḥ
translated: Or in supporting that, there would be the assumption of the meaning of the unmentioned ṣaṣṭhī case, and the violation of the co-reference. And in assuming thus, there would be the undesirable consequence of the Vāmadevya of the master being without a cause.

original: ubhayāśrayo vā vairupyanimitto vā ṛyabhedaḥ syāt /
analyzed: ubhaya āśrayaḥ vā vairupya nimittaḥ vā ṛyabhedaḥ syāt
translated: Or the difference in the sacrifice may be due to the difference in the basis, or to the difference in the cause.

original: yaḥ somaṃ vamati yasya somamṛtvigvamatoti cāśrayaṇānyataraparigrahe tu svāmivamanagrahaṇaṃ yuktam śabdasāmañjasyāt /
analyzed: yaḥ somam vamati yasya somam ṛtvij vamati iti ca āśrayaṇa anyatara parigrahe tu svāmi vamana grahaṇam yuktam śabda sāmañjasyāt
translated: If one vomits Soma, or if the priest officiating at the Soma sacrifice vomits, then in the case of the basis, it is proper to take the vomiting of the master, because of the similarity of the word.

original: evaṃ tāvadārādupakārakatve /🔽yadā tu vākya śeṣopanautayāgaśeṣadravyapratipattiniyamabhreṣopajanitaṃ phalalābhāyogyatvamato na pratisamādhīyate iti kalpyate tadā yajamānaphalotpatteratyantāhaṣṭatvāttadāśaṅkati tenaiva pratisamādhāneṣṭiḥ karttavyetyasaṃdigdham /
analyzed: evam tāvat ārāt upakāraka tve  yadā tu phala lābha ayogya tvam atas na pratisamādhīyate iti kalpyate tadā yajamāna phala utpatteḥ atyanta ahaṣṭa tvāt tat āśaṅkati tena eva pratisamādhāna iṣṭiḥ karttavyā iti asaṃdigdham
translated: Thus far, in the case of indirect help.🔽But when it is assumed that the inability to obtain the result is produced by the violation of the rule of obtaining the remaining substance of the sacrifice by the completion of the sentence, and it is not remedied, then, because the production of the result for the sacrificer is completely lost, there is no doubt that the expiation should be performed by him alone when it is remedied.

original: yattu dakṣiṇālābhātmaka mṛtvijāṃ phalaṃ tatsati cāsati vamane lakṣyamānaṃ dṛśyataiti nirāśaṅkatvādanapekṣitapratisamādhānaṃ neṣṭiṃ gṛhṇāti /
analyzed: yat tu dakṣiṇā lābha ātmakam ṛtvijām phalam tat sati ca asati vamane lakṣyamānam dṛśyate eti nirāśaṅka tvāt anapekṣita pratisamādhānam na iṣṭim gṛhṇāti
translated: But the result for the priests, which consists in receiving the sacrificial fee, is seen to be indicated whether there is vomiting or not, and therefore, being free from doubt, it does not accept the expiation, which does not require to be remedied.

original: yadā 'pi prakṛ takarmakartṛ niyamāṃśena bhakṣayitṛsaṃskārārthaṃ bhakṣaṇamataśca badveṣe karttavaiguṇyamupajātaṃ dravyasaṃskārasya tadupayogātmakasya nivṛttatvāditi kalpyate tadā'pi taddveṣakṛtathājamānaphalavighnaprasaṅgāt tannivṛttyarthatvāṭyattaccha vdanirdeśācayajamānavamanaeva bhavitavyam /
analyzed: yadā pi bhavitavyam
translated: Even when it is supposed that the eating is for the purpose of purifying the eater, by the rule that the action is to be done by the agent, and so the defect in the sacrificer has arisen, because the purification of the substance, which consists in its being used, has ceased, even then, because of the undesirable contingency of obstructing the fruit of the sacrificer caused by that defect, and because of the injunction of that eating by the word 'yat', it must be the sacrificer's vomiting.

analyzed: etena apūrva saṃskāra artha tvam api vyākhyātam
translated: By this, the meaning that it is for the purification of the unseen potency is also explained.

original: yadā 'pi hi somavamanānna vihitākaraṇaṃ nāpi pratiṣiḍasevanamāpadyataiti kṛtvā doṣanighatārthatvamiṣṭeranāśritya nimittaṃ karmāṅgaṃ tadāpi ca yacchabdena puruṣasyopāttatvājjammānanyāyena prakaraṇāgatapuruṣasaṃskāratā 'dhyavasīyate tadāpi yājamānāstvityanenaiva tatkarṭa katā /
analyzed: yadā pi hi soma vamanāt na vihita akaraṇam na api pratiṣiḍa sevanam āpadyate eti kṛtvā doṣa nighata artha tvam iṣṭeḥ an āśritya nimittam karma aṅgam tadā api ca yad śabdena puruṣasya upātta tvāt jammāna nyāyena prakaraṇa āgata puruṣa saṃskāra tā dhī avasīyate tadā api yājamānāḥ tu iti anena eva tad karṭa ka tā
translated: Even when it is supposed that the purpose of the sacrifice is the removal of the defect, not taking recourse to the injunction that what is not enjoined is not to be done, nor the prohibition that what is prohibited is not to be used, even then, because the person is referred to by the word 'yat', it is concluded that it is for the purification of the person referred to in the context, by the principle of the 'born one', even then, by the very same (word) 'of the sacrificer', it is said to be done by the sacrificer.

analyzed: vamava samāna viṣaya tvāt ca yajamāna vamanam eva nimittam
translated: And because the object is the vomiting, the occasion is the sacrificer's vomiting alone.

original: yattvadhvaryyādivamanepi dravyapratipatibhreṣaḥ kartṛ saṃskārāt vināśo vā samādhimapekṣataiti /
analyzed: yat tu adhvaryya ādi vamane pi dravya pratipati bhreṣaḥ kartṛ saṃskārāt vināśaḥ vā samādhim apekṣata eti
translated: As for the loss of the substance even in the case of the Adhvaryu's omission, or the destruction of the sanctification of the performer, they require a remedy.

analyzed: yadi api apekṣate tathā api avidhānāt na grahīṣyate
translated: Even if they require it, they will not be taken up because they are not enjoined.

analyzed: ca kutvartha puruṣa artha pakṣeṣu ca ṛtvij vamane vidhānam iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that in all cases, whether it is for the purpose of the ritual or for the purpose of the person, the injunction is in the case of the omission of the priest.

analyzed: atas ca yadi tad hamanam aduṣṭam eva tatas tūṣṇīm eva āsitavyam
translated: And therefore, if the omission is not defective, then one should remain silent.

analyzed: atha duṣṭam mānya vihitam kiṃcid karttavyam
translated: If it is defective, then something enjoined elsewhere should be done.

analyzed: na ca atra kutu artha ādi anyatama pakṣa atra dhāraṇa prayojanam asti iti na atauva avadhāraḥ yatitavyam
translated: And there is no purpose in holding to any of the alternatives such as for the sake of the ritual, etc., so one should not strive for a determination.

original: athāpi tattvajñānaṃ prayojanaṃ tato jañjabhyamānapakṣa parigrahautavyaḥ /
analyzed: atha api tattva jñānam prayojanam tatas jañjabhyamāna pakṣa
translated: If, however, the knowledge of reality is the purpose, then the alternative that is trembling should be accepted.

analyzed: tathā ca sūtrakāra tad artha tvāt iti āha
translated: And thus the author of the aphorisms says, Of the master, because it is not for that purpose.

analyzed: liṅga darśanāt ca
translated: And because of the indication of a sign.

original: vyudhyataiti sa vaktavyo yasya somapānāvṛddhiḥ prārthyate /
analyzed: vyudhyata eti sa vaktavyaḥ yasya soma pānā vṛddhiḥ prārthyate
translated: It should be said that he who desires the increase of drinking Soma is defeated.

analyzed: tad vaiguṇyāt ca vyṛddhiḥ āśayate svāminaḥ ca tat ubhayam apauti tasya eva iṣṭiḥ
translated: And because of the deficiency of that, defeat is indicated, and both of those belong to the master, and his sacrifice is spoiled.

original: sarvapradānaṃ haviṣastadarthatvāt🔽aṣṭākapālādiśabdaiḥ samastaṃ dravyaṃ devatārthamavagamitamāhanīya prakṣepegā ca haviṣo devatārthatā bhavati /
analyzed: sarva pradānam haviṣaḥ tad artha tvāt  aṣṭākapāla ādi śabdaiḥ samastam dravyam devatā artham avagamitam āhanīya prakṣepegā ca haviṣaḥ devatā artha tā bhavati
translated: The offering of all the substances is for the sake of the oblation.🔽By the words eight-piece cake etc., the entire substance is understood to be for the deity, and the oblation becomes for the deity in the pouring into the Ahavaniya.

original: yadāhavanīye juhvatīti vidheragnimukhā vai devā iti cārthavādāt /
analyzed: yat āhavanīye juhvati iti vidheḥ agni mukhāḥ vai devāḥ iti ca arthavādāt
translated: As it is said, When one offers in the Ahavaniya by the injunction, and the gods have Agni as their mouth by the explanatory passage.

original: evaṃ ca sati tataścet kiṃ cidapyapanauyeta tadā 'nyat śrutamanyatkriyeta tasmātsarvabhakṣepaḥ /
analyzed: evam ca sati tatas ced kim cit api apanauyeta tadā nyat śrutam anyat kriyeta tasmāt sarva bhakṣepaḥ
translated: And in that case, if anything were to be removed from that, then something heard would be done differently. Therefore, all is to be offered.

original: kiṃ punarayaṃ pūrvapakṣavādī śeṣakāryāṇāṃ sviṣṭakṛdiḍāprāśitraśaṃyuvākakālabhacaturdākaraṇānāṃ vidhiṃ na paśyati /
analyzed: kim punar ayam pūrvapakṣa vādī śeṣa kāryāṇām sviṣṭakṛt iḍā prāśitra śaṃyuvāka kālabha caturdā karaṇānām vidhim na paśyati
translated: But what does this proponent of the prima facie view not see as the injunction of the subsidiary rites - the Svishtakrit, the Ida-sprinkling, the Samyuva-sprinkling, the time for eating, and the four-cornered arrangement?

analyzed: satyam na paśyati iti ka cit
translated: It is true that he does not see it.

original: na tvetadyuktamiva na hovaṃ kva citpūrvapakṣo na bhavet /
analyzed: na tu etat yuktam iva na ha uvam kva cit pūrvapakṣaḥ na bhavet
translated: But this does not seem right, for there would be no prima facie view anywhere.

original: ataḥ paśyannevāne nābhiprāyeṇa mantrayataiti vaktavyam /🔽vidyamāneṣu śeṣeṣu dravyāṇāmaprayojakāḥ /
analyzed: atas na abhiprāyeṇa mantrayatā eti vaktavyam  vidyamāneṣu śeṣeṣu dravyāṇām aprayojakāḥ
translated: Therefore, it must be said that he sees it, but argues with the intention of not accepting it.🔽When there are remaining portions, the substances would not be the cause.

original: bhaveyuḥ śeṣabhājo hi niśeṣa tu prayojakāḥ
analyzed: bhaveyuḥ śeṣa bhājaḥ hi tu prayojakāḥ
translated: For those who partake of the remaining portions, the remaining portion is the cause.

original: yathaivājyena śeṣaṃ saṃsthāpayatīti pūrvakarmaṇaḥ paryavasāsānādadhike pūrvasadṛśe vā śeṣaśabdaḥ prayujyate yathā ca tataḥ śeṣeṇa viśiṣṭa deśajātyādimanto janma pratipadyante iti svarmaphalakarmaṇo niḥśeṣopayogādatyaphalasya cānyatva vyāpārāsaṃbhavāttato 'nyeneta vaktavye tataḥ śeṣeoti gautamācāryeṇoktam /
analyzed: yathā eva ājyena śeṣam saṃsthāpayati iti pūrva karmaṇaḥ paryavasāsāsānāt adhike pūrva sadṛśe vā śeṣa śabdaḥ prayujyate yathā ca tatas śeṣeṇa viśiṣṭa deśa jāti ādimantaḥ janma pratipadyante iti svarma phala karmaṇaḥ niḥśeṣa upayogāt ati aphalasya ca anya tva vyāpāra asaṃbhavāt tatas vaktavye tatas gautama ācāryeṇa uktam
translated: Just as the word 'remainder' is used to denote something that is left over from a previous action, or something similar to it, as in 'he sets aside the remainder with the ghee', and just as it is said that 'from that remainder, those endowed with specific qualities born in particular places attain birth', because the karma that results in heaven is completely utilized, and because it is impossible for something that has no result to have any other operation, therefore it is said 'from that remainder' by the teacher Gautama, even though something else is meant.

analyzed: evam iha api yat pradhāna haviyaḥ nyaṣṭaviḥ tena eva anya tvena ādhikyena vā bhaviṣyati
translated: Similarly here also, the principal offerings will be different or superior by that very difference.

original: atha vā guṇatvena vā śeṣādityevamabhidhāsyate śeṣaśabdo chapayuktataravidyamānaṃ bravīti /
analyzed: atha vā guṇa tvena vā śeṣāt iti evam abhidhāsyate bravīti
translated: Or the word 'remainder' will be used in the sense of 'from the remainder', as it denotes what is more useful than what is present.

original: na ca pradhānahaviṣāṃ ki ciddidyate 'nyeṣāṃ ca sarvametadrūpamasti tasmād dravyāntarāṇi gṛhyeran /
analyzed: na ca pradhāna haviṣām ki cit didyate nyeṣām ca sarvam etat rūpam asti tasmāt dravya antarāṇi gṛhyeran
translated: And nothing is lacking in the principal offerings, and all this form is present in the others. Therefore other substances should be taken.

analyzed: yathā vakṣyati
translated: As he will say:

analyzed: nirdeśāt tastha anyat arthāt iti ced iti
translated: 'If it is argued that it is different from the original due to the instruction,'

original: athāpyatyantaṃ śeṣaśabdānurodhaṃ kṛtvā teṣāmeva ki ciccheṣyate tathā 'pyastyevānyadvicārasya prayojanaṃ nāvaśyaṃ pakṣoktenaitra prayojanena bhavitavyamitramapi saṃbhavati /
analyzed: atha api atyantam śeṣa śabda anurodham kṛtvā teṣām eva ki cit śeṣyate tathā pi asti eva anyat vicārasya prayojanam na avaśyam pakṣa uktena etra prayojanena bhavitavya mitram api saṃbhavati
translated: Even if we entirely follow the word 'remainder' and accept that something is a remainder of those (oblations), still there is a purpose for the consideration (of the Sviṣṭakṛt offering). The purpose need not necessarily be stated in the proposition. It can be something else as well.

original: yadā pradhānavācyādaśeṣapradānaprasaktau satyāṃ śeṣakāryavaśeja śeṣāḥ sthāpyante tadā yathaiva pradhāna tasya haviṣaḥ prayojakamevaṃ sviṣṭakṛdādīnyapīti /
analyzed: yadā pradhāna vācyāt aśeṣa pradāna prasaktau satyām śeṣa kārya vaśeja śeṣāḥ sthāpyante tadā yathā eva tasya haviṣaḥ prayojakam evam sviṣṭakṛt ādīni api iti
translated: When, in the context of the possibility of giving all the remainders to the principal oblation, the remainders are established by the requirement of the remaining actions, then just as the principal oblation is the motivator of that oblation, so too are the Sviṣṭakṛt offerings and others.

analyzed: tad artha avadāna nāśa doṣa apahāraṣu api pradhāna vat eva haviḥ antaram
translated: Even in the removal of the faults of the loss of the portion intended for them, another oblation is produced just like the principal oblation.

original: yadā punaḥ pradhānacodanākṣiptasyaiva śeṣasya khiṣṭakadādoni grāhakāṇi bhavanti tadā teṣāṃ paraprayutadravyopajīvanādaprayojakale sati nāśadoṣāpahāredhvapi akriyā siḍā bhavati /
analyzed: yadā punar pradhāna codanā kṣiptasya eva śeṣasya grāhakāṇi bhavanti tadā teṣām para prayuta dravya upajīvanāt aprayojaka le sati nāśa doṣa apahāredhu api akriyā siḍā bhavati
translated: But when the Sviṣṭakṛt offerings and others are the acceptors of only the remainder that is implied by the injunction of the principal oblation, then, since they are not motivators due to depending on the substance brought by another, even in the removal of the fault of loss, non-performance is established.

analyzed: ubhayoḥ pakṣayoḥ asarva pradāne sti prayojanam iti arthavān vicāraḥ
translated: Therefore, even in both positions (of the Sviṣṭakṛt offering being a remainder or not), there is a purpose in not giving everything, and so the consideration is meaningful.

analyzed: niravadānāt tu śeṣaḥ syāt
translated: But it would be a remainder due to the absence of a portion.

analyzed: yadi āgneyaḥ ṣṭākapālaḥ iti evamādi uva bhavet tatas sarva pradānam eva avadhāryeta
translated: If it were like the injunction One should offer an oblation to Agni on eight potsherds, then the entire offering would be determined.

original: atra punastasmātpuroḍāśāderniṣkṛṣya kiṃ cideva hotavyaṃ śrayate dirhaviṣo 'vadyati madhyātpūvaḍāca hiravadyati aṅguṣṭhaparvamālamavadānaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atra punar tasmāt puroḍāśa ādeḥ niṣkṛṣya kim cit eva hotavyam śrayate diḥ haviṣaḥ vadyati madhyāt pūvaḍāca hiḥ avadyati aṅguṣṭha parva mālam avadānam bhavati
translated: But here, some part is extracted from that cake etc. and is enjoined to be offered - He cuts from the middle of the cake, He cuts from the middle of the cake, The portion is the size of the thumb joint.

original: dyavadānaṃ juhvatītyevamādivākyālocanena hi kiṃ cideva hotavyamavagatamataḥ śeṣayitavyaṃ kiṃ cit /
analyzed: divadānam juhvati iti evamādi vākya ālocanena hi kim cit eva hotavyam avagatam atas śeṣayitavyam kim cit
translated: For when one considers statements like She offers the portion, it is understood that only a part is to be offered, so some part remains to be offered.

analyzed: upāyaḥ vā tad artha tvāt
translated: Or it is a means, because it serves that purpose.

original: yadyetāni vākyānyutpattivākyāvagatamaśeṣa homamabādhamānāni na niviśeran yadi caitāni pradhānasya pra tyāsannatarāṇi bhaveyustato bāgherannetāni tu saṃskāravākyāni avirodhenaidopapadyante /
analyzed: yadi etāni vākyāni utpatti vākya avagatam aśeṣa homam abādhamānāni na niviśeran yadi ca etāni pradhānasya pra tyāsannatarāṇi bhaveyuḥ tatas bāgheran etāni tu saṃskāra vākyāni avirodhena edā upapadyante
translated: If these statements were not to be included without contradicting the entire oblation understood from the originative injunction, and if these were closer to the primary act, then they would contradict. But these statements about embellishment are logically possible without contradiction.

original: śakyate hyaṅguṣṭa parvamāvairmadhyapūrvāḍḍa tairdiśaḥ pratairavadānai saṃskṛtya saṃskṛtya niḥśeṣaṃ haviḥ pradātum /
analyzed: śakyate hi aṅguṣṭa parva māvaiḥ madhya pūrvāḥ taiḥ diśaḥ saṃskṛtya saṃskṛtya niḥśeṣam haviḥ pradātum
translated: For it is possible to offer the entire oblation by embellishing it with portions the size of the thumb joint, the middle portion, and the eastern portion.

analyzed: atas sarva vākya vaśena evam śāstra arthaḥ bhavati
translated: Therefore, by the force of the entire statement, this is the meaning of the scripture.

original: yadaśeṣaṃ havirjahoti tadevasupāyamiti tena na kasya ciḍoma pratiṣidhyate /
analyzed: yat aśeṣam haviḥ jahoti tat eva su pāyam iti tena na kasya cit ḍoma pratiṣidhyate
translated: Whatever entire oblation one offers, that is indeed the best means. By that, nothing is prohibited for anyone.

analyzed: tasmāt sarva pradānam karttavyam
translated: Therefore, all giving should be done.

original: yattu yathāśrutetikatrttavyatāko yugapanna śakyate ka tumahāvadānahomaprasaṅgāditi /
analyzed: yat tu yathāśruta itikatrttavyatākaḥ yugapad na śakyate ka tu mahā avadāna homa prasaṅgāt iti
translated: But what is to be done as heard, cannot be done simultaneously, due to the contingency of a great oblation offering.
As in the Jyotiṣṭoma, it is determined in the Mīmāṃsā commentary.

analyzed: tavyaḥ homaḥ
translated: The oblation is to be done.

analyzed: tad artha tva aha vata artha tvāt yā ga artha tvāt apūrva artha tvāt ḍā kasnasya aṣṭākapālasya
translated: Because it is for that purpose, because it is for the purpose of that, because it is for the unseen purpose, the eight-pan offering of any one is not.

analyzed: na eka deśa māva homena utpatti vākya artha saṃbhāvanā bhavet
translated: The meaning of the originative injunction cannot be assumed to be fulfilled by an oblation of a part.

analyzed: śratha vā vidāna saṃskārasya dravya artha tvāt
translated: Or, because the purification by the injunction is for the purpose of the substance.

analyzed: kṛta tvāt tu karmaṇa dravyasya guṇa bhūta tvāt
translated: But because the rite is done once, the substance being subordinate,

analyzed: na etat asti
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: punar punar hiḥ avakhaṇḍanam homaḥ bhyasitavyaḥ iti
translated: The cutting again and again, and the oblation there, should be repeated.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: khaṇḍanam guṇa bhūta tvāt abhyasyeta iha yadi api
translated: Even though the cutting is subordinate, it is repeated here.

analyzed: homaḥ pradhāna bhāvāt tu na āvṛttim pratipadyate
translated: But the oblation, being principal, does not undergo repetition.

original: āgneyacodanāyā hyānumāniko homasaṃbandhaḥ sarvapuroḍāśāvayavasāmānya pravṛttaśca sa yāvannaiva nirvartate tāvadastyeva hyavadānaṃ juhototyanena niṣkṛṣya saṃbandhaḥ kalpitaḥ /
analyzed: āgneya codanāyāḥ hi ānumānikaḥ homa saṃbandhaḥ sarva puroḍāśa avayava sāmānya pravṛttaḥ ca sa yāvat na eva nirvartate tāvat asti eva hi avadānam juhota iti anena niṣkṛṣya saṃbandhaḥ kalpitaḥ
translated: For the connection of the Homa with the Āgneya injunction is inferential, and it applies to the general class of all cake-portions. As long as that is not accomplished, the connection extracted by the text He offers the portion is indeed imagined.

analyzed: tasmin ca siddhe na ānumānikaḥ
translated: And when that is accomplished, the inferential one is not possible.

original: tena yatmāmānya pravṛttamā gneyatvaṃ tad dyavadānacodanayā sāpradaśyamiva prākaraṇa kaidya vadāna viṣaya mevopasaṃkriyate /
analyzed: tena yat māmānya pravṛttam ā gneya tvam tat sāpradaśyam iva prākaraṇa kaidya vadāna viṣayam eva upasaṃkriyate
translated: Therefore, the Āgneya-ness, which applies to the general class, is brought to the portion-offering topic itself, as if it were to be performed by the portion-offering injunction.

analyzed: tatra eṣa ṛthaḥ vijñāyate yava dānam āgneyam karoti iti atas vayava antarāṇām a codita tvāt na homa prasaṅgaḥ
translated: And in that, this meaning is understood: He makes the portion Āgneya. Therefore, since the other portions are not enjoined, there is no connection with the Homa.

analyzed: kim ca
translated: And what else?

analyzed: na ca avaśya pradānena haviḥ āgneya miṣyate
translated: And the oblation is not necessarily desired to be Āgneya by the portioning.

analyzed: di avadāne gṛha ute hi sarva āgneya tva saṃbhavaḥ
translated: For in the portioning, the Āgneya-ness of all is possible.

analyzed: sāptadaśyam hi sāmidhenaunām uktam anāramya vādena na kratūnām
translated: For the Saptadaśa-ness is stated for the Sāmidhenīs by the Ārambhaṇavāda, not for the sacrifices.

original: tasya tu kratusaṃbandhastadvāreṇānumānikaḥ kasapyo na ca pratyakṣasaṃbandhe satyānumānikaḥ kalpyataiti yukta upasaṃhāraḥ /
analyzed: tasya tu kratu saṃbandhaḥ tad dvāreṇa ānumānikaḥ kasapyaḥ na ca pratyakṣa saṃbandhe sati ānumānikaḥ kalpyate iti yuktaḥ upasaṃhāraḥ
translated: But its connection with the sacrifice is only inferential through that (connection of the Havirdhana with the sacrifice), and when the connection is directly perceived, it cannot be inferred. So the conclusion is proper.

analyzed: na tu aṣṭākapālasya asphuṭaḥ devatā saṃbandhaḥ taḍitā abhihita tvāt
translated: But the connection of the Aṣṭākapāla with the deity is not clear, because it is stated by the word 'lightning'.

analyzed: sa hi ha avadānasya eva ānumānikaḥ syāt
translated: For that would be only inferential for the Havirdhana.

analyzed: utpatti vākye ca karmaṇā uṣṭākapālena saṃvandhaḥ śrayate
translated: And in the originative injunction, the connection of the rite with the Aṣṭākapāla is heard.

analyzed: ha avadānena punar utpanna vākye
translated: But in the Havirdhana, which is produced by another injunction.

analyzed: tava etat syāt
translated: This might be your view:

original: karmasaṃbandho'ṣṭākapālasyānumāniko jhavadānasya pratyakṣastagāve vā''numānikakalpanaṃ na saṃbhavatīti /
analyzed: karma saṃbandha uṣṭākapālasya ānumānikaḥ jhava dānasya vā ānumānika kalpanam na saṃbhavati iti
translated: The connection of the Aṣṭākapāla with the rite is inferential, while that of the Havirdhana is direct. Therefore it is not possible to assume an inferential one.

analyzed: na etaktam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: evam sati jhava dānam juhota iti etat eva utpatti vākyam abhyupagatam bhavet
translated: If it were so, then this very originative injunction 'he offers the Havirdhana' would be accepted.

original: yadi hyaṣṭākapālavākyaṃ juhotivākonopasaṃhṛtaṃ tato 'nenaiva karmotpattiḥ kriyeta /
analyzed: yadi hi aṣṭākapāla vākyam tatas nena eva karma utpattiḥ kriyeta
translated: For if the sentence about the Aṣṭākapāla were not included in the sentence 'he offers', then the rite would be produced by this very (Havirdhana sentence).

original: tataścāgneyavākye codite hi tadarthatvāttasya tasyopaditṛtīyādhyāyasya caturtha pāda /
analyzed: tatas ca āgneya vākye codite hi tad artha tvāt tasya tasya upadiś tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturtha pāda
translated: And then, when the Agniṣṭoma sentence is enjoined, because it has that as its purpose, that (Havirdhana) is enjoined by that (Agniṣṭoma sentence).

analyzed: śyeta iti evam vākya bhedaḥ prāpnoti
translated: Otherwise, there would be a split of the sentence, as in he lies down.

original: na cānanumāya yāgamāgneyādivākyānāṃ vākyāntarāpekṣā tatsaṃbandho vā 'vakalpate ityuktam /
analyzed: na ca an anumāya yāgam āgneya ādi vākyānām vākya antara apekṣā tad saṃbandhaḥ vā iti uktam
translated: And it has been said that without inferring the sacrifice, the sentences beginning with to Agni cannot be related to another sentence or to that [sacrifice].

original: ato yadyapyānumānika saṃbandhastathā 'pi svārthaparyavasāyitvānyathānupapatteḥ prathamataramanumita iti siddhe saṃbandhe na śakyaṃ pratyakṣaśatenāpyanyathātvaṃ karttam /
analyzed: atas saṃbandhaḥ tathā svārtha paryavasāyi tva anyathā anupapatteḥ prathamataram anumitaḥ iti siddhe saṃbandhe na śakyam pratyakṣa śatena api anyathātvam karttam
translated: Therefore, even if the relation is inferential, still, because it cannot be otherwise explained except as ending with its own meaning, it is first inferred. Thus, when the relation is established, it cannot be made otherwise even by a hundred direct perceptions.

original: na ceha sāmānyaviśeṣabhāvaḥ saṃbhavati avayavāvayavinoḥ sāmānya viśeṣavyavahārābhāvāt /
analyzed: na ca iha sāmānya viśeṣa bhāvaḥ saṃbhavati avayava avayavinoḥ sāmānya viśeṣa vyavahāra abhāvāt
translated: And here, there cannot be a relation of general and particular, because the parts and the whole are not conventionally regarded as general and particular.

original: aṣṭākapālaco nayā hi pratyakṣameva samasta puroḍāśa upadiśyate /
analyzed: hi pratyakṣam eva samasta puroḍāśaḥ upadiśyate
translated: For the injunction on eight potsherds directly teaches the entire cake.

analyzed: dhava ḍhāna codanayā
translated: And by the injunction of cutting, it has equal strength.

original: nanu hāvadānavyatiriktāvyavaprāptiḥ sāmānyena puroḍāśaśabdena kriyamāṇā durbalā syāt /
analyzed: nanu ha avadāna vyatiriktā avyavaprāptiḥ sāmānyena puroḍāśa śabdena kriyamāṇā durbalā syāt
translated: But the general indication of the cake by the word cake, which is not obtained except by cutting, would be weak.

analyzed: uccate  yadi hi avayava arthena puroḍāśaḥ vidhīyate
translated: It is said:🔽If the cake were enjoined by the meaning of its parts,

analyzed: tatas sāmānya vṛttiḥ syāt sa tu sākṣāt vidhauyate
translated: then it would be a general [indication], but it is directly enjoined.

original: devatāyai hi dātuṃ dravyaṃ tyajanti na vibhavena /
analyzed: devatāyai hi dātum dravyam tyajanti na vibhavena
translated: For they abandon the substance to give to the deity, not for the sake of wealth.

analyzed: tatra yat ha vata arthāt anyat adhikam tat gṛha avasthita dravya antara vat aparivyaktam
translated: There, whatever is more than the meaning is not manifested, like another substance remaining in the house.

analyzed: na ca atra tyāgasya bhedena vidhānam asti
translated: And there is no injunction of renunciation separately here.

analyzed: devatā saṃbandha karaṇa vidhinā eva hi asau arthāpattyā ācipyate
translated: For it is inferred by the injunction connecting with the deity.

original: sā cāthapattiryāvatā vinā devatāyeṃ dānaṃ na saṃbhavati tāvatyaṃ vāvasthitā nānyatra /
analyzed: sā ca athapattiḥ yāvatā vinā devatāyem dānam na saṃbhavati vā avasthitā na anyatra
translated: And that inference remains only to the extent that without the deity, the gift is not possible, not otherwise.

analyzed: na hi śeṣa dravya parityāga ādinā
translated: And there is no impossibility by the abandonment of the remaining substance and so on.

original: sarvatra ca samāptividhānamiṣyate tenāpi yāvata eva yāgasamāptyaṅgatvaṃ tāvata evākṣipta yāgavidhirnāvayavāntarāṇām /
analyzed: sarvatra ca samāpti vidhānam iṣyate tena api yāvataḥ eva yāga samāpti aṅgatvam tāvataḥ eva ākṣipta yāga vidhiḥ na avayava antarāṇām
translated: And in every case, the injunction of completion is accepted. Therefore, by that also, only to the extent that it is a part of the completion of the sacrifice, it is inferred, not of the other parts.

original: ato yathā caturmu ṭyatiriktānāmanasi sthitānāṃ vrohiyavānāṃ na nirvāpavelāyāmalyāgādasvatvamevamihāpi nāvayavāntarāṇāṃ tatsyāditi /
analyzed: atas yathā catur mu ṭi atiriktānām anasi sthitānām vrohi yavānām na nirvāpa velāyām alyāgāt asvatvam evam iha api na avayava antarāṇām tat syāt iti
translated: Therefore, just as barley and wheat remaining in the mind, which are more than the four, do not become non-owned at the time of the oblation due to the absence of sacrifice, so also here, that would not be for the other parts.

analyzed: athā ucyeta nirvāpa velāyām anupajāta madhya pūrva ādi vibhāgam dravyam anabhipreta tyāgam api balāt parityaktavyam
translated: Now, it may be said that at the time of the offering, the substance, which is not yet divided into middle, beginning, end, etc., and which is not intended to be given up, must be forcibly given up.

original: na hi tadānīṃ vijñāyate kebhyo vrauhigyo hyavadānaṃ niṣyatsyate kebhyo netyagamyamāne viśeṣe yāneva na tyajettegya eva kadā cidavadauyeta /
analyzed: na hi tadānīm vijñāyate kebhyaḥ vrauhigyaḥ hi avadānam niṣyatsyate kebhyaḥ na iti a gamyamāne viśeṣe yān eva na tyajet tegyaḥ eva kadā cit avadauyeta
translated: For at that time it is not known to whom the portion will be given, and to whom not. When there is no known distinction, one would give up only what one would never give.

analyzed: tatra tyaktānām adānāt ca dānāt ayathā ta karagā prasaṅaḥ
translated: There, due to not giving up what is given up and giving up what is not given up, there is the undesirable consequence of non-performance.🔽Therefore, this is not so - when the general rule is acted upon,

original: tasmātsarvatyāga hani naitadevam / na hi sāmānyaśākhegā vyavahāre kṛte sati /🔽viśeṣaśāstrāvasarastammādādita eva saḥ
analyzed: tasmāt sarva tyāga hani na etat evam na hi sāmānya śākhegā vyavahāre kṛte sati  viśeṣa śāstra avasaraḥ tammāt āditas eva saḥ
translated: there is no occasion for the specific rule, therefore it is from the beginning itself.

original: yadyāgneyādicodanayaiva haviprakṣepo 'bhidhīyate tato hyavadānacodanayā parisaṃkhyā tumaśakyatvātsarvaprakṣepaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: yadi āgneya ādi codanayā eva havi prakṣepaḥ abhidhīyate tatas hi avadāna codanayā parisaṃkhyā tum aśakya tvāt sarva prakṣepaḥ prāpnoti
translated: If the pouring of oblation is stated by the injunction of the Āgneya offering alone, then due to the impossibility of restricting by the injunction of the portion, all pouring would be obtained.

original: tadā ca tathā ''gneyacodanayaiva prakṣepaścodyeta yadā yāgahomayorabhedaḥ /
analyzed: tadā ca tathā gneya codanayā eva prakṣepaḥ codyeta yadā yāga homayoḥ abhedaḥ
translated: And then, when there is no difference between the sacrifice and the oblation, the pouring would be enjoined by the Āgneya injunction itself.

analyzed: tayoḥ tu bhedaḥ śabda antara adhikaraṇa nyāya siddhaḥ
translated: But their difference is established by the reasoning of the Śabdāntarādhikaraṇa.

original: tadakte śravaṇājjuhotirāsecanādhika syāditi sūtrakāraṇoccamānaṃ tavaiva samarthayiṣyāmahe /
analyzed: tad akte śravaṇāt juhotiḥ āsecana adhika syāt iti sūtra kāraṇā ucca mānam tava eva samarthayiṣyāmahe
translated: In the sutra, the author will establish the same point that the offering is for the purpose of sprinkling, based on the hearing of that statement.

original: yathā devatoddeśena svatvatyāgamātraṃ yāgo devatoddiṣṭa tyajyamāna svatvadravyaprakṣepo juhotiḥ /
analyzed: yathā devatā uddeśena sva tva tyāga mātram yāgaḥ tyajyamāna sva tva dravya prakṣepaḥ juhotiḥ
translated: Just as the sacrifice is merely the relinquishment of ownership with reference to the deity, the offering is the throwing of the substance whose ownership is being relinquished, with reference to the deity.

original: tatra ye doṣā darśapūrṇamāsajyotiṣṭomādiṣvahomatvādāhavanīyo na bhavedityādayastānapi tatraiva parihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ye doṣāḥ darśa pūrṇamāsa jyotiṣṭoma ādiṣu a homa tvāt āhavanīyaḥ na bhavet ityādayaḥ tān api tatra eva parihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: There, we will also remove the faults such as the Ahavaniya fire would not be used in the Darsha-Purnamasa and Jyotishtoma sacrifices because they are not offerings and so on.

original: ubhayośca bheṭe sati āgneyo 'ṣṭākapāla ityanena tāvaddākona yāvatā vinā 'ṣṭākapālasyāgneyatvaṃ na bhavati tāvadeva codyate /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ ca bheṭe sati āgneyaḥ ṣṭākapālaḥ iti anena yāvatā vinā ṣṭākapālasya āgneya tvam na bhavati tāvat eva codyate
translated: When both are combined, by the injunction the cake on eight potsherds is for Agni, only as much is enjoined as is necessary for the cake on eight potsherds to be for Agni.

original: tasya ca svatvaparityāgadevatoddaśau kevalāvantareṇāgneyatvaṃ na jāyate na prakṣepamapi tatra yadi vākyāntaraṃ na syāt tata īdṛśaṃ karma bhavet /
analyzed: tasya ca svatva parityāga devatā uddaśau kevalau antareṇa āgneya tvam na jāyate na prakṣepam api tatra yadi vākya antaram na syāt tatas īdṛśam karma bhavet
translated: And that ownership is not relinquished merely by the relinquishment of ownership and the reference to the deity, it does not occur without the throwing in. If there were no other sentence there, then such an act would occur.

analyzed: supakkam a vikalam aṣṭākapā tantravārtike
translated: The cake on eight potsherds is well-cooked and deficient.

original: lamācaritaḥ śrutau deśe nidhāya devatāmuddiśya nāyaṃ mameti saṃkalpaḥ karttavyaḥ /
analyzed: lam ācaritaḥ śrutau deśe nidhāya devatām uddiśya na ayam mama iti saṃkalpaḥ karttavyaḥ
translated: Having placed it in the heard place, with reference to the deity, the resolution this is not mine should be made.

original: tatparipālanārthaṃ ca punaḥ kadā cidapi na svatvaṃ dravye badhnīyāt /
analyzed: tad paripālana artham ca punar kadā cit api na sva tvam dravye badhnīyāt
translated: And for the sake of protecting that, he should never again attach ownership to the substance.

original: yadi hi bannauyātataḥ pūrvasaṃkalpaṃ vināśayedanṛtaṃ ca vadet /
analyzed: yadi hi pūrva saṃkalpam vināśayet anṛtam ca vadet
translated: For if he were to attach it again, he would destroy his previous intention and speak falsely.

original: yo hi prathamameva jānāti punarapyahamatra svatvamādhāsyāmīti tasya na mamaitaddevatāyai tvetaditi saṃkalpa eva na bhavet /
analyzed: yaḥ hi prathamam eva jānāti punar api aham atra sva tvam ādhāsyāmi iti tasya na mama etat devatāyai tu etat iti saṃkalpaḥ eva na bhavet
translated: For one who knows from the very beginning that he will again attach ownership to it, would not have the intention This is not mine, but this is for the deity.

original: tena devatoheśatyāgottarakālaṃ yadasya bhavati tadbhavatvityavadhārya na kaścidyāpāro vo ḍhavyo bhavet /
analyzed: tena devatā ūha īśa tyāga uttara kālam yat asya bhavati tat bhavatu iti avadhārya na kaścid yāpāraḥ vaḥ ḍhavyaḥ bhavet
translated: Therefore, after the renunciation to the deity, whatever remains to him, let that be, thus determining, he should have no further action or thought.

original: tathā prāpte tu vākyāntarāṇi bhavanti upastuṇāti hirhaviṣo 'vadyati abhighārayati caturavattaṃ juhotītyevamāṭoni taimtāvadidamavadhāryate yadadānaṃ haviṣo hotavyamiti /
analyzed: tathā prāpte tu vākya antarāṇi bhavanti upastuṇāti hiḥ haviṣaḥ vadyati abhighārayati catur avattam juhoti iti evam taim tāvat idam avadhāryate yat adānam haviṣaḥ hotavyam iti
translated: When this is the case, there are other statements such as he attends to the oblation, he cuts off the portion, he pours clarified butter over it, he offers the four-sliced oblation. By these it is determined that the oblation should be offered.

analyzed: sarvāṇi ca etāni prakṛta dravya ālambi tva gat tad pādāya pravarttante na apūrva dravya grāhi tvena
translated: And all these occur with reference to the original substance, not with reference to a new substance.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: For instance,

original: caturavattaṃ juhotītyava homasyāprāptatvānna tamuddiśya dravyaṃ vidhīyate caturavattaṃ ca pūrvavākya kalpitaṃ prayojanāpekṣamasti /
analyzed: catur avattam juhoti iti ava homasya aprāpta tvāt na tam uddiśya dravyam vidhīyate catur avattam ca pūrva vākya kalpitam prayojana apekṣam asti
translated: As for the injunction of the offering of the four cuttings, since the offering has not been enjoined, the material is not enjoined with reference to that. And the four cuttings, which are assumed by the previous sentence, exist in dependence on a purpose.

original: tasmāttasyānena prakṣepamātraṃ śakyaṃ vidhātumiti na caturavattaviśiṣṭa homavidhānamavakalpate /
analyzed: tasmāt tasya anena prakṣepa mātram śakyam vidhātum iti na catur avatta viśiṣṭa homa vidhānam avakalpate
translated: Therefore, it is only possible to enjoin the mere throwing in of that by this. Thus, the injunction of the offering qualified by the four cuttings is not possible.🔽And since even three-fourths of the offering are completed up to the end, and when the throwing in is enjoined in the last part, by the abandonment of the two intended ones, should the injunction be assumed by implication for the two unseen results, or should the two, which are obtained from somewhere else, be accepted? There, by the principle of the conflict of two injunctions, when there is lightness, since heaviness is not a valid means of knowledge, the understood abandonment and the horse-sacrifice are accepted, not the cake on eight potsherds, etc.🔽And their natural instrumentality to the sacrifice is not contradicted.

original: homasyāpi ca tryaṃśasya samāptiparyantatvāt sarvāntyeṃśe prakṣepe codyamāne tyāgata hevatoddeśayoḥ kimapūrvayorarthāpattyā vidhi kalpyatāmuta kutaścitprāptayorevāśrayaṇaṃ kriyatāmiti tatrāgne vyadhikaragānyāyena lāghave sati gauravasyāpramāṇakatvādavagatatyāgoheśāṃśahayānyaṣṭākapālādaunyeva gṛhyante /
analyzed: homasya api ca tri aṃśasya samāpti paryanta tvāt sarva antya iṃśe prakṣepe codyamāne hevatā uddeśayoḥ kim apūrvayoḥ arthāpattyā vidhi kalpyatām uta kutaścid prāptayoḥ eva āśrayaṇam kriyatām iti tatra agne vyadhikaragā nyāyena lāghave sati gauravasya apramāṇaka tvāt avagata tyāga ūha īśa aṃśa hayāni aṣṭākapāla ādauni eva gṛhyante
translated: Even the Agni-sacrifice, which is being enjoined, is in that sacrifice. Thus, by the principle of the conflict of two injunctions, when there is lightness, since heaviness is not a valid means of knowledge, the understood abandonment and the horse-sacrifice are accepted, not the cake on eight potsherds, etc.

original: na ca teṣāmautpattikaṃ yāgasādhanatvaṃ virudhyate /🔽pratiṣyamāṇānāmagniyāga nāmapi tadyāge iti ka pu pā tṛtīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda /
analyzed: na ca teṣām autpattikam yāga sādhana tvam virudhyate  pratiṣyamāṇānām agni yāga nām api tad yāge iti ka pu pā tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ pāda
translated: And their natural instrumentality to the sacrifice is not contradicted.🔽Even the Agni-sacrifice, which is being enjoined, is in that sacrifice. Thus, by the principle of the conflict of two injunctions, when there is lightness, since heaviness is not a valid means of knowledge, the understood abandonment and the horse-sacrifice are accepted, not the cake on eight potsherds, etc.

analyzed: sādhana tvā vighātaka tvāt
translated: And their natural instrumentality to the sacrifice is not contradicted.🔽Even the Agni-sacrifice, which is being enjoined, is in that sacrifice. Thus, by the principle of the conflict of two injunctions, when there is lightness, since heaviness is not a valid means of knowledge, the understood abandonment and the horse-sacrifice are accepted, not the cake on eight potsherds, etc.🔽And their natural instrumentality to the sacrifice is not contradicted.🔽Even the Agni-sacrifice, which is being enjoined, is in that sacrifice. Thus, by the principle of the conflict of two injunctions, when there is lightness, since heaviness is not a valid means of knowledge, the understood abandonment and the horse-sacrifice

original: devatāntarasaṃbandhena hi yāgaviparītakriyā saṃbandhena vā virodha syāt na tvasāvasti /
analyzed: devatā antara saṃbandhena hi yāga viparīta kriyā saṃbandhena vā syāt na tu asau asti
translated: For there would be contradiction either by the connection of the sacrifice with another deity, or by the connection with an action contrary to the sacrifice, but that does not exist.

original: tenaiṣo 'rtho bhavati aṣṭākapālena yava kva citpradeśe sthitena yajeta tadīyaṃ ca dyavadānaṃ yatva kva citpracipediti /
analyzed: tena eṣaḥ rthaḥ bhavati aṣṭākapālena kva cit pradeśe sthitena yajeta tadīyam ca dyavadānam kva cit pracipet iti
translated: Therefore this is the meaning: One should perform the sacrifice with the cake on eight potsherds located somewhere, and one should offer the oblation belonging to it somewhere.

original: tava vedyāṃ havīṃṣyāsādayati barhiṣautivacanāttatra sthitena puroḍāśenejyate /
analyzed: tava vedyām havīṃṣi āsādayati barhiṣau iti vacanāt tatra sthitena puroḍāśena ijyate
translated: He places the oblations on the altar, as stated by the text on the sacrificial grass. Therefore the sacrifice is performed with the cake located there.

original: yadāhavanauye juhotīti vacanāttatra hāvadānaṃ hayate sa tu homa kiṃ pūvādyāgādarthāntaramitikarttavyatā bhavati uta tasyaiva yāgasyāṃśānta raviraḍyā rūpāntaraṃ jātamiti cintanīyam /
analyzed: yat āhavanauye juhoti iti vacanāt tatra ha avadānam sa tu homa kim pūvāt yāgāt artha antaram itikarttavya tā bhavati uta tasya eva yāgasya aṃśānta rūpa antaram jātam iti cintanīyam
translated: When he offers in the Ahavaniya fire, as stated by the text, the oblation is offered there. But should that Homa be a different act of offering from the original sacrifice, or is it a different form of that same sacrifice, a different part? This should be considered.

analyzed: tatra eva rūpa antara upajananam iti brūmaḥ
translated: We say it is the generation of a different form of the same sacrifice.

original: karmāntarasve hi dravyāntaraṃ devatāntaraṃ ca nāriṣṭhahomādivatprāpnati /
analyzed: karma antara sve hi dravya antaram devatā antaram ca na ariṣṭha homa ādi vat prāpnati
translated: For if it were a different act, it would entail a different substance and a different deity, like the Nārīṣṭa Homa and so on.

original: yathoktena nyāyena sa eva yāgaḥ pracitataro juhotitvamāpadyate /
analyzed: yathā uktena nyāyena saḥ eva yāgaḥ pracitataraḥ juhoti tvam āpadyate
translated: By the stated reasoning, that same sacrifice, being more elaborate, becomes the Homa.

analyzed: na ca etāvatā utpattika yaji rūpa vighātaḥ śrāśayaḥ juhoteḥ yaji viśeṣa tvāt
translated: And this much is not enough to destroy the form of origination, because the Juhoti is a particular of the Yaji.

analyzed: sāmānye hi kaścid hi śeṣaḥ na bhavati api
translated: For in a general statement, something may not be a particular.

analyzed: na tu niḥsāmānyaḥ kaścid hi śeṣaḥ upapadyate
translated: But a completely general statement is not possible.

original: tataśca yathā vṛkṣamānayetyukte śiṃśapāmityavirodhātpaścāducyamānaṃ na virudhyate tathā yajetetyukte juhotitvāvirodho 'vagantavyaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca yathā vṛkṣam ānaya iti ukte śiṃśapām iti avirodhāt paścāt ucyamānam na virudhyate tathā yajeta iti ukte juhoti tva avirodhaḥ vagantavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, just as when it is said Bring the tree, and The Sleshmana is stated later without contradiction, it is not contradicted, so when it is said Sacrifice, the state of being Juhoti should be understood without contradiction.

original: so 'yaṃ yāga eva grākāraḥ samastena puroḍāśena kriyate hāvadānena juhotyavasthānītaḥ śeṣeṇa tu sāmānyarūpa ekasminnapi ca caṇe jhākāro'pi niṣpadyate /
analyzed: saḥ yam yāgaḥ eva grākāraḥ samastena puroḍāśena kriyate ha avadānena juhoti avasthānītaḥ śeṣeṇa tu sāmānya rūpe ekasmin api ca caṇe niṣpadyate
translated: This sacrifice is performed with the entire cake, with the offering, which is a substitute for the Juhoti, but with the remainder, which is of a general form, even in a single grain, the form of the Juhoti is produced.

original: yadaiva hi ḍāvadānamāhavanauye nicipyate tadaiva yājyānuvākyābhyāṃ samastaviṣayadevatāsaṃkalpotyāpanaṃ kriyate tena naivaṃ bhramitavyaṃ yammājjuhasthaṃ hāvadānamāśravaṇa pratyāśravaṇābhyāṃ tyāgāyorataṃ ca tasmāttadeva kevalaṃ devatāyai saṃkalpitaṃ netaraditi vidvadbhyāmadhvaryayajamānābhyāṃ vedārthamanusṛtya samastaparityāgadevatoddeśau yathāīṃ karttavyo adhvaryaṇā hyavadānaprakṣepo 'tiriktonuṣṭheya iti /
analyzed: yadā eva hi ḍāvadānam āhavanauye nicipyate tadā eva yājyā anuvākyābhyām samasta viṣaya devatā saṃkalpa utyāpanam kriyate tena na evam bhramitavyam yammāt ha avadānam āśravaṇa pratyāśravaṇābhyām ca tasmāt tat eva kevalam devatāyai saṃkalpitam na itarat iti vidvadbhyām adhvarya yajamānābhyām veda artham anusṛtya samasta parityāga devatā uddeśau yathāīm karttavyaḥ adhvaryaṇā hi avadāna prakṣepaḥ tiriktaḥ anuṣṭheyaḥ iti
translated: For as soon as the Avadāna is placed on the Juhu and the Ahavanīya, the idea of the deity with reference to the whole is removed by the Yājyā and Anuvākyās. Therefore, one should not be confused in this way: The Avadāna placed on the Juhu is not to be abandoned by the two recitations and non-recitations. Therefore, only that is intended for the deity, not the other. The learned Adhvaryu and sacrificer, following the meaning of the Veda, should perform the dedication of the whole and the offering to the deity. For the Adhvaryu's placing of the Avadāna is to be performed as an additional act.

analyzed: na ca etāvatā yāgasya vairupyam aśobhanam mantavyam
translated: And this should not be considered as a blemish of the sacrifice.

analyzed: vacana sāmarthyāt īhaśasya eva śobhana tva pratīteḥ
translated: Because of the power of the statement, the beauty of the sacrifice is understood here.

original: yathā kasya citpuruṣasyaikaḥ pādaḥ purastāita iti na tāvatā kiṃ cidrelakṣaṇyaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yathā kasya cit puruṣasya ekaḥ pādaḥ purastāitaḥ iti na tāvatā kim cit relakṣaṇyam bhavati
translated: Just as for some person, if one foot is in front, that does not make any difference.

original: tathā 'va ḍāvadānapāde'dhikamapi prakṣepāṃśaṃ gate satyutpattivākyaśiṣṭaṃ yāgasādhanatvaṃ samastenāṣṭākapālena pratipannameṃ vetyavirodhaḥ /
analyzed: tathā prakṣepa aṃśam gate sati utpatti vākya śiṣṭam yāga sādhanatvam samastena aṣṭākapālena pratipannam eṃ vā iti avirodhaḥ
translated: Similarly, when the additional part of the offering is completed in the Avadāna section, the instrumentality of the sacrifice, which is indicated by the originative injunction, is accepted as a whole with the eight-piece cake. Thus there is no contradiction.

analyzed: tasmāt jhākāram eva etavyadhānam draṣṭavyam
translated: Therefore, this injunction should be seen as having the form of a sacrifice.

original: atha vā yastatra yāgastasya prādhānyaṃ yastu prakṣepaḥ so 'ṅgameva /
analyzed: atha vā yaḥ tatra yāgaḥ tasya prādhānyam yaḥ tu prakṣepaḥ saḥ u ṅgam eva
translated: Or, the sacrifice there is primary, while the offering is merely a subsidiary.

original: tathā hi /🔽phalavākye yajereva saṃbandhaḥ śrayate mphuṭaḥ /
analyzed: tathā hi  phala vākye yajeḥ eva saṃbandhaḥ śrayate mphuṭaḥ
translated: This is because:🔽In the sentence speaking of the result, the connection of the verb to sacrifice is clearly heard.

analyzed: tad saṃnnidhau samāmnānāt juhotar aṅga tā iṣyate
translated: By the rule of proximity, the verb to offer is understood.

analyzed: aprayojaka tvāt ekasmāt śeṣasya guṇa bhūta tvāt
translated: Because it is not the motivating factor, and because the subsidiary is subordinate to the one action,

original: yadāhavanīye prakṣepeṇa akṣapito haviśeṣa pratipāditastadā śeṣakāryāṇi sviṣṭakṛdādīni kathaṃ kriyantāmiti vicāryate /
analyzed: yadā āhavanīye prakṣepeṇa akṣapitaḥ havi śeṣa pratipāditaḥ tadā śeṣa kāryāṇi sviṣṭakṛt ādīni katham kriyantām iti vicāryate
translated: When the special oblation is offered into the Ahavaniya fire, then how are the remaining rites such as the Svistakṛt offering to be performed? This is considered.

analyzed: tatra artha karma tvam manyamānaḥ ekasmāt iti āha
translated: There, considering it to be an object of the verb, he says from one.

original: satyapyarthakarmatve yadi tadarthamevaitāni dravyāṇi utpannāni bhaveyustataḥ sarveṣāṃ sambhāvanāya paśvavadānānāmivaikammādapi sidhyati yāge sarveṣāṃ saṃbandhaḥ kriyeta tattu nāstyaprayojakatvāt /
analyzed: sati api artha karma tve yadi tad artham eva etāni dravyāṇi utpannāni bhaveyuḥ tatas sarveṣām sambhāvanāya paśu avadānānām iva ekammāt api sidhyati yāge sarveṣām saṃbandhaḥ kriyeta tat tu na asti aprayojaka tvāt
translated: Even if they are subsidiary acts, if these substances were produced only for that purpose, then just like the portions of the animal, one would suffice for the imagination of all, and the connection of all in the sacrifice would be accomplished. But that is not so, because they are not instrumental.

analyzed: atas tuṣa upavāpa kapāla dekena eva siddhiḥ
translated: Therefore, the accomplishment is by just one, like the husking and the potsherd.

analyzed: saṃskṛta tvāt ca
translated: And because of being refined.

original: yaśca pradhānānāmevādṛṣṭaḥ saṃskārama ekadravyaniṣpāditaiśaśeṣa kāryesmidhyatīti na dravyāntaramapekṣate /
analyzed: yaḥ ca pradhānānām eva a dṛṣṭaḥ eka dravya niṣpāditaiḥ aśeṣa kārye smidhyati iti na dravya antaram apekṣate
translated: And one who is unseen only for the principal ones, and accomplishes the subsidiary rite produced by a single substance, does not require another substance.

original: sakqacchandaśca sakṛdavadānābhiprāya /🔽itarathā tu sarvāvadāne 'pi tanveṇa prayogātmakṛttvopapatteravaktavyataiva syāt /
analyzed: sakqa chandaḥ ca sakṛt avadāna abhiprāya  itarathā tu sarva avadāne pi tanveṇa prayoga ātma kṛt tva upapatteḥ avaktavya tā eva syāt
translated: And the desire is for the portions to be taken once.🔽Otherwise, even if all portions are taken, the completion of the performance by a single one is possible, so it would be inexpressible.

original: atha vā tataḥ śeṣa kāryāṇi sarvebhyaḥ kriyeranyadi saṃskārakāṇi bhaveyarna tvetāni saṃskārakāṇi /
analyzed: atha vā tatas śeṣa kāryāṇi sarvebhyaḥ kriyeran yadi saṃskārakāṇi bhaveyaḥ na tu etāni saṃskārakāṇi
translated: Or else, if the subsidiary rites were to be performed for all from that, they would be performed. But these are not subsidiary rites.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: saṃskāra antaraiḥ eva saṃskṛta tvāt
translated: Because they are refined by other refining acts themselves.

analyzed: ayam api avirodha abhaviṣyati iti ced
translated: If it is argued that this would be non-contradictory,

analyzed: tatra api eṣa
translated: even there, this is the meaning of the sutra.

analyzed: saṃskāra kramasya atikrānta tvāt
translated: Because the sequence of refining acts has been transgressed.

original: yā vayakṛtaprayojanaṃ dravyaṃ bhavati tāvatsaṃskāramapekṣate pradhānaniṭatyuttarakālaṃ tu kṛtaṃ saṃskārairiti saṃskārāṇāmanavasaraḥ /
analyzed: dravyam bhavati tāvat saṃskāram apekṣate pradhāna niṭati uttara kālam tu kṛtam saṃskāraiḥ iti saṃskārāṇām anavasaraḥ
translated: That substance which has a purpose already accomplished requires refinement, but after the completion of the primary rite, the refinement has been done. Thus there is no scope for the refinements.

analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ vā kāraṇa aviśeṣāt saṃskārasya tad artha tvāt
translated: Or, all of them, because there is no difference in the cause, since the refinement is for that purpose.

analyzed: yaiḥ tu dravyam cikīrṣyate iti evam saṃskāra karmāṇi etāni
translated: Those by which the substance is desired to be accomplished, thus these are the acts of refinement.

original: tava hyutpattau yena saṃyuktamiti pratipattayastāśca sarvaiḥ kṛtārtha cāviśeṣādapekṣitāḥ /
analyzed: tava hi utpattau yena saṃyuktam iti pratipattayaḥ tāḥ ca sarvaiḥ kṛtārtha ca aviśeṣāt apekṣitāḥ
translated: For in the origination, that with which it is connected, and those are understood by all, and since there is no difference in the one who has accomplished his purpose, they are required.

original: yadyapi caitābhirdravyāṇi na prayocyante tathā 'pi dravyaireva tāsāṃ prayuktatvātsarvaviṣayatā nirṛtte 'pi ca pradhāne tadīyānāṃ satāmeṣāṃ kā pra tipattirbhavatvityapekṣite śakyaḥ pratipattiniyamo vidhātum /
analyzed: yadi api ca etābhiḥ dravyāṇi na prayocyante tathā dravyaiḥ eva tāsām prayukta tvāt sarva viṣaya tā nirṛtte ca pradhāne tadīyānām satām eṣām kā pratipattiḥ bhavatu iti apekṣite śakyaḥ pratipatti niyamaḥ vidhātum
translated: And although these do not employ the substances, still, since they are employed by the substances themselves, the universality is established. And even when the primary rite is accomplished, when their existence is required, the restriction of understanding is possible to be enjoined.

analyzed: liṅga darśanāt ca
translated: And because of the indication of the mark.

original: sakatma kṛditi sviṣṭakadravadānavopsā sarvebhyo 'vadāne saṃskārapakṣe vā 'vakalpate nānyathā /
analyzed: sakatma kṛt iti su iṣṭaka drava dāna vopsā sarvebhyaḥ vadāne saṃskāra pakṣe vā na anyathā
translated: The Svishtakrit offering of the substance sakṛt kṛt is possible for all in the case of refinement, or otherwise, in the case of taking out of all.

analyzed: prayojana sūtrāṇi ca etāni
translated: And these are the sūtras on the purpose.

original: yadi nāma śeṣakāryavaśena pūrvapakṣe 'dhya sarvapradānaṃ kiṃ bhavati tadā vicārasya prayojanamiti /
analyzed: yadi nāma śeṣa kārya vaśena pūrvapakṣe sarva pradānam kim bhavati tadā vicārasya prayojanam iti
translated: If, on the strength of the requirements of the subsidiary acts, all the offerings are to be made on the Parvas, then what is the use of the discussion?

original: tatra yaḥ pūrvamasmābhirabhihito 'rthastavaiva sūtraṃ yojyam /🔽pūrvapate havīṃṣi śeṣakāryāṇāmaprayojakānautyeka mātkriyeran /
analyzed: tatra yaḥ pūrvam asmābhiḥ abhihitaḥ rthaḥ tava eva sūtram yojyam  havīṃṣi śeṣa kāryāṇām aprayojakāni auti eka māt kriyeran
translated: In that case, the meaning that we have already stated should be connected with the Sūtra itself.🔽If the offerings are subsidiary to the requirements of the subsidiary acts, then they should be made on the Parvas, because of the single mention.

original: balāttvapahāraḥ pradhānebhyaḥ sakṛtkṛte samasta kṛta iti saṃskṛtatvānnānyato 'pi karttavyaḥ /
analyzed: balāt tu apahāraḥ pradhānebhyaḥ sakṛt kṛte samasta kṛte iti saṃskṛta tvāt na anyatas karttavyaḥ
translated: But the removal of the strength is done once for the principal acts, and when that is done, it is done for all, because it has been accomplished. Therefore, it should not be done again.

original: siddhānte tu sarvahaviṣāṃ prayojakatvāviśeṣātsarvebhyo liṅgadarśane ca paurṇamāsyadhikaraṇavatprayojane 'vasthitasiddhāntaṃ dyotayati /
analyzed: siddhānte tu sarva haviṣām prayojaka tva aviśeṣāt sarvebhyaḥ liṅga darśane ca paurṇamāsī adhikaraṇa vat prayojane vā sthita siddhāntam dyotayati
translated: But in the Siddhānta, because all the offerings are equally the cause, and because of the indication of the text, just as in the Pūrṇamāsī section, it shows the established conclusion in the cause.

analyzed: ekammāt ced yāthākāmya viśeṣāt
translated: If it is by the single mention, because of the option,

original: yāthākāmyamityasyaiva buddhisāmānādhikaraṇyena strovivakṣāyāṃ ṣigaurādibhyaśceti ṅauṣi kate halastadditasyeti vyaṅyakāre lupte yāthākāmo bhavati /tantravārtika /
analyzed: yāthākāmyam iti asya eva buddhi sāmānādhikaraṇyena strī vivakṣāyām ṣi gaura ādibhyaḥ ca iti ṅauṣi kate ha laḥ tad d itasya iti vyaṅ yakāre lupte yāthākāmaḥ bhavati tantravārtika
translated: If the word 'optionally' is intended to be construed with the word 'buddhi', then the affix 'na' is added by the rule 'naugauradibhyaśceti', and the affix 'au' is added by the rule 'halastaditasyai'ti'. When that is elided, it becomes 'yāthākāmam'.

analyzed: mukhyā āḍā pūrva kāla tvāt
translated: The principal is first, because of the prior time.

original: śeṣanimittakaṃ hi vihitāvaśyakarttavyatānimittaṃ ca śeṣakārya prathamasya tāvatpāṭhakramānusārātpūrvamāpatati /
analyzed: śeṣa nimittakam hi vihita avaśya karttavya tā nimittam ca śeṣa kārya prathamasya tāvat pāṭha krama anusārāt pūrvam āpatati
translated: For the purpose of the remainder is the purpose of what is to be done as a necessary duty enjoined, and the purpose of the remainder comes first, in accordance with the order of recitation.

original: na ca tadā kaścivirodha iti kriyate /
analyzed: na ca tadā kaścid virodhaḥ iti kriyate
translated: And then there is no contradiction, so it is done.

original: kate nivṛttavyāpārā codanā na nimittībhavatīti virodhādakāraṇam /
analyzed: kate nivṛtta vyāpārā codanā na nimittībhavati iti virodhāt akāraṇam
translated: And when the injunction has ceased to function, it does not become the cause, due to contradiction.

analyzed: bhakṣa a śravaṇāt dāna śabdaḥ parikraye
translated: The word 'gift' is for purchase, because no food is mentioned.

original: puroḍāśasya catukaraṇe idaṃ brahmaṇa ityādini deṃśaḥ śrūyate /🔽kathaṃ ca tattadbrahlādivyapadeśyaṃ bhavati yadi tebhyo dauyate tena dānaṃ vihitam /
analyzed: puroḍāśasya catu karaṇe idam brahmaṇaḥ ityādini śrūyate  katham ca tat tat brahla ādi vyapadeśyam bhavati yadi tebhyaḥ dauyate tena dānam vihitam
translated: In the four-handed offering of the cake, the distribution beginning with 'this to the Brahman' is heard.🔽And how can that be designated as belonging to the Brahman and so on, if it is given to them? Therefore the gift is enjoined.

original: tattu kimatvijāṃ yatheṣṭaviniyogārthaṃ parikrayāyāmnāyate atha bhacyamāṇaśeṣa pratipayarthamiti /
analyzed: tat tu kim atvijām yathā iṣṭa viniyoga artham parikrayāya āmnāyate atha bhacyamāṇa śeṣa pratipaya rtham iti
translated: But is that mentioned for the purpose of the free disposal of the priests, or for the purpose of receiving the remainder of what is being offered?

analyzed: parikraya artham iti āha
translated: He says it is for the purpose of purchase.

original: na hyava yajamānapañcamā iḍāṃ prāśnantautivat dravyaprādhānyaṃ bhakṣaṇaṃ vā śrūyate tasmād dravyāṇāṃ karmaśeṣatvātkarmayukto bhyaśca dānādantareṇāpi parikrayaśrutiṃ dakṣiṇādānavatpa rikrayārthamiti /
analyzed: na hi ava yajamāna pañcamāḥ iḍām prāśnanti iti vat dravya prādhānyam bhakṣaṇam vā śrūyate tasmāt dravyāṇām karma śeṣa tvāt karma yuktaḥ bhyaḥ ca dānāt antareṇa api parikraya śrutim dakṣiṇā dāna vat parikraya artham iti
translated: For we do not find any statement like 'the sacrificer and the priests, being five in number, eat the Idā', indicating the predominance of the substance or the eating. Therefore, since the substances are subsidiary to the ritual, and since the giving is connected with the ritual, even without a statement of purchase, the giving is for the purpose of purchase, like the giving of the sacrificial fee.

analyzed: tad saṃstavāt ca
translated: And because of their praise.

original: eṣā vai darśapūrṇāmāsayordakṣiṇeti dakṣiṇā ghṛtvijāvaira mutsāhakāriṇī parikrayasya caitadrūpam /
analyzed: eṣā vai darśa pūrṇāmāsayoḥ dakṣiṇā iti dakṣiṇā parikrayasya ca etat rūpam
translated: This is indeed the sacrificial fee for the new and full moon sacrifices. The sacrificial fee is what encourages the priests, and this is the form of purchase.

analyzed: bhakṣa arthaḥ vā dravye sama tvāt
translated: Or the substance is for the purpose of eating, because of equality.

analyzed: na ca eṣa vibhāga parikraya arthaḥ
translated: And this division is not for the purpose of purchase.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

original: parikrayo hi sarvatra svena dravyeṇa kalpate /
analyzed: parikrayaḥ hi sarvatra svena dravyeṇa kalpate
translated: For the purchase is accomplished everywhere with one's own substance.

original: devatārthe parityakte svāmitvaṃ na ca kasya cit🔽brahmādibhirbhāgānāmupakurvadbhirna kathaṃ ciṭ dṛṣṭamityuktaṃ vadeti dravyacapaṇasyāpekṣitasya dṛṣṭatvāt /
analyzed: devatā arthe parityakte svāmi tvam na ca kasya cid  brahma ādibhiḥ bhāgānām upakurvadbhiḥ na katham cit dṛṣṭam iti uktam vada iti dravya capaṇasya apekṣitasya dṛṣṭa tvāt
translated: When dedicated for the deity, no one has ownership.🔽It has been said that it is not seen that the shares of the Brahman and others, who are helping, are given. Because the purchase of the substance, which is required, is seen, it is said to be given.

original: bhāgaistu brahmādaunāmupakāra kairityanenāpi sutarāṃ parikraya āpadyate /
analyzed: bhāgaiḥ tu brahma ādaunām upakāra kaiḥ iti anena api sutarām parikrayaḥ āpadyate
translated: But even more, the purchase is implied by the statement that the shares of the Brahman and others are for the purpose of helping.

analyzed: na ca avaśyam bhakṣa gaṇena eva teṣām upakriyate gṛha ānayana ādinā pi upakāra upapatteḥ
translated: And it is not necessarily that they are treated by the group of foods, because it is possible to help them by bringing them into the house and so on.

analyzed: sarvatra ca dravya saṃskāra artha tām bhakṣasya vacyati
translated: And in all cases, the food is said to be for the purpose of purifying the substance.

analyzed: vrata ādibhiḥ nivṛtti anabhidhānāt
translated: Because it is not stated to be stopped by vows and so on.

analyzed: puruṣa saṃskārāḥ hi vrataiḥ nivarttaran
translated: For vows stop what is a purification of the person.

analyzed: tatas evam vaktavyam
translated: Therefore, it should be stated in this way.

original: satyaṃ bhāgānāṃ pratipattiḥ tathā 'pi tu prakṛtakaṭa niyamasya prayojanāpekṣāvelāyāṃ dṛṣṭaṃ satyadṛṣṭadaurbalyādṛṣṭa eva kartṝṇāṃ sāmarthyarūpa saṃskāraḥ kalpyate /
analyzed: satyam bhāgānām pratipattiḥ tathā tu prakṛta kaṭa niyamasya prayojana apekṣā velāyām dṛṣṭam satya dṛṣṭa daurbalya adṛṣṭe eva kartṝṇām sāmarthya rūpa saṃskāraḥ kalpyate
