translated: It is true that the parts are obtained, but even so, when the time comes for the seen and unseen to depend on the purpose of the rule of the original, only the unseen purification in the form of the ability of the performers is imagined due to the weakness of the seen.

analyzed: saṃskāraḥ ca sarva antaraṅgaḥ bhakṣaṇam nāma
translated: And the purification of the performer is the most internal part, called eating.

original: gṛhamapi ca nītvā yāvadbhakṣaṇaṃ na kriyate tāvattadanupayo gādanupakāraḥ /
analyzed: gṛham api ca nītvā yāvat bhakṣaṇam na kriyate tāvat tad anupayogāt anupakāraḥ
translated: And even after bringing it into the house, as long as it is not eaten, it is not helpful due to not being used.

analyzed: tena avaśyam su dūram api gatvā bhakṣaṇe paryavasitavyam
translated: Therefore, even if one goes a long way, one must end up eating.

original: tava prathamātikrame kāragābhāvādyogyatāvaśena ca vyādeśadvāraprakrāntabhakṣasamāpanasyāvaśyaṃ karttavyatvāt brahmādaunāmeva bhakṣaṇenopa karttavyamiti gamyate /
analyzed: tava prathama atikrame kāraga abhāvāt yogyatā vaśena ca vyādeśa dvāra prakrānta bhakṣa samāpanasya avaśyam karttavya tvāt brahma ādaunām eva bhakṣaṇena upa karttavyam iti gamyate
translated: And since, on the first transgression of yours, there is no reason for the performance, and since, by the force of eligibility, the completion of the eating begun by the declaration is necessarily to be done, it is understood that it is to be done by the eating of the Brahmins alone.

original: śeṣasthāpi ca capaṇāpekṣasya bhacagākṛtameva capaṇaṃ yogyatayā vidhāryate /
analyzed: śeṣasya api ca capaṇa apekṣasya bhacagā kṛtam eva capaṇam yogyatayā vidhāryate
translated: And in the case of the remainder also, the offering of the remainder, which depends on the eligibility, is restricted by eligibility itself.

analyzed: vyādeśāt dāna saṃstutiḥ
translated: The praise of the gift is from the declaration.

original: dakṣiṇeti prāsaṅgikopakārāpekṣayā brahmaṇa ityādinirdeśa sārūpyādā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: dakṣiṇā iti prāsaṅgika upakāra apekṣayā brahmaṇaḥ ityādi nirdeśa bhaviṣyati
translated: In dakṣiṇā, the reference to the incidental benefit is to the Brahmin, etc., as indicated by the similarity of the statement.

analyzed: tasmāt ic arthaḥ iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that this is a teaching for that purpose.

original: iti śrībhaṭṭakumārilakhāmiviracite maumāṃsātanvavārttike tṛtīyasyādhyāyasya caturthaścaraṇaḥ samāptimagamat /
analyzed: iti śrī bhaṭṭa kumārila khāmi viracite maumāṃsā tanva vārttike tṛtīyasya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ caraṇaḥ samāptim agamat
translated: Thus ends the fourth quarter of the third chapter of the Mīmāṃsātattvasaṃkṣepa composed by the revered Bhaṭṭa Kumārila.

analyzed: tantravārtike
translated: In the Tantra-vārttika.

analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya pañcamaḥ pāda
translated: The fifth quarter of the third chapter.

analyzed: śrī gaṇeśāya namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the illustrious Gaṇeśa.

analyzed: ājyāt ca sarva saṃyogāt
translated: And from the clarified butter, because of the connection with all,

analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ vā kāraṇa aviśeṣāt iti asya ati prasaktasya apavādaḥ kriyate
translated: or to all, because there is no difference in the reason - this exception is made to what is too widely applicable.

analyzed: tam eva tāvat pūrvam pakṣam smārayati
translated: He recalls that very former view.

original: tathā ca sarvebhyo havirbhya ityanuvāda upapadyate /
analyzed: tathā ca sarvebhyaḥ havirbhyaḥ iti anuvādaḥ upapadyate
translated: And thus the restatement from all oblations is appropriate.

analyzed: niḥśeṣa havi viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because it refers to all oblations without exception.

analyzed: kāraṇāt ca
translated: And because of the reason.

original: purākalpe ca yatkāraṇaṃ sviṣṭakṛdarthe 'vadāne saṃkorttitaṃ tadājye 'pyaviśiṣṭaṃ yaddevebhyo havirasau vahati tasya tena bhāgaḥ prārthitaḥ /
analyzed: purākalpe ca yat kāraṇam sviṣṭakṛt arthe vadāne saṃkorttitam tat ājye pi a viśiṣṭam yat devebhyaḥ haviḥ asau vahati tasya tena bhāgaḥ prārthitaḥ
translated: And the reason that was stated in the ancient ritual for the taking for the Sviṣṭakṛt is the same for the clarified butter, namely that it is a share of that oblation which is carried to the gods by that (clarified butter).

analyzed: ājyam api ca upāṃśuyāja devatābhyaḥ tena avaśyam voṭavyam
translated: And the clarified butter must also be taken for the deities of the Upāṃśuyāja.

analyzed: atas ca bhāgena bhavitavyam
translated: And therefore it must be a share of that also.

analyzed: ekasmin samavatta śabdāt
translated: In one, because of the word equal share.

analyzed: ekasmin iti kasmiṃścid karmaṇā iti arthaḥ
translated: In one means in some ritual.

original: athavā yuṣmadabhiprāyeṇa ekasminhaviṣi viṣṭakṛtyavadīyamāne sati samavattaśabdo 'nyasahitādavadīyamānavacano nāvaka 'atiprasaktasye'ti ga pustake nāsti /tantravārtike /
analyzed: athavā yuṣmad abhiprāyeṇa ekasmin haviṣi viṣṭakṛti avadīyamāne sati samavatta śabdaḥ ati prasaktasya iti ga pustake na asti tantravārtike
translated: Or, according to your opinion, when the Sviṣṭakṛt is being taken from one oblation, the word equal share refers to what is being taken from what is mixed with something else, not to what is excessively extended.

analyzed: lpeta mad pace tu ājyam api tatra avadīyate eti avakalpiṣyate
translated: But in my view, the clarified butter will also be taken from that.

analyzed: kka punar idam śrūyate tat abhidhīyate
translated: And where is this heard? That is being stated.

original: ādityaḥ prāyaṇīya payasi carurityeko yāgaśvoditaḥ punastatraivoktam /
analyzed: ādityaḥ prāyaṇīya payasi caruḥ iti ekaḥ punar tatra eva uktam
translated: One says that the cake in the Prayaniya (first) milk-offering is a sacrifice, and again it is said there itself:

original: ā jyasyainaṃ carumabhipūryājyamāgāḥ pathyādayaścatasro devatā yaṣṭavyā te ca dravyasāmānyādapāṃśuyājavikārāścatvāro 'pi yāgā ādityacakarāgneyavikāraḥ tatrāgnaye viṣṭakṛte samavadyatauti śrūyate /
analyzed: ā jyasya enam carum abhipūrya ājyam āgāḥ pathyā ādayaḥ catasraḥ devatāḥ yaṣṭavyā te ca dravya sāmānyāt apāṃśuyāja vikārāḥ catvāraḥ api yāgāḥ āditya cakara āgneya vikāraḥ tatra agnaye viṣṭakṛte samavadyatau iti śrūyate
translated: Having filled the cake with ghee, one should offer the ghee and the four deities beginning with Pathi. They are also four sacrifices, modifications of the Apsu-yaja, due to the common substance. The cake is a modification of the fire-offering to Aditya. There it is heard: 'One should cut from the cake for Agni-Viṣṭakṛt.'

analyzed: tat yadi caroḥ eka stha atideśena viṣṭakṛtmā prastatovadyati iti eva syāt
translated: If it were only to be cut from the cake by the transference of the one place, then it would be as stated.

original: yadā tu prakṛtādājyādapyupāṃśuyājadravyāt viṣṭakṛttadā vāpi ya ṣṭavya ityubhayoścarvāccayoravadāne samavattaśabdaḥ samarthito bhavati /
analyzed: yadā tu prakṛtāt ājyāt api upāṃśuyāja dravyāt viṣṭakṛt tadā vā api yaḥ ṣṭavyaḥ iti ubhayoḥ carva āccayoḥ avadāne samavatta śabdaḥ samarthitaḥ bhavati
translated: But when it is to be offered to Viṣṭakṛt even when cut from the ghee of the original Apsu-yaja, then the word 'samāvadyet' (should cut) becomes justified for both the cake and the ghee.

analyzed: tasmāt api santi ājye śeṣa kāryāṇi iti
translated: Therefore, there are subsidiary rites even in the ghee.

analyzed: ājye ca darśanāt sviṭakkat arthavādasya
translated: And because of the seen statement of the purpose in the ghee.

original: avadāyāvadāya dhutrāṃ pratyabhiṣārayati sviṣṭakṛte'vadāya na pratyabhivārayatīti dhruvāta evāvadāyeti pratiśabdāt dṛṣṭārthatvāccāvagamyate /
analyzed: avadāya avadāya dhutrām pratyabhiṣārayati sviṣṭakṛtā iva dāya na pratyabhivārayati iti dhruvātaḥ eva avadāya iti pratiśabdāt dṛṣṭārtha tvāt ca avagamyate
translated: Having cut from the Dhruva vessel, he offers to the Sviṣṭakṛt. Having cut from the Apsu-yaja, he does not offer back. From the Dhruva vessel itself he cuts. This is understood from the word 'prati' (back) and from the seen purpose.

original: yadapi sviṣṭakṛte vidīyate tadapi dhruvāta eva yena tadarthe 'vatte dhruvāyā pratyabhighāraṇaṃ pratiṣidhyate /
analyzed: yat api sviṣṭakṛte vidīyate tat api dhruvātaḥ eva yena tad arthe vatte dhruvāyāḥ pratyabhighāraṇam pratiṣidhyate
translated: And what is offered to the Sviṣṭakṛt is also from the Dhruvā, since it is offered for that purpose, and the re-sprinkling of the Dhruvā is prohibited.

original: na hi tataḥ parāmāhutimitihetuvacanātpūrvāṇi pratyabhidhāraṇāni sviṣṭakṛdarthānīti darśayati /
analyzed: na hi tatas parām āhutim iti hetu vacanāt pūrvāṇi pratyabhidhāraṇāni sviṣṭakṛt arthāni iti darśayati
translated: For the reason that it is said not from that for another offering, it shows that the previous re-sprinklings are for the purpose of the Sviṣṭakṛt.

original: tataśca tatmāmānyāditareṣu tathātvamiti sarvaiḥ śeṣa kāryairbhavitavyam /
analyzed: tatas ca tad māmānyāt itareṣu tathātvam iti sarvaiḥ śeṣa kāryaiḥ bhavitavyam
translated: And from that, by analogy, it is so in the others. Therefore all the remaining actions should be performed.

analyzed: aśeṣa tvāt ta na evam syāt sarvāṃṭānāt aśeṣa tā
translated: It would not be so because of the non-remnant, all remnants are non-remnants.

original: sati pradhānadravyaśeṣe śeṣakāryāṇi kriyante na copāṃśutṛtīyā dhyāyasya pañcamaḥ pāda /🔽yājahaviḥśeṣo vidyate sarvādānāt /
analyzed: sati pradhāna dravya śeṣe śeṣa kāryāṇi kriyante na ca upāṃśu tṛtīyā dhyāyasya pañcamaḥ pāda  yāja haviḥ śeṣaḥ vidyate sarva ādānāt
translated: The remaining actions are performed when there is a remnant of the principal substance, and there is no remnant of the Upāṃśu offering, because all of it is taken.

analyzed: katham sarva ādānam iti ced
translated: How is it that all is taken?

analyzed: tat uttara sūtreṇa āha
translated: If it is asked how all is taken, it is stated in the next sūtra.

analyzed: sādhāraṇyāt na dhruvāyām syāt
translated: It should not be in the Dhruvā because of the commonality.

analyzed: dhuvāyām tāvat na upāṃśuyājasya śeṣaḥ vidyate
translated: To begin with, there is no remnant of the Upāṃśu offering in the Dhruvā.

original: dhauvasthāsaṃyuktotpatteḥ sarvājyakāryārthamādānātsarvamai vā etad yajñāya gṛhyata iti vākyāt /
analyzed: dhauva sthā saṃyukta utpatteḥ sarva ājya kārya artham ādānāt sarvamai vai etat yajñāya gṛhyate iti vākyāt
translated: Because of the origination connected with the Dhruvā, and because of the taking for the purpose of all the actions with the entire clarified butter, and because of the statement all this is taken for the sacrifice.

analyzed: taittirīyāṇām tu katipaya upastaraṇa abhighāraṇa ādi kārya anukramaṇāt
translated: But for the Taittirīyas, the sequence of actions such as spreading ghee, pouring ghee, etc. is mentioned.

original: tanmadhye copāṃśuyājasyāpi saṃkīrttanāt tāvatāṃ sādhāraṇamupastugāntrabhighārayantrājyasya yajanniti vākyāgamyate /
analyzed: tad madhye ca upāṃśuyājasya api saṃkīrttanāt tāvatām sādhāraṇam upastugān abhighārayan ājyasya yajan iti vākyā āgamyate
translated: And since the Upāṃśuyāja is also mentioned in the middle of that, it is understood from the sentence They spread ghee over the Upāṃśu cup, they offer the ghee that it is common to all of them.

analyzed: sādhāragoṣu ca pariṣadana upahāra goṣṭhaubhojana ādiṣu iyam sthitiḥ
translated: And this is the rule in common rites such as the Pariṣad, Upahārad, Gosthya, Bhojana, etc.

analyzed: yat ekasya bhāge payātite tāvanmātram eva tasya
translated: That when one part is not finished, it is only that much for him.

original: a vaśiṣṭaṃ tu tatsamānabhājāmavadhāryamāṇaṃ na pūrvaśeṣa ityevamakṛtārthatvena na pratipattimapekṣate /
analyzed: a vaśiṣṭam tu tad samāna bhājām avadhāryamāṇam na pūrva śeṣaḥ iti evam akṛtārtha tvena na pratipattim apekṣate
translated: But what remains is determined for those who have equal shares, and it is not a remainder of the previous. Thus, being incomplete, it does not require completion.

original: yadā tu sarvaiḥ samānabhāgbhiryathāyoga muratā bhāgā bhavanti tadā tasya sādhāraṇyānuguṇaiva pratipattyapekṣā bhavati /
analyzed: yadā tu sarvaiḥ samāna bhāgbhiḥ yathāyoga muratāḥ bhāgāḥ bhavanti tadā tasya sādhāraṇya anuguṇā eva pratipatti apekṣā bhavati
translated: But when all the shares are taken according to their respective rights, then the requirement for completion is in accordance with the commonality.

original: tadihopāṃśayājārthe bhāge upanaute na kaścidapi tadīyaḥ śeṣo vidyate śiṣṭasya parastā dvāvyuparastaraṇābhighāraṇādigṛhītatvenākṛtārthatvāt /
analyzed: tat iha upāṃśu yāja arthe bhāge upanaute na kaścid api tadīyaḥ śeṣaḥ vidyate śiṣṭasya parastā
translated: Here, when the share for the Upāṃśuyāja is taken, there is not even a remainder of it, because what remains is not completed by being taken for the spreading, pouring, etc. that come after it.

original: kṛtārthapratipattayaśca śeṣakāryāṇi na svayamevākṛtaprayojanamapi dravyaṃ prayuñjate /
analyzed: kṛtārtha pratipattayaḥ ca śeṣa kāryāṇi na svayam eva akṛta prayojanam api dravyam prayuñjate
translated: And those who have accomplished their purpose do not themselves employ a substance that has not served its purpose, even though it remains.

original: tasmānna dhruvāyāṃ śeṣo'sti /🔽yastu samastakāryani ṭacyuttarakālaṃ sādhāraṇaḥ śeṣo bhaviṣyati tasya samiṣṭayajurākhyaṃ pratipattyantaramāmnātam /
analyzed: tasmāt na dhruvāyām śeṣaḥ usti  yaḥ tu ṭaci uttarakālam sādhāraṇaḥ śeṣaḥ bhaviṣyati tasya samiṣṭa yajuḥ ākhyam pratipatti antaram āmnātam
translated: Therefore, there is no remainder in the Dhruva vessel.🔽But that which will be a common remainder after the completion of all actions, for that another means of disposal called Samishtayajus is prescribed.

original: yadī tvidamapyupastaragādivadevārthakarmāvadhāryate tadā sutarāṃ śeṣābhāvaḥ / śakyaṃ tu taittirīyavākyāpekṣayotpattāvanyasaṃyogāt samiṣṭayajuṣaśca juhoticoditatvenāyajñatvā vyatipattitvamavadhārayitum /
analyzed: yadī tu idam api upastaraka ādi vat eva artha karma avadhāryate tadā sutarām śeṣa abhāvaḥ śakyam tu taittirīya vākya apekṣayā utpattau anya saṃyogāt samiṣṭa yajuṣaḥ ca juhoti codita tvena ayajña tvā vyatipatti tvam avadhārayitum
translated: But if this is determined to be a mere act for the sake of an object like the spreading of grass, then the absence of remainder is all the more certain. However, in relation to the Taittiriya text, it is possible to determine that the Samishtayajus is not a sacrifice because it is enjoined by the word 'juhoti' due to its connection with something else in the origination.

analyzed: niḥśeṣa tvena ca asau avasthitā iti śeṣa kārya antarāṇi bādhate
translated: And since it is established as being without remainder, it supersedes the other actions to be done with the remainder.

analyzed: tasmāt dhruvāyām tāvat na usti śeṣaḥ
translated: Therefore, there is no remainder in the Dhruva vessel.

analyzed: avatta tvāt tu juhām tasya ca homa saṃyogāt
translated: But because it has been measured out and because it is connected with the offering,

original: tatraitasyāt yatkevalopāṃśuyājārthe juhvāmavattaṃ tasyaiva grahavamaseṣviva somasya śeṣo bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: tatra yat kevala upāṃśuyāja arthe juhvām avattam tasya eva graha vamaseṣu iva somasya śeṣaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: in that case, it will be a remainder of that which has been measured out in the Juhu for the Upamshuyaja alone, just as in the case of Soma in the Grahas and Vasatkarana.

analyzed: tat anupapannam
translated: That is not correct.

analyzed: kutas
translated: Why?

analyzed: tasya samastasya catur avattam juhoti iti homa saṃyogāt
translated: And because of the connection with the Homa, as stated in 'He offers the four Avadânas of all that'.

original: uktaṃ hyetadupadhānārthaṃ caro nānyatra śrutama nyava viniyoktavyamiti /
analyzed: uktam hi etat upadhāna artham caraḥ na anyatra viniyoktavyam iti
translated: For this has been said: 'The Avadâna is for the purpose of the Upasthâna, and what is not enjoined elsewhere cannot be employed for another purpose.'

analyzed: tasmāt na juhvām śeṣaḥ upapadyate
translated: Therefore the Remnant cannot be used in the Juhû.

analyzed: camasa vat iti ced
translated: If it be said that it is like the Chamasas.

original: atha yaduktaṃ camasavat satyapi homasaṃyoge śeṣobhaviṣyatīti tatpariharttavyam /
analyzed: atha yat uktam camasa vat sati api homa saṃyoge śeṣaḥ bhaviṣyati iti tat pariharttavyam
translated: Now what has been said, that even with the connection with Homa, there will be a Remnant, like the Chamasas, that must be refuted.

analyzed: na codanā virodhāt iviḥ prakalpanā ca
translated: Because of the contradiction with the injunction, and because of the assumption of something else.

original: naitatsomena tulyaṃ tatra hi grahacamaseṣu haviprakalpanamātre kṛte yathā na sarvahomastathā some vacanāmaco na vidyata ityatrādhikaraṇe vacyāmaḥ /
analyzed: na etat somena tulyam tatra hi graha camaseṣu havi prakalpana mātre kṛte yathā na sarva homaḥ tathā some na vidyate iti atra adhikaraṇe vacyāmaḥ
translated: This is not the same as in the case of Soma. For there, when the mere preparation of the oblation in the Grahas and Chamasas has been done, not all the Homas are performed, just as in the case of Soma, because of the absence of the injunction. We shall explain this in the section on 'na vidyate'.

original: tena codanāvirodhaṃ tatva vakṣyamāṇaṃ pariharatāṃ na sarvahomo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tena codanā virodham vakṣyamāṇam pariharatām na sarva homaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And by those who avoid the contradiction with the injunction by that, not all the Homas will be performed.

original: śe avattatvāśceti ka ga pu pā /
analyzed: śe avatta tvāḥ ca iti ka ga pu pā
translated: And because of the Avadâna-ness.

original: ṣakāryānyārthadarśanaṃ ca momasyāgne vohotyanuvaṣaṭkarotī tyādi sarvataḥparihāramāśvinaṃ bhakṣayatītyādicamasasamākhyā ca na virokhyate /
analyzed: ṣakāryā anya artha darśanam ca mā omasya agne vohoti anuvaṣaṭkaroti ityādi sarvatas parihāram āśvinam bhakṣayati ityādi camasa samākhyā ca na virokhyate
translated: And the seeing of the Homa for another purpose, such as 'He offers to Agni', 'He pronounces Vashat', etc., and the designation of the Chamasas as 'âshvina', etc., are not contradicted.

analyzed: anyathā syāt
translated: Otherwise, there would be contradiction with that.

original: atha vā na tavāsamastahome sati kā ciccodanā viru dhyata ityāvirodhādasarvahīmaḥ /
analyzed: atha vā na tava asamasta home sati kā cit codanā viru dhyate iti ā avirodhāt asarvahīmaḥ
translated: Or, if you do not have a complete offering, there is no contradiction with any injunction, so there is no offering without everything.

original: iha tu virodhaḥ syādayameva cāvirodhā heturiti sūtragamanikā /
analyzed: iha tu virodhaḥ syāt ayam eva ca avirodhāḥ hetuḥ iti sūtra gamanikā
translated: But here there would be contradiction, and this itself is the reason for non-contradiction, so the sutra is explained.

original: yathā tu bhāṣyakāreṇa pūrvaṃ camasamanudāhṛtya camasavaditicediti sūtramupanyastaṃ tathā paricodanāsūtrameva homasaṃyoga naikāntikatrapradarśanārthaṃ kalpayitvā parihāro vaktavyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā tu bhāṣyakāreṇa pūrvam camasam an udāhṛtya camasa vat iti ced iti sūtram upanyastam tathā paricodanā sūtram eva kalpayitvā parihāraḥ vaktavyaḥ
translated: However, just as the commentator previously quoted the Chamasa and presented the sutra as if it were the Chamasa, so the objection sutra itself should be imagined for the purpose of showing the non-exclusiveness of the connection with the offering, and the answer should be stated.

original: tatra vacanāntarakṛtatvāccheṣa syādava vacanāntararahitatve sa tauti viśiṣṭasya hetoravyabhicārāt /
analyzed: tatra vacana antara kṛta tvāt śeṣaḥ vacana antara rahita tve sa tauti viśiṣṭasya hetoḥ avyabhicārāt
translated: There, because it is done by another statement, it would be a remainder, but if it is devoid of another statement, then the non-deviation of the qualified reason is stated.

original: atha vā 'vattatvātta juhvāmityetadeva tuśabdasyāne caśabdaṃ kṛtvā pūrvapa cavādipratyavasthānaṃ vyācacāṇaiścamaso dṛṣṭānto dātavyaḥ paraṃ vā 'nubhāṣaṇasūtraṃ vaktavyam /
analyzed: atha vā juhvām iti etat eva tuśabdasya āne caśabdam kṛtvā vyācacāṇaiḥ camasaḥ dṛṣṭāntaḥ dātavyaḥ param vā nubhāṣaṇa sūtram vaktavyam
translated: Or, this very statement because of being measured, it is in the juhu should be taken as having the word tu as a word cha, and the objection of the opponent should be explained, and the example of the chamasa should be given, or the sutra of repeating the opponent's view should be stated.

analyzed: etat uktam bhavati
translated: This is what is said.

analyzed: a vatta tvāt tu juhvām camasa vat śeṣaḥ stu
translated: But because of being measured, let it be a remainder in the juhu, like the chamasa.

analyzed: tasya uttaram tasya ca homa saṃyogāt iti gata artham
translated: The answer to that is that it has already been explained that it is connected with the Homa because of its connection with the Homa.

analyzed: utpanna adhikārāt sati sarva vacanam
translated: The statement of all is due to the authority of what has arisen.

original: yastu sarvebhya iti prātyapekṣo 'nuvādastava yādṛrśa vayamiha sarvatvaṃ paśyāmaḥ tādṛśasyaivānuvāda iti manyāmahe /
analyzed: yaḥ tu sarvebhyaḥ iti vayam iha sarva tvam paśyāmaḥ tādṛśasya eva anuvādaḥ iti manyāmahe
translated: But if you think that the statement to all is a restatement dependent on each, we think that it is a restatement of only what we see as all here.

original: sarvacaiva ca paramasarveṇa vyavahārābhāvādadhikṛtāpekṣaḥ sarvaśabdo gṛhyata iti na virodhaḥ /
analyzed: ca paramasarveṇa vyavahāra abhāvāt adhikṛta apekṣaḥ sarva śabdaḥ gṛhyate iti na virodhaḥ
translated: And since there is no usage of the highest all with all, the word all is taken as dependent on the authorized. Thus there is no contradiction.

original: tena yeṣāṃ śeṣamabhāvena pratipattikāryādhikāro 'sti ye vā vidyamānatvena prakṛtaśeṣāḥ tebhyaḥ sarvebhya iti gamyate tantravārtika /
analyzed: tena yeṣām śeṣam abhāvena pratipatti kārya adhikāraḥ sti ye vā vidyamāna tvena prakṛta śeṣāḥ tebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ iti gamyate tantravārtika
translated: Therefore, it is understood that it is from all those for whom there is authority for the performance of the remainder by non-existence, or those who are the remaining subjects by existence.

analyzed: jāti viśeṣāt param
translated: Due to the particular caste, after that.

original: pūrvavadeva samavadyateḥ anuvādatvādyathāsaṃbhavamā jye 'pauti carāvavadīyamāne saumyāttadavayavasyācikaurṣitamapyavadānaṃ balāivati /
analyzed: pūrvavat eva samavadyateḥ anuvāda tvāt yathāsaṃbhavam ā jye pauti carau avadīyamāne saumyāt tad avayavasya ācikaurṣitam api avadānam balāivati
translated: As before, due to being a restatement of the equal division, as far as possible, when the animal is divided, even the portion of the Soma, which is desired to be cut, is cut by force.

analyzed: tat etat saṃsṛṣṭa dravya jāti hayam apekṣya saṃśabdaḥ nuvādaḥ
translated: This word sam is a restatement with respect to this, which is dependent on the mixture of substances and castes.

analyzed: antyam areka artham
translated: The last is for the sake of the word are.

original: antya yattu kāraṇaṃ sviṣṭakadartho 'rthavāda ityukta ta dammatpace 'pyupapadyataevārakārthatvāt /
analyzed: antya yat tu kāraṇam su iṣṭa kadarthaḥ rthavādaḥ iti ukta tad dammat pace pi upapadyate eva ārakārtha tvāt
translated: As for the final reason, it has been said that the purpose of the Sviṣṭakṛt is the explanatory passage, and that is indeed possible in the case of the Amāvasyā sacrifice also, because of the meaning of the word 'ar'.

original: sviṣṭakṛte 'vadāyeti tāvadyatastamyāvadānaṃ bhavati yādṛśaṃ vā saṃbhavati tādṛśamiti gamyate /
analyzed: sviṣṭakṛte vadāya iti tāvat yatas tamyā avadānam bhavati yādṛśam vā saṃbhavati tādṛśam iti gamyate
translated: As for 'having offered to the Sviṣṭakṛt', it is understood that the offering is made from whatever is available, or in whatever form it is possible.

analyzed: puroḍāśa ādibhyaḥ ca tasya avadānam dhruvātaḥ ca upastaraṇa abhighāraṇe
translated: And the offering is made from the cake etc., and from the Dhruva vessel, with the sprinkling and pouring.

analyzed: na caturghi antena dhauvam eva avadānam saṃbadhyate
translated: And the offering is not connected only with the Dhruva vessel ending with the four-cornered one.

original: sā hi devatārthadravyāntarāvadāne'pyupastaraṇābhighāraṇopayogitvātpratyabhidhāraṇamapecataeva tena prāka sviṣṭakataḥ parastādapi dhauvopayogo 'stautyavatte avatte pratipūrayitvā tataḥ paraṃ tu na kiṃ citkāryamiti nārthaḥ pratipurona /
analyzed: sā hi devatā artha dravya antara avadāne ipi upastaraṇa abhighāraṇa upayogi tvāt pratyabhidhāraṇam apecate eva tena prāk su iṣṭakataḥ parastāt api stauti avatte avatte pratipūrayitvā tatas param tu na kim cit kāryam iti na arthaḥ
translated: For that (offering) requires the sprinkling back, because it is useful for the sprinkling and pouring even in the case of an offering from another substance for the sake of the deity. Therefore, the use of the Dhruva vessel is before and after the Sviṣṭakṛt offering. Having filled in the portions that have been offered, there is nothing else to be done after that, so there is no purpose in the individual cake offerings.

analyzed: na hi etat pratipūraṇam pūrva sthā vadānasya saṃskārakam adṛṣṭa artha tva prasaṅgāt
translated: For this filling in is not a consecration of the previously placed offering, because that would lead to the undesirable consequence that it would serve an unseen purpose.

analyzed: arekaḥ tu uttara kārya arthaḥ pratyakṣaḥ tanmāt antareṇa api tad avadhika areka artha tvena upapannaḥ ṛthavādaḥ
translated: But the one without a wife is for the purpose of a subsequent rite. It is directly perceived. Therefore, even without the purpose of the Sviṣṭakṛt, it is appropriate as a praise, with the meaning of being limited to that.

analyzed: sākaṃprasthāyye sviṣṭakkṛt iḍam ca tadvat
translated: In the Sākṃprāsthāyy, the Sviṣṭakṛt ladle is the same.

original: 'yathā sambhavamartho 'pī'ti ka ga pu pā /🔽tadavayavasyā'nusyūtasyācikīrpitamiti ka pu pā ceti ka ga pustakayornāsti /
analyzed: yathā  tad avayavasya anusyūtasya acikīrpitam iti ka pu pā ca iti ka ga pustakayoḥ na asti
translated: As possible, the meaning also. K Ga Pu Pa.🔽It is not mentioned of the continuous part that is not declared. K Pu Pa. It is not found in both K and Ga manuscripts.

original: amāvāsyāyāṃ nityaṃ sviṣṭakadiḍaṃ sāntrāyyādavadīyate taha / gavikāraśca sākaṃprasthāyyaḥ śrata ihāpyavadātavyamityetāvatā viśeṣegātulyāśaṅkāyāmatideśaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: amāvāsyāyām nityam su iṣṭakat iḍam sāntrāyyāt avadīyate gavikāraḥ ca sākaṃprasthāyyaḥ śrataḥ iha api avadātavyam iti etāvatā viśeṣegā atulya āśaṅkāyām atideśaḥ kriyate
translated: On the new moon day, the Sviṣṭakṛt ladle is always taken from the Sāntarāyā. And the Sākṃprāsthāyy is a modification of that. Here also it should be taken. With just this much difference, the extension is made due to the doubt being the same.

analyzed: tahat eva aśeṣa tvāt na evam syāt mavaṃdānāt aśeṣa tā iti
translated: It would not be so because of the entirety in the same way. The entirety is due to the offering of homage.

original: evaṃ hyatra savaṃdānaṃ homāyeṃ prasarpataḥ saha kumbhaubhiriti anavattasyaiva dohasya kumbhībhyāṃ saheti vidadhadaśeṣahomaṃ vidadhāti ato na śakyaṃ kiṃ ciccheṣayitum /
analyzed: evam hi atra prasarpataḥ saha kumbhaubhiḥ iti an avattasya eva dohasya kumbhībhyām saha iti vidadhat aśeṣa homam vidadhāti atas na śakyam kim cit śeṣayitum
translated: For thus, here in the offering of homage, when they proceed together with the two pots, by enjoining the milking of only the unmilked cow together with the two pots, he enjoins the offering of the remainder. Therefore, nothing can be left as remainder.

analyzed: sautrāmaṇyām ca graheṣu
translated: And in the Sautrāmaṇī, in the cups.

analyzed: tahat iti varttate
translated: That is the same continues.

original: sautrāmaṇyāṃ surāgrahā payograhāścāśvinādaya ātrātāsteṣāṃ pṛthakprakalpanamātrātmakatvāt camasavatsarvahomaprāptirnāstīti viśeṣāśaṅkāyāmatideśāttatrāpi yathāgṛhītānāṃ homārthenādānena saṃbandho yathopāttānāṃ ca homena thūyate /
analyzed: sautrāmaṇyām surā grahā payaḥ grahāḥ ca aśvin ādayaḥ ātrātāḥ teṣām pṛthak prakalpana mātra ātmaka tvāt camasa vat sarva homa prāptiḥ na asti iti viśeṣa āśaṅkāyām atideśāt tatra api yathā gṛhītānām homa arthena ādānena saṃbandhaḥ yathā upāttānām ca homena thūyate
translated: In the Sautrāmaṇī sacrifice, the Soma cups and the cups for the Aśvins and others are protected. Since their protection consists merely in their separate arrangement, as in the case of the goblets, there is no obtaining of all the oblations. When there is doubt about a special rule, by extension, even there, the connection of those taken as grasped is with the offering for the sake of the oblation, and those as taken are enjoined by the oblation.

original: yathāgṛhotān grahāndatvija upādadate uttare 'gnau payograhān juhati dakṣiṇe surāgrahāniti /
analyzed: yathā gṛhe utān grahān datvijaḥ upādadate uttare gnau payaḥ grahān juhati dakṣiṇe surā grahān iti
translated: The priests take up the cups as grasped, they offer the cups for the Aśvins and others in the northern fire, and the Soma cups in the southern fire.

analyzed: tada c ca śeṣa vacanam
translated: And this is a supplementary statement.

original: ananyaśeṣabhūtaśca pratiṣedho 'nuvāda ucchinaṣṭi na sarvaṃ juhotīti /
analyzed: an anya śeṣa bhūtaḥ ca pratiṣedhaḥ nuvādaḥ ucchinaṣṭi na sarvam juhoti iti
translated: And the prohibition, which is not a mere reiteration, is cut off, as in one should not offer everything.

original: ucchinaṣṭauti vidhiḥ tadanuvādastu niṣedhaḥ aśeṣahomaprātyā śeṣakāryanittiṃ darśayati /
analyzed: ucchinaṣṭau iti vidhiḥ tad anuvādaḥ tu niṣedhaḥ aśeṣa homa prātyā śeṣa kārya nittim darśayati
translated: One should cut off is the injunction, but the prohibition is a mere reiteration. It shows the necessity of the remaining rite by the implication of the offering of all.

original: vācanikasya ca śeṣasya pratipattyantaramarthakarma vā 'nyadastīti tato 'pīti viṣṭakṛdiḍaṃ ma karttavyamiti /
analyzed: vācanikasya ca śeṣasya pratipatti antaram artha karma vā pi iti viṣṭakṛt iḍam ma karttavyam iti
translated: And since there is another means of knowing or an object-act for the remaining part mentioned in the text, therefore the cutting of the Idā is not to be done.

analyzed: dravya eka tve karma bhedāt pratikarma kriyeran
translated: When there is oneness of substance, they should be performed for each rite due to the difference of rites.

analyzed: tantravārtika
translated: Tantra-Vartika.

analyzed: idānom śeṣa kāryeṣu
translated: Now, in the remaining rites, the remaining details are considered.

original: tatra sarvaṣṭaṣṭhā yāmanyonyanirapekṣa caturthyanta parikalpitaiḥ ṣaḍirgagobhinnadravyadevatāsaṃgho gairdevatāntarāvaruḍayāge devatāntarāsaṃbhavāt guṇena bhedakena ṣaṭa karmāṇi /
analyzed: tatra yām anyonya nirapekṣa caturthī anta parikalpitaiḥ ṣaḍiḥ ga go bhinna dravya devatā saṃghaḥ gaiḥ devatā antara avaruḍa yāge devatā antara asaṃbhavāt guṇena bhedakena ṣaṭ karmāṇi
translated: There, the most important is the group of six deities, which are different substances, independent of each other, ending in the fourth case, imagined with the six deities. In the sacrifice where one deity is included, another deity is not possible, so the six rites are distinguished by the quality.

original: teṣu keṣāṃ cihninnānyeva harvauṣi anyeṣāṃ punareka eva rathacakramātra puroḍāśa nātaḥ /
analyzed: teṣu keṣām cit ninnāni eva anyeṣām punar ekaḥ eva ratha cakra mātra puroḍāśa na atas
translated: Among them, for some the oblations are different, for others there is only one cake the size of a chariot wheel.

original: sa yadāṅgīkriyate tadā vicāra kiṃ karmabhedāccheṣakāryāṇāṃ bheda uta dravyaikatvāttanvamiti /
analyzed: sa yadā aṅgīkriyate tadā vicāra kim karma bhedāt śeṣa kāryāṇām bhedaḥ uta dravya ekatvāt tanvam iti
translated: When that is accepted, there is a consideration: is there a difference in the remaining rites due to the difference in the rites, or is there no difference due to the oneness of the substance?

analyzed: nanu ca ekādaśa vicāraḥ yam tatra nirṇeṣyate
translated: But this is the eleventh consideration, which will be determined there.

original: ekadravye saṃskārāṇāṃ vyākhyātamekakarmalamityatrāta iha na vicāraṇīyam /
analyzed: eka dravye saṃskārāṇām vyākhyātam eka karmalam iti atra atas iha na vicāraṇīyam
translated: In the case of one substance, the modification of the rites has been explained as one rite, so it is not to be considered here.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: pratipādyam idam dravyam bhedena sahate kriyām
translated: This substance can bear the action with difference.

analyzed: khaṇḍaśas ca pradhānānām aṅga tvāt na asti tantra tā
translated: And the primary rites are in parts, so there is no connection due to being subsidiary.

analyzed: karma saṃskāra pakṣe hayamāna saṃskāra pakṣe vā bhavet
translated: Whether it is the side of ritual modification or the side of modification of the horse, it would be like that.

original: śeṣasaṃskārastvayaṃ sa ca śeṣa sādhāraṇastasya ca dakṣiṇottarārḍe gṛhyate /
analyzed: śeṣa saṃskāraḥ tu ayam sa ca śeṣa sādhāraṇaḥ tasya ca dakṣiṇa uttara arḍe gṛhyate
translated: This is the remaining rite, and that remaining rite is common to both, and is taken up in the southern and northern parts.

analyzed: na pradhāna avadāna deśaḥ tasya prakṛtau acodita tvāt tatas ca śakyam agṛhyamāṇa viśeṣa tvam
translated: It is not the place of the principal offering, because it is enjoined in the original. And from that, it is possible to state that there is no specification.

original: yadyapi hye kapradhānoddeśenottarāīṃ gṛhṇauyuḥ tathā 'pi tathā coditārthasaṃpattyā pradhānāntarāṇyapi kṛtārthāni bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yadi api hi e ka pradhāna uddeśena uttarāīm gṛhṇauyuḥ tathā tathā ca udita artha saṃpattyā pradhāna antarāṇi api kṛtārthāni bhaveyuḥ
translated: For even if they were to take up the northern part with reference to the principal, even so the other principals would have their purpose accomplished by the completion of the enjoined meaning.

analyzed: tasmāt tantram
translated: Therefore it is a separate topic.

original: yattu pratipādyaṃ vibhavatauti pratipacyantare catukaraṇe tadupayujyate /
analyzed: yat tu pratipādyam vibhava tauti pratipacī antare catu karaṇe tat upayujyate
translated: But what is to be accomplished is divided, and in the consideration of four in another consideration, that is useful.

analyzed: aindra vāyave tu vacanāt pratikarma bhakṣaḥ syāt
translated: But in the Aindravayava, the drinking should be at each performance by reason of the text.

original: some vacanāico navati sāmānyena bhakṣavicāra kṛtvā viśeṣavicāro 'yaṃ karttavya āsīt /
analyzed: some vacanāt aicaḥ navati sāmānyena bhakṣa vicāra kṛtvā viśeṣa vicāraḥ yam karttavyaḥ āsīt
translated: In the Soma, after the general consideration of the drinking has been done by reason of the text, this special consideration should have been done.

analyzed: yat tu prathamataram kriyate tad pūrva adhikaraṇa apavāda lena
translated: But what is done first, that is set aside by the rule of the previous section, because of the quicker establishment of the rule.

original: pūrvavadi dravyaikatvātmakṛikṣite kṛtaḥ śāstrārtha iti nyāyāt prāpte vacanād dirbhakṣaṇaṃ hiraindravāyavastha bhakṣayatīti /
analyzed: pūrva vadi kṛtaḥ śāstra arthaḥ iti nyāyāt prāpte vacanāt dis bhakṣaṇam bhakṣayati iti
translated: As before, the purpose of the treatise is accomplished by establishing the oneness of the substance, according to the principle. When this is established, the eating is done by the statement He eats the Hāriyojana when it is in the Indra-Vayu cup.

original: bhavanti cedvathānyapyadhikaraṇāni yeṣāṃ nyāyema pūrvapakṣaṃ kṛtvā vacanena siddhānto bhavati /
analyzed: bhavanti pūrvapakṣam kṛtvā vacanena siddhāntaḥ bhavati
translated: And if there are other sections where the prima facie view is taken according to reasoning and the conclusion is reached by a statement,

analyzed: mā tu etat yuktam
translated: but this is not proper.

original: saṃdehābhāvāttava vai tat kriyate yatra nyāyena pratipādito vavanād bādhitaḥ tadabhāvātmamānanyāyeṣūpakariṣyati /
analyzed: saṃdeha abhāvāt tava vai tat kriyate yatra nyāyena pratipāditaḥ bādhitaḥ tad abhāva ātma māna nyāyeṣu upakariṣyati
translated: For that is done where what is established by reasoning is contradicted by a statement, and in the absence of that, it will help in other reasonings.

original: sa ceha gyāya pūrvādhikaragonaiva pradarśita iti mandaphalo vicāraḥ /
analyzed: sa ca iha pūrva adhikaragonā eva pradarśitaḥ iti manda phalaḥ vicāraḥ
translated: And that has been shown here by the previous section itself, so the consideration is of little fruit.

analyzed: tasmāt nā evam varṇanīyam kim tarhi tantravārtike
translated: Therefore, it should not be described in this way. What then? In the Tantra-Vartika:

analyzed: pratikarma sviṣṭakṛt iḍam karttavyam pradhāna bhedāt
translated: In the case of all the Pṛṣṭhya sacrifices, the Sviṣṭakṛt offering should be made separately for each, due to the difference in the primary sacrifices.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: It is as follows:

original: siḍavatpradhānabhedamaindra vāyava saṃskārahetumāha hiraindravāyavasya bhakṣayati dihyetasya vaṣaṭkarotauti tasmādyābaddaṣaṭakāra śeṣasaṃskāra ityuktottare datte dṛṣṭāntamanubhāṣya sūtreṇa parihārī vaktavyaḥ aindravāyave tu sakṛcaṇe prāpte vacanāda hirbhakṣo na pradhānabhedanimitto hetvadhikaraṇe hetornirākṛtatvāt /
analyzed: siḍa vat pradhāna bhedam aindra vāyava saṃskāra hetum āha hiḥ aindra vāyavasya bhakṣayati dihi etasya vaṣaṭkaroti iti tasmāt śeṣa saṃskāraḥ iti ukta uttare datte dṛṣṭāntam anubhāṣya sūtreṇa parihārī vaktavyaḥ aindra vāyave tu prāpte vacanāt hiḥ bhakṣaḥ na pradhāna bheda nimittaḥ hetu adhikaraṇe hetoḥ nirākṛta tvāt
translated: He states the modification of the principal as the cause of the consecration of the Aindravayava, as in the case of the Siddha. He drinks the Aindravayava, he utters Vashat for this. Therefore, as long as the remaining consecration is for the sake of the Vashatkara, the example stated in the previous statement should be commented on by the sutra. But in the case of the Aindravayava, the drinking is obtained by the single utterance, not by the modification of the principal, because the reason has been refuted in the section on the cause.

original: evaṃ ca sati pūrvādhikaraṇaśeṣeṇaiva satā somabhakṣasāmānyavicārasmāraṇānna kramakopo bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: evam ca sati pūrva adhikaraṇa śeṣeṇa eva satā soma bhakṣa sāmānya vicāra smāraṇāt na krama kopaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And in this case, the consideration of the general drinking of Soma, which is present as a remainder of the previous section, will not cause any disorder in sequence by reminding it.

original: some 'vacanāico na vidyate🔽aindravāyave tāvaddiśiṣṭavidhānādapi bhakṣo bhavet athetaragrahagate camasasthe ca some saṃdehaḥ /
analyzed: some vacanāt ai caḥ na vidyate  aindra vāyave tāvat diśiṣṭa vidhānāt api bhakṣaḥ bhavet atha itara graha gate camasa sthe ca some saṃdehaḥ
translated: There is no drinking of Soma due to the absence of a statement.🔽First, the drinking of the Aindravayava would be by the injunction of the direction. Then there is doubt regarding the Soma in the other cups and in the Sāmidhenī verses.

original: kiṃ bhakṣo 'sti neti tatvāpi sarvataḥ parihāramāśvinaṃ bhakṣyatītyādiṣu aindravāyavanyāya eva syāt /
analyzed: kim bhakṣaḥ asti na iti tatvā api sarvatas parihāram āśvinam bhakṣyati ityādiṣu aindra vāyava nyāyaḥ eva syāt
translated: Whether there is drinking or not, even in those beginning with he will drink the Aśvina from all around, it would be the same as the case of the Aindravayava.

original: idaṃ tu sarvathā tatrāpi vicāryate kiṃ prāpte bhane viśeṣaṇamātraṃ vacanena vidhīyate uta viśiṣṭavidhānametaditi /
analyzed: idam tu sarvathā tatra api vicāryate kim prāpte bhane viśeṣaṇa mātram vacanena vidhīyate uta viśiṣṭa vidhānam etat iti
translated: But this is considered in every way even there - is the mere qualification enjoined by the statement when it is obtained, or is this an injunction of the qualified?

original: kaścātra viśeṣaḥ sa yadi vācanikastato yācadacanameva karttavyo 'tha tvayataḥ kutaścittata ekadeśasthamapi liṅgaṃ sthālopulā kanyāyena samastadyotakaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: kaḥ ca atra viśeṣaḥ sa yadi vācanikaḥ tatas yācat acanam eva tu ayatas kutaścid tatas eka deśa stham api liṅgam samasta dyotakam bhaviṣyati
translated: And what is the difference here? If it is verbal, then the statement itself should be done. If not, then from somewhere, even if located in one part, the indicative will become the illuminator of the whole by the principle of the potsherd.

original: trayaśceha pakṣā saṃbhavanti kimanyārthadarśanānāṃ prātyapekṣatvādavidhānācca naiva bhakṣaḥ uta prātyabhāvādagyārthadarśanānyeva vacanaukṛtya yāvaddacanaṃ bhakṣa uta samākhyāvaṣaṭkārahomā bhiṣavanimitto 'pi bhakṣa iti/
analyzed: trayaḥ ca iha saṃbhavanti kim anya artha darśanānām prāti apekṣa tvāt avidhānāt ca na eva bhakṣaḥ uta yāvaddacanam bhakṣaḥ uta samākhyā vaṣaṭkāra homāḥ bhiṣava nimittaḥ bhakṣaḥ iti
translated: And three alternatives are possible here - is the eating not at all due to the dependence of the appearances for another purpose and the non-enjoining, or due to the appearance, are the appearances for another purpose themselves the statement-making, as far as the statement, the eating? Or is the eating even for the sake of the sipping, which is the cause of the name, the Vaṣaṭkāra, and the Homa?

original: kiṃ prāptam ājyasā kaṃprasthāyya saunāmaṇīgrahaṇavat samastahomasaṃyogāccheṣa eva nāsti kutaḥ punarbhaca iti /
analyzed: kim prāptam ājyasā kaṃprasthāyya saunāmaṇī grahaṇa vat samasta homa saṃyogāt śeṣaḥ eva na asti kutas punarbhacaḥ iti
translated: What is obtained? Like the taking of the Sākamedha cups in connection with the Ajyasamutthāna, there is no remainder due to the connection with the entire Homa. From where again is the eating?

original: na cāva prakṛtitaḥ prāptirna ca pratyakṣopadeśo yo 'pyupadeśa iva so 'pyanyaparatvādasamarthaḥ /
analyzed: na prakṛtitaḥ prāptiḥ na ca pratyakṣa upadeśaḥ yaḥ pi upadeśaḥ iva saḥ u pi anya para tvāt asamarthaḥ
translated: And there is no attainment by nature, nor is there a direct injunction. Even if there is an injunction, it is incapable due to having a different purpose.

analyzed: tasmāt na asti bha ca iti
translated: Therefore, there is no BHAJ.

analyzed: syādā nyā artha darśanāt
translated: It could be due to seeing a different purpose.

analyzed: vacanāni tu a parva tvāt tasmāt yathopadeśam syuḥ
translated: But the statements are not connected, therefore they should be as per the instruction.

original: yadyanyārthadarśanāni bhaveyustato 'nyatrāpi prāptiḥ syāicanāni tvetāni tasmādyathopadeśaṃ bhakṣo 'yaṃ nānyatreti /
analyzed: yadi anya artha darśanāni bhaveyuḥ tatas nyatra api prāptiḥ tu etāni tasmāt yathopadeśam bhakṣaḥ yam na anyatra iti
translated: If they were seen to have a different purpose, then there would be attainment elsewhere also. But these statements are not connected, therefore this Bhaj is as per the instruction, not elsewhere.

analyzed: camaseṣu samākhyānāt saṃyogasya tad nimitta tvāt
translated: Due to the designation in the goblets, the connection is for that purpose.

original: gṛhṇīma etadyathopadeśamiti sa tu samākhyādibhedabhinna upadeśo 'nusatavyaḥ na tu śrutaviśeṣamātraniṣṭhaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhṇīmaḥ etat yathopadeśam iti sa tu samākhyā ādi bheda bhinnaḥ upadeśaḥ na tu śruta viśeṣa mātra niṣṭhaḥ
translated: We accept this as per the instruction. But that instruction, distinguished by designation and other differences, should be followed, not just based on the literal meaning.

original: tatra camaseṣu tāvat yadyapi brāhmaṇagataḥ pratyakṣopadeśo nopalabhyate tathā 'pi praiṣagatayā samākhyayā 'numoyate hoṭacamasatvodiviśiṣṭaṃ hi dravyanayanapreṣaṇaṃ na kathaṃ cidupapadyate yadi teṣu hotrādayaḥ somaṃ na camanti /
analyzed: tatra camaseṣu tāvat yadi api brāhmaṇa gataḥ pratyakṣa upadeśaḥ na upalabhyate tathā pi praiṣa gatayā samākhyayā numoyate hoṭa camasa tva udi viśiṣṭam hi dravya nayana preṣaṇam na katham cit upapadyate yadi teṣu hotṛ ādayaḥ somam na camanti
translated: And in that case, although the direct instruction related to the Brahmins is not found in the goblets, still it is inferred by the designation found in the command. For the sending of the substance to be taken is not possible in any way if the Hotrakas and others do not drink Soma from those goblets.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: camasa iti adanārthasya cameroṇādike 'dhikaraṇasādhane asanpratyaye kṛte praiṣavelāyāṃ bhūtabhaviṣyadvarttamānānāṃ kva citsaṃbandhe 'pekṣyamāṇe bhūtavarttamānayoradarśanādbhaviṣyattvamanumauyate /
analyzed: camasaḥ iti adana arthasya cameḥ oṇādike dhikaraṇa sādhane asan pratyaye kṛte praiṣa velāyām bhūta bhaviṣyat varttamānānām kva cit saṃbandhe pekṣyamāṇe bhūta varttamānayoḥ adarśanāt bhaviṣyat tvam anumauyate
translated: In the word 'chamasa', which is derived from the root 'cam' meaning eating, with the affix 'as' added to indicate the receptacle, at the time of the command, when a connection between the past, future and present is required in some cases, the future nature is inferred due to the non-apprehension of the past and present.

analyzed: na hi anyathā hotuḥ camasaḥ mā etu iti etasya anuṣṭhānam śakyate
translated: For otherwise, the performance of 'hotr-chamasa' and 'maitr' is not possible.

analyzed: tasmāt camitavyam ha uvādibhiḥ
translated: Therefore, the chamasas should be eaten by the Hotrakas.

analyzed: soma śeṣavantaḥ camasā preṣitāḥ iti tasya eva apecita pra tantravārtike
translated: And the chamasas, along with the remaining Soma, are commanded. Thus, the connection with the particular injunction is understood.

analyzed: prakati patti viśeṣasya pratyāsattar bhakṣya tvam gamyate
translated: The connection with the eating is understood from the proximity of the particular injunction.

analyzed: sa śeṣaḥ camasaḥ alpam juhoti iti vacanāt
translated: And the chamasa with the remaining Soma is offered, as stated by the words 'alpaṃ juhoti'.

analyzed: na ca anyat odana ādi dravya pratīyate yasya camanāt camasa tvam upapadyate
translated: And no other substance like rice etc. is understood, of which the chamasa-ness is possible.

analyzed: na ca tat camanasya karma aṅga bhāvaḥ syāt
translated: And that chamana would not be a part of the ritual.

analyzed: tatra raṇam bādhyeta
translated: There, the sacrifice would be obstructed.

original: praiṣo 'pi cotkṛṣyeta somacamasasamākhyā ca bādhyeta yadi caudanādi bhacyeta tata ucchiṣṭena pātreṇa punarhomo na kriyeta /
analyzed: praiṣaḥ u pi ca utkṛṣyeta soma camasa samākhyā ca bādhyeta yadi ca odana ādi bhacyeta tatas ucchiṣṭena pātreṇa punar homaḥ na kriyeta
translated: And the direction would be extended, and the designation of the Soma cup would be contradicted. And if the cooked rice etc. were to be eaten, then the oblation would not be offered again with the vessel that is impure.

original: śuyarthaṃ tava lakṣaṇādyāśrayo yasya hoṭacama satvādyavadhāritaṃ tasya vināśāt dravyāntaraṃ tatmamākhyaṃ na bhavatīti samākhyātaiya sādhanakahomavidhānabāghaḥ sthāt /
analyzed: tava lakṣaṇa ādi āśrayaḥ yasya hoṭa cama sattva ādi avadhāritam tasya vināśāt dravya antaram tat mamākhyam na bhavati iti sādhanaka homa vidhāna bāghaḥ sthāt
translated: And because the oblation that is determined by the presence of the Soma cup etc. for the purpose of purification is destroyed, that which has the same designation as it does not become a different substance. Thus there would be contradiction of the injunction of the oblation that has the designation as its means.

analyzed: etena camasa antara upādānam pratyuktam
translated: And by this, the taking of a different cup is answered.

analyzed: tad utpādane ca śruta camasa saṃkhyā atikramaḥ syāt
translated: And in the production of that, there would be an excess of the number of cups mentioned in the text.

analyzed: na ca vacana sāmarthyāt acchiṣṭena hotum śakyam
translated: And it is not possible to offer with what is impure by the power of the text.

analyzed: vacanasya antareṇa api ācāra bhaṅgam soma bhace sāma kāśa tvāt
translated: Because even without the breaking of the practice, the text has the capacity for the eating of Soma.

original: somabhakṣe 'pi sarvametattulyamiti cennaitadevaṃ na somenocchiṣṭā bhavantīti śruteḥ /
analyzed: soma bhakṣe sarvam etat tulyam iti ced na etat evam na somena ucchiṣṭāḥ bhavanti iti śruteḥ
translated: If it is argued that all this is the same even in the eating of Soma, it is not so, because of the text They do not become impure with Soma.

analyzed: tasmāt camasibhi bhecayitavyaḥ somaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, the Soma should be drunk by the Soma-drinkers.

analyzed: bhāṣyam api anena eva krameṇa netavyam na yathā likhitam
translated: And the commentary should be taken in this very order, not as it is written.

analyzed: upapatti antara āgām upapatti antara vyavadhānena kliṭa tvāt
translated: Because it is defiled by the interruption of another birth.

analyzed: tammāt ca abrāhmaṇasya soma bhakṣaṇam pratiṣedhati
translated: Therefore, it prohibits the Brāhmaṇa's eating of Soma.

original: yadi ca prayajamānasyeti samākhyayā na somabhaca prāpyate tataḥ phalacamasavidhau sa yadi somaṃ bibhakṣayiṣeditina somamiti ca pratiṣedhanasaṃkīrttanaṃ nāvakalpeta tasmādasti camasināṃ somabhakṣa iti /
analyzed: yadi ca prayajamānasya iti samākhyayā na prāpyate tatas phala camasa vidhau sa yadi somam bibhakṣayiṣet iti na somam iti ca pratiṣedhana saṃkīrttanam na avakalpeta tasmāt asti camasinām soma bhakṣaḥ iti
translated: And if the eating of Soma is not obtained by the designation 'of the sacrificer', then the statement of the prohibition 'if he wishes to eat Soma' and 'not Soma' in the injunction of the fruit-bowl would not be possible. Therefore, the Soma-eating of the Chamasādhvaryus exists.

analyzed: udgāṭa camasam ekaḥ śruti saṃyogāt
translated: The Udgātṛ alone has the Chamasa, because of the connection with the Śruti.

analyzed: idānīm vaṣaṭkāra homa abhiṣaṣa bhaca an anutkā eva prasaṅgāt samākhyā bhaca viśeṣa anusaraṇam eva tāvat karoti
translated: Now, because the eating of the Soma, the Homa with Vaṣaṭkāra, and the drinking of the Abhiṣeka are not being discussed, he first considers only the specific details of the eating based on the designation.

original: tasminneva praiṣe prodgātṛṇāmiti śrūyate tava catu saṃdehaḥ kimeka evodgātā bhakṣayeduta sarvartvija uta stotrakāriṇaḥ āho khiccatvāro 'pi chandogā iti /
analyzed: tasmin eva praiṣe pra udgātṛṇām iti śrūyate tava saṃdehaḥ kim ekaḥ eva udgātā bhakṣayet uta sarva ṛtvijaḥ uta stotra kāriṇaḥ āho khid catvāraḥ api chandogāḥ iti
translated: In that very call, it is heard 'of the Udgātṛs'. And there is a doubt: Should only one Udgātṛ eat, or all the priests, or the Stotra-performers, or even all four Chandogas?

analyzed: ke cit tu dvitīya caturthayoḥ pakṣayoḥ ekatvam icchanti
translated: Some people desire oneness in the second and fourth alternatives.

analyzed: sūtraiye pi sarva śabda prayogāt lakṣaṇāyāḥ ca pratyāsatteḥ kevala chandoga viṣaya tvāt
translated: Because in the Sūtra, the word all is used, and because of the proximity of figurative interpretation, it refers only to the Chandogas.

analyzed: kutas saṃdehaḥ
translated: Where does the doubt come from?

analyzed: visaṃvādaḥ sphuṭaḥ hi atra prakṛti pratyaya arthayoḥ
translated: Here there is a clear contradiction between the meaning of the root and the suffix.

analyzed: tatra kasya anurodhena kasya vṛttiḥ bhavet iti
translated: So which one should be followed, and which one should be modified?

original: smaranti hi udgāturimityaṇpratyayaṃ na tu tasya karteti pratyayalopam /
analyzed: smaranti hi udgātuḥ im iti aṇ pratyayam na tu tasya kartā iti pratyaya lopam
translated: For they remember the suffix a in udgātṛ but not the elision of the suffix in tasya kartṛ.

analyzed: tasmāt na audgāva śabdāt eṣaḥ nugantavyaḥ
translated: Therefore, this should not be understood from the word udgātṛ.

original: tathā ca varaṇanimittamiti vakṣyati tenāyuktamidaṃ vyākhyānamiti /
analyzed: tathā ca varaṇa nimittam iti vakṣyati tena ayuktam idam vyākhyānam iti
translated: And thus he will say for the purpose of choosing, so this explanation is inappropriate.

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: udgātā gauṇaḥ mukhya udgātuḥ asaṃbhavāt
translated: The udgātṛ is only secondary, because the primary udgātṛ is impossible.

analyzed: kalpitaḥ yam parāvṛttyā brāhmaṇa ādiṣu rāja vat
translated: This one is imagined by transference, like a king among the brāhmaṇas and others.

original: yathaiva vyaṅgaiḥ sviṣṭakṛtaṃ yajatītyatra nāṅgānyanūdya vitvaṃ vidhīyate kiṃ tarhi pūrvaniṣpannaḥ samāsārtho vidheyo bha vati tathehāpi paripūrṇāṃsya padasya padāntarayogāt kadeśaniṣkarṣe ca sāmarthyābhāvādaśakya mevānuvadituṃ yo vaṣaṭkartturbhaca iti /
analyzed: yathā eva vyaṅgaiḥ sviṣṭakṛtam yajati iti atra na aṅgāni anūdya vi tvam vidhīyate kim tarhi pūrva niṣpannaḥ samāsa arthaḥ vidheyaḥ bha vati tathā iha api padasya pada antara yogāt ca sāmarthya abhāvāt aśakyam eva anuvaditum yaḥ vaṣaṭkarttuḥ bhacaḥ iti
translated: Just as, in the sentence ‘yathā svishtakṛtam yajati aṅgaiḥ’, the component parts of the sacrifice are not enjoined as the means of accomplishing the act of sacrifice, but what is enjoined is the previously accomplished meaning of the compound, in the same manner, in the case in question also, the complete word being already there, it is not possible to extract a portion of it by connecting it with another word, and hence it is not possible to repeat the word ‘vaṣaṭkartṛsya bhakṣaḥ’ .

original: na hi prāksamāmāgacasya vaṣaṭkasaṃbandho yuktaḥ sāpekṣatve sati samāsānupapatteḥ /🔽nanu ca bhavati vai pradhānasya sāpecasyāpi samāsa iti satyapi vaṣaṭkartṛ saṃbandhe samāso 'vakalpiṣyate /
analyzed: na hi vaṣaṭka saṃbandhaḥ yuktaḥ sāpekṣa tve sati samāsa anupapatteḥ  nanu ca bhavati vai pradhānasya sāpecasya api samāsaḥ iti sati api vaṣaṭkartṛ saṃbandhe samāsaḥ
translated: For, it is not possible for the word ‘vaṣaṭkartṛ’ to be connected with the word ‘bhakṣaḥ’ before the compound is formed, because, if it were so connected, the compound could not be formed.🔽But, as a matter of fact, we do find compounds formed even when the principal factor is dependent on something else. So that, even though the word ‘vaṣaṭkartṛ’ is dependent upon the word ‘bhakṣaḥ’, the compound may be formed.

original: bhavedetadevaṃ yadi bhakṣa evaikaḥ sāpekṣa syādiha tu prāthamyamapi vaṣaṭkartṛ saṃbandhitvātmāpekṣam /
analyzed: bhavet etat evam yadi bhakṣaḥ evā ekaḥ sāpekṣa syāt iha tu prāthamyam api vaṣaṭkartṛ saṃbandhi tva ātma apekṣam
translated: This might have been possible, if the word ‘bhakṣaḥ’ were the only dependent factor. As a matter of fact, however, the first position of the word ‘vaṣaṭkartṛ’ is also dependent upon its connection with the word ‘vaṣaṭkartṛ’.

original: na hi prāthamyasya bhakṣo nimittaṃ kiṃ tarhi vaṣaṭkartṛtvamato vaṣaṭkarttuḥ prathama ityevaṃ saṃbandha āpadyeta tataśca vispaṣṭamasāmañjasyaṃ syādyo vaṣaṭkarturbhaca iti cānūdyamāne viśiṣṭānuvādadoṣo bhakṣamātreṇa vaṣaṭkartturanākṣepāt /
analyzed: na hi prāthamyasya bhakṣaḥ nimittam kim tarhi vaṣaṭkartṛ tvam atas vaṣaṭkarttuḥ prathamaḥ iti evam saṃbandhaḥ āpadyeta tatas ca vispaṣṭam asāmañjasyam syāt yaḥ vaṣaṭkartuḥ bhacaḥ iti ca anūdyamāne viśiṣṭa anuvāda doṣaḥ bhakṣa mātreṇa vaṣaṭkarttuḥ anākṣepāt
translated: For the firstness is not the cause of the eating, but rather the being the performer of the Vasat-utterance. Therefore, the connection would be that the first is of the performer of the Vasat-utterance. And then there would be a very clear inconsistency, if it were reiterated that the eating is of the performer of the Vasat-utterance. And if the specific reiteration were faulty, because the performer of the Vasat-utterance would not be mentioned by mere eating.

original: vaṣaṭakartṛtvasya ca kriyāntareṣvapya nai kāntyādanyatarānuvāde tu sarvabhakṣāṇāṃ prāthamyaṃ vidhīyeta sarvavaṣaṭkartṛvyāpārāṇāṃ ca /
analyzed: vaṣaṭa kartṛ tvasya ca kriyā antareṣu api a na aikāntyāt anyatara anuvāde tu sarva bhakṣāṇām prāthamyam vidhīyeta sarva vaṣaṭkartṛ vyāpārāṇām ca
translated: And because the quality of being the performer of the Vasat-utterance is not exclusive to other actions, if one were reiterated, then the firstness of all eatings would be enjoined, and the activity of all performers of the Vasat-utterance.

original: taccāśakyaṃ katta mato vaṣaṭakarṭa prāthamyaviśiṣṭāpūrvabhakṣa vidhānametat /
analyzed: tat ca aśakyam katta mataḥ vaṣaṭa karṭa prāthamya viśiṣṭa apūrva bhakṣa vidhānam etat
translated: And that is impossible, therefore this enjoins the eating of the unseen effect qualified by the firstness of the performer of the Vasat-utterance.

analyzed: tayoḥ ca paraspara niyamāt atyanta samāna viṣayatvam atas yāvati viṣaye vaṣaṭkāraḥ tāvati eva prathama bhacaḥ
translated: And because of the mutual restriction of those two, the object is absolutely the same. Therefore, the first eating is only as much as the object of the Vasat-utterance.

original: kathaṃ punarvaṣaṭakārī nimittabhūtaḥ sannupādīyate kathaṃ cānupādīyamānasya niyamo 'vakalpate /
analyzed: katham punar vaṣaṭa kārī nimitta bhūtaḥ san upādīyate katham ca an upādīyamānasya niyamaḥ
translated: But how is the performer of the Vasat-utterance, being the cause, mentioned? And how is the restriction possible for one who is not mentioned?

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: sarvathā tāvat eka karma nimittakaḥ
translated: The restriction is in every way based on one action.

analyzed: upādāna anupādāne na viśeṣaḥ pratīyate
translated: No distinction is perceived between taking and not taking.

analyzed: mūlyam prāpaṇa vyayaḥ ca deyaḥ
translated: The price and the cost of conveyance should be given.

original: anyairmahāśayaiyaiḥ kānicit khaṇḍāni saṃgrāhyāṇi teśca pratyekaṃ khaṇḍānā mūlyaṃ prāpaṇavyayaśca deya iti
analyzed: anyaiḥ mahā āśayaiyaiḥ kānicid khaṇḍāni saṃgrāhyāṇi teṣām ca pratyekam khaṇḍānām mūlyam prāpaṇa vyayaḥ ca deyaḥ iti
translated: By others, by those with great capacity, some parts should be collected, and the price and the cost of conveyance should be given for each part.

original: hauvasamākhyayā hi prāk yajamānasya yājoti to vacanāt sarvaṃ hotuḥ prāpitaṃ tava vacanena yājagrāmācaṃ yajamānasaṃbandhi kṛtaṃ vaṣaṭkārādayastu hotustadavasthā eva /
analyzed: hauva samākhyayā hi prāk yajamānasya vacanāt sarvam hotuḥ prāpitam tava vacanena yajamāna saṃbandhi kṛtam vaṣaṭkāra ādayaḥ tu hotuḥ tad avasthāḥ eva
translated: For by the name of Hova, before the statement of the sacrificer's Yaja, everything has been brought to the Hotṛ. But by the statement, the Yaja-duty has been made related to the sacrificer. But the Vasat-utterance etc. are just as they were for the Hotṛ.

original: yadi punaryajamānādapanaya iti vyākhyāyeta tata stasya yājagrāmācaṃ prāpitaṃ sadapanauyataiti vaṣaṭkārādiprātyabhāvādapanayāśava na syāt /
analyzed: yadi punar yajamānāt apanayaḥ iti vyākhyāyeta tatas tasya prāpitam sat apanauyate eti vaṣaṭkāra ādi prāti abhāvāt na syāt
translated: If, on the other hand, it is explained that it is removed from the sacrificer, then what has been brought to him by the Yaja-duty is removed, and because of the absence of the Vasat-utterance etc., the removal would not be complete.

original: tasmādyajamānasya yājepratyanena yājagrāmātrāpanayāddaṣaṭkārasya ca yājāto 'tyantavyatirekā daṅgāṅgitvābhāvācca yajamānena prayujāmānāyā upari hotā vaṣaṭkṛtya bhakṣayet /
analyzed: tasmāt yajamānasya yāja grāma atra apanayāt daṣaṭkārasya ca tyanta vyatirekāḥ daṅga aṅgi tva abhāvāt ca yajamānena prayujāmānāyāḥ upari hotā vaṣaṭkṛtya bhakṣayet
translated: Therefore, because the Yaja-duty of the sacrificer is removed by this removal of the Yaja-duty alone, and because the Vasat-utterance is completely different from the Yaja, and because there is no relation of primary and secondary, the Hotṛ should eat after uttering Vasat to the offering made by the sacrificer.

original: vaṣaṭkāranimitto hi bhakṣo na bājānimitta ityanapanītaḥ /
analyzed: vaṣaṭkāra nimittaḥ hi bhakṣaḥ na bājā nimittaḥ iti an apanītaḥ
translated: For the eating is prompted by the Vasat-utterance, not by the Yajya. Therefore it is not removed.

analyzed: yaṣṭuḥ vā kāraṇa āgamāt
translated: Or the sacrificer's, because of the coming of the cause.

original: yadi yajamānasya yājyetyetāvanmālameva śrūyeta tataḥ kadā cinnāpanīyeta bhakṣaḥ iha tvevaṃ śrūyate svayaṃ niṣadya yajatīti /
analyzed: yadi yajamānasya yājyā iti etāvat mālam eva śrūyeta tatas kadā cit na apanīyeta bhakṣaḥ iha tu evam śrūyate svayam niṣadya yajati iti
translated: If only this much were heard: On the Yajya of the sacrificer, then the eating might sometimes be removed. But here it is heard thus: Sitting himself, he sacrifices.

original: vaṣaṭkāreṇa ca haviḥpradānārthatvādijyate na kevalayā yājyayā /
analyzed: vaṣaṭkāreṇa ca haviḥ pradāna artha tvāt ijyate na kevalayā yājyayā
translated: And because the offering of the oblation is for the purpose of the Vasat-utterance, it is sacrificed by the Vasat-utterance, not merely by the Yajya.

original: tathā inavānaṃ yajatoti yājyāta ārabhya yāvadyanaterarthaḥ samāpyate tāvannāvānitavyam /
analyzed: tathā yajati iti yājyātaḥ ārabhya yāvat yanateḥ arthaḥ samāpyate tāvat na avānitavyam
translated: Similarly, while the sacrificer is sacrificing with the Anuvakya, as long as the purpose of the Yajya is completed up to the end of the Anuvakya, he should not eat.

original: ekakartṛkatve ca yājyāvaṣaṭkārayoridamupapadyate nānyathā /🔽tasmāt yatra yājyā tatra vaṣaṭkārabhakṣāvapītyantaregā/
analyzed: eka kartṛka tve ca yājyā vaṣaṭkārayoḥ idam upapadyate na anyathā  tasmāt yatra yājyā tatra vaṣaṭkāra bhakṣau api iti antaregā
translated: And this is possible when the Yajya and the Vasat-utterance have the same performer, not otherwise.

analyzed: pi ekatvam aṅga bhāvam ca apanayaḥ vijñāyate
translated: Therefore, where there is Yajya, there the Vasat-utterance and the eating are also. Thus the unity and the subordinate nature are understood to be removed.

analyzed: pravṛtta tvāt pravarasya anapāyaḥ
translated: Because of the occurrence, the Pravara is not removed.

analyzed: yat tu pravara vat iti tatra ucyate tambavārtike
translated: As for what was said about it being like the Pravara, it is said in the Tantravartika:

analyzed: pravaraḥ na tu atikrāntaḥ yāvyā kāle panīyate
translated: The Pravara is not transgressed, it is removed only at the time of the Yajya.

analyzed: bhakṣaṇasya tu bhāvi tvāt śacyāḥ upanaya kalpanā
translated: But because of the existence of the eating, the assumption is made that it is removed after the Svacha.

analyzed: tṛtīya arthaḥ ca kalpyaḥ syāt dvitīya arthasya bādhanam
translated: And the third meaning would have to be imagined as the obstruction of the second meaning.

analyzed: samasta soma vādhaḥ ca yaji niṣkarṣa kalpanā
translated: And the extraction of the sacrificer would be imagined as the obstruction of all Soma.

original: yadi tāvadapūrva eva bhakṣaśvodyate tato'pyāra dupakārakatvaṃ na bhavatyadṛṣṭa kalpanātmakara gāviniyogaviprakarṣādasaṃbaḍopakāritvācca /
analyzed: yadi tāvat apūrvaḥ eva na bhavati adṛṣṭa kalpanā ātma kara gā viniyoga viprakarṣāt asaṃbaḍa upakāri tvāt ca
translated: If, first of all, the eating is enjoined only in relation to the unseen, then even that does not serve the purpose of helping, because of the remoteness of the unseen and the non-connection of the help.

original: tathā taṃ prayacchediti dvitīyayā vispaṣṭaṃ saṃskāryatvaṃ gamyate /
analyzed: tathā tam prayacchet iti dvitīyayā vispaṣṭam saṃskārya tvam gamyate
translated: Similarly, the second case clearly indicates the state of being to be refined by the expression he should give that.

original: anyathā hi teneti prāpnoti tasmātsaskāraḥ/🔽saṃskārasya caiṣa svabhāvo yadupayukta su santravārtike /
analyzed: anyathā hi tena iti prāpnoti tasmāt saskāraḥ  saṃskārasya ca eṣa svabhāvaḥ
translated: Otherwise, it would be by that, therefore it is to be refined.

analyzed: payeā ucyamāṇam vā dravyam avalambate
translated: And this is the nature of refinement that it depends on a substance that is already used or being mentioned.

analyzed: tatra api bhakṣitasya pu nar upayoga asaṃbhavāt upayukta saṃskāra tvam eva jñāyate
translated: Even there, because of the impossibility of use for what has been eaten, it is understood to be the refinement of what is already used.

original: tena phalacamasaḥ saṃskārabhūtaṃ bhakṣamupasarpanneva śakyo niyokta yadi kka cidupayogaṃ gacchasi tato bhakṣaṇena saṃskṛiya se nānyathā sa copayajāmānatvaṃ prārthayamānaḥ prakaraṇādyāgopayogitvaṃ pratipadyate /
analyzed: tena phala camasaḥ saṃskāra bhūtam bhakṣam upasarpan eva śakyaḥ niyokta yadi kka cit upayogam gacchasi tatas bhakṣaṇena saṃskṛiya se na anyathā sa ca upayajāmāna tvam prārthayamānaḥ prakaraṇāt yāga upayogi tvam pratipadyate
translated: Thus, the fruit-cup, while approaching the food which is the sanctifying factor, can be enjoined only if it goes to some use, then it is sanctified by eating, not otherwise. And that, desiring to be the Upāṃśu, becomes connected with the sacrifice through the context.

original: tatrāpi yāvatyanupayujāmāno yajamānabhaca saṃskāryatvaṃ na pratipadyate tāvataiva yajñabhāgenārthāpacyā saṃbadhyataityavadhāraṇādyajamānaca masābhyā senaivaikena saṃbadhyate na hi grahacamasāntareṣvanupayujāmānasyāsya yajamānabhakṣatvamanupapannam ataḥ somo 'pyanugrahīṣyate /
analyzed: tatra api yāvati anupayujāmānaḥ saṃskārya tvam na pratipadyate tāvatā eva yajñabhāgena arthāpacyā saṃbadhyate iti avadhāraṇāt yajamāna ca masa abhyā sena eva ekena saṃbadhyate na hi graha camasa antareṣu anupayujāmānasya asya yajamāna bhakṣa tvam anupapannam atas somaḥ u pi anugrahīṣyate
translated: Even there, to the extent that it is not being used, it does not become the object of sanctification of the sacrificer's food. To that extent, it is connected by presumption with the sacrificial portion. Thus, it is determined that it is connected only with the sacrificer's food and the cup. It is not impossible for this, which is not being used in the other cups and goblets, to be the sacrificer's food. Therefore, even Soma will be favored.

original: yahā aprotiṣṭomaprakaraṇena saṃbaddho 'yaṃ bhanaśabda uccāryyamāṇaḥ prakṛtaṃ somabhakṣamevāvalambate /
analyzed: yahā a protiṣṭoma prakaraṇena saṃbaddhaḥ yam bhana śabdaḥ uccāryyamāṇaḥ prakṛtam soma bhakṣam eva avalambate
translated: Here, this word eating, uttered in connection with the context of the Atirātra, relies only on the previously mentioned eating of Soma.

original: sa ca yāgopayuktadravyaśeṣasaṃskāratvena prajñāta iti phalacamasamapi tādṛśameva saṃskatta" śaknoti /
analyzed: sa ca yāga upayukta dravya śeṣa saṃskāra tvena prajñātaḥ iti phala camasam api tādṛśam eva saṃskatta śaknoti
translated: And that is known as the sanctification of the remaining substances used in the sacrifice. Therefore, the fruit-cup is also able to sanctify in the same way.

original: na tvasāvidānaumanya prayojanaḥ śakyaḥ kalpayituṃ na ca tasya karmāntaratve kiṃ cicchandāntarādi kāraṇamasti /
analyzed: na tu asau idānaum anya prayojanaḥ śakyaḥ kalpayitum na ca tasya karma antara tve kim cit chanda antara ādi kāraṇam asti
translated: And it is not possible to assume that this is a meaningless injunction, nor is there any reason, in the shape of a different desire or the like, for regarding it as a distinct act.

original: api ca sa yadi somaṃ vibhakṣayiṣediti svavākyopātta naiva somabhakṣaṇana saṃbandhī vijñāyate anyathā hi tadupādānaṃ vyartha meva syāt /
analyzed: api ca sa yadi somam vibhakṣayiṣet iti sva vākya upātta na eva soma bhakṣaṇana saṃbandhī vijñāyate anyathā hi tad upādānam vyartha meva syāt
translated: Moreover, if he wishes to eat Soma, it is not understood to be connected with the eating of Soma, as mentioned in the same sentence, otherwise the mention of that would be entirely useless.

analyzed: na ca na somam iti anuvādaḥ vakalpate
translated: And it is not possible to construe na somam as a restatement.

original: yadi bhakṣānta ra mevedamārādupakārakaṃ codyeta tataḥ samānakāryatvābhāvānnaiva somaṃ nivarttayedanivarttite ca tasminna pratiṣedhānuvādaḥ syānna ca vidhiyukto vākya bhedānekādṛṣṭa kalpanā prasaṅgādasaṃbaī ca vākyaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: yadi codyeta tatas samāna kārya tva abhāvāt na eva somam nivarttayet anivarttite ca tasmin na pratiṣedha anuvādaḥ syāt na ca vidhi yuktaḥ vākya bheda aneka adṛṣṭa kalpanā prasaṅgāt ca vākyam bhavet
translated: If this were enjoined as merely a subsequent help, then, because of the absence of the same effect, it would not even set aside the Soma. And if that were not set aside, it would be a restatement of a prohibition, and not connected with an injunction, because of the undesirable consequence of the assumption of multiple unseen results due to the split of the sentence. And the sentence would be meaningless.

original: yadi somaṃ bhagona saṃskatta micchettataḥ phalacamamabhakṣaṇa mārādapakārakaṃ kuryātphalacamasaṃ vā saṃskuryāditi /
analyzed: yadi somam bhagona saṃskattam icchet tatas phala camama bhakṣaṇa mārāt apakārakam kuryāt phala camasam vā saṃskuryāt iti
translated: If he wishes to prepare the Soma for eating, then he would perform the subsequent help of not eating the fruit-mixture, or he would prepare the fruit-mixture.

original: yadā tvayamartho gṛhyate yena bhataṇena yathābhūtaṃ somaṃ saṃskattu micchetṛtīyādhyāyasya pañcamaḥ pāda /
analyzed: yadā tu ayam arthaḥ gṛhyate yena bhataṇena yathābhūtam somam saṃskattu micche tṛtīya adhyāyasya pañcamaḥ pādaḥ
translated: When, however, the meaning is taken as that by which one would desire to prepare the Soma in accordance with the truth, then the word yena is to be taken in the sense of the Instrumental.🔽

original: phona tathābhūtameva phalacamasa saṃskuryāditi tadā 'rthāpattyā yajamānacamasayāgābhyāmasaṃvandhaḥ kṛto bhavati tasmādivyāyāmayaṃ somavikāra iti siddam /
analyzed: tathābhūtam eva phala camasa saṃskuryāt iti tadā rthāpattyā yajamāna camasa yāgābhyām asaṃvandhaḥ kṛtaḥ bhavati tasmāt ivyāyām ayam soma vikāraḥ iti siddam
translated: But when the meaning is taken as that he would prepare the Soma as it really is by that means by which he would desire to prepare it as it really is, then by presumption the connection with the Yajamana's cup and the sacrifices is made. Therefore it is established that this is a modification of Soma.

analyzed: sā eṣā vyavadhāraṇa kalpanā iti
translated: This is the assumption of a restriction.

original: yathaivāśvapratigraheṣdyāṃ yāvato 'śvānpratigṛhauyāditi śrute pratigrāhayediti vyavadhārya kalpitaṃ tathaivāla bhakṣaṃ prayacchediti śrute yāgasādhanaṃ prayacchediti kalpyate /
analyzed: yathā eva aśva pratigraha iṣdyām yāvataḥ śvān pratigṛhauyāt iti śrute pratigrāhayet iti vyavadhārya kalpitam tathā eva ala bhakṣam prayacchet iti śrute yāga sādhanam prayacchet iti kalpyate
translated: Just as in the case of accepting horses, when it is heard he should accept as many horses as he accepts, the meaning is restricted and assumed as he should accept, similarly when it is heard he should give the eating, it is assumed that he should give the means for the sacrifice.

analyzed: etena pūtīkān abhiṣuṇuyāt iti ādauni vyākhyātāni
translated: By this, the injunctions beginning with he should press the Putika plants are explained.

analyzed: homāt
translated: From the Homa

analyzed: homa anuvādena
translated: The injunction of the young Darbha grass is possible as a modification of the sacrifice, by the statement of the Homa.

analyzed: camasaiḥ ca tulya kāla tvāt
translated: And because of the same time as the Chamasas

analyzed: saṃdigdha yāga sādhana unnayana eka vākya tā ca etat tulya tve
translated: And the oneness of the statement of the offering of the means of the doubtful sacrifice is possible in the case of equality with this, not otherwise.

analyzed: liṅga darśanāt ca
translated: And because of the indication

analyzed: soma pratiṣedha anuvādaḥ ca liṅgam iti vyākhyātam
translated: And it has been explained that the restatement of the prohibition of Soma is an indicative mark.

analyzed: anuprasarpiṣu sāmānyāt
translated: In the case of those who continue, it is by the general rule.

original: daśapeye śataṃ brāhmaṇā somaṃ bhakṣayanti daśa daśaikaikaṃ camasamanuprasarpeyuriti tatra rājanyacamaso 'pi kiṃ brāhmaṇaireva daśabhirbhacayitavyaḥ uta rājanyairiti maṃdehaḥ /
analyzed: daśapeye śatam brāhmaṇā somam bhakṣayanti daśa daśa ekaikam camasam anuprasarpeyuḥ iti tatra rājanya camasaḥ api kim brāhmaṇaiḥ eva daśabhiḥ bhacayitavyaḥ uta rājanyaiḥ iti maṃdehaḥ
translated: In the Dashpeya, a hundred Brahmins consume the Soma. Ten each should continue with each cup. There, should the cup of the Kshatriya be consumed by ten Brahmins only, or by Kshatriyas? This is the doubt.

original: kaḥ punaḥ saṃdeha hetuḥ ke cidāhuvacanavyaktibheda iti /🔽yadi hi daśadaśaikeka miti vidhistatastulyajātantravārtike /🔽toyeṣu daśakeṣu sarvatra vihiteṣu śataṃ brāhmaṇā iti yaṃthāprāptānuvādī brāhmaṇagrāmavaddūstā bhavatīti rājanyā daśa /
analyzed: kaḥ punar saṃdeha hetuḥ ke cid āhuḥ vacana vyakti bhedaḥ iti  yadi hi daśa daśa eka ekam iti vidhiḥ tatas tulya jā tantra vārtike  toyeṣu daśakeṣu sarvatra vihiteṣu śatam brāhmaṇāḥ iti yaṃthā prāpta anuvādī brāhmaṇa grāma vat dūstā bhavati iti rājanyāḥ daśa
translated: And what is the cause of doubt? Some say it is the difference in the expression.🔽For if it is an injunction that ten each with each, then in the case of ten sets of ten being enjoined everywhere, the statement a hundred Brahmins would be a restatement as it stands, like the village of Brahmins, and would be defective. Therefore, ten Kshatriyas.

original: atha punaḥ śataṃ brāhmaṇā iti vidhirdaśadaśaikaika miti anuvādastato vidhau gauṇatvāsaṃbhavātsarvatra brāhmaṇaireva bhacayitavyamiti brāhmaṇā daśa /
analyzed: atha punar śatam brāhmaṇāḥ iti vidhiḥ daśa daśa ekaikam iti anuvādaḥ tatas vidhau gauṇa tva asaṃbhavāt sarvatra brāhmaṇaiḥ eva bhacayitavyam iti brāhmaṇāḥ daśa
translated: But if a hundred Brahmins is an injunction, and ten each with each is a restatement, then since the secondary cannot be in an injunction, it should be consumed by Brahmins everywhere. Therefore, ten Brahmins.

original: kiṃ tāvatprāptamanuprasapeṃyurityasya vidhisāmarthyābhakṣayantīti cānuvādena sāmarthyāddaśadaśaikaikamiti vidhau sati ke daśetyapekṣāyāṃ tulyajātīyeṣu saṃkhyāvṛttikhābhāvyādbrāhmaṇacama seṣu brohmaṇā rājanyacamase rājanyā daśeti gamyate /🔽sāmānyāditi ca daśasaṃkhyāṃ coyitvā nivṛttavyāpāre śāstre tatpūraṇārthamatāsu vyaktiṣūpādīyamānāsu yāsāṃ kiṃ citpratyāyakamasti tā grahautatryāstulyajātīyānāṃ ca sāmānya gamakaṃ vidyate na jātyantarānugatānām /
analyzed: kim tāvat prāptam anuprasapeṃyuḥ iti asya vidhi sāmarthyā bhakṣayanti iti ca anuvādena sāmarthyāt daśa daśa ekaikam iti vidhau sati ke daśa iti apekṣāyām tulya jātīyeṣu saṃkhyā vṛtti khābhāvyāt brāhmaṇa camaseṣu brohmaṇā rājanya camase rājanyāḥ daśa iti gamyate  sāmānyāt iti ca daśa saṃkhyām coyitvā nivṛtta vyāpāre śāstre tad pūraṇa artham atāsu vyaktiṣu upādīyamānāsu yāsām kim cit pratyāyakam asti tāḥ grahautatryāḥ tulya jātīyānām ca sāmānya gamakam vidyate na jāti antara anugatānām
translated: What is the prima facie view? They would be distributed. By the force of the injunction, they would be distributed. By the force of the statement, it is understood that ten of each are to be distributed. When there is an injunction that ten of each are to be distributed, there is a need to know which ten. Due to the absence of repetition of numbers in similar categories, it is understood that ten Brahmins are to be distributed in the Brahmin goblets and ten Kshatriyas in the Kshatriya goblets.🔽And by the general rule, after the number ten has been enjoined and the scripture has ceased to operate, when those individuals are being adopted to fill that number, those which have some indicator are to be taken. And there is a general indicator for similar categories, not for those belonging to different classes.

original: atha vā sāmānyāditi viṣayasāmānyādarthekatve dravyaguṇa yoriti hi phalacamasaṃ pratyupādoyamānayoḥ kṣatriyatvadaśatvayoḥ parasparaniyame sati yāvata viṣaye daśatvaṃ tāvati rājanyatvamityavagamyate iti balāddaśa rājanyā vijñāyante /
analyzed: atha vā sāmānyāt iti viṣaya sāmānyāt artha ekatve dravya guṇayoḥ iti hi phala camasam pratyupādoyamānayoḥ kṣatriya tva daśatvayoḥ paraspara niyame sati viṣaye daśatvam tāvati rājanya tvam iti avagamyate iti balāt daśa rājanyāḥ vijñāyante
translated: Or, by the general rule, due to the similarity of the object, in the case of the substance and quality, it is understood that as much as the number ten is the object, so much is the Kshatriya nature, when the Kshatriya nature and the number ten are being adopted in relation to the fruit goblet, there is mutual restriction. Thus, by force, ten Kshatriyas are understood.

original: atha vā sāmānyāditi tulyakāryaṃ tulyajātīyaṃ ca tulyasya bādhakaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: atha vā sāmānyāt iti tulya kāryam tulya jātīyam ca tulyasya bādhakam bhavati
translated: Or, the general rule is that what is similar in effect and similar in kind sets aside what is similar.

original: tadyadi rājasūyacodanāto rājanyatvaṃ prāptaṃ prakṛtitaścaikatvaṃ tatva daśatvaṃ vidhīyamānaṃ sāmānyādātideśikatvāccaikatvaṃ bādhate na jātibhinna kāryatvāttataścā nivṛttajātireva yajamānacamaso daśatvena yojayitavya iti daśa rājanyā bhavanti /
analyzed: tat yadi rājasūya codanātaḥ rājanya tvam prāptam prakṛtitaḥ ca ekatvam daśatvam vidhīyamānam sāmānyāt ātideśika tvāt ca ekatvam bādhate na jāti bhinna kārya tvāt tatas ca nivṛtta jātiḥ eva yajamāna camasaḥ daśatvena yojayitavyaḥ iti daśa rājanyāḥ bhavanti
translated: If the Kshatriya-ness obtained from the injunction of the Rajasuya and the oneness from the archetype, then the injunction of tenness sets aside the oneness from the general rule and from the transference, not because of being different in effect due to being of different classes. And therefore, the sacrificer's cup, which has ceased to be of that class, should be connected with tenness. Thus there are ten Kshatriyas.

original: nanu ca daśatve vidhauyamāne yadekaikaṃ camasamanuprasarpantoti viśiṣṭānuvādādākyaṃ bhidyate /
analyzed: nanu ca daśa tve vidhauyamāne yat ekaikam camasam anuprasarpanti iti viśiṣṭa anuvādāt ākyam bhidyate
translated: But when tenness is being enjoined, the sentence is split due to the specific restatement of each cup being served.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: camasamiti dvitīyāntaṃ kevalamanūdhate tābatā tu saṃskāryatvaṃ gamyate /
analyzed: camasam iti dvitīya antam kevalam anūdhate tābatā tu saṃskārya tvam gamyate
translated: The accusative ending cup is merely restated. To that extent, the state of being refined is understood.

original: na ca camasānāṃ bhakṣaṇaṃ mukkā 'nyaḥ saṃskārastena sa evānuprasarpaṇaśabdena lakṣyate tatra ca pratyekameva bhakṣaṇaṃ prāptamiti tadapyanudyate /
