translated: Therefore, it is established that it is the producer in relation to that time.

original: ataścetarasya pariśeṣasiddhaṃ guṇavidhitvaṃ na hi tasya kiṃ ciddhedakāraṇam /
analyzed: atas ca itarasya pariśeṣa siddham guṇa vidhi tvam na hi tasya kim cit heda kāraṇam
translated: And therefore, the quality-instructing nature of the other is established by elimination, for it has no other cause.

original: ata eva vapāpracāraṇotkarṣo 'sti nāstīti vicāritam /🔽sati hi vapāpracāragotkarṣe pūrvasyaiva prātaḥsavane viparihatteḥ kālaṃ pratyupādānaṃ pratyabhijñānātkalpyeta /
analyzed: atas eva vapā pracāraṇa utkarṣaḥ sti na asti iti vicāritam  sati hi vapā pracāra ga utkarṣe pūrvasya eva prātaḥsavane viparihatteḥ kālam pratyupādānam pratyabhijñānāt kalpyeta
translated: For this very reason, the discussion about whether the carrying forward of the shaving is or is not is considered.

analyzed: yathā uta sannidhau tu avibhāgāt iti
translated: For if there were carrying forward of the shaving and the Soma-pressing, the mention of time in the morning pressing itself would be imagined due to recognition, as in the case of the near one, due to non-division.

original: kāle ca karmaṇi vidhīyamāne pratyayasya sannikṛṣṭe 'rthe vyāpāro bhaviṣyati vapāpracārakālasya punaḥ savanauyotpattikriyātaḥ kriyāntara viśeṣaṇatvādduṣpratipādo viśiṣṭavidhiriti vākyabhedaḥ syāt /
analyzed: kāle ca karmaṇi vidhīyamāne pratyayasya sannikṛṣṭe rthe vyāpāraḥ bhaviṣyati vapā pracāra kālasya punar savanauya utpatti kriyātaḥ kriyā antara viśeṣaṇa tvāt duṣpratipādaḥ viśiṣṭa vidhiḥ iti vākya bhedaḥ syāt
translated: And when the time is enjoined in the action, the operation of the suffix will be on the proximate meaning, but the time of the shaving and Soma-pressing, being a qualifier of the action other than the action of origination, its injunction as a qualified action would be difficult to comprehend, so there would be sentence split.

analyzed: asmad pace punar vyathai kavākya tvam bhavati tathā uktam
translated: But in our view, there is syntactical unity as stated.

original: evaṃ ca parivyāṇasyāpi prakaraṇalabhyo 'ṅgabhāva ihānuvadiṣyate anyathā punarviprakṛṣṭatare gaṇa krameṇa prāptimapecyā nadyeta tammādayamevotpattivi dhiḥ /
analyzed: evam ca parivyāṇasya api prakaraṇa labhyaḥ ṅga bhāvaḥ iha anuvadiṣyate anyathā punar viprakṛṣṭatare gaṇa krameṇa prāptim apecyā tammāt ayam eva utpatti vi dhiḥ
translated: And thus, the subsidiary nature of the Parivyañjana, which is obtained from the context, will be followed here. Otherwise, however, it would be delayed, expecting to be obtained by the order of the group at a much greater distance. Therefore, this is indeed the injunction of origination.

analyzed: katham punar asmin pace bhāṣyakārasya vākya bheda upanyāsaḥ
translated: But how is it that the author of the Bhāṣya mentions the split of the sentence in this case?

analyzed: ucyate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: karmaṇaḥ bhedaḥ eva ayam vākya bhedaḥ bhidhīyate
translated: This is indeed said to be the split of the sentence due to the difference of the action.

analyzed: saṃbandhe tu eka vākya tvam artha anya tve pi gamyate
translated: But even when the meaning is different, unity of the sentence is understood when there is a connection.

original: somanāśe hi pratinidhyapekṣāyāṃ satyāṃ putīkā vi dhoyante na yāgasādhanāpekṣāyām /
analyzed: soma nāśe hi pratinidhi apekṣāyām satyām putīkāḥ vi dhoyante na yāga sādhana apekṣāyām
translated: For when there is a need for a substitute due to the loss of Soma, the Putika rites are performed, not when there is a need for the means of sacrifice.

original: ato 'yaṃ pratinidhiniyama eva bhavati yatsakalasomadharmāsaṃbhave vikalānsaṃ madharmānutpādayettatpūtokagatāniti /
analyzed: atas yam pratinidhi niyamaḥ eva bhavati yat sakala soma dharma asaṃbhave vikalān sam ma dharmān utpādayet tat pūta uka gatān iti
translated: Therefore, this is indeed a restriction on the substitute, that when all the characteristics of Soma are not possible, it should produce the incomplete characteristics of Soma, which are present in the Putika.

analyzed: vacyati hi niyama artha
translated: For the injunction is stated somewhere for the purpose of restriction.

analyzed: tat nityam tad cikorṣā ha iti ca
translated: And that is always desired by him.

original: ataśca naivātra pūtīkalaṃ kama kiṃ tarhi somadharmopalakṣaṇārtha tena śrutilacaṇasthāpi pūrveṇāviśiṣṭatvamiti /
analyzed: atas ca nā eva atra kim tarhi soma dharma upalakṣaṇa artha tena śruti lacaṇa sthā api pūrveṇa a viśiṣṭa tvam iti
translated: And therefore, there is no Putika rite here at all. What then? It is for the purpose of indicating the characteristics of Soma. Therefore, even though indicated by the Veda, it is not distinguished by the previous one.

analyzed: tena iha api tat eva cintāyāḥ prayojanam
translated: Therefore, here also that alone is the purpose of the consideration.

analyzed: tad āśrayasya pravarttitavyam
translated: Hence, one who desires good qualities should engage in it to avoid the loss of its basis.

original: anye vāhuḥ sakalavyaktyāśrayaṇo hi guṇakāmā vaikalyādiha na pravarttante /
analyzed: anye vā āhuḥ sakala vyakti āśrayaṇaḥ hi guṇa kāmāḥ vaikalyāt iha na pravarttante
translated: Others say: Those who desire good qualities do not engage in this because they rely on the entire manifestation.

original: nityasya hi karmaṇo'vaśyaṃ prakramātmakāntasya sarvasyāvaśya samāpanīyatvā tkiṃciḍa me vaikalye 'pyavaiguṇyābhyanujñā yujyate yathā tu kāmyānāṃ pratini dhibhiḥ prakramo nāsti tathā guṇakāmaina pravarttitavyam /
analyzed: nityasya hi karmaṇaḥ uvaśyam sarvasya avaśya samāpanīya tvāt me vaikalye pi a vaiguṇya abhyanujñā yujyate yathā tu kāmyānām dhibhiḥ prakramaḥ na asti tathā pravarttitavyam
translated: For a permanent ritual, the entire end consisting of the necessary performance must necessarily be completed. Therefore, even in the case of some deficiency, the permission of non-defect is appropriate. But just as there is no performance by substitutes in the case of optional rituals, one who desires good qualities should not engage in it.

original: yadi tu prakrānte kasmiṃścidgaṇakāmakalpe dravyanāśe sati tantravārtike /
analyzed: yadi tu prakrānte kasmiṃścid gaṇa kāma kalpe dravya nāśe sati tantravārtike
translated: But if in some commenced ritual desired by one who desires good qualities, when the substance is lost,

original: pratinidhīyate tatastasyāvaśya samāpanīyattvāhikāreṇa pratinidhinā vā tulyaṃ samāpana mityūhānuhāveva prayojanam saṃsthāstu samānavidhānāḥ prakaraṇāviśeṣāt
analyzed: pratinidhīyate tatas tasya avaśya samāpanīya tva ahi kāreṇa pratinidhinā vā tulyam samāpanam iti ūha anuhau eva prayojanam saṃsthāḥ tu samāna vidhānāḥ prakaraṇa aviśeṣāt
translated: a substitute is used, then the completion is the same as by the substitute, which must necessarily be completed due to the action. Thus, the purpose is only the inference of that. But the conclusions have the same injunction due to the absence of a specific context.

original: aneka graha camasayāgābhyāsātmakaścatuḥsaṃstho jyotiṣṭomo 'vadhāritaḥ sarvasaṃsthāsu tu jyotiṣṭomarūpamanusyūtam /
analyzed: aneka graha camasa yāga abhyāsa ātmakaḥ catur saṃsthaḥ jyotiṣṭomaḥ sarva saṃsthāsu tu jyotiṣṭoma rūpam anusyūtam
translated: And the Jyotiṣṭoma consisting of four sections, which is in the form of the repetition of the sacrifices of many Graha and Camasa libations, has been determined. But the form of the Jyotiṣṭoma is interwoven in all the sections.

original: yathaiva devadattasya sthānopaveśanagamanaśayanādyavasthābhede 'pi devadattatvaṃ nāpaiti tathā jyotiṣṭomātmanaḥ saṃsthāntaropajanāpāye tattvaṃ nāpaiti /
analyzed: yathā eva devadattasya sthāna upaveśana gamana śayana ādi avasthā bhede devadatta tvam na apaiti tathā jyotiṣṭoma ātmanaḥ saṃsthā antara upajana apāye tattvam na apaiti
translated: Just as Devadatta's being Devadatta does not cease even when there are differences in his states such as sitting, lying down, walking, etc., similarly the reality of the Jyotiṣṭoma does not cease when other sections are added or removed.

original: saṃsthānāṃ ca virodhādanyonyaṃ samāveśo nāsti jyotiṣṭomarūpaṃ tu sarvatrāvirudamanuvarttate /
analyzed: saṃsthānām ca virodhāt anyonyam samāveśaḥ na asti jyotiṣṭoma rūpam tu sarvatra avirudam anuvarttate
translated: And because of the contradiction between the sections, there is no mutual inclusion, but the form of the Jyotiṣṭoma continues everywhere without contradiction.

original: sa ca jyotiṣṭomaḥ phalāya coditaḥ jyotiṣṭomena svargākāmo yajeteti /
analyzed: sa ca jyotiṣṭomaḥ phalāya coditaḥ jyotiṣṭomena svarga a kāmaḥ yajeta iti
translated: And that Jyotiṣṭoma is enjoined for the sake of the result: One who desires heaven should perform the Jyotiṣṭoma.

original: tathokthyādisaṃsthānāmapi paśukāma ukthyaṃ gṛhṇīyādityādi phale vidhānam /
analyzed: tathā ukthya ādi saṃsthānām api paśu kāmaḥ ukthyam gṛhṇīyāt ityādi phale vidhānam
translated: Similarly, for the Ukthya and other sections, there is the injunction of the result: One who desires cattle should take the Ukthya, etc.

original: tamevaṃvidhaṃ jyotiṣṭomaṃ prakṛtya dokṣagoyādayo dharmāḥ samānātāste saṃdihyante kiṃ sarvasaṃsthajyotiṣṭomohe śenāmnātā uta kevalāgniṣṭomasaṃsthoheśeneti /
analyzed: tam evaṃvidham jyotiṣṭomam prakṛtya dokṣa goya ādayaḥ dharmāḥ samānātāḥ te saṃdihyante kim sarva saṃstha jyotiṣṭoma ūhe śena āmnātāḥ uta kevala agniṣṭoma saṃsthā ūheśena iti
translated: With that Jyotiṣṭoma as the subject, the Dharmas beginning with the Dohakā are mentioned. They are doubted: Are they mentioned for the Jyotiṣṭoma with all the sections, or only for the Jyotiṣṭoma with the Agnistoma section alone?

original: na tvayamupanyāso yuktaḥ na hi dharmasaṃbandhavelāyāmuddiśyamānasya jyotiṣṭomasya kā citsaṃsthā vi śeṣaṇatvena śrūyate /
analyzed: na tu ayam upanyāsaḥ yuktaḥ na hi dharma saṃbandha velāyām uddiśyamānasya jyotiṣṭomasya kā cit saṃsthā vi śeṣaṇa tvena śrūyate
translated: But this statement is not proper. For at the time of connection with Dharma, no particular form of the Jyotiṣṭoma mentioned is heard as a qualifier.

original: yadyapi kathaṃ cicchūyaṃta tathā 'pyuddiśyamāna viśeṣaṇatvānna vivayeta na cokthyādigrahaṇāṃśena jyotiṣṭomasya grāhakatvaṃ phalasādhanabhāvāddhi tavokthyādaya evetikarttavyatāvanto bhavanti jyotiṣṭomastabāśrayatvenopasarjanabhāvāntra dharmagrahaṇayogyo vijñāyate /
analyzed: yadi api katham cit śūyaṃta tathā pi uddiśyamāna viśeṣaṇa tvāt na vivayeta na ca ukthya ādi grahaṇa aṃśena jyotiṣṭomasya grāhaka tvam phala sādhana bhāvāt hi tava ukthya ādayaḥ eva itikarttavyatāvantaḥ bhavanti jyotiṣṭomaḥ taba āśraya tvena upasarjana bhāvāt tra dharma grahaṇa yogyaḥ vijñāyate
translated: Even if it is somehow heard, it would not be distinguished due to being a qualifier of what is mentioned. And the Jyotiṣṭoma is not the apprehender by the part that includes the Ukthya etc. Because the Ukthyas etc. are the means to the result along with the procedure. The Jyotiṣṭoma is known to be subordinate by being the basis, and is fit to take the Dharma.

original: jyotiṣṭomena svargakāma iti caitaḍākyagatasya vibhāgāditi ka pu pā /
analyzed: jyotiṣṭomena svarga kāmaḥ iti ca etad ḍākya gatasya vibhāgāt iti ka pu pā
translated: And the sentence One desiring heaven by the Jyotiṣṭoma is divided into two parts.

original: tṛtīyādhyāyasya ṣaṣṭhaḥ pāda /🔽jyotiṣṭomasya dharmasaṃbandhaḥ sarvasaṃsthāsvaviśiṣṭa ityagniṣṭomasaṃsthamevetyayuktam ata evaṃ vaktavyam /
analyzed: tṛtīya adhyāyasya ṣaṣṭhaḥ pāda  jyotiṣṭomasya dharma saṃbandhaḥ sarva saṃsthāsu aviśiṣṭaḥ iti agniṣṭoma saṃstham eva iti ayuktam atas evam vaktavyam
translated: The sixth section of the third chapter.🔽It is not proper to say that the connection of the Jyotiṣṭoma with Dharma is the same in all forms, so it is only in the form of the Agnistoma. Therefore, it should be stated thus.

analyzed: kim jyotiṣṭomasya eva ukthya ādīnām api saṃsthānām iti
translated: Is this the Dharma of only the Jyotiṣṭoma, or of the forms like the Ukthya etc. as well?

analyzed: tat ca evam samarthanīyam etat eva granthena uktam iti
translated: And that is to be established in this way, as stated by the text.

original: ya dyapi saṃsthābhiīrmā gṛhyante tathā 'pi tāsāṃ svayamakriyātmakatvāt jyotiṣṭoma evāśrayatvād hārambhavatīti kiṃ sarvasaṃsthaṃ prakṛtyetyāha /
analyzed: ya di api saṃsthābhiḥ īrmāḥ gṛhyante tathā tāsām svayam akriyā ātmaka tvāt jyotiṣṭomaḥ eva āśraya tvāt ha ārambhavatī iti kim sarva saṃstham prakṛtyā iti āha
translated: Even though the forms are grasped, since they themselves are not of the nature of action, the Jyotiṣṭoma alone becomes the substratum due to its being the basis, so what is the use of taking the entire form as the subject?

original: kiṃ dvārabhūtaṃ phalavantaṃ ca prakṛtyota phalavanta mevetyartha /
analyzed: kim dvāra bhūtam phalavantam ca prakṛtyā uta phalavantam meva iti artha
translated: The meaning is: is it taken as the subject that which is merely the door, or that which is endowed with a result, or only that which is endowed with a result?

original: yadā ca kevalajyotiṣṭomārthatvaṃ tadā tahasādhāraṇatvātpariśeṣāhā 'gniṣṭomasaṃsthasyaiva jāyataiti tatsaṃsthasya vyapadeśa /
analyzed: yadā ca kevala jyotiṣṭoma artha tvam tadā gniṣṭoma saṃsthasya eva jāyate iti tad saṃsthasya vyapadeśa
translated: And when it has the sole purpose of the Jyotiṣṭoma, then due to its being common to that, by the method of difference, it is produced only of the Jyotiṣṭoma form, so it is designated as of that form.

original: ukthyādiṣu hi yadyapi jyotiṣṭomasyāpi grāhakatvamasti tathā 'pi tanna vyajyate kimukthyādigṛhītā dharmā etasya dvāratvāddhavantyutātmīyaphala sādhanatvāditi agniṣṭomasaṃsthā cāsya nijamaṅgamatastatsaṃstho gṛhṇantrayaṃ gṛhṇātīti śakyate vatam /
analyzed: ukthya ādiṣu hi yadi api jyotiṣṭomasya api grāhaka tvam asti tathā tat na vyajyate kim ukthya ādi gṛhītāḥ dharmāḥ etasya dvāra tvāt havanti uta ātmīya phala sādhana tvāt iti agniṣṭoma saṃsthā ca asya nijam aṅgam atas tad saṃsthaḥ gṛhṇan trayam gṛhṇāti iti śakyate
translated: For in the Ukthya etc., even though the Jyotiṣṭoma also has the nature of a grasper, that is not manifested. How can it be said that the dharmas grasped by the Ukthya etc. belong to it because it is the door, or because it is the means of accomplishing its own result? And the Jyotiṣṭoma form is its own limb, therefore it can be said that one who grasps it grasps the three, as one of the Jyotiṣṭoma form.

analyzed: tasmāt samyak upanyastam dharma sādhāraṇyam ca upadeśa atideśābhyām pakṣa haye pi abhyupagamyate eva iti vidhāna grahaṇam
translated: Therefore, the general nature of Dharma is properly presented and accepted even in the case of the Pāśha, through instruction and extension. Thus, the mention of injunction.

original: kiṃ prāptaṃ jyotiṣṭomena saha samānaṃ saṃsthānāṃ dharmavidhānam /
analyzed: kim prāptam jyotiṣṭomena saha samānam saṃsthānām dharma vidhānam
translated: What is the conclusion? The injunction of Dharma for the Saṃsthās is the same as for the Jyotiṣṭoma.

original: kutaḥ prakaraṇāviśeṣāt jyotiṣṭomo hi phalavatvādupajātakathaṃbhāvastadanuvṛttisannidhau samāmnātān gha man gṛhṇāti na jyotiṣṭomatvena taccokthyā donāmeteṣveva dharmeṣu sarvamaviśiṣṭamupadeśāsaṃbhave cātideśo bhavati tasmādupadeśa eva sādhāraṇa iti /
analyzed: kutas prakaraṇa aviśeṣāt jyotiṣṭomaḥ hi phalavat tvāt upajāta kathaṃbhāvaḥ tad anuvṛtti sannidhau samāmnātān gha gṛhṇāti na jyotiṣṭoma tvena tat ca ukthya ādonām eteṣu eva dharmeṣu sarvam aviśiṣṭam upadeśa asaṃbhave ca atideśaḥ bhavati tasmāt upadeśaḥ eva sādhāraṇaḥ iti
translated: Why? Because of the absence of difference in context. The Jyotiṣṭoma, being related to a result, has a natural connection with the Saṃsthās. It accepts the Dharmas mentioned in its vicinity, not because of being Jyotiṣṭoma, but because of being related to it. And this is all the same for the Ukthya and other Saṃsthās. And when instruction is not possible, extension takes place. Therefore, instruction alone is common.

analyzed: vyapadeśaḥ ca tulya vat
translated: And the designation is like the equal.

original: jyaśeṣasya pratipattiṃ vidadhattu lyavatsaṃsthā kratuprakaraṇa saṃbandhitvena korttayati /
analyzed: pratipattim vidadhat tu lyavat saṃsthā kratu prakaraṇa saṃbandhi tvena korttayati
translated: The Saṃsthā, which lays down the understanding of the subsidiary, connects it with the connection to the context of the sacrifice, as if it were equal.

analyzed: yadi ā agniṣṭomaḥ juhoti tantravārtike
translated: If one offers the Agniṣṭoma oblation,

original: yadākthyastenaiva śeṣeṇa paridhimanakti yadyatiśavaḥ etadeva homayajuṭīmagne pṛtsa martyamiti japan havinaṃ pratipadyeteti ato vijñāyate sarvo 'ṅgavidhiḥ sādhāraṇa iti /
analyzed: yat ākthyaḥ tena eva śeṣeṇa paridhim anakti yadi atiśavaḥ etat eva homa yajuṭīm agne pṛtsa martyam iti japan havinam pratipadyeta iti atas vijñāyate sarvaḥ ṅga vidhiḥ sādhāraṇaḥ iti
translated: When the Aṛk-hyas are performed, he anoints the enclosing sticks with the same remaining (material). If there is a surplus, he should enter the Havirdhāna shed, reciting the Yaju-mantra O Agni, crush the mortal (Taitt. Sam. 1.1.1), thinking This is the Homa-Yaju-mantra. From this it is understood that all the injunctions of subsidiaries are common.

original: sāmānyato dṛṣṭamivāyuktamuktaṃ yadi hi vākyavaśena kiṃ citprakaraṇānātaṃ saṃsthābhiḥ saṃbadhyate tataḥ kimasaṃyukta saṃbandhenāpi yukta bhavitum /🔽na hi hādaśāhīnasyetyādiṣu śeṣadhama/
analyzed: sāmānyatas dṛṣṭam iva ayuktam uktam yadi hi vākya vaśena kim cit prakaraṇa ānātam saṃsthābhiḥ saṃbadhyate tatas kim asaṃyukta saṃbandhena api bhavitum  na hi hādaśa ahīnasya ityādiṣu
translated: It is said that this is like a general rule, but it is not proper. For if something enjoined by the context is connected with the forms by the power of the sentence, then is it proper to be connected even without being enjoined?

analyzed: śaṅgitam
translated: For in the passages beginning with of the twelve-day sacrifice (Taitt. Sam. 1.1.1), the subsidiary nature of the subsidiaries is not suspected to be for the sake of the incomplete.

original: yāvaddacanaṃ cayitvāddacanānāmityevaṃ vyācaṣṭe yadi hi sāmānya vihitamagniṣṭomasaṃsthasyaiva syāhinā 'pi ta dupādānena tadaṅgatvasiḍennavāgniṣṭomaṃ saṃkīrtta yedyatastu saṃkīrttayati ato manyāmahe nūnamaviśeṣitamagniṣṭomasya na labhyate /
analyzed: yāvaddacanam vyācaṣṭe yadi hi sāmānya vihitam agniṣṭoma saṃsthasya eva syāḥ ahinā tad upādānena tad aṅga tva siḍet nava agniṣṭomam saṃkīrtta yet yatas tu saṃkīrttayati atas manyāmahe nūnam aviśeṣitam agniṣṭomasya na labhyate
translated: He explains thus: Because of the statement, the statements are to be accepted as far as possible. If what is enjoined in general were only of the form of the Agnistoma, then even if it were obtained by the addition, its subsidiary nature would not be stated. Therefore, since it is stated, we think that what is not specified is not obtained for the Agnistoma.

original: taccaivaṃ na labhyate yadi saṃsthānāmapi sādhāraṇaṃ prakaraṇam /
analyzed: tat ca evam na labhyate yadi saṃsthānām api sādhāraṇam prakaraṇam
translated: And that is not obtained in this way if the context is common even to the forms.

analyzed: kevala jyotiṣṭoma prakaraṇa pakṣe tu punaḥśrutiḥ anadhikā syāt
translated: But in the case of the context of the Jyotiṣṭoma alone, the repetition would be superfluous.

original: tathokthyādīnāmapi yadi prakaraṇamasti tato 'nyataraniraṇārthaṃ yadiśabdopabacaṃ grahaṇaṃ yuktamaprakṛtatve tu hādaśāhīnasyetivaddinaiva yadiśabdena saṃbandhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: tathā ukthya ādīnām api yadi prakaraṇam asti tatas grahaṇam yuktam aprakṛta tve tu hādaśa ahīnasya iti vat dinā eva yadi śabdena saṃbandhaḥ syāt
translated: Similarly, in the case of the Ukthya etc., if there is a context, then it is proper to take them up with the word 'yadi' for the purpose of determining one or the other. But if they are not in the context, then like the Ahīna of twelve days, the connection would be only with the word 'yadi'.

original: na hi jyotiṣṭomaprakaraṇe sthitasyaivaṃ vādo yujyate /
analyzed: na hi jyotiṣṭoma prakaraṇe sthitasya evam vādaḥ yujyate
translated: For such a statement is not proper when one is situated in the context of the Jyotiṣṭoma.

analyzed: yadi jyotiṣṭhomaḥ tatas ha ādaśa ahaḥ tatas mukam iti
translated: If it is the Jyotiṣṭoma, then this; if it is the Ahīna of twelve days, then that.

original: aneka sannihitāpekṣaṃ hya tadvacanaṃ bhavatyato 'pi samānaṃ prakaraṇam /
analyzed: aneka sannihita apekṣam samānam prakaraṇam
translated: For that statement would be in relation to the many present. Therefore, the context is the same.

analyzed: idam aparam liṅgam
translated: This is another indicative mark.

original: āgneyamajamagniṣṭoma ālabhetendrāgna mukyye hi toya maindraṃ dṛṣṇiṃ ṣoḍaśini tṛtīyamiti /
analyzed: āgneyam ajam agniṣṭome ālabheta indra agna mukyye hi toye mā aindram dṛṣṇim ṣoḍaśini tṛtīyam iti
translated: One should sacrifice the black-necked animal dedicated to Agni at the Agniṣṭoma, the one dedicated to Indra-Agni at the Ukthya, and the one dedicated to Indra at the Ṣoḍaśin.

original: samānavidhā natve pūrvapūrvo hyuttarottaratva pratyakṣaśrutatvāt kriyataiti dvitīya tṛtīya darśanamupapadyate /
analyzed: samāna vidhā na tve pūrva pūrvaḥ hi uttara uttara tva pratyakṣa śruta tvāt kriyate eti dvitīya tṛtīya darśanam upapadyate
translated: The injunction is the same. For the latter is done in accordance with the former, because it is directly stated. Therefore, the second and third views are proper.

original: vikārapakṣe tu pratyakṣaśrutairaindrāgnādibhirāgneye bādhite sarvacaika eva syāt /
analyzed: vikāra pakṣe tu pratyakṣa śrutaiḥ aindrāgna ādibhiḥ āgneye bādhite sarva ca ekaḥ eva syāt
translated: But if the view be that the two are modifications of the Agnèya, then, the Aindragna and the rest, being directly mentioned, would set aside the Agnèya and there would be only one.

original: nanu ca pratyakṣa śrutatve'pi saṃsthāntare saṃsthāntarāsaṃbhavātṛtīyādhyāyasya ṣaṣṭhaḥ pāda /
analyzed: nanu ca pratyakṣa śruta tve pi saṃsthā antare saṃsthā antara asaṃbhavāt ṛtīya adhyāyasya ṣaṣṭhaḥ pāda
translated: But even though the Aindragna and the rest are directly mentioned, yet, inasmuch as the other Terminuses are not possible in the other Terminuses, the Agnèya would be the only one to be performed.

analyzed: nirnimittaḥ pūrva pūrvaḥ na prāpnoti
translated: And in that case, there would be no reason for the Agnèya to be performed first, even though it is mentioned first.

original: yo hyagniṣṭomastotre samāpyate so'gniṣṭomo na taddanmātraṃ yaścokthyādiṣu samāpyate nāsau pūrvatra samāpto bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi agniṣṭoma stotre samāpyate saḥ ugniṣṭomaḥ na tad dat mātram yaḥ ca ukthya ādiṣu samāpyate na asau pūrvatra samāptaḥ bhavati
translated: That is to say, that which is completed in the AgnistomaStotra is the Agnistoma and not merely the Agnistomadayamatra and that which is completed in the Ukthya and the rest is not the Agnistoma that has been completed in the first Terminus.

analyzed: tena dvitīya darśanāt āpramaṅgaḥ pakṣa haye tulyaḥ
translated: Thus then, even under the view that the two are modifications of the Agnèya, the incongruity of the second Terminus not being performed is equally applicable.

original: satyaṃ saṃsthāni mittatve tulyaḥ stotranimittatve tu samuccayaḥ /
analyzed: satyam saṃsthāni mitta tve tulyaḥ stotra nimitta tve tu samuccayaḥ
translated: True, the incongruity is the same, if the two are regarded as having the Terminuses for their cause. But if they be regarded as having the Stotra for their cause, then there is a combination of the two.

original: tathā ca bhāṣyakāra āha dve hi tatra nimitta agniṣṭomastovamukthyastotraṃ ceti siḍavadetadvavauti /
analyzed: tathā ca bhāṣyakāraḥ āha dve hi tatra nimitta agniṣṭoma stovam ukthya stotram ca iti siḍa vat etat vavauti
translated: And it is in this sense that the Bhashya has declared that there are two causes of the two Terminuses the AgnistomaStotra and the UkthyaStotra.

original: kathaṃ puna saṃsthāslovasādhāraṇāgniṣṭomādimamabhihāre tulye stotranimittatvamevāṅgīkriyate na saṃsthānimittatvam /
analyzed: katham punar tulye stotra nimitta tvam eva aṅgīkriyate na saṃsthā nimitta tvam
translated: But how is it that, in the case of the Agnistoma and the rest, which are common to all the Terminuses, the cause of the two Terminuses is accepted to be the Stotra and not the Terminus?

analyzed: tāsām hi phalavavena prayojanava tvāt akleśena eva nimitta tvam āpadyate
translated: For they, having the purpose of producing results, become the cause without difficulty.

analyzed: tatra ke cit āhuḥ
translated: Regarding this, some say:

original: satyapi śabdasādhāraṇye śāsvasya mahāviṣayatvānugrahārthaṃ stotranimittatvāśrayaṇamityathavā stotraviśeṣitāyā eva saṃsthāyā evaṃśabdakatvātpūrvatarapratītaviśeṣānimittatvasaṃbhave javanyavi śeṣyanimittatvakalpanā na yuktā /
analyzed: sati api śabda sādhāraṇye śāsvasya mahā viṣaya tva anugraha artham stotra nimitta tva āśrayaṇam iti athavā stotra viśeṣitāyāḥ eva saṃsthāyāḥ evaṃśabdaka tvāt pūrvatara pratīta viśeṣa a nimitta tva saṃbhave javanī avi śeṣya nimitta tva kalpanā na yuktā
translated: Even though the word is common, the basis for the cause being the praise is accepted for the sake of favoring the great scope of the eternal. Or, because the form qualified by praise itself has the nature of the word 'thus', when it is possible to be the cause of the previously known qualification, it is not proper to assume the cause of the non-qualified.

original: yahā '' kṛtyadhikaragānyāyenaitra stotreṣu mukhyaḥ śabdaḥ saṃsthāyāṃ lākṣaṇikaḥ /
analyzed: yahā kṛti adhikaragā nyāyena etra stotreṣu mukhyaḥ śabdaḥ saṃsthāyām lākṣaṇikaḥ
translated: Here, by the principle of the section on what is to be done, the primary word in the praises is figurative in the form.

analyzed: śruti asaṃbhave ca lakṣaṇā
translated: And when there is no possibility of the Vedic text, figurative meaning should be assumed.

analyzed: śaknoti ca stotram api saptamau nirdeśāt nimitta tvam pratipattum
translated: And the praise is also able to understand the causal nature from the seventh case indication.

analyzed: niṣphalānām api ca bhedana ādaunām vacana sāmarthyāt nimitta tvam iṣṭam
translated: And the causal nature of the fruitless acts like breaking etc. is accepted by the power of the statement.

analyzed: atha vā saṃdigdheṣu vākya śeṣāt iti evam stotra āśrayaṇam
translated: Or, in doubtful cases, the praise is accepted in this way by the remainder of the sentence.

original: sa tyapi vā saṃsthānāṃ mukhyatve vyavadhāraṇakalpanayā vākyaśeṣeṇa stotraparigrahaḥ /
analyzed: sa vā saṃsthānām mukhya tve vyavadhāraṇa kalpanayā vākya śeṣeṇa stotra parigrahaḥ
translated: Or even if the form is primary, the Stotra is included by the supplementary passage through the assumption of restriction.

analyzed: evam hi śrūyate
translated: For it is heard thus:

analyzed: āgneyam ajam agniṣṭome ālabheta śrāgneyaḥ hi agniṣṭāmaḥ iti
translated: One should offer a tawny animal to Agni in the Agnistoma, for the Agnistoma belongs to Agni.

original: katarasminnagniṣṭomeya āgneyaḥ stotrasya ca stutibhāgagnidevatā vidyate na saṃsthāyāḥ /
analyzed: katarasmin agniṣṭomeyaḥ āgneyaḥ stotrasya ca stuti bhāgaḥ agni devatā vidyate na saṃsthāyāḥ
translated: In which Agnistoma is the animal to be offered to Agni? The Stotra has the deity Agni as its praiseworthy part, not the form.

original: sā hi vyāpāraparityāgā tmakatvodabhāvabhūtā na cābhāvasya devatayā kāryyamasti /
analyzed: sā hi vyāpāra parityāgā ātmaka tva udabhāva bhūtā na ca abhāvasya devatayā kāryyam asti
translated: For that consists of the abandonment of activity and is essentially non-existent, and there is no effect of non-existence by a deity.

analyzed: botantravārtika
translated: The Varttika on the Bhotatantra.

original: yāgābhyāse 'pi hi yā devatā sā tasyaivāgneyatvaṃ karoti na saṃsthāyāḥ /
analyzed: yāga abhyāse hi yā devatā sā tasya eva āgneya tvam karoti na saṃsthāyāḥ
translated: Even in the repetition of the sacrifice, the deity makes that sacrifice belong to Agni, not the form.

analyzed: na ca saḥ eva saṃsthā
translated: And that is not the same form.

analyzed: tad uttara kāla audāsaunya vacana tvāt saṃ pūrvasya tiṣṭhateḥ
translated: Because the word tiṣṭhate with sam at the beginning denotes the state after that.

analyzed: na ca anya gatayā devatayā nyasya vyapadaśaḥ bhavati
translated: And one cannot be designated by the deity belonging to another.

analyzed: tathā ukthya ṣoḍaśinoḥ api darśayitavyam
translated: In the same way, it should be shown for the Ukthya and Ṣoḍaśin also.

analyzed: api ca aindrāgnāni ukthyāni iti sphuṭam eva stotra grahaṇam
translated: Moreover, the clear mention of the Stotra is in the words the Ukthyas are for Indra and Agni.

analyzed: na hi saṃsthā ukthyānī ti anena śabdena ucyate
translated: For the form is not denoted by the word Ukthyas.

analyzed: tasmāt sati stotra nimitta tve yuktaḥ samuccayaḥ iti
translated: Therefore, when there is a reason for praise, combination is proper.

analyzed: nanu vikāra pakṣe pi adṛṣṭa artha tvāt paśu yāgānām anyonya kāryya āpatti asaṃbhavāt upapadyate eva samuccayaḥ tathā hi
translated: But even in the case of modification, because the animal sacrifices are for unseen results, the impossibility of mutual dependence of actions justifies combination. Thus:

analyzed: na ānumānika mātram yat tat pratyakṣeṇa bādhyate
translated: What is merely inferred is not contradicted by perception.

analyzed: virodhe sati bādhaḥ hi virodhaḥ ca eka gocaraḥ
translated: For contradiction is when there is conflict, and conflict is on the same object.

original: sarve hi paśavaḥ sarvatra prāpnuvanto yatpūrvasaṃsthāsu pare na bhavanti tannimittābhāvātpratyakṣeṇa tu nimittena pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ paratra vākyātprāpnoti /
analyzed: sarve hi paśavaḥ sarvatra prāpnuvantaḥ yat pūrva saṃsthāsu pare na bhavanti tad nimitta abhāvāt pratyakṣeṇa tu nimittena pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ paratra vākyāt prāpnoti
translated: For all animals, when they are reached everywhere, they do not occur in the previous positions due to the absence of a reason. But by the reason of perception, each previous one is reached in the subsequent one by the sentence.

original: tatra kiṃ samākhyayaikakāyaṃtvaṃ kalpayitvā bādhavikalpayoranyatara śrāśrīyatāmuta vākyaprāptasamuccayānurodhena kāryyānyatvaṃ kalyatāmiti vākyabalīyastvātmamuccayena bhavitavyam /
analyzed: tatra kim samākhyayā eka kāyaṃtvam kalpayitvā bādha vikalpayoḥ anyataraḥ śrāśrīyatām uta vākya prāpta samuccaya anurodhena kāryya anyatvam kalyatām iti vākya balīyaḥ tva ātmamuccayena bhavitavyam
translated: There, should the unity of the group be assumed by the designation, and then one of contradiction or option be accepted, or should the difference of actions be assumed in accordance with the combination obtained by the sentence? Due to the strength of the sentence, there should be combination.

original: yathā prayājānuyājādaunāṃ satyapi samākhyaikatve vākyasāmayatkāyyonyatvaṃ samuccayaśca /
analyzed: yathā prayāja anuyāja ādaunām sati api samākhyā ekatve samuccayaḥ ca
translated: Just as in the case of the prayāja and anuyāja offerings, even though there is unity of designation, there is difference of action and combination due to the power of the sentence.

original: atideśe punaḥ samākhyayā kāvyakatvam atideśena kāryyānyatvaṃ tenāpi samutantravārtike /
analyzed: atideśe punar samākhyayā kāvyaka tvam atideśena kāryya anyatvam tena api
translated: In the case of extension, on the other hand, the connection with the original injunction is by the name, and the difference in the action is by the extension. Therefore, in the Sāmutrāyaṇī Brāhmaṇa,

analyzed: na cayaḥ
translated: and in the Nāciketa.

original: tasmāñcopadeśāntargatā samākhyaiva baloyasīti tatkṛtaṃ kāyaikatvamāśritya virodhāddāghaḥ parigṛhyeta /
analyzed: tasmāt ca upadeśa antargatā samākhyā eva baloyasī iti tat kṛtam kāya ekatvam āśritya virodhāt dāghaḥ parigṛhyeta
translated: Therefore, the name, which is included in the instruction, is stronger. Relying on the unity of the action created by that, the contradiction should be accepted by the selection of the one with the name.

analyzed: vikāre ca prakṛti liṅga saṃyoga apekṣā vidyate eti kāvya āpattiḥ vijñāyate
translated: And in the modification, there is a need for the connection with the gender of the original. Therefore, the connection with the original is understood.

original: na tu samānavidhipakṣe prakṛtiliṅgasaṃyogaḥ kaścidona kāryyāpattiravadhārthyeta /
analyzed: na tu samāna vidhi pakṣe prakṛti liṅga saṃyogaḥ kāryya āpattiḥ avadhārthyeta
translated: But in the case of the same injunction, there is no connection with the gender of the original. Therefore, the connection with the action should not be sought.

original: ke cittvāḍaḥ /🔽samānavidhitve parasparānapekṣairdravyadevatāsaṃyogaiḥ kamabhedo 'vasīyate vikāre punaratideśaprāptayāgānuvādena guṇamātraṃ vidhīyate tataścaika eva yāga syāt na dvitīyāṭya iti /
analyzed: ke cittvāḍaḥ  samāna vidhi tve paraspara anapekṣaiḥ dravya devatā saṃyogaiḥ kamabhedaḥ vasīyate vikāre punar atideśa prāpta yāga anuvādena guṇa mātram vidhīyate tatas ca ekaḥ eva syāt na iti
translated: But some say:🔽In the case of the same injunction, the connection between the substance and the deity is determined by the mutual independence. In the modification, on the other hand, the quality alone is enjoined by the restatement of the sacrifice obtained by extension. Therefore, there would be only one sacrifice, not a second.

original: sa tvayaṃ guṇavidhiraindrāgne saṃbhavennendra sarasvatyora ne kadravyadevatāvidhānena vākyabhedapramagādekāntena karmāntaratā /
analyzed: sa tu ayam guṇa vidhiḥ aindrāgne saṃbhavet na indra sarasvatyoḥ a ne ka dravya devatā vidhānena vākya bheda pramagāt ekāntena karma antara tā
translated: But this injunction of the quality would be possible in the Aindrāgna, not in the Indrasarasvati. Due to the inevitable split of the sentence by the injunction of the substance and deity, it is definitely a different action.

original: tenaivaṃ samarthanīyaṃ kamantaramevadaṃ vidhīyamānaṃ kimapūrvāntarasāvanatvaṃ pratipadyatāmuta prākṛtasavanīyāpūrvameva sādhayatviti pūrvaklaptāpūrvaviniyogamātre saṃbhavati nāpūrvāntara kalpayitvā tatsādhanatvādhyavasānaṃ yuktam /🔽tathā 'tideśaprāptasavanīyāpūrvamapi sādhanāpekṣāvelāyāṃ pratyakṣa śrutasavanīyaparityāgena na savanīyāntaraṃ gṛhṇāti sarvāpekṣāsu prakṛtāsaṃbhavanāma kṛtagrahaṇādyāgagato 'pi vyāpāra prākṛtenaivāpūrveṇa klṛptasaṃbandho na śaknotyapūrvāntarasaṃvandhaṃ pratipattum /
analyzed: tena evam samarthanīyam vidhīyamānam kim apūrva antara sāvana tvam pratipadyatām uta prākṛta savanīya apūrvam eva sādhayatu iti pūrva klapta apūrva viniyoga mātre saṃbhavati na apūrva antara kalpayitvā tad sādhana tva adhyavasānam yuktam  tathā atideśa prāpta savanīya apūrvam api sādhana apekṣā velāyām pratyakṣa śruta savanīya parityāgena na savanīya antaram gṛhṇāti sarva apekṣāsu kṛta grahaṇāt yāga gataḥ vyāpāra prākṛtena eva apūrveṇa klṛpta saṃbandhaḥ na śaknoti apūrva antara saṃvandham pratipattum
translated: Therefore, it should be argued thus: When this is being enjoined, should it be taken as producing a new unseen result, or as accomplishing the original unseen result of the Savaniya? When it is possible to simply apply the previously established unseen result, it is not proper to assume a new unseen result and determine that it is its means.🔽Similarly, even the unseen result of the Savaniya obtained through extension, at the time of needing a means, does not take another Savaniya by abandoning the directly stated Savaniya. In all cases, it takes what is already established due to the impossibility of the original. Even the operation related to the sacrifice, whose connection with the original unseen result is established, cannot ascertain a connection with a new unseen result.

original: kathamakla ptasāmarthyaṃ savanauyāntara prākṛtamapūrvaṃ sādhayatoti cet yathetarasminpakṣa 'pūrvāntaraṃ yāgagataṃ vyāpāramityadoṣaḥ /
analyzed: katham a klapta sāmarthyam prākṛtam apūrvam sādhayataḥ iti ced yathā itarasmin pakṣa pūrva antaram yāga gatam vyāpāram iti adoṣaḥ
translated: If it is asked how the original unseen result of another Savaniya can accomplish what has not yet been established, it is not a fault, just as in the other case, it is the operation related to the sacrifice and the new unseen result.

analyzed: kaḥ tāḥ nayoḥ viśeṣaḥ
translated: What is the difference between these two?

analyzed: uccate
translated: It is said:

analyzed: yadā yāga gata vyāpāra gā
translated: When there is an operation related to the sacrifice,

original: pūrvāṇya pecyante na tadā vaikṛtasavanīyāpūrvaṃ klṛpta yattanminnaṃśa nipatadyadā punarapūrveṇa karmāpaṃcyate tadā savanīyatvaprakṛtiliṅgasaṃyuktaṃ karmāntaraṃ vidyamānamavabuddhya prākṛtaṃ nirākaroti /
analyzed: pūrvāṇi a pecyante na tadā vaikṛta savanīya apūrvam nipatat yadā punar apūrveṇa karma āpaṃcyate tadā savanīya tva prakṛti liṅga saṃyuktam karmāntaram vidyamānam avabuddhya prākṛtam nirākaroti
translated: The previously performed sacrifices are not destroyed, as their unseen potentiality has already been accomplished. When the unseen potentiality is again produced by a sacrifice, then the existing sacrifice connected with the archetype of the Savaniya is understood, and it rejects the original.

original: prakṛtī d cāpūrvakalpanāva marāhighīya mānasavanīya catuṣṭayātuniṣṇāṭyapūrvacatuṣṭayaṃ kalpyate /
analyzed: prakṛtī marāhighīya mānasavanīya kalpyate
translated: And in the case of modification, four unseen potentialities are assumed from the four Savaniya sacrifices, as the unseen potentiality is not assumed from the original.

original: na hi tatva jñāyate kataratyūvataravalṛptaṃ yamya sādhanāntarasaṃbandhaḥ syāt /
analyzed: na hi jñāyate yamya sādhana antara saṃbandhaḥ syāt
translated: For it is not known which unseen potentiality is assumed, which would be connected with another means of knowledge.

original: kamrmālocanavelāyāṃ hi karmmarūpāṇyeva dṛśyante apūrvakalpanā 'pi yugapaivatīti na jñāyate viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: hi karmma rūpāṇi eva dṛśyante apūrva kalpanā na yugapad evatī iti na jñāyate viśeṣaḥ
translated: For at the time of examining the sacrifice, only the forms of the sacrifice are seen, and it is not known that the assumption of the unseen potentiality is simultaneous.

original: vikārapakṣe tu jñāyate prākṛtasya pūrvataraṃ valṛptirityavaśyāvaheye'nyataramikammaṇi viprakṛṣṭaṃ prākṛtaṃ hātavyaṃ bhavatīti bādhaprasaṅgaḥ /
analyzed: vikāra pakṣe tu jñāyate prākṛtasya pūrvataram viprakṛṣṭam prākṛtam hātavyam bhavati iti bādha prasaṅgaḥ
translated: But in the case of modification, it is known that the assumption of the original is prior. Therefore, in the case of one of the two necessarily to be rejected, the remote original should be rejected, which leads to the undesirable consequence of contradiction.

original: nanu ca vikārapakṣe 'gniṣṭomasaṃsthāyā eva vikārabhūtāḥ parāḥ saṃsthā bhavanti na paraspareoti kevalasyāgneyasya prāptasya parairvādhātsarvava dvitīyastha darśanaṃ na syādityetāvanmātraṃ vaktavyaṃ kimucyate tṛtīyasya darśanaṃ na prāpnotīti /
analyzed: nanu ca vikāra pakṣe gniṣṭoma saṃsthāyāḥ eva vikāra bhūtāḥ parāḥ saṃsthāḥ bhavanti na paraspare iti kevalasya āgneyasya prāptasya paraiḥ vādhāt sarva dvitīyasya darśanam na syāt iti etāvat mātram vaktavyam kim ucyate tṛtīyasya darśanam na prāpnoti iti
translated: But in the case of modification, the higher forms of sacrifice are modifications of the Agnistoma form only, not of each other. So the only thing to be said is that the Agnèya, which is obtained, is set aside by the higher ones, and hence there would be no seeing of the second and third. What is the use of saying that there would be no seeing of the third?

original: naiṣa doṣo yadi tvayamaindrāgnādaunāṃ paratva prāptānāṃ bādhādadarśanaṃ brūyācano niṣpramāṇakaṃ va dedayaṃ tvadarśanamātraṃ vadati/
analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ yadi tu ayam aindrāgna ādaunām bādhāt adarśanam niṣpramāṇakam tu adarśana mātram vadati
translated: This is not a fault. If he were to say that there is no seeing due to the setting aside of the Aindragna etc., which have attained priority, then he would be stating something baseless. But he only says that there is no seeing.

original: taccāgneyasya bādhānmadhyamayoścāprāpterupapannameva tenaiva cāgneyo bādhyetetyāha na pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ pareṇeti /
analyzed: tat ca āgneyasya bādhāt madhyamayoḥ ca aprāpteḥ upapannam eva tena eva ca āgneyaḥ bādhyeta iti āha na pūrvaḥ pūrvaḥ pareṇa iti
translated: And that is quite possible, since the Agnèya is set aside, and the middle two are not obtained. And by that same (argument) it is said that the Agnèya is set aside, not the earlier by the later.

analyzed: tasmāt samāga vidhānāḥ
translated: Therefore, they are enjoined together.

analyzed: vikārāḥ tu kāma saṃyoge nityasya sama tvāt
translated: But in the case of modification, in connection with desire, the permanent is equal,

original: ukthaprādayaḥ samāptiviśeṣāḥ phalamāghanatvena codyamānāḥ samāptimantamāśrayamapekṣamāṇāḥ prakṛtaṃ japrotiṣṭomaṃ samāśrayantastasya nijāmagniṣṭomasaṃsthāṃ vikatya niviśantaiti vikāraśabdenīcyante /
analyzed: uktha pra ādayaḥ samāpti viśeṣāḥ phalam āghana tvena codyamānāḥ samāptimantam āśrayam apekṣamāṇāḥ prakṛtam samāśrayantaḥ tasya nijām agniṣṭoma saṃsthām vikatya niviśantaḥ eti vikāra śabdena icyante
translated: The particular completions such as Ukthya, etc., when enjoined as the result, require a basis that has a completion. They depend on the original Jyotiṣṭoma, which has its own completion in the form of the Agnistoma, and enter it by modifying it. Thus they are referred to by the word 'modification'.

original: nanu cokyaprādaunāṃ samāptitve siddhe samāptimadapekṣā bhavati /
analyzed: nanu ca ukya pra ādaunām samāpti tve siddhe samāptimat apekṣā bhavati
translated: But if the completion of the Ukthya, etc. is established, then there would be a requirement of something that has a completion.

analyzed: na ca eṣām prāk jayotiṣṭoma saṃbandhāt samāpti tva tantra vārtike
translated: And their completion is not established before their connection with the Jyotiṣṭoma.

analyzed: siddhiḥ ārambha madhya apekṣat tvāt samāpti śabda pravṛttaḥ
translated: The word 'completion' is used because it depends on the beginning and the middle.

original: atha prathamaṃ tatsaṃbandhastataḥ prathamaṃ kratvaryatve 'vadhārite phalasaṃbanvābhāvātsa nityasya samatvādityevamavikāratvaprasagaḥ /
analyzed: atha prathamam tad saṃbandhaḥ tatas prathamam kratu arya tve vadhārite phala saṃbanva abhāvāt sa nityasya sama tvāt iti evam avikāra tva prasagaḥ
translated: If the connection with it is first, then if their being for the sake of the sacrifice is determined first, then due to the absence of a connection with the result and the equality of the eternal, there would be the undesirable consequence of their not being modifications.

analyzed: kiñca
translated: And what else?

original: grahaṇādau ca vispaṣṭe codyamāle phalaṃ prati /
analyzed: grahaṇa ādau ca vispaṣṭe codya māle phalam prati
translated: And when the result is clearly enjoined with regard to the grasping, etc.,

analyzed: saṃsthānām phala saṃbandhaḥ katham adhyavasoyate
translated: how is the connection of the completions with the result determined?

original: nanu cokthyaṃ gṛhṇīyāditi sāmānādhikaragya prayogānāmapi grahaṇādīmāmeva syāt /
analyzed: nanu ca ukthyam gṛhṇīyāt iti sāmānādhikaragya prayogānām api grahaṇa ādi imām eva syāt
translated: But if it is said that one should grasp the Ukthya, then even for the usages with the same subject, there would be only the grasping, etc. of the Ukthya.

analyzed: na etat evam
translated: This is not so.

analyzed: ukthya stova saṃbandha ādi samāptiḥ eva ukthya śabdena ucyate tad saṃbandhāt gahā upacaryate
translated: The completion itself is spoken of by the word Ukthya due to its connection with the Ukthya hymn, and the cup is figuratively spoken of due to that connection.

original: na ca mukhyasaṃbhave gauṇaḥ parigṛhyate nityaṃ tu yajñasāmānādhikaraṇyenokthyādīnāṃ prayogo dṛśyate /
analyzed: na ca mukhya saṃbhave gauṇaḥ parigṛhyate nityam tu yajña sāmānādhikaraṇyena ukthya ādīnām prayogaḥ dṛśyate
translated: And when the primary is possible, the secondary is not accepted. But the application of Ukthya etc. is always seen in the same context as the sacrifice,

analyzed: ukdhyena yajeta ukthyaḥ yattaḥ iti
translated: as in One should sacrifice with the Ukthya, the Ukthya sacrifice.

analyzed: tathā ṣoḍaśinā yajate ṣoḍaśī yajñaḥ
translated: Similarly, One should sacrifice with the Shodashin, the Shodashin sacrifice.

original: na vai ṣoḍaśī nāma yajño'stauti sa cāntyantāvyatiriktasamāptivacanatve 'vakalpate na grahastovavacanave /
analyzed: na vai ṣoḍaśī nāma yajñoḥ stauti sa ca anti anta avyatirikta samāpti vacana tve na
translated: And it is not that there is a sacrifice named Shodashin. And that is possible if it denotes completion not separate from the end, not if it denotes the cup and hymn.

original: ṣoḍaśauti ca pulliṅgaḥ samāptivacana etṛtīyādhyāyasya ṣaṣṭhaḥ pāda /🔽ghopapadyate /
analyzed: ṣoḍaśa auti ca pulliṅgaḥ samāpti vacanaḥ  gha upapadyate
translated: And the word Shodashin in the masculine gender is appropriate if it denotes completion.🔽It is not appropriate if it denotes the cup, because that is neuter.

original: napuṃsakaliṅgasya stovavacanatvāt /" yastu puṃlliṅgaprayogaḥ stotre va ciddaśyate / yathaikaviṃśaḥ ṣoḍaśauti / sa gauṇa iti pratipattavyam /
analyzed: napuṃsaka liṅgasya stova vacana tvāt yaḥ tu pum liṅga prayogaḥ stotre cit daśyate yathā ekaviṃśaḥ sa gauṇaḥ iti pratipattavyam
translated: And the use of the masculine gender in the hymn, such as in The twenty-one, the Shodashin, should be understood as figurative.

original: iha vākyaśeṣe puṃlliṅgaḥ ṣoḍaśau pratoyate iti saṃsthāvacanaḥ /
analyzed: iha vākya śeṣe pum liṅgaḥ ṣoḍaśau pratoyate iti saṃsthā vacanaḥ
translated: Or in this supplementary passage, the Shodashin is mentioned in the masculine gender, so it denotes the completion.

original: atirājeśa prajākāmama iti vispaṣṭameva saṃsthāvacanatvaṃ na hi tava kriyāntaramupāttaṃ yajirapi ca ṇyarthopasarjanatvena śruta kleśena pradhānīkarttavyaḥ /
analyzed: atirāja īśa prajā kāmamaḥ iti vispaṣṭam eva saṃsthā vacana tvam na hi tava kriyā antaram upāttam yajiḥ api ca ṇi artha upasarjana tvena śruta kleśena pradhānīkarttavyaḥ
translated: The statement For one desiring offspring, the Atiratra clearly indicates the completion. For no other action is mentioned, and the verb yaji is heard as subordinate to the meaning of ni and should be made primary with effort.

original: tasmādrāvimatautya yā samāptiḥ sā phalena saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: yā samāptiḥ sā phalena saṃbadhyate
translated: Therefore, the completion that occurs in the Rāvi mantra is connected with the result.

original: yadi ca grahāstovayoḥ phalasaṃbandhaḥ syāttatastayoḥ kriyātvādāśrayāpekṣā nāstīti svatantrayoreva prayogaḥ prāpnoti tava ca prakaraṇāmnāna prayojanamukthyādiśabdaprayogaśca na jñāyeta /
analyzed: yadi ca graha āstovayoḥ phala saṃbandhaḥ syāt tatas tayoḥ kriyā tvāt āśraya apekṣā na asti iti svatantrayoḥ eva prayogaḥ prāpnoti tava ca prakaraṇa āmnāna prayojanam ukthya ādi śabda prayogaḥ ca na jñāyeta
translated: And if the Ukthya and Atirātra were connected with the result, then because they are actions, there would be no need for a basis, so their performance would be independent, and the purpose of their mention in the context and the use of the words Ukthya etc. would not be known.

analyzed: tasmāt api samāptayaḥ phalavatyaḥ
translated: Therefore, the completions also have results.

original: kathaṃ tu prāka ṛtusaṃbandhātsamāptitvamiti ke cittāvadāhuḥ /
analyzed: katham tu prāka ṛtu saṃbandhāt samāpti tvam iti ke cit tāvat āhuḥ
translated: But how can they be completions before their connection with the sacrifice? Some say this.

original: sapta somasaṃsthā agniṣṭhomo 'tyagniṣṭoma ukthya ṣoḍaśyatirāvo vājapeyo 'ptoyama iti smaraṇātso pramāvasamāptivacanatve siddhe kamāntarāṇyanādṛtya somayāgamātre 'pekṣite prakaraṇāt jotiṣṭomasyāśrayatvasiddhiriti /
analyzed: sapta soma saṃsthāḥ ukthya ṣoḍaśī atirāvaḥ vājapeya uptoyamaḥ iti smaraṇāt saḥ u pramāva samāpti vacana tve siddhe kama antarāṇi an ādṛtya soma yāga mātre pekṣite prakaraṇāt jotiṣṭomasya āśraya tva siddhiḥ iti
translated: The seven Soma-sacrifices are: Agnishtoma, Atyagnishtoma, Ukthya, Shodashin, Atiratra, Vajapeya, and Aptoryama. When it is established that the statement of completion refers to the Soma-sacrifice, then, disregarding other sacrifices, when only the Soma-sacrifice is required, the Jyotistoma is established as the substratum by context.

original: anye tu manyante protiṣṭomasya va cidamyāsaviśeṣe samātyantaraṃ vijñāyate yadutpadyamāna me vokthyādivyapadeśaṃ labhate phalasaṃbandhaṃ ca tatra śrutibalīyastvātmakaragālabhyaṃ kratvarthatvaṃ bādhyate /
analyzed: anye tu manyante protiṣṭomasya vā cit amyāsa viśeṣe samāti antaram vijñāyate vijñāyate vā ukthya ādi vyapadeśam labhate phala saṃbandham ca tatra śruti balīyaḥ tva ātma karagā labhyam kratu artha tvam bādhyate
translated: Others think that even in the Jyotistoma, a different completion is known, which is produced and obtains the designation of Ukthya etc. and is connected with the result. There, the purpose of the sacrifice is overridden by the strength of the Vedic text.

analyzed: yaḥ tu āśraya āśrayi saṃbandhaḥ saḥ anuguṇa tvāt āśrīyate
translated: But the relation of substratum and subsistent is accepted because it is favorable.

original: aparaṃ darśanam ukthyādiśabdavācyaṃ kimapi prathamameva phalena saṃbadyate kiṃ punasta divyapekṣāyāṃ vacanāntareṇa jagrotiṣṭomasya samāpyantara vijñāyate /
analyzed: aparam darśanam ukthya ādi śabda vācyam kim api prathamam eva phalena saṃbadyate kim vacana antareṇa vijñāyate
translated: Another view is that something denoted by the word Ukthya etc. is first connected with the result. What is that? When there is a requirement, it is known from another statement that it is the completion of the Jyotistoma.

original: yahā gyāsaviśeṣa evāyaṃ vacanāntarāt jayotiṣṭomasyānte niviśamāna pha lāya codyate tena vā tasminvā kratuḥ saṃtiṣṭhataiti saṃsthāśabdenābhidhīyate /
analyzed: gyāsa viśeṣaḥ eva ayam vacana antarāt jayotiṣṭomasya ante codyate tena vā tasmin vā kratuḥ saṃtiṣṭhate iti saṃsthā śabdena abhidhīyate
translated: For this particular act is enjoined for the sake of the result, as it is mentioned in another text, being included at the end of the Jyotiṣṭoma. Therefore, it is called a 'completion' by the word 'saṃsthā' (completion), in the sense that the sacrifice is completed by it or in it.

analyzed: ke cit panar manyante
translated: But some think differently.

original: saṃsthā nāmāntyayāgāmyāsānantaraṃ yā kriyoparatiḥ mā 'bhidhīyate na cākriyātmakatvāttasyāḥ phalamāghanatvaṃ yuktamatastadupalacito 'bhyāmaśrodyataiti /
analyzed: saṃsthā nāma yā kriyā uparatiḥ yā kriyā uparatiḥ abhidhīyate na ca akriyā ātmaka tvāt tasyāḥ phalam āghana tvam yuktam atas tad upalacitaḥ
translated: The 'completion' is the cessation of the rite that occurs after the last sacrifice, and it is not denoted by the word 'saṃsthā'. And because it is not an action, it cannot be connected with a result. Therefore, it is mentioned along with the two acts that are enjoined.

analyzed: anye tu āhuḥ
translated: But others say:

analyzed: vacanasya atibhāra abhāvāt abhāvaḥ codyamānaḥ nā eva virudhyate eti
translated: Since the text is not too heavy a burden, even the non-existence that is enjoined is not contradicted as being connected with a result.

analyzed: yathā kurvan vihitam karma iti avākaraṇasya asataḥ pratyavāya hetu tvam
translated: Just as the non-performance of an enjoined act is the cause of a bad result, even though it does not exist.

analyzed: atha vā sti eva ācaudāsaunya pratipatti rūpaḥ saṃkalpaḥ iti avirodhaḥ
translated: Or else, there is no contradiction, as there is the intention in the form of the attainment of the state of being a cow.

original: iha ca yathā guṇātphalaṃ bhavati yathā ca kāmyo guṇo nityamarthaṃ vikaroti tadindriyakāmādhikaraṇagodohanādhikaraṇābhyāmupasaṃharttavyam /
analyzed: iha ca yathā guṇāt phalam bhavati yathā ca kāmyaḥ guṇaḥ nityam artham vikaroti tat indriya kāma adhikaraṇa godohana adhikaraṇābhyām upasaṃharttavyam
translated: And here, how the result comes from the accessory, and how the optional accessory modifies the permanent act, that should be brought together by the Indriyākāma and Godohanā adhikaraṇas.

analyzed: tat darśayati
translated: He shows that.

analyzed: guṇāt evaṃjātīyake phala a niṣpattiḥ
translated: The result of such qualities is the non-production of the fruit.

analyzed: evam hi śrūyate
translated: For it is heard thus:

original: paśukāma ukthyaṃ gṛhṇīyānna jotiṣṭomakāma ukthāgṛhaṇakāmo vetyanena kratvarthatvaṃ nirākaroti/
analyzed: paśu kāmaḥ ukthyam gṛhṇīyāt na jotiṣṭoma kāmaḥ ukthāgṛhaṇa kāmaḥ vā iti anena kratu artha tvam nirākaroti
translated: One desiring cattle should take the Ukthya, not one desiring the Jyotistoma or one desiring the Ukthya-taking. By this, he denies the purpose of the sacrifice.

original: kratvarthatve hi satyantareṇāpi kāmapadopabandhaṃ tadupakārakamevaitatkarttavyamiti vijñāyate /
analyzed: kratu artha tve hi sati antareṇa api kāma pada upabandham tad upakārakam eva etat karttavyam iti vijñāyate
translated: For if it were for the purpose of the sacrifice, even without the connection with the word 'desire', it is understood that this should be done only as a helper of that.

original: yadi cokthāgṛhaṇasvarūpamātraṃ cikīrṣyata tato 'rthādukthāgṛhaṇakāmasyaiṣa vidhirbhavedāsyaivaṃ prārthanamukthāgṛhāstra rūpamā kathaṃ nirvarttatāmiti tatta / iyamapi paśukāmopādānādanavaklṛptam /
analyzed: yadi ca ukthāgṛhaṇa sva rūpa mātram cikīrṣyata tatas ṛthāt ukthāgṛhaṇa kāmasya eṣa vidhiḥ bhavet ā asya evam prārthanam ukthāgṛha astra rūpam ā katham nirvarttatām iti tat te iyam api paśu kāma upādānāt anavaklṛptam
translated: And if the mere form of the Ukthya-taking were desired, then this injunction would be for one desiring the Ukthya-taking, with the meaning that his desire is thus: How can this form of the Ukthya-taking be accomplished? But this is also not appropriate due to the mention of one desiring cattle.

original: ataḥ kāmyatvādasti godohanavyāyena vikāratvaṃ tatra kathamiti itikarttavyatākāṅkṣāyāṃ jotiṣṭomagṛhautetikarttavyatā'tidiśyate /
analyzed: atas kāmya tvāt asti godohana vyāyena vikāra tvam tatra katham iti itikarttavya tā ākāṅkṣāyām jotiṣṭoma gṛhautā itikarttavya tā atidiśyate
translated: Therefore, because it is desired, there is modification by the exertion of milking a cow. There, when there is a desire for how it is to be done, the procedure of the Jyotistoma-taking is transferred.

original: kaḥ punariha pra kāro yanetikartavyatā gṛhyate yadi tāvatsannidhānaṃ tataḥ samānavidhāna meṃ bābhyupagataṃ bhavati na hyatideśasya sannidhi kāraṇaṃ sāhṛpyaprabhavatvena vakṣyamāṇatvāt /
analyzed: kaḥ punar iha kāraḥ yan itikartavya tā gṛhyate yadi tāvat sannidhānam tatas bhavati na hi atideśasya kāraṇam sāhṛpya prabhava tvena vakṣyamāṇa tvāt
translated: What, then, is the procedure here that is taken as the model? If it is proximity, then it is accepted that it is a case of injunction of the same thing. For proximity is not the cause of extension, as it will be said to arise from similarity.

analyzed: atha kāyi pacyā tatra api kāraṇa antara tvam nirākṛtam
translated: If it is the performance, then the fact that it is a different cause has been refuted there too.

original: na ca dokṣaṇīyādayaḥ saṃsthādharmmāḥ yataḥ kāyāpanne saṃsthāntare bhaveyuḥ na jotiṣṭomasyokthyādayaḥ kārye varttate yatastammanpratipadyante /
analyzed: na ca dokṣaṇīya ādayaḥ saṃsthā dharmmāḥ yatas kāya āpanne saṃsthā antare bhaveyuḥ na jotiṣṭomasya ukthya ādayaḥ kārye varttate yatas tamman pratipadyante
translated: And the Ukthya and other sacrifices are not the properties of the Jyotiṣṭoma, from which they could be in another performance when the Jyotiṣṭoma is absent. They are in the effect of the Jyotiṣṭoma, to which they are related.

analyzed: etena atideśa pacaḥ pratyuktaḥ
translated: By this, the argument of extension is answered.

original: yo hi manyate 'tideśena dharmā bhaviṣyantīti tasyāpyatideśakāraṇaṃ sārūpyaṃ nāstīti yadyadhyagniṣṭomasya saṃ sthayā sāmānyamasti jeprātiṣṭomasya tu na kiṃ cidukyādisāpyamityaprakṛtitvam /
analyzed: yaḥ hi manyate tideśena dharmāḥ bhaviṣyanti iti tasya api atideśa kāraṇam sārūpyam na asti iti yadi adhi agniṣṭomasya sam sthayā sāmānyam asti tu na kim
translated: He who thinks that the properties will be by extension, for him too there is no similarity, which is the cause of extension. If there is a general similarity of the Jyotiṣṭoma with the performance, but the Ukthya and others have no similarity with the Jyotiṣṭoma, then they are not the archetype.

original: ata eva ca bhāṣyakārī api sannidhānādityetāvanmālamutkā tṛṣṇabhūtastena vattāvyametaducyate /
analyzed: atas eva ca bhāṣya kārī api sannidhānāt iti etāvat mālam utkā tṛṣṇa bhūtaḥ tena vattāvyam etat ucyate
translated: For this very reason, the author of the Bhāṣya, being eager to say by proximity up to this much, said this.

analyzed: atideśaḥ yam iti etat purastāt eva sādhitam
translated: This is a case of extension, as has been established earlier.

analyzed: na ca sārupyam eva ekam atideśasya kāraṇam
translated: And similarity is not the only cause of extension.

analyzed: yadi yuktyā vinā evā iyam nityasya iti abhidhīyate
translated: If this is said to be eternal without reason,

original: kāmyasyaiveti kiṃ naitadayuktataramucyate🔽yadi vinaiva pramāṇena kevalanityārthatvaṃ tvamicchasi hanta madicchayā 'pi kevalakāmyārthatvamevāstu /
analyzed: kāmyasya eva iti kim na etat ayuktataram ucyate  yadi vinā eva pramāṇena kevala nityārtha tvam tvam icchasi hanta mad icchayā kevala kāmyā artha tvam evā astu
translated: why is it not said to be more unreasonable to be optional?🔽If you desire the mere eternal meaning without any evidence, then let it be mere optional meaning by my desire also.

original: atha punaridamapramāṇakamiti nāśrīyate tataḥ pramāṇavatsādhāraṇya miṣyatāmiti /
analyzed: atha punar idam apramāṇakam iti na āśrīyate tatas pramāṇavat sādhāraṇya miṣyatām iti
translated: But if this is not accepted as without evidence, then let it be accepted as common with evidence.

original: tatrātiśayoktimasahamāno bhāṣyakāra sādhāraṇapakṣe copakariṣyatīti niṣpramāṇakamapi kevalakāmyapakṣameva tāvannyāyena nirākaroti /
analyzed: tatra atiśayoktim asahamānaḥ bhāṣyakāra sādhāraṇa pakṣe ca upakariṣyati iti niṣpramāṇakam api kevala kāmya pakṣam eva tāvat nyāyena nirākaroti
translated: There, the author of the commentary, unable to bear the exaggeration, refutes the mere optional position with reasoning, thinking that it will help in the common position.

original: yatra yatra guṇe kāmastatra tatra kriyāyāṃ sādhyamānāyāṃ nānyatheti /
analyzed: yatra yatra guṇe kāmaḥ tatra tatra kriyāyām sādhyamānāyām na anyathā iti
translated: Wherever there is a desire for a quality, there in the performance of the action, it is not otherwise.

original: yadi nāma guṇaḥ svātantryeṇeti karttavyatāṃ gṛhītuṃ śaknuyāt tata evaṃ syāt /
analyzed: yadi nāma guṇaḥ svātantryeṇa iti karttavya tām gṛhītum śaknuyāt tatas evam syāt
translated: If a quality could be taken as an injunction independently, then it would be so.

original: sa ca kathaṃ śaknu yādyadi karagauravetikarttavyataḥ saṃbadhyeta yadi ca guṇānāṃ svata eva bhāvanāviśeṣaṇatvaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: sa ca katham yāt yadi kara gaurava itikarttavyataḥ saṃbadhyeta yadi ca guṇānām svatas eva bhāvanā viśeṣaṇa tvam bhavet
translated: And how could that be possible if it were connected with the injunction of the act of holding? And if the qualities were by themselves modifiers of the bhāvanā?

analyzed: na tāvat kara gauḥ itikarttavya tā saṃbadhyate iti uktam
translated: It has been said that it is not connected with the injunction of the act of holding.

original: saptamanavamādyayośca vakṣyati bhāvayetkathamityapekṣya bhavati na karaṇe na kathamiti /
analyzed: saptama navama ādyayoḥ ca vakṣyati bhāvayet katham iti apekṣya bhavati na karaṇe na katham iti
translated: And in the seventh and ninth chapters, it will be said that the word 'bhāvayet' (should effect) requires the question 'how?', not 'by what means' or 'how'.

original: yasyāṃ tu bhāvanāyāṃ dhātvarthāḥ karaṇaṃ bha vanti tasyāṃ te vastvantaranirapecāḥ paścāttanamaruṇaikahāyanonyāyalabhyamitikarttavyatāsaṃbandhaṃ labhante /
analyzed: yasyām tu bhāvanāyām dhātvarthāḥ karaṇam bha vanti tasyām te vastu antara nirapecāḥ paścāttanam aruṇa eka hāyanaḥ nyāya labhyam itikarttavya tā saṃbandham labhante
translated: But in that bhāvanā where the meanings of the verbal roots are the means, they, being independent of other things, obtain the connection with the subsequent injunction, which is understood by the rule of the red one-year-old cow.

original: yasyāṃ punarguṇānāṃ karaṇatvaṃ tasyāṃ dhātvarthaviśeṣādinā karagatvānupapattaḥ sādhyabhṛto dhātvartho uparo 'pekṣitavyo nahi vyāpāramāmānya ya guṇairutpattiḥ śakyā na ca kriyāviśeṣamasādhayan guṇaḥ sāmānyasādhanatvaṃ bhajate tana yasthāṃ bhāvanāyāmavasthito gugā itikarttavyatāṃ gṛhṇāti tasyāṃ prathamatarasaṃntriviṣṭo dhātvartho dṛśyate /
analyzed: yasyām punar guṇānām karaṇa tvam tasyām dhātvartha viśeṣa ādinā sādhya bhṛtaḥ dhātvarthaḥ uparaḥ pekṣitavyaḥ nahi guṇaiḥ utpattiḥ śakyā na ca kriyā viśeṣam asādhayan guṇaḥ sāmānya sādhana tvam bhajate yasthām bhāvanāyām avasthitaḥ itikarttavyatām gṛhṇāti tasyām dhātvarthaḥ dṛśyate evam ca tasyām anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra anyatra an
translated: But in those where the qualities are the means, the meaning of the root, which is the object to be accomplished, must be assumed, because the meaning of the root cannot be the means by the specific meaning of the root and so on. For qualities cannot produce without a specific operation, and a quality that does not accomplish a specific action does not have the nature of accomplishing the general. Therefore, in those where the bhāvanā is present, the qualities take on the nature of what is to be done. In that, the meaning of the root, which is first determined, is seen.

original: tattaśca tena tāvatsaha prathamataramarugaṇe kahā yanauvanniyamaḥ /
analyzed: tat tas ca tena tāvat saha prathamataram aru gaṇe ka hā ya nau vat niyamaḥ
translated: And that, along with that, is first determined together with the qualities. This is the rule.

original: yadi hautikarttavyatāgṛhaṇayogyaḥ sa na bhavettato na gahṇīyātsa tu phalavattvāditikarttavyatādvārabhūtabhāvanāviśeṣakhatvācca na kathaṃ cinna gṛhṇāti tatra catuṣṭayamapyatra prathamataraṃ grahaṇaṃ prayute bhāvanā tāvanna dhātvarthaviśeṣādinaitikarttavyatāṃ śaknoti grahotuṃ guṇo'pi ca na dhātvarthamanupanīya svatantraḥ śaknoti tannirapekṣabhāvanārahitatvānnirviśeṣasya ca karotyarthamāvasyānanuṣṭheyatva davyāpāratvācca grahotumityāśrayati /
analyzed: yadi sa na bhavet tatas na gahṇīyāt sa tu phalavat tvāt itikarttavyatā dvāra bhūta bhāvanā viśeṣa khatvāt ca na katham cit na gṛhṇāti tatra catuṣṭayam api atra prathamataram grahaṇam prayute bhāvanā tāvat na dhātvartha viśeṣa ādinā etikarttavyatām śaknoti grahotum guṇaḥ api ca na dhātvartham an upanīya svatantraḥ śaknoti tad nirapekṣa bhāvanā rahita tvāt nirviśeṣasya ca grahotum ityādi
translated: If the word were not capable of taking the Bhavana, then it could not take it; but as a matter of fact, it is quite capable of taking it, because it is related to the result, and also because it is the means of accomplishing the Bhavana, which is the principal factor in the performance of the action. And in this case, all the four words are taken first, because the Bhavana cannot take the iti kartavyata, without the help of the meaning of the root and the other words. The Guṇa also, without referring to the meaning of the root, cannot take the Bhavana by itself, because it is devoid of the Bhavana that is independent of the meaning of the root, and because that which is devoid of any distinction cannot be taken as the meaning of the word karoti, because it is not something to be performed, and because it is not an operation.

original: tathotikarttavyatā guṇābhimukhaṃ gacchantau na dhātvaryamullaṅghya śaknoti gantumiti ta nmukhe tāvatpatati / dhātvartho'pi svayamitikarttavyatākāsaḥ san guṇārthamapi prasthitāmetāṃ grahaṇasamarthaḥ sankimiti parityajet /
analyzed: tathā utikarttavyatā guṇa abhimukham gacchantau na dhātvaryam ullaṅghya śaknoti gantum iti tad mukhe tāvat patati dhātvarthaḥ upi svayam itikarttavyatā ākāsaḥ san guṇa artham api prasthitām etām grahaṇa samarthaḥ san kim iti parityajet
translated: Thus, the iti kartavyata, going towards the Guṇa, cannot go beyond the meaning of the root, and therefore it falls on that. And the meaning of the root, being itself in need of the iti kartavyata, being capable of taking it, why should it abandon it, even though it has started towards the meaning of the Guṇa?

original: ato 'va phalāya coditānāsukthyādīnāṃ jayotiṣṭomāśrayatvenāvagatānāmitikarttavyatāmākāṅkṣatāṃ prakaṇena dokṣaṇīyādaya upanauyamānā mārgāntarābhāvādavaśyaṃ tāvat jayotiṣṭomamukhe patanti /🔽na hukthyādayaḥ samāptirūpāḥ tatparihāreṇa grahautuṃ sa marthāḥ khamukhapatitāṃśca na kathaṃ cit jotiṣṭomastānupekṣate taddarśayati nāmau sādhyasyābhavanto sādhanena saṃbadhyate /
analyzed: atas phalāya coditānām ukthya ādīnām jayotiṣṭoma āśraya tvena avagatānām itikarttavya tām ākāṅkṣatām prakaṇena dokṣaṇīya ādayaḥ upanauyamānāḥ mārga antara abhāvāt avaśyam tāvat jayotiṣṭoma mukhe patanti  na hi ukthya ādayaḥ samāpti rūpāḥ tad parihāreṇa grahautum sa marthāḥ kha mukha patitān ca na katham cit jotiṣṭomaḥ tān upekṣate tat darśayati sādhyasya a bhavantaḥ sādhanena saṃbadhyate
translated: Therefore, when the Ukthya and other sacrifices, which are enjoined for the sake of results, are understood to be based on the Jyotiṣṭoma, and they desire the procedure, the Doṣaṇīya and other rites are brought in. In the absence of any other path, they necessarily fall within the Jyotiṣṭoma.🔽The Ukthya and other rites are not complete in themselves, and cannot be performed separately from the Jyotiṣṭoma. The Jyotiṣṭoma cannot ignore them, even though they fall within its mouth. This is shown by the statement: The result, not being the object of the injunction, is connected with the means of accomplishing it.

original: sa hautikarttavyatāviśeṣa evaṃ codyate yathā 'nena phalasya sādhanamukthyādisādhakaṃ tathā kuryyāditi yathā sau sādhako bhavati tathā kuryādityarthaḥ /
analyzed: sa hauti karttavyatā viśeṣaḥ evam codyate yathā nena phalasya sādhanam ukthya ādi sādhakam tathā kuryyāt iti yathā sau sādhakaḥ bhavati tathā kuryāt iti arthaḥ
translated: The Jyotiṣṭoma is enjoined with a particular procedure, to the effect that one should perform the Ukthya and other means of accomplishing the result in such a way that they become the means of accomplishing it. The meaning is that one should perform in such a way that they become the means.

analyzed: tatas ca karoti saṃsparśāt bhāvanayā eva saṃbandhaḥ
translated: And from this contact with the verbal root, the connection is with the bhāvanā (the act of accomplishing).

original: evaṃ ca sati nāsti sa pra kāro yena dhātvarthaṃ pariṝtyānayetikarttavyatayokthyādayaḥ sādhakāḥ kriyeran /
analyzed: evam ca sati na asti sa kāraḥ yena dhātvartham sādhakāḥ kriyeran
translated: And when this is the case, there is no other way by which the Ukthya and other rites could be performed as the means, setting aside the meaning of the verbal root.

analyzed: kriyāyām asādhyamānāyām ananuṭahyamāṇāyām iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is when the action is not being accomplished, not being performed.

original: ye tu tenāsādhyamānāyāmityukthyādineti saṃvandhayanti teṣāṃ pūrvaprastuteti karttavyatāviśeṣaparityāgādasaṃbaḍatvaṃ tatva tava kriyāyāṃ sādhyamānāyāmityanena ca punarutatvaṃ syāttena sādhakasyāpi guṇatantradhārtike sthetikattavyatāmicchatā sādhyasyāsau dhātvayaṃ syetyetadabhyupagantavyam /
analyzed: ye tu tena asādhyamānāyām iti ukthya ādinā iti saṃvandhayanti teṣām pūrva prastutā iti karttavyatā viśeṣa parityāgāt asaṃbaḍa tvam tava kriyāyām sādhyamānāyām iti anena ca punar uta tvam syāt tena sādhakasya api guṇa tantra dhārtike stha iti kattavyatām icchatā sādhyasya asau dhātu ayam sya iti etat abhyupagantavyam
translated: But those who connect it with when it is not being accomplished by that and by the Ukthya etc. for them, due to abandoning the particular injunction of what is to be done by the previously presented, it would be unconnected. And by when the action is being accomplished it would be repeated. Therefore, one who desires the injunction of the means of accomplishment as a subsidiary should accept this: That is the root meaning of what is to be accomplished.

original: evaṃ sāmānyalakṣāmuktā saṃprati prastute viśeṣe yojayati sādhyaśca jotiṣṭāma iti /
analyzed: evam sāmānya lakṣām uktā saṃprati prastute viśeṣe yojayati sādhyaḥ ca jotiṣṭāmaḥ iti
translated: Thus the general definition having been stated, he now applies it to the particular case at hand, saying And what is to be accomplished is the Jyotiṣṭoma.

analyzed: ta smāt na tāvat kevala kāmyā artha tvam
translated: Therefore, it is not merely for the sake of desire.

analyzed: atha kasmāt na sādhāragā tvam iti balavat tvena dvitīya paca upanyāsaḥ
translated: Now, why is it not a common property? The second statement is made by way of strength.

analyzed: siddhāntavādī āha
translated: The proponent of the established view says:

analyzed: nitya vat āmnānāt iti
translated: Because of the recitation as if it were eternal.

original: sarvatra hokarudhye sati tantrasaṃbandho ghaṭate na ca dhammanprati jayotiṣṭomasya saṃsthānāṃ ca aikarupyamasti /
analyzed: sarvatra ha ukarudhye sati tantra saṃbandhaḥ ghaṭate na ca saṃsthānām ca aikarupyam asti
translated: When there is obstruction everywhere, the connection with the Tantra is appropriate. And there is no uniformity of the Jyotiṣṭoma with the rites with respect to the Dharma.

original: dharmā hi kārmānimittasaṃyogābhāvānnityavadāmrāyante yadaiva jayotiṣṭomastadaiva dokṣaṇīyādayaḥ prayoktavyā iti satyapi ca protiṣṭome vinā paśukāmādinokthyādayo na saṃbhavanti saṃsthāntaraprayoge cāvaśyameva saṃsthāntara na saṃbhavati /
analyzed: dharmāḥ hi kārmā nimitta saṃyoga abhāvāt nitya vat āmrāyante yadā eva jayotiṣṭomaḥ tadā eva dokṣaṇīya ādayaḥ prayoktavyāḥ iti sati api ca protiṣṭome vinā paśu kāma ādinā ukthya ādayaḥ na saṃbhavanti saṃsthā antara prayoge ca avaśyam eva saṃsthā antara na saṃbhavati
translated: For the Dharmas, being connected with the cause of the action, are perceived as if they were eternal, that the Dākṣiṇā and others should be employed only when there is the Jyotiṣṭoma. And even when there is the Jyotiṣṭoma, the Ukthya and others are not possible without the desire for cattle and so on. And in the application of another Saṃsthā, another Saṃsthā cannot exist at all.

analyzed: na tu etāsu jyotiṣṭomaḥ kadā cit na asti
translated: But the Jyotiṣṭoma never does not exist in these.

analyzed: sarvatra samasta ātmanā pratyekam
translated: Because it is always cognized in its entirety, like a universal in each case.

original: ata ete yathāmnātā protiṣṭomena saha saṃbadhyante nānityābhiḥ saṃsthābhiḥ /
analyzed: atas ete yathāmnātā protiṣṭomena saha saṃbadhyante na anityābhiḥ saṃsthābhiḥ
translated: Therefore, these, as mentioned, are connected with the Jyotiṣṭoma, not with the non-eternal Saṃsthās.

original: nanu satyapyāsāmanityatve jyotiṣṭomasyaikasya nityatvānnityavadarbhānānaṃ nityārthatvena virotsyate nityāmānaṃ tāvataṃ prati kṛtārtha bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nanu sati api āsām anitya tve jyotiṣṭomasya ekasya nitya tvāt nityavat arbha ānānam nitya artha tvena virotsyate nitya āmānam tāvatam prati kṛtārtha bhaviṣyati
translated: Even if these are non-eternal, because the Jyotiṣṭoma is eternal, the eternal application of the eternal Saṃsthās will not be contradicted as having an eternal purpose. The application of the eternal Saṃsthās will have served its purpose for that much.

original: yadi tu tamanmatyevānityo 'pyaparaḥ saṃbandhaḥ kalpyate kiṃ no bādhyate /
analyzed: yadi tu tamanmatyā iva anityaḥ pi aparaḥ saṃbandhaḥ kalpyate kim no bādhyate
translated: But if even that non-eternal connection is imagined, what is contradicted?

original: yo nityārthameva nityavadāmāyate sa virudhyate naivaṃjātīyaka iti /
analyzed: yaḥ nitya artham eva nitya vat āmāyate sa virudhyate na evaṃjātīyakaḥ iti
translated: That which appears as if eternal for the sake of the eternal is contradicted, not one of this kind.

original: naitadevamevaṃ sati tanvaṃ tāvatparityaktamaprayojakalacaṇāpannatvādyadā hi nityavadānānaṃ nityārthatvena tāvaddinā na bhavati kapte ca tādaye nirākāṅkṣībhūte pāṭhe prasaṅkāditarasaṃbandha iti na sāmānaviṣyam /
analyzed: na etat evam evam sati tanvam tāvat parityaktam aprayojaka lacaṇa āpanna tvāt yadā hi nitya vat ānānam nitya artha tvena na bhavati kapte ca nirākāṅkṣībhūte pāṭhe prasaṅkāt itara saṃbandhaḥ iti na sāmānaviṣyam
translated: This is not so. In that case, the body has already been abandoned, because it is subject to uselessness. When the injunction is not for the eternal purpose like the eternal injunction, and when the text is complete and free from expectancy, the connection with the other is accidental, so it is not a common locus.

original: itarathā hyevaṃ dharmavi dhi syānnityametān jayotiṣṭome dhamānkuryyātkadā cicca yadā paśukāmādayo bhavantauti tacca vipratiṣiimekasya vidhānasya /
analyzed: itarathā hi evam syāt nityam etān jayotiṣṭome dhamān kuryyāt kadā cit ca yadā paśu kāma ādayaḥ bhavanti iti tat ca vipratiṣiim ekasya vidhānasya
translated: Otherwise, the injunction of dharma would be thus: One should always perform these rites in the Jyotiṣṭoma, and also sometimes when one has the desire for cattle etc. And that is contradictory to the injunction of one.

original: nanu hāvetau prakaraṇāmānānumitau vidho tayo reko nityabaddidhāsyati aparaścānityavaditi /
analyzed: nanu hau etau prakaraṇa āmāna anumitau vidho tayoḥ rekaḥ nitya bat didhāsyati aparaḥ ca anitya vat iti
translated: But these two are inferred from the context and the injunction, one will be for the eternal injunction, and the other for the non-eternal.

analyzed: satyam prayoga vacanayoḥ bhedāt avipratiṣedhaḥ prayojā vacanāni tu nitya anitya prayoga vacana anuvidhāna ādi pratiṣidhyante
translated: True, there is no contradiction due to the difference in the statements of application, but the statements of purpose are contradicted by following the statements of eternal and non-eternal application.

analyzed: tena eṣām nitya tva avighātam icchatā vaśyam grāhakam api tam ayam evā abhyupagantavyam
translated: Therefore, one who desires to avoid the eternality of these must necessarily accept that very cognition.

analyzed: atas ca avyabhicārāt jyotiṣṭoma artha tvam eva yuktam iti
translated: And therefore, because of the invariable concomitance, it is proper that it is only for the sake of the Jyotiṣṭoma.

original: nanvagniṣṭomasaṃsthāpi kāmyeti yadā sarvasaṃsthānāmanityatvaṃ na ca tadyatiriktaṃ nityaṃ kiṃ cit jyoṣṭomarūpamasti tadā jayotiṣṭamena nityavadhaṇāttahārabhūtena tulyakalpameva sarvāsāṃ dharmopanayanamiti kva nityaḥ prayoga ityanavadhāraṇāt kevalānityārthatvaṃ balāīkalpikanyāyena bhaviṣyatītyataāha sa nityasya samatvāditi /
analyzed: nanu agniṣṭoma saṃsthā api kāmyā iti yadā sarva saṃsthānām anitya tvam na ca nityam kim cit jyoṣṭoma rūpam asti tadā jayotiṣṭamena tulya kalpam eva sarvāsām dharma upanayanam iti kva nityaḥ prayogaḥ iti anavadhāraṇāt kevala anitya artha tvam bhaviṣyati iti atas āha sa nityasya sama tvāt iti
translated: But even the Agnistoma-form of sacrifice is optional, when all forms are non-eternal and there is nothing eternal apart from that, then the application of all the rites is just like the eternal injunction of the Jyotistoma, so where is the eternal performance? Since it cannot be determined, it will be purely optional by the principle of optionality. To this he says It is because of the equality of the eternal one.

original: samau hi kratvarthapuruṣārtho vidhau tau hi hāvāloccaikasya tūbhayatve saṃyogapṛthakvamityevamagniṭomāntasya nityasyaiva kāmasaṃyoga iti itarasya tu kevalakāmasaṃyogādanityattvamiti viśeṣaḥ /
analyzed: samau hi kratu artha puruṣa arthaḥ vidhau tau hi tu ubhaya tve saṃyoga pṛthakvam iti evam agniṭoma antasya nityasya eva kāma saṃyogaḥ iti itarasya tu kevala kāma saṃyogāt anitya tvam iti viśeṣaḥ
translated: For in the injunction, the purpose of the sacrifice and the purpose of the person are equal. For in the absence of one, both are equal. But when both are present, there is a separate connection. Thus, the eternal one ending with the Agnistoma is only connected with desire. But the other, due to being purely connected with desire, is non-eternal. This is the difference.

original: tena yadyapi prayogeṇeyamanityā tathā 'pi jayotiṣṭomasya nityattvā detasyāśca taṃ prati prāptirūpeṇa nityatvāttadgṛhautadharmaparabhāgalābhācāgniṣṭomasyetyevaṃ dharmāṇāṃ vyapadeśo 'tha vokthyādiṣvapi prāptiiye sati protiṣṭomāṃśena yā prāpti sopadeśena yokdhyāṃśena sā 'tideśātmiketi vivekaḥ /
analyzed: tena yadi api prayogeṇa iyam anityā tathā jayotiṣṭomasya tasyāḥ ca tam prati prāpti rūpeṇa nitya tvāt tad gṛhauta dharma parabhāga lābhāt ca agniṣṭomasya iti evam dharmāṇām vyapadeśaḥ vā ukthya ādiṣu api prāpti iye sati protiṣṭoma aṃśena yā sā upadeśena yā ukdhya aṃśena sā atideśa ātmikā iti vivekaḥ
translated: Therefore, even though this is impermanent by that performance, still, because of the eternality of the Jyotiṣṭoma and because of the eternality of its attainment towards it, and because of the acquisition of the remaining part of the duties pertaining to it, it is of the Agniṣṭoma. Thus there is the designation of the duties. Or, even in the Ukthya etc., when there is attainment, that attainment which is by the part of the Jyotiṣṭoma is by instruction, and that which is by the part of the Ukthya is by implication. This is the distinction.

analyzed: vacanāt ca samuccayaḥ
translated: And because of the statement, there is combination.

analyzed: viśiṣṭa vidhānasya na atibhāraḥ
translated: There is no excessive burden for the injunction of the qualified.

analyzed: tadā asya api iti kha pu pā
translated: And this is also so. This is the reading in the K manuscript.

analyzed: tantravārtika
translated: Tantra-Vartika.

analyzed: pratiṣedhāt ca pūrva liṅgānām
translated: And because of the prohibition, the earlier indications.

original: kratukaraṇeṣu cottara vidhau yatpūrvābhāvamanuvadati sa vikārapakṣe vikalpate /
analyzed: kratu karaṇeṣu ca uttara vidhau yat pūrva abhāvam anuvadati sa vikāra pakṣe vikalpate
translated: And in the injunctions of the sacrificial acts, when the absence of the earlier is repeated, it is an option in the case of modification.

analyzed: codaka prāptasya ca uttareṇa pūrvasya bādhita tvāt
translated: And because what is obtained by the injunction is overridden by the later, by the earlier.

original: sāmānavidhye hi pratyakṣa nimittasavidhānātprāpte nimitta naimittikamavaśyaṃ karttavyamiti samuccaya syāttava pratiṣedhaḥ pṛthagvidharupagamyamāno vākyaṃ bhindyāt /
analyzed: sāmānavidhye hi pratyakṣa nimitta sa vidhānāt prāpte nimitta naimittikam avaśyam karttavyam iti syāt tava pratiṣedhaḥ vākyam bhindyāt
